reviews.review: Lots for everyone to do!. We could of spent alot of time here exploring the maritime museum and the ships, shopping, dining, sea life aquarium, zoo to name a few.

What a playground for KIDS and ADULTS. Darling Harbor has everything the family needs to relax, play, eat, drink and enjoy a very nice day. The children playground section offers numerous water games, a large sandbox, slides, zipline and much more. For the adults, there are many restaurants and bars, IMAX cinema, a marina and a marvelous surrounding. Once you go to Darling Harbour, you’ll want to go back time after time.
buzzing with interest and activity. There is a lot going on here with bars, restaurants and activitie. The chinese gardens were of particular interest. Needs to viewed day and night if possible.

The heart and soul of Sydney!. We went for a walk around Darling Harbour and was surprised at how much there was there. There are lots of restaurants /fast food places too all serving good quality food. A nice way to spend an hour or so seeing where locals gather!
A lot to do . If you have a free Sunday or Saturday this will be ideal place to visit. Recommended for people who love activities like cruises, love water and looking for inspiration
What a skyline . Super place To visit. Nice Not to crowded with to many boats. The old bridge still functions and they sometimes use it for fun.

Always something to see. There are lots of eateries on the waterside, all sorts of cuisines available. A level walk all around & the pedestrian Pyrmont bridge links the 2 sides. Colourful at night & popular with everyone in the evenings.
Nice and Busy. We went to Darling Harbour on saterday night. Many people, lots of nicecand tasty restourants. At 21:00 there is a show of Fireworks. It was amazing show. You must go there.
Lovely place . It's the place you have to come to if you come to Sidney It's got all the sea life and many attractions .So much to do it would be very hard to do in one day .

Amazing. Lots to do and lots of entertainers. The view of the water and harbour bridge is amazing. There is no shortage of places to eat either. Lots of little cafes, takeaways and restaurants. Look forward to going back there with my kids very soon.

Dining . Nice place to walk around the place
Great Resturant different nations flavor
Relaxing atmosphere With lot of people with international tourist and local as well
day out. food and drinks no shortage of bars and resturants,boat trips the waxworks the aquareum and the maritme museum
just beautiful!. such a nice place to just relax or take a stroll with family.. nice cafes all around --- and amazing view!!
Great place for food. Nice night life, great food places, not the cheapest destination but clean and friendly and buzzing as my kids would say x
Water park time. The water resources park at Darling harbour is great kids just love it very shady splash park is perfectly suited for the little ones

A great place to walk around. We often catch a ferry or train into the city then make our way over to darling harbour and walk around stopping to grab something to eat at one of the many cafes or restaurants. Then stopping for a coffee and cake or ice cream before heading homeWhen the kids were little we'd drive down Lots to see and do for all ages

Only if you are hungry. In Australia for five days, staying in Circular Quay. We had heard that Darling Harbor was a worthwhile place to visit so we took the ferry over. We were sorely disappointed. The area around the harbor is wall-to-wall restaurants. There were some shops at Harbourside, nothing special. The Maritime Museum certainly has its worth if that is what you are looking for. The Star is a great place to go if you'd like to lose some money gambling, its a huge casino. The IMAX theater is closed for renovation until 2019!! I think some tradesmen are getting paid by the hour there. Don't waste your time. There are better things to do in Sydney.
Vibrant Darling Harbour. It's a place for all ages as so much is going on. So many places to eat & so many places to occupy yourself with even for the kids.
Lovely place. Lovely place to spend some time. Lots of attractions, shops, great places to eat and drink. Spectacular at night.
Beautiful place to visit. Really enjoyed my visit here. So many restaurants and bars to choose from. Interesting street performers. You can wander at leisure without having to look out for cars.

VERY touristy..... its VERY touristy and the restaurants and the quality of the food served there reflect that. There is a firework display on Friday evenings though which is nice and during the day its a bit quieter.

got to see. This is an iconic Sydney attraction. Something that has to be seen and revisited. Lots of good shopping and restaurants to go to. Nice views on a sunny day and a good walk as well. very relaxing being near the water.

okay. this place is okay if you like shopping. plenty of shops although put off a bit by shop owners constantly watching tourists felt a bit uneasy. plenty designer shops. also various museums. and zoo. I max and resturaunts. not as clean as sydney harbour

Picturesque. Lots of charming harbor side places to eat. Navy ships to tour, tour boats departing etc. Great views of the city. A bit of a walk from Circular Quay but certainly doable. Some hills to walk up but worth it!
Lovely vibe. Great area with fabulous restaurants and bars on the marina. Great shopping. Could spend days here and right in the heart of Sydney

Darling is my darling. This venue oscillate between great and very good so there is not much to add. I must visit my darling once every 6 months and the authorities have kept the place up well in terms of safety and cleanliness. I was rather glad that the crowd was subdued rather than the shoulder shoving experience like in Asia.

Not as exciting. Had a few hours at darling harbour but not much there now .
We had a bacon sandwich and coffee at place in the food hall good and also good price .
Love it. Just love having a drink and people watching. lots of different bars etc to try and the walk to Circular Quay is lovely.

An Interesting Distraction. A beautifully constructed harbor facility with every imaginable bar/restaurant/coffee shop and fast food outlet to suit all tastes from around the globe. It is is clean ,well serviced as such has a relaxed and pleasant cosmopolitan atmosphere. The walkways allow access all over the harbor and it's an easy place to while away a lazy afternoon.

Lunch with visiting relatives.. Darling harbour is a hive of activity. It has many shops cafes and restaurants and bars. All cuisines and costs. There is also the eyemax theatre and Aquarium. To name but a few of the things you can do there. It also has plenty of parks and places for young children to enjoy.

So much to see and do. Take your time there is so much to see and do. Lots of places to explore then add the restaurants and the bars you do need a few hours. Take your time and plan before hand. Enjoy
Perfect for Sat evening. If you are in town do not miss the saturday fireworks with some nice dinning options and lots of other activities to do around Darling harbour

Lots if options. Small walk from city centre.
Heaps of food options.
Free playground for big and little kids.
Live music and street entertainment when I was there. Kids had so much fun.

Indian Darling. Lunched at an Indian restaurant here which was beautiful. Called Zaafran, the service was exemplary, the food yummy and authentically Indian. Thankfully we asked for mild spiciness which was still quite hot. Great cocktails and outside balcony with views of darling harbour. A must go.

Excellent place to bide your time . This place has everything going for it. Lovely views , lovely restaurants with lots and lots of options , great aquarium , IMAX and a maritime museum. In fact there is a fireworks show almost everyday in the evening around 8.30 pm. In all a place you can come everyday and still find something new to experience. We were in Sydney for 4 nights and made it a point to be here almost every evening.

An expensive walk. Darling Harbour is a must for all visitors. It is a great walk along the harbour & the King Street ferries run from here as well. The bars & restaurants can be very expensive though. Alot of them have happy hour's, normally between 3-6pm. Beer and wine are 5 dollars & food is often cheaper as well. This is only on weekdays though, NOT at the weekend. Really busy at the weekends, quite quiet at the start of the week.

Lots of tall buildings. Darling Harbour has so many eating places it is unbelievable. It is beautiful at night all the lights and all the buildings light up and hundred of people.You can just walk for miles and spend hours at Darling Habour we loved it.

Touristy but Delightful !!. The Darling Harbor is a delightful area ... Though filled with bars and restaurants .. I found it to be pretty nice strolling through the area and the restaurants .. The view of the harborline is amazing in the night.. while in sydney .. should not miss it ...

Big name attraction magnet. There is no doubting Darling Harbour has attracted the big name tourist hang outs (Madame Tussards, Imax cinema, Sydney zoo, sea life aquarium, etc) and therefore I can see the appeal but sadly this was not for us. We found the area too touristy and it seems to of lost its soul, possibly not helped by the plethora of 'i could be anywhere in world' type bars and restaurants.
Nice to walk around place. Nice to walk around place a lot of people walk and tourist come too. I walk with my children , there have several museum. Enjoyed .

Good place (weather permitting) with too many restaurants. A good place to take a walk and to have lunch in the many (too many) restaurants which invade the place. It's a shame because the place could have been a calm one with beautiful views

Underwhelming. I haven't been to Darling Harbour for many years, and sad to say I was very underwhelmed and disappointed with the shops and choices of eateries. The views are fantastic, and I recommend coming down to take in the beautiful views and boats coming in and out. It appears to have 'lack of attention' to this attraction over the years. I remember it being much nicer years ago.
Love it here. Visit is a must so many things going on here but you don't feel rushed,great view of cruise ships, opera house an the bridge.
Nice place. Lots of boats and ships in Harbour and places to walk and eat. Safe and clean. Nice views!! It's a nice place to stay the day

Bustling eating area. Brilliant place to go to eat. There is every variety of restaurant you could think of. There is a firework display on Saturday nights. Perfect for all the family. Great for people watching

It is cheesy and touristy. This is a mass market tourist area with little going for it in my opinion. There are the standard classless bars and restaurants and I don't really know why you would rush over there. There are museums etc but it just feels like America. The Barangaroo end is a little nicer and with a nicer view.

Must visit once in Sydney. Darling Harbour is one of must visit while in Sydney. It's so much to see. It's vibrant and popular destination. It's place where everyone is going for lunch dinner party as here is so many busy and big restaurants 100+tables. .. It's definitively tourist place because here is many of main tourist attraction. Naval museum with great exhibition inside building and plus many ships anchoring outside including destroyer ,submarine ,tall boat, sail boat etc.... If you visit it in Saturday evening. There is fireworks going on. Enjoy your stay.

The Jewel of the City. Darling Harbour is a picturesque location which delights tourists and locals alike. On a sunny day you will find views and a lovely walk by the water. On rainy days there are enough activities and shelter to keep you occupied.If you have kids, then head down to the Mery-Go-Round and then venture on to the kids' playground. The water play area will keep them occupied while you have a coffee and relax. Or wander over to the Chinese Gardens, or into Chinatown when you are finished.
Superb!. Should I say a romantic place :P A please with fine dining and perfect walk along promenade.Visit if you're in Sydney
Delightful place for a stroll. Great to walk around and see the development. Places to eat by the mile. Popular and relaxing. Stop and explore some of the museums etc as you go

Loved it . Don't forget to go on Saturday Evening for the fireworks. Amazing. Great atmosphere.
Loved it.
Coming from USA, you worry about seeing large crowd and potentials of violence. Wow, there is so much fun and ease in the atmosphere.
Sydney felt like festival every day.

Lively. We came by ferry from Circle Quay! The harbor is an amazing place with beautiful modern architecture! A long walk all around the piers with restaurants all along! Definitely worth a visit! Post card photos garenteed!

Great food, great people. I stayed close to Darling Harbour when I visited and I don't regret it. I met a lot of wonderful people, made friends, ate good food, went to an aquarium, a zoo, and had more than a few drinks with my new friends. T

Great day in the sun. We are from NZ and loved our day strolling round Darling harbour. We circumnavigated it about 3 times. The kids had gelato and the grownups had a wine.The views are great.There is an endless supply of bars and restaurants.If you can't find something to eat or drink here there is something wrong!Prices were pretty reasonable due to competition I think.It is also a great place to catch a ferry or water taxi to circular quay or taronga zoo.Well worth the visit.

Cracking Waterfront Location. Our stay in Sydney was at the 4 Points by Sheraton Hotel in Darling Harbour and was a few steps away from this wonderful location. Darling Harbour has all a tourist could need - bars, great restaurants, shopping and other attractions to make a stay truly worthwhile.I'd definitely recommend Nick's Seafood restaurant, the Maritime Museum and the Dinner Cruise ships that offer spectacular views of Sydney Harbour with fine food to enjoy whilst taking in the sights. If you're visiting Sydney then make sure you spend some time enjoying all that Darling Harbour has to offer - I don't think you'll be disappointed. As a bonus if you're there on Saturday evenings then you'll even get a free firework display! Awesome!

Very picturesque harbour. We came into the harbour from the sea, and it had great views in many directions and areas. A couple of old sailing ships as well as an Australian Naval vessel were in the harbour, but could well have been part of the maritime museum located in the harbour. Quite a bit of building work being undertaken which devalued a little the experience. But worth visiting

Almost missed it!. I was going to skip Darling Harbour, but I had one last free day so I thought I'd stroll to it. I ended up enjoying a tasty brunch at one of several restaurants along the jetty with gorgeous harbour views. They have the aquarium and maritime museums here, complete with battleship and submarine docked outside. It's a bustling, beautiful area worth your time.
Superb!. So pretty and so much fun to be had. Romance your significant other with fine dining or walk along the promenade. Its a surefire way to have a great first date.
Darling harbour. Darling harbour is a beautiful place to visit, it has some wonderful places for lunch or dinner and lots to see

Sunny and relaxing. Easy place to visit and soak up views and sunshine. They have been really expanding and baking over the whole area since I was here last year. Great playground for children. A nice place to relax for a day loads of food and things to see.

Always love to stay around this area.. Darling Harbour is not a gigantic area, however, it is still good enough if you wish to spend an evening out. There are plenty of nice bars / restaurants around - some of them serve great food. It's always relaxing to stroll along the coast line to enjoy its great views and gentle sea breeze.
Good!. For view of skyline, blue water, opera house and Sydney bridge - this is must visit place. Thank you!
Morning glory of the place. Very easy to get there and walk around. Away from the city crowd and near the ocean. Do not miss the chance to visit it!
Great food and entertainment. So many fab restaraunts and fast food places along Darling Harbour, cinemas, museums and attractions like Madame Tussaud or just to sit and watch the world go by!

Lovely place. We visited a couple of times during our stay and really enjoyed the place . There is lots to see and do with the Maritime museum, the aquarium and Madame Tussaud's to mention just a few. The place is packed with restaurants and fast food eateries do the choice of food is excellent. The restaurants we used were very good quality and reasonably priced. There is a mid sized shopping centre which had a food court. Lots to see and do.
Prefered it 10 years ago. We couldn't wait to go back to Darling Harbour again, but it was not as good as we remembered it. There has been a lot of building work some of which is still taking place.

Beautiful and Vibrant by Night. Out for a stroll to see the sights and were blown away by the colour and size of Darling Harbour with all cuisines catered for. As the day was the first warm day for summer the crowds were out.So it was quite busy but with the sheer number of eateries finding somewhere for dinner was no problems

Fabukius. Haven't been to darling harbour for a while. Got a train to Wynyard - easy walk to king street wharf and delightful walk around to darling harbour. Buzzy , fun - had a few beers along the way. Really a fun day. Got a ferry back to Luna park. Highly recommend a day out there.

Plenty to see and do :). Masses of things to do with the family. Sea life, Maritime museum and Sydney wildlife zoo, loads of water taxis and ferries to see the harbour from the water and when is all gets a bit tiring plenty of eateries of varying budgets to try. Well worth to spend a day there.

Wonderful Place Day or Night. This place is great for anyone, including families. Lots of eateries, lots of activities - boat tours, Sydney Visitor Centre, fast food, a park, Harbourview Centre, Hard Rock Cafe, etc. Something for everyone. Fun during the day, romantic at night. A must-see must-be-there place.
trip to darling harbour. went to darling harbour to sealife and maritime museum also great places to eat soom cheap places most expensive, good for walking around,

Great for families. There is so much for everyone at Darling Harbour. If you are hungry or just want to sit and watch the day go by this is the spot. For the kids there is the water play park, the aquarium and the wildlife zoo. There are plenty of restaurants to suit everyone and every budget.

Improving steadily. Darling Harbour is growing up and improving with age. So many places to get to from here and a lovely part of the harbour to walk around. Dining options are excellent and the bars along king st wharf have happy hours from 3pm which means you can get drinks at $5 beers and wine til 6 or 7pm. Perfect in a busy city.

Tourist trap, not a must-see. Contains a small animal habitat and an aquarium which we didn't bother seeing because we had already visited Taronga Zoo and spent four days snorkeling the Great Barrier Reef. Madame Tussaud's didn't interest us either. Lots of restaurants so the area is good for dinner and a stroll if you have the time. Baia Italian restaurant has a great deal, an excellent three course early dinner with wine or beer for only $30. We found Circular Quay to be a much more picturesque and authentic area.

Stayed in an apartment at Darling Harbor. A truly outstanding experience and location. Take the hop on hop off buses and boats that cruise the harbor and waterways around Sydney. A great experience including a boat trip to the Taranga Zoo.

Lots of restaurants and fantastic cheap eat shops with awesome harbour views. Harbour views from the many restaurants that lined the wharf.Many cheap eats/take away shops inside the Darling Harbour complex.Maritime Museum and the Aquarium are around the corner.Sydney CBD is only a short 20min walk from Darling HarbourThere are a few pubs and also Star Casino nearby.Handful of hotels are nearby.A must visit tourist area.

Still great . Darling harbour is still a great place to visit. Beautiful city views, great restaurants, shopping and many attractions: maritime museum, aquarium and boat cruises. A truly world class location.

Beautiful area with great restaurants. If your looking for a place to enjoy a good meal or a few drinks in Sydney, Darling Harbour is the place to go. It is beautiful with wonderful restaurants and bars. Just avoid the Hard Rock, it's loud with terrible service and worse food.
Good vibe. Great vibe. We went to the wildlife sanctuary and sea life centre here. Plenty of places to choose from if u want food or drinks. Close to walk from the city centre

Darling Harbour. Nice relaxing stroll along the harbor. Plenty of shops and great restaurants with balconies facing the harbor. They had fireworks at night which added a special ambiance to our dinner.It's a fun place to hang out and have a good time.
Always beautiful. Walked across Darling Harbour on the pedestrian bridge. Great eating place on the other side of the Harbour

Holiday. Darling Harbour is a must for all who visit Sydney- close to Chinatown, definitely worth stopping to have a great feed. The great eating places and shops fantastic. High light for me the Maritime Museum and to be able to go onboard the ships is brilliant.

So Beautiful....I'm In Awe. This harbour is definitely one of the most beautiful attractions in Sydney. Fabulous restaurants surrounding this awesome harbour and I can sit for hours admiring the beauty of this place. This is a must see location in Sydney

Buzzing energetic harbourside bar & restaurant area. Darling Harbour seems to continually reinvent itself to stay modern, attractive & lively. Had the pleasure of going there after stepping off a Rydalmere ferry to meet friends & the place was alive with lights, sounds & people. Really good place to meet with friends, loved ones or working colleagues. With the development of Barangaroo (old shipping terminal) into high & lowrise apartments & offices, there is more to see & do. Definitely worth a visit.
Fun day out. We had a fun day with kids at darling harbour fun for all ages lots to do and see food can be a bit pricey.
Week end Markets. I am not a market person but these markets have a variety of product that have something for everyone. The spray can artist at the western end of the market is worth a look

Beautiful restaurants lots to see. Jump on the ferry to darling harbour and take a walk around to the museum and Harbourside shopping complex. If you enjoy food this is the place to be with countless restaurants to try. The aquarium is also here plus many places to book tours. Be sure to stop at the museum and take a look.

Overrated and gauche. Should be called give us your money imho. The maritime museum is worthy of a visit but everything else was a disappointment. The shopping centre was poor, the restaurants expensive and lacking in ambience. The walkway bridge entrance was stunning however. So overall good for a walking visit or if you want to take the kids to the aquarium or Madame Tussaud's but otherwise spend your money elsewhere.

Stroll along the Harbourside . An easy walk past restaurants and bars and a few shops. Always some interesting places to eat, catch a ferry, go to the 3D cinema or relax and enjoy a coffee or a drink.

Our Favorite. What a view and so much to do for the whole family kids of all ages will enjoy everything that is offered right at your doorstep great family restaurants play parks even the famous luna park which is a must see and do so much fun , sitting by the water eating fish and chips is one of our family favorites x

lively place to eat and dring. ferries come and go all day and into the evening. you can walk from the station if you feel energetic. great for a stroll , supper and a glass or two . lively with music and entertainment available

TRUE DARLING ON THE HARGOUR. Darling Harbour is part of the greater SYDNEY HARBOUR ,close to CHINA TOWN andan easy walk from most parts of the city. Darling Harbour currently has a number of currently a number of construction zones, but it is still well worth a visit,The Authorities are making the place as attractive as they can and there are still plenty of shops,waterfront restaurants and fast food . Fantastic harbourside walks.Great views of the cityday or night.This is also the place that the City stages many festivals and holiday attractions,Ther is something for everybody, childrens playgrounds,plenty of fast food options,upmarket eateries and late night venues or just bring a picnic.plenty of nearby parking. Tourists and locals enjoy this beautiful haven.

fantastic in day and night. It is a heaven for tourists . A lot of attractions are near by . A start point for hop on hop off ships . Many choices of restaurants and cafes from MacDonald to Lindet cafe .Darling Harbour is the light house of Sydney.
Beautiful location with plenty to see. Great holiday destination. Good place for a walk, see attractions such as Madam Tussauds, Chinese garden of Friendship or have a meal at one of the restaurants.

Some great bits, some just ok bits. Darling Harbour is billed as a "must visit" location in Sydney. Travelling with kids, we focussed on the southern end of the precinct for wandering around. The kids playground is fun for kids aged 2 - 10ish. There is also a fun water park with water trails and a splash pad. My two (7 & 10) enjoyed this the most and would have spent hours there if we'd had that time. Tip: chuck a couple of small towels into your day pack so that wet kids don't hold you up. We visited the Chinese Gardens (excellent), Harbourside (don't bother), walked across the Pyrmont Bridge (very good), went to the Aquarium (ok) and the Wild Life Zoo (ok), caught the light rail from Paddy's Market to the casino and walked back to the city. We also came back on Saturday night at 8.30 to see the free fireworks and enjoy the free street entertainers, which was well worth it.Not sure that I would agree that Darling Harbour is a "must visit" and if you only have a short time in the city, there are better ways to see the harbour and city, however the kids enjoyed their time in the play area and Chinese Gardens, so would recommend those areas to families travelling to Sydney.

Family get together. Myself and my wife met up with our son and his wife plus two other cousins and their partners at "The Port" Darling Harbour, what a beautiful part of Sydney this is, made all the more pleasant with the small craft bobbing at their moorings etc.The part I really loved was the maritime museum of Australia, interesting facts etc about the colonisation of Sydney and the ships voyages from UK.Being a visitor from UK I was interested in the Australian Navy section of the museum, they have preserved HMAS Vampire, a Daring Class Destroyer, I was on a ship during the Borneo Confrontation accompanied by the Vampire on our Patrols, it brought back fond memories.An area to spend hours either wandering around or sipping coffees or a beer etc.Superb.

Lots of attractions . Often a destination to eat, this place is packed with attractions and sights.It is a stone's throw away from the city centre by foot, and is served by ferry, bus, and I believe by the team system (never used it, so don't quote me).Always busy restaurants, a shopping centre, several attractions - a zoo, an aquarium, Maritime Museum etc, there's lots to do.Not as photogenic as Circular Quay, this place is most impressive after dark.

What to do with a Billion dollars and a Harbor. Everything is new here. In fact, the Convention Center is still under construction. Great place for walking and eating. Lots and lots of restaurants (not cheap) and a great place for kids with swings and play equipment. A two minute walk to China town from here. Imax theatre is in the middle (currently closed !!) but a great place to have lunch or dinner with spectacular views of the harbor and the highrise building beyond.

Evening action. What an exciting place to visit at night. Spend the night enjoying great food and drinks plus people watch. Entertainment all on its own. So many great eating places and bars overlooking the water. Loved it.

Love Love Loved It. Darling Harbour is just beautiful, the coffee shops are lovely to sit down in have a coffee and watch your kids play on the amazing equipment in the park, my kids especially loved the mini pirate ship. Beautiful place.

Girls weekend away . Just loving coming to darling harbour every chance I get. I the all the different restaurants and always a side trip to lindt. The shopping centre is always a favourite and has a great food court.

Awesome place ! . Still awesome since my last visit (15 years ago). More crowded now, it has a playground for kids with carousel, Madame Tussaud, Sydney Sea Life Aquarium. There's Mc Donald and lots of cafes along the Harbour. While your kids play at the playground, you can take a stroll or if you don't feel to take a walk , just take a sit at the Harbour .. Enjoy the sunset panoramic, sip a cup of coffee

Lots to do. The Harbour is a great starting off point to explore all of Sydney's most famous sights. It has a lot of places to eat- though pricier than other parts of the city- and has an excellent atmosphere.
Great place for a walk. stunning place to take a stroll, plenty of eateries. Easy access to the Aquarium and also madame tussauds.

Australian Travellers. A great place to visit, within easy walking distance from the city with lift access and escalators to and from the Anzac Bridge to Harbourside shops and the many restaurants around Cockle Bay. Great for families and parents with prams or strollers to access the attractions or just walk around the area taking in views of the harbour area and city. Very pretty at night when dining from one of the many restaurants facing the harbour area.

day time activity. the darling harbor is right across syndey opera house and is the main hub if you want to indulge in any water activities. can be accessed by taxi or water taxi, the latter more preferable

Enjoyable . Lovely day just walking around darling harbour, from the shops to eateries, the aquarium, zoo , then you can walk down to bangaraoo which is a lovely area to have a picnic lunch with the family

Oh my Darling. If you have never been here wait until the evening to walk out into the Harbour and be dazzled by the magical lit up buildings that takes your breath away. The restaurants surrounding it are fabulous and very reasonably priced. I experienced Toros Tapas, Italian and The Hard Rock Café - nothing bad to say about any of them. To add to your experience, there are sometimes fireworks on a Saturday Night - 10 mins of Disneyfied sparkle in the sky - either a perfect end to a day, or the beginning of an exciting evening because there are many more eateries and bars to sample.

Very relaxing. A very typical tourist area with restaurants lining the water front. Shops are plenty as well with some good bargains at some of them. But make sure you know the fair market prices, otherwise you might be paying more than you should.
Different views . This is another great harbor! Short walk from the man harbor. Still offers great views from different side!

Go pro robbed here. Don't be deceived by the activity, fun and laughter. We had our go-pro taken out of a bag. The police collaborated, but it was a loss. Thinking back, for the crowd that gathers of a Sunday, there is little supervision. Be cautious even though in Sydney in general, we did lower our "tourists cautiousness".
Bustling. This was a flying visit to darling harbour we got the ferry here to manly bay.boats coming and gong all the time.This is like the hub of Sydney.

One of the best places in Sydney. This is one of my favourite places to go in Sydney. There are so many things to do there with your family or friends. Restaurants, bowling, laser tag, cinema, aquarium, museum, playgrounds. You can even just walk and enjoy the view.

Great offer for foodies!. If you enjoy food and also have kids (you can also enjoy it without kids, it's a bay of restaurants) then it's a great option for Sydney. It has plenty of things to do with children (IMAX, several museums, etc.) and so many food options that you'll grow tired of deciding where to eat next.

A must visit when in Sydney. Darling Harbour is so relaxing to sit by the water and watch the world go by.Its not too busy and most of the time it is very quiet and peaceful. Enjoyable, easy walk right around. Visit the Maritime museum and purchase tickets to go on 4 ships. There are plenty of bars and restaurants all around to choose from, both out on the deck and inside the Harbourside building There is construction underway on the new International Conference centre The best part for families and people just visiting has to be the big firework display every Saturday night at 20:30, this attracts thousands of people and it a great show.Tranport by light rail and ferry. Imax, Aquarium, Chinese Friendship Garden all close by. As well as several types of speciality shops inside, So something for all kinds of weather
Darling Harbour is that. Darling Harbour is a lovely little walk from the CBD and has some nice shops, restaurants and vistas. It is well worth a walkabout.

Many things in 1 place. Visit Darling Harbour on a Saturday at 8pm where they have a fireworks display. Plenty of dining options and activities to do there such as the maritime museum, aquarium and ferry rides to do whale watching or just simple let the kids play at the playground. Great place to spend a day with so much to do and see all in 1 place.

A must visit! . I loved Darling Harbour! The waters were pristine, the bridge was beautiful and there were heaps of eateries and what not around! I could easily spend almost half a day there. Sitting on the bridge was great for people watching too.
Excellent . Loved it here so pretty and when we went in July it was busy but not too busy!The shops and the atmosphere were great!Will return one day!

View of the water, happening place with people buzzing around. View of the water, happening place with people buzzing around. Spoiled for choice with eateries and bars. We enjoyed happy our drinks at Tokio Hotel (cocktails $10 and spirits $5) with great live music. Got Gelato at Gelatissimo and sat by the water. Go into imax if you need to use the bathroom, it was clean.

Nice area to enjoy a break. There are a lot of interesting things to do in Darling Harbour. My wife and I prefer the most basic one, we sit and enjoy the sunshine and just watch people go about their business. You can get an ice cream an a coke and just relax on a really nice day.

catch the fireworks!. charming harbour lined with cafés, restaurants, Imax and aquarium.
fireworks on Saturday night was a nice surprise!

Darling Harbor, ok. Darling Harbor is ok but not my favorite. The Zoo, Aquarium, wax museum and other very touristy things are here and there are not many great views. The Maritime Museum is just across the water but there is no easy way to walk there.
If you miss this one, you won't miss anything.

Good vibe. This is a bustling public space with plenty to do and keep people occupied including the Maritime Museum and an IMAX theatre. There are places to eat and drink and when I was there a street entertainer was trying to juggle flaming swords with varying degrees of success. The harbour is surrounded by skyscrapers and urban scenery fatigue is a risk!

Still impressive but is beginning to lag. The first visit here is always impressive but the place is static while in other cities these sort of places are moving forward. Its almost a metaphor for Sydney itself in the last 10 years.

Busy waterway. Second most popular harbour in Sydney, anchorage for many private yatches and ferrys. Cool nice place with many tourist attractions around. The Star Casino is just walking and Maritime museum is one of the attractions around. Darling Harbour bridge is a technological marvel worth trod-ding around

Romantic and lots of restaurants. This is a really romantic place and has lots of restaurants for a caffe or for dinner. This is a must see place and a place to spend some time during the evening for a walk through and a dinner.
Nice visit.. Awesome to walk around. Great restaurants. Interesting marine museum. Not too much for teenagers to do.

Food. Darling harbour/Cockle bay is full of bars and restaurants and especially for seafood. Nick's is perhaps the best but you need to book to guarantee a table. There are also good fish/steak/ meat choices at most of the places there

Great place to stay. It is one of my favourite places to visit. There are many thing to see and do and also has some great accommodation available. There are many different options for dinner and also includes a shopping centre. There is a ferry to Circular Quay also. It is about a 10 minute walk to Tower Hill station.
Just lovely.... You have so much to see and do at Darling Harbour. You could spend a whole day shopping, eating, drinking and sightseeing!

Nice views . Darling Harbour has lots of bars and restaurants. Most of the bars have a Happy Hour so walk around and see which ones best suit you.There's an IMAX cinema as well if you like gigantic cinema screens!!There is also the maritime museum that you can tour around. This can take several hours if you are interested in walking around retired warships, a submarine and a full scale sailable replica of Captain Cook's The Endeavor.
Sightseeing. We took ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. Went there to visit Madame Tussauds and Hard Rock.

Whole day fun. Darling Harbour is one of these places you can go and spend the day and night at. If you're going with kids, bring spare clothes and let them play in the big, free playground which also has water features. you can then take them for lunch (we like the chinese and dumpling places in the mall, despite being mall-averse), then off to the Maritime Museum - they have special exhibits for kids, a dedicated room or little ones, an area where kids all ages can do activities and you can visit historic boats and a submarine. There's the aquarium, the wildlife place, the Imax cinema.... all these are fun without kids too. I recommend The Malay for dinner, and there are bars there too.
Nice place for lunch. Darling Harbour area has lots of restaurant next to the harbour. You can sit down with yummy seafood plate and look over the nice harbour view.
Beautiful . Beautiful place to visit. You can find many restaurants and shops. Cruises through the Harbour also depart from here.
Very trendy. Trendy location for a nice of dinner & drinks. Awesome to stroll around the habour at eveningsfor beautiful city light voews along the water after a great meal & couple of drinks.
Wow. I love this place visited a lot while I have been here. Lots of lovely shops to look in and great coffee shops
Will be good when the building work finishes. The place is a bit of a mess at the moment but when it is finished it will be a great place to spend some time at. Much better when the sun is shining.

The best place to pass time in Sydney. Located in Sydney CBD. Madam Tussaud, Sea Life Aquarium, Sydney Zoo, IMAX and some more attractions are located here. Best of the restaurants are also here in Darling harbor where one can sit and enjoy the cool breeze and delicious food.
Family visit. A good place to visit with family. Many attractions for family visit and good places to eat out though a bit expensive.

Nice spot. Darling harbour is a great place to go whent he weather is good, it is so relaxing to sit by the water and watch the world go by.Its not too busy and most of the time it is very quiet and peaceful.There are often street performers around the water.There are plenty of bars and restaurants all around to choose from including the world famouse Hard rock Cafe.The big wheel was a good attraction to the area but it is no longer there.There is construction underway on the new International Conference centre which looks good and will be great for the area once completeThe best part for families and people just visiting has to be the big firework display every Saturday night at 20:30, this attracts thousands of people and it a great show.
Scenic, shopping, museums. Large commercial, wharf, museum, restaurant area. Great day out around Darling Harbour, over to Chinese Gardens, Haymarket. Lots of eating options, shade areas.
Great place. One of the great places you can spent time in sydneyLots of things to doSea life, madame tussade, wildlife etcAlso plenty of restaurants and bars all overA must visit place !!!

spectacular at night. Thanks to a weakling bridge you can circumnavigate Darling Harbour on foot from Kings Quay right round. There harbour is home to dozens of restaurants that cater to all tastes. The are also attractions, such as a casino, Madame Tussards, an aquarium etc.

Very nice. Quite picturesque maritime museum nearby and a plethora f bars and restaurants either-side of the harbour. The ferry is easily assessing from either Darling or nearby Pyremont. Saturday nights at 8.30pm a firework display lights up the harbour. The walkway above the harbour provides another good view of Darling Harbour occasionally your held back n the bridge while bigger vessels come in and out worth a view if your lucky. Very wheelchair and children friendly facilities.

Great place to visit. Darling harbour is one of the famous place to visit in sydney. There is a hard rock cafe there in darling harbour. The souvenir is quite expensive. For me you should shop for souvenir at the market city. You can eat pancake on the rocks here and there is a delicious french crepe here aswell .

This is a less formal place to have fun. If you are visiting Sydney and your goal is to take the pictures of the all "must see" places, then you should start with the Harbor/the Rocks/the Opera House area just a bit north. But if you just want to have fun, maybe with your friends or family - Darling Harbour has a lot of activities. My favorite one is the kids playground - it's a truly world class place. They also have some fun cruises leaving from there, and they attract some very classy dressed locals, so you can enjoy some people watching. And there are more formal attractions like wax or maritime museums. And, by the way, this area maybe not as recognizable as the Sydney Harbor, it still looks and feels great.

We used to lived here and loved it. We will always miss this place, We used to live here and they have great restaurants, ( I recommend Hurricanes ) there is a play are for kids, A massive Imax cinema ! which you must go to and the museum is great ( you can go in the submarine and on the ships ) great fun for family's
You have to go....just because. Darling Harbour is one of those places you just need to visit once. Nice walk on a sunny day and lots of side attractions. Just go, tahe a walk and rekax.
Nice place to stroll. This is an awesome place to take a stroll... The sydney aquarium is walking distance and also the China Town. There are some awesome restraunts here
Good place for seeing the seagulls and piegons. It's a good place to have a close touch of the harbour. If you like to see the sea animals at the aquarium, you can pay a short trip there.
Great Day Out. You can spend the day at Darling Harbour-Wax Museum/Aquarium/Wildlife Park could fill in the day in one area. Plenty of eating areas-also movies-spend a day there!

Great outing. Fantastic place to spend the day Especially worthwhile is time spent on the submarine etc
Allow yourselves enough time to do that or make sure you go back and do it
Site seeing. Great place lots of attractions to go to. Bowling laser scermish, imax wax museum. Also lost of free stuff it has an amazing kids playground and the maritime museum is great.
Mmmmmm. Mikes fish and chips ..best I've ever tasted will remember them always not one piece of fish but two wonderful ..
So trendy. Darling harbour is a must visit when you come to Sydney there is so much to offer and it is a very trendy place.
Sydney Break. Darling Harbour, an entertaining area of its own. Heaps of shops and Restaurants and can catch water taxis to anywhere on Sydney Harbour. Close to the STAR Casino - Cheers.

Wow!!. Love the maritime history in Darling Harbour. So many ships, old and new. Many historical displays. Great restaurants too. Wish we had more time to spend exploring this place. Will definitely make time to visit again!
Nice place to spend the evenings. The fireworks in the night are amazing.. The place always has some actives going on.. Many good pubs and restaurants in this area..

Darling Harbour, Sydney, AU. Darling Harbour, Sydney, AU is a great place to go for a day trip. There's lots to see and do in the area. There are many great restaurants, the aquarium, the wildlife park, a wax museum and a maritime museum, IMAX, Chinatown and lots of shopping and even a casino.

So much to do here. Darling Harbour is one of the Sydney CBD's buzz places comprising cafes, restaurants, shopping complex with food hall, IMAX cinema, maritime museum, Chinese gardens and entertainment attractions.

Great views and eateries. Spent most of our time eating at restaurants in Darling Harbour. Great place to walk and views excellent. Very busy with ferries. Good night life and always something happening.

First Night Visit. My previous visit was during the day. This is a revisit to Darling Harbour after 3 decades but during evening. View was great. Overly commercial and touristic. Recommended 45 mins walk along the harbourside will be sufficient to take it all in.

Darling Harbour ferry landing.. Returning from a day trip we took the ferry. It was a great trip which landed us at the Harbour.
Darling Harbour is a very active and fun place to visit. From people watching, shops, restaurants, and views of the harbor.
Nice spot . Great variety of restaurants and bars. Lots of play areas for kids and the maritime museum was interesting and the imax theatre was great also. Great part of my vist to Sydney
Great sights and walkway . Great walking trails to go along the harbor for shopping or just sit and enjoy the water. Anything you could possibly want is provided there.
Sydney Weekender. Saturday night fireworks a highlight- plenty of great places to eat. Trenery at the Novotel Darling Harbour has a great breakfast and great dinner options!

So much to do here. So much attractions and activities are cramped into the site that used to be a working harbour that has been rejuvenated and converted into a tourist and commercial area. Ibis and Novotel hotels, The Star which houses Sydney's casino and entertainment centre, the Sydney Aquarium, Maritime Museum, restaurants, etc. are located here. You can just stay here for a week and get yourself busy without stepping out from this location.Easily accesible by light rail from Central Station or ferries.
Nice outing accessible by Ferry. We stayed at the Rocks and visiting Darling Harbour by ferry from Circular Quay- a nice outing and great place to find a fish lunch.
Too Tourist Trap. If you're into wax museums and ripley's believe it or not, make sure you get to Darling Harbour ... i thought it was a waste of time.

Darling harbour. Best place to stay lots of eating places and shopping you can go to darling harbour buy yourself at night while partner is having a nap from any of the hotels going behind darling harbour have been staying there for the last 20 years and never had a worry at all about my safety and love the shops female point of view great place

One big construction site. You can't always get it right and we chose to visit Darling harbour whilst it was undergoing a major makeover. I am confident the finished product will be a wonderful experience. It is easy to see this is a major attraction already and with the new development it's going to be a knock out, I am looking forward to coming back to see it when it is finished. Just to clarify I am of pensionable age but I had a ball with the completed water feature that has channelled waterways with locks that could be opened and diverters to alter the direction of the water flow and these quirky spiral water elevators or water pumps, I can imagine the kids having an absolute ball with these, we did. I am told the old water feature has been filled in, which is a pity as this was also good fun, hopefully it will be replaced with something equally enjoyable. Darling harbour is always going to be a magnet for tourists or even locals and there is so much to do there, you would need three days to do it justice with the Aquarium, The Maritime Museum, The Chinese Garden and whatever else they build into the new complex. Good job there are so many restaurants and cafes there to cater for your hunger doing all these things.
One of my favourites. I just love this area of SydneyIt is a great place to visit and a great place to eat and drink or just walk around
Out and about . Wonderful day and night out. The aquarium the wax museum was good. I enjoyed the day you need to get a catamaran from parramatta if you can excellent trip

An excellent location for entertainment and food variety.. We spent one afternoon and two nights visiting darling harbour. Sydney Acquarium is very informative. Enjoyed the food variety that is economic, well cooked and offered.

Very Touristy. It is a long way to walk, and so many places to eat, but they are all the same! It has lost its appeal for us as its crowded and very touristy. I couldn't find the Chinese Gardens and the spaces were not as open as I remembered. Its been a while.

So much improvement since last time. Many years ago when i worked and lived in Sydney I craved somewhere to go to be able to eat and have loads of variety. Being from Melbourne I had been spoilt. Finally Sydney has somewhere. So much choice. Amazing.

Good bars . This is a cool place to visit with family or friends. With numerous restaurants and bars to suit everyone's appetite. Also be aware that quite a few boat tours depart from Darling Harbour so it can get a little busy at times! Well worth a visit!!

Vibrant Atmosphere. We went to Darling Harbour to primarily go to the Maritime Museum and were so impressed with the vibrant atmosphere of the area.There are so many bars and restaurants overlooking the water and numerous attractions.We caught the train to Town Hall and walked down to Pyrmont Bridge. It was so easy to get there without the parking hassles.

So much to see and do!. Absolutely LOVE Darling Harbour. There is everything to do in just this area from the Zoo and Aquarium to great bars and dining. Hard Rock Cafe Sydney was one of my favorite places and the Aussie burger is a must try! You can walk around, take the bus, taxi, ferry, just about any type of travel leaves from Darling Harbour. I can't wait to go back!

Must visit place for anyone visiting Sydney. Darling Harbour is having everything one wants to spend quality time with friends and family. Good place having best of shops, cafes and restaurants.Weekly Saturday fireworks add to the fun.

Scenic views & variety of yummy food. A beautiful scenic view of the harbour especially at night and good shopping arcade with reasonable prices.. A wide variety of cuisine choices fromSeafood, steaks, chinese ans indian to name a few..
Relaxing visit. Darling Harbour is a very good and popular location with many attractions. Currently there are building taking place, but still a good place to visit.

Lots to see.. Darling Harbour was being redeveloped at the time of our visit yet it had so much to offer, plenty of shops, grass/park area, a water area for people to enjoy (mainly children), food outlets, a cinema, boats trips, a zoo and an aquarium to name a few things. Definitely one area of Sydney to visit but plan for a few hours when visiting this area as there is much to see.
Darling Harbour. Great choice of bars and restaurants and entertainment. Easily accessible from all areas of sydney either by road or ferry

A bit toursity for me. But a great maritime museum, an interesting aquarium, lots of people watching and lots of places to eat. However, I usually don't eat there as the resturants don't offer much distinguishable food. Worth a viist thought
Chinese Gardens and Paddys Markets. What a wonderful experience, a walk along the wharf , the childrens water park fantastic days outing

Sometimes stuck!. I travel to Sydney at least once a year on business. A couple of times I have had limited time in this interesting City, so much so that on more than one occasion I have not been able to venture any further than Darling Harbour. Some great restaurants here including Kazbah. Plenty to see and do if you open your eyes, and your attitudes.

Love Darling harbour. I really love to wander around Darling harbour, especially at night when it is all lit up. There are a plethora of restaurants and bars and during the day many attractions to visit.

Darling harbour . Visited our old favourites. I enjoyed the factory outlets above Paddys market more than the market. Watching the fudge being made at the fudge shop in the main harbour complex was a fun entertainment. Easy to get about and good access to ammenities

Must come when in Sydney!. Darling harbour is a beautiful place to be. It is a great combination of shopping, restaurants and family friendly things to do. There is a nice playground very close to the McDonald's in darling harbour. LOVE IT HERE!
Good food and a relaxing atmosphere to spend the day. Come here. You will not be disappointed.

Always a MUST visit. Again gorgeous place. So sad to see the IMAX is closing. Saw Sully today which was awesome.
Fab food, fab views and just another gem to visit.

Plenty to see and do. Spent a pleasant couple of hours just wandering, didn't want to spend any money, which proved to be quite easy. There are plenty of things to see without opening the wallet, also spent some time just people watching, which is endlessly entertaining in this environment.

The best spot in Sydney. I will rate this even higher than the Opera House and Circular Quay. Fabulous place to relax. Add to this a beautiful skyline, a well maintain bridge, a harbour with a multitude of boats and ships. Also add the existence of the Aquarium, Madame Tussads, mini-Zoo, Maritime Museum and the Harbourside Mall and you have everythign you want to have within your reach. The best spot in Syndey in my opinion.

Better and better. This place is just getting better and better, I'm quite spoilt as whenever I come to Sydney there is really good weather and I cannot think of a better place than Draling Harbour to spend my time, I cannot wait for the construction to finish.

Grest Setting!. A good feel about the place. Lots of places for shopping and lots of restaurants to choose from. Use public transport to get to Darling Harbour as parking in the city is quite expensive.
Perfect area to stay and dine in!. I stayed at The ParkRoyal Darling Harbour and ate most of my meals in this area. There's lots to choose from and it really comes to life at night.

Some interesting things to do. We went to the aquarium and after we had some burger with pints in the harbour restaurants. We've also booked whales sightseeing which departed from a ferry to Circular Quay. Nice Marina with good places for a bite and amazing views. Don't miss it.

Romantic Place. My wife and I went here (trough pyrmont bridge) on our last day OZ trip. It really fits its name: romantic and beautiful. Great view of sydney downtown, harborside, cockle bay wharf, kingstreet wharf, museum of maritime, sea life aquarium, madame tussaud etc. Fortunately there was a fireworks show at night. It made the night even more memorable. I should return here whenever I have chance to come here.
Darling Harbour is Darling. We enjoyed Darling Harbour. It is populated with plenty of restaurants and cafes. People watching and strolling are the the best activities in this area.

Beautiful experience. We were lucky during our hop on-hop off city bus tour that the weather held up. It was still a bit breezy on the bridge that was a bit bone chilling for us.
We walked completely around the harbor soaking in the beautiful views of the harbour, and the the surrounding city. Darling Barbour was a fabulous visit!

Great Place to unwind and relax. I had been to this place when I was visiting my brother in Sydney. It is one of the go to attractions in Sydney which provides lots of food choices and activities. I would definitely recommend buying tickets for the aquarium in advance if you want to skip waiting for long in the queue.
Great place to visit. There is so much to see and do here that you could spend your whole visit in this one area. Restaurants, ferries and even a Submarine (a real one) to visit

Only the second best thing to Sydney harbour. amazing eat outs, shopping places and tourist attractions, don't miss the aquarium, its probably the best you will see on the lines of sea world, san diego

Great Tourist attraction. It is beautiful and great place to spend a long fun family day!
The aquarium was a hit with the kids.
They loved feeding the birds and having the mall made it great for hanging out there all day.

A good place to grab a bite and a few drinks. Nice view specially during the night. And it is a good place to eat and drink. The place offers a lot of good restaurants. If u just wish to click pictures or just sit and relax this is the place you should come to.

Spend the day. Darling harbour is a great spot for tourists. I would suggest you spend a whole day there. It's particular good if it's a miserable day. They have madame tussauds the aquarium maritime museum Imax theater and plenty of restaurants and cafes. There is also harbourside shopping centre. A short stroll is town hall and the queen Victoria building. Nicks cafe on the harbour does a great meal that is quite affordable. And has all day breakfast.
FISH AND CHIPS. When you pass by darling harbour. Don't forget to eat Fish and Chips at the restaurant nearby. It's a must!
nice to visit. nice to visit by day or night. We enjoyed a nice short walk and dinner, followed by a fireworks show. always heaps to see and do.

Gorgeous Darling Harbour, Full of Life. Houses the National Maritime Museum as well as restaurants and an Imax theater (biggest in the world), Darling Harbour is a very lively place and has a weekly fireworks show every Saturday night.

Spring has sprung in Sydney!!!. Today I was in Darling Harbour trying to decide what to have for lunch. Ended up decided to take advantage of this beautiful weather and sit on the wooden steps outside near the marina. So peaceful watching the seagulls, water and boats surrounding you!

Happening Place. This place is really happening specially evenings over the weekend. And the fire works from here were too good. Saw a couple getting there pre wedding shoot done so this is definitely a must visit place.

Watching the fireworks over the harbour.. I love going somewhere that has something to offer both day and night. The shopping is relaxed and varied and on a weekend, the nightlife is abuzz with families, couples and friends all out for a great night out. There's something for everyone of all ages. They have an AMAZING park for kids, with Cafes lining the boardwalk and across from there, are restaurants to suit every culinary taste and budget. The fireworks are always a treat.

A pleasant afternoon. Looking for a great weekend trip? Head down to the darling harbour & soak up the sun.With a superb family environment & weekly festivals it is a definate winner.Why not pack in a gelato or two? Want a sly cappucino? Darling harbour has it all.
Relaxing place to visit. darling harbour is such a lovely place to walk and relax during the weekend, there is always something on and plenty of restaurant options. Take a stroll next time your there

Lots to choose from. The Darling Harbour has so many things to do you can't do it all in a day. Maybe you can't even do it all in 2 days. So many restaurants to pick from along with so many other things. And looking at the boats is enjoyable also.

vibrant place with many activity options. We went to Darling Harbour to visit Madam Tussauds and walked through the restaurants afterwards. It houses various eating options, clubs/bars and even an IMAX Theater for movie buffs. It's one of the places that stay alive after 6 PM.

Lovely place to watch the world go by...... We stayed just across the bridge in the Park Royal Hotel.The harbour was done up with lots of different love themed things for the month of love. Lots of lovely cafe's and bars to sit and watch the world go by. We ate in a couple of places and all where delicious and good value for money.Can catch a water taxi from Darling Harbour to see some more sights in Sydney. We walked from Darling Harbour around to the Sydney Opera House. Easy walk with no fear of getting lost. Lots to see and do, cannot wait to return!

Vibrant place to be. There are range of events & cerebration throughout the year @ Darling Harbour. Fireworks every Saturday & the place is buzzed with street entertainment against the backdrop of packed restaurants, pubs & bars.
Came to attend attractions . Nice easy access. Wet say probably nicer on a sunny day. Many various boat trips leave from here. Planks slippery when wet
Another Sydney Harbor. In here, you can see several interesting place, such Sydney aquarium, I-Max, wildlife, etc. We visited last week, and use light train from town hall. Nice area to visit.
great harbour location. a place for everyone to enjoy - nice and sunny and plenty of places to eat shop and space for kids to run around - access to ferries to see the beautiful water ways.
Very enjoyable . We spent some time down at Darling harbour with a few exclet meals and morning coffee. View of the houbour at night is stunning.

Changed a lot. The harbour area has a lot of construction going on and it is a bit chaotic. The water itself is littered with rubbish and filthy. There are buildings now encroaching into the water, making he harbour smaller. I was disappointed with the mess. They are spoiling what was an asset

Stay away till building is finished. The food court was a good place to get variety but the shopping areas are not very interesting. May be better when the re building is finished. The attractions outside are still good m

Worth a vist - scenic - but lots of construction at present. Darling harbour is another special visiting point around SydneyIt has good restaurants of all price categories...You can access by ferries or you can walk It is very scenic with lots of street theatreLots of play equipment for kidsNice gardensHOWEVERMajor construction is taking place which means that it isnt quite as pretty as it will be or has been
great place to chill out. a fun percent on the water in Sydney with a plethora of restaurants and bars to enjoy as well as the Sydney Aquarium and Imax

Attractive harbour even in the pouring rain. We took the ferry around the Harbour and probably got off a stop too early, so we had to walk over the bridge to the other side. On a fine day this would be a good plan but as it was pouring with rain we got soaked! Nevertheless, there is a lot to see and it is very pretty. We went into the shopping mall where we found a waterfront bar to have a meal, and lots of indoor shops to wander around. Take a ferry, and make sure you walk both sides to make the most of it.

Love, Love Love This Area. Both times that I've travelled to Sydney I've stayed in the Darling Harbor neighborhood. I love the short walk to Paddy's Market, the central bus station, the aquarium, the ferries, the restaurants and the Galleria. Everything that you could ever need is right there in Darling Harbor and it's clean, safe, and fun.

Museums and food. Darling Harbor is very lively. There are a ton or restaurants lining the water. The aquarium is here as well as a wax museum. The Maritime museum is on the other side of the harbor. There is also a casino. We took the ferry from Circular Quay.

Spend an hour, a day or more time if you have it.. Seriously one of the best places to visit, eat or enjoy a relaxing drink. Darling Harbour has it all so make sure you book plenty of time to relax and enjoy the many sights, cafes, restaurants and attractions it has to offer. A cultural melting pot of cuisine so there is choice for fast food to quality dining options and attractions for the young and old. Enjoy land based or water activities but whatever you do don't miss out on this wonderful location.
Best icecream. Not sure of the spot there its not nz icecream although they do have good icecream, its a mavpovic or something? Anyway got to have a stroll there at night and stop for icecream :)

Wish I'd had a more than a day here!. This is a beautiful touristy harbour. So many things to do here. We had coffee in one of the many coffee shops (an Italian place, I forget the name) and then we decided to visit the Maritime Museum (Highly recommended). There's a Sea World here, Madame Tussauds and Australian Wildlife exhibit here (not the real name, but that escapes me). We didn't do these but really wanted to. Time was an issue for us. The food places looked good and we did note that they were not as expensive as Sydney Harbour. If we went back to Sydney again, I'd spend a full weekend here.
Great place for lunch or dinner. A nice view from most of the restaurants. Great place to have a drink and watch the sunset. Lots of restaurants to choose from.

The only part you MUST visit. Whilst in Sydney on business, I didn't favour very much. But darling harbour is simply divine. A must visit if in Sydney. With lots to see and do on offer, it was simply the only reason I would ever return to Sydney. Absolutely beautiful place to be if here. Lots of lovely restaurants as well.

favourite place in sydney. Darling harbour became my favourite place in sydney. Buzzing with energy, there is so much a tourist can do here. during evenings the place takes another shape all together. some amazing restaurants around. childrens play park has free entry. Many water taxis start from here. Aquarium, zoo, madam tussads museum , everything is hereselect a hotel which is at walking distance from darling harbour to enjoy the place

Happening !!!. The darling harbour buzzes all day with sll the restaurants around. One could find a variety of restaurants with open air seatings helping you enjoy your lunch or dinner overlooking the harborZ

Showed up just in time for fireworks. During an evening trip to photograph the Sydney Opera House, a friendly family on vacation told me about some fireworks at Darling Harbour. I wasn't quite sure where that was, but I figured if I followed the waterfront, I would find it eventually.It took me longer than it would have had I simply asked for directions, but I was looking for a bit of an adventure. I arrived right as the fireworks were started. There was a a bridge packed with people for the show. It was short, but spectacular. After that, I walked around and Darling Harbour is a happening place full of shopping and restaurants. I made a second trip back during the day there is plenty to do. It would be easy to spend a whole day between the shops, attractions and restaurants.
Amazing Place. This is stunning area with shops and food places around the harbour there is a great vibe and a must see place enjoy the water and street performers at certain times of the day

Lots of activities in this area. We only wandered and had a drink here but there are many restaurants and bars as well as ferries departing. The area is home to many museums and the Aquarium. A must visit
Beautiful at night. What a lovely place especially at night. Great place to sit and eat and thoroughly enjoyed by my wife and I. Highly recommend going here

Quick visit whilst waiting to fly home!!!!. Excellent day out and easy to get to from our airport hotel by train. Plenty to see and do, unfortunately we only had limited time to spend here. The maritime museum and dock area was really good.

Scenic, with attractions, shopping and dining. Darling Harbour is a nice place to spend half a day or so. You can visit the National Maritime Museum and its static displays --- sub, battleship and old warship, or the Seaquarium.It's a very pretty place and good for just having a walk. It is filled with shopping although I can't say I saw any shopping that was truly unique. It also has lots of nice restaurants with views. Definitely something you have to do on a nice day
Fabulous. Great bars & restaurants in a lovely harbour front area - like being in a totally different city. Much nicer area than the cbd.

Nice place for a stroll. Lovely layout with cafes and restaurants dotted along the fringe. Was excited to hear that there are fireworks held here EVERY Saturday!! After a long day walking Sydney we just wanted to curl up in our hotel but set an alarm to go back out and watch the fireworks. Great choice. The atmosphere was great with crowds of people all there to do the same thing & the display lasted at least 5 minutes. Was well worth it.
Fun Area. Darling Harbour has lots of restaurants/bistros to choos from, a nice play area for children, clean restroom areas, etc.
One of nicest places in Sydney for views and food!. Love this place! Several excellent restraunts with variety of choice and relaxing place for a meal and few drinks. Accessible by ferry.
Sweetie Darling - mwah mwah!. What an excellent place. Stroll the waterfront, pop into a bar for a drink, or food. Within walking distance of the central city.

Very Cosmopolitan. Loved Darling Harbour, so well set out. Lovely restaurants, water features & shops. There was a boat show on at the time and they were all lit up. Lovely for a nice relaxing stroll.

Great for retail therapy and food . That's pretty much it. Great shopping in harbourside and so accessible by foot or light rail from Central train station. Gelatissimo gelato is delicious too near Imax - some is dairy and gluten free!
Also brilliant for kids with huge water play area, flying fox and sand play areas.
We love visiting Darling Harbour!

Cool Little spot. Awesome place to chill with family and friends, or alone.
Massive kids play area, constant entertainment, plenty of food and drinking venues, boats and a lovely walk to china town.
Free fireworks . The best time to visit Darling Harbour is on a Saturday just before 8.30 pm to ensure you get to see the free fireworks.

Romantic at night, don't try at any other time. A reflection of your journey is clearly stated on the water in front of Darling Harbour bay. Lights from surroundings, and a 'fancy' bench along the coast will give you a serenity and tranquil feeling despite of people walk or mingle around you. Such a bay. Try to eat or drink in the bay side, one to many. Take a sit on café, restaurant, or on a bench with your carry on food pack, and enjoy the fantastic atmosphere in Darling Harbour, Sydney.
Beautiful . Darling harbour is a trendy part of Sydney lots of great eateries oops take a stroll watch the ferries and look at some very rich boats
Beautful view. Lots of things to see and do especially if you want to eat. Good attractions to see as well which will keep you busy.

Best place to have food by the side of Sydney skyline………….. Darling harbour is best to visit on weekend nights as there are so many pubs for drinks and all…hut I specially recommend to people for food such as zaffran for Indian food and casa best Italian food. It’s well connected with road and sea.

Nice view on the bridge. It's always been a nice view to walk on the bridge across the darling Harbour. It's a bit chilling today. Both sides of the Harbour have plenty of seafood restaurants, so there are many choices around here.
My favourite place in the world. unreal this place love it so so much you wont be disappointed so many places to see and eat and relax, drink or just explore
Best place in Sydney. Nice place with awesome view on the marina side. Lots of restaurants, cafes and other entertainment for the family such as the aquarium.

Lots of construction at present. A good variety of restaurants and shops, however great disruptions at present from construction..A great deal to see and do at Darling Harbour.It is one of the focal Points of Sydney; along with Circular Quay,The Rocks and the Botanical Gardens

Darling Harbour. Spent an afternoon walking aroubd Darling Harbour soaking up the sun, entertainment and fine restuarants. Plenty to do which includes shopping, Museum and just sit back and enjoy the buskers. Well worth the experience.

When in Sydney - Darling Harbour is a must do.... We have been in Sydney many times, we love the city and will ( if we can ) always come back. The darling Harbour is ti me one of the best scenic attraction in Sydney. Simply you will find almost anything you are looking for. The natural surrounds, jet so tp speak fenced in by the harbour and enhanced through the architecture that has been added, gives this place it never ending charm. Walking along the key's with their offerings on one side the harbour and boots big and small, you can take one of them for a sight seeing trip on the harbour, or join in and have a drink or a meal in one of the many restaurants and bars on the way. A cocktail here, and entree there and perhaps a meal some place else. The restaurants cater for any taste you will not be disanointed. ( and may I say they cater for any budged as well ) We love this kind of eating out, sitting outside and watch the world go by. Often - on weekends Sydney but on a splendid fireworks display in the evening, you can hear the aahhh's nd ohhh's from everywhere. You can walk up and over to the bridge that is close by and see Sydney's old jet most photographed attraction, the Sydney Harbour Bidge ( the big one ) visible from everywhere near the Harbour. If you have the energy to walk further to the "Rocks" The excess to that bridge is near by. A casual walk (free) over the bridge gives you a fantastic look over Sydney either side and plenty of photo opportunity.There is a charming little place on the other end where you can get some refreshments before you go back, or take the train back to Circular Key.However, going back on foot to the area called the "Rocks", you find plenty to see eat and drink. A truly multicultural area that offers a taste for everyone. Including a German Beer and a Bratwurst or other many culinary specialities. Finger licking goodHave a go! ps lets not forget the art gallrieas in that area and the fantastic old buildings with historyyou can ask any shopkeeper about the history within.

Lovely walks around the area. Lots of restaurants and shops.. This is best visited on a good day, when the sun is out and people are enjoying themselves there. The views of the city and surrounding architecture are awe-inspiring.

Beautiful Harbor. We came to Darling Harbor to take a dinner cruise. While waiting to board our boat we were able to see what a beautiful harbor this is. Lots of boats both private and commercial. Also another place for views of the city. And lots of restaurants and shops.

THE BEST CITY HARBOUR!!. My boyfriend & I vacationed, in Sydney, Australia, in May 2016. We walked to Darling Harbour, from our hotel, etc. several times while there because it is the best city harbour we have ever been to! We enjoyed walking around the harbour plus there are so many great restaurants to choose from offering various types of food. The food was great at every restaurant we ate at and the services at each was also great. There are pedestrian friendly bridges into the harbour, which is a plus. of these restaurants, are very reasonable especially during lunch time. The atmosphere, at the harbour, is very nice and people really enjoy themselves while there. The Wildlife Sydney Zoo is also located at this habour and the Chinese Garden of Frienship is next to it. There is also in indoor shopping mall on one side of the harbour and an IMAX movie theater near the restaurants. There is ample seating available throughout the harbour. We also noticed an area that had fun family activities to enjoy.

Sydney has the best harbour . What I love about this place is that it really caters for everyone.There are plenty of play areas for kids - great food - and just chilling out with a fish and chip takeaway and sit on the sides.It's great that they have the IMAX here as well.Summer and even winter is good here.Lots to see and gaze around.The best thing is you don't need to spend a lot of money to enjoy yourself.Sydney rocks xx

What a fab place.... Loved it here, we stayed just up the road and walked over most nights. Loads to see and do, went on the big ferris wheel, went to see Star Trek in the Imax cinema visited a few restaurants, the food hall is good for a family who have different tastes, in an expensive city you want to pay for food that your kids are going to like so loads of choices. Preferred it in the evening with all the lights spectacular back drop. Only down side under 18's can't even go into a bar and have a coke so we didn't visit many bars...
Ok. Boring as far as harbours go. A few nice resteraunts & cafes but nothing much else to do here. There is a lot if hype about this place but seriously nothing to see no biggie if you miss this out

Recently re-developed. The harbour was still undergoing a bit of a face lift when I visited in January (not sure if it still is?), but it was still beautiful. Loads of big yachts kicking about to have a look at, the sea world aquarium and zoo are here too so it's a great place to take kids. Some great restaurants and also a shopping centre here for the adults. Lovely place.
Darling Harbour . Great place to explore with lots of options to entertain you. Great eating places and lovely ice cream!
Great for eating. We had a great time around Darling Harbour we were staying quite close so we ate at different restaurants not disapointed at all
Weekend getaway. I love darling harbour and it is a must everytime we go to Sydney. It is lovely just to sit and relax and take in the atmosphere

Multicultural fun walkway full of bars with the biggest I-max cinema.. Don't miss having a drink and people watch. We got to see Tarzan. A great experience. Unfortunately our daughter had her silver Go-pro stolen. Be cautious.

Darling Harbour. Take a water taxi or a early morning stroll from Sydney Harbour through to a very modern upmarket Darling Harbour with spectacular views of the buildings and boats galore , its a place with many eateries ,one can choose from a quick take out or fine dining , lots of Wey side entertainment along the way.

Nice walk. Nice place to walk and relax. There is a lot of building going on at present. Hugh variety of eateries to choose from for meals. There is also a number of attractions there as well. These include Aquarium, Madam Tussauds & Wild Life Sydney Zoo.
