Lots to see. Darling harbour was close to our hotel and good to get to Circular Quay and Manly. There are loads of restaurants and shops as well as the Aquarium, Wild Life, Madam Tussaud's and the IMAX. Once you figure out the opal card using the ferries is easy!
A day out with the family. We went to darling Harbour by Boat and had a BALL ! The environment was wonderful and the scenery spectacular.

Great place to be. Sunday afternoon spent relaxing in the harbour with tapas, cocktails and shots :-) perfect way to spend the weekend away without the kids ... Really loved the harbour for its laid back feel

Amazing and entertaining for the whole family. Darling Harbour has something for every one. It constantly has new attractions and fairs on the weekends. Sat night is fireworks nights.
The restaurant and bars are wonderful and they even have a good food court for that quick lunch.
We love to walk down to see tumberlong park and have the kids play on all the equipment.

its under construction. i used to love spending lazy afternoons in darling harbor, great places to eat and filled with so many international visitors, i was there during the winterfest, i found it a bit drab...the weather wasn't helping but so many open construction sites and too many people killed the atmosphere for me...

Darling Harbour. We loved this area as a family. Plenty of shopping, places to eat and things to see. Easily accessible by train (the Town Hall station) you can find plenty to keep a family busy. Boat tours leave from here, there is a giant IMAX multiplex and a wonderful city park playground. We enjoyed this area a lot!
Crinitis . Fantastic Italian with the most extensive menu ever - quality great food - excellent fast service with of course a fabulous view over the harbour
Dining and shopping paradise in Sydney. A place filled with fine restaurants and shopping malls. Romantic atmosphere in the evening. Nice view of the harbour both day and night.
Excellent Hangout place. Excellent place to visit, lots of bars and restaurants. Play area for kids in the quarter. Options for every age group.
Nice for a stroll round. Lovely to grab a drink and sit and take it all in. Nice bars and nice to walk round and look at the ships. Recommended. A good place to spend a couple of hours.
Great Outdoors. Surrounded by great Restaurants,cute shops and an imax theater its a great place to spend the afternoon

Beautiful Sydney Darling Harbour. This place is full of awesome restaurants and the Sydney Aquarium and Museum is right there as well and only just a quick walk to the city centre to shop so a great place to stay near.You are only a stones through from China town for a great massage and it is a great central location, I always stay right near Darling Harbour as it is just amazing and with the new convention centre being built right there it is going to be great.If your at a convention at Australian Technology Park you are only a 45min walk from Darling Harbour or a $10-$15 Uber ride.I love shopping at Queen Victoria Centre, Myer Centre & Westfield and it is only a short walk to Darling Harbour for dinner or lunch after shopping.

Well worth wandering around and soaking up the sights. Why not start with a visit to the Maritime Museum and follow that up with a visit to the aquarium? That's two attractions where you can spend half a day before browsing the plethora of shops prior to having a bite to eat at one of the many cafes and restaurants available - something for all budgets.Seek out the Chinese Garden for a touch of tranquility and then head for the Imax Theatre for a dose of escapism. Go for a boat ride.Alternatively, you can just amble around at your own pace to soak up the atmospher and admire the views, especially the city skyline.

A Gastronomic Paradise. This harbour houses many restaurants which offers many kind of cuisines & seafoods including The Hard Rock Cafe Sydney. It also has a ship South Steyne which has also been partly converted to a restaurant also. Facing the main attractions on the other side of the harbour is Madam Tussauds & Sea Life Aquarium. Good for visits on the day and also night where lights & reflections from the harbour waters will make good pictures
Lots to see and do. A great way to experience Sydney Harbour, with generous quays to walk along, museums, shopping, pubs and restaurants, or just to hang out and take in the skyline.

Feast for eyes. You can't visit Sydney without walking around Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf. The Pyrmont Bridge - foot traffic only - is one of the world's oldest (and still operational) swingspan bridges, enabling easy access to Darling Harbour from the CBD. It also provides a great spot to sit and watch what's happening around Darling Harbour. There's plenty to see and do around Darling Harbour, so plan to make a day of it (especially as the Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, the IMAX theatre and the Chinese Garden of Friendship are all located within this vicinity). And if you don't feel like doing touristy things, there are plenty of cafes/restaurants to satisfy hungry and thirsty travellers!

Nice family day out. Make sure to pack swimmers and extra clothes for your little one! A place not to miss, full of fun and activities! Love to take my daughter to the zoo and aquarium ( merlin pass oblige) and then stop at the playground area to let her play , getting dirty and wet! When it s sunny it s perfect but when it s raining, place to avoid !

Splendid place. Blue skies, beautiful bridge to the darling harbour. Peaceful and relaxing walk. Lots of food and posh restaurants around the vicinity, with the aquarium and maritime museum nearby as well.
An amazing place !!. This place is so good even just to look at. esp. at evening just go for a walk the views of the harbour..skyscrapers etc. with all those lighting is beautiful.

Darling harbour visit. Spent the day at Circular Quay and considered this area a must stop. Plenty yo see and do. Can be a cheap day out or an expensive day out, your choice. Enjoyed just walking around and sight seeing.
Beautiful during the day and as pretty at night. There are so many good places to eat near this place and it's great to walk about the harbour admiring the views after a good dinner.

Beautiful views. Lovely area to stay in, lovely walks around with loads of attractions, restaurants and bars. Not cheap. IMAX screen there as well as aquarium, Maritime Museum etc etc. Go past the IMAX and there is a child's play area with a play ground, zipline and water play (even has an Archimedes screw!!) which is lovely and my daughter didn't want to leave.Great place to stay as walking distance to everywhere.

21st Birthday Harbour Cruise. Absolutely BEAUTIFUL sailing around the harbour for my daughter's 21st. I suggest if you would like to do something different this is a must. Beautiful lights and we were lucky to even have fireworks (double at that) to top off the night

A Concrete Jungle. We last visited Darling Harbour some 15 years ago and it was a lovely unspoilt part of the city, however on stepping off the ferry we felt completely hemmed in by the huge amount of high rise building. Near the shops there appears to be further work being done, and regrettably the food hall was full of the workers on their lunch break, finding a seat a challenge.Quite a let down

Oh Darling!. This is little more than a depressingly soulless tourist trap. Over priced bars and restaurants surround a rather dull and lifeless waterspace. We visited the Sealife Centre and escaped as quickly as possible. So much more to Sydney to bother coming here.

Special. Wow this place always looks and feels great, so much to take in very special place, don't miss it.
Be sure to take a ferry ride.

So much to do. So much to do in Darling Harbour. All sorts of shops, cafes, restaurants and attractions are along here. Very clean streets considering the amount of people that come through it. Within walking distance to the city centre and the malls. Wish I had extra time here to explore everything it had to offer.
Darling harbour . Nice friendly people at toussands wax museum,wildlife park and aquarium,easy to get back on ferry to go back round to circular quay to our hotel
Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is nice place of attraction. You can take walk here, you can have food here, you can have cruze from here. Nice place

Lively at Night. This place becomes very lively when the sun is down. There are fireworks every night and the restaurants along the harbour are mostly jam-packed especially on Friday nights. It's an ideal place to just have fun.

Always a highlight. Fun playground at the back of the Imax theatre that could keep the kids occupied for hours (if you let them) Darling harbour is always beautiful, but this made our trip all the more fun!
Tourist hellhole. Darling harbour is always busy. There are lots of tourist "attractions". There is a fair number of mediocre eating places.

love this place. A bustling harbour front with an abundance of excellent cafes and resteraunt a. Has a really good vibe around the place and loved spending time here. Shops, boat trips, attractions and I max but not at all tacky.. Fave place on our visit

Good place to chill. The centre of city. Satisfy all ur need in Sydney. It has events or festivals almost every week. Fireworks every Saturday. So many food and bars surrounding. Definitely is a good place to chill if u have noting to do.

Lots to see and do. Nice area with many shops, restaurants and activities. Sydney zoo is there- it's small but very nice. We took the ferry from there to Sydney Harbor-great little ferry ride with awesome views.

Beautiful. Always a beautiful part of Sydney. Worth a walk to take in the views and relax at a cafe or restaurant.
We stayed at the Sheraton, and it was only a short stroll down Market St

scenic. A lovely harbour with lots of people walking along. Many restruants and food places to eat at. Entertainment also where you walk along. Some yachts docked there and floating restruant. Water was clean. Lovely walk at night time too and a view of the city also.
Excellent place. Great location and in my opinion exceeds circular quay in so many ways and the Saturday night fireworks are excellent

Sightseeing. Having 2 international exchange students we headed for a day wandering the city... No exact plans except to start at darling harbour.The place is a huge construction zone!!!Our usual parking could no longer be accessed so round and round we went finding parking down near star city. Wandered Harbourside to find a few shops closed and some empty or being refurbished. I know work has to go ahead but everywhere we went seemed like a construction zone.Oh well, our visitors still had a nice time and managed to get some Aussie souvenirs to take home.Shame Harbourside was so bare, but we will wander across to the wildlife zoo and aquarium.

Scenic on a Sunny Day. Darling Harbour is always lovely on a sunny day. There are plenty of good places to eat and there is always something interesting happening along the waterfront. Whether it be some entertaining busking, fancy ships in the harbour or just people watching you are a bound to be entertained.

Vibrant for all ages. Lots of good eateries for all tastes. I was particularly impressed with the great area for the children to play. An interesting water park that children can use their imagination for hours of play. I had not been to Darling Harbour for a few years & was amazed at how the whole area has been developed into a great venue for all ages to just wander, eat, meet & relax.

One of the tourist spots in Sydney. I visit every year for the last ten . Unfortunately , over time, they reduce the green areas at the expense of surrounding buildings . Now there is a large reconstruction and building more - large buildings.Night is very lively and the restaurants and bars are full of people .
Pretty!!. Darling Harbour is such a beauty! Soak in the sun, enjoy the view. Have a glass of wine in one of the bars, relax!

Probably my fave place in Sydney. . My fiancé and had our first kiss here and our engagement. At night it's the most beautiful place. It has plenty of food and drink places quite expensive but worth the trip. The fireworks are magic especially over the lit up harbour. The best place to eat in my opinion was Nick's. Home was a good club and boat party's are a must.
Sightseeing . The weather was perfect. Stunning setting. Visited the museum. Sat in the latest Tesla which was in display. Perfect day.

Bustling harbour with big wheel and lots of restaurants. Lots of boats in the harbour this July in advance of a Boat Show. There are fireworks on Saturday nights at 8:30 but it was windy the Saturday we were there and everyone was disappointed that there were no fireworks and no announcement or notices displayed, just nothing happening. There is a great choice of places to eat and a good evening atmosphere. The play area is very good with water and dams to interest older children.

Too many people. Every time I visit Darling Harbor there are too many people, I even saw a bunch of storm troopers walking through Darling harbour on my last visit. It is good for shopping & restaurants though. I am not into boats but I do find the maritime Museum interesting.
People watching. Lots of new building going on at the moment but restaurants are open and it's still a great place to sit, have a wine and watch the world go by.

Romantic Harbour.. Its nice Waterfront area with yachts and boats ; big and small. Plenty of space and places to sit and relax. Restaurants and cafes are all around. After a long day in Sydney, this will ideal place to sit back and enjoy a good glass of beer.Please vote if my review was helpful.

Must visit if in Sydney. Plenty of great restaurants and bars, great for a walk around the harbour, the aquarium and the Maritime Museum if you are into history with the Casino for a gamble and cheap eats..

TOURISTY. The spot is lovely but locals really do not go there. It is mostly tourists. There are more locals over at Cockle Bay. I find the food over priced and not that good. There are much better places to go and get great food with a view.

Great spot. It is a great spot to walk around, sit and relax, pick one of the many places to eat, go to the movies, stop for a tea/coffee, hot chocolate at Lindts, walk pyrmont bridge, visit the Aust maritime museum, madam tussades, sea life aquarium, cockle wharf, sit on the seats to relax and the shops in Harbourside shopping Ctr. One place you must go is the Chinese Friendship Garden, so relaxing and beautiful. Lots of Pokemon, pokee stops. We stay at the Ibis so that's nice and close to enjoy all that darling harbour has to offer.

Fun activities and dining. Lively, bustling entertainment precinct with lots of restaurants, imax theatre, shops, maritime museum, aquarium, departure point for whale watching tours and of course the wonderful weekend fireworks. Terrific kids playground too.

Harbour Heaven. Shop til you drop and eat til you pass out!!!! And then if you're of age, stop and smoke some great hookah and party the night away. Darling Harbour has everything for everybody. An amazing ferris wheel, the best background for selfies, a multitude of shops & restaurants and plenty of views for people watching.

Water alleys and play park a must!. So much to do here, you could never leave! The water feature and play park are great for kids (and adults!) and there are loads of areas to run around. Get a takeaway coffee and watch the world go by.

So much to do. Darling harbour has almost everything : cafes, restaurants, madame tussauds, wild life park, children playground. From there you can walk one block and find the Chinatown and Paddy's market/hay market. Take a ferry to Circular Quay,at some point you can take a photo with Sydney Opera house on the background. One-way ferry ticket is available on the pier, no need to but Opal card.

wonderful spot. what place to sail out of if you are on a cruise as we had been when sailing out of Australia its a great city, its expensive for sure I would say London pricing for food and drinks the weather is great the shopping is not fab I have been to better in Europe
Nice walk. Great for a walk, lots of restaurants and cafés with some good views. We walked from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay which is a bit of a walk but some nice sights.

The best place in Sydney.. This place is the hidden gem in the crown. The shopping of harbourside, the numerous quality restaurants abound on both sides of the harbour. There is much history to see and learn about. Best place for families on a weekend with the playground to keep all amused.
Great Atmosphere. Lots happening at Darling Harbour, Music, ferry rides, movie theatre, shopping and an abundance of eating places.
A must visit in Sydney. Lots of shops and cafe around, we had a good time hanging around in Darling Harbour. A few attractions nearby as well such as the wildlife park etc. Good fun for kids

Sydney Boat Show. We were lucky enough to visit Sydney when the Sydney Boat Show was on at Darling Harbor. We are boa ties so to have such an amazing collections of Australian (and international) craft was exciting to see. The facilities and organisation was great and worth seeing if you are in Sydney when it is held.
A bit overrated. It is much smaller than expected. A bit overrated and definitely looks better in photos or promotional clips. Good for a first visit but probably will not go back again.

Fantastic best area of Sydney for children. We searched high and low in the city centre for children's parks and free activities and the water/sand/ park area at Darling Harbour was absolutely fantastic. It kept our five year old entertained for ages! Best place we found.

You can spend hours here. Great to shop, eat, wander or head to the attractions. I have spent ages here and each time i go back more has opened and it gets busier. Free fireworks on a sat eve as well.

Would love to live here!. What a fantastic place Darling Harbour was! There are many attractions to see, great food, cruises and things to do and see and close to other locations about the city,easy to walk across Pyrmont Bridge, with shopping centre and Maritime Museum

Vibrant modern quartier for tourists and locals. When I enter Darling Harbour I always feel happy. There is an incredible atmosphere with all the attractions, bars, restaurants, the groups of tourists, but also the locals who go there to enjoy a drink or a dinner, or just for a quick lunch break. Definitely a must go if you visit Sydney.

The face of Sydney. Its been a personal favorite and i can very say that everyone who has been to sydney would have been to the harbour. its a destination which offers everything, good hotels, excellent restaurants, attractions like museums and ferry rides to the Opera house and others. Take a tranquil walk around the harbor to feel relieved, I just hope they complete the ongoing constructions at the earliest which is little bit bothersome

We adore Darling Harbour. We stayed at a nearby hotel and spent nearly all our time in and around the area, it has fantastic restaurants of many cuisines, nice little bars and some big ones too, all have very friendly staff who love to chat.
wow. So busy on a beautiful winter day. Lots of restaurants for all walks of life, A lovely place to meander looking at the yachts and other people doing the same!

A pretty setting. During late July/early August, just a few days, the Sydney Boat Show holds a wonderful display of boats. This is worth a look-in as the crafts are parked in this safe little harbour.

Weekend away . Went to Sydney for the weekend in July , had a great experience walking around Darling Harbour and seeing all the sites . Found it to be very clean and entertaining , and the shops and wharfs were lovely . Can't wait for my next trip

Another Universe!. As a visitor to Sydney I was amazed at crossing into a totally new world. I have visited San Francisco's Wharf, Chicago's Navy Pier, London's Docklands, but nothing prepared me for Darling Harbour with its marina full for the Boat Show, the abundance of eateries from snack bars to top class restaurants catering for every possible cuisine to satisfy the multi-cultural visitors. Lunch times and evenings are truly bustling. Just one little point - breakfasts were advertised at many venues but even at 8am none were open to cater for the many hungry people already thronging even then in search of food.
A view to remember. Such a beautiful place to be especially in the Summer months when all the lights are on by the Harbor. Lots of tours by boat and a very scenic view. Put on your bucket list.
Darling Harbour. Visited Darling Harbour during the day and plenty of restaurants to eat in the evening & saw water, laser and fireworks on the harbour👍😉

One of Sydney icon. Darling Harbour is located in central of Sydney. A lot of restaurant and shop nearby. Lindt cafe one of the best.
You can depart to Captain Cook cruise from here.

Great night & day location..... Darling Harbour has so much to offer & you can easily spend a full day & night there. Lots of dining & nightlife options overlooking the Harbour. Large shopping mall to bag a bargain. Large food court offering many cuisines at reasonable prices. Wifi cafe to catch up on your emails or do on line research on what to do. Spectacular at night especially when the Vivid Light show festival is on. Try & stay close by to make the most of all it has to offer.
Stunning views and a great place!. I just love hanging out here. Lots of option to eat. Great views and quite a few activities like cruises, maritime museum etc. Weekend fireworks are great!
Lots to do. Darling harbour is full of attractions, restaurants and shops and of course quays, enough to keep all ages occupied for hours!

A really Buzzing Place. Darling Harbour is a lovely spot at any time, but especially during the Sydney Boat Show. This year was no exception. Lovely weather, a little cool early in the days, but the harbour is a real sun trap and warmed up quickly. All the restaurants surrounding the harbour do a great business during the show and no doubt on any sunny day. Well worth a visit even if its just to sit and watch the world go by.

Great place to hang out. Darling harbour has just sooo much to offer! The most amazing restaurants, views and entertainment along he waterfront. A place where you can easily spend every night without getting bored!
Best place to eat. I loved the food court,restaurants ,the cuisines,stores for shopping.you get kangaroo steak in the restraurants and amazing sea food.

The Sydney Boat Show was on!. Even though the weather was drizzly and it became somewhat naturally dark, it did not take away from this picturesque setting. It was fortunate that the boat show was on because the entire place was busy and bustling. Wonderful boats and ocean-going vessels on view. Plenty of photo opportunities.

fireworks!. We walked around the harbour on a saturday evening ,and enjoyed the atmosphere and fireworks,all for free! The bars and restaurants were lively,but many young families also enjoyed the display.

Lively and happening place.... One of our favorite stops on our Hop On Bus Tour, we decided to check it out and look for a café for lunch on Valentine's Day. The harbour area was a representative slice of international peace and harmony as hundreds of people walked, pushed babies in strollers or handicapped elders in wheelchairs or pushed walkers themselves, out enjoying all the sights and sounds that this bustling cosmopolitan city had to offer. There was a couple selling perfect red roses for sweethearts for the occasion and sightseeing boats owners touting rides with their company. There were long lines of kids with parents hoping to soon get into the Sea Life Aquarium and out of the hot sun and also very many little sidewalk restaurants to choose from. It was a great place to sit and have a bite to eat, or just enjoy a cup of coffee and just people watch!

Enjoying the view. We had both breakfast & dinner at darling harbour, great place lots of option to eat. Shopping center is OK although many shops aimed at tourist ,nice place to walk around lots of places for coffee or drinks
Not cheap but worth the effort. There are a good variety of places to eat and drink. They are not particularly cheap for a family meal, but you are in the middle of a major city!

Great for a stroll and lunch. . Took the ferry from Sydney Harbour which took about ten minutes and had a lovely afternoon. Beautiful walk through the Maritime Museum and lovely restaurants for lunch or dinner. Lots to see and do.
A nice place to relax. Harborside with lots of places to eat or browse. You can also catch boats here too. Lovely place to sit and relax.
Beautiful harbour. A really beautiful harbour. There was a boat show making the harbour very busy and it's a really nice view to look from a balcony connected to the bridge.

Busy spot. There is a mix of old dated restaurants along here and the harbour is a little polluted. Some of the older buildings could do with some attention. With the new constructn and development hopefully the standard will rise and some of the expensive restaurants and other bars will lift their game in the face of new competition.

Family day out. There is a lot of development with the construction of the new convention centre but this doesn't distract from the experience. Great outdoor playground for all age groups. Harbourside has a reasonable food court but there are so many eateries around the hardest thing will be deciding where to eat ( if you like meat i suggest Brazza)
Lovely place to eat and drink. This is a lovely modern area of Sydney full of bars and restaurants. Busy in the evenings but a great place to chill.
great place to visit. If you want to see some of the ships of the Australian Navy as well as other vessels this is the place to be.

Australian Holiday 2016. Awesome is the only word ro explain Sydney Darling Harbour. This is a world class harbour, restaurant, shopping and entertainment area.
This is a must see location for international tourists. The area is a kaleidoscope of culture.

Once a harbour, almost a harbour. Darling Harbour was once a working harbour, wresting a living from the sea. Now this sweaty hardscrabble anchorage isa mainly a tourist destination, on the western fringe of central Sydney. Darling Harbour is popular with visitors and Sydneysiders alike for recreating and socialising. Darling Harbour also hosts a major boat show. The Harbour also has some good restaurants.

Holiday with wife and daughter(22). Was quite surprised at the price of food and drink! Not as costly as we where expecting it to be! Would pay more in most city centres in UK. Does get very busy though but you usually can get in somewhere.

Attraction hotspot. Great place to spend a day and night. This area packs with several attractions, restaurants, bars and cafes. Together with nice view, you cannot skip this area. Firework shows every Saturday night from 8.30pm.

Boat Show Beauties. The Sydney Boat Show is a stunning site on Darling Harbour. Blue skies entices great crowds to Darling Harbour which is interesting full of locals and visitors.
Pyrmont bridge opens to let boats through, spinning on its axis.
Shopping, looking, dining, everything is here.
Lovely part of Sydney. Dense and complicated waterfront crossed by wide Pyrmont pedestrian bridge. Museums, Zoo, Imax theatre, and wharf-side attractions all good for walking and exploration.

Just Beautiful at Night. There were many shops and restaurants, and from the Harbour you can see downtown Sydney. The sunset if you catch it just right over the horizon is just a picture calming sight.
Nick60. The first part of the Sydney Harbour and closed to the city where most of the bars and resturants are to be found.

Pretty views, bustling atmosphere. We visited Darling Harbour on a Saturday night, we intended to go and see the fireworks but unfortunately they were not on that evening. We however still had a lovely evening at Darling Harbour even though there was no fireworks! The atmosphere was lively, filled with young people, couples and families all out enjoying their evenings. There are plenty of bars and clubs to go and drink at, also restaurants if you are looking for a bite to eat. The skyline and all its lights were very beautiful, as was the stroll along the harbour. Would recommend a turn on the Big Wheel if you are not afraid of heights, it was nice to sit and view the city lights!

Take the ferry to Darling Harbour. If you want to visit Darling Harbour take the ferry from Circular Quay which takes you under the bridge and gives you a great view on the Opera from the water. Continue your trip to Darling Harbour where you can visit madam tussauds and various aquariums and take a walk to Chinatown through Tumbulong Park

Caution: generic harbour-side tourist trap under construction.. Walked down here having just arrived and wanting to get over jet lag. Could be twinned with Fishermans Wharf in San Francisco. Commercial, cookie-cutter bars and restaurants. Building work. Chinese peace garden looked promising but having flown via a Hong Kong stopover and seen the real thing for free didn't feel like paying to see a facsimile. Best thing were the scavenging Ibis. Seagulls could learn some manners from these guys. Probably OK for families with small children as there was a playground that looked nice and a McD's but could be anywhere in the world really.

excellent. plenty to see & do, can be ok in wet weather with indoor activities, recommended, plenty to see & do with childrens playscape, power house mueseum, Star casino, winter wonder land theme was excellent, night time walks were the best experience the precinct comes alive with light shows, awesome, buy an OPAL transit pass to get around great value

Just Busy. Great place to wonder with a Friend, Partner or Children as there is so much to see and do. Food everywhere so take your pick of places to eat. Walk up to China Town for a spot of shopping, or just sit by the water and watch the world go by.

#/4 of it is beautiful, other partbe updated a bit more. Darling Harbour is a beautiful area in Sydney, especially the city side and the construction that is going on across the water. The shopping center on the other side could be a little more updated, lot of cheap shops that doesn't give the area a good look.

HIDDEN GEM. I have been visiting Darling Harbour over the last ten years and it has changed.I take darling harbour as a large number of venues. Harbourside has some great eaterys and hands on attractions ,maritime museum is around the corner and two very good hotel chain names

Darling Harbour. Love the harbour area, lots of places for food and most are very family friendly. Can walk around and experience it or access it by all water accesses. Has lots to see and do for the traveller.
Great restaurants & scenery! . The restaurants on the harbour were quite expensive, but overlooked the harbour which was nice, walking dusts de from sea world & Madame Toussads too!

Nice and fun place to visit. A short walk from the hotel I stayed in, Darling Harbour is interesting and fun to visit. I meandered through the free section of the Maritime Museum (make sure you get a stamp on your hand first) which was really interesting. I also dined at one of the many restaurants there, which was not badly priced ($16 for a lunch special) with a nice view over the water. There are many restaurants to choose from, and the Darling Harbour shopping mall is right there.
Great place to find something to eat. Lots of great food places and bars to visit but at the moment it a bit of a construction zone but when completed it will only be better.
Busy. A lot of construction going on so little to enjoy but noise and the sight of scaffolding. Food expensive. People friendly. Inly visited once for an hour. That was all we needed.

Lovely place.. A beautiful area to visit. It is full of shops of all kinds, and includes numerous restaurants and cafes. It is nice for just a walk or to go and sit down at one of the great eateries and enjoy a meal or someone's birthday celebration.
great for families. Very nice place with plenty of coffee shops. Great experience for the kids to watch the boats and the naval activities.
Nice place to visit. It´s a nice place to visit, walk around and have a nice lunch with view to the harbour. There are places for different budgets, so you just need to find the correct place.
All day happy hour. Plenty of cafes, restaurants and bars. But on the pricey side but expected. You can find happy hour advertised everywhere done from 11am.

Promenading. Great place for a weekend chill out. Loads of atmosphere, cafes, bars and restaurants. Something for everyone and everything is centred around the harbour. Close to the city, Circular Quay and the Casino. It's not my first visit and it certainly won't be my last. Promemading around is an adventure of colour and fun. Always a happy, relaxing place to visit.
Darling Harbour , a great name. This is the best place to visit round the harbour. Every thing seemed to be centred round this Harbour there is so much to do.

Great area for everyone. There are lots of bars and restaurants here. There is shopping and a hard rock restaurant. Lots of other restaurants on the harbour too with boast some cool happy hours if you time it right! On a sunny day you could spend all day down here. There is the IMAX cinema and the ferris wheel which would keep the kids happy too. Definitely not an area to miss out when you are visiting Sydney.

Nice Place. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit. It has plenty of places to eat or to stop and have a coffee. Unfortunately the Western side is a bit of a construction sight at the moment making it not very interesting. Other than that it's a nice place to walk around.
Beautiful. Absolutely loved it loads to see fun bars and plenty of food options to pick from only downside is its a bit pricy but overall good experience

Alot of it under construction . There is the main attractions (imax, aquarium etc.) are all open. However once u start walking towards Chinatown area it's all under construction at the moment. Makes general exploring around a bit worthless at the moment.

Lovely Harbor with lots of Restaurants and attractions.. Lovely Harbor with lots of restaurants and attractions (almost all cost money). You could probably end up spending lots of money here. Looking around is free of course.

FABULOUS !. A walk around this area is one of movement and entertainment… there is the Aquarium, Movies, Water Movement and lots of bars to stop at and take a drink and a meal and feel very refreshed… especially in the afternoon when the sun is shining.. so much to see and enjoy..
Beauty to Behold. Absolutely love Darling Habour. Great shopping, great layout, great night lighting. Such a beautiful place to walk around, to sit and relax and just watch the world go by.

Really a tourist area for families.. Not our cup of tea but would be a great area for families. Hard Rock, Ripley's, Aquarium, many Restaurants etc. Nice area but not what we were looking for in our trip. We found the Quay Area much to our liking.

Darling Harbour is one of my favourite places. Darling Harbour is a great place for everyone to visit. There is lots to do for young children with the water attractions and parks and lots for adults with the casino, bars and restaurants.
This is one of my favourite places in Sydney.
beautiful harbor!. Gorgeous Harbor with many places to sit and eat. You can also catch water taxis here as well as boats to go whale watching. A must visit while you are in Sydney.
Competition for Sydney Harbour. Darling Harbour is a very nice place to get a bite to eat or go shopping. The is an aquarium and wildlife park as well as a theatre.
Will be great when all of the building work has been completed. This is a real dawn to dusk place with a plethora of things to see and do. However the building works do detract from the experience.

Visit Darling Harbour. A beautiful place to visit. There are things to see for young and old. A Ferris wheel is located outside the main shops in the middle. There are a number of restaurants, coffee shops, The Maritime Museum, Maddam Toussauds, the Sydney Aquarium as well as the beautiful Chinese gardens. I recommend you visit this place.
Beautiful place. Darling Harbour is very beautiful. World class. Nice and clean surroundings. Friendly atmosphere. Lots of variety in regards to food and entertainment.

Good place to be with children. Was a very good place to be with chldren - Free children playground, I max, courroussel, and we had the chance to be there last week when the ice skating place was still on ! Lot of fun !
In the mall, a foodcourt where everyone can find his meal. Perfect !

Lots of activities for kids. Very vibrant place with lots of shops, cafes and activities and play areas for kids. Nice place to hang out and watch people come and go! Walking distance to Chinatown if you crave for Asian dishes.
Great Place. This area has really developed over the years and now hosts many hotels, restaurants and tourist activities.
Nice views in nice place to dine. Very nice to visit at night to enjoy the views and to eat something. Lots of food variety and you can take ferry from there with many options for trips.

Lots of activity. Enjoyed a couple of alms around the harbour. There is always something going on. Lovely to be near the water and a good energy level about the place. Lots of people enjoying the outdoors.

Beautfiful location. We were here 2 days in a row visiting Madam Tussauds and Sea Life.
It was not too busy but it had a nice atmosphere.
Nice location to stroll and sit on one of the benches and look around.
Entertaining. You'll never be bored when you visit Darling Harbour. It has the cinema with the biggest screen and there are lots of options if you want to go with your kids.

An amazing number of things to see and do. Darling harbour hosts many wonderful attractions as well as eateries, shopping and many of the harbour cruises depart from there. Well worth the visit time and again.

Very scenic. This is a great place to walk along, soak in the sun, admire the awesome boats and enjoy the fresh harbour breeze. There are many areas to relax as well, and you dont need to sit in a restaurant to do so.Some of the restaurants along the harbour have great lunch deals, others are very pricey. It can get very busy with many people lurking around the aquarium area, but other areas are fairly quiet (especially further north).Its definitely worth a visit!

Penguins on ice!. This is really a great place. I love the stroll around Darling Harbour and the restaurants. I always enjoy the great street art. There is a great playground for the children - which is huge. But best to tackle this on a week day. On the weekend it was crazy busy. The ice skating was happening and little children were being propelled along the ice by motorised penguins! The adults struggling along behind hanging onto each other! Darling Harbour is spectacular. Make sure you see it!

Beautiful scenery, deliciously calm, so much to do!. Plenty of places to see, and many delicious places to eat!
My family and I spent a whole day just walking around and visiting little shops tucked away!
It is so beautiful, and you mustn't miss it!

Lovely Views around Sydney CBD. An easy walk along the foreshore with lots of tour boats , cafes, restaurants etc. to see. SHowcases the truly wonderful Sydney Harbour in all its glory. A great place to sit & people watch while having a coffee - very easy walk & is wheelchair accessible.

Darling Harbour Evening must do. Really enjoyed Darling Harbour. Wish we knew about the fireworks every Sat night before we came. Has a lively vibe so even if tired you get a pick me up just being there. Lots of food options including a food court if you need a cheaper option to collect and sit by the water. Want a good evening stroll then it is great for that too.
Enjoy the view of the opera house. You can sit and watch ferries coming in and out, and Sydney opera house - and enjoy the cool morning breeze plus restaurants and shopping
harbour highlights. So much to see & do. Shopping centre, movies, bars, restaurants, maritime museum, aquarium, wildlife park, wax museum plus much more.

beautiful relaxing atmosphere and scenery. darling harbour is a great place to just wander around. there are plenty of eating, drinking, chilling out places in this space. we loved just being able to walk through this space and do whatever took our fancy. at times eating a meal, at other times having a drink with friends, watching a movie at the IMAX theatre, or sitting on the wharf people watching. a wonderful part of Sydney.

Rebuild in progress. All the building detracts from the ambiance of Darling Harbour at present. It felt crowded and dusty and you did not want to linger there. Many previously enjoyed activities were missing but I'm sure it will be great when it is finally finished.
A Wonderful Spectacle, Good for Kids. Huge touristy entertainment complex; you don't hear Australian accents here -- mainly American instead. Some great rides and a park for kids.
Wow. We got here by ferry from circular quay. You could easily spend a day here visiting all the museums, aquarium... Etc.

A great outing for family and friends. I loved visiting Darling harbour for a relaxing day on sunny day. You can just walk around and see all different restaurant and on weekends there is always some shows, music , activities and ect . There is a play area for children to have fun and decide where to eat out on all different food area and shopping .
good eating spots, good views, lots of people. shops are somewhat overpriced - a bit too tourist trap. BUT, good eating spots and los of little thigns to do while you wander around in teh sun
NYE Fireworks were Awesome!. I spend NYE at the Harbour - we were unable to make it to Circular Quay so decided to check Darling out and we had a great time. The firework show was great, and free!

Wish I had stay here. Booked a hotel in the middle of CBD. Had a difficult time finding a family friendly place for dinner. Walked to Darling Harbour and wished we had a hotel in the area instead. There are so much restaurants up and down the entire harbour. Also, kids activities. Check out the water play area for kids in Darling Circle - it's really cool.

Eh...kinds of like a Downtown Disney in the US.. We found it to be overpriced and were underwhelmed. great location for a boat tour though. Restaurants close after lunch at 2 and only reopen around 6.

Great place to have eat and have a drink. There are several restaurants in this area to choose from as well as bars and coffee shops. There is also a shopping area. When I visited there was a nightly laser light display to music that was great.

So much to do. Darling harbour is a great place for the entire family: large selection of restaurants, IMAX theatres, aquarium, Madame Tussauds, Maritime Museum with excellent special exhibitions, two areas to catch a ferry to other parts of the city, close to city centre.Also great venue to relax along the waterfront, eat an ice cream and watch the numerous tourists stroll by.

Fun for whole family. Fantastic restaurants, great kids activities (ice skating,aquarium,IMAX theatre too many to mention) Had a great time walking around this area with such a beautiful backdrop Sydney Harbour, well worth the visit.

Very romantic place to visit. When you have a candle light dinner by the harbour it was a very unforgetable memory ... try to visit THE PLATE ..... very good food yet excellent service by the waiters. Friendiest service i found in Sydney were here.
Pleasant. Nice place to wonder for an afternoon.Plenty to see and do, or just sit and people watch (one of my favourite pastimes)
Family fun. Great play grounds for budget day out.lots of cheap eat options and place for kids to play. Lovely city scenery and food

Great for families with children. We live two hours north of Sydney and come here nearly every time we come for a visit. The park is huge and suitable for young and older children. It can be a bit stressful keeping an eye on more than one child because of its size, but my three boys could spend the day there if we let them. There are also other attractions in the harbour like the Aquarium (if you don't have a voucher, be sure to purchase tickets online to save $$). We just spent a few days there and our kids and I enjoyed a skate session that was part of their winter festival. We've also been when they have fireworks at night and who doesn't like to watch fireworks?

Top Spot. Darling Harbour has so much to offer from accommodation, the Casino, the theatre (including an IMAX cinema), shopping complex and cafes etc and is easy to get to.We visited Darling Quarter where they had an exhibition (of "Little Miss" and others like Mr Grumpy etc) and also the "Winter Forest".They were undergoing a lot of renovations (roads and walkways) around Darling Harbour when we were there – will be interesting to see what it looks like when it’s been finished.

Wonderful area. Darling Harbour is the best place for tourists and Sydneysiders to wander, enjoying water views, shops, cafes, restaurants and various entertainments. There is some construction at the moment but there is so much else happening it doesn't impinge on your enjoyment.

A walk definitely to remember. Certified tourist spot that should not be missed. There are a lot of activities, especially for the kids. Shopping center has dining, souvenir shops, specialty shops, and a lot more. Australian Maritime Museum is just a few steps away too.

One of the best places in Sydney. Arrived here by metro from Wynyard station and took a walk to the harbour. It was already evening , else would have tried one of the 2 activities:- A ferry ride/ whale watching trip- a visit to the Sea AquariumIts a great place to be with friends/ family or grab a beer on a Friday evening before heading home for the weekend.

Awesome location with plenty to do. We stayed local to Darling Harbour and found everything that we needed during our stay.Gateway to the harbour via water taxis or Captain Cook cruises.Plenty of entertaining areas and shops, restaurants with fantastic views.Overall would recommend Darling Harbour for your next visit

Never a dull moment!. Yet another favorite place in Sydney. It is an amazing place with so much do and so much to see. I love Dalring Harbour specially in the evening. There are heaps of eateries as well as good restaurants in and around Darling Harbour. This time we took a cruise and loved it.

A must see when visiting Sydney. This old dock area was converted to public space about thirty years ago and is still evolving. There is an excellent aquarium, maritime museum and many restaurants offering varied cuisines. Some have silly prices even for an expensive town like Sydney but a few are reasonable value. On the city side of Darling Harbour you are fairly close to Chinatown. If you are shocked by the restaurant prices at Darling Harbour calm down over a coffee and watch the passing parade then head for a much better value meal in Chinatown.Darling Harbour has several lovely park areas and playgrounds for kids and the buskers we saw there were quite talented. Darling Harbour is a real must see place which would be at its best on a summer evening.

What Else Could You Want. Darling Harbor is awesome. It has everything. Lots of entertainment, lots of places to grab a bite, and if you are a "people watcher" well really there's no place better! Grab a tea and just enjoy the view. And oh man the views are fantastic! You name it, it's there! Darling Harbor perfectly summarizes Sydney.
Interesting friendly place. Darling harbour has something for everyone, families, couples, singles. Fireworks every weekend, and security patrols making us feel safe. Very beautiful fun place.

Lots to do, great kids park. So much to do and see here, many Resturants and attractions, and so beautiful too. The kids park at Darling is great. We just had enough time to eat lunch, let kids play at playground and have ice cream, but you could spend days (and lots of money) there doing all that is available.

Heart of Sydney?. Close to the city centre, always alive and pulsating, this place have both recreation and fun experience. Food, museums, cinema, and beautiful harbour scenery. Take a pause from your shopping here.

Lovely place to visit with your family.. We walked to Darling Harbour on a chilly Sydney afternoon. We spent most of the hours at a nearby playground called Darling Quarter where there were lots of slides, maze and water fountain the kids could play with. (There's a nearby toilet to dry your kids' socks just in case they get it wet in the water).

Great shopping, food, and site seeing!. Definitely worth your time if you are visiting!...Plenty of things going on to keep everyone in the group interested. Good shopping and great restaurant... I recommend The Meat & Wine Co...you will need to make reservations!

Wow....Simply amazing. We were there to watch Vivid Sydney light show and it took our breath away....What's good.......the atmosphere, the cafes offering everything for 5$ during happy hours, the ferry's waiting for tourists, the crowd, sound ,light and fire show.....what a memorable time spend with family and friends...... Spend more than five hours but still needing some more time to spend.Nearby ship museum, imax theatre, and many more activities to indulge in.Live bands, neon lights.....it was spectacular and magical.......What's bad.......NOTHINGjust enjoy your evening.....
Great for a night out. Lots of places to eat and drink, real hustle / bustle type of place, lots to see and do and would visit again

Lovely area. Darling Harbour is a great area for a stroll round or to go for a meal in the evening. There are plenty of restaurants to chose from, there is the Wildlife and Madam Tussauds to look round if you want to. We were lucky enough to be here when 'Vivid' was taking place and it really was lovely to watch. Great place.

Wow!. Awesome place to be. Many different restaurants so you're able to pick where you want to go and it's only a short walk around to different places. It's home to SeaLife and the wildlife zoo, also the Hard Rock Cafe. The shopping is good and there are usually many awesome attractions around the harbour, such as a Ferris wheel and ice skating. Amazing place!

Great atmosphere. I spent quite a lot of time in Darling Harbour on my last Sydney trip. I really like this location for accommodation and as a base. It's close enough to the CBD to walk, but fantastic views, atmosphere and less frantic pace. The Harbourside Mall is quite large and I quite happily spent a couple hours looking through the stores. Lots of fantastic places to eat all around Darling Harbour! The biggest problem is choosing a place each night!There's a great fireworks display which I believe usually happens each Saturday night - truly stunning and an unexpected highlight.Will definitely enjoy getting back to Darling Harbour on my next trip.

Australia with kids. It's just one of the bays in the harbour. There is a swimming pool on the Botanical Gardens-side (Andrew (Boy) Charlton pool). Access to the botanical gardens on that side as well, with stairs. Excellent place to go jogging (past the wharf terraces, along the shore to Macquarie's Point).

Great for a warm winters day. Lovely harbour to be on a warm winters day. Very different to the Circular Quays, restaurants are closer to the docks which provides a nice view for lunch / dinner.
Would have spent more time here if i had it.

Nice harbour scenery. Darling Harbour is a typical Sydney scenery. Maritime museum on one side and colossal skyscrapers on the other side leaving marina between them. From marina you can take ferry or taxi to go. There was also ferris wheel which gives you nice picture of the area. There's also Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife Sydney Zoo. And of course you can go to the city center easily by just going over the bridge.
Nice day in the sunshine. What a beautiful place, so much to see and do. Delightful eateries with an amazing variety of tastes. So much to see and do, a must for everyone who visits Sydney.

Great area . Lots of bars and restaurants to enjoy, loved the walk around the harbour, would definitely go back again.Easy walk around to the star casino if that's your thing. Similar to Melbourne's docklands.

When it's all finished again I'm sure will be great. The rebuilding work is continuing , the kids playground is open again and there is now a Ferris wheel which looks a bit dinky a dyer the London eye , but hey it's probably good funThere is lots to do there and plenty of pages to eatIf you are going to do wildlife or SeaWorld buy your tickets online first - the Wye was huge at the ticket counter
Great place to be. Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour are both great places and have a great atmosphere and architecture. Great walking too.

Forever Australia. I will forever love and remember Australia, Sydney is one of the places you surely need to visit when you plan to go on a trip to Australia. Highly recommended. Great tourist spots, clean surroundings and nice people. ❤️
Nuce. Beautiful place and lots to see and do around darling harbour.. Family friendly place.. Lots of restaurant to choose from .. Recommend to all .

Holiday in Sydney with kid, teenage . Staying at Metro apartment, walking distance to the Darling Harbour. Lots of happening, many night spot. Young kid get to play the Ferris wheel. Stay in a room that able to out facing the Harbour, really good view.

Bustling!. This was pretty both day and night. We ate overlooking the water -- it was pricey though. We went to the aquarium here which we loved. There was ice skating set up and the world's largest Imax theater.

Love this area. . Playground with water for the kids. A lot of nice restaurants, carusells and happy people. Could go here every night.
Both night and day time here is to recommend.
Great place to visit. We spent a couple of days at Darling harbour and had a great time trying out the sights and restaurants would definitely recommend a visit close to Paddy's market 8/10

Cool yuill. At the moment in darling harbour they have cool yuill. This is an ice rink snowball tent and a tent with trees lit up and snow on the ground and snow blown out of vents onto you. Not much of an exciting event for us from Scotland but the auzzies and Chinese thought it was such a novelty as I don't suppose they see it very often !!! My granddaughter had a great time on the ice rink last night

Sydney sites. Not sure what all the excitement is about this area, it's a big giant tourist trap full of overpriced restaurants with mediocre food. Shopping is typical tourist junk. A walk around the harbor and across the bridge is fine, but that's enough.

Great place to wine, dine or just walk around. There is always plenty to look at from the free entertainment on and off the water, the shopping area and the numerous cafes and restaurants to choose from. Plenty of free things to keep the little ones happy too
Loved Darling Harbour!. Awesome park for the kids, shops & ample eateries. Sea Life, Wildlife & Madame Tussauds are located there. We loved spending time at Darling Harbour.

Amazing and diverse harbor . For me, the best way to experience this harbor is via the water, this enables you to experience the diverse beauty and various attractions / sights of Sydney. Is really a special place for me and always enjoy spending time in this harbor.
Great Tourist Place. Darling Harbour boasts a lot of great restaurants and attractions, as well as water transportation to Circular Quay and other Sydney Harbor area attractions.

Always a Great Place to See. There is always something happening at Darling Harbour. It is a must see place. Fantastic park for kids, lots of places to dine on the waterfront and always things to see and do.
Another place of interest to walk. Darling Harbour has a great range of coffee shops and places to see - it is easily accessible and makes for a very pleasant walk.
Beautiful spot. Was there during a stopover in Sydney. Really enjoyed the many restaurants and the Ferris Wheel ride

Great for hanging out. There's loads of restaurants by the harbour, at night there's live music in at least one of the establishments. When you eat al fresco, gotta watch out for the birds, they're feisty! There's also Sealife, Wildlife, and Madame Tussaud's by the harbour if you're wanting to do more than just sitting and watching boats and ships. Very good place to just wind down.

A good place for food and drinks. This harbour is near to Chinatown and has plenty of restaurants and food and beverage joints. There is a casino and maritime museum nearby and also an imax theatre here. Good place to sit around and watch the activities going on here in the evenings. There is also a tourist information centre located here, beside the imax theatre. You find many boats, yachts, a naval warship, a submarine and even a pirate ship moored here.
Nice place to chill. Great places to eat and drink and nice vies to boot too. Still being developed but plenty of things to do. Worth a visit.

Lively, great views and a lot to do.. We always love Darling Harbour as there is something for everyone. Day time entertainment such as the cinema, bowling and sea life for family fun. Great bars and places to eat, lovely views and even a spot of shopping if you do desire. This is a must visit for every tourist.

Terrible . Had dinner here with a group of 9 people. Besides the view, everything else was very ordinary. Food is amateurish and too sweet. Cost was over $300 and left still hungry. No happy and will not be returning again.
Fun just to cruise ... or shop... or eat!. There is so much to do at Darling Harbour. Something for everyone. July everything is decked out for winter though the temps are easily in the 50s to 60s.

Partly beautiful, partly under construction. Normally I would have given Darling Harbour a much higher rating. There are still plenty of restaurants, an IMAX theatre, interesting shopping, museums, nice hotels and views across the water to the Sydney city skyline. However a good part of the Darling Harbour complex is presently under a major reconstruction. Never being satisfied with the not so old buildings, ameneties and Convention centre the powers that be have deemed it necessary to add huge new buildings which are going to take a long while to complete. Therefore a good part of Darling Harbour has been closed off and will be for some time, so visitors will be subjected to noise, detours of walkways and the eyesores that come with new construction work and hoardings for quite a while yet. At the opposite end of the harbour, construction will soon commence on the building of a new casino. Best come when all this is finished unless decisions are made for more "enhancements".
Cool and calm! . I had my office right at darling harbor, cool nice place to spend the evening. Lot of cafes around here, and a bunch of ferries that would take you around...

Lovely. We always take a morning walk around Darling Harbour when in Sydney. There are some great restaurants for breakfast or even just a coffee. Fabulous spot and always buzzing. Great for kids too with the water features etc.

My favorite bay /harbour in Sydney . I love this place.... The vibe, the feel..... We walked on both sides of the harbour just taking it all in.... And there were places to sit if you are tired and just want to soak in the view..... I love Australia!

Speechless. The place has an extraordinary charm to it. Surrounded by huge buildings with open spaces all around adds to it beauty. I was mesmerised by its charm that I spend my entire 6days in Sydney at this place. It has unlimited food options for food lovers ranging from Chines, japnese, Thai, Indian that too at the water front. Also it has small but very amazing playground for kids which can keep them busy through out. It is a must visit place
Fun walk around. Nice place to walk around and grab a bite to eat. Some nice areas to sit around and catch up with friends while checking out the boats
Darling Harbour has many attractions. Spent half a day there and enjoyed the Sea Aquarium, the Chinese Gardens, Maritime Museum, Cafe's and many interesting stores ..

Fireworks on Saturdays!. One of my favorite spots in Sydney! I prefer to go at night when all the lights are out. Tons of restaurants, bars, and shops. Great spot for locals and tourists too. Plus, there's a free fireworks show every Saturday! Grab a seat outside the Meat & Wine Co. (which is also a fabulous spot) and watch the harbor light up!
Lovely area. Lovely area of sydney and can take make photos and opportunities.Full of street performers, boats, ferries and other cute anecdotes.
Ferris wheel and walk . Did the Ferris wheel at Darling Harbour. Your usual eateries and views of the harbour. Does not compare to circular quay views.
Food Court. Great Variety of food overlooking the Harbour.They is fast food shops and Fine Dining as well. We went to the Hard Rock Cafe.

Nice spot. Lots of restaurants on the water, was raining day we visited, but still great. Got the light rail from central, and walked back (10 min.) some shopping but mostly food. IMAX theatre, 10 pin bowling, etc. can also get ferry back.

Vastly changed. We visited for 3 days pre- cruise. Was here 2 years ago, wow it's changed so much. There were construction works everywhere. It will look great when it's finished, but looking at the amount of work being done, that probably won't be for a few years.All the water features are gone, which is a shame, hopefully they will be replaced with something equally as nice.We were there during Vivid, that was awesome, the crowds were enormous on the weekend. You could hardly move & it took over an hour in line to get anything to eat. Next time I'll eat early. All in all I love Darling Harbour, there is so much to do there, so I will be interested to see the progress there next time I go.
Very entertaining. Lots of bars and stylish restaurants with a romantic setting for any couple will be visiting again in the near future

To have a nice walk. To have a nice walk. Amazing, people start drinking beer on sunday from 10am !
Good place to relax, long way walking distance but affordable because it is beautiful.
Do not hesitate to do it !
Stunning . It is a beautiful place, perfect to stop and take pictures, and enjoy the view at any weather, even in winter. It is stunning to have a walk, and visit the different restaurants there.

❤️. Always enjoy this place :)
Wonderful to walk around in, grab a bite & see the maritime museum, Madame tussards or just sit on the docks and watch the world go by ❤️
A good tourist destination. So close to the CBD and easy to walk to or take a ferry from Circular Quay. Different atmosphere to the CBD, more touristy , lots of shops and restaurants.
Good Shopping Great food , Imax and more. Cheap shopping of basic teen girls clothes. Fantastic restaurants to fit all prices and the max nearby

Loved it!. Darling Harbour is an excellent place to visit and see the best of Sydney.
Be sure to do the Opera House tour,to get tickets take stairs down under Opera House.

Great place in a great city . Go their and don't miss the vibe at Darling Harbour. Fantastic Restaurants great hotels, sea life, wild life and so many great other things to see. One of my favorite places in Sydney.

interesting place to visit it has a lot of rstaurants and IMAX theatre and Aquarium (great for Kids). its an interesting place to visit it has a lot of restaurants and IMAX Theatre and Aquarium (great for kids)

great for all ages. a multitude of restaurants, bars,shopping and attractions surrounding a busy harbour this is a must for all visitors to our great city. Give yourself plenty of relaxation time, you'll need it. ENJOY

Great place to visit. Darling Harbour has a lot going for it, plenty of world class restaraunts coffee shops. bars but for peace and solitude away from the rat race the Chinese Gardens well worth a visit. The casino not so far away, boats galore to walk around and admire.. Worth a day out

Cockle Bay. Great place to eat so many restaurants to choose from its amazing views specialty bars and so much to do. You can spend the whole day just wandering around eating and drinking and relaxing. I had the pleasure of having my daughts hens day there and we enjoyed a high tea with a twist. So much fun

Restaurants everywhere - Lovely walk around the harbour with lots to see and do. We walked around the harbour, had a yummy lunch and spent a few hours going thru the Sea Life Aquarium. Lots of activity and the weather helped make it a perfect day. We sat outside for lunch and just watched everyone walk by...
Average. Nothing much for travellers to do here.. we went , clicked few scenic pic.. went to farris wheel. if you are party person then it is good

Sydney Darling Harbour. Sydney Darling Harbour is easily accessible by ferries, and trains. It is walking distrance to China Town. Very beautiful day and night scenery. The restaurants and bar is open late into the night.

Here you see how the Australians enjoy life. Darling Harbour is one area you may not skip on a visit to Sydney, it is home to several attractions, such as the Aquarium, Sydney Zoo, Madame Tussauds, National Maritime Museum, Chinese Garden and China town. And lots and lots of restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. When you walk around on a regular day around lunch time to will see full terraces at the restaurants, and many people just munching at their lunch on a bench along the quay. Darling harbor can be easily reached by ferry from Circular Quay, or a short walk across town. It is also home to most of the river cruise and dinner cruise ships that operate in Sydney Harbour and the close sea shore. The area is kept clean, there are free public rest rooms (with toilet paper) and it is very relaxing to stroll with all the other tourists and locals along the quay.

Fine mixture of entertainment and dining options. A short walk down from the CBD to a wide range of restaurants and cafes with entertainment of the IMAX and shopping at harbourside. Close to the Darling Quarter precinct and past the aquarium to King St Wharf. So many options to explore any night of the week.
Have a look. This location has hotels , pubs , restaurants ,cinema and shopping not to mention an aquarium , something for the whole family

Great base whilst in Sydney. Darling Harbour has expanded a lot over the past 10 years or so. It has a great buzz, lots of restaurants and shops. Great for families too, with a playpark, Aquarium, Imax cinema, Madame Tussauds etc. There is a weekly fireworks display.

Day and Night. Darling Harbour was only a couple of minutes walk from our hotel, so we managed to visit several days and nights...the harbour is a lovely spot. Whether for walking, eating or chilling.There are many lunchtime specials at the many restuarants along the harbour.We were there during the Vivid specatacular so things got pretty hectic at night!
Best Way. Take Tram (Light Rail) from Central to Pyrmont Bay for easy access to Darling Harbour. Don't bring your ca, the parking fee is expensive.
another must visit. would have had better views if it wasn't for a huge cruise ship hadn't been in the harbour. completely blocked the view of the opera house
Vivid festival 2016. Went to Darling Harbour during Vivid. The laser light show on the harbour was really good. Fountains of water lit by laser lights were sprayed into the air. Very enjoyable.

Little bit of everything for everyone. Darling Harbor is a horseshoe shaped inlet that is covered in restaurants, nightclubs and shopping options including the multi-storied mall. You can either take the very large walking bridge over to the other side or walk around. You can grab a ferry/water taxi from this harbor. Madame Tussauds Wax Museum is located in this harbor, as well as, the sea life aquarium, Imax theater, bowling, charters, cruises, museums, etc. Tons to do here. Great place for the family, a date or just hanging out by yourself on a lunch break.

Lots of things to do in a wonderful setting . Rarely can be seen in city a place where you can have several types of entertainment like here Imax, Mme Tussault, Powerhouse Museum and heaps of restaurant and shops a few footsteps from the Chinatown.

Lots to see and do.. The area to the rear of Darling Harbour is a bit of a building site when we were there. Lots going on and it will really add a lot to the area. Not that there isn't a lot going on anyway. Definitely recommended.

Perfect waterside setting. Stayed close to darling harbour for 6 nights, and every evening, ended up there at restaurants and bars. Excellent atmosphere, some very good eateries, and lovely as the sun sets and then the vivid light shows took over. Could quite happily spend every evening here!
Nice Walk. Right at the water. It has good mix of eating places as well as the maritime museum. Good for a stroll to take in the air and enjoy the sites. Another VIVID site for evening light shows

Underrated darling of Sydney. Darling harbour has so much on offer for various tastes and likes. The harbour itself is beautiful and surrounded by various bars, cafes and restaurants. Additionally it is short walking distance to other attractions like seaworld and the ferry towards circular quay (near the opera house) and other destinations around Sydney harbour. We were there during the Vivid lightshow and the Darling harbour lights were fantastic. Additionally fireworks occur every Saturday evening I'm told, and we really enjoyed that on our trip. It does get very crowded in the evening due to the various nightclubs in the area, however adds to jovial atmosphere. Must visit.

Everything Melbournes Docklands isn't!. I love my hometown Melbourne but it's great disappointment is its ill thought out Docklands. Darling Harbour is everything it's not. Sydney's link to the water is partly the key with its thriving water craft activity offering much but it more than that. There is life everywhere at Darling Harbour because they have centralised so much there. The science buffs get the Powerhouse Museum nearby ( Melbournes Scienceworks is on the other side of the Westgate Bridge in the suburbs). Sydney's aquarium is here ( ours in on the river near an already thriving area near the Casino instead of the lifeless Docklands). Darling Harbour has the Maritime Museum, the Wildlife Experience and Madam Tussauds, a brilliant children's playground, the Chinese Garden, IMAX ( Melbournes is in the Museum nowhere near the docks) and consistently busy restaurants because of a dynamic harbour experience. There's something for everyone and a must see in Sydney.

Crowded place where many attractions are located. An easy walk from Town Hall Station or Wynyard Station. You do not usually go to Darling Harbour for its harbour facililies (although that will be the place to board your cruise for whale watching), you go to Darling Harbour to visit Madame Tussards, Sea Life Aquarium, Wild Life Zoo and Marinetime Museum. You go to Darling Harbour to eat (but i still find the restaurants at Newtown better) overpriced food. Expect lots of people (and also seaguls) everywhere there.
Beautiful visit. We went in June 2016, during Vivid Sydney. Beautiful place for picture and convenient to walk from Darling harbour to Queen Victoria Building
Fireworks and bars. Lovely atmosphere with the backdrop of the city, watch the sun go down and enjoy the free amazing fireworks- great for all occasions

Great place to walk around, but is definitely a tourist trap. I am originally from Sydney and love Darling Harbour. When the weather is nice, it is a fabulous place to walk around. Any visitor to Sydney must visit Darling Harbour. My recommendation, catch the ferry from Circular Quay which passes the Opera House on the right, then goes under the Harbour Bridge. It takes no more than 15 minutes and you are at Darling Harbour.There are lots of shops and restaurants which I feel are overrated and expensive. Like I said, great to walk around and a must visit, but avoid the expensive shops and restaurants.
Lots of options. The Harbour offers lots of options in activities like Imax, the aquarium, and the wax museum...plus lots of restaurants all with such a beautiful view. Close to the bus stops.

Don't go for the shopping. Whilst in Sydney we went over to Darling Harbour for some shopping - very little to see really. plenty of places to eat if that's what you are looking for.the maritime museum was next door which is probably worth a look - other than that we couldn't see much of interest.

Week at Darling Harbour. We stayed at the Novotel, central to everything. Fantastic eateries, and heaps of things to do like ferry rides, whale watching, boat dining, and stuff for thrill seekers. With The Rocks and the Opera House nearby, we only went into Sydney town twice, and that was for concerts. Perfect place to drink, eat, play, and relax.

GREAT location for accommodation and restaurants. WE had a wonderful time at Darling Harbor. We stayed at the Sheraton four points and ate at three restaurants. We liked each one very much. VIVID was on when we were there. The dancing waters were FANTASTIC

Nice place to hang out day and night. I stayed near to Darling Harbour, which just 8-10 mins walk by foot from my hostel, BaseHostel. So basically I went there almost everyday, during the day you can just stroll and leisure walk, same goes at night as well. Every Saturday they have fireworks show. Beside that, there're lots of nice restaurants which served really nice food at Darling Harbour.

Lively and Touristy. We stayed on Darling Harbour for 5 days. Transportation options are good. Views of Harbour very pretty especially at night and sunrise. Hundreds of dining choices for all budgets. Some very good ice cream shops too. Many vendors offering boat and land tours. Seemed very safe and well lit at all hours. Attached to some of the hotels is a large mall that offers more dining choices in their food court as well as some convenient stores and the usual souvenir offerings.

ENERGISED. This place is quite small but is jamed pack with many many things to for all ages and all budgets and you don't feel like your on top of each other !! Access a food hall or a 5star restaurant. Buy souvenirs or new clothes, or get a new look !! Activities from walks to movies to games and rides.Anything for anybody !!

Fun place with lots to do. There is something to do for everyone here at the Darling Harbour. If you fancy shopping, there are lots of shops, designer stores and the ordinary bargain stores. There are many pricey bars and restaurants facing the harbour. However you can also go inside the Harbour side shopping centre where you will find a food court with all cuisines.You can take the ferries or dine in one of the ships or simply take a walk on the harbour. When you get tired, simply sit by the waterfront and have your drink.The fireworks at night are my favourite at the Darling Harbour.

Full of people on the hunt!. Atmosphere in darling harbour always seems to be lacking class. Love the maritime museum and I can see the appeal for tourists, as I local, I vote to give it a wide berth!

Don't miss it!. Darling Harbour is a true entertainment district, with bars, fast foods, restaurants, and attractions for all budgets. Full of tourists and locals, it's a pleasure to walk along the water and maybe catch a ferry or a boat for a cruise or a whale watching tour
VIVIDLY IMPRESED. We dined at The Pumphouse and loved our food and atmosphere. We strolled around Darling Harbour's sights and rode the giant ferris wheel before watching the great light show!
Great atmosphere at nighr. I loved wandering around darling Harbour during vivid. Teaming with people, music, light show etc. the restaurants were busy. It felt safe and fun

GREAT LOCATION. We stayed twice at the Ibis in Darling Harbour as we just love the area. It is easy to walk from there to the Chinese Gardens and Paddy's Market. The Harbour itself is surrounded by bars and restaurants which nearly all seem to have "Happy Hour" so always somewhere different to eat or have drink. It is also the home of the Maritime museum, and you can catch the ferry to Circular Quay and other places from there. You can also walk into the city from the Harbour and if you prefer a longer walk you can walk right around the harbour to The Rocks and Sydney Harbour...though there is a lot of construction going on at the moment which makes it a bit more difficult. But a great place to stay.

interesting harbour. visited in feb this year plenty to do few shops plenty of eating and drinking places, had a steak and drink for two in one of the eating house round the harbour and it was beautifully cooked

It's all fun. Darling harbour is great it has Madame Tussaud's, the aquarium, the museum or you can book a cruise. There's so much more to do. Whether you're a family or a couple or single there seems to be something for everyone.
Amazing. A great place to visit, food is also reasonably priced here. Lots of activities for the entire family.
Kids activity and good food. Kids activity and good food. Imax is nearby to watch a movie too. Good parking close by. Diversity of restaurants.

Museums, restaurants and views. Every time I am in Darlington harbor, it seems like there's some interesting event going on. This time was no different. The Vivid festival was in full swing and Darling harbor was a great venue for parts of it.
Holiday. great location to sit, lunch, drink enjoy company and watch the world go by or to "people watch". Lots to see if interested in poking around and the maritime museum.

Everything you need is here!. Darling Harbour is a great harbor and area that I always stay at and play in and around whenever I visit Australia since my first visit just over 10 years ago now. There are lots of shops, restaurants and attractions in Darling Harbour, my favorites being Sydney Aquarium and the National Maritime Museum, also cool that some scenes from the Tony Jaa movie Tom Yum Goong were filmed there in 2004/5 like the bridge that you can see featured prominently. Be sure to check out Chinatown at the top end as well, lots of great places to eat and converse there too.

Fun strolling place. Great walk around the harbor from circular quay. Darling Harbour is lined with high rises, museums, restaurants, and activities. We sent s full day there and easily could have stayed two if we had done more of the maritime museum and aquarium.

Sunday fun day . Great place to take the family as there is always something happening and lots of play equipment to keep the kids entertained . The main shopping centre has lots of places to eat from restaurants to easy takeaway

Amazing for restaurants and family activities during the day and party hard all night!. The array or restaurants, shopping, parks, entertainment, IMAX theatre and views at Darling Harbour make it great for locals and travelers alike. Relax with a sunny view for brunch or lunch and eat before visiting a club in the evening.

Great Rainey Day Respit.
