While Darling Harbour is a beautiful place to visit with restaurants, parks and outdoor venues, it also has a great area of different attractions that is indoors and will bring enjoyment and wonder to families with children of all ages.There is an indoor zoo that is really nice, showcasing many of Australia's most famous animals.Next there is a Madam Tussauds, full of really life like persons from around the world. Some were just fun while others were so life like they were scary. Great opportunities to have your picture taken with movie stars and politicians from all over.Finally there was a really great aquarium that lets you view from above the water level and look down on the sea life and then also go down under the water through glass tunnels where the Sharks, whales, turtles and fishes swim all around you. A great view to see what the fish see in the sea.

Favourite place to visit in Sydney. Their is so much to do and see in darling harbour . Enjoy a nice stroll or have some food at any of the restaurants along the strip . Their is the aquarium and the wax museum and iMax to visit ! Stunning harbour

One of the entertainment quarters in the CBD. This place is packed with restaurants! On one side is the Harbourside mall, and at the other end showcases a streamline of restaurants from Darling Quarter, Cockle Bay Wharf to King St Wharf. Just recently, Barangaroo is swiftly rising, with restaurants and food stalls popping one after another. It is not that accessible from the nearest train stations of TownHall and Wynyard but still within a reasonable walking distance. However, you can catch the light rail from Central Station and alight at Pyrmont Bay. This will direct you in Harbourside Mall and you can also visit the nearby Star Mall and Casino. Coming from Circular Quay, you can catch the Sydney ferry and alight at the Darling Harbour stop.For kid friendly attractions, Darling Harbour is perfect. There is a park in Darling Quarter, Maritime Museum is beside the shopping centre, IMAX is centrally located and Madame Tussauds, Wildlife Sydney Zoo and the Sydney aquarium are just right adjacent to each other. If I am not mistaken, there is also a fireworks show every Saturday night.
Great place to visit. A lot of work going on at the moment so a little awkward to move around but don't let this deter you. So much to see and do. Shopping centre a bit quiet but easy to get around.

While we drank cappuccinos, Our kids loved the park . We are a family of 5 from the USA. After a long day my husband and I drank cappuccinos while watching the kids play in the awesome park. There is an area in the park with water where u can learn how dams work. My really loved that and played for hours. They also have climbing things and a sand area. Also a ziplining area. Highly recommend. Very safe.

Always Something to See. From the museums to the parklands there is always something to capture your imagination in the Darling Harbour precinct. A number of waterfront eateries, an economical food court, a shopping centre, the aquarium, maritime museum or theatre rainy days are covered too. A ferry connects you to Circular Quay, the Opera House and Botanic Gardens. Chinatown and Paddy's Market are a short walk away. In the other direction the main shopping precinct of the city. And if you just want to enjoy the local parkland and waterfront you can do that too.
lovely place for bars and resturants. darling harbour great place day or night to eat and drink or just wander aroundwish we could have stayed longer

Darling harbour. Lots of building work going on around the harbour, but it didn't stop us having a good time lots of resturants plenty of choice, Every Saturday evening they have a firework display good entertainment.

Supah touristy, supah fun. The entire harbor area in downtown Sydney. Tons to see and do and eat at here. A must-visit for Sydney. Pro tip - be prepared for tourist crowds and prices. I quite enjoy tourist stuff and so do does my family; there's no shame in it.

Always abuzz with tourists. We spent Saturday evening at Darling Harbour - strolled around the shops and dined at Nicks Bar and Grill. Very busy eatery and a great menu to choice from and our meals where delicious and ample to leave one full on completion. Waitress was lovely and looked after us well. Great place to have a meal hat.

Wedding anniversary. We go there every year on our anniversary to watch a show at the Lyric and so because we come from Gulgong we stay at the Darling for 3 days and every year we get a complementary champagne and strawberries, the room is always perfect and the staff are great. We would recommend them to everyone. We a;ways enjoy our stay, we will always go every year, thankyou for a great time.

One of my Favourite places in Sydney. A visit to Sydney is not complete without a wander around Darling Harbour. Have a meal there - the restaurants are fabulous, overlooking the water and there is plenty of fast food venues if you want a cheap snack. Shopping is good for tourists but the best part is just sitting, overlooking the yachts, and just people watching. It's lots of fun.

Everything here. An area that covers everything - shopping, sightseeing, eating and drinking and attractions.Sealife Aquarium, Madame Tussads and Chinese Gardens all situated around Darling Harbour and all easy walking access.Must go over Prymont Bridge for the view up and down the harbour. Restaurants cover all options, family dining, fine dining, casual and seafood. Hard Rock Café also here for a visit.Easy access to Cockle Wharf & King Wharf and the dinner cruise boats from here.

Shop Eat and Drink. A great collection of shops, cafes and restaurants set around a body of water. Lovely place to watch the world go by. There is often street entertainment as well. Can get quite busy though

Lots to do and see.. Great for a family day out. This is one of Sydney’s little gems. There are numerous attractions such as the Maritime Museum and Aquarium for both adults and the kids. Play areas and street buskers to entertain you while you walk around.It also has a good concertation of various restaurants from seafood to Asian and European cuisines. As well as some of the more well now fast food chains if you want to eat on the go.We stayed in one of the hotels in Darling Harbour so spent a lot of our time wandering around this amazing location, designed for all round family fun for both young and old, not to mention those in between. Don’t miss this area if in Sydney, even for one day.
So much to offer. Darling Harbour offers great shopping, food and wine, views, and entertainment. There is always something new to see and do.
AGM Sydney. Amazing area clean and tidy with plenty of restaurants and shops. Loved staying in this area lots of things happening all the time and at night.
Darling Harbour. Always so good to walk around the harbour. Views of the craft in the water. Fish smell can be overbearing at times.
similar to Docklands Melbourne. very similar to Dockland in Melbourne, nice place to chill with friends for chilling nights, good place to go for a drink or two

Getting a bit tied and o dear more people. Use to be a great place for us country folk to visit. Now the 'harbour' is getting taken over by floating buildings, boats and rubbish. Very dirty looking. Full of Asian and oriental food places. The shops are taking over the walk ways, more people less space to move around. No where for a decent aussie feed. Sorry but I stayed in my hotel.

Visit in the morning AND evening. I enjoyed the walks along Darling Harbour... it was very relaxing, and had a different vibe in the morning and at night. There's a lot of restaurants around, as well as a mall but I mostly just enjoyed walking along the bridge with friends.

Great light show. We went on a harbour cruise to witness Vivid sailing from Kings Wharf. On our return we were in time to experience the light show, it was fantastic. Dancing water spouts, projected images and flame throwers all working in harmony with the music. This show was definately better then the lights we saw at Circular Quay. Should have aaved the money we spent on the harbour cruise and just spent the night here

More sitghts and sounds of Sydney. Darling Harbour is under major reconstruction at the moment, heading for completion in 2016. It is a mecca for business lunches on weekdays with so many restaurants catering for group bookings. The shopping centre on the western side of Pyrmont Pedestrian Bridge, is filled with tourist shops and eateries and with the occasional opening of Pyrmont Bridge and the very interesting Maritime Museum, definitely worth a visit. The south eastern side of Darling Harbour has the Imax theatre, a huge screen for monumental movies. The restaurants on the eastern side a cut above other main stream eateries, great for lunch or dinner. Also on the eastern side of the water, you have the Sydney Aquarium, the Australian Zoo and Madam Tussaud's Wax Museum, great for kid's entertainment and the real attraction of Darling Harbour for kids. With the Maritime Museum on the other side of the water, Darling Harbour is a must see area for visiting families.
bfast lunch and dinner. easy walk from town hall via the arcade between the church and town hall then right on Kent st about 4 blocks and you are there

Great for vivid . Spent a few evenings here watching vivid Sydney and the fireworks, as always with darling harbour very busy but great atmosphere. I would recommend getting there for 6pm vivid show before it finishes.

Good views close to the city. If you are looking for a place to walk around within walking distance of downtown Sydney, then Darling Harbour is ideal. It is a short walk down Market Street to a pedestrian bridge over the street and you are on the Pyrmont Brdige, leading to a number of attractions on the Western side of Darling Harbour, including the highly rated National Maritime Museum. You can walk back around the harbour foreshore to the King Street side where there are a number of attractive restaurants and bars to choose from for either lunch or dinner.

A Great Place to Start. Put it on top of the list of things to do. We where here during the light show and it was quite spectacular. Lots to do in the harbor area. We signed up for a dinner cruise at Captain Cooks Cruise, which was very good but another review. You can walk the bridge across the harbor, very nice view of the light show.

Vivid Festival . I have been here many times, alone, with my wife and with my family, I enjoy every visit. Very vibrant and lively, lots of things to do, places to eat & drink. A great vantage point for the Vivid light show & fireworks.A must visit spot for every visit to Sydney.

In my top favorites!. I stayed in Pyrmont during my visit to Sydney and Darling Harbor was an integral part of my daily morning runs. Absolutely stunning scenery with major landmarks and also a great hangout spot. I also visited the Maritime museum here which is one of its kind. This will be definitely high on my list of recommendations for sightseeing spots in Sydney.

The romantic place !. The area and atmosphere puff darling harbour is one of the best for a lovely evening on couple or with friends (nice view, nice restaurants, nightclubs) everything you might need to have a good fun !
Vivid Sydney. Amazing light show on in June, many bars and restaurants. Nice views. Good place to get a drink or just walk around. Aquarium is here if you want to do the touristy stuff.

Nice Part of Sydney . Darling habour is a place for everyone. You want to go for a walk ? Eat in fancy restaurants ? Want to see the biggest imax cinema ? Visit sea life, wild life or Madame Tussauds or just want to see a nice sunset ? Darling habour is the right place for you !

Great place to hang around and taste different cuisines. Darling harbour is a great place to hang out with family and friends. Loads and loads of different eating places (though are a bit on higher scale of pricing which is expected due to the location) beutiful view of the city lights..
Cocktails at Darling Harbour. We enjoyed cocktails at Darling Harbour during Happy Hour while we watched the people running to their ferry.
Fantastic, so much to see and do. Lots of choices for how to spend your time here. Very easy access from the CBD, and a lot of attractions whether you want to be on or off the water.

Darling Harbour - an amazing place to visit. Darling Harbour has a plethora of places to eat, drink, visit and photograph. The fireworks on a Saturday night are not to be missed, the atmosphere is electric.

Happening place. There is a shopping center - Harborside right there. Point of interests at the harbor includes the aquarium ( lots of fun),the mini zoo(not very impressive), the madame Tussauds wax museum and the Maritime museum. There are many restaurants around the harbor. They are a tad expensive but not too bad. The harbor looked magical with the backdrop of the magnificent magenta clouds at sunset. After sunset, when the lights are on all the high rise modem buildings and the giant Ferris wheel, the harbor dazzles. When we were there, the Sydney Vivid event was going on. There were water/fire shows at the harbor every night from 6:00 pm onward. There was fabulous firework display on Saturday night. It is a busting place day and night. Definitely worth a visit.
The name says it itself. Darling harbour is really nice and cosy, I walked along the embankment and enjoyed the atmosphere around.

Lovely Evening. I was in Sydney for about 3 days. I love to spend my evening at Darling Harbour to unwind and relax. I enjoy watching boats approaching the harbour, people rushing get on-board and off-board, other doing exercise, beutiful birds sound and fresh sea breeze. Stay a bit longer, the harbour lit-up at nigh creating splendid view over the horizon. It is a nice place to enjoy a lovely evening alone, or even with family.

A hive of activity!. We spent time here in March and it was warm and lots happening.Restaurants were great and we really enjoyed the fireworks in the evening over the Harbour.Good for a stroll and browse the many shops.

Darling Harbour. I have been here few times with my young family and it is a great place to spend your day at though it does require abit of walking but you will find things to do and see along the way like wax museum, sydney aquarium and wild life. Plus plenty of place to eat at with reasonable price.

Lots of development changing the character of the Harbour for the better. Like lots of waterfront property in major cites all over the world such as London, New York, Baltimore, Barcelona, and many more, Darling Harbour has been transitioning from run-down docks to a destination with lots of different attractions.
So many choices. The restaurants, cafes, shopping, attractions and the pure joy of being on the water are all part of the unique atmosphere in this beautiful part of the world

Center of attraction in the city. This is a beautifully designed place right in the downtown. Have to understand, that unlike USA, where downtown means only business place and not so happening, Australian downtown's are the most happening places. This Harbor has so many activities, museums, shopping mall , boardwalk, and lot many things to offer. They do offer Fine Dining restaurants with lovely view and dinner cruises. If your in sydney and have a day to spare, hang out here.
great place to spend evening. lot of performances happening and one sit and enjoy and amazing eateries available lot of options on hand
My favourite place. Truly one of the most beautiful and yet quite busy, places on earth.If I could afford it I would retire here.Love the food, love the atmosphere, and I love the people.

Great Place for Restaurants & Shops. As well as the Maritime part of this area such as the impressive looking maritime museum, this is a lovely vibrant area that oozes character and life from the restaurants and shopsYou will find any style of Restuarant that you could wish for from every nationality that you could think of This is also the place where you will find the Sydney Hard Rock Cafe, where you can sit overlooking the harbour as you eat The Vivid lights are shown here or were when we were there in the early evening with the 'Dancing Fountains' which are well worth a visit if you can see them shown against the lit up buildingsRecommended - Enjoy

Darling Harbour and Vivid Sydney.. Darling Harbour and Vivid Sydney was the time we chose to visit.... So many eateries, there has to be something to suit everyone's fancy. Boat wharfs, cruises and water taxis, across the footbridge you have even more eateries and entertainment like the Ferris Wheel...great atmosphere all around Darling Harbour, great area for locals and tourists alike.
Such a site to check out . I enjoy walking and eating around darling harbour. We visited while the Vivid light show was on and man they out on an awesome show it was unbelievable.

Caught the Festival Deco - Vivid Sydney. During the months of May and June, there is light and water shows held at Darling Harbour every 30 mins. So you can choose to watch outdoor near the water front or enjoy a meal at the outdoor seats with the show.Something different to soak in the local atmosphere.

Fireworks & Vivid Sydney at Darling Harbour. We visited Sydney especially for the vivid lights & fireworks. However fireworks only displayed on Sat nights at 8.30 pm. You can come a bit earlier for dinner & watch the vivid lights first before the finale fireworks. Lots of eateries along the darling harbour for all budgets. There's even a food court in the harbour side mall. Definite must in your travel itinerary during the Vivid Sydney. Darling harbour looks beautiful in the day as well with all the private yachts parked at the harbour. Lots of attractions for kids as well like the sea aquarium. Madame Tussaud's, wildlife sanctuary like the lovely Ferris wheel. I would recommend taking the Ferris wheel in the night to enjoy the vivid lights & fireworks if you time it right. Panaromic view of the harbour from the Ferris wheel. Alternatively walk to to the prymont bridge for Panaromic view of the harbour, vivid lights & fireworks.

Great for dinner! . Great for lunch or dinner and a stroll around. Perfect little boutique shops spread around and often not as busy as in the city. Wasn't that impressed with Hard Rock Cafe, I have been here so many time over different times of the year and they always seem to have something on, like the winter wonderland display and Latin festival. It's free to walk around and the look back at the main part of the city is also so interesting. Great free little walk.
Stunning Vivid lights. We sat having hot chocolate while watching the wonderful Vivid lighting show in Darling Harbour. It was wonderful.

Vibe festival . Went during the Vibe festival and the laser show at night was amazing. They had one every 30 minutes, and each show lasted about 10-12 minutes. We watched 3 in a row and they were all different.

Must visit if in Sydney. One of the most beautiful areas around the CBD. If you find the right vantage point you can view the city and the busy water front. It is also the home of the wheel, a popular tourist destination.
Family holiday. We went round Sydney on the open top double decker bus and saw the whole of Sydney a must as you wont see Sydney. Great place to chill bars and food amazing

So many things to see & do. I went to Sydney with an open mind & have come away with fond memories of the stunning views of Darling Harbour for it has something for everyone! It host a plethora of cafe & restaurants to many exhibits such as seal life to name but a few
Have a great time relaxing, watching and eating. It is a truly a nice place housing huge buildings, restaurants and ferries on the water - and you can enjoy and relax as you wish.

Disappointing. We revisited Darling Harbour after an absence of about 20 years, and it was disappointing to observe that the harbour has been over-done with touristy junk such as a ferris wheel - what happened to the tasteful harbour which appealed to diners seeking an evening out visiting attractive wine bars and open-fronted restaurants!

most happening place food , shopping,best harbourside restaurants. best harbourside resturants , top eating joints , happening nightife ,best harbour views and best evening passtime if you are in sydney cant be missed

needs more work,. currently undergoing a transformation but Darling Harbour needs a lot of work.Sure the waterfront is nice and a good selection of restaurants but one cannot help feel that unless you are a tourist for a day there is little else in this precinct.

Explore Darling Harbour. Fantastic place for a casual walk and to take in all the sites.Great place for a meal and a drink from one of the many restaurants and bars located there.Take in a free show located in the promenade area.Great shopping in the indoor mall located there.Visit the Maritime Museum, the Wax Museum, the Aquarium etc.Lots to see and do!Catch the Hop On Hop Off Bus there or catch a boat to see the other sites of the Sydney Harbour.Lots and of Hotels located within easy walking distance.We have been there 3 times and plan on going back soon - Great Place to do as mush as you want or as little as you want to!
Fantastic location. This is the most fantastic location within Sydney City. It has a few interesting spots to visit including ferries too. It has lovely scenery in entire harbour.
Colours . One of my favourite place and when vivid is on . Which is Sydney's famous light show the Opera house and all the surrounding area is so beautiful . Must see

World class. This is the essence of Sydney. An absolutely fabulous setting of the blue harbour waters, the shops, superb seafood restaurants and perfect sunshine. I could spend days lazing around here and I promise I won't complain. If you find yourself in Sydney on a sunny day then this is the place to be. Honest.

Great day out. Darling harbour is a great day out with the kids. It's crowded but there's many choices of places to go and things to do. We did not go into any of the attractions or museums but just walked around and spent a lot of time in the children's park - which was fantastic! There's carousal rides and water fountains and many little spaces for kids to hang around. We ended up spending most of the day there outdoors and it was a lovely sunny day experience!
Nice harbour with good restaurants. Very touristy, but a nice harbour with some good restaurants and bars, a good tarting point for a walk into Sydney lots of hotels close by

Darling Harbour. This Harbour is the happening place especially at night, where you can dine and wine with fantastic view of the Harbour and city of Sydney. You can also take a cruise to Circular Quay where you would go to the Opera House and the Rock which are tourist spots.
It is Darling. What a view in night when lights are on. I was standing in hotel balcony and enjoyed the view of Darling Harbour.

Darling Harbour the perfect place to relax!. During our recent visit to Sydney my husband and I enjoyed many amazing experiences. My visit to Darling Harbour (as my husband had other commitments) was a most enjoyable experience. I walked from our hotel and crossed various walkways to get to the Harbour. The sights of the harbour were amazing and I had lunch at a restaurant which was the most amazing fish and chips whilst enjoying watching the people passing by. I then visited the aquarium (as I had not seen one for a long, long time) which was fantastic. This amazing experience took over an hour and I am glad that I decided to take the time. I loved it!!

All together! Great for tourists. Such a wonderful place. You can find all together, museums, nice and fancy restaurants, culture, wildlife, shopping, fun, festivals, relax, lights, everything. of you come to Sydney, its a must to go there.
Excellent. Great environment, always something happening! Try the amazing restaurants, nightlife, bars, clubs and street performers!

Great view. Darling Harbour is a nice place to spend the day exploring, or even to have dinner and drinks. You can take ferries from the harbour to other locations and explore that way, or just walk around!The harbour is currently lit up for Vivid Sydney!

See a space stick a building.. Darling Harbour has grown big time since was last there.
Lots of great fairly well priced restaurants, & attractions, something for everyone.

interesting and vibrant. Our hotel was in darling harbour and we loved the atmosphere of the place. There was stuff going on, including the laser and light show for vivid Sydney. The ferrys are easy to catch. harbourside shopping complex is right there, as is a ferris wheel if you fancy a ride.

Beautiful place. Visited Darling Harbour as part of the Vivid light festival. It was truly an amazing place to visit during the day and especially in the evening. We saw a spectacular laser light show including fireworks as part of Vivid.

Darling Harbour. Heaps of activities on during Christmas, New Years and fireworks every Saturday night @ 9pm. Heaps of restaurants around the area and a small mall that has a food court + gourmet restaurants.

Great place to go!. Darling harbour is a great place to go whether it's day or nigth!! u can have a lunch there, with a waterview and sun!! it's really really great!
u have a range of things u can do there!!
Nice location. Lots to do. Loads of food outlets. plenty of shops, SeaWorld and water tours. The promenade is wide and there's a large kiddies play area

Relaxing place by the waterfront.. We were able to walk to Darling Harbour from our central city hotel. We spent a couple of hours there, including visiting the Fish Market (via LIght Rail), enjoying fresh fish and chips from one of the many affordable waterside restaurants, and watching the children and families enjoying the extensive playground areas. Seating along the waterfront was not plentiful- it would be good to have more provided for people to just enjoy the location, watch the boats and ferries coming and going, or have a picnic.

Vivid. We spent the last friday evening in may here at the beginning of the vivid festival. The place was bustling with people watching the fabulous light shows and enjoying the fireworks. My son also enjoyed playing in the big play park behind the imax cinema after dark...even though it was only about 7pm. Lots of very nice restaurants and wine bars in this area too and I will have to return child-free to try them all

Fun place to be. We visited the Darling Harbour around lunch time and it looked a very active and vibrant place. There are tons of restaurants overlooking the harbour and seemed a popular spot with tourists and locals. We had lunch in a very busy Thai restaurant enjoying the ambience. The banners and logos of the Darling Harbour appears to be targetted towards a fun loving younger audience

So much fun!. Very entertaining area. Nice restaurants and bars. We were there at Vivid Sydney so it was a lot of fun Activities all aroundTry the carousel ride. We had a ride on day time and later at night! Great view from up there. Light shows were wonderful.

Nice lively waterfront. This place can be best enjoyed just about sunset time. Lots of people moving about for an evening walk. Few tourists enjoying the weather just before they need to get back to their hotels and many waiting in queue for the cruises. Oh this place is so exciting. It becomes more and more lively, every hour after dusk. So many awesome restaurants and great food and music. Pizza restaurants, Hard Rock Cafe Starbucks and many more more.

A great place to spend an hour or two. We walked around Darling Harbour, saw the shops, ate gelato, and just enjoyed the weather by the water. It wasn't crowded, so it was a great place to relax. It got very crowded at night for Vivid Sydney, and it wasn't worth going then as the Opera House has a much better show.

Leisure at its Best....... Not crowded. Very good for a leisure walk. Excellent surroundings. Plenty of eating joints to suit every pocket. Real pleasure water front. Maritime Museum, Madame Tussaud, Animal kingdom and Sealife Aquarium lined up to justify the place. All the attractions are on entry fee basis.

Tourist Entertainment Mecca . Darling Harbour is the home to Madame Taussaude, Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife as well the IMAX and the Hard Rock Cafe. There are plenty of restaurants along the waterfront, none suppose be all that good. Several hotels dotted in the area - the ones that stands out are Holiday Inn, Novotel and Ibis. This is a bit of Myrtle Beach or Kissimmee but in Sydney.

A Development Success. A nice place to walk around to take in the ambiance. Food prices are not bad in the food hall of the shopping centre, outside restaurants and bars tend to be very expensive. Great place to see fireworks and Vivid displays.

Darling Harbour Transforming. This is a very different place to the one I recall of my childhood. From a dour working wharf precinct to a vibrant entertainment hub this place has seen much hange over recent years, most notorious is the passing (and deconstruction) of both the Sydney Monorail and Sydney Entertainment Centre. Work has been relentless over the past 2+ years with the demolition and reconstruction of both the Exhibition Halls and Convention Centre - the new ones, nearing completion, will be magnificent venues adding to the energy of this area I'm certain. There are several venues here which deserve their own separate reviews..... get down there.

Darling Harbour has a lot to offer!. This part of the City is often ignored by visitors but I would highly recommend including this area on your itinerary. It's got a fantastic waterfront area with a whole host of restaurants, bars, attractions. While we were there they also had a big Wheel attraction. It's place is lit up at night and there is tremendous buzz about the place. Highly recommended.

Great space for little ones. There is a fairly new area for children with merry go round, water splash and activity areas. This is a great area to stay but accessible from many other parts of the city

Often overlooked but more chilled and less touristy than other parts of the city . We had a couple of nice meals and a good walk around the harbour, which is an easy 30 minute meander. It will be even better when the current renovation work is complete.

Excellent water front. Really nice strolling along this excellent water front, a lot of eateries, restaurants, and attractions, such wax museum Madame Tussaud, Wildlife Sydney Zoo, Sydney Sea Aquarium, and Australian Maritime Museum on the other side of Cockle Bay. Also admire the Pyrmont Bridge, a timber bridge heritage built more than 100 years ago. This waterfront front can be visited by ferry (a bit pricey) or by Light Rail Tram, stop at either from Convention or Pyrmont Bay Station.
Busy harbour. This is a very busy area with harbour front restaurants, Sealife and other attractions. Currently there is a water light show every half hour as part of Vivid Sydney

Beautiful place to walk around and explore. If you have time to kill in Sydney and want to experience lots of restaurants and attractions, visit Darling Harbour. There are tons of restaurants and they range from casual and inexpensive to more glamorous. You can just go for a walk and look around and spend some leisurely time.

Good eateries.. A great walk with lots to see and plenty of shops for those that want them. The Imax theatre has changing shows, we visited some years ago and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The Naval museum is worth a visit too. There are plenty of eateries to choose from but this time we got it wrong, we used the Blackbird Cafe. The service was terrible and the staff totally uninterested in having any customers. It advertises itself as the ideal spot for lunch, dinner or a fun night. Avoid it, there are plenty of other places to choose from including a steak house.
Amazing . Felt like in heaven and enjoyed the vivid light show ... Get food ... Get people and get night out around ..............just amazing
Nice place with rows of pricey restaurants. Lovely place especially during the vivid Sydney preparations.Parked at Darling Park for flat rates on weekends (AUD15).
Darling harbour . Excellent spot to visit vibrant full of great eateries restaurants theatres and access to the water access to madame tuseauds ocean world maritime mueseum

Magnificent Place!. Walking to Darling Harbour in the early afternoon is so fascinating. Everything and everyone are there. Among the many places in Darling Harbour, I am always drawn to Lindt and enjoy their hot and tempting chocolate drink.

Fantastic Location. I stayed at Darling Harbour during my stay and it was a great choice. Minutes away from the water where there is so much to see and do. Great food and atmosphere, especially at night.

Excellent Walk near Sydney Aquarium and Darling Harbour. Excellent Walk near Sydney Aquarium and Darling Harbour ... Hard Board Walk, Breezy and Windy Weather ... Lovely Sunny Walk for about 1.5 Kms from IMAX Theatre till the end of Aquarium. Must visit for people who long walks along the harbour

Amazing.. This is one of Sydney Harbours Amazing gems.There's Loads of attractions and restaurants to visit,and a full day is needed to get the most out of this place.The Maritime Museum,and the Aquarium totally ROCK!!

Loads to see and too. Great vibe here and with SEA LIFE, Wildlife and Madame Tussaud's plenty of attractions to occupy you. Start with a visit here or come for sundowner drinks, lots of bars and eateries.

Fun place to walk around. Our hotel was located within an easy walk of Darling Harbour.So we spent a lot of time here.Lots of food options.I suggest trying out a shake or chocolates at the lindt shop really good.There is a nice cheap Indian restaurant called pakwaan at harbourside mall nearby.Madam tussads and all the other tourist attractions are nearby .

Best hotels and restaurants. Luckily booked into Novotel in darling harbour
Lots of eating places And shops
We took the ferry to circular quay and back .
Easy access to the opera house etc doing that.

Everything you need. So many great restaurants there you could eat every meal at a different restaurant and be weeks before you ate at the ssme one for a second time. To see and do there is Imax, Sea life aquarium, Wild life Sydney,Madame Tussauds, the maritime museum, shopping and all the ferries and harbour cruises. It it the highlight of any time I visit Sydney.

The Very Essence of The Harbour City. I have seen Darling Harbour develop from scratch over the last couple of decades during my regular visits to Sydney. Today it is the venue for major attractions like IMAX, the Maritime Museum, the Sydney Aquarium, several up market restaurants, retail outlets, hotels, etc.Today we had glorious weather for a walkabout which is precisely what I did after lunch with a friend.

Great walk with view. We visited twice to Darling Harbour during our stay in Sydney. Nice view with easy walk for family. There are many tourist attractions such as sea life aquarium , zoo and Madame Tussaud's etc. highly recommended for all new tourists to Sydney.
Delightful place. We spent eight days in Sydney and we found this to be one of the most delightful places to visited. Fill with looks of great cafes and restaurants.

Beautiful and scenic. Walking along the harbor and taking in fresh air and nice view iwas a healthy and happy walk. You can see people from different backgrounds enjoying and spending quality time. Seagulls make a nice photo background and the Opera house is a real beauty to behold. Love to walk along the water.

Great place to watch the world go by!. Always something happening around here, you've got the many bars & eateries, the shops and just the atmosphere to take in. If you've got the time to do nothing then you could spend the day here just people watching, great to relax when the sun is out also.
Nice walk with restaurants. We went their with my family it was nice walk around the shore, nice shops and close to ferries. Close to fast food and starbucks and mcdonalds.

A pleasure to walk through. Walked from the Star Casino area north to where the Imax theatre was located, on a series of business meetings while in town for a couple of days. Strikingly enjoyable to see the mix of tourists, locals and other people out and about on business walking along the water and the cityscape of shops and restaurants.

Beautiful . I live this place...
For family, friends...
Restaurant are a little bit expensive but the view is verry nice.
All the saturday night there are a fireworks and some shows on the street so its verry nice!
A big playground for kids are just to close!

Nice harbour. Its nice to have evening or night walk there by the side of the harbour. Our hotel was close to the harbour so we went to the harbour 3-4 times during our stay. Many things like madam tussads, sea museum, shopping mall, cafes etc are walking to the harbour. Theatre which has the largest seating capacity is also quite close to the Darling harbour. Catching a ferry from darling harbour is also convenient.

Great ride on The Ferris Wheel. Even though there is quite a lot of construction and alterations happening at the moment, there is still lots to see and do. Recently a Ferris Wheel was set up at Darling Harbour so we decided to have a ride, great fun and the carousels can be spun around by the individual occupants, giving great 360 views, also great views across to the new Barangaroo complex on the opposite shore.

Must see. This is another place to visit. It has many restaurants, museums, shopping , boat rides, entertainment and is a beautiful place to linger along. The old bridge is amazing. If you look you can see the former light rail stops still standing on either end of the bridge. There is a huge play area for children with much equipment and water activities too.

Must Visit.. If you are in Sydney, then Darling Harbour should be third on your list after the Opera house and Bridge.It's a vibrant, fun place to visit with bars, restaurants and shopping! It was actually pouring down on the day we visited so we went to the IMax - which is worth a look if there is a film on you fancy! We visited a couple of bars on the way round (The Black bird) and an Italian restaurant on the other side for dinner. There is always something going on Darling Harbour and we were lucky enough to be there when they were doing fireworks at 8:30 on a Saturday night, which were fantastic! Visit Darling Harbour!

Over hyped . Wasn't excited at all being around this area even on a weekend. It's just over hyped for people who haven't travelled around the world. I prefer marine drive in Bombay. Atleast it's lively everyday
I love this place. Truly beautiful. Came late afternoon around 4pm, walked round the harbour watching the sun set then grabbed a drink before heading home.One of my favourite places in Sydney

Attractions are abundant. Beautiful day in Sydney and what better way to walk around Darling Harbour. Crowds were a plenty but the size and scope of the area ensures sufficient space without bumping into each other. Plenty of cafes and restuarants, and attractions are abundant.

Fantastic Food. When staying in Sydney you must visit Darling Harbour. Surrounded by fantastic restaurants and filled with people the atmosphere is buzzing. Stop by on a Saturday night to catch the weekly fireworks at 9pm.

A tourist attraction with a lot to see and do. A definite tourist attraction with lots places to dine, lots of things to see and do.
It's about a 5-10min walk from Town Hall station. There is also a ferry that gets you here from darling harbour.
Just passing the day away.. What a great place to sit, enjoy a quiet drink, enjoy a good meal and watch the world go by..... and did I mention the Sun.......

A must!!. Whether its shopping, visiting the aquarium or zoo, fine dining or just a snack or drink harbourside then this is for you. You will need more than a day to do it all but the revamped harbour is beautiful. There are some areas of development still happening but this does not in any way detract from the area.

A bit touristy and didn't really enjoy the construction sites around . It was the second time we went to the Darling Harbour and last time when we visited in summer, the overall atmosphere was much more festive! This time, the Harbour now became surrounded by several construction sites that really affected it's charm! Of course, the bridge and the Harbour together makes the iconic view of Sydney, just now people don't go there chill and relax. If it's your first time in Sydney, still worth going!And don't miss the fireworks on every Sat night! :)
One of the best harbours!. They have built up this harbour in a very planned way and I found it to be one of the best harbours worldwide, You get to see different kinds of Yachts and boats here.

One of the best place to live rp Stay in Sydney. Close to Good and luxury hotels plus you can walk to Star Casino. Harbour Bridge and close to metropolitan area. Nice shopping centres as well.Overall i would prefer to stay in darling harbour if i am staying in sydney for short term.
Good fun. Take the ferry to go to darling harbour and enjoy the breezy ride. The place has some great restaurants.

A walking experience. We started out with no destination in mind and found ourselves walking over the Darling Harbor bridge. There are many museums and attractions here but we just enjoyed walking around looking at the water craft while munching on comfort food.

My favourite place in the city. Fireworks every Saturday night.A beautiful view with cafes around.Peaceful at night even though it's in this big city.A gorgeous park and there are many things happening.I will never get tired of this area. I like to buy a 50cent icecream at Mc Donalds and sit on the bench and look at the view in peace. Every weekend there is sometjing happening in the park you van watch/visit/taste. Cultural happening such as Indian food and entertainment or Korean festival and so on. And they also have free outdoor movie nights a few times and many other free events. I go here for the view, for entertainment, for food, drinks and to go think.

Loved it! . Darling Harbour is one of my favorite places in Sydney. It's has a lot of night life and is a great day/night out. The atmosphere is wonderful and it's also family friendly. I would recommended going on the Farris wheel if you are not scared of heights- it's only $8 per person and has a great view.Be sure to have a nice long walk around as I'm sure you will not be disappointed.

Amazed and delighted. So many incredible restaurants Great walks and the building work which is happening in the area will be incredible Harbourside shopping centre quite good especially for reasonably priced souvenirs. Had some lovely meals, juices and ice cream Live Miovenpick ice cream Breakfast at Nick's cafe was excellent Fireworks every Saturday night

Tourist mecca!. Darling harbor is an excellent place for tourists. Not only can you shop 'til you drop but, if when your done shopping and need a bite to eat or a good cup of coffee or tea there's loads of eateries. Also if its keeping the kids amused while they're learning, then there's the aquarium, and a few other things to entertain them. Or if you simply want to soak up the sun while taking a leisurely walk or jog you can do that too.

Most touristy place in Sydney. Provide yourself with one full day to explore this place because there is a lot to do, and not just shopping and eating. Sydney Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife, Madame Tussaud, IMAX Theater, are just a few examples of activities to be done in Darling Harbor. You can also go to King Wharf and catch a cruiser to enjoy Sydney the best way: boating and exploring the harbor, enjoying the view of Sydney's landmarks from water. After a full day, finish your night with dinner at Nick's Bar & Grill, the most amazing seafood and great service!
Awesome. Whether you're shopping. ..sightseeing. ..lunching. ..Darling Harbour is a MUST.....the atmosphere is amazing. ..sitting having a drink and looking over the Harbour is perfect.

Very touristy. A lot of tourists are in this area due to the activities and restaurants. I've visited several times and the day is crowded with children because there is a park for the kids. There are many restaurants in this area that seem reasonably price. There is also a tourist information place to book tours. The harbor itself is busy with tourist boats as well as ferries to get to other areas of Sydney.

Great place.. Darling Harbour has a little bit of everything for everybody. Sydney Wildlife,Maddame Tussauds, the Maritime Museum and the worlds largest IMAX. Not to mention every kind of food you would care to eat. A must see place while in Sydney and they have a fireworks display every Saturday night at 8PM weather permitting and it is worth showing up for.

Ticks all the boxes . You can't come to Sydney and don't visit Darling Harbour,it's a great place to spend half day, visit the aquarium and other tourist attractions and enjoy a meal in one of the restaurant .
Busy place. Restaurants aplenty for all tastes. There was always people about and there are a few bars which also serve good food
Inexpensive and charming . Highly recommended and worth the wait for a table at the water front. Try the glazed scallops from one of the vendors or some great mud crab!

Nice for Walking. We stayed at The Star and walked around the Harbor. Although the fringes of the Harbor are construction zones, the sights from the bridge is spectacular. The bridge has speed limits. Go mate!
Touristy. This place will give you idea about Sydney's vibrant city life. Try visit it on any Friday night to see the buzz.
special. Darling Harbour is a very special place and if you are in Sydney it is a must to do, beautiful in the evenings and an awesome experience

So much to do, so little time!. Darling Harbour has an energy and ambience that is quite unique. Its like a big playground, with shopping and eateries added on for a total experience. On the day we visited, we were caught on the bridge in a flash downpour, but that didn't dampen our spirits ( forgive the pun). We headed for the food court, did some browsing and shopping under cover and when the sun came out, we strolled around the Harbour, enjoying the display of hilarious street and information signs. A leisurely walk brought us to the Chinese Gardens, and then to Paddy's Market...which is a review for another time. darling harbour is easily reached on foot, take the train to Town Hall, walk down Market street past The Queen Victoria Building ( another review coming for the QVB), or take a bus, or ferry from Circular Quay. Lots of good weather activities at the massive children's playground, or if you need an activity forrainy days, head to the Aquarium, Wild World or Madame Tussauds. Fabulous restaurants offering a variety of cuisines, including fine dining face onto the Harbour. Cruises for lunch or dinner leave from here to explore Sydney Harbour. So MUCH to do and see. Go There! Cheers!
Love it. Darling Harbour is hive of activity and full of great things to do and see. Easy to catch the ferries from. Good shopping outlets and the Star Casino is right here.

Yanks eating in Oz. Besides being a very beautiful harbor with lots of different boats to look at, there are a multitude of activities and restaurants to enjoy. We ate at an outside cafe, enjoying a great lunch and watching people and life go by.

We enjoyed a beautiful autumn day visiting the new venues.. The new children's playground with the changeable watercourses was very popular on this sunny autumn day. The teenagers enjoyed their first IMAX experience and we all enjoyed the food and the ferry trips.

Great place to hang. You can easily take the ferry from downtown Sydney or you can walk here. Very touristy. I was there around valentines day and they had a large ferris wheel and fun activities for everyone. There are restaurants, coffee places and ice cream places.

Food, shops, pubs and so much more. I was not really sure what to expect form this harbor, but it exceeded my expectations. Around this harbour you have loads of opportunities to shop, drink and eat. No matter what part of the day you visit, there is always something going on. In the evening they even have 3 giant fee's walking around.
Great place to people watch!. An array of restaurants to eat and catch up with friends. Handy location only a short walk from many popular hotels.
Fun. We enjoyed browsing the Harbour area. We had just landed from a sixteen hour flight. The harbour is lovely

Great harbour view and a lot of activities to do. Its a great place for an afternoon stroll, lunch, and even dinner. You can have lunch with the view of harbour bridge and opera house. It is beautiful at night and there are a lot of things and attractions there. A must see if you are travelling to Sydney
Great place to watch sunset. Grab a table at one of the cafes, get a few happy hour libations and watch the day end as the boats come & go. Very enjoyable way to spend an hour or so.

So much. Endless things to do, so many places to eat, drink and explore!!
Fireworks on Saturday nights, at 8:30pm, are great fun.

Darling View. It was our first time to visit and we were keen to take pictures and look at everything. The harbour is really a darling and find it something of a romantic vibe! It is along the Sydney Opera house and easy access after a few photo op there.Perhaps nice to visit as well in the evening with a lot of restaurants around the corner. The train is just up there and very convenient for all travelers.

Lunch Dates, Shopping and Views. Darling Harbour is a great spot for a lunch date! There are many restaurants, some very high class, others very casual. There is also a shopping mall with a variety of cute clothing stores and there are also activities like Bowling and Laser Skirmish available. If you're up for a movie, there is a massive iMax Theatre screening all latest films. Very accessible by public transport.

Great Place to spend a day.. Plenty of Restaurants, bars, shopping and things to see and do. At the front of Darling Harbor they are funny signs from around the world to see. You can shop till you drop or just sit at one of the sidewalk cafes with a drink and people watch.

Wonderful harbour, loads to watch, drink and eat. What a lovely harbour. It's clean and tidy, there are loads of places to eat and drink and watch the world go bye. Lovely walk from the Sydney bridge around the new casino building to darling too. Sydney has to be one of my favourite cities to be in. It's safe, friendly, clean and the culture and climate can't be beat in my view. Worth the long trip from UK everyday.
Amazing at night. So much to see. What a beautiful walk around Darling Harbour. Everything lit up and alive. So beautifulSensational
Great atmosfeer. full of great restaurants and things to do, fireworks every Saturday night making for a romantic date night, recommend waterfront grill for a meal.

Darling is darling. This area is very clean and I felt very safe walking day and night. Lots of food and entertainment choices in the area. The tourist info center was very helpful in getting day trips planned out.

Wonderful place both at day and night. Whether you are there during the day or at night, you will enjoy the different views. Have your seafood there or enjoy music play and cold breeze during the night. Stroll around the Darling Harbour and have great shots.

Family . The area is very tired and the current construction zones make the western side of Darling Harbour not so friendly towards tourists.The once sparkling water area was congested with various pontoons and a large marquee restricted the views.The restaurants seem to offer good service and ambiance. But currently better enjoyed by night as by day it's not really pretty.As a tourist we struggled to find maps and useful signage and relied on our own GPS to find our way. Hopefully the area will be improved when the convention centre is complete.
Nice Skyline at night. We were staying in the CBD, easy walk over the bridge and around the harbour. Very lively. Great photos at night.
Super place to visit.. Well worth a visit. Plenty to keep occupied. Good fish restaurants. Well kept. Commercialised but unavoidable I guess.

Fun to visit. Darling Harbour is a fun place to visit and with children there is lots to do! The maritime museum is fabulous and then of course there is the acquarium and Madame Toussauds. There are also some great restaurants and bars with good views - fun to sit and watch the boats and people go by.It's easy to take a ferry from here to any of the other Sydney attractions, but also easy to walk around. I would definitely recommend visiting Darling Harbour as a key site on your Sydney trip.

Brain food. Wonderful to walk around; always something happening.Nautical Museum worth a visit.Great for seafood restaurants: we thought Nic's was the best.Fireworks every Saturday evening around 8.30.Brilliant cityscape at night.

Heartbeat of the city. To me Darling Harbour tends to be the hub and heartbeat of the city. I love the place as it is an easy walk to and from the trains and shops it is ideally suited for those who may not be in the city for long but want to get that flavour of Sydney as it is also the place to pick up the harbour boat tours. We went to Sea Life initially but stayed the day taking the chance to take a cold beer in the sunshine and watch the world go by – a thumbs up from me. In our view Cockle Bay Warf is where the best places to eat happen to be. There always seems to be street performers about and for some reason during our time in Australia it was the only place we saw Aborigines in native dress play a digeridoo! There really is something for all ages. So good we went back every night

Multitude of attractions. Darling Harbor is beautiful and enjoyable day and night. By day activities for kids might be the choice; aquarium, IMAX theatre, wild life zoo, Madame Tussaud's, etc. At night the harbor lights up with high rises on one side and restaurants on the other. It is very busy with locals and tourists alike jamming the many restaurants and bars. Weekends especially is very busy with Saturday night fireworks drawing large crowds. You might want to view and have dinner during the week. If in the CBD, you can walk over the Pyrmont Bridge. If on Pitt or George street, cross over on Market street, walk over the highway overpass and then over the bridge. Or you could take the light rail, but that requires you being near it. Enjoy the activities, attractions, fabulous lights both sides of the harbor, restaurants and shops. Darling Harbor is also home to the casino, called The Star. It has many restaurants also in addition to the casino.

Great walk, then ferry to circular quay!. This is a great spot to be. The aquarium is nearby with the wax museum and zoo next door as well. Walking around here is great and it has a really neat vibe. Plus take the ferry from here to circular quay and you get to see a lot for cheap. Especially if you do it at sunset. Luna park, big pirate ships, going under the harbor bridge, and the opera house! It was just really a highlight.

Buzzing place. This harbour is the location of several restaurants with good views , good looking boats, madame tussuads, sealife aquarium and wildlife zoo. The hop on/off ferry stops here and it is within walking distance of The Rocks area.

Busy but great place with huge choice for breakfast lunch and dinner. This is a very busy but well loved part of Sydney. Many cafe's bars restaurants, with fantastic value breakfasts sitting outside on the harbour, and good lunch deals. Very crowded in the evenings and weekends can be rowdy. But relaxing, connected to gardens, and many activities every weekend. New Exhibition Centre being built, and a hotel, and unfortunately, this harbour is vastly overbuilt, with more at the end with Casinos and hotels. Shadowed in the evenings by blocked sun from new buildings, so we have yet to see how it will turn out. But remains pleasant, breakfast and lunch weekdays quieter times to enjoy.

exciting place. Our last trip to Sydney was in 2009 and this place has definitely expanded. There are more buildings and eateries around the harbor. Major constructions are in progress and somewhat made the place unsightly.However, this is still a place to visit while in Sydney. Plenty of attractions like museums, aquariums, cruises and eateries.There was an Indonesia fare during our visit and we enjoyed the entertainment and food served.Very accessible if staying within the CBD.

Great to stroll along the waterfront . Darling Harbour is a great place just to stroll through, the sights of the harbour, the restaurants, the people , a good way to get between circular quay the maritime museum, the Bridge, and the Aquarium, there are several floating restaurants and party boats along the harbour as well,and I'm sure I have forgotten several attractions, if you're a visitor to Sydney you should check it out for yourself.

Wonderful!. Beautiful little Harbour. We caught a ferry here, to cruise the Harbour. There are a few really yummy eateries. One of our favourite places to visit here was Madam Tussauds. Definitely a must see.

Lots to Do. This is a must place to go if you like to people watch & be near the water. There are many restaurants to choose from. also lots of bars and attractions. Good place to see street performers ~some quite good, lots of people watching. There was a bit of construction going on so we were having to step carefully & follow the signs!!

Best place to stay in Sydney. We stayed at the Novotel on Darling Harbour & I would highly recommend it. Picturesque views & free entertainment with a multitude of restaurants on your doorstep. Wildlife centre, Aquarium, Waxwork museum & Maritime museum all on your doorstep to walk to. Water taxi's to take you to Circular Quay to avoid the road traffic & allow for beautiful views & photograph opportunities. Extensive take away food mall if you are on a budget or having a fast paced day. Great shops & lovely harbour side walks. Much better than staying in the city. We will definitely return here.
Its a construction zone.. Darlng Harbour under reconstruction so it best to five t a miss.till its closer to completion around Dec 16.Alright to visit for a quick peek at whats to come.
Exciting. Great area with a lot going on. Easily could spend a whole day here shopping, eating and checking out the sites. Museums, Aquarium, History, it's a great spot.

Darling Harbour. We traversed Darling Harbour daily during our stay in Sydney, as our accommodations were in Pyrmont, near to the Harbour, and we would walk from Circular Quay to our accommodations via Darling Harbour, which is just an average location.
So much to see. This is a must place to go. A lot of restaurants, bars and attractions. Good place to see street performers.

Lots to do and see!. The shops and restaurants in Darling Harbour are looking a tad tired, but it is still a vibrant, interesting place to visit. The greatest attraction is the Australian National Maritime Museum, which is exceptional (actually in Pyrmont) with wonderful displays including submarine Oberon, destroyer Vampire and patrol boat Advance, to say nothing of sailing ship James Craig.
unfortunately smoke haze. Lots of things to do in this area. Very clean and family friendly. Jump on a ferry, go on a cruise, do some shopping, go to maritime museum etc

Great place to just walk around and spend an evening. Went to Darling Harbour for the first time in about 5 years and forgot how nice it is there. Very close to the CBD and Shopping so when you have had enough of that you can stroll across to the harbour and grab a biet at one of the many restaurants there and watch the World pass you by while taking in the sites. Seems there are a few activities there for kids now like handling wildlife, an aquarium and Museum to name a few.

Awesome - we loved it!. What an amazing place to visit! Access to so many of Sydney's main attractions - either on site or via ferry. Many eateries catering for all tastes. Small shopping mall to browse through. Easy access via light rail. Absolutely worth the visit!

Spent some memorable times there. Darling Harbour has everything, from good restaurants and bars to family entertainment at the Aquarian or Madam Tussauds. We spent many an hour walking there and on one occasion caught the water taxi and saw more of the harbour from the water. Great photo opportunities there.A must if you go to Sydney.

Under some construction, but worth the visit!. We took the Darling Harbor Ferry to this stop - second of two as we were heading to Paddy's Market. Lots of construction, BUT easy to maneuver and about a 15 walk. For those with children, great play structures that they would really enjoy. This was our second ferry trip of the day - easy to do, but give yourself time to enjoy each one as the ferry rides are a nice break from walking to see each place.

Major sepanx. Since my work is just 5mins away from this area, I am almost here every single day. This is one of the most popular touristy place in Sydney esp. The waterfront on Saturday night because of the weekly fireworks show

Plenty to see and do. Great place both during the day and at night. Lots of places to eat and drink, along with places to visit.We had a pleasant time just walking around, watching the world go by and enjoying the amazing weather.Close enough to walk to from the CBD, but also great to get a ferry from Circular quay to travel around to, as you then get great views from the water of all the buildings, especially the new developments in the Barangaroo area.

Nice getaway.... Its very strange how full on the city is in general in sydney but arriving in darling harbour - there is a different more relaxed atmosphere there. People are rushing but aren't rude when going by or anything- definitely a beautiful area at night to go to would be romantic for a dinner with your partner or have a random family night at the imax - one of my new fav spots in sydney whenever i go over now
Offers something for everyone. Spectacular by day, stunning by night. So many things to do and see. Amazing variety of restaurants and cafes.

Sad to leave. Absolutely love Sydney and won't stay anywhere else but Darling Harbour. Ideally located in the heart of everything. Short walk to Sydney tower eye and the shopping precinct. Down to cockle wharf where there is so many attractions and restaurants. Absolutely love the place.

Everythig At Your Feet. Darling Harbour has everything at you feet nice Restaurants, Cinemas, Chinese gardens, Madame Tussauds, Shopping outlets and many more. its is perfect for a night out day outing.

Great place to spend an evening . This place is a good option to spend an evening.
There r a lot of very good restaurants and bars.
The scenery is amazing at night you can just sit at the docks and watch it for a while.
The is a huge imax nearby and a shopping mall with local and international shops.

Had a nice stroll. Had a nice stroll around the harbour after dinner.
Beautiful lights reflecting off the water in a cool sydney autum night. Occasionally stopping and enjoying views.
Not something you would forget.

Surrounded by too many Awesome restruants and Attractions. It presents a amazing walk surrounding the Darling harbor. Also there are too many good sea-side restaurants and sit-outs circumference-ing the darling harbor. Amazing for night-life party animals.

Great harbour views and eats. Lovely harbour with lots of great restaurants. We ate at a restaurant called Nick's (which I believe is short for Adronicus). Food was great as was the view. The harbour is well worth a visit! Did not make it to the Aquarium (which is located in the harbor and which I understand is very good). Next time…

A wonderful place for a short visit. I did not expect that much. However, this area was quite amazing. You can walk through till here from China Town. There are a lot of spots you can make a stop. The harbour itself was great, too. Sitting aside the harbour was so relaxing. There are a lot of restaurants in the shopping mall. You can enjoy good time and great view at the same time.
a sydney icon.... i love darling harbour for its restaurants. you are spoilt for choice here. a nice spot to relax and enjoy sydney skyline.
Great night spot. Very busy with a good selection of bars and eateries . Loved the busy diverse location. Entertainment everywhere for all ages

Great spot . Darling harbour is a great place for drinks eating and people watching It's a beautiful spot almost in the middle of the city with wonderful restaurants at prices that were very (relatively) cheap for the quality offered We ate here 3 nights and the going rate seemed to be $30 / person for 2-3 course and in one case even a drink included
Great outdoor restaurqanrs. Take the ferry for a nice dinner away from the crowds at circular quay. We had a grat meam at Nicks....specials on Mon Tue are a real bargainn

A great place to spend a few hours.. While visiting Sydney during our April 2016 vacation, we spent a few hours at Darling Harbor. We caught a ferry from Sydney Harbor which only took a few minutes. It was very convenient because we could use the same Opal card we used on the buses.We stopped for a cup of cappuccino and a pastry just after getting off the ferry at one of the many cafes. As you walk along the harbor there is so much to see. We stopped at the zoo for a while then continued our walk along the harbor. There is a large shopping mall where we visited a few stores and purchased some things. Longing for some oriental food, we stopped at an Asian noodle restaurant. The food was great and I wished we had one of these back home in Maui, Hawaii.

Lots of fun activity to enjoy. Cafes, shops, boats and people to watch are great ways to enjoy this harbor. Ferries, water taxis, yachts, speciality boats are all abuzz in the water. Tip: Besides all the waterside cafes, there are also nice restaurants on the upper level. During the afternoon, trail fireworks go off around the docks' edge and bridge. The sun captures the water and glistens and you can't help but smile all over at being at this special place.

Great place for social functions.. Attended a party at Beer DeLuxe Bar on Darling Harbour. The list of beers available is extensive. The food was delicious and the staff were great. Views of Darling Harbour were lovely and so it all made for a fantastic place to have a party.

Sort of a second tourist area, if you have time. This is much farther from the Opera House area, but there is a shopping area and places to eat nearby. This area I would check out after you have done the main tourist area over by the Opera House, etc.

Over hyped, much better areas to see and eat. Much talked about by others, so very disappointed. Sydney has so much to offer and this place is not one of them. Great let down on all hype, save your money, enjoy elsewhere.

The ultimate tourist trap. Crowded tourist area. Many of the very touristy attractions are in darling harbor. no reason to go if you are not going to the aquarium or the wax museum or other attraction.

Amazing night view. My favourite time to Darling Harbour is the night time! The light in that area is very beautiful. Sitting down in the café around the harbour is a lovely idea. Easy to reach by public transport. I was lucky when I enjoyed the street performance with his violin playing some classical music!
Always something new. great atmosphere. Plenty to do, even just watching the world pass by. Terrific eateries. Relaxing and casual strolling or just sitting.

Views. Just love Darling Harbour. Only a 10 min walk from the Meriton Campbell Street. It is a beautiful place to be, great shops and cafes. The children's playground is amazing during the day and in the evening.

A Terrific Place To Visit. I love Darling Harbour! Although it's undergoing lots of construction at the moment, it's worth just walking across there to eat at one of the many restaurants and look back across the Harbour to the stunning city skyline!There are also many attractions - Maritime Museum, Madame Tusseauds, Aquarium - and lots of coffee shops and eateries. There 's also a range of shops in the shopping mall. And it's also just a short stroll to the Star Casino.

Fireworks. Lucky enough to be at Darling Harbour on a Saturday evening and enjoyed the FREE fireworks and entertainment. Spectacular !!! and the entertainers - Sirens and especially the Beat The Streets group were So nice to watch and the leader was a great showman. Good foodhall nearby with a variety of food at reasonable prices. Recommend tourists visit Darling Harbour in the evening

From Sheltland to Australia. We stayed in the Park Royal hotel which I have already reviewed. Darling Harbour is an amazing place within easy walking distance of the Park Royal . We had the most delicious meal at The Blue Fish, while watching THE most amazing fireworks display we have ever seen. All around the harbour area is so beautiful,so clean and well kept .

Perfect sights!. Darling Harbour is where you can get the post card shots of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. There is also a playground that fits most ages. It has a mini zipline and my kids had a blast! Most restaurants in Darling Harbour aren't really kid friendly though.

Vibrant . From the sealife centre to the shops , restaurants and bars , there's everything you need around Darling harbour. A lot of construction going on at the moment but it doesn't impede you getting around .

So much to do.. My wife and I visited Darling Harbour and absolutely love it. We caught the ferry over from Circular Quay and trudged around the Harbour for a few hours. The board walk is cool with the large boards you walk along and the water views as you walk along. Walking along we were tempted by all the restaurants which seem to offer specials and compete with one another. We choose a cool little restaurant for lunch over looking Darling Harbour and had a few beverages. The different boats in and around the Harbour are cool to look at. We headed up over the bridge which looks as though its a moveable bridge for bigger boats to come through although its looks like its in operable at the moment. Theres heaps on offer at Darling harbour, Aquarium, Australian animal zoo, boardwalk train rides for the kids, an abundance of restaurants and bars and shopping centre. There is also a IMAX theatre. Being Chinese new year there were heaps of displays in the actual harbour and on the land. Recommend you find a restaurant over looking the Harbour and sit and relax taking in the views. Go for a walk around the harbour and look at the cool attractions.

Lots of things to do here!. A must see when in Sydney. We did the following attractions located in this area on a day it was raining in Sydney: SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium, the WILD LIFE Sydney Zoo, Madame Tussaud's, and the Australia National Maritime Museum. There are many restaurants/bars in the area as well as shopping.
On an Autumn day. What more could you ask for? Well maybe a little less humidity but gorgeous to just sit in the sun with icecream and someone special.

Ruined even more every time I see it. Years ago when I visited, Darling Harbour was the jewel in the crown for me. Lovely, relaxing, and easy access via the monorail. This has all changed with the dismantling of the mono rail to make way for a super duper exhibition centre. Totally ruined in my opinion. Last time I was there, there was loads of construction still happening, years after it started, and it looks like a concrete jungle. It is hard to get to for someone with limited mobility, as it is a fair hike from one end over to the bus stop, which I think only goes to limited places anyway. I noticed one of the best joints there has closed, and the amount of people there was much less than on previous visits. Sux to ruin such a beautiful spot. Bring back the monorail.

Great day out. Had a great day out here. Nice promenade and lucky to hit on the Indonesian travel show in the Chinese gardens. So excellent food from the stalls. Main reason to visit was the aquarium but stayed all afternoon for the bars and cafes there.

Sunday Exercise. Lots of restaurants, the Aquarium, and other attractions. Ferry service and sightseeing ferry tours available. Saturday night there is a fireworks display which is pretty extensive and a good show.

So much to see. Strolled the concourse with 2yo in stroller after dark. No crowds. .. enjoyable..relaxing..interesting.
Not much open on Sunday evening except food joints. ... but easy to check out what u want to see best in daylight

Beautiful at night. It looks beautiful at night with lights all around. There's a good shopping mall where we visited the food court often. There is sea world, madame Tussaud's and museum very close. Several restaurants and pubs there. Friday night its packed with people. One day spent at darling harbour one can see all these places .

Darling Harbour Wonderful Place. A wonderful place to visit , happy hour most restaurants from 12 o clock, huge selection of restaurants, everything you can imagine . The Harbour is within walking distance of Sydney Harbour .

A good place for your visitors. We always take our visitors to Darling Harbour, so much to see including the Maritime Museum, plenty of places to eat and drink, lots of hotels, and now you can walk right round from Circular Quay, even better

Great place to spend weekends. Darling harbour is a great place to spend your weekends. You have a host of eateries on the promenade. Typically you would have some street artists demonstrating their talent on the promenade.
We went there on Saturday evening and enjoyed the fireworks at 8.30 pm (available every Sat)

Much to do and see.. We spent a couple of days taking in the many sights around this incredible place. There are many attractions around the harbour edges. Maritime Museum, Aquarium, Imax Theatre to name a few. There are many restaurants that would provide for every taste. If taking a ferry ride to another part of Sydney Harbour is on the agenda then Darling Harbour is the place to start.

Nice part of the city . Lots of restaurants and cafes as well as access to the aquarium and boat trips around Sydney. While I wont say it's a must do it is a nice part. What I found very strange while in Sydney was just how early things close down and stop serving food. My first evening found me struggling to find a Resturant that served food after 930pm. After 9pm and they are rushing you! For a major city I found this bizarre!
Superb. Enormous harbour. Fabulous skyline at night with all the tall buildings. Lots of restaurants on the harbourside. Great place to walk around day or night.
Love Darling Harbour. Spent an evening dining and just people watching. There's always something going on here. Huge choices for meals, bars and night clubs and very family friendly

Bustling area. Although this harbour area is not as busy on the actual water as the Circular Quay as a limited number of boats/ferries come into it, it is a very vibrant area with lots of great restaurants, the aquarium, maritime museum, IMAX theatre, and Friendship Garden. Well worth walking to and exploring the area. Currently there is a lot of construction in the area towards the Powerhouse museum but there is still reasonable walking access.

Beautiful Place. Absolutely loads of bars and restaurants around here. Seems a bit more laid back than Sydney harbour in the fact that you dont need to get too dressed up at night, we felt fine here in our shorts and a t-shirt. Great views at night from a bar with all the lights lighting up the Sydney Skyline.

A Must Visit. Unfortunatley we had put Darling Harbour quite low on our to do list, so didn't visit until our last day in Sydney. So glad we did! There are hundreds of restaurants to choose from and most have great value offers. The area is so peaceful yet trendy. Beautiful scenery with the waterside and boats.

Certainly worth a visit. It has been a few years since we visited Darling Harbour, we caught the ferry from Circular Quay, what a magic day it was, the Harbour was at it's best, on arrival we sat and sat and had a coffee and then we walked right down past the carousel and parkland and could not believe how many interesting bistros that had opened, the best is yet to come with the refurbishment of the area. Fantastic to see such an icon growing.
Good. Really good. Maritime museum, shops, restaurants, etc. Very built up and busy so don't expect an intimate little harbour!

Staying at a Darling Harbour. Great place to stay, good access by both train and ferry, it is easy to miss the "Star Centre" but everyone should visit, the food in the restaurants all looks so good, very fresh, and more appealing than some of the older fast food establishments.

Always something happening.. There are heaps of restaurants and bars which provide reasonably priced meals, drinks and opportunities for people watching. Most places have great "Happy Hours" when cocktails are very reasonably priced. Other drinks are also reduced.

Darling Harbor is very busy!. Darling Harbor is always busy. There are ferries that leave from there, the Aquarium, the Wildlife Park, the IMAX and plenty of eating establishments. You will not find anyplace to eat that doesn't start at least $21/meal, so if you are looking for a quick, inexpensive meal, you won't find it there.

Darling Bay. After arriving by water taxi from Sydney Habour, we explored the bay. There were varied places to eat, all of which look very appetising and after lunch we went to the zoo. Now I don't really like zoos, but this one was very good. It was only Australian animals, birds, reptiles etc so as an English person I found it very interesting. Later we walked around seeing what Darling Bay had to offer and I must be honest it was an enjoyable days excursion

For all. You haven't been to Sydney if you haven't set foot on Darling Harbour. Lots of attractions are located there, like IMAX movie, Madame Tussaud's, the Aquarium. And bars, and restaurants, and ice cream kiosks.

So much to see. Only had one day exploring Darling Harbour. Visited the maritime and Wildlife centres. Both well laid out, interesting and informative. Caught the small yellow water taxi under the bridge and over to the Opera House. Plenty of places to eat overlooking the river.

Lots of tourist restaurants, shoppes and hotels. It seems that every major waterfront city has an area like Darling Harbour with restaurants, tourist souvenir shops, museums and attractions. They are all crowded with tourists and all of the restaurants serve the same food with different names. Most of the souvenirs are made in another country.It is a very nice area, but we were charged a $5 per person surcharge at a restaurant because it was Sunday (or a holiday). That stinks!So my advice is to enjoy walking the Darling Habour shoppes and use the ferry terminal to travel about, but don't eat there on a Sunday or holiday. The restaurants that our group visited were not worth the price, let alone a surcharge. More on the specific restaurants in my other reviews.
