Spend a week there to see everything. We spent four busy days in Darling Harbour and did not see every thing there was to see. We were in a hotel that over looked the harbour. Every thing we wanted to see was a short walk away so there was no transport to pay for. A bonus for us Superannuants. There are plenty of restraunts etc. for every pocket.

1988. I removed 1988 so well My nan took me to darling Harbour to see the tall ships still got the tickets . It's so big now and really a tourist trap . But heaps to do and good for someone who's visiting the city for the first time .
Darling Harbour. Fabulous place to visit . Beautiful views and so many attractions, great movie theatre and shopping is amazing. Went back several times. Love the wherl especially at night
Best choice when it comes to food and drinks. if you wanna chat and hang out with friends this is the place you'd rather be. several things to do and try.
A Day Out. Plenty to see and many restaurants. The National Maritime Museum is worth a look ans something for everyone.

Great place for all ages. There is so much to do in this harbour. Cinemas, shops and loads of restaurants, cafes (even Hard Rock). Lots of fun stuff on the water during our visit. Great boat trips including return to and from Sydney main harbour. Kid friendly areas with play zones. AArea served by the hop on hop off buses if you want to travel by road.

So much to do... not all of it at a cost. Darling Harbour has do much to do it can be quite daunting (and expensive). It has something for everyone, and they don't all come at a cost.The aquarium and imax are always great (Star Wars 7 at Imax was an experience we'll never forget), and there's heaps of food options ranging from cheap takeaway all the way through to fine dining. Shopping isn't great, quite limited and expensive, and obviously geared to the tourist market.The highlight for us (and for the kids) is Tumbalong Park. It's an awesome facility, completely free. It's got slides and swings and sand and water... things to climb and things to dig... all the required ingredients for very happy satisfied kids. At night it's lit up with coloured lights reminiscent of the vivid festival, and much less crowded than during the day. As long as you accept the kids will probably get at least a little bit wet, you'll all have a fab time.

Congested but lively. Quite disappointed because the harbour is very congested. Too many shops along the harbour making it very narrow and intimidating with the tall bldgs alongside the harbour. The walk over pyrmont bridge was nice but since the fence of the bridge was rather high, cannot enjoy the harbour while seated in the benches. Went on a weekday so not too crowded but can imagine the crowd during a warm sunny weekend.

Tooooooo much to do.!!!. We stayed close to the harbour on both our recent trips to Sydney and are still finding new things to see and do.Walk under tge road bridge by the Imax and there is another swathe of restaurants and bars and the Chinese Gardens. From there up the slope into Chiba Town and a the end of China Town is Paddys Market.Keep walkjng and keep exploring.

Cool for kids. Saw this place while on a hop on hop off tour. I wish I had located it earlier because lots of stuff close by like the Chinese gardens, the aquarium, the image theater, a shopping center and lots of little cafes. It has a really quaint look to it that would have been nice to take in during a stroll, but alas, time did not permit. A better stop for those with kids than Sydney harbour.
Much prefer vs. the Circular Quay.. Very vibrant, especially at night! A ton of people and restaurants. Prices pretty competitive since there are so many

China Town, and the Chinese Garden plus riverboat tours. Darling Harbour is just the other side of the Coathanger Sydney Bridge. easy walking ditance to China Town, the Rocks , The Opera House, the Chinese Garden, The Aquarium and ferries up the river past the Olympic Stadium

Lots going on for old and young whatever the weather. Great playground.. We arrived by ferry from Circular Quay with our two young grandchildren so that started the excitement. We walked around the harbour and made the most of the wide variety of choices in food hall! The Maritime Museum and Sealife Centre (which do have a fee) were options if it was wet but the children preferred the fairground rides and the playground. The playground is amazing, with swings, slides, climbing frames, zip wire and a large wet play area with fountains. Handy to have snack outlets in the area too. The ferry trip back gave the children and us a chance to chill out.
Beautiful at night. We stayed at a hotel near darlinf harbour and enjoyed walking around darling harbour. It offers an amazing view of the city. There are many restaurants with the view of the city.

Night visit . Cool cool night. Some performance were going on at different venues. Crowds are invited to join in and be interactive. There are many food outlets at reasonable prices. Had coffee and watched the people strolling by. There's also a dance club and the queue was long.

everything there. you can eat Kangaroo and crocodile at one of the many restaurants - the zoo and aquarium and maritime museum are here... full of people and the largest Imax theater in the world - we saw Batman vs. Superman there -- the screen is huge -- almost too big. There are street performers and this is the place to buy any tours you want to see....
Delightful area. This is a delightful area to walk around. Plenty of restaurants for all tastes, maritime museum and welcome wall are worth a visit.
A great way to spend a sunny day while in Sydney. A beautiful area to walk around, stop at one of the restaurants close to the water for a glass of wine or a leisurely lunch and enjoy the scenery.

So many lovely things to see, do, an eat!! . What a great day at darling harbour.. We came by ferry.. Mainly to visit Madame Tussaud's but not realising how many other awesome things darling harbour had to offer.. Restaurants, aquarium, iMax theatre, maritime museum, was so good to walk all around an see everything right along the waters edge, we had lunch at Hard Rock Cafe which was a little pricy, hadn't realised there was a big food hall an cafes in nearby huge shopping centre
DARLING it is.. Darling Harbour around the corner from Sydney Harbour can be walked. It has excellent shopping till you drop oppertunity and an excellent spot for refreshments from various Eateries.
Gorgeous!. Crowded as usual but it was a stunning view with the amazing sea breeze.Enjoyed the ferry ride as well

Good location central to a lot of great entertainment.. Lots to do and see beautiful scenery. Will be better when some of the constructions are complete. Visited the IMAX and floating restaurant. They had a display of funny international signs that gave us quite a few giggles.

Beautiful place to date. My husband and I have experience of dating here before, so we recently dropped by here again. Beautiful harbour (but not really clean water) with nice cafes around. But better to go near winter, otherwise you'll feel too hot and it is not easy to find the shadow.
Beautiful. We stayed near darling harbour over the long Easter weekend. We were surprised at the number of things to do there, and all the great restaurants that were open even on public holidays.
Tired!. Lots of nice food and shops that are overpriced. Good to visit but visited once and you find the area a little tired and in need of a face lift
Vibrant area indeed. We enjoyed the vibrancy of the area - restaurants, Maritime Museum, animal zoo, ferries, boardwalk, people, Saturday fireworks all add to a very busy and vibrant area

Great place to bring visiting friends. This is another all day outing, all in one place. Wear your joggers as it is a place for walking. Also a hat, water bottle and sunnies and sunscreen. Those council water bubblers to refill your bottle are superb. You will be thankful when you see pink shoulders around you by lunch time. The light rail from Central Station is very slow but the ferry from Circular Quay works well. It is faster to walk. Fromthe south end to the north there is lots of variety. the zoo, aquarium, places to eat, maritime museum with submarine and sailing ship, plenty of fascinating places, and the Chinese Garden for kids to run around and explore. If you bring or get a picnic lunch take it up to the north end onto the Barangaroo headland for the views and harbour traffic (barangaroo.com). The landscape design with stone boulders is brilliant. So good for New Year's Eve! The trees are not big enough yet for good shade so umbrellas are the go. After dark on Saturdays there is a fireworks show - see the darling harbour web site for times. There is a helpful darling harbour web site too. How much fun can you have? Not enough!

Great Day Out. There is something here for everyone. Great places to eat and lots of great shopping. Kids can play in the water themed area with fountains and water toys as well as a great big playground. There are carnival rides, a lovely Chinese Garden and the Maritime Museum. Kids went to the Pirates attraction where we could go on ships and inside a submarine which was great fun. Lots of open grass to run and rest. We often spend time here on weekends and kids always love it. Easy to get to by ferry. Should defiantly visit.
It is OK. Big area of Bars, restaurants and things to do, but there are many of these in all cities, the rocks area is better

Nice, New and Expanding. The urban area around Darling Harbor is exploding with new retail and condo apartments. Prices are high as us all of Sydney CBD but there is abundant choices of things to do. Best is the scenery and people watching! Be sure to have your camera here.

The busiest harbor in Sydney. The ride to Darling by ferry is nice in that you can take great pictures on the bridge and opera. Once arriving, be prepared for the crowds. The aquarium and IMaxx theater are there which can bring the crowds.

Gorgeous Harbour. Perfect for couples, families and just about everyone, the harbour is filled with activities, food, bars and sightseeing for a full day. There's a huge kids playground near the IMAX cinemas, water fountains, quiet parks and strips, plenty of waterside restaurants and bars, a shopping complex, Casino, aquarium, museums, the list goes on...On weekends and some evenings, there are various activities on display like street performers, light shows and if you're lucky fireworks.If you're on a budget, there is a food court on the ground floor of the shopping complex, or you can always walk to Chinatown nearby (around 5-10 min walk), as the food by the harbour can be pricey.Easily reachable by foot, car, monorail and public transport. Excellent location to spend a full day.

Nice place to visit . Spent time in Darling Harbour during a recent trip to Sydney on a few occasions both during the day and on an evening. Beautiful scenery and lovely fireworks on a Saturday evening whilst having dinner. Lots of nice places to eat, drink and relax.

Good place to visit. Darling Harbour is a very lively atmospheric place, full of restaurants, cafes and bars. We had 3 very good meals and met a long-lost second cousin. It is certainly worth a visit.
Colourful and buzzing!. Some great bars and restaurants. So much happening. A great place to relax, enjoy the lights and sip a cocktail. Some great shops- divine lemon meringue gelato :)

Activity or just relaxing. You could spend the whole day here just observing, shopping, eating or taking in the sights. Lots to do and the variety of eating place incredible. Maritime Museum very interesting.

Great place to hang out. Madame Tussaud is here along with sealife aquarium and a wildlife park. Nice place for a stroll with loads of restaurants which turns extremely expensive during weekend dinners but good for cheap lunch deals. Every Saturday night they have fireworks ( which we were lucky to see). They also have an IMAX in this area. Most of the bars have happy hours along with great views of course. The bridge is also nice for a stroll.
Exciting Place. Spent a whole day here. Enjoyed the hustle bustle of the harbor and the peace of the park. Lots of food choices. Good place to sit and rest.

Chill out ! Don't miss !!!. It is the place I like most while I had visited Sydney. I recommend to visit there in the evening. You will love it like me. In Harbourside there is food court in the ground floor if you want to eat cheap.

Full of restaurants, nice sea-side walk, a must go for visitors. One of the must-go locations in Sydney, believed to be the most popular dining location in town. Surrounded by commercial buildings while offering a sense of leisure, the bridge linking the two sides of the harbour is a nice walk with bikers and visitors. A good place to spend half and hour or so just to get a feel of it.

Huge selection of restaurants. We took a stroll around the area and we were impressed with the choice of restaurants and eateries. The harbour is pretty and clean with wide board walks and we enjoyed walking over the bridge as well.

Great to visit, once or twice.. I loved Darling harbour the first couple of times and for the over 50's it's nice to walk around and dine for breakfast or lunch. However if you are in this age bracket, don't waste your time at night as it turns into night club city. Long lines of people to get into anywhere for a drink and if you did the music is very loud. You have to go down Harris St to the old pub to get a quiet drink !
Awesome busy area. Darling Harbour is beautiful and bustling with tourists. Lots of restaurants, bars and shops. We saw lots of amazing Street musicians performing around darling Harbour.
Great place to visit. Lots to see at Darling Harbour--restaurants, aquarium, wild animal park, great views, shopping, coffee, craft beer, etc
BAE-UTIFUL. FIREWORKS AT DARLING HARBOUR ON CHRISTMAS EVE. WHATTA SIGHT!!!! i wasnt able to be there in the daytime but i would still recommend this place
Nice for tourists. Darling harbour was great for seeing and exploring th tourist attractions like sea life centre etc and ships, restaurants.
A little Expensive. Really nice place to go and have a look at but considering what is around the area, the food and drinks were a little expensive but I suppose you pay for the service and scenery.

Fascinating part of Sydney. Darling Harbour is a precinct of Sydney built on what used to be an old part of the Port of Sydney, and a railway marshalling yard. Largely thanks to the vision of one time Premier, Neville Wran. It contains shops, restaurants, cafes, night clubs, convention centre, Chinese Gardens, IMAX Theatre, hotels, aquarium, zoo, Maritime Museum, children's playground, ferry terminal and cruises, etc!
Great spot.. Worth a visit. Big selection of restaurants and cafes and the harbour itself is really lovely. Walking around to Pyrmont is beautiful. Enjoy!

Eating and drinking with a harbour view.. Darling Harbour is a very nice harbour covered with plenty of restaurants and cafes.
You can also go there with ferry and pass a wonderful evening or night.

Shopping by the sea. I really love darling harbour from the shopping to the eateries to the restaurants you'll find it all here,stop for a coffee and watch the water and the boats and just relax or shop till you drop you must go here

Not so good in the pouring rain!. We went by ferry from Meadowbank - best form of travel! Drawback: the ferry goes to the side of Darling Harbour with Restaurants - it started to pour and we had wanted the shops but we never reached the other side as my cousin has a bad back and it was too far for her to walk so we entertained ourselves people watching!!! What happened to the little transporter train?As others have said there is a lot in Darling Harbour but disabled or elderly are not catered for.

Attractions all year round. Every time we visit Sydney we make sure we pop down to Darling Harbour. There are many restaurants that will appeal to all. It's a great tourist destination and a MUST to visit when in Sydney.

Always pretty and never boring. Always something to do down here. Shopping, food, bars, Aquarium, Museums and great views. I also love to get a Cat from here to Circular Quay or vice versa. Such great way to see the Harbour and get from one to the other

The prettiest area in Sydney. Darling Harbor is the prettiest place in Sydney and a great place to spend the day. Plenty of activity and a little something for everyone. We came across a Greek Festival in the area. Relax and have an ice cream, plenty of restaurants, shopping and entertainment.. Darling Harbor is a must when in the Sydney, daytime activities and nightlife abound.
nice on a sunny day. Lovely place to stroll round on a sunny day with good selection of bar and restuerants also pick up point for the big red bus tours
So much to do. Darling harbour has everything shopping bars restaurants attractions you name it it's there. Definitely a must do and see while in Sydney

Fun, Tourist Area of Sydney. Great place to people watch...day or night! Darling Harbour is lined with cafes, restaurants, bars and shops of all types. There is even a movie theatre (not sure who would go there when there is so much to see and do).

Nice sunday's walk!. I took a long walk on a sunday, this place is amazing, a very large malecon fill with family and kids taking a walk, having brunch in one of the many restaurants. The place to see or to be seen...

Sunset Dinner. So many wonderful Restaurants and Bars to visit and enjoy. The Helm Bar has a great happy hour from 6pm to 7pm. Very affordable drinks and food with incredible views of the Harbour from the Restaurant and Deck upstairs.

Lots to see. We happened to be in Darling Harbour becaus we wanted to go to the Harbourside Shopping Centre. There is a lot to see in Darling Harbour, The small Wildlife Sydney Zoo, Sealife Aquarium,Madame Tussauds, Maritime Musuem....lots more too. We may have to go back to see everything

Cute Place to Eat, Drink and People Watch. My husband and I walked around Darling Harbour. There are several restaurants, including a food court. There is a carousel for people to ride. We could see the Harbour from our hotel room. It's very pretty at night with all the lights. They even shoot fireworks off at night. At least they did for two nights while we were there.

A small slice of a big pie. Darling Harbour is one of the many areas within Sydney Harbour that is just as fabulous as the rest. You can catch Harbour cruises here, ferries to the beaches, and a great bite to eat at one of the many restaurants along the boardwalk. It's a nice place to explore or just sit and people watch. A definite must see when in the area.

What rudeness. Another traveller having difficulty in getting tickets for the Darling ferry to the circular quay received virtually no help for the chap in the ferry box who seemed to be more interested in anything but travellers. When we asked for help he was also extremely rude so much so that I actually told him that he was not a good ambassador for Australia (nor the ferry company for whom he worked). Pity he didn't have a name badge on!!!!
Wooden boat festival. Was great. Well organised and very enjoyable. We enjoyed seeing the various boats and going on board The New Endeavour moored at the Maritime Museum

4 day Stop Over.. 2 minutes walk from our Hotel, we went down Thursday Lunch, Friday Dinner & Saturday night.Fantastic atmosphere especially Friday night when all the workers finish in the nearby offices.But the night of all was Saturday night when at 9pm they started the 5 minute Firework display.They told us the Fireworks display was to celebrate the month of LOVE, from Valentines to 14th March.We have been told it's every Saturday night because of the success, but I have not seen confirmation of this.A place in Sydney I would recommend as the choice of eating and drinking is hard to beat.
Unbelievable variety of eateries at reasonable prices.. Check the daily special boards and choose a spot outside, but remember to be aware of the birds because they will steal your food!
Absolutely loved it - amazing.. Everything about the harbour was beautiful, food, views, people, and attractions. I can't wait to go back again!

Lots of family friendly activities. Although this is certainly qualifies as a tourist hub, it's great for families with kids. The ferries run there from Circular Quay, as do buses, and the light rail stops nearby across the. Ridge. It's accessible and there are many kid friendly activities clustered here including the Aquarium, the Wildlife Park, and the wax museum. The nearby bridge is a lovely walk, and there are are eateries and shops all around. It isn't authentic old world Sydney, but it offers entertainment and experiences unique to the city, and the proximity of multiple attractions make it a great place for a families. You can also book a nHarbor cruise from here. Multiple activity passes are available which reduces the cost.

Nice place to visit. We went early in the morning and not much happening except for the vast new building work being done. It got better later in the day, and the evening is full of life and people. Worth going there. Light rail from Central Station is great.

We had 2nd breakfast at Darling Harbor. We took the HOHO bus to Darling Harbor and had 2nd breakfast there. This is because of still being on US time we had 1st breakfast REALLY early. It was great to sit outside, watch the school groups going into the IMAX and the early morning tourist.
Lots of lovely bars and places to eat. Good fun to take a ferry to central key . See the bridge and the opra house from the water grat view.

Always spectacular. Love visiting Darling Harbour and trying the many wonderful restaurants and bars. We're working our way through them. There's always a great vibe and when I see the tourists getting excited it makes me proud to live in Sydney. Yummy lunch at Nick's Seafood, then a lovely stroll across the bridge to Messinas at Star city, to placate my daughter's ice-cream craving; completed a lovely sunny and sparkly day on the harbour.

Great place for a stroll and good restaurants. Loved Darling Harbour as it is always busy but not too much so that you can enjoy the atmosphere of a harbourside walk without feeling crowded. Just strolling around here was a joy in lovely warm weather and we had evening meals outside which were all great food and value.We were lucky to be staying in a hotel within 10 minutes walking distance so this made for an ideal location for an evening meal and a stroll back after.
Typical tourist concrete hub. Lots of souvenir shops, average eateries.Boring and predictable. Not exactly Hong Kong or Bangkok or Singapore.

Family fun at Darling Harbour. One of the newer attractions, Darling Harbour has a nice collection of restaurants and museums. Children have plenty to do here and can run off some of the excess energy. Take your time and just wander.

Great way to see the city. Lots of things to see and do. Lots of shops and restaurants. Movies ie. IMAX Theatre etc. On a lovely day, even better. but even on those cold days, you'll find something to-do. Lots of hotels, around if you're looking to stay a few days.

A lovely place to visit. Our hotel was just 500 metres from Darling Harbour and what a place to walk through to get to the city and our activity. A bit of construction as we walked through the Chinese Garden , but always something happening on the water or around the edge.
Darling Harbour daily look. We found Darling Harbour a great hub for transport we were able to catch many forms of transport to where ever we needed togol
Always a favourite!. Every time we come easy we head to Darling Harbour! There's a lot of growth and development but it's still looking amazing. Head down, you'll love it!
Lots to see.. Lots to do and see, plenty of eateries, places to go.All the ferries leave from here and lots of things for the kids, big and little to see. Great play ground for the little ones.

Plenty of shopping and eating options.. There are so many restaurants, each with its own happy hour and lunch time special offerings. The mall has many different stores but for souvenir prices - which are cheaper than in the shops around The Rocks - Manly pedestrian shopping street is still better. The Naval museum looked interesting (although we did not have time) and its ships are an interesting addition to the harbour.

Good atmosphere to drink and chill. Darling Habour has various type of restaurants and bars. Good place to wander around at night. Take a walk, have dinner or even chill at a bar. This place also has a cinema. There is a bar I don't remember the name but they serve Shi Sha. A very good place to chill out.

Water Taxi tour. We took a tour on the Water Taxi at Darling Harbour, it cost $120 or 45mins for 2 x adults and 1 x child, the driver Marcus was very knowledgeable of the area, we were very impressed and would recommend this tour around the Darling Harbour by Water Taxi, they assist in getting great photos. Well done
So nice !. If you travel alone and you want to see lots of people, this is the place to be. Lots of restaurants, bars. It's worth the visit

Kids will love the play ground and water park. Darling Harbour is always busy. There is a huge park for kids. Take swimmers and towel for the kids to play in the water play area. Take an umbrella to give you SHADE! Take table tennis bats and balls to play on the outdoor table tennis tables.Bring your wallet for the great restaurants. Avoid the overpriced tourist shops on the Pyrmont side of the harbour. Do try to time your visit to see when the foot bridge opens to let boats sail through. On Saturday nights at 8:30 pm there is fireworks, get a seat on the steps around the water from about 8 pm to get a good seat, or better still book an outdoor table at a restaurant.

There is something for everyone. Lot of reataurant and bars. I max theater. They Sydney aquarium, fire works in Saturday night. Maritime museum in the area. Can take ferries, water taxis. Go see the wildlife zoo, wax museum. Great place to walk around. Have a gelato and sit beside the harbor people watch. Fun place and on the weekends the djs spin the music.
Busy and exciting harbor. Loaded with things to do from eateries, ferries, museums. Beautiful area to visit. Easily reached from circular quay. Very popular drawing large numbers of tourists

The Place To Stay. Stayed here for a week, it is close to reasonable eats and fine dining as well. The ferry is on the doorstep which will take you any place in Sydney plus commercial cruises as well. Only a ten minute walk into the CBD.

Lots of things to do, see, eat & drink. Darling Harbour is the place to be it seems...and why wouldn't you pay it a visit?? It boasts the world's largest IMAX screen, Madam Tussauds, Sealife Centre, Hard Rock Cafe, a shopping centre, the Chinese Garden of Friendship, Australian Maritime Museum, water taxis, sea cruises, hop on/hop off busses and more restaurants you can shake a stick at!! There is also a casino on The Star hotel just a block away...When we were there there was a free open air concert too

Lovely Place to while away a few hours. I spent a day here and loved it, full of history and next time I would like to visit the Maritime Museum. It was very hot when I was here so spent most of the time with a cold one watching the world go round!!
Buzzing. It's all going on here, walk round the harbour, shop, dine, catch a ferry, watch the free fireworks on a Saturday night really is a happening place.

Great entertainment venue.. This was the first place we walked to from our hotel, and it is impressive. Lots of restaurants and pubs and great attractions like the aquarium. Not many shops, though. You can also pick up one of several sightseeing-by-boat options.

Something for Everybody!. We took a taxi from Circular Quays to Darling Haebour as there are many restaurants there. We watched a show with water spraying and people riding water spouts on what looked like a skateboard. Not sure how to describe it but it was cool! There is an IMAX Theatre, the aquarium, many restaurants and shopping. And boats! Lots of boats!

Enchanting. We went to Darling Harbor three times and never felt bored,it's so refreshing and vibrant.there are plenty of eateries catering to all budgets, there are also couple of Indian restaurants and if booked in advance one can get table with a view, lots of people but it's not crowded, the evenings with harbor lines with skyscrapers is great sights..one should not miss.
Fantastic little area. Beautiful harbour, very busy, lots and lots to do. This place has everything. What a wonderful gem! We will be coming back to this area to stay for a few days and explore more.

Construction - but nice. We stayed in the area of the Harbour and our hotel was under constructions as was the new convention center going in in the Harbour. The bridge over the Harbour is nice and wide and well traveled. There is a casino on the other side of the Harbour from downtown and we walked through but didn't sit anywhere. I think then the convention center opens there will be more people in the area.

Such a Darling. Second time back to Sydney and this was my first time here (darling harbour). Very lovely place not very busy on land but in the water the traffic is hectic. This location is a great spot for a morning/evening walk.
well managed lots of things to do. Very busy place as many Ferries move in and out as well as a cruise ship harbor. Lots of food, shopping, and entertainment available .
A hustle and bustle harbour. Our hotel is right next to the Darling Harbour. We enjoyed walking on the bridge and spent time watching the fireworks every Saturday! A must go place on a Sat night!

Plenty to do at Darling Harbour. This waterside precinct with its array of restaurants and tourist attractions, such as Sea Life Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, the National Maritime Musuem and the Imax Theatre is well worth a visit. You can spend a day here and the kids will love it.

Lots of attractions. We took the ferry from Circular Quay... which is an attraction in itself...then roamed around this wonderfully revitalized area of Sydney. The shopping mall can be avoided (the interior is in great need of updating) but there are plenty of other shops, restaurants and museums to keep you occupied

Fireworks on Saturday night. We heard there were fireworks on Saturday night, so we bussed to the harbour to check it out. We were surprised by the number of people there! The MANY restaurants were quite full, so we didn't get to eat after the display. We'd plan ahead next time. But it was a fun adventure.

All Good. Darling Harbour is walkable from Sydney Harbour and has the same restaurant and bar lined promenade's that make Sydney a great walking experience. It seemed to be full of families and people of all ages enjoying being outside and together. You can also get to a casino on the other side of the Darling Harbor Bridge. And there is an I-Max Theater there.

Lots to do at Darling Harbour!. Darling Harbour is adjacent to downtown Sydney and offers a variety of things to do for most every visitor. You will find great dining options, sidewalk cafes on the Cockle Bay Wharf, nightclubs, wine bars and bistros. There's also the SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium, an IMAX, Madame Tussauds, shopping, harbour cruises, and a terminal for the Sydney Ferry.At the south end of Darling Harbour and and a short walk from Chinatown you'll find the Chinese Garden of Friendship ($6) with willow trees, lagoons, lotus plants, waterfalls, koi ponds, water dragon, and birds.Across the Pyrmont Bridge is the Australian National Maritime Museum and their tall ship replica of James Cook's 'HMB Endeavour' along with the tall ship 'James Craig'.Darling Harbour is a must see for any Sydney visitor!
Center of Sydney's attraction. Come here with children. You can explore many attraction from here. Walk around, seat and munch something, watch people taking selfies. Enjoy.

Still building. Went here on a cloudy but quite warm day. Walked along the harbour first thing, quiet early but much busier later especially in the evening, loads of restaurants. Lots of building work still going on
Great choice of Eateries and Bars. A great variety of restaurants and bars to choose from. Also several family friendly attractions such as Imax, Children's Playground and the Chinese Gardens.

Captain Cook Dinner and drinks cruise. We (wife and I) boarded the cruise ship and was shown to our table and served a complimentary champagne. After a beautiful trout entree we were served wine of our choice. Our main course and dessert was of high standard and the cruise provided a magnificent view of the harbour and the Sydney skyline including of course the bridge . We recommend this evening dinner drinks cruise to add to any trip to Sydney and the harbour

Favourite Sydney location. Darling Harbour has something for everyone. I've stayed here with a young family, and 15 years later with a teenage family. Great access to everything, good transport and enjoyable walks! Best of all is the atmosphere, always such a happy place.
Madume Tussards. A great place just to walk around. You can go all out and go to Madume Tassudes, Aquarium or have a great meal.

Only visit for specific attraction. This was a nice place years ago but it is now only worth going to if you have something specific to see eg Imax or Aquarium. Millions of eating places and some tacky shops in shopping centre

Sweety darling, lovey. One of the nicest most attractive places in the city; always something to see and do, people to watch, super cafes and restaurants, great transport links, or just simply walking along the waterside before hopping onto the harbour ferry. There are even one or two shops...

Uptown Restaurants and Attractions. Darling Harbour is an area of Sydney built up around the waterfront. There are many different types of restaurants all around the harbour as well as shops, offices, and attractions. It is busy during the day and way into the night.
All in One. Pretty much everythg in one place.. havent finished exploring yet though.. plenty of restaurants to choose from... center of most things in sydney i guess..
Holiday with grandchildren. First time holiday with grandchildren in Sydney they had a fantastic time and did not want to leave.

Awesome atmosphere. This is just a great place to go and hang out. We quite often hopped on a ferry to here and had dinner or drinks and soaked up the atmosphere. There is a wonderful childrens playground, lots of shops a range of eateries for all budgets. It was so easy to get to from either the light rail or from Town Hall, as well as by ferry. At the weekend they have fireworks at 9pm which is worth going to as well.
Take my breath away.... . What a great spot. Iconic, vibrant, Beautiful... You can't visit Sydney without spending at least one night here.
Busy busy busy. This area is always so busy since it is such a major attraction to the Sydney area. Like coming to visit here, just not so fond of the crowds.
More Food and Amusements anywhere in Sydney. Great place to eat, and have your kids enjoy the variety of activities. You can take a ferry to anywhere in Sydney from this harbor.
Family friendly. We took our grandson to Darling harbour and had a great time, we only had time for the Zoo but will be back next time we are in Sydney

Great place for lunch. Nice harbor next to Circular Cay... Short walk.... Great place to have a drink or lunch.... Cafes are along the harbor and many have lunch specials.... One of the stops on Capt'n Cooks harbor tour

Tourist Mecca - So much to do..... Darling Harbour is a Mecca for shopping, Restaurants, activities and being in the centre of everything.
Get along there and enjoy the food, the parks, the play grounds and walk around.
It is close to the city and to China Town so talking around is simple.

First visit to Darling Harbour. It is vibrant, endless choice of restaurants, very popular spot. I was not so overwhelmed as my friends. I struggled with the choice of food, everywhere was so busy and the restaurants had all the trappings of too many customers. A great place for younger people to hang around.
Beautiful harbour . Beautiful harbour. By day and night. Lots of restaurants for all times of the day. I had an amazing day every time I was wondering around.
An interesting place. Darling Harbour is great for a slow walk to see the sights. There are plenty of shops and eating places. We took advantage of Happy Hour to have a cheap pre-dinner drink.
A favorite place in Sydney. I love visiting Darling Harbour, there's always so many different things to do. Great restaurants, shopping and lots of people watching. Always a fun day out.

Scenic and busy. Loads of bars and boats worth a visit but the bars in the evenings not really for couples! Fine if you want loads of beers with the hens or lads!
Nice spot during the day though
great place. There is a lot to do and see here with plenty of shops and restaurants. It is the in place to go. There is sea life place to visit

The place to be on Saturday night. Free fireworks display at 9pm (enough said). There are buskers, festivals, and Harbourside Shopping Centre (plenty of halal food options). Cocklebay Wharf is renowned for it's views. The place is packed. There is a playground and gardens to stroll in.
Darling!!!. Darling Harbour is full of outdoor bars and shops. Excellent place to walk and relax during happy hour into the night.

A great way to spend a day. I love Darling Harbour. It is always a great way to spend a day. Lovely food, shopping, tourist attractions and plenty of great spots to stop for a drink and 'people watch'

It really is an amazing place. It is a victim of its own success. The crowds can get a bit much, the restaurants a little pricey - but that's what happens when everyone wants to be in the same place at the same time. Great in the day or night (especially weekend nights). If you are not a Sydney regular - do check the place out (along with The Rocks).

One of our favourite places. Darling Harbour is magical. Shops, the Maritime Museum and ferries to Circular Quay. There are dining facilities of every genre,. It is after dark that the area really comes alive. It is a joy to sit on the verandah of one of the restaurants watching the world go by. Oh to be here on New Year's Eve!

Fun, Fun, Fun!!!!. Darning Harbour is a relatively new entertainment and retail development (more accurately, a redevelopment) area in Sydney. It is close to the CBD, and is an easy walk from many hotels. Darling Harbour is a lot of fun to visit. Although really crowded, everyone seemed to be having a good time and were relaxed! The area offers a wide array of shopping and dining options. There are also arcades and a large cinema multiplex. Without question, everyone can find something to do and enjoy at Darling Harbour!! (We didn't have time to do it, but the Australian National Maritime Museum is located here. It looked very impressive, and I will certainly visit on my next trip to Sydney.)The only current downside to Darling Harbour is that the area is still a "work in progress." There is a lot of construction going on in the area, and that causes some minor inconveniences. Not really a big deal, however. The area will be extremely impressive after all the building is completed.A visit to Darling Harbour is highly recommended.

A very pleasent Experience.. A wonderful atmosphere surrounds Darling Harbour & it is well worth a visit. There are extensive construction works in progress at the moment but this does not take awy the beuaty of the area. Not to be missed. There are plenty of restaurants, bars etc. We experienced live free music on the harbour on one of our visites. All in all a very pleasent Experience.

Bustling, touristy, close to city centre.. Darling Harbour has a wide selection of dining, hotel and entertainment options. A trip to the IMAX Cinema at Cockle Bay is a personal favourite, with the world's largest screen, showing popular Hollywood blockbusters and global documentaries. Shopper's paradise, you won't be bored!
many eateries . lots of lights! all eateries are busy busy busy . there is an imax there as well. saw people dress up in costume to enter a club.

Just one great area to spend a day.. There is something for everybody in your family at Darling Harbour. Plenty of accommodation close buy, restaurants and activities for the kids. Right on the harbour with views to die for! Why not spend a day or two at Darling Harbour Sydney.

Plenty to do. I visited Darling Harbour again a couple of days ago, this time with my 3yo son. There is currently construction happening around the place, but it doesn't impact upon your visit too much. As always, DH is a beautiful spot with lots of restaurants, shopping, sights and attractions. Whilst there we visited the aquarium, zoo and Hard Rock Cafe. My son loved seeing all the boats and ferries and the cranes building the skyscrapers.Plenty of toilets available and lots of places to sit and rest little legs.

Lots of great places to eat and a nice place for a casual stroll. A must for all visits to Sydney - Plenty of places to eat for all budgets and a really nice place just to wander around and enjoy the day.

This place never stops. Went twice recently and I have to say that there was so much to see and do that it was a bit of a sensory overload. Street performers and musicians, lots of restaurants, the harbour and lights, boats,ferries and tourist attractions like the aquarium make this a must see. We have the viaduct in Auckland but it's a pale comparison. Go in the evening when you can sit at a harbourside restaurant and do some people watching.

Lots to see and do, and a beautiful nighttime place to visit. Stayed at the Novotel in Darling Harbour and spent time wondering around the harbour here. A bit hot during the day (not a lot of shade), but at night the place comes to life. The lights and atmosphere become electric. There are dozens of place to eat and shop, and it also has the world's largest IMAX theatre! The Maritime Museum is also located here as well. You can take a city water ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour for a visit and take the ferry to go back. Or you could even walk back through the city to see some additional great shopping locations and older historic buildings.

typically touristy. great little place for eating and watching the world go by have an aquarium and a little wildlife park and madam tausauds plenty to do food is typically touristy priced but not as expensive as circular quay

Family visit. There were 8 of us on this trip, ranging from 14 to 74! Lots to do and see for all ages, street entertainers, views, boats. Lots of different places to eat, quite expensive but then you are in the harbour with the views!It's a great place to people watch while we had our fish and chips on a seat in the harbour

Vibrant and "buzzy" atmosphere.. Great location for cafes and restaurants.Harbour development is breathtakin, with some awesome skyscrapers being built. Eating is not cheap but the food is good so we really can't complain.

Great selection of places to eat drink, and lovely views.. This is a bustling Harbour, with Sydney ferry links to Circular quay. Take the ferry round and see all in 25 minutes. Many choices from Breakfast, lunch or evening dinner with friends. It gets busier and much development now with the re-building of the Sydney Exhibition centre, and hotels. Very busy weekends, best enjoyed weekdays and breakfast or lunch. Stunning virws, sparkles in the sunshine, but getting overcrowded and over developed.
Lovely area with really good eateries. Stayed in this area for three days and loved it. There is plenty to see and the shops are good. Shame about the rain.

Great kids playground. There is a very busy but great kids playground. With activities targeted at a range of children's ages. Our 2 year old loved it.
Although the toilets nearby weren't very clean. So keep that in mind when travelling with children

Love this place! . I fell in love with this Harbour. First of all it is beautiful. There are various beautiful restaurants around the edge...steak, seafood, Chinese plus many more. We ate in I'm Angus...gorgeous steak and very yummy cocktails. If you are on a tight budget probably not the best place to eat. Some places are a bit pricey. Every Saturday there are free fireworks, it does get busy so book a table. Oh and the Lindt Cafe is worth a trip...try a milkshake...amazing!

Lots to do. Quite a touristy spot, lots of restaurants, children's activities In abundance, great for families. Lots of restaurants overlooking the water and really reasonably priced for such a busy tourist spot. A walk over the Pyrmont bridge is really nice too.

Fabulous views both day and night. We were staying at the Novotel hotel right on the side of the bay, joined to the shopping precinct of over 100 stores, by a bridge. Shops are varied and interesting, with several 'Australian' stores.There is a brilliant food court, with loads of choices from kebabs, grills, indian, chinese thai, etc, plus several chocolate and deserts outlets.Open the door to the outside and you are standing on the quayside, which is ringed all around by restaurants and bars. Sydney ferries stop next to the Maritime museum at Pyremont bay, right by the pyremont bridge that goes over to the other side, where all the other ferries stop, including the famous Manly ferry (see review) Paddy's market at the end of the bay should not be missed - it's huge and cheap.Chinatown, the children's water park, Chinese friendship garden, seawaoirld, wild life zoo, madame tousauds, and many more are all here on this bay. Use the manly ferry to nsee all other waterfronts and beaches in Sydney harbour.

Lots of construction, former glory. I can tell that Darling Harbour used to be beautiful back in 1988 all the way up to 2000 Olympics.Since then I feel that it has lost much of its finesse and is in need of a big facelift.Also, it feels more claustrophobic due to the higher number of cluttered builds beside the small harbour.

Nice place to take a stroll. We visited Darling Harbor, while in Sydney for a few days. I enjoyed sitting near the water and people watching. We visited the Aquarium and Wildlife Center. At the Wildlife Center we were able to be inside the kangaroo enclosure. There was a playground for children. There were several places to eat.

Currently a building site. Once more used this as a meeting point and the place is blessed with good eating places but we were upset to see our favourite water feature had been replaced by a big building site and it ruined the whole ambiance for sure.... I reckon this will continue for at least 12 more months.... That said we still made the best of it

Too much change, far too commercial. A massive amount of building in the three years since I last visited means this once lovely harbour is now just another money pit. Yes there are some good restaurants but unless you book way in advance you may only get an early dinner slot (4.30 - 6pm)

Totally over developed. Not been here for many years. Now just a lot of apartment buildings with a few restaurants underneath. Madam Tussards, shopping centre ect. Very, very overdeveloped. Could be anywhere.

Best part of city centre. I first visited Sydney years ago and somehow entirely missed this area. Don't make my mistake. Be sure to put aside at least an afternoon for a visit.It's a lovely waterfront dock with restaurants and bars. I visit the maritime museum which has a variety of real ships (and a submarine) in the dock you can explore. Put aside at least 2 hours for this.

Great venue. Darling Harbour is well worth a visit at night time. The views of the city and the harbour are spectacular. There are so many dining options available. The harbour is easily accessible either by ferry or train.
Fun day. Festive clean people watching. A lot of walking involved. Watched the boats coming in and out. Git there on hop on hop off.

Impossible to find in a car. Good central location for walking into Sydney. Lots of attractions and good selection of hotels. Harbour side shopping mall nothing spectacular. Staff seemed very ill informed about where anything was. Signs to the harbour were so erratic and poorly placed that it was more by accident than design that our driver was able to enter the area.

Beautiful Harbour with a great deal to do and dine. First time at Darling Harbour I found it was a beautiful setting with many restaurants. Some a little more pretentious than others. I was very surprised that many restaurants required a reservation even though they were 90% empty. We had a large group of professional 30-somethings and were turned away from one restaurant because we did not have reservation. Overall there was many places to choose from to eat while enjoying the people walking by and the birds. Definitely a great place to relax and enjoy the fantastic eats and drinks the area has to offer.
Harbor is nice, but too touristy!. The title is probably an obvious statement, but I was underwhelmed by Darling Harbour. Just seemed like an overflow place for Circular Quay area.
Fun, lots of walking. We took the ferry over and went to the aquarium and shopping. Lots of restaurants. We ate at the Italian restaurant above the Ferris Wheel. It had great pizza.
Holiday. Beautiful place . Lots of places to eat and shop . Great walking around . Scenery is awesome a must see if visiting sydney

It has lost its charm a bit.. I visited Darling Harbour a few years back, and I feel it has lost its charm a bit. Maybe because of the new flyover over it.Having said that, it's still a very happening place and has something for each type of traveller.
Pretty good place to hangout. Darling Harbour is really nice place to hang around. But we went to IMAX theatre nearby & Madam Tussauds at the Darling Harbour.

Great area with something for everyone.. We went here to be collected for a day out on a boat and we also visited on another day on the evening. Beautiful area filled with so many bars and restaurants. Truly something for everyone; Groups, families, couples in basically all cuisines. Lovely views and pleasant walks all the way around. Would recommend to all.

Great Place if a little cluttered nowdays. WE approached Darling Harbour by Ferry as it is a great ride out from Circular Quay. This trip involved a number of stops each taking us closer until we docked on the Southern side and alter swung across to the Northern (Western) Side making access quite easy. There have been a lot of changes to Darling Harbour and more are on the way, it is a beautiful little spot tucked back in the ever increasing ring of super hi-rise buildings that clamour for a view. Nevertheless, the setting is great, the food outlets provide a huge range of options it would literally take years to eat your way through every single one, and the food quality and choice is second to none. A definite for the traveller or the day to day office worker looking for a breakfast or an evening meal - all right there ready to go and all very high quality. And there a re adjacent facilities to stay while ,or just have a beer and look out onto the harbour, so much going on.
Beautiful location. Beautiful location, stunning views, great bars and restaurants even when it is raining. All bars in walking distance from each other and a good shopping nall

Just Chill..!!. Yes, a wonderful place to chill out the whole day. Lots of places to eat, drink and have fun. Nice and newly developed water play area for kids is just awesome. Something kids can do for hours in nice warm weather. Availability of free drinking water is a question. Lots of café, pubs,restaurants and cinema as well. Most of the city attractions like sealife, madam tussads, wildlife, etc. are here..Just awesome and happening place to be.
A Great Place to Visit. A great place to visit. Surrounded by innumerable restuarants and bars and often you will be fortunate enough to see fireworks.

Great place to chill in the sun or visit attractions. Darling Harbour is a relaxing area surrounded by bars and restaurants, the sea life centre and maritime museum. Lots of building work going on for a new casino and hotel complex, conference centre etc but it's a loverly place for a stroll and leads you into the Chinese Gardens at the end.Afterwards I got the ferry to circular quay which opened up the Harbour fantastically, what a great view from the water of Darling Harbour, the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.... Cross crossing the Harbour to Luna Park on the way

Always a great visit. Whatever season, whatever time of the day darling harbour is perfect for walking through and checking out the sites. You dont have to go to any of the attractions,restaurants or spend money at any of the shops to soak up the atmosphere at Darling Harbour. The difficult choice is whether to walk along the restaurant side, or harbour shopping...or, if your feet are up to it, do both, and walk over the pedestrian bridge also!

Center of all tourist attractions. Darling Harbor has everything you need if you want a tourist day. You do not have to walk far at all to get to everything from the aquarium, to the IMAX, other major attractions, and many good restaurants. The information center is there as well as the Chinese Friendship Gardens. There is a great shopping center on the Harborside side of the harbor next to the Hard Rock Cafe. There is a playground for the kids and bars galore.
Fun in Darling Harbour. So much to do and see in Darling Harbour especially for children with the Sydney Aquarium well worth a visit.

Tourist trap.... So many other more authentic parts of Sydney deserve your time and attention before you venture to Darling harbor. This said family with kids will enjoy it because it is safe, easy and comfortable with almost all the major restaurant chains you are familiar with, a nice aquarium and war ships opened to visitors. You will also find the largest iMax theater in the world for rainy days...

Vibrant up and coming area, lots to do!. Darling Harbour is fantastic! Bars and restaurants all along the Harbour, there's an iMax, Sealife Centre, Madame Tussauds and a shopping centre to wonder round if the weather isn't that great. You can catch all different types of ferry trips from there as well which is great! A lovely place to just relax in the sun, grab a drink and a bite to eat and watch the ferries coming in and out. Just a quick note to say that there is a lot of building work going on there to rejuvenate the area but this won't affect your experience. I can't wait to see the finished article as I love it now...

busy waterfront setting good for eating and viewing historic ships with museum also. Walked around the harbor to see the submarine, the warship and historic craft on the waterfront. took a trip up the lighthouse ($1) where there are perfect photo viewpoints of the harbor.The monorail has been taken away so its a walk across the bridge from the city center. The shopping mall has plenty of shops and fast food outlets and there is a Maritime museum which I visited previously and well worth seeing You could spend three hours or so walking around.
Good views. Plenty to see and do- mainly eat. Plenty of good restaurants which are full of good food and atmosphere. A good place to stop for a bite.

WOW! what a great place to soak up some time.. We were first time travelers to Sydney and stayed near Darling Harbour. Our first walk around the harbour was one filled with the atmosphere of Dragon Boat races and the carnival atmosphere was sensational. We walked around the harbour and took in the many views and side walk eateries. A clean and well kept place and a delight to visit

Needs......something . Although I enjoyed the Japanese Gardens and the water views, I feel like Darling Harbour relates to the casino these days and needs a shore line uplift. It's boring really. Sorry to say but even though there's restaurants and shops, it's need of some energy boosting and fun. Not high on the list of what to do for me. Not cheap either.

Surprisingly good shops and food options plus museums. Having had disappointing experiences with harborside shopping malls (e.g., Baltimore), I was expecting nothing special, but Darling surprised me with an array of interesting shops and a central food court with quite the array of different foods. This is a great option for families because of the diversity, the cleanliness, and the relatively low meal cost. The shops and food court are located along the innermost part of the harbor and between the Powerhouse Museum and the Maritime Museum.The park complex extends seamlessly underneath the expressway to a very interesting park with water features and places for kids to romp. And the park is lined with an assortment of appealing cafes and fast food shops.

Lots to see and do. Darling Harbour has everything you could need to enjoy Sydney. Immaculately clean and continuing to develop. Lots of bars and restaurants (including Hard Rock) to suit most budgets. If you time it right, you can tour each bar and get happy our to stretch to three hours.

Such an inviting location!. When i first arrived, i was amazed by the atmosphere. It was crowded, however very harmonic. A harbour with a lot of entertainments! I thought the big firework was for welcoming me :) joking. I spent a few hours there without getting bored! In my mind played the song: " Oh darlin, darlinWhat have I done?Well I've been away from you too longAnd all my days have turned to darknessAnd I believe my heart has turned to stone...
Let go back to Darling Harbour. Its time to go back to Darling Harbour for a visit, there's so much to see here in Sydney And I just love it here...

GREAT PLACE TO BE IN AT NIGHT!. We went to Darling Harbour at night and really walked around the place, saw the street happenings and the liveliness all around us. It is a good place to hang out at night and perhaps eat and drink something in one of the many restaurants it has to offer.

Great Eats. Nice location, great eats. Beware of the construction happening around Sydney. This has disrupting a number of areas in Sydney. The construction has reduced the walking areas, and it can feel congested. However, the restaurants are world class. They are also building a NZ "Cloud" like structure, which was shown off in Auckland during the 2011 Rugby World Cup. There's a maritime musuem closeby and access to activiites around as well. A small mall with lots of great shopping.

Excellent . Darling harbour has loads of atmosphere and plenty to do. The aquarium wildlife zoo maritime museum
Lots of eating places with special offers and 'happy hour' ideal place to visit

Sight seeing. It is crowded. Esp during evenings.
Nice ambience if you like to dine here.
I came her to eat and wine.

Nice to walk around, will be better once all the works completed.. Relaxing walk in evening. Lots of people out and about. Dancing on the boardwalk near restaurants South side, was a nice touch. We happened upon a Thai Festival and watched the singing and dancing and all sorts of things cultural. Lots of restaurants to choose from. A childrens water playground was delightful. Some good buskers entertaining us. Even just sitting on the waters edge and enjoying the water sights, sun going down and people activity.
Great area. A great area to visit - shopping and many good restaurants and cinema. Fireworks on a Saturday night.

A work in progress. Even though I'm a local and live 500 metres from here, I always enjoy my visit. Even though, a lot of it is currently a building site, it's highly enjoyable to stroll through and see the new bits taking shape, eat in one of the good restaurants like Eat Pizza Love, gaze at the water and generally people watch. I also enjoy the shopping, there ARE bargains to be had there, especially on the second floor of Harbourside Central at some of the boutiques.

Fireworks on Saturday Night . Nice place to have food or to party. They are open till late and there's fireworks on Saturday night at 9.00 to 9.30pm weekly. So if you're in the area on that day, you should add that in your schedule. Enjoy it!

If you value convenience over substance. Other Sydneysiders will have their own opinion of Darling Harbour. I just offer this review in case overseas visitors who are planning their visit to Sydney keep seeing Darling Harbour mentioned but don't know why.It's an ex industrial area very close to the centre of the city that was re-developed in the 1980s. Development included a massive ugly casino, plenty of charmless hotels and apartment buildings and large freeway flyovers. Because the northern part of the CBD (downtown) has relatively few hotels, Darling Harbour can house a large number of tourists very close to the centre of the city. It has attracted the sorts of businesses that serve concentrations of tourists - bad restaurants, shiny malls selling T-shirts and Ugg boots and tourist 'attractions' like a museum of wax figures of people you can take a selfie with.Pros: If you are only able to stay a few days in Sydney, and you get a good deal on accommodation, Darling Harbour is a relatively convenient location to some of the real attractions you will want to visit. If it's a family holiday and you actually want/need to squeeze in koala patting, lizard spotting and wax 'celebrity' viewing all in a couple of hours, Darling Harbour may be an okay location to base yourself.Cons: It has acres of concrete, bare pavers and baseball cap wearing tourists licking icecreams. At the moment there are several big construction projects happening creating some noise.If you're a grown-up and have plenty of money you will prefer to stay at the north end of the downtown area. If you're a grown up and want to stay somewhere more 'real', you will prefer the area around Central Railway station/Chinatown. You can still walk to Darling Harbour from either area.
far too inpersonal. we prefer the circular quays to darling harbour, because the harbour is just a collection of new buildings mostly serving similar goods

Evening walk. This is a very lively place full of coffee shops and night clubs. We went for a walk there and a few drinks in the evening time. It was very interesting, wonderfull city lights. We had some white wine which was very good. Although many of the coffee shops close at midnight.

Best for shopping and eating. Not sure if i would make it a destination place but was nearby at the Maritime Museum and had another walk through. Close to the CBD, easy to get to, probably best by ferry from Circular Quay; probably best for shopping and eating; lots of cafes and restaurants.
Dining and clubs. Lots of choices of eateries with variety of cuisines and price ranges. Nice views of the water and inner city.
Cool Day trip Stop. Pretty views and great restaurants over looking the harbour and the boats. It would be good stop for lunch with drinks or happy hour into dinnertime.

Lots to do and see. We stayed in Pyrmont, within walking distance to Darking Harbour and enjoyed the Saturday night fireworks, the IMAX, the nearby maritime center and the restaurants. Great location for jumping on the ferry to see the rest of Sydney

Re vamp!. This is a interesting place, with lots of bars and restaurants, a very social place. Would love to re visit once all the building work is complete, it's a bit of a shambles at the present time, apart from the waterfront.
Lots to do. Stayed just off Darling Harbour and there was always something going on - very easy to get buses,ferries etc. Great location and good for restaurants/bars etc.

A beautiful part of town. Here you will find restaurants and bars, the IMAX, links on the monorail, attractions like the sealife and wildlife centres, and the water just makes it all seem extra lovely. Sure it's a tourist trap - but it's lovely all the same. Try the King St Brewhouse if you like beer - it's excellent.

Lots to do and see. Took the ferry over to Darling Harbour, great harbour walk and restaurants. The Star Casino is in this area as well, so if you are a gambler go on over. Hard Rock Cafe and numerous malls, restaurants to see and visit.

Check This Out!. This energetic area of Sydney offers a great variety of Lodgings, Restaurants, Shops, Casino, Tourist Attractions....and lovely harbor views! Should be worth an hour or two of your time for a visit.......minimum! Even just strolling along the harbor-side is
very rewarding!

Darling harbot. A beautiful scenic place to walk around with lots of restaurants. There are playgrounds, and museums to visit for kids. There was a Ferris wheel & a nice board walk to walk around. It is best to see at night. They have sea life with thousands of animals . Also, madam Tussauds.

Great Harbour Vibe, Lots of Open-air entertainment. Ideal for tourists. Great area to walk around, a myriad of restaurants offer up a plethora of food from varied cuisines.
Although a little on the pricey side - well positioned in Sydney for tourists who want to spent the best part of the day strolling around.

one of the downtown hubs. Great place for people watching. There are quite a few restaurants in this area, most of them a bit touristy and overpriced. You can definitely do better for restaurants, but this is a fun place to wander around. This is also one of the spots to catch the harbour ferries to tour the area.

Beautiful Darling Harbour, Australia. great place to walk around to places to eat or drink. Ferries are located here. A must if you want to see it from the water. Highly recommend the hop on hop off ticket.

Most beautiful harbour in the world. We love spending the day on the harbour. Fantastic restaurants and places to grab a coffee. Catch the ferry to Many, we did and it was just beautiful on the harbour

Darling Harbour. Stayed in apartments near the Harbour. Many places to visit such as the Aquarium, the Maritime museum and the imax theatre.
Many, many cafes and restaurants to choose from for breakfast, lunch or tea.
Lovely Harbour. Stayed 5 mins away. Lovely place to visit. Lots of bars/restaurants to visit, go on an evening when its all lit up. Beautiful.

Wish We Had More Time Here. My girlfriend and I were fortunate enough to spend Australia Day in Sydney and the fireworks were going to be set off in Darling Harbour so about mid day we set off to explore the area. There a lot of great restaurants and attractions, it really is too bad we didn't have more time to spend there. I would have loved to see the Sea Life Sydney Aquarium but it was closed when we got there.We sat on a bench on the pier to watch the show. It was amazing! I'm not sure how long it went on for but it felt like a good 30 minutes with fireworks going off from the harbour and off the tops of buildings as well. It was an impressive show to say the least.We heard a lot of great things about Darling Harbour, be sure to spend the day there.
Loved it. Great place to visit, good restaurants and bars, maritime museum and ferry links to circular quay. Also looks great at night
Excellent Venue for Late Night Food and Drinks. Arrived late (just before kitchens were closing) but we were treated royally. Excellent food and banter with waitrons.

Our Annual Holiday Destination. We are young baby boomers in retirement, and absolutely love Darling Harbour, and Sydney's CBD restaurants, shopping and harbour cruising. If only Sydney could get rid of the State of Origin Blues, it could be a nice place to live. Go Queenslander!

Darling Harbour. A place for lovers of all ages. It's nice to spend time here with your love ones, family and friends.Just walk around, sit down, eat, drink and relax. They have fireworks too at night. There are good buskers too.
Ever changing. Lots going on here with devolpment but all for the good, still lots to do and see, a must see spot for sure
Beautiful. Really nice harbour with fireworks on saturdays. Enjoyed having a chilly evening with some fellow backpackers.
Crowded Harbour. People, people and people. This is one of the major tourist attraction in the city, of course. It's easy to get to. Shopping, eating, and people watching.

Beautiful. Darling Harbour was amazing, we stayed at the Star on the Harbour and had fantastic views over the Harbour. Lots of restaurants and cafe's and things to do. Great social place and the cinema is a 2 minute walk from the harbour

Nightlife or just plain relax!!!!. Whatever you decide to do... enjoy the Sydney nightlife or just plain sit chill n relax with a drink... Darling harbour can entice n engage in all regards for hours at end....

CR. The Darling Horbour venue used to be a great place for locals and visitors alike, accessible to the CBD by foot and monorail.Now the monorail is gone access is limited to walking or a bus which takes at least half an hour.The Australian Maretime Museum is rearly the only venue worth visiting on the western side of the bay.
A builders site. Having been to Darling Harbour many times on this visit we found it untidy and full of temporary structures. Its an untidy construction site and best avoided for the next 12 months

Tower and darling harbour combined. Be prepared for some walking since the best way to get to Darling is by walking over the Pyrmont bridge.This gives great views of all the harbours attractions including Sea world the National Maritime museum and Sydney wildlife park as well as a good shopping centre and numerous restaurants.Well worth the walk which is 45 mins at reasonable pace.GO!!

LOTS TO SEE & DO. If you like browsing & looking at boats then spend a morning here and just enjoy the views & the comings & goings. Stop for lumch at one of the many cafes & restaurants and just enjoy.

Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour's name is perfect. It is a darling place to visit. The setting is filled with restaurants, shopping, and night life. You can visit the zoo on the pier and see Koala Bears and Kangaroos and other Australian wildlife, see the aquarium, or visit the wax museum. This is a must visit for those staying in Sydney.

relaxing. We were in Sydney only for one night, pre cruise. We had travelled from the USA and were exhausted. In the morning we walked to Darling Harbor from Holiday Inn Darling Harbor hotel, a short distance, and enjoyed a lovely relaxing morning sitting at harbor at one of the many restaurants enjoying a leisurely brunch and the beautiful views.

You can easily spend a whole day their.. If you never being to big Aquariums, this one is worth of visiting. It reminded us similar Aquariums in Maui or Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. We cannot say anything about Sydney Zoo at Darling Harbour because we went to Taroinga Zoo instead. But their Maritime Museum is something. It is free for general exhibition. But we would suggest do not go cheap and buy tickets to their major exhibitions. You can visit battleship "Vampire" and military submarine "Onslow". It is very impressive. Also you can explore their Barque. Only 4 left in the whole world. It is restored to perfect condition. You can even take a ride on it once a month. There is a Harbourside Shopping Mall, IMAX theater (largest screen in the world), Hop On Hop Off Cruises and hundreds of dining choices.
Great for a drink before/after your aquarium visit. Check out the indoor zoo or the aquarium, and grab a drink at one of the restaurants/bars lining the water at Darling Harbour.

A little too commercial. Darling Harbour has several attractions, restaurants and shops. But many of the attractions and restaurants are chains that can be found around the world.Does have the authentic Aussie vibe.
Always something going on . Some nice restaurants. Pretty at night. I visited the week before mardi gras and the place was buzzing with street performing arts and other bits and pieces.

Foodies delight. Loved the vibrant atmosphere especially on Saturday night. So many eateries to choose from, and for every budget. We visited for breakfast, lunch and dinners. Tried many different places and we're satisfied with all of them. Much easier to select a dining experience than in the city centre as you can see what people are eating to help you to decide. The retail shops were disappointing. Overall, a great place to just sit and watch the world go by.

Great place. Even with works in progress around Darling Harbour, it is a great place to wander around, have a meal and seems so safe. While we were there the Dragon Boat races were on as part of Chinese New Year - so plenty to see and do.

A very nice place!!!. A very nice walk. Very nice view. We went there twice once in the evening and once in the morning. Both were different experiences. Evening you could see the all lighted Sydney on one side and a line of restaurants and pubs with nice n cool breeze flowing. Again a must go if in Sydney!!!!
Must see area of Sydney. Large entertainment and tourism attraction area set off Sydney harbour. Had a walk around Darling Harbour at night. There is also a large IMAX Theatre and many restraunts.

Lots of activity on a Saturday night! . A 'must see' if you're visiting Sydney, whether you just walk around it, stop for coffee or a drink, do some people watching or just enjoy the scenery. Not as impressive as The Rocks, Opera House or The Harbour, but nice.
Fab place for lunch and an afternoon stroll. Great lunch beside the harbour. The pathways are spacious and clean and you can easily spend an hour or more just strolling around looking at the boats.
A hub of activity in Sydney!. Darling harbour is a hub of activity in Sydney! There is so much to do here! Restaurants, bars, clubs, cinema. And it also has weekly fireworks!

Good for food. Darling Harbour is to the west of the Sydney CBD. Formerly, it was a working harbour, but now it's mainly an entertainment area. Darling Harbour has many good restaurants. Last time I went, I had lobster. Dining by the water is very pleasant..
Busy scenic harbour. Overlooked by the high rises of the CBD the harbour offers many ferries, tourist water tours, restaurants and bars. Great spot just to sit and watch the activity and the people.
Great Holiday. Darling Harbour has many good quality restaurants well worth looking round and checking them out....

Plenty of places to eat. Picturesque, heaps of places to eat and drink. They are reconstructing something just under the bridge but all places are still accessible. My favourite place is the Italian down there and also the hard rock Cafe!
Many Restuarants and Bars to choose from. Darling Harbour has many restaurants and bars in the area. There are other atractions suitd to families like the Imax theatre and Aquarium.

Great place, enjoyed both day and night. As we were staying in Darling Harbour walking around here is great both day and night. Lots of places to eat and drink. The cinema is here too. Easy to get to the Maritime museum. Easy to get public ferries which take you all over the place.

Darling Harbour. Its a must to see in Sydney but this time I visited we noticed they has added a very unattractive floating venue on one side of the harbour! In my opinion I thought it was hideous and definitely takes away the beauty of the harbour! Also there was so much building work taking place which hopefully will enhance the area eventually!!The fireworks are a must on a Saturday night at 21.00.The food outlets all seem good and always full!The trips out and around the harbour are a must!
Where the night life resides. This is where the night life of Sydney Resides.Good clubs, attractions for every kind of public, and the 'other side' of the bay.

Hustle bustle and lots of places to eat and drink!. My favourite place in Sydney! I used to go here from Circular Quay using the ferries. This place can be very busy and crowded. There are a lot of bars and food joints on the banks.
What a relaxing place!. If you haven't been, you should. Most do if in Sydney. Great place so much to do. For any type of budget. Should be on everyone's Bucket list!
Nice area for an evening out. A nice area for a walk in the evening. Lots of people, and lots of bars and restaurants as well. A good bonus was viewing the fireworks from the bridge.

So much to do. Darling Harbour has lots going on, views, restaurants, bars, clubs, shops, museum and parks. You can spend the whole day and evening here. It does get busy at times but for me that adds to the ambiance of the place. A must for anyone visiting Sydney.

Great for evening stroll. One of the musts for your Sydney visit is a stroll around Darling Harbour / Cockle Bay. You can choose to eat at one of the many fine dining establishments or cheaper take away locations. At present (March 16) they are renovating some of the gardens but this wont impact. Great for a sunset / night stroll to take in the bay reflections of the city scape.
Great place to stay. Darling is central to the city , we stayed in one of the hotels around the harbour, lots of bars,places to eat ,and only a short 15 min walk to the bridge and ferries,
Very busy plaace. Very crowded, expensive restaurants but - not to far away from Fish Market. But it is worth to see, especially when you have children.

Construction work. The area around the Chinese garden was a shambles today. Many areas were cordoned off and there was little to see. Apparently some of this was in preparation for a corporate event, but there was also a lot of noisy building work taking place - and this is projected to be long term. Perhaps it depends which part of Darling harbour you go to. All of the recent positive reviews could not have been describing the area that I saw today.

Better than Circular Quay and the Rocks. Darling Harbour has so much to see and do and all in walking distance. Shops, restaurants, Imax, the Maritime Museum, Madame Tussauds, Aquarium, close also to Chinatown and Paddys Market - there are several good hotel chains to choose from.

This Harbour is Darling!. The waterfront cafes are everywhere, so great dining options. Nice IMAX theatre, Aquarium and Wildlife park. The Sydney Harbour ferries stop here every 20-30 minutes, so you can get to anywhere on Sydney Harbour for $2.50 with an Opal card. If you are anywhere central Sydney, this is worth the visit to enjoy.
Amazing. This place is amazing day and night. Lots to see and great eateries. Very cosmopolitan. Lots of people around buyt doesnt feel crowded.
Bit touristy. Probably developed for cruise ship hoards in mind and it shows, expensive restaurants and attractions and easy walking. Not the real Sydney for me.

Great place . We walked here from Central Park ,the whole harbour was buzzing,there is everything here,restaurants,cinema,big wheel,shops,a great day just browsing the harbour looking at the boats and attractions,we took the ferry back to circular quays with captain Morgan cruises,and the staff on here do an informative run down on all the buildings along the quays side
Worth it. Great restaurants and tourist attractions in a gorgeous setting. I went here many times while in Sydney.

Crazy place. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and went out for food with two young children. We felt like country bumpkins - it was so busy and vibrant. Very exciting place although you have to be in the mood for lots of crowds on a Saturday night in the summer.
