We stayed in the area for a few nights and it was calmer on other days and evenings and a really lovely place.

Lots going on in a small area.. So easy to pass time here with the Attractions available or just settle with a coffee and watch the world go by. Catch a water taxi here or one of the ferry boats to get around.

The place to be. Bustling with great atmosphere. This time we stayed in darling harbour rather than circular quay.Much better place to feel part of the holiday scene. It's easy to get a ferry or the light railway to see the sights and city.
Briliant vibrant happy area. Great place to stay with lots of bars and eateries. Various prices and styles of food. Great fun, no pressure, relaxed atmosphere.
Tourist Trap. Very old buildings and extremely expensive restaurants. Much better food, drinks and sights can be found elsewhere.
fantastic harbour lots of activities and restaurants. really great area and even nicer then circular quay, Lots of restaurants, shopping centre, cinema everything you need for a great day
Saturday Firewoks. Travellers or Locals must see the fireworks on Saturday, it doesn't happen every Saturday. So, it is always good to check the website before going.

Good nightspot. Darling Harbour is good in the day and great at night. It has a great selection of restaurants including hard rock and teppanyaki. It also has a water area for the kids and fairly good shopping.

Nothing much. Very touristy and only worth going if you want to go for the attractions there like the Maritime Museum or Wild life.
Many restaurants and a nice short Boardwalk but not quite worth the 25 min ferry ride from Circular Quay

Fun Trip over.... I took a ferry ride over. This is the place to be. They have a ton of shops and it is fun on this dude. We had dinner and rode the Ferris wheel. I would recommend taking a ferry to Darling Harbour because they had great music and a ton of great music and nice bars and night clubs (if you like those I don't) but it was there. A must visit.
From brothels to bistros. One has to be impressed by the courage of the powers that be to turn a remarkable piece of shoreline into a great place to people watch eat or walk
Fun place to watch crowds. Good place to take a stroll or enjoy a nice afternoon. Lots of good restaurant and cafe choices along with beautiful views of the wharf. Very close to the CBD.
Vibrant evening destination. Had a lovely meal while watching the world go by- not a huge choice of restaurants but should be something for everyone there
Darling Harbour. What a place love it love it we stayed there 5 days Restaurants to many to mention but must have a meal on the floating boat in the harbour,good meal and good value
beautiful scenery. We will never fail to visit this attraction whenever we are in Sydney. Good place for family and for individuals looking to unwind.

Great vibe and a very pleasant evening just walking around. Spent the latter part of our evening out, just wandering about Darling Harbour and attending an establishment on the King Street Wharf. The vibe of the area is great and at all times my wife and I felt safe. A very popular place for both locals and tourists alike, will definately go back shortly for another visit.

Darling Harbour: Tourist Town. Lots going on here, but 90% of the people you see here will probably be other tourists. Some pretty good restaurants, bars, and an IMAX theater. The only attraction not to miss is the Australian Maritime Museum.

Exciting place. Lively all evening & late into the night, awesome fireworks display started at 9pm to set tone for night. Many great meeting places, bars, clubs & lots of music. Harbour tours from thus location always coming & going, very colourful at night. Lots to see & do plus aquarium & maritime marine museum location.
Visit the National Maritime Museum. It's worth coming here to visit the Australian National Maritime Museum and to see the swing bridge being lifted on the hour.

Great city. We stayed in Sydney for 3 nights last week. Darling harbour was one of the highlights of our 22 day tour of Australia. Good restaurants, lots to do and see. The Chinese garden of friendship, which is just outside the harbour, was one of the most jaw dropping events of the stay! Go and see it, to find such an oasis in a city was a joy. Would love to go back to Sydney, amazing place.

Great sights to see. The Thai festival was on at Darling Harbour. Was a great learning experience. Free fireworks at 9pm. Plenty of things to see and do. Street performers were amazing. The park was great for a stop over for the kids. Looking forward to the new upgrade that are happening.

Stunning view. Visited there during mid march, amazing view, weather was great, tons of restaurants and bars, very convenient public transports, if u a person like to visit museum and library u will love this place for sure.

Expensive real estate ..... This is a place we reached on our very long, long walk from our hotel, The Larmont, near Kingcross road....our tour guide took us through some very nice gardens and through the harbour where you can see lovely boats....beautiful homes and ...what else can I say...it is lovely...and invigorating walk that will make you thirsty for a cold beer probably by the Rocks where there are many places.I suggest to walk when in a new town...get acquainted with everything by foot..then you don't feel so guilty when you have a nice lunch or dinner. You did your work out.
Good choice of entertainment. Seemed a lot more built up to. Me. Enjoyed the ferry ride from circular quay. Lots of stair ants, bars and entertainment to keep you busy.

So much to do !!!. It's one of those places that caters to almost everyone.Great food plenty of things to do and transport from the harbour to the many other attractions is very easy.Don't forget to look online to deals which offer entry to multiple attractions it will save you lots of time and money.
Try the theme parks. Everything is down here from sea life, wild life Australia and lots of shopping and places to eat, beat the crowds and come early in the morning

Great place to walk around, eat, drink.. We ate there several times, no restaurant disappointed us. We were there for the fireworks one night. Walked around on several evenings after dinner. Gorgeous in daylight and with the lights of evening and night. Amazing on a moonlit night.

Overdeveloped . This used to be a haven of tranquility with a lake and several water features but it is fast becoming a victim of overdevelopment. Its only saving grace is that it is used at weekends for ethic festivals which can be entertaining.

Ugly and boring. Ugly , boring, bloody expensive shops and restaurants, and very hard to get to, no bus, no train, takes a long time to walk from rail(syd train or light rail) and even longer for ferry terminal...
Don't bother
a brilliant place to visit, don't go to Sydney without a visit. so much to see and do at Darling Harbour. very tourist type attraction, lots of places to eat as well.

So many choices for dining and relaxing. Recently met up with friends for tea...many choices available and good prices. Very picturesque at night with all the city lights. Unfortunately...or more so fortunately,there is many renovations and building works happening at the moment..so will be keen to return in approx. 6months. Lovely area to walk around and many sights to see.

Beautiful. Not only is darling harbor beautiful to look at, there is also things to do. We visited the wildlife zoo and sea life center which were spectacular! And they didn't cost too much either, perfect if you're like myself : a traveler on a budget.

Avoid going here for another 6 months. Construction in this area has led to a very poor visual. Not a pleasant place to be at the moment. I am sure by Sept/Oct 2016 the area will be welcoming and wonderful again, but not for now.
Darling. So much to see and do here, it's busy but still feels relaxed and laid back. Attractions, shops, bars and restaurants all in a great setting
Cool spot. Nice spot for a walk, lots of restaurants around but they are touristy and over priced. The maritime museum is a fun free activity.

Super touristy & kitschy. Darling Harbour is an extremly busy, touristy and kitschy place with pseudo-original restaurants like a German "Brauhaus" and so on. Of course all places are pricy and some looked even like of low quality. Totally replaceable spot. We found far nicer and better places, many of them also much cheaper, more "original" and less busy.

Great place to people watch. Spent several nights here, there was always something going on but even if not just sitting watching the world go by was excellent. Large choice of pubs/eating places and access to shopping centre.

The Month of Love. In February they were celebrating the Month of Love so hearts and romance everywhere. Ferry can be taken to the Opera House, lots of restaurants and a fantastic place to stay. Central for the station to the Blue Mountains, for Bondi Beach and the touring bus.

lovely place.. Plenty of bars and restaurants, ferry pick up for trips around Sydney Harbour, good information shop, redevelopment work going on but this does not spoil a pleasant walk around the harbour. A few minutes walk to the Chinese area and about 20-30 mins walk to the Rocks for the bridge snd opera house.
Great for a stroll . We went on the ferry and had a stroll round. We dropped lucky it was happy hour in some of the bars cheapest drink we had.
Stunning at night. Strolled in Darling Harbour on the night of Mardi Gras, red hearts and people in rainbow outfit everywhere. Great atmosphere and stunning view.

SYDNEY LAND MARK. You can visit Darling Harbour and spend time to walk, shop or eat. There is a huge shoping center where you can select from various shops to buy. there is also a tour desk to buy tours for blue Mountain and a lot of restaurants.
Also you can enjoy fire works evening on Saturdays.
Museums near by

Darling. This place was the first we went to on arrival as we stayed at the Goldsborough apartments around the corner. Our first impression was amazing so much to please the eye and choices to eat and drink made it easy to relax and take it all in. We sat and had lunch and planned our stay in Sydney. Will be coming back

One of my favourite places. I absolutely love everything about Darling Harbour!! The places to eat, the shopping, the street performers. There is so much to see, do and eat. Its such a lively place. Great for couples, families, or even a lone traveler.
Endless Views!. Lots of great restaurants with a great view. We enjoyed the many stores to visit and shop. Busy yet peaceful seeing the many, many boats come and go.

Love Darling Harbour !. Great place to visit. Enjoyed coffees, lunches and dinners on 2 occasions. Shopped in the centre and there were some great bargains. Great atmosphere. Went to the Maritime Museum which is very interesting. Some great stories on the back wall of people who have travelled to Australia to live.

Beautiful Harbor. Known for the million dollar homes and views. Place is very nice. We took a ferry there which makes transportation much easier getting around, no parking of a car. Views and sights are really nice.
Excellent place. A place I will never forget. The fireworks every saturday are amazing! A lot of stores, restaurantes, and fun things to do there. Enjoy!

Great Base For Sydney. We stayed in Darling Harbour as our base for Sydney. Out of all the areas of the city that we visited it was the cleanest, felt safe, vibrant with lots of great bars, restaurants and attractions. you could not get bored here and we loved what it had to offer.

Stunning Views!. Lots of things going on in the harbour, I had a great afternoon one day of cocktails and lunch in the sunshine watching all the hustle and bustle!
A must see if you're in Sydney!

Beautiful Spot with Lots to Do. Our first day in Sydney we walked the upper portion of the harbor and discovered lots of beautiful restauants, the IMAX theater and a Starbucks. That evening we were encouraged to return to the harbor for their fireworks on a Saturday evening - spectacular!!! It was a short show, both so worth it! The other great thing was just watching the people out enjoying a warm summer evening of walking. Also enjoyed walking through the large mall that runs down one side of the harbor and window shopping

Perfect way to end the day. My wife and I met up with friends for dinner in Darling Harbour. The place is just perfect at sunset when the establishments start lighting up for the night. Most of the areas around the harbor are perfect for picture-taking. When we were there, there was a part of the harbor with floating hearts, perhaps part of the Valentine's Day festivities. Lots of dining options and bars to choose from. And plenty of shops too. It was an enjoyable night with friends we haven't seen for quite a while.

Lots going on . There is lots going on in Darling Habour so lots to watch and lots of restaurants to go to. We went at the beginning of our month long trip and it was just after Chinese New Year so there was lots going on around this festival. We also went on the last day of our trip - a month later - and it was the lead up to Mardi Gras. So again lots going on. It is also a great way to see different parts of the city.

A touristy attraction of Sydney with lots of restaurants and bars. My friend lives in Pyrmont (very close to Darling Harbour) so I get the chance to visit this lovely place every week and every time I'm there I just feel great. It is always packed with people and tourists which gives you the great feeling of life.

One of the very best Harbour quarters on the planet.. Darling harbour is an amazing concentration of Restaurants, shops, entertainment venues all in a compact & walkable area. The area is safe, busy & on Friday & Saturday nights absolutely buzzes with activity. For those interested in fashion watching - this is a Mecca, as Aussie style in all it’s glory (good & bad) is on display.

Major development taking place here. This is fast becoming the "mecca" on a visit to Sydney with many new buildings under construction so the atmosphere is a little spoilt by the cranes and sounds of construction works although when finished it will no doubt be the jewel in the crown of Sydney.
A beautiful spot especially at night. Hot summer evenings are perfect for a walk around the harbor. Plenty of restaurants to choose from and great slots to sit and people watch.
Lovely place!. Worth a visit, there are lots of nice restaurants and bars to chose from. It makes for a nice walk from the city centre to escape the hustle and bustle.
A vibrant venue. A wide choice of Restaurants and trips,and an interesting collection of ships in the Maritime Museum.Fun for the family or couples.
Lovely area.. A nice area to walk about. Enjoy the families using the area. Or check out one of the restaurants, or do some shopping. Easy to see why people use this harbor.

History, Gambling, and More!. You can spend a whole day here and never be bored. You can walk there from Town Hall Station or take the Light Rail. Attractions include the Sydney Maritime Museum, the Tall Ship "James Craig", submarines, and battleships..A giant casino lights up the day and night. A fancy Ferris wheel offers "private" cars for $50 AUS. These have red drapes that you can close. Other cars on the ride are much less expensive and provide a brilliant view of the whole area. The rest of Darling Harbour is filled with cafes, restaurants, and tempting shops. Enjoy the attractions during the day, then have dinner and head for the casino. The Light Rail stop there will take your to your next destination.

Fantastic!. A beautiful harbor with a lot of attractions, including the Aquarium, many restaurants and cafes, and great views across the harbor. Nice architecture.Service in the restaurants was pathetic, unfortunately, which can be said for many other restaurants in Sydney. Some nights there is a great fireworks display on the water, for about 15 minutes.

Great experience.. Darling Harbour is well worth a visit. Bus services go past here frequently and we used the 'hop on-hop off' red bus that takes tourists around the city. Darling Harbour is full of restaurants and cafes so no shortage of places to have a meal. If you appreciate scenery and great food then definately visit this area.

A great night out to be had here!. Darling Harbour offers a wealth of eating and drinking options and you can finish your visit on the illuminated Ferris Wheel and enjoy some Swiss Movenpick Ice Cream in their Parlour, which is open until late!
Busy but fun. This is a busy touristy area but lots to look at as you go around. Lots of bars and restaurants around the harbour and ships etc to visit.

Exciting & alive location. One of the best spots in Sydney Darling Harbour offers something for everyone whether they are couples, families, or kids. So many bars & restaurants offering an amazing variety of food & drinks. There is always something happening to keep the kids happy including the water park that provides fun & education for all the kids & a great way to keep them cool on a hot day & it's free!!!
Great to walk around and across. Lots of cafes and restaurants, shopping, a bridge over to the Maritime Museum, and loads of ships offering various trips out on the water.
Lots of Activities. Darling Harbour has lots of things to do there. Restaurants, iMax and Aquarium are some of the fun things to do there. People watching is fun to do there too.
VERY TOURISTY BUT GREAT PLACES TO EAT. Darling Harbour has all the tourist shops where you can get any and all souvenirs. The Meat Company has the best steaks and Nicks has the best seafood.

A Great Place To Be Entertained. This is a true entertainment complex. You could spend hours in this place so wear some comfortable shoes; It is is a great place to be entertained eat,drink and spend money.Sydney at its best.

A lot of attractions and good restaurants. There is a Maritime Museum, Aquarium and Wild Life. Plenty of restaurants and bars. You can walk there from CBD - I used iPhone map. At night we took a ferry to Circular Quay and metro train from there to our hotel. It was safe.

Come with your darling!. There is aquarium, zoo, and shopping malls. You can take a walk along the quay, biking or cruising. We were there in Feb., so they have a big stage for Valentine, and a big heart on the bridge, lovely.
a good place to chill out. plenty to do and see at darling harbour, just chill out and watch the world go by. Go shopping or eat your way to heven

Dragon Boat Races and other fun things. We visited Darling Harbour for the Dragon Boat Races, which are held every January in conjunction with Chinese New Year Festival. The races were fun to watch for awhile, but one really needs to know people who are participating to fully immerse your self in the event. It started to rain, so everyone tried to huddle under the expressway overpass, which still allowed for a view of the races. The races add to the general atmosphere of Darling Harbour, which is packed with restaurants and other things to do. It is a great place to go for families, especially now that the kids area has been renovated and a new restaurant strip opened near there. One can also shop, take a cruise, ride on the carousel, or just walk around and people watch. So much to do.

Excellent location to visit good restaurants but not for really fine dining. The Darling Harbour is a great place to go to visit restaurants and attractions. Go by Ferry on form the Circular Quay or walk. There are plenty of dining options but most are more mid range and good value. There are a lot of chain restaurants there such as the Hard Rock Café, Meat and Wine Company etc.. I would recommend it for families with young to teenage children and couple who like good wholesome food. Its not really what I would call a "Foodie" destination.

Hub. So much here for the tourist, aquarium, Madame Tussaud's, Wild Life, Sea Life, Hard Rock Cafe, bars, restaurants, ferries. Brilliant place to visit but busy at weekends. Coming in by ferry was a treat.

Darling of a Harbour!!. Just to have a walk round Darling Harbour is memorable especially when the sun is shining. Plenty to see & do. We stopped off at Cargo Bar, which was my old stomping ground, during my travelling days. Eat some great tapas there & a nice cold cider. Darling Harbour is a lot quieter than Sydney Harbour but I feel there is plenty more to do. We booked our bridge climb at one of the tourist information desk located on Darling Harbour! A great place which holds fond memories. Highly recommended!!
A busy place lots of people passing by. Ferries and boats can be aboard here. Aquarium, restaurants and exhibitions were here as well. It's a part of the busy city center of Sydney.

Great place to tour. The Sydney harbor is full of historical venues. There are many restaurants worth visiting that look out over the harbor. One way to see the harbor is catch a cruise boat many located along the King Street Wharf.
Dinner at Darling Harbour. Plenty of Restaurants to select from all different menus from all countries. We chose Italian. A main meal a sweet and a drink for 25.00 good value.

Some great things to see here 2 old and new. I like this walk its great just to catch up with friends and do a short walk around the labour as well there are tours in the area to old boats to check out plus the new buildings and the Harbour its self to see can spend a few hours or all day .. night time there is cafes and small pubs in the area plus the night city lights

Beautiful. It's such a beautiful place to visit. Just walking around or sitting up watch the world go by is great. Ferries, ships & boats activities are abundance. Get to see large cruise liners too. What a sight!!

Favorite Harbor . Our hotel was steps from Darling harbor which has so many things to do. From restaurants to museums there is something for everyone. On the weekend there are street performers here off throughout the day providing even more to see.They do a firework show here every Saturday night around 9pm. The show is phenomenal and free! We loved every second of it and we're very impressed.

Modern and lively, lots of nice restaurants and bars. This area has been developed recently so its really modern, with lots of nice restaurants and bars. We had dinner at a seafood restaurant which was just great! but most of the places looked really nice for both food and drinks. Very nice area for an evening walk, lively and fun.
Highly overrated. Superbusy, expensive, posh and impersonal. The Brewhouse and the aquarium are the only (admittedly pretty) nice things there.

Food, Family, Fun and Fireworks. Darling Harbour is a perfect social outing joint for singles, couples and families alike. There are attractions like Sea Life, Madam Tussads, IMAX theatre for entertainment besides the street shows and the Saturday fireworks. To add to this are the numerous restaurants and food court options to keep hunger at bay. Boat restaurants, gondolas, merry-go-round, self-row boats and shopping as well. The list goes on. The challenge would be on parking, finding a good restaurant (unless pre-booked) or to walk about freely on a busy night where it gets as busy as an overcrowded metro train.

Love the fireworks every Saturday night!. Darling Harbour might be the most likely favorite hangout spot of mine. I love every second hanging out with my friends, dates and classmates every Saturday to see the fireworks (it is the small firework performance but very interesting to observe).
They also have the playground for kids, tons of restaurants/bars/clubs to cash out your wallet.
Lots to do. Very lively and teeming with restaurants, bars, cafes, coffee and cake shops, museums, theatres, casino and a huge children’s playground.

A wonderful first impression of Sydney. Darling Harbour is a real asset to the Sydney foreshore. There are a lot of things to interest people of all ages and nationalities. It is aesthetically pleasing and very easy to walk around. Lovely restaurants with a view.

Best venue at Sydney. Daring Harbour is the best. Certainly it is not that famous to Tourism. Sydney harbour is nice but only magnificient once in a year. Daring Harbour is nice thru out the year, day and night. There are many nice restaurant here as well. Occasional, at the evening, there are concerts at Daring Harbour and bring everyone together for a great evening.It just so happened that our visit on Sunday 28th, encountered the Greek Festival of Sydney and the concert of Greek Singers push the atmosphere to its peak and is just can not be imagined and described.
Great for a few drinks. Great way to either spend the afternoon with a coffee, or enjoy a few drinks in the many bars along the harbour. Something to do for all ages.

Scenic place with lots of eateries. This is a wonderful place and in many ways even better than the Sydney Harbor. It has wonderful restaurants on either side of the waterfront. The lighting at night is fantastic and on Saturdays they have a fireworks show.We stayed in the Darling Harbor area and it was just five minutes walk from our hotel to reach the wharf in Darling Harbor. There are frequent taxi ferry services from here to Sydney harbor and vice versa. Darling harbor is also very near to the Chinese garden of friendship and also the Paddy's market. The Maritime museum is situated right on the harbor and so are Madam Tussaud museum and IMAX. The Star casino is also nearby.Lovely place to visit

A place for fireworks, food and friends.. Said we would go down and see the fireworks at New Years Eve.. A few bangs and a few flashes. Great for kids but to be endured by a middle aged grumpie old man, I thought. No, fair play to the Aussies, they know how to put on a great show. Although short by comparison to the main show, it was very entertaining and creative. Fabulous indeed. The area itself if full of restaurants and has a good ambiance. Difficult to get out of when it was thronged, but a great experience. Bring the family.
Darling Harbour. Lots of nice restaurants here. We were staying in the Holiday in in Darling Harbour and it was not too far too walk.
Darling habour. What a place lovely lots to do and see we had a late lunch then looked around the shops too at night very pretty with fireworks
Beautifullllllll......... A beautiful place with plenty of restaurants. Go anytime there morning, afternoon or evening you always enjoy there. Park is beautiful.
Sydney tour. Best place in which I have seen you will enjoy every moment and the money worth so I would request people should go and enjoy with ur family n friends
Activity center. Many nice restaurants and bars. Good connection to various parts of the city, such as China Town and the main harbor.
Maritime museum. Walk along Darling harbour and visit the museum or just look at the tall ship in the dock and the submarine.

Quite nice but maybe too touristy. Nice but if you want to dine out there or have a drink, maybe a little expensive, or not authentic. At least in my opinion and on my tastes.
The park is still great though, like many in the city.

Lovely new area. Great place for restaurants bar etc When we were there they had an outside cinema with chairs and bean bags to sit on. There is a great play area for children and it is on the flat. Loads of ferries going to various places
Lots of Places. Took the Eco Hopper from Circular Quay and this is the second stop. Aquarium is here as well as the Maritime Museum. Lots of stuff to do here.

a big and growing area. lots to see and do with shops and restaurants all around. Some of it is a bit run down/dated, which takes away from the appeal. But there's a lot of improvements underway too. The Chinese Garden was a surprising good stop for us too
Plenty to do for Everyone. Used Opal card to sail to Darling Harbour. There we found plenty of shops and restaurants as well as the maritime museum. Well worth a visit. Throbbing after dark.
Great vibe. Such a beautiful place. Many tourists of course, but still very pleasant. Try and go on a sunny day!

Where it all happens in Sydney. Darling Harbour is the buzz of Sydney - no matter what time of the day or evening you visit there is always activity, people and fun. Plenty of places to eat and drink, and the fireworks on Saturday night at 9pm is a fantastic show. You haven't been to Sydney if you haven't spent a good amount of time at Darling Harbour

Cruise of Harbor. This is not your typical harbor cruise. Not with views of the Sydney Bridge, Opera House, and all the beautiful homes along the harbor.
There are many tours, dinner cruises and showboat options to pick from. There is even a hop on hop off ferry that will allow you to visit many points of this huge harbor for one fee.

Go if you like crowds, kitsch and carnivals. On the plus side, Darling Harbour brings you into contact with the Maritime Museum and the outstanding Sydney Visitors Information Center. There are also boats and a ferry. But the restaurants are for the most part overpriced and not very appealing and the souvi stores are a little cheesy. A fireworks display on Saturday night (at 2100) attracted scores of people in party mode, jostling for viewing position with smartphones. Lots of families were there too and the kids especially seemed to enjoy the show.
good day out. plenty of things to see and do nice places to eat and drink if you are interested in old warships this is the place to visit

The OTHER Sydney harbor!. I never heard of this but it was close to my CBD hotel so I walked over and it was a real pleasant surprise. First, for free, walking around is nice - beautiful views of the water and lively happenings everywhere. Second, there are many attractions, shops, restaurants, and bars here. Third, there are regular ferries bringing people to and from Sydney Harbour so it's easy to get to from the main touristy area.

High Energy. A great area to visit. Truly a feast for the senses! Great views, restaurants and shops, on both sides of the harbor. With a connecting pedestrian/bicycle bridge connecting both sides. Beautiful at night and during the day! Lots of activity but not overly crowded feeling. Ver special place.

Lots of bars and restos!. There's s lot of things to do at Darling Harbour.. From museums, attractions, shopping and restaurants.. Name it they have it. It also is the best place just relax and admire the harbour.
great on a good weather day. I always head to Darling Harbour on a nice day. Its a great place to take a walk, watch people, eat and drink.

A very good place to go for a Saturday night out. Darling Harbour has loads of bars and restaurants to choose from, and a super fireworks display EVERY Saturday night at 21:00. Restaurants are pricey, though, and some are not worth it.
Good place to sit and people watch. The area was nice, lots to see and do, but nothing spectacular, it was a great place for transportation to other areas.

A beautiful place to visit. On a really hot afternoon it was lovely to visit this beautiful place. Lots of eateries, boats, glistening water. Huge further ongoing development will make this an even more exciting place in the future. One if Sydney's many jewels in it's crown.

thriving busy and marvellous. about 5 years ago, they were about to close this area down....now its thriving...we loved everything about it. the restaurants offer specials before 6PM so go for early sunset dinners on the opposite side of darling harbour view
Excellent harbour area - under development still. Excellent harbour area - under development still, but really nice area and lots going on, much improved to 15 years ago and really buzzing.

Truly a darling. We were lucky to see the Harbour both at day time and night time. We were impressed during our day visit with the serenity and charm of the place. Aside from the spectacular views, there are the museums and aquarium that would appeal to the whole family, and lots of restaurants and shops to choose from. When we visited on a Saturday night, we enjoyed the vibe and activity of the people around the Harbour. There were live bands, street parties, good food and drinks, and there was even a fireworks show. Everyone was having a real good time
Lively and authentic. The area is good to enjoy walking day time and even more night time, where all the restaurants and bars stand all along the path.Very nice atmosphere by the sea

dreadful. This artificial harbour- glossy buildings and swarms of tourists- is definitely a place to avoid. the total opposite of being representative of real Sydney life. avoid unless you like up-class tack
Short Break. Visited Darling harbour the fortnight before Mardi Gras. Lots of festivities to introduce this event. great eateries and areas for kids to have fun

Trendy and busy.. There is quite a lot to see and do around Darling Harbour - plenty of shops and eateries. Of course this all comes at a price, literally and annoyingly, it comes with its own crowd. Despite this, there are a wide range of things to do in a pleasant seaside setting.

Least impressive of Sydney neighborhoods.. We walked this area on an especially hot day right before Australia Day. They were setting up a large stage for some event, and the construction of the convention center is huge, loud and right there! A handful of restaurants, but not the local cafes that are so yummy in other parts of Sydney. American style shopping center was not particularly interesting either. Go to the Rocks instead!!

Vibrant. The view from darling harbour is lovely. There are so many interesting restaurants in this area. You might just get lucky to see fireworks during special occsaions. There are lot of interesting activities for the kids to do here.

My favourite for food and fireworks!. Every time I'm in Sydney I will dine at Cyren's with a table facing the water. Not just the food is good here, you get to see fireworks every Saturday night at 9 pm with a clear view.Darling Harbour has loads of eateries and also Hard Rock Cafe.

Intertayment. So good lots of Intertayment relaxing nice view very harmonious environment lots of shop, restaurants, lots of tourists and nice place to be visited by families and friend very secure place give you around you.
A must visit place. Been here a few times over the years a great place to visit great place to walk round and lots goid bars resturants with terrific views

Most Calm & Soothing place Yet Full of Entertaintainment. There is really nowhere in the world quite like Darling Harbour.From first light to starry nights, there’s always something going on here. New Year's Eve celebration, children play, friends chat, steaks sear, glasses clink, bass thumps and fireworks crackle. Everyone is found clicking pictures of the wonderful view from every angle. Amazing Restaurants and bars in Darling Harbour are big news. You’ll find absolutely masses of choice without having to wear out your shoe leather finding it.If you’re a local, chances are you really do come here often. If you’re new in town, there’s no question you’ll have this sparkling harbour on your Sydney bucket list.Advise: Donot Forget your Camera :)

Starting to look tired. Needs a good spruce up, whole area looks tired hopefully will fix up once exhibition centre is open. Vacant shops and is starting to be come trashy/touristy. Pavers need replacing and dome roof was leaking when it rained.

Wonderland in the heart of Sydney. Yes you must visit if in Sydney.The area is a mixture if old and new,with a vast amount of restaurants and bars plus living units.Attractions abound and you would be hard to please if you could not find plenty to do and see for a full day.

Had atmosphere. Went there during the Chinese Lunar Year celebrations. Even though there is a lot of rebuilding going on at DH there is still a lot to take in, even watching the tourists can become a past time. The dragon boat races were on the day we visited, which was a spectacle in itself. Great location and all for free! GL

Great place to hang out. The dragon boat rac festival was on to celebrate Chinese New Year so the place was packed. Plenty to see and do with a diverse range of restaurants and bars although not the cheapest.

BeUtiful. What can I say the sun was out beautiful day, and just so lovely to walk around at ur own pace no rushing or shoving, loads to see on your walk about some really nice restaurants some very expensive but some quite cheap, all in all I loved it!
Lovely place. We stayed in an hotel overlooking the harbour and it is near the aquarium, madam tussauds waxworks, ferries and eating places.

A location for family and couples. We stayed at the Parkroyal At Darling Harbour for two nights. Not cheap but it is in the middle of Darling Harbour. Their is lots to do from the maritime museum, souvenir shopping, watching the tall ships and huge day tripping boats, to walking around Barangaroo or even shopping at the QVB. Darling Harbour is in the centre of everything. Lots of kids play areas and sites to keep them happy. Food outlets vary from Mac Donalds for the kids to some of the best eateries on Kings Wharf.
Great day out. Lots of different shops food outlets movies gondolas taxis fireworks lots to see cocktails takeaway or sit down
Lots to do. There is a wide range of activities, including Sea Life, Wild Life, the lighthouse, museums, restaurants, shopping and can be accessed by ferry or tramway.

Beautiful Darling Harbour. Yet another awesome setting in the Sydney area. this is a jewel of a Harbour setting, so tranquil and picturesque. Surrounded by lots of quality restaurants with tranquil views is just the start. Plenty of free entertainment for the children and access to the Whale Watching Cruise.Madam Tussaud, Sea World, Naval History, Chinese Garden and shopping area if you wish.Lots of construction over the last 3 years and more ongoing but it does not spoil the view.To understand what value people place on being here, i will relate to you a recent Auction result. Whilst figures may not be totally accurate, you will get the idea.A group of luxury apartments were recently auctioned online. Positioned on the waters edge in Darling Harbour, the first sold for 1.8 million dollars and the last made 5.9 million dollars!!!! That must surely convey to you how desperately people wish to enjoy the delights of Darling Harbour and you can enjoy it free of charge.Awesome.

Do I like Darling Harbour? - - - Yes!. The west side of this prescient is, I believe, due for some much needed refurbishment. At the moment it's a cheapish touristy area which I really don't like.The east side is packed with some wonderful restaurants along the entire length of Cockle Bay. Every visitor to Sydney should try eating here at least once.The area is lovely to walk around, although this might not be the case at the moment with lots of construction.Can't wait for the NEW Harling Harbour.
Good jump off point to many adventures. everything starts from here. Good jump off point. Public transport gets you here very easily and their are loads of things going on close to the harbour

another spectacular view of Sydney and people watching. Be sure to go to the Chinese gardens and then walk around Darling Harbour to view the sights, the people and the architecture. Loads of restaurants and places to sit with a lovely cup of coffee

Vibrant spot. We visited this vibrant spot many times over a ten day period and there was always plenty going on. Crowds were thick on the warm summer evenings, strolling around or enjoying the many cafes and restaurants. The Saturday evening fireworks are well worth seeing and we enjoyed the dragon boat races, part of the Chinese New Year celebrations. There were lots of activities for Valentines' Day too and a wonderful playground for kids at Tumbalong Park. Well worth a visit and allow a couple of hours if you want to include the park for the kids.
Lots to see. This place is suitable for all types of travellers of all ages there is nearly always something to see or do day and night and most times there is some sort of attraction happening
Lots of restaurants and pretty at night. Mostly just a place to go and eat, but there are also often events happening here. Also a big kids playground.
Beautiful Area to Walk Around and Eat. Beautiful views of the harbour and great restaurants. Whale watching cruises available from this area.
Harbour by the city. Nice to see the harbour by the city, a darling at that! There is a museum and many other attractions ie. Madam Tussaud & Seaworld and host of many restaurants.

Saturday Night Fireworks. Tonight at 9 pm, and every Saturday from now onwards, there is a firework display from barges anchored in the centre of the harbour. You can see the display easily from anywhere but we found the view from the Pyrmont Bridge the best. Lasts for about 10 minutes. If we had planned it better a restaurant table on the front line would have been even better. Worth booking one.

OMG. So much to do and fun for kids . We were so surprised at the amazing water park and adventure playground. So great to see a town invest in families and something so special but free. We could have easily spent the day there...Lots of ambience and eating spots... Between Imax, the wax museum, aquarium and zoo... Well worth it!!!!

Fam bam adventure Jan. We stayed at the park Royal DH which is a amazing location. Just so much to do you just don't need to go anywhere else. Town hall train station and ferry terminal are right in ur door step of many hotels there

Day out at the Harbour. Absolutely Beautiful Area,Plenty to see and walk around,loads of eating places and kids area.Only a short walk from Paddys Market through China Town.so much to see around this place.Great pub in an old Pump House.Loads of shopping and eating places your really spoiled for choice.

Under construction . Darling Harbour is a must see for any visitor...loads to see and do for the whole family too!! Now that its under construction im sure there will be plenty more too.....love taking my family to Darling Harbour....nice part of the city

Fireworks at Darling harbour. Fireworks starts at 9pm on Saturdays so there are crowd around and the cafes along the harbour are filled. There is also a fairy wheel at Aud8 per person or Aud50 for a private carriage. Nice place to spend an evening with family and friends and chill at the cafes along the harbour. Transportation is convenient with Light Rail stop (Fare Aud2.10) nearby after you board from Central station, otherwise if you wish to take a stroll it's within walking distance.

Entertainment precinct. Darling Harbour is a spectactular achievement for Sydney. They managed to include a fantastic waterway into the lives and surrounds for all to use. And all this is in walking distance to the CBD.Restaurants and cafes line the banks whilst ferries and boat capitilise on the waterways. The attractions and tourist availability is immense, not forgetting the spectacular views. What a tourist mecca.

Loads to do. Get the ferry here so you arrive on the water. Great day out, loads to do. Plenty of places to eat, there are always loads of free attractions, when we went it was the week before Valentines, so the theme was "Feel the Love". We spent an afternoon in the Maritime museum. Although we didn't have time to see it all, we will be back

Great place. We visited Darling Harbour recently and had a great time.. views are spectacular.. fire works on the Australia day was amazing. Place is full of high quality restaurants and one is spoilt for choice. Lindt cafe was excellent for Swiss choclates.

What is happening to Darling Harbour. I couldn't make sense of Darling Harbour. It seems like a new concrete city in the making. Just new building work all over the place. I was so disappointed re visiting, the lovely old charm has completely disappeared.

Nice harbour area!. There's a lot of awesome restaurants around here as well as a cinema. The hard rock cafe is right here too! There's also a mall which has souvenirs, food etc and there's a novotel that outlooks the harbour. There's also an aquarium which is good for kids! The ferrys connect circular quay and darling harbour together so you can travel under the harbour bridge. There's also water taxi's that could take you there. You should definitely visit here while you visit Sydney!

Good morning walking. Darling Harbour is full of Restaurants of all cuisines there is something for everyone. It is a lovely morning walk with lots of boot camps and there is also a lovely new bay Barangaroo which is still under construction with walk ways as well as cycle ways. There is the maritime museum here as well as Madame Tussauds & Sydney Aquarium there is plenty to see and do in Darling Harbour
So much to see. Great place for a stroll around and have a drink or snack in one of the many bars and restaurants or for kids to play in parks

Great People Place. From the Prympnt bridge to the walks around the Harbour, Darling is a great place to people watch, have a meal or drink and shop for souveniers. Very busy at night, very laid back, lots of fun, good food, and GELATO!!
Top pick for a visit or stay. Your spoilt for choice here! Many cafes, restaurants, attractions and things to see and do in Darling Harbour. Perfect for a day or night out. Simply beautiful!

Our little getaway!!!!. My wife and I visited Darling harbour in January and loved this place.We had drinks and dinner on the harbour and watched the fireworks.There are so many bars and restaurants to visit.Definitely worth a visit here.

Love Darling harbour.. Once a tired part of Sydney, old crumbling disused wool sheds and industrial harbour transformed into an amazing vibrant city hub with a plethora of bars restaraunts and tourist attractions. Wonderful walkways and a nice place to experience a variety of cuisines whilst viewing the harbour.
Overcommercialised. Try the quay - a prettier option. Maybe now they are doing works down there it will be nicer but not my favourite part of Sydney
The best place to relax and soak it all in. Darling Harbour has lots of great restaurants and bars and attractions. I enjoyed sitting at the sidewalk cafe and soak it all in. What a happy place.

work in progress. Darling Harbour will be the premier spot to visit in Sydney but at present there is work going on everywhere so it probably currently not at its best However it is still a great place to visit ,eat, go to the theatre or visit museums . It's convenient to heaps of hotels and close to walk into the city.  Always worth wandering down.!
Just a quick visit. A good 15 mins walk from the station.Evening time,lots of shops around.Place to relax.And as it says,its an harbour.Thats about it.
darling harbour walking. found it interesting lots to see and do plenty of places to eat etc., found the gift shops tooo expensive for a family
Too commercial. Too busy, too many people, to tacky too too too - not attractive at all - don't bother - there are do many more wonderful places to visit
Great lively place.. I visited many years ago and there wasnt much here....now theres loads. Cafes bars aquarium madam tussards loads to do. Easy to get to by train ferry or walking....great place.

Chinese New Year.. This was very busy and full of everything Chinese so it was noisy, brash, lively and full of interesting people doing what Chinese people do. I think I prefer it when it's not so busy and you don't have to fight for everything.
Too much industrial work and noise to enjoy. A walk and lunch down at Darling Harbour - WAY TOO NOISYThere is a large array of building works going on - keep clear

Great Place to visit. Loved Darling harbour for its buzz and choice of bars,restaurants and shops. However i would recommend eating in china town if you want asian as they are better quality and less expensive.I did eat some excellent seafood dishes in the restaurants around the harbour. A must try is the morten bay bugs

Chinese New Year in Darling Harbour. A magical place to be for CNY and Valentines. Thank you Sydney for the huge effort, wonderful place day or night. The Harbourside was really buzzing and the vibe was contagious. Loved every moment of our four night stay.

What a place!. Better than I expected! It is very lively, something to do for everyone, or just do nothing and look around, sit on a bench and watch people go by, or better yet, take a ferry to a vast array of destinations.

Darling Harbour. Very good place to visit, lots of restaurants and entertainment. Aquarium and Maritime museum very interesting. There are ferry trips to all the other areas from here. It's a 15 min walk from the hotel.

exellant place to eat and drink. very impress place. lot of good restaurants with all kind of food you look for. Imax, museums aquarium small zoo. big marina and many bars and stores. boat for local sailing.

Oh the fireworks!!. Not sure if the fireworks were extra special because we went on the Saturday before Valentine's day but it was amazing! Make sure you don't miss them. They happen regularly - I think every week :)
Darling harbor. What a lively place to visit. So much to do. Lots of place to eat and do some people watching. We had pizza and walk about
Its the month of love. Check out all the fun things you can do at Darling Harbour during the month of love - row a boat, watch a film, take your picture from the heart seat....
Fun place. A great place to people watch and enjoy the harbor! Many great eating places! Very clean and safe! Enjoy

Great place to visit, lots of variety for restaurants. We ended up here after spending the day at the zoo. Found it great to have a drink and relax with many restaurants to chose from. We had appetizers, and drinks at a couple of these fine establishments; all had friendly staff, and great service.

so peacefull. The first day of our two months Australia/New Zealand trip started here, on Darling Harbour. After the hustle of Kuala Lumpur, Sydney, and Darling Harbour in particular, was like a gleam of oxygen. Can be crowded, especially around Sealife. We walked all the way from Darling Harbour to Sydney Opera House!

Good for sightseeing, shops & eating/drinking. Visited Darling Harbour twice using hop on hop off bus. Plenty of restaurants bars & shops plus the harbour/boats etc. Lots of building work going on there at the moment which detracts from the experience a little. Aquarium, Waxworks are major attractions there.
Loved it!. We spent several evenings eating as different places here, yes it's a bit of a construction site but look beyond to enjoy great views, a fantastic atmosphere and varied cuisine.

Another great setting in Sydney. When in Sydney, it seems that everywhere you look there is something beautiful to look at. This harbor is surrounded by nice restaurants and shops with terraces and fountains. Colorful flags everywhere celebrating the Chinese New Year, private yachts docked waiting to go out in the bay. Next to the Sydney Aquarium and the Chinese Gardens.
valentine. we stayed at the parkroyal 5 minute walk to this great place plenty to do there restaurant's shopping ferry's must place to vist

Very nice. We had gone there on Valentine's Day and Chinese New Year festival was also going on so it was crowded and very lively place with some performances were going on and boats were decorated with lights and were sailing . I love this place
Darlinh harbour. It so far away walking from one place to other. Half and hours at least. Very hot at noon. Not suitable for elderly and small child.

Noise pollution a problem. Sydney is a great city to visit but experience frequently spoiled by noise pollution from cars and motor bikes. I don't know if it's anyone's job to review trip advisor ratings but some one in the tourist trade or Syndey Council should look seriously at having a bylaw that prohibits exhaust noise above 90 decibels. Frequently woken by noise greater than 100 decibels and maybe more - and also suffered when out walking. Please do something about this Sydney.

Great place to just wander around and eat, drink and view the sights. Yanks- dont forget the Aussie dont tip!. Met an Aussie friend in Darling after a trip around several australian cities. Was a nice bookend to the overall trip which started in Melborne and the racecs.

A great spot with lots to do. It is all here. Retail, restaurants, entertainment, walking to many attractions. Easily will occupy most of the day and more. Movie theatre, IMAX, Conference centre, Japanese Garden and the list goes on. Lots of night time activity. Aquarium, Koala Zoo. Keeps you busy from sunup to past sundown. Possibility of fireworks at night.
A great place to visit. This is a lovely place to visit - lots to do the zoo, aquarium,waxworks, or to walk or people watch or dine at one of the restaurants.

Amazing spot. Having a shopping centre and a promenade eatery with great views is a must for any traveller that comes to sydney.We had dinner and found a fireworks show that made the experience unforgettable
wow. tons of restaurants bars, theaters, IMAX, ferries, condos and hotels, madame Tussaud, the aquarium and open plazas and some gardens

Vibrant location. Darling Harbour has been developed into a tourist spot featuring attractions like the Aquarium, and Australian heritage spots like the Maritime Museum. there are sightseeing cruises available as well are bars and restaurants. The area goes to make a great day out

Atmospheric and great for people watching!. No visit to Central Sydney is complete without a stroll around the famous Darling Harbour. It is another element of the labyrinth that makes up Sydney's amazing waterfront, it is within walking distance of the City Centre, and the U shaped harbour has many attractions.We arrived by ferry from Balmain and the disembarkation point is a good place to start the thirty minute walk as it is at the far end of the harbour. You will pass attractions such as the Aquarium, the Imax cinema and the Maritme Museum, not to mention buskers of all descriptions. There are restaurants of all types along the harbour but you will pay higher prices here than in the suburbs. We ate at a Belgian place and the waitress was friendly, the food excellent, but the bill a little hefty.There is an excellent children's play area just off the waterfront with very imaginative equipment including sand and water play features. Sydney does a lot for small children and this a larger version of the excellent children's playgrounds that can be found all over the city.The Harbour does get busy, especially at weekends. On the Saturday we visited there was a Serbian Festival taking place with free music and dancing performances and stalls advertising Serbian goods - it was very atmospheric. We also enjoyed an amazing break dance performance by some athletic locals.Darling Harbour is a good place to hang out for an hour or two and watch some interesting and often out of the ordinary characters. You should include it on your Sydney itinerary.
Gorgeous . Darling harbour was the first place I ever came to in Sydney and I've loved it ever since. Beautiful views with plenty of options for food & drinks.

Great place to spend a day!. This harbor isn't as busy as the main Sydney Harbour, but there is still plenty to do and see! Lots of restaurants, shopping and attractions here. There is the aquarium, wildlife park and wax museum here. Fireworks every Saturday!

Beautiful. A mate and I sat at one of the pubs surrounding the harbour, ordered ourselves a beer and soaked up the sunshine whilst doing some very interesting people watching. An enjoyable and relaxing day well spent!
A must do. Take a day to visit the venues located at Darling Harbour. The maritime museum, the aquarium and all other shops and restaurants.
Nice view!!!!. I've never seen submarine so I was glad to see it!!I went there before Valentine's Day so there were many decorations of valentines!! <3Here was very nice viewing.

A nice hangout spot full of attractions, but it's pricy!. Darling Harbour is one of the main attractions in Sydney on its own, not to mention the large list of attractions contained within, so it's reasonable to understand why it's such an expensive hangout spot. The attractions are nice and so are the restaurants, but be prepared to spend, spend, spend! Sydney SeaLife Aquarium is a must. Enjoy!

Darling Harbour is full of life. We stayed near the Darling harbour and spent most of our time there dining in the evening.Everything is also nearby within walking distance. It's full of life day and night.Darling harbour is huge with shopping mall, restaurants, cafes, museums, Madame Tussaud, and many more attractions.

Always changing always something to see and watch. Darling Habour ia place you can relax in, do things in and find a huge range of food outlets. Festivals and street theatre are common place and while they are currently making massive changes to the area with heaps of major buildings works they still have managed to attract ongoing entertainment, areas of interest and places to see and visit. Shade is not in abundance so take a hat and plenty of water. Lots of young children to explore, not so much for teens that is free.
Buzzing!. A great place for a stroll and to admire the yachts! An abundance of great restaurants and lthings to do including a great aquarium.

Interesting place. Darling Harbour is a tourist Mecca in Sydney but it works. There are still plenty of offices close by so there's a good crowd of locals to keep the cafes and restaurants well priced and on their game. The children's playground is brilliant, especially the water features. Arrive by ferry, stroll around, eat, drink and enjoy.
Restauranys. It was good having all the restaurants, but not as diverse as the Sydney harbor. Great access to places to visit with kids.

If you can't do it all, make this one of your TO DO. Skylines, harbour, food, people, energy, peace giving, wonderful part of the city. Enjoy the wonders that are being built all around you and take time to read the wall boards that tell you how the area got its name, the women who were pioneers in preparing the future in what you're enjoying. It's amazing.

Our most favoured place in Sydney. This is our 4th trip to Australia and every time we go, our anticipation of just being down on Darling Harbour really excites us. There is something magical about the place. It is so cool a place, with lots and lots of bars, restaurants, attractions and the best part of it is that it is sooo family friendly. Theres lots to do but we just love to spend evenings down there and 'watch the world go by' after an excellent meal, with a glass of vino and soak it all up.

Great in the summer!. We thoroughly enjoyed this lively neighborhood with its many restaurants and large playground, the Maritime Museum, water taxis, ferries to Circular Quay and the excellent Friday night fireworks. It is also a short walk to the Fish Market (well worth a visit!) and within walking distance of The Rocks. If you can, get an apartment with a balcony overlooking the harbour - great views and lovely breezes after a long day of sight-seeing!

A Beutiful Place - Must See. Darling Harbour has lots of things for the tourists, an Aquarium, a mini zoo, and good number of restaurants. We were also lucky to see beautiful fire works display at night which is probably held only on some particular days.

Tours, Travel, Bars, Restaurants, Cafes, Shops - Everything. Darling Harbour is a hub of activity, the starting place for many harbour tours. It contains heaps of bars, restaurants, cafes, buskers and shops each side of the Pyrmont bridge. Great place to look around and close to the City. The restaurants are also very nice and can usually be booked for the same evening. Recommend to get there and look around.
Lots of eating places to choose from. IMAX and mall!. We stayed a few nights at Darling Harbour. We walked, took the ferry, saw fireworks, and went to the Aquarium. It was a fun visit

Great Spot. A great place to relax and visit away from the hustle and bustle. There is a varied and extensive selection of cafes and restaurants to choose from. There is a range of experiences to be viewed like the aquarium ,wildlife- park, Madame Tussaud's wax museum. Strolling around the Chinese Gardens is peaceful and the area also caters for families.

Great way to spend the day. We went to Darling Harbour to take the "Sydney Eco Whale Watching small group cruise" we had booked through Viator. There are many types of tour boats you can pick up from this harbour but most are massive and jammed with tourists. Our boat was small with only 6 passengers and a more personable experience. Thanks Tony from Australian Spirit Sailing for a great tour! The harbour is beautiful. Nice to walk on a sunny day. Many restaurants, bars and cafes. Lots of other attractions but we didn't have time to get to them.

great place for tourists to visit when in Sydney. Great place on the Harbour for tourists to visit when in Sydney. Plenty of places to eat, near the Chinese gardens (very pretty) and a short walk from Central Station. I like to take a ferry circuit here from Circular Quay

Full of things to do. Darling harbor is full of things to do including eateries, tours and sightseeing. Even if you don't eat there, there is so much to do and see it is a must do for any traveler to Sydney.
Great place to walk around. There are so many restaurants and views. This is a great place for a stroll and for people watching.

A tourist and nightlife hot spot of sydney. Darling harbour is one of the tourist and nightlife hotspots of sydney! It has a bunch of bars, restaurants and clubs and a whol bunch of things to do for children such as an aquarium, cinema and playground.

New Years Eve from Darling Harbour. We arrived in Sydney on the morning of New Year's Eve so after a sleep we headed to the nearby Darling Harbour for a 'NYE harbour tour and view of the fireworks'. Darling Harbour is a really lively family orientated area day or evening. We had a drink in one of the many bar/restaurants before seeing the 9pm fireworks then another wander before boarding for our fantastic nye fireworks cruise. We also visited daytime and enjoyed it very much.

A place close to lots of attraction . Darling harbour is close to the Chinese garden, the maritime museums, the aquarium, Madame tussaud wax museum, sydney wild life and so many attractions. And there is so many restaurants to choose from . Good place to shop and buy souvenirs, a place to relax ,to enjoy the view and have a drink.
Exciting place to visit.. Lots to see and good restaurants good shops and a museum on board a very large old war ship which we didn't get time to visit.

Sunny days to sit and watch the world go by.. Heaps of cafe's, bars and dining facilities whereby you can pull up a chair and have a nice cold beer and watch the world go by, people from all nations flock here and it is easy to see why. Every thing from kebab to best seafood Sydney can offer, it's all here. Great family location with heaps of play areas to the south.
It's a harbour. Complete with boats and water. The pavements attract people and seagulls. It's been done up apparently.
fantastic family playground upgrade. Amazing childrens' water park area, equipment, fun play space for families and children since upgrade of Darling Harbour area done.

Busy and touristy. Worth a look but I wouldn't necessarily recommend this are unless you want mall shopping and touristy food outlets. It's a very busy area for tourists and the Chinese and Japanese visitors outnumber every other nation here 10-1

A bustling, showcase.. We spent three and a half days based at Darling Harbour, and found it a perfect spot. We enjoyed the great choice of restaurants, and bought a 'hop on hop off' ferry pass to get round the harbour to places such as Circular Quay and Taronga Zoo. The Aquarium was also fantastic, and what we really enjoyed was the fact that Darling Harbour has such great pedestrian walkways to the various parts of that area. It was a very good base for exploring Sydney.

Great place to eat, relax and take in the scenic view.. This place has change so much since the last time I was here. They are growing it and making it so much more entertaining and relaxing. Lots of places to eat and just relax.
Great restaurants and street entertainment. Lovely area to soak up the Sydney atmosphere and get some food too. Lots of street entertainment too keep you occupied too.

The happening harbour. Darling harbour of Sydney may have just been a port where prisoners were downloaded from pertinent ships when Sydney was just a penal colony but those jailbirds have made the city one of the very best in the world with the harbour itself as one of the happening places in the world ,a mere walk able distance form the famous opera house the darling harbour is a zone of tourism ,brilliantly designed with aquariums ,madame Tussaud wax museum ,Pentax movie theater ,thousands of restaurants where one could dine or drink watching the waves lapping as huge cranes disembark the containers from huge ships in the harbour ,well connected to the city the place is ideal for a long walk and a frolic for children in a lovely park

Must area to visit for any tourst, water, boats, bars and restaurants. Darling harbour has something for everyone.. from Wild life to boat tours plus many restaurants , bars, pubs all of flavours. A lovely walk around the harbour and pleasant just watch the world go by

Quality family time. My family had come down for vacation and they enjoyed the ferry ride to manly. It was wonderful and hassle free trip and we got lots of nice shots of the harbour bridge and opera house too!
Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour has a fantastic range of interesting cafes and bars; shops and shopping centre. Close to the Sydney Fish Market.

No longer our darling !. This part of Sydney has changed for the worse over the last 10-some year, with recent and still ongoing construction making for a very closed-in feeling. You can still walk around the hatbour, but it is no long a pleasant stroll. What a shame ...

Something for everyone. Darling Harbour has something for everyone. We ate dinner at Casa. Good Italian food right on the waterfront. We also went to Sea Life and Wild Life (great for families especially). There are plenty of shops, museums and night life. It was one of our favorite places to visit in Sydney.

Lots of Things To Do. Darling Harbour is a great place to walk around. They have a mall on 1 end. There are also many restaurants, and the ferry wharf. There is also The Aquarium and The Zoo Wildlife Experience. On Saturday night they have fireworks at 9:00 pm. This area is also a must see in Sydney

There is something for everyone here . We took a Ferry to Darling Harbour and spent a day there. Madame Tussauds, The Aquarium, Amusement park, Restaurants, Lindt Chocolate are just a few things to experience. Unfortunately, my photos are on my camera and not my phone.
Mr darling . So many bars and resteraunts fighting for business there loads of happy hours and deals to be had visited on Australia Day for fireworks and drinks spectacular

A perfect complement to Sydney Harbour. . Darling Harbour showed off in a big way with music, fire, laser light, and electrifying water geyser displays. Vivid 2015 was truly amazing and the DH displays brought a complete sense of thrill and excitement to me. Topped with the worlds largest Imax ever, there is no shortage of retataunts, shopping, and tourist attractions like the maritime museum. (I reviewed it separately). Easy to get there via ferry, I wandered the Harbour twice in four days. Going under the Harbour bridge, I highly recommend he ferry. Enjoy a wonderful day on the water in DH. J

BEAUTIFUL HARBOR (MUST experience). Circular Quay Harbour is MAINLY where you buy cruises and excursions and depart for these activities.DARLING HARBOUR has PERSONALITY!!!A few excursions depart from this harbour, BUT it is SO MUCH MORE.One side is lined with 25 to 30 small restaurants. Cross a bridge and SHOP the Small Mall on other side of harbour. EXCELLENT reasonably priced merchandise.I purchased 3 tops and a dress. Had purchased nothing in the HIGH PRICED Queen Elizabeth mall.Found a restaurant and ate. Then found a seat outside and waited for the SATURDAY NIGHT fireworks in DARLING HARBOUR. A great 15-minute firework show.WONDERFUL day at DARLING HARBOR!!!!
Not for solo travelers!. Darling Harbour is for families and old people, you won't be able to find a reasonably priced bar and you'll feel like the most touristy person around.

All things in one place . Shops, restaurants, entertainment... All on one! Enjoy your time at Darling Harbour and remember to come on Saturday when there is 8pm fireworks. Parking are usually cheaper after 6pm. So if you plan to go by car, park two or three stations away from CBD, maybe you can find a free one.
Lots of Things to see and do. Darling Harbour has a lot to offer local and overseas visitors. This is definitely worth a day's worth of a visit or even a few days as there are lots to see and do.
WOW, WHAT A PLACE. During our trip to Sydney, we went out for a walk and diner at Darliing Harbour. What an impressive location. The atmosphere was great,. A location not to miss.
Lots here.... Virtually a straight walk down Market Street from the CBD, there is lots here from Madame Tussauds, The Aquarium various street acts, boat trips, bars, restaurants & clubs.
best place to hang out. close to town hall with very ease and comfort walking distance.Its beautiful place to make some time.

Safe and inviting. We stayed in walking distance of here and we came and went regularly. Good mix of attractions and food and shops. Street performers at night were entertaining and it felt safe to walk around with children at night.

Tremendously Popular Neighborhood Especially at Night. We walked to Darling Harbor late on a Saturday afternoon to enjoy the crowds (massive), eat dinner (at one of many waterfront restaurants), and see the fireworks (every Saturday night during the summer). Mission accomplished! It is a fun area that will be even more crowded in the future when the new Sydney Convention Center is completed.

Love Darling harbour.. This was our second time on Darling harbour, both our hotels were within walking distance, (10 minutes). Lots to do and see, plenty of placed to eat. Access to the local railway service and various bus routes. There is the National maritime museum there and also an aquarium. A good central point to stay whilst in Sydney.

Good nighttime atmosphere. A beautiful part of Sydney, loads of stuff to do here, restaurant are all reasonable prices, some more expensive than others, but a varied choice to suit all pockets. Sea life centre is on the harbour. You can get a boat from here to Sydney or catch the open top sightseeing bus or even the water taxi ( although they are quite pricey. Lovely area and great for a night out too

Beautiful part of Sydney. We travelled by ferry for around 5 Dollars single. Ferry goes under the Harbour Bridge so provides a unique photo opportunity.. Plenty to see in this fabulous harbour with plenty of shops and restaurants. We visited the Maritime Museum and had a lovely cuppa in their restaurant. Take your time and explore all parts of this beautiful part of the City.

Major redevelopment underway. A very popular area which is presently undergoing major redevelopment. There is a very imaginative children's water park, lots of restaurants, an interesting skyline, nearby is The Powerhouse, Chinatown, Australian National Maritime Museum, Chinese Garden, Paddy's Market, the Capitol Theatre and ferry terminals. Nearest train station is Central

Simply Wonderful!!. So much to see and do truly an entertainment destination. There is a selection of restaurants, shops or you can even see a movie! Imax is conveniently located within Darling Harbour so no need to go anywhere else. While visiting Sydney we went to the Aquarium, Madame Tusades and even caught a ferry to Circular Quay. Whatever your travel plans are Darling Harbour is suited to everyone. On our last night there we even got to watch the fireworks!! Who doesn’t like fireworks!!
Sisters. Walking distance from our hotel. Excellent lunch specials. So not only having a delicious lunch but EXCELLENT views out onto Darling Harbour
Sydney from the ocean. You need to bring jacket. Sometimes it's very cold there. Great view in Aquarium museum. Restaurant koalas and kangaroos, beautiful
The real hub of tourism in Sydney. all the big attractions are there, Madame Tussauds etc, very crowded, lots of restaurants, right on the sea.

Love the vibe . Great place, simply love it at the darling harbour.
Happening place and lots of options for everyone

Great!!!!. One of the two best places to spend time for entertainment in Sydney.Aquarium museum ships boats great seaview cafes restaurants koalas and Kangaroos at the wild life attraction next to the aquarium.What else do you need to go there.It has everything and it's great.
Big area with lots to do. We visited the aquarium and walked through the harbor. There is a lot of restaurants there. A very touristic place but it has a nice atmosphere.
Beautiful . Loved Loved the Harbour. You will too. So much variety. Heaps to do and see. Yes....go here. You wont be disappointed.

best place to stay. My partner and i stayed at the darling harbour for our short holiday and we both liked it very much. The location was close to a few major attractions that we both thoroughly enjoyed and would recommend it for anyone who is staying for a quick visit.

Variety of things to do. Good restaurants - maritime museum - madam tussards - aquarium - IMAX theatre & children's' playground. Also you can catch a ferry to circular quay & visit the rocks area
& opera house.

Beautiful views and nice shops and restaurants. We stayed at the Four Points Hotel near Darling Harbour and went down to the harbor several times. I am in a wheelchair and several of the lifts were out of service which made getting down to the harbour walkway quite difficult. There is a wonderful old bridge across the harbor (I believe the Victoria Street bridge) that provides wonderful views of the harbor and allows easy access to the other side without having to walk around. There is also a Darling Harbor ferry terminal

Interesting. This harbor is the poor sister to the circular quay area Sydney but it is worth the visit.It is easily accessible with the hop on hop off bus or a cheap cab ride.Some beautiful walkways and a large pedestrian bridge with great views of a marina area.There is attached shopping but nothing but ordinary shops.

Pretty touristy for my tastes, but ok. I should preface this review by saying that I live in Southern California where we have a lot of the same kinds of things Darling Harbour has to offer. It's a pretty touristy part of town and as I also live in a touristy area, so it wasn't that different from the stuff I have at home. That being said, there's a nice aquarium there if you are into that and depending on where you live, you might find it a great place! So I would say if you aren't into super touristy stuff (like touristy restaurants and attractions) then skip it, but if you ARE into that, then definitely go! I think some people might really enjoy that area.

Lots of Restaurants. Darling harbour is really a place where you can see where the name comes from. It's very trendy yet also very romantic. And definetly a place to go for a romantic dinner with your spouse.There are plenty of restaurants to chose from and you can end the night on one of the dance floors.

Pretty Average tourist area. It had been some years since I last visited and I had expectations that it would have developed more, and hopefully gone a bit more up market. I guess it caters for first time visitors to Sydney reasonably well.

Enjoyable meandre along harbour front. Spent a long afternoon exploring all things nautical. Very wet afternoon but plenty to do inside as well as outside. Huge choice of eateries - great for all the family.

Lots of attractions & food . Stopped off in Darling Harbour as part of a boat cruise. Not really my thing as it felt really commercial for me.It has a wartime ship museum, madame tussards, sea life centre and lots of bars/restaurants.To me i could have been anywhere, it wasn't the place to be for an Australian tourist experience, nothing breathtaking or for the site see-ersDefinitely a place to go if you have children for an afternoon out but not necessarily a good tourist spot (apart from the eat) If you do go here make sure you visit the Chinese garden of friendship, that is worth a visit!!!
Our oz trip. Had a lovely evening here and there are many places to eat or have a drink, very much a tourist area but , a pleasant meal and evening was enjoyed

Very scenic and lively area. I do like Darling Harbour as it is full of many different restaurants and attractions for people to see and do.I really enjoy walking all around the harbour from the Hurricane bar and grill to the Imagine sign towards the rocks.During the day the area provides lots to see and do, whilst during the night the general hustle and bustle of people keeps it alive and all the pretty lights come on which is a sight to see.The only downside to this area is that I would class it as what I would call a tourist trap. Lots of tourists paying over the price costs for goods they could get better somewhere else. However I will say it is very convenient area to go to for drinks and food. At the weekend this place really does come alive!

Cool place to visit while in Sydney. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit while in Sydney. Great restaurants and pubs. You will find lots of good boat tours and ferries leave from this harbour. Lots of things to do for families of all ages with a maritime museum, sea life centre and zoo in one place. You also have a new imax cinema close by

Eateries abound. You will find many eateries at all price points in Darling Harbour. From Italian, tapas, steak, fish, pizza, gelato - and at all price points. We visited twice - on Monday evening restaurants were full, mostly with what appeared to be business people. On another visit on a weekend, the evening was not only busy with diners, but shoppers. The jumbo-tron on the water, with DJ and loud music, was a big draw for the 20-30 year old crowd. IMAX theater is located here too.

What a shame !. When I first visited Sydney in 2003, Darling Harbour was a lovely and jovial place ! I was shocked when I went back this afternoon. A huge and dirty construction site with no soul ! It's a real shame. What a waste !

Darling Harbour . Lots of changes since last visit. The attractive water fountains have all been removed, filled in & replaced with playground equipment, mini stalls etc.
might be better for families, but has lost of its picturesque appeal to me.

Lots to do here for every age. As we were staying near Darling Harbour, it was only a short walk across the Prymont Bridge to get to the Australian National Maritime Museum. You can take any amount of cruises here either on catamarans down to the water taxi rides and ferries going to Circular Quay.
