The Sydney Aquarium and Wild Life Sydney Zoo are also here along with Madam Tussauds and the Imax Theatre. The Powerhouse Musuem and the Chinese Garden of Friendship are also worth a visit. There is a good variety of shopping available and many eating places. The Star Casino and Sydney Lyric Theatre are situated here also.

Very busy and touristy. A top destination in Sydney, worth a look but not somewhere I wanted to spend a lot of time. Main place to get a day/tourist cruise. The aquarium and other tourist attractions are here.

A revitalized place along Sydney's harbour front. This area has been greatly transformed recently with many more restaurants, entertainment areas, etc. Fireworks on the weekend also make this place popular.

Great location, awesome activities around, close by Acquarium..... Lots to do around this place. We went in the evening over the weekend and got to check out the fireworks, which were a delight with the atmosphere working perfectly. They were screening Avatar in the lawn, lots of parties going around...quite some booze flowing through the bars around...its kind of crazy fun....
the best. this is the best place to stay in Sydney,so many bars and restaurants all along the harbour.you can sit here all day and people watch over a lovely bottle of wine ..... or TWO :-)
I LOVE DARLING HARBOUR!. Beautiful, in love with it. The atmosphere is fantastic and so much to do there. Peaceful by the harbour too!

Beautiful area of Sydney - lots to do. . Darling Harbor is really a beautiful part of Sydney. We spent quite a while walking around the area. There are tons of restaurants and bars. There are also a lot of areas for younger kids to play if you are traveling as a family. The whole area looks quite new and fresh. Still construction going on for some major buildings that will be beautiful once finished.Whoever planned the area did a great job. If you walk across the pedestrian bridge to the other side of the harbor, take the time to walk another 1 kilometer and get to the Fish Market area. That was amazing for the food and sights to see. So worth going.

Too Touristy, Not Impressed. I try to avoid overly touristy places when I travel. Darling Harbor is one of those places. I have been there once and never really need to go back. There are the typical tourist places and shops. There was very little local appeal to it. To give you an idea of how geared toward tourist this place was, it had a Starbucks. I only saw 2 Starbucks on my entire 6 weeks in Australia. It was crowded and everything was overpriced.I actually became rather upset to walk by the "zoo" or wax museum and see a poor koala in locked in a small viewing area desperately clinging to a tree and being hounded by tourist trying to take his picture. If that is the kind of Sydney/Australian experience you would like, then go to Darling Harbor.

Great spot. I have been here on several occasion. Sometime we'll take our daughter to the play ground and enjoys the little zip line. Lots of restaurants to choose from. Great place to be on Australia Day especially to watch the fireworks
Might be great someday. Not sure how lucky no it's been a construction nightmare but as of this review I can't say it's very interesting unless you sell large cranes

My Favourite Place in the World!! ;). I have lived on 4 different continents in the world and travelled extensively but on a recent trip to Sydney, I realised my opinion of Darling Harbour hasn't changed one little bit! Over the last 15 years I've had the chance to visit Sydney more than once but I hadn't been for quite a while, this time I visited with a husband and two kids. Darling Harbour being my favourite part of my favourite city ... now it's become a favourite place for all of us! From the Saturday evening fireworks over the summer months, to the choice of restaurants, to the newer kids free play areas, the aquarium, museums, ferries providing easy access to the rest of Sydney ... what's not to love! Can't wait until I can get to go back again ... with all the current developments it's set to be even better!! ;)

Aquarium and Madam Tussauds - Fantastic!!!. Darling Harbour is not the place in Sydney to go shopping, but if you enjoy attractions then make sure you take a look at the Aquarium and Madam Tussauds...go online and purchase a three or five visit pass and save $$$.

museum . we went and explore the boots that was an eye opener how they live in this crowded places it is worth to visit you appreciate how soldiers defend your life on tv it looks pretty cool but going in there give you a good look have fun

Highlight of a week in Sydney. Our first trip to Sydney and we chose to stay and play on Darling Harbour. The location , the shops and eateries...everything you need is just a short walk or ferry ride away...we stayed a week and is wasn't long enough!

The'new' 'Sydney. Spent Australia Day there, enjoyed it immensely, many bars and restaurants suitable for all, good walkways, many boats and ferries, the evening ending with an impressive firework display.

nice spot. I have a nice meals here....great food...great scenery especially for you as your first visit in sidneyi have a bigest burger ever in my life. can't wait to have an opportunities to visit darling harbour and try another restaurant there.very nice experience
Beautiful!. Heaps to do for all ages, lovely setting, restaurants, bars a plenty. Would be a great place to stay.

Wonderful Atmosphere. The energy and atmosphere at Darling Harbour is wonderful. There are so many great restaurants to choose from, shopping and family entertainment that you could spend all day here and still not see everything. I love Darling Harbour, it is one of my faves when visiting Sydney.
never miss this place. everything is here. beautiful place and equally beautiful people. dining places are a little costly but good food. nice place to walk around with your family

Tourist mecca. Darling Harbour has become like so many other attractions around the world. It's been taken over by the tourists period noisy, crowded, and with a few too many chain restaurants for my liking. If you are interested in are the fireworks they are visible from other places in the city such as Barrangaroo.

fascinating activities at Darling harbour. Darling harbor has a history of more 7000 years and it has undergone changes from time to time and has become place of great attraction in the last century. It continues to have its own importance for various activities with restaurants, cruise ride etc.

Great for family activities. Darling has restaurants, bars, and plenty for children the worlds largest IMAX cinema, zoo, sea world attractions, plus a play area. The adults have the views whilst drinking a cold beer or glass of wine near the harbour. If you are a walker you can follow the path along the waterfront back to The Rocks and Circular Quay, lovely stroll when it's not too hot

Great place with lots of attractions. Its very easy to travel from here both public boat trips and so easy to walk around the city.The maritime exhibition is excellent too.Lots of places to eat here all budgets.

A very interesting part of the Sydney Harbour Scene. This is yet another part of Sydney Harbour around the corner from the famous bridge. There are lots of shops and restaurants here as well as interesting Maritime things - ships, submarine etc. it us great to sit in one of the cafés and just enjoy the views and the scenery.
Awesome. Nicer lace to take the family, some major construction work going on, but will be awesome when it's finished, nice places to eat, and just soak up the sun
So much to see and do in Darling Harbour. We spent hours walking around Darling Harbour and enjoyed the sights and could have spent all day there

Fun for everyone. There is so much to do here. Maritime museum, HMAS Vampire, HMB Endeavour, HMAS Onslow all on the same price package admission. Variety of restaurants, shopping and IMAX theatre. Children's playground area.
A nice area to walk around. I walked here from my hotel and walked around the harbour area. I had a nice time. Easy wide walk ways felt very safe. Would love to come back and spend more time here.

Second visit and even better than the first . Darling harbour constantly amazes me with its restaurants, aquariums, entertainment and shops! Second time down from Adelaide and only improved since last time and being here around Australia Day makes for plenty of excitement

great. great place to sit with a beer and watch the world go by.
madam teusauds, sealife and wildlife centres are all here

Awesome harbour. From viewing fireworks to having great food, Darling harbour offers something for everyone. In the past 8 years I have visited this place at least once every month and I never get tired for walking around and exploring the various sights, food, activities, events and fireworks every Sat.

not what it was. Have been many times over the last 20years .
Now it is more like a small mall .
They have a small food hall.
There are the tourist shops all things Australian good for some one from over
seas .
There are some restaurants.
Its the place when theirs not much to do.

Darling Harbour cruise. We took a Christmas Eve cruise on Vagabond cruises on Christmas Eve. It was an excellent cruise with decent food and some entertainment. The best part of the cruise was meeting nice people from all over the world and the fabulous harbour, harbour bridge and Sydney Opera House views. Took some fabulous pictures!

Great place for food and shopping. We stayed close by at the Hilton and really enjoyed the restaurant and shopping selection of Darling Harbor. In addition, there are several other activities here including the Maritime Museum and Sydney Heritage Fleet and the James Craig which we took on New Year's Eve.
Nice way ro chill. Spent an afternoon just chilling out walking around Darling Harbour plenty of restaurants and shops nice view's

lovely harbour. this is a great harbour that is just under the harbour bridge to the left of circular quay. there is a lovely shopping mall, plenty of restaurants imax theatre maritime museum sea world wildlife world so much to do here there is also a lovely childrens playpark there is a lot of construction going on behind the harbour at present not sure if its hotels or something else but it does not disturb your day in darling harbour there is also childrens merry go rounds and a big wheel at the moment. we love coming down here when we come to sydney

Make the effort to go here. It's about 20 minutes to walk here from Circular Quay but it's worth it. There are a lot more restaurants right in the waterfront and bars too. It's a nice harbour with plenty going on.
Interesting location, full of life. Various food choices, drinks, shopping and the intriguing Maritime museum all at Darling Harbour. Very good area for families.

What a buz. With more than 25 million visitors per annum, Darling Harbour must be our darling destination. 9 pm fire works, restaurants, musicians, live entertainment, water transport. The entire area is getting a face lift with new conference facilities, hotels and joins the new developments of Barangaroo. It will ever increase in popularity. Great to visit today and even more so in the future.

My favourite place in Sydney!. Great views (once the construction works are finished it will be better). So much to offer! The shopping centre could do with a few new shops but for a day out Darling Harbour is great. Tons of restaurants to chose from and even more bars. Blue Fish is a personal favourite for seafood & Blackbird do great cocktails. Eat love pizza is absolutely rubbish .. Service & food are very behind on what the rest of the harbour has to offer. The sunset menu at Baia is great value for money but staff aren't great. Hurricanes aren't as good as they used to be. Cyren are brilliant for both bar snacks and dinner. Cocktails are delicious and even tastier when it's happy hour. Meat and wine Co has been recommended to us various times but we were disappointed. Over price for average food. Watershed another for good food and drinks. Overall well worth the visit, even if it's just to grab an ice cream and watch the fireworks!
Fantastic.. Lots of stuff to do here. Plenty places to choose from to Eat and Drink. You also have thr Imax and thr over bridge and also a few shops near the Qantas Stadium

Interesting!. Darling harbour was very lively. It had a huge outdoor playground for kids and an outdoor theatre for all. Lots of food options along the harbour. Great place to ppl watch and to watch the sunset.

Darling Harbour. We love visiting Darling Harbour when we stay overnight in Sydney. The hussle and bussle is awesome, the environment is very clean, easy to get to, so many restaurants and cafes, something for everyone, the fireworks are awesome. Just love to sit and watch the world go by, and the night lights are also amazing ...

Great. This a brilliant thing to go to you can get a ferry from circular quay or the bus or walk.There is everything for all ages lovely resturants fast food cafes ice ream parlours .You have pleasure cruises water taxis and lots of lovely shops and hotels .In the harbour you have warship museums the Endevour which sailed to England and lots of other ships.Also there is a cinema you can spend a full day here.
Shops. A lot of this seems to be under construction at the moment. Some great places to eat ,enjoyed the iMax movie theatre.
Place for entertainment. If you are looking for some entertainment this is the place i would recommend it to you. Many shows are held here like 4D movies and all. Quite near to opera house.

Fun for everyone. Darling Harbour caters for all age groups and tastes. We went with two grand children under 10 and we all had a ball. There are a great variety of eateries through out the complex most of which are very family friendly, there is the water play park, the swings and other playground goodies, the antique carousel. Also within the complex are Madam Tussauds, the aquarium,the maritime museum (for Pop) etc.The fire works on Saturday night are well worth staying out a bit later.

So cosmapolitan. Loved darling harbour !The trip over on the boat is lovely. The harbour is full of sky rise building and hotels, it's all very modern. There are lovely boats all lined up along the harbour. The shops and bars are great, but for me it's the restaurants that make this harbour so special. Eating outside watching the boats come In and out is lovely. Every Saturday night at 9 pm they have a spectacular fireworks display.
If you are a more mature person stay here and avoid circular quay. Beautiful place. Great affordable restaurants and bars. Safe for children. Less populated than Circular Quay
Darling quarter playground brilliant!. So much to do for our young children at the enormous playground. Their favourite was the water playground. I loved the coffee and shady trees!

Fab hub of Sydney.!!. A great place for entertainment, museums, eateries, ferries, trains etc. Lovely to just walk around and enjoy the amenities. Massive rebuilding going on at present and will be fantastic when all finished.

Mingle with the cosmopolitan throng.. Visiting Sydney we were taken to Darling Harbour by friends and were amazed at the thousands of people of every conceivable nationality enjoying strolling, sightseeing, dining at the numerous restaurants or just chatting and relaxing on a lovely evening. Thankfully with smoking now banned the area was spotlessly clean and everyone seemed to be thoroughly enjoying this special part of Sydney, a must for any visitor.

Activity Galore. It's easy to overlook this area with all that Circular Quay has to offer, but we are so glad that we did not miss it! The huge boardwalk along the harbour is magnificent, clean, wide and welcoming with more restaurants than you can imagine. Here you can book water tours or packages for entrance fees to attractions. It's where you will find the Sea Life Aquarium and Madame Tussauds.Walk across the flag-draped Pedestrian Bridge for a great view of both sides of the harbour. There are sailing ships, ferries and yachts for the sea lovers and varied architectural delights for the land lovers.
Another must see in Sydney. Great place to stroll around, watch the boats and the people and chose from tons of places to eat, satisfying every taste and budget.

Great central location. Darling Harbour offers a fantastic central meeting point with many bars and restaurants and is adjacent to the centre of Sydney. Good to walk round with fantastic views or simply hop on a ferry to explore other parts of Sydney. Did I mention there are some fantastic coffee shops.
Darling Harbour. Lovely place to walk around, shops, and plenty of places to eat, from just having a coffee or a meal. It was Christmas time when we visited so was nicely decorated.

Loads of Construction. Love Darling Harbour but now it looks like a construction site with the new convention centre and hotel being built, not due for completion until Dec 2016. Such a nice place but now it looks like a building site.

Foodies , tourists or family this place caters all!. Not the harbor you expect , this is an old type with small and big boats cruises , yachts ,navy ships this got all. 1000s of Food outlets and low to high end Restaurants .

A highlight of Sydney. A highlight of Sydney. Offers bars and restaurants with a great view of the Harbour and the city's CBD. It provides a great family atmosphere in the afternoon and a decent nightlife on a Friday and Saturday night for young visitors. It houses the Aquarium, Wildlife Zoo, the Harbourside Shopping Centre and is about a 10 minute walk from the Star Casino. A number of hotels are situated along and nearby the Harbour, making it a great place to stay in Sydney.

Good for shops and eating out.. A good shopping centre which was busy when it rained non stop for 4 days in early January.
Very busy at weekends
Must visit . Darling Harbour its a must place to visit while in Sydney.. Lots of places to eat and have a drink .. Lot of shops to browse through.

Great for tourists. We stayed in the Darling Harbour during the summertime and Sydney Festival when there are many activities and special opportunities for visitors It features the Harbourside Shopping Centre. A great food court can be found on the ground floor, featuring many cuisines at cheap prices. Restaurants abound with many dining options. It is pretty at night time to sit and watch Sydney CBD light up. Whilst we were there, there was an evening outdoor theatre for families with some great movies to watch. There are also two ferry terminals to Circular Quay. The Pyrmont Footbridge allows people to walk to and from the CBD of Sydney.
Day out. Great place to start your day , you can catch a boat or train , bus ,all within this area , very busy all times of the day , you can sit have a meal , drink or just people watch
Great Restaurants Here. Looking at tour boats is so-so, but the number of good restaurants within the harbor area is great. The Aquarium is also there, which is unusual, and decent.

A must when in Sydney - especially saturdays at 9:00pm. Restaurants, ice-cream bars, people, great views, playground, people, streetentertainers, restaurants, people,,,you get the drift? Excellent place to just strole about, watch people and the views, have lunch/dinner (Braza recommended for dinner) and the Imax theater is here if you'd like to watch a movie on a seriously big screen. Go, enjoy it all!PS: the fireworks show goes off at 9:00pm on saturdays, not to be missed!

Can spend a whole day here, a lot to see and do. Darling Harbour is so close to the city. You can spend a whole day here. There is the Maritime Museum, the Imax theatre, Chinese Gardens, the Sydney Aquarium and much more. There are also many restaurants and shops here.

A Darling. We arrived by ferry having viewed Darling Harbour from the sea, very busy lots of places to eat and drink. For those interested there is a vast shopping centre. There is a Naval ship that you can go on board and view. Lots to do a great place to visit including the Aquarium and Madam Tuesauds.
Amazing sights. This habour is amazing and with well planned surrounding cafes, restaurants, shops and places of interest.

Good times. A very different place from the last time we visited in 2008 - we were impressed at the amount of variety of bars and restaurants in the area. Its turning into a very nice area and you can also walk from the harbour to circular quay but get your walking shows on as its a way when not used to it. Definitely worth a visit.

Sydneyland?. This place hosts some of Sydney's major attractions ( wildlife Sydney, madame Tussaud, the aquarium, ... ) and a huge combination of restaurants and cafés. It feels more like a theme park than a real part of the city.

Always buzzing. A good starting point to get to anywhere, buzzing, plenty to see either views or attractions. Copious restaurants ranging from light meal, snacks, drinks and dinner. Boat trips start here to visit other areas. Hop on hop off bus starts here too.
lazy day on the harbour. Great place to visit however at the moment construction work makes it difficult will be great once all work is completed Still a good place to visit
My Darling. Darling isn't so big so you can walk around easily.Its more interesthing to do Your walk At night.Then is It crowdy and noisy.So,iTS good for THE youngsters and THE voyeurs.

A cool location. What a lovely spot to spend some time ambling around the harbour, looking up at the City, looking around at the boats, and looking out for a nice spot to enjoy a coffee (you don't have to look far at all.) So close to the CBD. Don't miss it.

Lots of work going on in the vicinity - a bit dated. Yes lots of places still open but the vibe is changing - it is a reasonable place to spend a few hours but isn't as it was many years ago, more resembling a building site in parts
A great afternoons walk. Lots to see and do around the harbour shops eating and drinking areas, harbour performers and boat trips book in advance

Worth a visit. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit. There are shops, restaurants and tourist attractions. We were here in November and there was a Santa Festival that was very cute.There are plenty of places to eat, the food is good, or this is a great place to sit and have a drink.There are shops here to buy some great gifts to bring home.
Cinema and Wildlife. Lots of stuff to do there - shopping, eating, walking and koala cuddling. A trip to the aquarium and the wildlife will not go amiss.
Must Visit!. We visited it on the ferry to Circular Quay. Darling Harbour was on the way. The same Opal card works for all public transport!

Fire works at 9. This is one of those places in Sydney that's worth a visit, it has a ton of bars and things to do but also has fireworks weekly at 9! that is one of the best things about Darling harbour so if you are planning to come to Darling Harbour make sure its at 9 PM

Great spot for mid afternoon drinks. Some great pubs and cafes that is perfect for a mid-afternoon drink/meal. By night, there are clubs such as Home Nightclub that absolutely goes off on a Friday night. Best place to catch live sport is at One World.

Worth a visit. Despite being a major tourist area - loaded with restaurants, bars & people - it is worth the short walk from city central. Here you can get a great panoramic picture of the harbor & city skyline.
Horrible histories small . The martime musuem good / horrible histories could have had more info like its show / i had fun with cannon fire n pirate gear and

Holiday. Fantastic view there was lots to do heret would recommend visiting this place if your in Sydney the only thing i could fault was when we went for lunch the waiter took along time to serve us.

Darling Harbour.. Once part of the commercial port of Sydney, and known as The Hungry Mile. It is now home to many public facilities and attractions. Enjoyed a nice meal at one of the many restuarants, and looking round the shops.
Fantastic. Shops, restaurants, ferry, museum and lots more. A little groundy but I would reccomend. They are air B&B near.
Darling Harbour. Absolutely perfect - you can sit with a drink and people watch all night long. Stunning, and cannot wait to go back

Lovely views, places to eat and stuff to do.. We had a drink at a bar over looking the harbor before going to the IMAX. The views at night are great and the IMAX is one the biggest screens in the world. If your a film buff like me, you can't miss out on going.

A Darling Day And Good For Families . This is a bit more laid back and quieter than say the Sydney Harbour. It offers restaurants for everyone's budget. The Aquarium is here as well as Wild Life Sydney Zoo, Madame Tussaud, IMAX Theater, 9D Theater, Maritime Museum and so much more. The only thing I didn't like was the Harborside Shops but it had a nice food court that had something for everyone. Do not miss visiting this area.

Outdoor Megamall. If you want all your shopping and attractions in one place, this is it. There are major chains, local tourism targeted businesses and museums, tourist attractions, an IMAX movie theatre and restaurants of all kinds.. Pick carefully and it is a worthwhile visit.

A short walk from the CBD. Just a great location and once you get your bearings in this city a very easy place to find. It's a very busy, commercial eating and drinking area that has fantastic harbour views. There are numerous establishments that will suit just about everyones palate. However it does get completely mobbed especially late afternoon/early evening, so book or be prepared to wait and I mean almost everywhere.
Great location. We used Darling harbour as our base for a holiday in Sydney. Great restaurants and bars, although quite busy

Disappointed. After leaving the Powerhouse Museum we headed to Darling Harbour. Lots of building work going on and poor signage. At one place we were unsure where to cross the road. It was a hot day when we were there. Shade available outside cafes and eateries. Lots of seagulls, ibis and other birds scavenging food which is a bit off putting. Very commercial with lots of building work. Preferred Circular Quay, and the view is better there.

Darling Harbour Area. Darling Harbour surprised us with the eating choices and shopping. Very busy place with a lot going on. (FYI - Hard Rock Café can be found here if you are into their merchandize.) Nice park for families with kids just south of the Harbour.

go for special events - and take the kids!. Darling Harbour run special events throughout the year. There is often a busking festival at Easter (called Hoopla!), a christmas Santa festival, Australia day events, Christmas in July, South American Festival... and lots of others. Check their website for what is happening. During these festivals, there is often free entertainment on stages thoughout darling harbour, and some ticketed activities or shows. We often take the kids in (you can park on the weekend relatively cheaply, or take advantage of $2.50 Sunday travel on the Opal card), see a show, and then take them to the water play (bring a change of clothes or swimmers) and huge kids playground - the playground is really one of the best in town, though beware it can get crowded. There is a giant chess set near the water play area too. There is a carousel and a few other rides if you are prepared to shell out the money for these too. If you bring the kids' scooter there are lovely paved areas for them to scooter around as well! The food around darling harbour is pretty ho-hum, expensive for what it is, and nothing terribly special, but there is plenty of variety if you want to grab a bite to eat.
Would go again. There is so much to do here for both young and old! there were firework shows when we were there and they staff said around 10000 were due to attend!
Go on. Great place for food and drink just sit relax and watch the people go by very busy as you would expect but with loads of places your really spoilt for choice
Perfect. I preferred Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. Lots of restaurants and bars and lovely walks around the shops. Seems to be vibrant and happening place to be

Busy but relaxing waterfront. There are lots of places to visit here : The National Maritime Museum, the Aquarium, Wild Life Centre and more. Lots of bars and restaurants along the waterfront, nice to sit and watch the ferries and tourist tour boats come and go. You could easily spend a whole day here.

Could be better, too much work happening.. I have always looked forward to visiting Darling Harbour. But at the moment it is full of building works, so it is so loud, busy and all you want to do is escape. Hopefully in the future it will be great again but now it is annoying.

An ok place to wander, but don't make a major detour. There's nothing either remarkably good or particularly bad about Darling Harbour. It has some shops, some restaurants, the ferry stops there, there's a museum. We enjoyed a wander round for a couple of hours, had a decent meal, looked at the shops. All acceptable ways to pass the time. Unlikely to either thrill or disappoint

vibrant and busy. a beautifull and busy harbour something for everyone and all cultures.lots to do for all ages,plenty of shops,eating houses,bars,great company with the local people too. Very friendly lot in Sydney.
Lovely place for a stroll and some food. Darling harbour has a range of entertainment and food options. We went there on Xmas Day for a meal with the family and it was lovely.

Fabulous!. We stayed just off Darling Harbour and it's fabulous. Really alive and full of bars and restaurants. Lots of fresh fish which is great for me. A really vibrant part of Sydney that is well worth going to. Will stay then again for definite.

Beautiful!. We were in Darling Harbor for Halloween, 2015. In the U.S., we don't typically have fireworks for Halloween, but we certainly enjoyed their beautiful display! With the "holiday", all the restaurants around the harbor, with a water view were extremely crowded; understandably so, given the fireworks display! It was a wonderful surprise, and it's a beautiful area.
K Farrelly . So much to see and do all in a small area. Great places to eat and so many fun things to do like the aquarium, madame tussaudes, wildlife park and Harbour Jet boat.
Nice to stroll around. As the darling harbour was close to our hotel we enjoyed it to stroll along the restaurants and shops

Good Point for drink, eat and enjoy!. Its one of the tourist attraction, Nice place to chill and relax with loved ones. Kind of happening place.. i have visited during christmas soo the place looked crowded and happening.

Beautiful area. Apart from the sun there are numerous attractions to suit all types from people watching to whale watching, numerous cafes and restaurants including the Harmd Rock cafe, Lindt Cocolatier and many more, a sea life aquarium and a Madame Thussauds, well worth the visit

Neat Part of the City. We walked down from our hotel - the area is really touristy, but has a lot to do. Neat places to grab food, shop, and visit the wildlife zoos. You can also catch water taxis to other areas of the city from here.

The place to be in, while visiting Sydney!. This is must visit part of Sydney and rightly so since it provides something to everyone. It's set up in fabulous surroundings, looks gorgeous & modern and has a very vibrant overall feel too the whole area. No words can define what one experiences at Darling Harbour and neither can any visit to Sydney can be complete without visiting Darling Harbour. Do plan to spend good time when visiting Darling Harbour due the immense choices of eateries, bars etc. it offers or simply consider a cruise on Starship Sydney Cruise.

What a surprise. Our hotel was close by but we kept going to Sydney harbor instead. Darling is perfect for families and singles. Tons of restaurants, shopping and entertainment. Lots of construction going on at the new convention center on one side and Barangaroo Point on the other. BP has a beautiful new park that is well worth the walk. Darling is also right next to Chinatown for a great meal. Worth the visit.
Good . Lots of shops. And things to do. Great to spend the day looking around and walking around the harbour.....Has a Ferris wheel wheel. $9 a ride. For about 5 minutes

Great night life. We found ourselves really hanging out here a lot in the evening between Lnydt chocolate and the numerous restaurants we had many good meals and fun nightsLike most of Sydney this area is vet crowded and more tourists then locals which is what we found disappointing but that is our issue as prefer more local culture and did not really feel that in Sydney overall

Slum to Tourist Mecca. For the many years I lived in Sydney, Darling Harbour was a rat-infested series of decaying wharves and docks.It was named after Lieutenant General Ralph Darling, who was Governor of the colony of New South Wales from 1825 to 1831. It was originally part of the commercial port of Sydney, and had sea, rail, tram and road links for the import and export of goods.During the Great Depression of 1929 it became known as "The Hungry Mile" because of the long queues of wharf side workers seeking work.Darling Harbour never revived and continued to degenerate. It was not until the 1980s that the NSW Government accepted a plan to redevelop the whole area as a pedestrian and tourist precinct. Darling Harbour today is full of restaurants, tourist attractions, Including the Chinese Gardens, the National Maritime Museum and the Sydney Aquarium.You can spend a whole day walking around Darling Harbour, visiting one attraction after the other, and having lunch at any number of restaurants ranging from the cheap and cheerful to fine dining with waiter service and spectacular views over the harbor;

Favourite harbour.. This is by far the best harbour out of the 2 (Sydney and Darling) I found there was so much more going on, a lot more night life and bars/restaurants. Highly recommend if your in Sydney to check this place out. Some lovely restaurants! Pricey but worth it!

eating out. darling harbour is brilliant if you are looking for somewhere cheaper than sydney harbour to eat out. there is a very live atmosphere and they have a firework show every saturday at 9pm which is great for families. they also have an imax cinema which is currently the largest in the world and a hard rock cafe and lindt shop

Changing Face of Sydney. A busy and vibrant place, with a choice of different venues to pick up a meal, snack and/or coffee. There are shops for browsing, street entertainment, concerts at various times. A ferris wheel features at $8 pp. Worth a visit, though currently much construction work means some congestion.

Entertainment mecca. If it's entertainment you want then Darling harbour is the place to go. With attractions such as the maritime museum, Madame tussouds, wildlife zoo, aquarium, imax, awesome children's playground etc. It is also just round the corner from Chinatown, the star and paddy's market. Get there with the lightrail using the star, pyrmont, convention, exhibition or paddy's station. You can also get there by ferry. If you want to park there are plenty of parking areas but be ready for a hefty price.

Darling Harbour in winter. Joined a friend for dinner in Darling Harbour and found a temporary winter wonderland with ice ring and igloo. Fair lights and snow. Even had fireworks at the end of the evening.

Lots to do and see with plenty of shade.. Darling Harbour is suitable for all weathers. It has lots of visitor attractions, resturants, children play areas and water transport. Both times that I have been there have been water special attrations, This time was a firework display at 9pm.

Not to be missed!. We nearly missed out on darling harbour as there wasn't a big enough deal made about it! Luckily one day it was raining and we decided to go to Madame Tussaud's which is located at Darling Harbour otherwise we never would have known about it and it was my favourite part of Sydney! We had a few drinks in different bars, and walked about, the rain didn't dampen the darling harbour beauty! Went for dinner in Hard Rock Cafe where the staff were fantastic. Really enjoyed our walk around Darling Harbour, visiting the Chinese gardens and just taking in the beauty of it all, definitely a place not to be missed when in Sydney!!

It has a bit of everything. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit, it has tonnes of (quite expensive) restaurants, a shopping centre, a cinema, an aquarium, a zoo, Madame Tussauds and more.The harbour is particularly good at night time, when you get the colourful reflections of the surrounding buildings in the water.There is also a free fireworks show at 9pm every Saturday, it's a pretty good show and lasts for about 8 minutes.

Fun area of town... While we thought The Rocks was very cool, we also had fun at Darling Harbor. Lots of modern restaurants, bars, sea life aquarium, etc. Tons of people walking around (maybe too many at times), but fun. Catch the ferry over and walk around.

Wedding weekend. We had travelled to Sydney for a wedding and stayed at Oaks Goldsborough apartments,Darling Harbour.darling Harbour is very touristy and has nothing much to offer other than cafes(so..so) and The Aquarium. The Aquarium is good but the rest is no big deal.Unless you go for something in particular,I would give it a miss.

Lovely in the sun. Busy place to visit with the kids. Aquarium, Nature Wildlife and Madame Tussaud's along with access to all the ferrys a shopping mall. There are tons of places to eat and a great kids play area. Would recommend

Great to wander, though quite expensive for food. It's a lovely site to visit, with lots to do- aquarium, museums, tons of nice bars and restaurants although a lot of these can be quite pricey. Aim for happy hours! Use the cheap ferry for travel between here and the main harbour (Circular Quay)
Brilliant area. A must to visit if you are visiting Sydney. Lots of restaurants and shops as well as old and reconstructions of historic sailing ships.

Great fun for everyone. darling harbour is such a fun place to go for all groups of people. There is an imax, an outdoor playground, lots of great coffee places and cafes/restaurants. There are activities such as fast jet boat rides, water taxis and you can catch the ferry.

Yuk!. I just didn't get Darling Harbour! It appears to be being builtup as a huge modern entertainment centre with many large hotels, restaurants and shops etc. For me it had no character or soul. There was nothing particularly appealing. It was very busy but is not an attractive place to visit. Was probably the only part of Sydney we visited that we did not like. Lots of construction going on so it will only get bigger and uglier.
Definitely for kids. You can spend the whole day at darling harbor, jumping from one activity center to another. Namely, Wild life zoo, aquarium, madam tussaud, maritime musuem, Lindt cafe, and mall.
Many Attractions. The Harbour is a beautiful area to stroll around and see one of the many attractions there or enjoy the views from a good selection of restaurants. Touristy but in a fun way.

Very touristy. The title says its all: this is tourist central. I would not have gone there if I could do it again. Just a long line of the same, big box restaurant, the same Madame Tousous (SP) wax museum, and a grossly overpriced aquarium. Go to the beach instead.
A must do. We walked through Darling Harbour on our way to the city each morning. There is always plenty to do, loads of restaurants and has fireworks on the weekend!
Bustling area, bring money!. Huge area! So much to do, shopping, dining, museums, tours, and more. Wear good shoes for lots of walking. Nightlife is loud and music is thumping all hours of day.

Enjoyed Darling Harbour at night and by day. So much to see in Darling harbour and went when they had a light show which was really neat by night. By day there was an art exhibition with exhibits around the harbour. Neat to see so many attractions within easy access of each other ie. The Rocks, Ferries etc. Restaurants, Opera house, Harbour bridge, shops etc.

Fantastic and getting even better!. Restaurants, bars, shops, IMAX, the Chinese Gardens, etc, etc, etc. It's a lot of bustling fun now, but Darling Harbor also has lots under construction, so I can't imagine how very cool it will be in the next year or so.

Wow get lost in the environment!. Where to start, what to do, what to see? What a great place and location and attraction to spend one day or 2 days here. Restaurants, bars, museums and warships to visit. There is something for everyone at all ages. bargains can be had at the restaurants, cold beers, juicy steaks and share plates if you want. The new water gardens are great for everyone and the Chinese gardens are worth seeing but you have to pay now. You must not miss this place out!

Lots of tourist activities to do. Lots of restaurants, cafes, and bars to choose from. It also have a shopping center right on the water front. There's also an aquarium for families to do things together. At night good place to start for drinks and dinner...

Lovely to go by ferry. Been there many times by ferry lovely sights lovely restaurants good food the casino is close by the view is excellent many of the first class hotels are adjoining darling harbour
Darling Harbour. excellent place to visit with children of all ages, kids enjoyed the playground and sight seeing at the water and the lovely walk around the promenade. excellent places for dinning.

The view is breathtaking!. We were there just as they were setting up for Santa Fest the day after Thanksgiving and every day of the 5 we were there, there was a new Santa sighting larger than life; flags, a giant 25 ' one from milk cartons, blown up ones, maze areas, it was just so festive. Add in all the normally there restaurants, boats, water taxis, info center, mall and locals skateboarding or hustling to work. Our hotel was right there and we strolled the harbor every day en route to a new attraction in Sydney. Perfect way to start our vacation.

Amazing place to be at night . Best place for me in Sydney specially during night. It has got cøol bars, amazing restaurants and the best part was I visited on Saturday and got lucky to see the fire work which happens on every Saturday.Dinner at indian restaurant "Zaffron" made the night perfect.
Great place to visit. Excellent central area to stay in for touring Sydney. Lots of great bars, eateries and retail shops in the area. Harbour is a stop for the majority of the harbour boat tours.
No title. Nice place to waste my time. Almost every weekend i come to this place for a fresh air. Close to my apartment, nice view perfect for inspiration seeker.

Spectacular place stunning views. Darling harbour is a beautiful sight. The lovely boats that are here , some are for rent, plenty of tourist places to book trips with. There is a shopping centre with 2 or 3 floors. Fast food restaurant among other harbour side cafés. A lovely place to sit and people watch

Lots to do, takes more than a day.. We arrived late mainly because it was SO hard to find parking. Once that feat was accomplished we discovered that it was a very large area with so many shops restaurants etc there was no way to see and do it all in a day. leaves something for next time !

Very nice area to walk around in Sydney. We walked through Darling Harbour and the Maritime Museum. You can get a good look at the naval ships without paying admission. We proceeded to walk across the Pyrmont Bridge towards the Queen Victoria Building. There are a lot of shops and restaurants near the harbour. You can also access Chinatown or the Star Casino if either of those interest you.

Trendy busy attraction. Plenty of choice no matter what time of day you visit this pleasant harbour hotspot. There are some prices restaurants but also plenty of others that do deals at certain times of the day. If still not satisfied there is the food court out of the sun.

Amazing !. I love the darling harbour area as it s full of cafes and restaturants and is always busy. However my food and drink experience in darling harbour area were not great during several times that I have visited sydney in the last 8 years. This time I went to a mall on the other side of the main building ( with the Lindth cafe and swan pool) and bought two sushi roles but it was very overpriced compared to the other food courts in Sydney central and was mainly filled with rice.
Wonderful experience. Darling Harbour has a number of attractions. One of the best best places to spend your time . The harbour is rather neat and after dusk has great views.
Gorgeous. I totally LOVE this place! It's a great tourist spot in the heard of Sydney, surrounded by restaurants which give you a stunning view of the harbor. I could sit there for hours.
Must visit place. This place is full of restaurants, bars, shopping arcades and LIFE. Peaceful area to hang around. We visited here daily for 4 days.

Beautifull place in Sydney. In Darling Harbour you got a lot of nice restaurants and bars with a good view of the harbour. Specially at night times it is a beautifull spot with al the lights that are reflecting in the water.In some periods there is also some beautifull firework in the harbour. It is one of the spots you have to visit in Sydney!
My favourite place in Sydney. Darling Harbour is a lovely place. There are so many lovely bars and restaurants to sit and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. Make sure you come here.

Shop, eat and drink on the water's edge. Always a good walk around Darling Harbour. No vehicles adds to the charm. Lots and lots of places to visit, eat, drink and shop at. Well worth the visit on every trip to Sydney. Used to be even better when the monorail stopped there but c'est la vie, now it's best to walk in from King Street.
Loved it!. Quite touristy but beautiful all the same. Worth adding it to your list. Nice for an evening walk. Restaurants have good early bird specials too. Worth checking out!

Gorgeous place in Sydney. Beautiful tourist hot spot in heart of SydneySurrounded by restaurants with the view of the harbour.. It's perfect for a walk and a meal in the evening ...Must do when in Sydney..
Great atmosphere. This is a great place to be esoecially at night when the harbour area comes to life with peope strolling around and the bars and restaurants are full.

Clean and bustling. Everything in one place, close to the city. Children's area, toilets, restaurants, shops and souvenir shops, berths for ferries and tour boats, sea life centre and wildlife centre, imax cinema, some seasonal attractions and so much more. Tourist information centre is also here. Clean and very well maintained.

Convenient location. Easy access to entertainment venues.. Walking distance to Chinatown, Fish Market, IMAX, even fireworks every Saturday in Jan & Feb 2016! Easy access to ferries which can take you Circular Quay too.
Beautiful . Our home city so am a little biased but this buzzing metropolis is the best city in the world. Should be on every travellers bucket list.

Dining @ Darling Harbour. This venue is in the middle of a major reconstruction but that has not impacted on the variety of events and places to visit. Despite what you might think, many of the restaurants in this area do offer affordable dining options. We visited a number of cafes and restaurants and were impressed with the quality of food and prices. For families, the children's park area is a real boon with rope climbing frames, carousels, water play areas and lots of other delights. Some of the attractions include Madame Tussauds, Sea Life, The Chinese Gardens and the IMAX Theatre. There is a Visitors Information Centre and a number of public toilets. The management hosts thematic displays and the area featured interesting Santa exhibits when we visited.

Great harbour. Plenty of restaurants, including the famous Hard Rock Cafe. Also, some nice shopping malls. The Maritime Museum is a must, you can visit both indoor and outdoor (one ship and one submarine). Water taxis and ferries available.
Great atmosphere. Walked to Darling Harbour from our hotel walked around great exercise tried yummy ice cream and juices. Lots of places to eat and drink. Great family atmosphere.

Beautiful! Must visit! . Everything here is nice! If you know you're history this place is even better. Very cool too see how much this place is elvoving and expanding. This place has something for everyone! Don't visit Sydney without going here!
Promenada. Superb place to walk, enjoy food and drinks with family and friends. Could be a little too crowded on holidays when the waiting line for Sydney Aquarium is hours long.
Such a great place. My family spent the day just dinning and walking through Darling Harbour. Be sure to relax and dine here.
Darling harbour. We just walk thru to the city. You can see all the big buildings in the city from the bridge. Cozy cafe close to it.

Cool vibe, Must visit!. The Darling Harbour is a nice area to spend part of your day. We strolled to the harbour to visit the Wildlife Zoo & Aquarium; however, we were pleasantly surprised by the awesome restaurants and beautiful views that Darling Harbour offers. I would recommend a visit to the Wildlife Zoo, outdoor seating at one of the many restaurants to enjoy the view, stroll along the promenade and enjoy the local talent performances, you might even want to catch a film at the IMAX theater as well. Afterwards, hop on the ferry to enjoy a beautiful scenic ride to Sydney Harbour!

Ferry Boat. We took the Circular Quay Ferry to Darling Harbour. We walked around and enjoyed the stores and view. We walked to Hard Rock Café to get some T-shirts and souvenirs. It is also close to Chinatown and we walked there to see the sights.

darling harbour - my family's favourite hang out place. my family and i strolled to Darling Harbour everyday when we visited sydney. it is just beautiful there. we ate gelato there - gelatissimo. yum yum... 2 days straight in a row. we rode on the ferris wheel. we ate at several restaurants there. we also visited the zoo, wax museum and sea life aquarium there.
Happening place!. huge commotion going around with lots of lounges & cafes. Evenings can be real fun here. shopping malls at walking distance.

Stroll and chill . This is a great place to either walk or jump on a river taxi to. It has a great chilled out vibe with a ton of restaurants to select from as well as other attractions like the aquarium.

Enjoyable typical harbor atmosphere!. Darling Harbour is a nice harbor, typical of others of its type. Lots of cafes and restaurants, all good for people watching and relaxing. There are dozens of boats that are coming in and out of the harbor, mostly tour boats.

Spent New Year Eve at Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour shops have changed to more affordable shopping. I remember a time when Darling Harbour only had speciality boutique shops that were rather expensive. There is plenty of eateries at Darling Harbour, including the newer eateries around the iMax theatre. However there appears to be a lot of construction in the area due to major redevelopment. So the place does seem a lot smaller than it used to be which was very spacious. Also there are plenty of restaurants in the area. There is a free play area for the kids called the Darling Quarter where kids can be occupied for hours. There are also bars and clubs on the other side of Darling Harbour. We spent New Year's Eve there for the kids fireworks at 9pm. This was a good place to take the kids as its not as busy as the Opera House or Harbour Bridge area for the fireworks display.

Great spot for fireworks!!!. Darling harbour is perfect if are not into the buzzzzy crowd waiting for the NY fireworks! It was comfortable if you arrive at 9 pm you will still make it in and had a spot that could see the fireworks very clearly. A lot of cafes and restaurants around and shopping. Majorly it wasn't a nightmare trying to leave the place as there were many ways of exiting the area where the crowd were great NY
Still one if the great days out in sydney. Had a great New Years day and spent some time in DH. Great restaurants, plenty of activities. Just such a nice place to spend a lazy day. Highly recommended

Shopping centre on the water. Visited the convention centre/Casino side of Darling Harbour this week (Wednesday) for a lunch trip.Walking through the shops reminded me of walking through a small shopping mall, but pitched at the overseas tourist. Interesting to watch the toffees being made.Not many restaurants, or cafes open to select from for a lunch time. Be selective and see what is being served up. Can't make a recommendation as I gave up and had some dumplings before leaving.

Great place plenty to do . We got the ferry and met friends for coffee. Great relaxed atmosphere. Will do more next time we visit. There was plenty of attractions and eating opportunities for every budget.

So much to see..... The Darling Harbour area of Sydney is a must see place to go to either as a visitor to Sydney or if you live here. There is an amazing array of Cafes & restaurants covering all types of cuisine to suit everyone, many with great views of the harbour. Most nights there are fireworks displays & the shops are often open beyond regular trading hours. Now there is the giant Ferris wheel to have a ride on & get wonderful views of the harbour & city. Within walking distance is the King St Wharf area, Cockle Bay, Sydney Aquarium, the Wax Museum, Maritime Museum & Star City! A vibrant, busy place but great to visit day or night! Easy to park or get public transport (train to Town Hall, buses or the light rail).

A Genuine Bargain Here. The shopping at Darling Harbour is not to be missed. Definite bargains here. Plenty of US and Canadian tourists here spending big time. We grabbed some wonderful clothing and shoe bargains. Better than most DFO's. Miss this experience and you will regret it.

Overshadowed by cranes.. This was one of the first places that we visited in Sydney nearly 8 years ago. Since then we have visited several times but this time with the cranes building the new convention centre and a "pavilion" on the water it seemed much smaller. However the atmosphere is still as good as ever!

Harbor Side of Sydney. This harbor has pretty different look from Circular Quay in that it does not have two major architect masterpieces. Boats are plentiful in here though and also its waters activities. Located across the bridge is the Cockle Bay Wharf.

Construction zone with a broken down lift.. Darling harbour is overrated any time. It is pricey, and not easy to get around in a wheelchair. Without friends to push me on occasion, it would close to impossible. There is an overpass from near Druitt Street, which has a lift at the Cockle Bay end, the alternative being stairs. On return from the Hard Rock Cafe after Elton John at the Entertainment Centre, the lift was out of order and blocked off. Instead of up the lift and an easy run to my hotel, we had to, not knowing where we were going, get through blocked off construction zones to another overpass. The wheelchair involved getting up a lift, once we'd found it, past wandering drunks, up a steep rise to Sussex St., then finally a few blocks to my hotel. Again, without friends to push, it would have been impossible. As it was, it delayed us getting to our hotel and to bed. The NSW government lauds Darling Harbour as a great success. They should be ashamed of what an inaccessible, overpriced and overrrated place it is.

Eclectic Entertainment. Darling Harbour has something for every member of the family from bub to granny. It can be accessed in so many different ways, each of them interesting in their own manner. When you get there, it's easy to do nothing and watch the passing crowd or immerse yourself in activity. There's truly something for everyone. For that reason, I like visiting there more than the Opera House.

Awesome fun in the Rain. Even though it was raining, my family and I had a great day at Darling Harbour. My son got to have his 1st ride on the Ferris Wheel and the smile on his face was priceless. We then went and got some of the famous fudge from inside the mall, then headed back to the dock to catch the ferry back to parramatta
a nice place to spend time. the place has almost everything, night cruises, restaurants, shows, dancing people, museums views of the harbour bridge and opera house

It is changing now. There are many changes happening in this vicinity at the moment while the new Exhibition Centre and Hotel are being built which is disappointing. The Harbourside Shopping Centre caters for mainly tourists with souvenir shops and a few places to eat. The area does come alive more during the Latin Fiesta and other festivals throughout the year especially Sydney Festival during January. There is a nice big playground close to Tumbalong Park. On the other side and closer to King St wharf, there are more restaurants and bars. The Aquarium, Madame Tussaud and Wild Life World are excellent attractions.

So many places to shop and eat!. There are tons of restaurants here! You can get any type of food. Anyone will be able to find something good to eat. There are lots of shops too. Clothes, jewelry, shoes, message, confectionery..... You'll find plenty to do here.

Great area with plenty of restaurants. Darling harbour is full of restaurants a park and attached to china town it has a great atmosphere. All ferries go from the attached marina . The only downside is the building work adjacent to the Marina which does takeaway a bit of the atmosphere however still worth a visit.

Under renovation now but still worth going. Right now it's undergoing major renovations. When it's done, it probably will be more attractive. The kids area is fantastic.m our two year old wouldn't want to leave.

Nice place to hang out. You find so much to see and do at and from Darling harbour: Aquarium, Imax theater, restaurants, pubs, bars, hotels, parks for kids, cruises, souvenir shopping, ...
If you are on a budget, you can definitely find things there to keep you busy all day on a budget. If you want to blow your money, also very possible.
A real buzz!. Great restaurants and a great place to relax and people watch! A must visit when in Sydney! Plenty of attractions here as well.

Disappointing day. Our stop at Darling Harbour was disappointing. It consisted of a lot of souvenir shops and restaurants which were average. There was no real view. There was a lot of construction going on in the area which didn't add to the experience.

The construction work. Always a favourite place to go whilst in Sydney but with the construction work happening it didnt have the same feel or vibe as in previous visits. Still worth a visit but will be much better once all the constrcution work has finished
Lots to do!. Very nice part of Sydney, huge area will loads of bars, restaurants and activities (Sea life centre, naval museum,iMax cinema, boat rides etc) very clean. 100% will go back

Enough here to make it a second or third day activity. You are better off starting a visit to Sydney in the Rocks, and should surely spend at least full day in that area, but Darkling Harbor offers a small wildlife park where you can see Koala, kangaroo, cassowary, and more. There is a Madam Tussaud's Was museum here, a naval ship to tour, a two old sailing ships. There are any number of restaurants and pubs. Darling Harbor is easily reached at minimal cost by ferry from Circular Quay, with the added benefit of getting a short harbor tour thrown-in.

Area under construction. Many awful buildings under construction in the area, which is losing all its soul. When completed, you will make no difference with Dubai, Singapore or any warehouse area. Some concrete basements, steel and glass everywhere. Some pubs and restaurants. Visiting it is a waste of time.
Great place. Great place with amazing restaurants. All around the harbour there are things to do. Shops, attractions, food, coffee

One of the top places to visit in Sydney!. Must visit if you are in Sydney. There is so much to see and do in here. This place also has a huge range restaurants to offer you a taste of Australia. I have been there just a few days back and had been there many many times. It has open spaces, function centers, museums, water front activities, aquariums, casinos and 100,s of food joints. You just can not get bored while you are in darling Harbor.

Very nice way to spend an afternoon!. It was walkable to start at f the King Street Wharf by way of a nearby pedestrian bridge where the Sea Life Aquarium, Wildlife World, Madame Tussaud's, Harbor boat rides, pick-up point for Hop-On, Hop-Off bus, and many restaurants and bars are conveniently located. The other side of the harbor has the convention Centre, Imax theater, Australian Maritime Museum. and many other things to see and do.

Definitely visit. I loved Darling Harbour the restaurants and bars are great, the atmosphere is good and there's loads to do.I would recommend Nicks Seafood restaurant! All the bars have happy hour too :)

Great place to wander. This is a great area for wandering around and there is entertainment and great places to eat everywhere you turn. Grab a table at one of the many restaurants on the harbour and enjoy a few hours watching everything that is going on whilst having some wonderful food. Lovely atmosphere about the place and great for chilling out.
Darking Harbour. Darling Harbor is a tourist place where many attractions, Restaurants, Ferries Terminal, Sea Life Museum, Madame Tassuad Museum, walking area and much more fun area

Harbour-side fun for the whole family. Darling Harbour has many shops and restaurants to enjoy and offers other activities like the Maritime Museum, boat rentals, and small aquariums/wild life. We were staying in the area and found ourselves at Darling Harbour a couple of times to eat or shop for souvenirs. What I found particularly charming was the integration of the harbour with the park. There was a great playground for children to play, benches to sit and enjoy the area, game boards, and recumbent bicycles. Also part of the complex was the Chinese Friendship garden. A great multi-use site - enjoying the outdoors for a walk around the water or through the park is free but there is a fee/cost for the restaurants and activities.As this was a family trip we were not looking for "night life" but did observe during our walk back from the ferry stop that it was a very "happening" place on a Friday evening! Great spot for people watching!The area is going through a face lift so there is construction, but we did not find it to detract from our experience.

Worth a visit. Just a short ferry ride from Circular Quay you will find the National Maritime Museum at Darling Harbour which itself is well worth a look. Your ticket includes the outside "exhibits" of a submarine,(quite an experience) warship, and two historic vessels.Whatever you want to eat you'll find it here and it's a great spot for people watching too. Don't miss it.

Buzzing atmnosphere. Arrived on a Saturday and stayed in the Darling Harbour area. We were blown away by all the action going on. Lovely eating places and so much to look at and fireworks at 9pm to finish the night. Put us in a great mood for rest of trip.
Night time is best. Looking back towards the city lights at night is a wonderous sight. No shortage of places to eat and drink. A must for a visit to Sydney.

Best view. I love darling harbour. The view is amazing and you can just sit around the harbour and relax. Darling harbour also holds various events. Be sure to check what's on. They also have fireworks every Saturday at 8:30 pm which is awesome.
Nice during night-time. Better to visit this place (about 2 kms from Opera House) during nightime/ evening when you find a lot of street shows, lighting and a festive atmosphere.

Lots of construction. We stayed in the Darling Harbour area during our recent trip to Sydney. It is a touristy area with a mall and lots of shops and restaurants as well as an aquarum, mini zoo, and wax museum.This is not a low priced area to be prepared to spend some cash. There are some good restaurants and we enjoyed the wildlife centre.Besides the prices, the only negative is the convention centre construction which impedes some of the pedestian and traffic flow making it more difficult to get around.

lovely to walk around. there are loads of activities, shops and restaurants here. you don't have to do any of these, just walk and watch. its a great place, you can get a ferry on either side of the harbour, one of which has a walk through the outside of the maritime museum, there are lots of places where you can sit and people watch, if you need shade you can sit under the under pass.
Great place always fun. Darling darling darling beautiful harbour we love this place always full of ppl and great free shows

It's Sydney, It's Fantastic!. Darling Harbour, Sydney's tourism centre. Everyone comes here and no wonder. Shops, a zoo, an aquarium, ferries to Circular Quay, an enormous number of waterside restaurants, and people watching opportunities galore. No wonder we love coming here. If you are in Sydney don't miss this! Oh and visit the Maritime Museum if you love the sea, ships and history. This is Sydney at its best.

Dynamic. Enjoyed a meal near Darling Harbour before venturing there to see the fireworks display which apparently happens regularly on a Sat night. Very active area which attracts young people in particular.

A good way to spend half a day.. Access by the ferries and water taxis is easy and enjoyable. A walk around the bay to the maritime museum is great and there is shade under the underpass if you want it,

This harbour is stunning. It is absolutely amazing, just walking around it, is like refresh all your mind from the crowded city. The view is unexplainable, in the best way. If i have a boyfriend i would definitely bring him here, its like really romantic, especially at night with the small lights.

A lovely place to walk. The harbour is full of sights and sounds cafes and restaurants. There is an IMAX cinema and a sailing museum, sea life center and much more. A place to spend an afternoon just wandering.

Darling Harbour- One of the best places in Sydney. Been to Sydney 3 times, & loved staying at one of the hotels in Darling Harbour. - Can just stay at one of the chocolate cafes for hours - Sipping hot chocolate- Go for a movie in IMAX- Go for Madame Tussauds wax museum- Eat in one of the best Restaurants if you wish , there are cheap options as well

So much to take in. This little Harbour has so much to offer, you can sit & watch the world go by. Eat at one of the many bars or restaurants. Visit one of the many attractions found right on the wharf or take a tour by ferry or private boat. The Maritime museum is right on the door stop. Or stroll over the bridge above the harbour to take in the views. There is always something happening in this corner of the world.

Aging gracefully with something for everyone. Darling Harbour has been around for quite a while now and some of the original attractions are showing their age, especially the shopping mall that is pretty much dominated by fast food places and tourist shops that sell low quality goods. But the good news is that the area continues to be updated and has expanded it's offerings in other ways. The aquarium and the zoo extension are ideal for families visiting this location and the Maritime Museum still does a great job of telling a story that everyone needs to hear. The new convention and meeting facility will be a great asset. Good hotels are available on both sides of the harbour and the pedestrian bridge across makes everything easy to walk to. Ferry connections to Circular Cay and points west are plentiful. Great people watching available at outdoor restaurants. Shines at night in a friendly way. Tram to Central Station is a good bet if you are tired from a full day of walking.
Can't miss it. If you're stopping through Sydney, you can't miss this. Plenty of bars and restaurants and things to see. And there are fireworks on Saturdays and they're spectacular! Lovely place.
Love darling harbour. Feel like dining here every evening since there are so many choices to eat and drink. The atmosphere is touristic , the harbour view is enjoyable.

So much to do . You can spend all day at Darling Harbour. The place is full of places to explore. Things to see, cafe's and eateries, and plenty to do for the whole family. We had a wonderful time on a not so brilliant day (weather wise)

walking distance from town. I stayed at Darling Harbour. It is walking distance from many places in town. A bit touristic but nice. Here you can take the hop off hop on bus for the city route and then change at Central Station for the Bondi route. Or you can take a ferry to Circular Quay if you do not want to walk 20 minutes to The Rocks.

Nice , specially from Sunset till late night ...... Certainly another place that any visitor to Sydney must visit and enjoy ....great during the day , and with a much more vibrant vibe / feeling once the sunset arrives and into the night...lots of restaurants , lights , good , safe walking around ....Do not miss it
Two days in a row here . Nice place to visit. Lots of restaurants to choose. Boat cruise and aquarium and things to do. Love being here.

Nice fireworks!. Darling Harbour had every Saturdat evening around 9pm fireworks combined with music. Nice to do in the weekend to go out afterwards to the multiple nightclubs or just have a drink at a bar closeby.

Lovely restaurants. Darling Harbour is a lovely place to go for a stroll but more importantly there are plenty of great restaurants to choose from. It's a lovely setting to enjoy a meal and a drink watching all the comings and going of the boats.

Habour that full of ships. Its amazing how a harbour can become an attraction to the tourist where you can actually just sit in one of the restaurant, order some food & drinks or beers & just relax at the harbour. Its really a relaxing place to visit.
True Essence of this wonderful city. Christmas in the City showcased at its best - lovely afternoon strolling around the harbour enjoying the sights and relaxing with a drink and a great feed.

Put it on the must do list!. Currently there is a lot of action in darling harbour with nightly fireworks, Christmas activities as well as the usual restaurants, shops, bars and cafes. Whether just having a stroll or looking for dinner don't miss darling harbour in Sydney.

Another harbour in the city.. This harbor area is worth a walk through. This area is going through a major overhaul of construction to beautify the area. There's shops and place of interest to see while in this area.
Darling Harbour restaurants and IMAX theatre. Nice views, lots of restaurants and the IMAX theatre. Not much undercover to walk along so keep that in mind and bring a hat!

Beautiful harbor with much to do! Restaurants, museums, shops!. We picked up our harbor ride over to the zoo! Upon return, we visited the aquarium and some of the shops and had some dinner as dusk set in. The lights on all of the buildings was beautiful!
Mesmerizing. If you are Sydney , a must place to visit .. Simply breath taking place for a romantic dinner in the evening ... Lobe it

Darling Harbour day and night is great. We preferred Darling Harbour to Sydney Bridge Harbour, its been redesigned brilliantly. Has a great vibe, you can walk around, enjoy the attractions, some great coffee shops, cafes and bars and boat restaurants for a posh dinner in the evening. Worth a visit.
Pleasantly surprised Harbour. My wife and I fell upon this harbour whilst strolling Sydney. A pleasant place to site and have a couple of beers followed with a evening meal. Very clean and safe.

So much to do. We went around the harbours in the ferries, had an adventure sailing trip,went to the wildlife centre,Madame Tussauds and the aquarium ,then ate at Nicks seafood twice. All this was at Darling Harbour. Very pleasant indeed.

Novotel stay. We stayed at the Novotel Darling Harbour Sydney they had reno's going on at the time which was Nov 2014 but it didn't interrupt our stay. You can take short walks around Darling Harbour and there are heaps of places to eat and things to do.
Attractive, modern marina, with extensive dining options. This modern marina is attractive and contains a good aquarium, zoo, extensive dining options and harbour boat cruises.

Disappointing tourist trap. I expected Darling harbour to be buzzing and exciting, but in reality I found it to be a tourist trap, overly commercialised harbour without much going on. It's possible I missed the excitement, but.... I wouldn't bother, personally.

Great part of Sydney to visit. Very vibrant area of Sydney. Plenty of great cafes, restaurants, bars & tourist attractions to enjoy. Star Casino is within walking distance, or you can catch a ferry to Circular Quay. They have a fireworks display every Saturday night which is also worth watching. You could easily spend a half day here.

Beautiful!. Beautiful harbour to look at with plenty of the trendy people. Walked across the Pyrmont Bridge to see both side of the harbour. Love the free fireworks on Saturday night. So glad I caught it and so easy to come out of the food court at Harbourside to find very good location to watch unblocked!!! Wow!!!!
get the vibe. Great place to spend the day seeing to transform from day to night time. Lots of restaurants, shops.

Lots of shops, restaurants, things to see. Darling Harbour is a very, very touristy place - but it does what it aims to set out to do. There are plenty of shopping stores, restaurants, the aquarium, boats to see, a park, and more. It's a good place to spend an afternoon enjoying in the bright Sydney sunshine. Another nice attraction with a good view is the Pyrmont Bridge, which is definitely worth the walk. I didn't go here at night, but I can imagine how beautiful it is on a summer's night. Well worth a visit for the afternoon.

Eating at the harbour. Went to Hurricanes What an experience had a 2 1/2 hrs wait to get seated it is so busy my friends enjoyed their meal It is a steak /spare ribs place lots on plate but I didn't enjoy my sirloin steak not done to my taste . Staff are friendly but I don't think I would go back again
Fun and pretty. Darling Harbour is a bustling centre aswell. With a few attractions and fireworks in the evening on a weekend therebis always something nice to do!

Fascinating. So much to see at Darling Harbour and some great restaurants to visit, not forgetting all the boats. The bridge decorated with lots of flags is fascinating and certainly the widest pedestrian bridge I have ever seen. A lot of construction and development is going on here including a casino, so we were informed.
Under construction. The area is under considerable construction at the moment, which will surely be wonderful when it's completed, but for now it takes away from the appeal of visiting.
darling harbour. Very lovely lots of resturants n cafes lovely to walkaround through harbour plenty to see great for tourists

Very commercial - kid friendly . This serves the purpose of entertaining the typical middle class family (with children) who like the aquarium, mediocre food with views of the harbour, access to a ferry ride, a ferries wheel, etc. But if you're looking for culture, I don't recommend. But it's cute for what it is.
Beautiful harbour. This is a gorgeous harbor and has lots of places to eat and drink nearby varying to all budgets, also very accessible on the ferry

Terrific restaurants, great views, lovely walk. We went to Darling Harbour to see the fireworks on Saturday night and were pleasantly surprised by all the restaurants and cafes that were there. It's a great spot to hang out, get a bite to eat and do some people watching.

Amazing place. This is an amazing harbour, with plenty places to eat and drink, there are several fish restsurants. There is even an IMAX theatre there, which is great. A good place to stay, several boat trips start or end here, great atmospher.

Feel congested. Not to be compared with the Sydney Harbour but Darling has other forms of activity and life including the Zoo and the Sea World and a Mme Tussaud's. Those aside you can hang around in the cafes and on the steps, maybe take a ferry ride and nothing much else.

Too much construction going on. Such a lovely place to visit with lots of great eating and drinking options, also with an area that has great interactive kids play equipment - BUT THERES SO MANY CRANES AND UGLY CONSTRUCTION WORKS !! My lovely breakfast was interrupted with these views of construction towers and exposed concrete and scaffolding. At least there's still some water and the hustle of the city life to keep you entertained. I still love the place but not right now (Dec 2015)
Great! . Great walks and no guide needed. Very eventful neighbourhood and great restaurants and bars. Rooftops a must

Wonderful Location to people watch. Great location to eat/drink & just watch the world go by .. Full of different types of restaurants to do this .. Things there for all age groups & ferries plying their trade to all locations .. a must visit if in Sydney ..

Must go. One of the tourist must do in Sydney. Just a 10- 15 walk from Paddys Markets/Chinatown. Lots of construction going around and will be good when its all finished. Heaps to see and do and lots of shops, shops and more shops and eateries. We went on a late sunday afternoon and by the time we left 8.00pm, it was still very busy with people everywhere so you felt safe walking around .

Dystopian Delight. If Kublai Khan had ordered the art director of Blade Runner to build him a pleasure dome, he might have ended up with Darling Harbour. Multi-level freeways roar overhead, while revellers revel below. There are some top restaurants here, and some decent bars but the place is low on ambience and high on woo woo. Best during fireworks.

Fireworks every Saturday at 9PM. Lovely small harbour served as an entertainment hubs. From bars, restaurants, cafes, even imax, you can find it all here. There's also firework show every Saturday at 9PM.

Nice place!. I've been quite offen at darling harbour because it is really nice and you can do a lot of things there. Especially the fireworks at saturdays are nice but you should be there early to get a nice place

Nothing out of the ordinary. Mostly crowded with tourists or people who are there to visit the attractions such as Madame Tussaud. The other side of the harbour is just a slew of restaurants and pubs that can be teeming with patrons over the weekend. Much more suitable for visitors with families or group of friends.

A hive of activity and night life. Good variety of restaurants and bars which would cater for children and adults. Plenty of activities, we loved it here and the evening fireworks were amazing. We would defiantly return.
More for tourists. So much to see with a variety of shops and restaurants but perhaps more for a tourist - close to both the CBD and casino and very accessible - easy to get to by ferries
