Great place to have dinner and just chill. Darling Harbour has a lot of nice restauranst. Great place to have dinner and just chill. Darling Harbour has a lot of nice restaurants with beautiful views. The atmosphere is very relaxed and nice :)

Scenic, vibrant, trendy and convenient part of Sydney.. My wife and I stayed a local hotel, conveniently located to Darling Harbour. We found it fun to just go exploring, either by foot , by tour bus or taxi. Great restaurants nearby and shops. Worth the visit.Goodness gracious what an impressive area of Sydney. We just loved it there.

i am so glad there doing a huge renovation.. love darling harbour. the imax side . that part of darling harbour is terrific. but i have been saying for years the other side needs a major makeover. You will have a GREAT DAY IF YOU VISIT.

busy and impressive. we stayed in the Darling harbour area for a few days ,,, plenty of activity and shops ; great water related activity with boats and the ferries. Great for a few days visit if fairly expensive place to be, the Opera house is close by together with a few hundred shops ...
Nice place . A nice place to walk around. There is a number of restaurants and the aquarium. The prices aren't as high as Sydney harbor.

Busy. Very busy place with many locals and tourists providing a lively environment. Plenty of bars and restaurants around which made it an environment that attracted the young. Quite a bit of construction going on near the harbour which made any photogenic view not as such.

Buzzing. If you're ever in the CBD of Sydney and plan to spend a whole day, then visit this place twice - day time and night. During the day you can just relax by the water or visit the numerous cafes and restaurants. Take in the sights and sounds. In the evening it is just as beautiful and once a week they have fireworks. Just lazing by the pier is good enough or having coffee along the walks... just couldn't get enough of this place while I was there.

So beautiful at Christmas time!!!. So much to do and see in the month of the December...all the decorations are up and there are daily activities, singers, and magicians wondering through the crowds, it does get super busy but the kids just love it.

So much to do. Whether its shopping, eating, museums or attractions there is a heap to do at Darling Harbour. Shop around for the pass and you can get a much cheaper entrance into the aquarium, madam Tussauds, wildlife and Counterpoint tower for one price. Didn't go to the sea museum as it was too expensive for a family ticket. Make sure you check out the Fudge shop - they have the best apricot fudge. Even if you don't want to spend money there is plenty to see with the numerous ships in the harbour and the ferries coming and going.
Great location. This is a great location to spend hours walking around. There are plenty of restaurants, an aquarium and shopping centre.
Garish. Darling Harbour is to Sydney what Leicester Square is to London- a garish touristy overcrowded hell full of chain restaurants and soulless bars.

The amazing lights!. there are lots of places and bars around Darling harbour but this place looks best in the night. the lights reflecting off the water surface, the active night scene, just splendid. There is also the biggest Imax dome theatre just around. Its very close to Townhall. Currently under renovations, there is a new huge convention centre coming up. The all - renewed darling harbour is expected to be ready by December 2016. This is on the top 5 list along with Opera house, Harbour Bridge and Bondi beach on the Sydney must do - If I only had one day in Sydney.

One of the most Plastic but still fun parts of Sydney. Nice place to sit down for a few drinks on the waterfront at any one of the bars. Best time to head there is 5 - 7pm on a weekday when most of the bars have happy hour. Head in to Chinatown for a meal afterwards for BYO and way better / value for money food.

Take half a day out, and spend it here!. There could be a lot to do for you, for the kids, or maybe nothing at all depending on which day you pick to come here!However it guarantees a few things for sure1. Enough options to eat2. Enough options to party (if you are here Friday or Saturday evenings, you would know)3. Enough to actually just sit and be yourself!

Always great. This place has an array of fabulous restaurants and places to see. Seafood is awesome, try Nicks Seafood of that is your taste. Just walk around in the evening, across to see museums and attractions. Well worth a visit

Romantic Stroll in the early morning. Im sorry to say these but many parts of darling harbour really looked alike and similar with Singapore's Collyer Quay area. I dont know who copy who? But anyway, Darling Harbour has many eateries such as Hard Rock cafe, pancakes on the rocks. I love to see all those boats parking at the wharf and wish that I could own one. A romantic stroll in the early morning for couples between 7am- 9.30am.

Amazing. Simply amazing in the evenings, especially during the Christmas season. Head over to their website to find out about the various activities they have in store and the best part is the free fireworks every Saturday between 830-9pm. Loads of food options available

Great place to visit. As my last visit was 17 years ago, I was shocked to see the changes Sydney has made for the city icon. Whether you need restaurants, bars, museums or cruises, this is the place to go. It is even kids friendly. Cheers Mate!!

Not what it was. while we can't go back and this is not as it was in its prime when I saw it they have have worked well to keep it an electrifying destination. Mono Rails Museum and some great shops have now been replaced with UBER TRENDY EATS, and some overpriced attractions. I mean if you are a tourist hooray a trip to the wax museum and marvelling at some of the pimped out water taxis and that sea air is always a joy. Potential for the precinct I think will be revised in years to come again. Who knows what apartment and casino developments may bring other than more shade only time will tell.

Not to be missed. Darling Harbour was the most amazing place. Lots of bars and restaurants to choose from. Street entertainers,brass bands playing Christmas songs and a wonderful firework display made it a wonderful place to spend an evening. A must see!
Only 10 minutes away from CBD.. We could not believe our CBD hotel was only 10 minutes away from here. Beautiful view, outstanding shopping, restaurants and all walkable
best view. it is a nice place to dine, walk around, best view of darling harbour, lots of tourist, fireworks display every saturday night, overall , nice place to isit when in sydney
Night time only. Night time it comes alive, with activity. During the day you can walk around the harbor. If you want a flea market, in China Town Paddys Market or City Market. have fun closes 5PM

Love to stroll around. Been visiting Darling Harbour on many occasions and it never disappoints.Currently going through a major redevelopment and it's a little eye sore but once it's going to be finished it will be the talk of the town.Plenty to see and do from restaurants, attractions, shopping, it's amazing views of the city sky line and much much more.The ealiking around is good crossing over the old Pyrmont Bridge which overlooks the Maritime Museum and Darling Harbour.Fantastic place at night when the city lights are on breathtaking is the only to explain it.If you have overseas visitors it is one place you should take them to.Great time as a family heaps of things to see and do.

just great it has lots to do and see. you can access the wax museum the water world and zoo also the maritime museum and walk on board the warship the submarine and replica of captain cooks boat . also hard rock cafe and other eateries and shopping

Touristy but a nice walk. The walk around Darling Harbour is very pleasant especially for a morning walk before it gets too busy. Once it opens it is tourist-hub centre with a cheap food court and chain stores that are most suited to Gen Y although there is a good British Lolly Shop inside that stocks items that will bring back memories for some. There are a lot of attractions around here for the family so it is a very popular spot day or night.
quick visit froom the ferry. This was very quick but there are plenty of eaterys and shops of all sorts there.at night the funfair opens but this was not our sort of thing

Tourist Mecca. Darling Harbour Is based around another Sydney Harbour inlet that was long forgotten but has now been totally redeveloped. It is now a glitzy area with lots of shopping, hotels and attractions. Food outlets are plentiful and tourist orientated speciality shops abound. The little harbour also serves as a marina for pleasure craft.  The old bridge from one bank to the other is an interesting feature. The center section of the bridge actually swings around on a pivot to allow craft to pass from the end of the inlet into the open harbour The National Maritime museum sits across the road from Darling Harbour shops Across from the maritime museum and its floating exhibist, are the Sydney Aquarium, Madam Tussauds Wax Museum and the Wild Life Sydney Zoo.

Great place to visit. We loved the area the harbour is set in. It's clean and tidy and well cared for.Food and drink prices are a bit of a premium to pay for the view and it's hard to get a seat some evening. A short walk will find you on China town with lots of alternatives on offer.
Darling Harbour. A little slice of the Harbour wrapped around restaurants and cafes, aquariums and zoos. Great place to catch up with friends and family.
overrated. Only worth a visit to one of the many restaurant, bars or cafes that offer deals on drinks or food..

The best. It's hard picking the best place when you are in Sydney but this is always a favourite. Great bars and food and easy access from the hop on hop off bus or by ferry which is excellent. I would recommend it for everyone from young to old. Something for everyone
Buzzing. Darling Harbour is a hive of activity, it has some excellent bars serving food drinks and good food, the Captain Cook dinner cruise from this harbour is well worth money.
Shopping and a nice stroll. We ventured down to Darling Harbour, the place is immaculate with a vibrant restaurant scene and plenty of shops to choose from. A great way to spend a day.
Visit. It was our first visit. The view were beautiful. Malls close a bit early. Around the harbour many eateries to choose from. Free wifi in many places. Really enjoyed it.

Plenty of night life.. Darling Harbour seems to be the hub of the private cruise tours, such as Captain Cook. There is also a lot of night life, with many busy bars and restaurants scattered around the place. There also seem to be some maritime museums at the harbour, but we didn't visit these this time round. We will probably go back and spend some more time there on our next visit.
Entertaining. Great spot for families !!!! So much to do and having food places and shops so close is very handy. Activities that are free are awesome as well. A must do

Great drinks and food. Its a little expensive, but what isn't on the water in Sydney. Lots of peoples and a good time guaranteed. Also, the Maritime Museum is there, which is an awesome stop before the evening begins.

Great place. A great place to .. Either in the food hall or in the many restaurants .. Lots of touristy things around as well .. We watched the free 21:00 Saturday evening fireworks display .. Get there early as its popular
Good place for a beer and a sit down. The area has been re-energised and improved. Lots of restaurants and bars. Free Wi-Fi in places. Lovely to sit with a beer and watch the world walk by.

One of the main highlights in Sydney. Great view of the harbour. There's IMAX, many cafes / eateries, maritime museum, wax museum, aquarium, etc... here, and Sydney Fish Market is within walking distance too (about 10-15mins walk?). Walk along Pyrmont Bridge where the monorail once bypass, where you will get a spectacular view.

A great stop in any Sydney visit. The Darling Harbour area is really a must do tourist stop to experience Sydney as a destination. The views are always a winner, and is nice weather the walking, shops and restaurants are worth the trip. I would say that you must be prepared for crowded restaurants and and pricey meals. With that said- it was a FUN place.
Buzzing. Darling Harbour is a varied day out with something for everyone. Attractions, cafes, bars or just boat or people watching. It has a great atmosphere.

Where to Eat?. Darling Harbour has a huge choice of restaurants and cafes to chose from - whether it be a food court option, cafe or fine dining. We got caught in a thunderstorm whilst there one day so ended up sheltering in a small cafe - lovely staff, great pizza & a tasty wine to wash it down. A beautiful spot overlooking the water. There was also a small ferris wheel there - would recommend it as it was not over priced and had great views. The playground down there is also popular - and gets plenty of use. A lovely spot to wander day or night.

Worth a visit.. Everyone should visit Darling Harbour as its alive with people, things to see and endless restaurants. One of these is an old Sydney ferry.At the present time its a giant construction zone and when finished should be spectacular.

Best place to walk and dine. Full of pub and restaurants. Great plave to catch up with friends or family to have some lunch or dinner and then go for a walk. at night time, all the night clubs will open, it turns to a clubbing street.

Attractions of darling harbour. I took the ferry over to darling harbour you get a nice view of Sydney opera house and harbour bridge. I then paid for 3 attractions the aquarium, wildlife, and Madame Tussaud's . It was very good value approx £30. You do need to allow a few hours to do all 3. I started with the wild life which show cased Australian wild life. Saw Tasmanian devil, bilby, kangeroos, koalas and lots more. My favourite were the koalas on the roof terrace . For an extra £10 you could go in the koala enclosure and take photos of the koalas posing and have photos taken with the koalas by the keeper. Educational talks throughout the day..I then went to the aquarium which was very interesting they have 2 dugongs which wer not there when I last went. The big tanks are fantastic with Ray's and sharks but the small tanks with a variety of sea horses and moon jellies were also nice to see.Madame Tussaud's was great fun and very interactive. Good to have someone with you to take photos of the stars. Well laid out and very enjoyable fun.

How to be closer of the sea ?. A nice walk surrounding by boats, boutiques, restaurants, beautiful nature, flowers, and majestic trees. Peoples from the place seems to be happy because they are really friendly, they smile and they exercice themselves but ask you if you are alright if they see you with a map.What a nice place to walk, gently and just looking, having a nice ice cream a having a meditation on a bench.

Ferris wheel at darling harbour.. When you visit Sydney put darling harbour on your must see list. So much to look at in this area. Madam trousseau wax museum is a must. Wildlife zoo and so much more. Loved the Ferris wheel which was only eight dollars a ride. Could see for miles. Big shopping center. Lots of eateries. Can get your captain cook ferries from here. Chinese garden of friendship is also a must in darling harbour. Outstanding play area for children.

Slightly trashy end of central Sydney but a great vibe. Loads of things to see and do. Maritime museum, plethora of boat rides in all forms, I Max Cinema (Biggest in the world) to name but a few. You can end up walking quite a long way but it is great. The eateries are not all high class but there is something for everyone. Can easily spend days here.
Great spot to spend an afternoon. There are so many things to do in this area for the entire family! There were many museums and places for kids to visit. We missed the weekly fireworks on Saturdays!

Work In Progress. The weather wasn't at its best during our two days here which didn't help the appearance. There is a lot of building work going on around Darling Harbour which takes the edge of the area. That said there is plenty to do for all the family and the number of bars and restaurants around the Harbour is staggering.

A visit to Sydney is not complete without a wander to Darling Harbour. Lovely restaurants/cafes in Darling Harbour with some great shops - although we have noticed a decline in the shops available since the mono rail closed down.

Numerous shops and restaurants ... A beautiful marina in the heart of Sydney! A walking bridge spans the Harbor, which allows pedestrians to access the mall and restaurants on the other side. As the bridge is beautifully festooned with billowing flags, it provides a great spot for a photo op!There is no shortage of things to do for the entire family -- whether a pleasure cruise on the water or cozy, evening dinner cruise around the Harbor.
nice place. nice place to just relax look at the boats and enjoy. this is a cool place to visiti loved it. visit soon.

Many restaurants to choose. You can travel to here by ferry from Circular Quay. This area is also assessable by foot from the CBD area thru Market Street and across the Plymonth bridge.There are many restaurants to choose from for your dining.Nice view of the city centre and also enjoy the cool breeze.

A centric part of Sydney with beautiful views, restaurant, bars and shops. Darling Harbour is a centric part of Sydnety located between The Rocks and Sydney's Fish Market. Here there are a lot of turistical attractions and shopping centers and it is a beuatiful site, where you can see wonderful views of the Harbour. Here there are Sea Life Syndey Aquarium, Wild life Sydney Zoo, the Pyrmont Bridge and Chinese Garden of Friendship, and it is near to George St. A wonderful place to walk, relax, buy gifts and eat something in any restaurant. (thank you dad for this gift)

Food and Drinks. Lovely place to come and people watch, have a fab meal or just a drink. Plenty of restaurants with lots of food choices.Only went there at night and was always very busy. Get there a little early to secure a table.
Disgusting. This used to be a lovely place to visit but now is filthy and a constant construction site and stinks. I would avoid this place at all costs....even the disgusting aquarium.

Wish they'd finish construction soon. Darling Harbour on a nice day is beautiful with the city backdrop but the on-going construction of the new convention centre and associated offices and residences really detracts at the moment, even if it's behind safety walls.
Wonderful Atmosphere. Wonderful atmosphere and open-air restaurants surround this harbour. Also, take in the Wildlife Sydney Zoo and Sydney Aquarium.

A Great Walk. I took a walk around the harbour and there's everything you could want there plenty of restaurants, shops, public transport, and of course people watching. Such a lovely harbour great name

"Great places to eat and drink". Great setting for a meal or a stroll around the harbour. Lots of places to eat and drink including a Hard rock cafe and The MEat And Wine Restaurant..can catch a ferry from circular quay which will drop off in two locations.
Lots of shops and restaurants around the area, a nice place to walk around. Lots of restaurants and shops around the area. Can be a bit packed during weekends. Nice overview of the Harbor.

Favourite Sydney Spot. I can't get enough of Darling Harbour. It's such a great location and has so much to offer. You are spoilt for choice with shopping, eating and drinking - what more could you want - oh and the view is fabulous!

Most happening hangout in Sydney . Harbour has a very modernised look with tall buildings on side and ferries parked at dock on the other side. Along the harbour, there are series of known eating joints making it really happening. Night view is also very amazing.
Tip: lunch recommended at harbour t enjoy the amazing view of harbour n sea.
Beautiful. Easily the best beach and bay in the area and in my opinion, nicer than Bondi. Plenty of shops to look around and rests to eat at for all tastes and pockets. Go....

fun place. this is a fun place to visit we went to the wax works there you can also go to the wild life show and the aquarium we walked of the bridge and to a shopping centre where we had a coffee at a food court open Sunday afternoon

Darling Harbour is well with visiting. The area around Darling Harbour is called Balmain. At one time it used to be the poor dock area but it is now a very popular place in Sydney. The Main Street through Balmain is full of characterful shops and good restaurants. There are also very individual and beautiful houses. Some of the buildings have great historical interest as well. When you go to the end of Darling Street on the bus you arrive at the Ferry which takes you back to the Harbour this area Balmain is well worth a visit.

Darling Harbor. Darling Harbor is a good place for restaurants.Also, the Wildlife World Zoo & the Sea Life Aquarium & Madam Tussaud are located in the Northern Section of the Harbor, which is known as King St. Wharf.King St. Wharf is also were the ferry to/from Circular Quay is located (13 minute ride).The Southern section of Darling Harbor is known as Cockle Bay Wharf.This is where the majority of restaurants are, also the large Ferris Wheel.The Saturday night fireworks are from the Cockle Bay wharf section of Darling Harbor.A good place to observe the fireworks is from the Pyrmont Bridge, which is a pedestrian bridge that crosses Darling Harbor.The walk from Cockle Bay Wharf section of Darling Harbor to the Opera House which is in Circular Quay is 30 minutes.The walk from the Pyrmont Bridge to the Sydney Fish Market is 8 minutes.The walk from the Pyrmont Bridge to Paddys Market in China Town is 14 minutes.

Darling Harbour Visit.. Arrived by ferry. Visited Maritime Museum. Walked through shopping area, down to Information Centre then up along other side past all the restaurants. Melbourne Cup Day and the place was 'jumping' and packed. Heaps of temporary Betting spots with very, very long queues. Everyone well dressed and ladies in beautiful frocks and hats. Tables all decorated and covered in Champagne bottles. Didn't know Sydneyites so passionate about our Melbourne Cup Horse Race.
Fireworks on the weekend.. Great view. Just sit on the side to enjoy the ambience.Many restaurants and bars along the sides. Watched fireworks on Saturday, 9pm. It was great and beautiful.

Just gorgeous!. Love darling harbour. Love how it is ever evolving...
Great place to take the visiting rellies....
Lovely and clean :)

A MUST to visit. Every time we go to Sydney we are visiting Darling Harbour. The Place is amazing. There are so many Restaurants, Ice cream shops, a big Shopping centre, Imax Theatre, Madam Tussauds wax museum, Aquarium and so much more. It will take one Page just to name all the attractions. It is a Must to visit.Just sitting on the Harbour side and watching the scenery is amazing. Unfortunately at present there is a big building site which spoils the scenery a bit on one site, but its still a great place. Every Saturday night they have a Firework, which we unfortunately missed. But we got told it is amazing.

Fantastic family friendly area.. Loved sitting at Darling harbour watching the world go by. Lots of places for adults and children alike. Large play park and gardens at Darling quarter and plenty of family friendly attractions at the harbour. Sea life aquarium, cinema etc. Lots of great Diners and bars. Also home to The Chinese Garden of Friendship, which is very peaceful and relaxing.

A place that has everything. A visit to Darling harbour is a must. Numerous eateries & restaurants covering every cuisine. Bars, Imax theatre, Aquarium, miniature zoo. Numerous cruises of the harbour can also be taken from her.
Great Location. Great waterside location with something for both husband and wife, between high end shops and the Maritime museum.
a mix of everything!. Good food, shopping, water and nice and close to the CBD! we stayed near by and ate here most nights and enjoyed how convenient it was to get to everywhere.
Not the best. The place os undergoing a major refurbished and is one massive building site. Wait till every thing is finished till you come back.

A magical harbourside area. Shaped like a horse-shoe, you have the broadwalk along the waters edge with ferries coming and going to various harbours on the city side. There are attractions, restaurants, cinema, shops, marine museum, casino all around - plenty to do and see. There's a pedestrian bridge across the water from Cockle Bay Wharf. We watched a fireworks display one Sat evening from the roof top bar of our hotel. This is a regular event during summer but you would need to check if it is held in other seasons. The area is lit up in the evenings with a good choice of cafes and bars to suit everyone.

The other Sydney Harbour!. Great place to visit, with a nice buzz. Countless restaurants and bars, plenty of things to do and see. Amazing maritime museum, the worlds largest IMAX cinema and Madam Tussaud's wax museum and so much more. Easy to access with many harbor ferry services. You can spend the whole day here.
Great. Everything goes on here and there are so many restaurants you are spoilt for choice. Lovely atmosphere and very interesting.
Darling Darlington Harbour. Beautiful modern harbour. A lot of new striking buildings. Many restaurants particularly if you like fish, a little pricey but worth it for the view. Shopping as well

Lovely area!. This harbour is lovely at day time or at night. We met some friends here in the evening for a drink and the lights were lovely. Have also walked around here in the day, plenty of places to eat and drink.
Nice place. Nice place to have brekky or lunch while you enjoy the views. Some activities here for the kids on a rainy day such as the aquarium and Madame Tussaud's.

Lots to see. Darling Harbour is an exciting hub with lots going on. A great place to find a meal or drink on the waterside.
There is something for everyone. We stayed in the Park Royal which is right next door. Very handy and ideally placed to see the city.
Many attractions. There are many places to visit here and would highly recommend Madame Tussaud's, Maritime Museum and the Chinese Gardens.

Great place for a walk. As a tourist, it is a must to Darling Harbour but honestly, there isn't much there. There is a mall, many choices of F&B to choose from and a handful of tourist attractions (IMAX, sealife, sanctuary, etc.). I went there twice, once in the morning and once at night. It was during winter and thus, the night walk was cooling. I enjoyed myself sitting by the harbor and watching the seagulls.

Must visit on a Saturday night !. There are fireworks on Saturday night 9PM which adds glamour to the entire evening. Apart from this, there are good restaurants and attractions like IMAX, Wax museum, etc which make up your evening.

A break in the city. A great place to visit at the end of your long day - to enjoy eating at one of the many restaurants there or just to sit there on the docks with a drink to unwind from the day's activities looking at the clear blue sky over the city!

Nice place to chill and take a stroll!. Loved Darling Harbour. Such a cool place to take a stroll. Sit at a restaurant or bar and just chill. There's also many places to sit around the promenade just to people watch.

Lots of Attractions and Food. Darling Harbour is a 5 minutes walk from the Chinatown. It has several attractions such as Chinese Garden of Friendship, Wild Life Sydney, Sea Life Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, Maritime Museum, just to name a few.

Everything is there. I was in Darling Harbour at the Lyric Theatre. The Star casino and other attractions are also there. The touristy things like Madam Tassards and the aquarium are right there. It's a beautiful harbour.

Hepening place ...Sydney attractive . we stayed in Sydney from 19th November 2015 to 21 November 2015 we stayed 400 metr distance from darling harbour we can see beauty of darling harbour from our hotel gallery hotel receipionest gave us nice view Really we enjoyed ably Sydney city tour & darling harbour shopping,food & madam Tussaud,sea world, & wildlife at harbour we loved this he pending place if you want to visit Sydney I suggest to stay near harbour bridge you can roam everything NCOs it is in centre We are very happy to see darling harbour we are keeping great memories with us lovely place thanks, Manish & Grishma

Touristy but pleasant. Great spot to sit back at one of the many restaurants with a glass of wine at the end of the day. Heaps of interesting people wandering past doing there own thing. Lots of the restaurants have happy hour and the food prices can range from very expensive to quite cheap.
Best place for everyone. Best place to visit any time of the day! Its fully crowded in the evenings and weekends. You can spend your day here completey
Worth a day. There a many attractions to see in this area. You can buy a ticket a a reduced price to see 5 different attractions. Well worth the price. Also many of the boat trips leave from here
Hive of activity, day and night. Never a dull moment, so much to see and do here. We stayed in the area for a week and could have stayed longer. An absolute must on your trip to Sydney
A buzzing area. Lots of restaurant, shops a real tourist area.Take a coffee in one of the cafes and watch the boats in the harbour.

A very happening place. I came here a few times during this trip, mostly for dinner, and am mesmerised by its surroundings. Lots of different things are going on here everyday. You see people dressed up for dates and people in their exercise attires jogging here. Its neon lights are captivating and its food are enticing. This place is a must when you visit Sydney.

Awesome Harbor View. It's one of the must visit place when you are in Sydney. This harbor offers amazing view where you can enjoy the busy harbor, blue sea, and clear sky especially during the summer. Highly recommended.

anytime is good time to visit Darling Harbour. One can visit darling Harbour any time of day, any season. visit darling Harbour in evening and night, ambience is very romantic. There are so many activities going on to do here, or else one can just sit back n relax. Very beautiful place.

great restaurants along the walk way........ We found some great restaurants with cheap beer deals overlooking the water and boats...
Nice place to just wonder around and soak up the sites and atmosphere..

Buzzing area. This area is great for a stroll through on a sunday afternoon to see street artists and just a general busy atmosphere and at the weekends. It is filled with lively eateries and also on a saturday you can see a fireworks show because its the weekend!!

Always something happening here. There is something for everyone here, whether you want a restaurant, and there are many here, shopping, visit the apquarium or the wildlife centre it's all here for you. A must not only for overseas visitors but for locals. There is always something new and interesting to see and do here.......maybe even wander up to the Chinese Gardens at the far end of Darling Harbour.

Lots to see and do. There are so many things to say about Darling Harbour. There is lots to see and do here. Many restaurants and a shopping mall as well as the iMAX cinema and boat trips, either day or Party Boats which depart during the evening. Not far from the Chinese Garden of Friendship and Paddy's Market.

Really nice, lots going on for all.. Shops, boats, parks, drinking and dining, museums, aquarium, and more. Great centre, and on the edge of Chinatown to add a little extra. Super kids park and play area, including water park, at the inland end of the harbour. Something special many weekends - e.g. local festivals and exhibitions at the inland end. Come and go by ferry ideally, but there are also buses and car parks. Not too far to walk from even CBD, but still come by ferry if you can. Essential part of Sydney.

Very busy place but still some worthwhile things to see and do!. We found the number of people around to be a little annoying but we got used to it once we sat down for a pizza in a quiet spot. Thenwe visited the tourist office and found some good info and a nice but expensive T-shirt. Around a curve we found the entrance to the China Gardens and this made our day. What a great place in the midst of the busy harbor!

Great place for restaurants and bars. If you are visiting Sydney and want to meet friends during the evening Darling Harbour is a great option. There are many restaurants and bars to choose from with a variety of cuisines and prices to suit all budgets. Many have outdoor tables if the weather is fine, and you can while away an hour or two people watching whilst you take in the spectacular Harbour scenery.

Tired. The restaurants are great very good prices would recommend nicks great seafoodThe area is looking a bit tired and could do with a faceliftThe shopping is not great unless you are looking for souvenirs
family friendly. great place to take the kids the park is amazing got lots for the kids a water park and flying fox !!

Everything in one place. Food, entertainment, shopping, bars and cinemas. It's all here as well as hotels. The Harbour is a great place with so much to see and do. You could just spend the whole weekend here.
Charming. A charming harbour with great green areas and a nice vibe to it! Long strolls in the afternoon are great!
Nice but a mecca for tourists. There are far better places to spend time in beautiful Sydney without being swamped by fellow tourists
Must see . Getting more and more the centre of Life in Sydney, day and night. A Lot of opportunities around in terms of food, Drinks, action, transport...

Great Place to Visit. Many different things to do for the entire family. Attractions to visit, shops, eateries and close to public transport. The light rail from central stops right at Darling Harbour. A place you can return to many times and still find new places to visit and things to do.

Wonderful place!!. We had gone their during our honeymoon and being the month of Feb. Valentines was being celebrated there..
You can meet people from all over the world just chilly in the numerous cafes, bar and restaurants here or just sitting by the walkway on the harbor...
The place has something to do for every1.
Must see if u visit Sydney!!!

Tourist area, center for attractions. Even though this is a huge tourist center, it's still a delight unless crowds become heavy. We saw dress-up charity balls on the water, a benefit for cancer research in the form of boat races (paddling 20 man canoes like crazy), fireworks over the harbor, and we ate at several excellent restaurants in a mid- to high-mid price range, and enjoyed the exhibits at the Maritime Museum. The ferries pick up and deliver at Darling Harbor well into the night. It's clean and well-lit, safe and secure, walking distance from downtown hotels.
Beautiful. Darling harbor is a beautiful part of Sydney. Lots of restaurants and has a great vibe. A small shopping mall and just a great place to sit down and have a drink.

If you're near, go. Wonderful. Historical walks around the edge, the modern centre has a busy vibrant atmosphere day and night, lots if restaurants and bars. The aquarium worth a visit. Lovely views all around. Central and easy to get to or go on from,
Beautiful!. Took the Hop on Hop Off bus to get here from The Rocks. Spent the morning strolling around the harbor, looking at shops & restaurants.

Amazing . One of the best places I have ever been, and my fave place in Sydney. This place has everything. Different types of food and great places to eat. Beautiful views. If going Sydney make sure you go here

Great sites and plenty to do. Met up with some colleagues to have a meeting and the weather was superb. Despite the renovations that are going on, the views and being so close to the water is great being in the heart of Sydney. We had a coffee at a nearby restaurant and were able to easily discuss our plans in a quiet and friendly environment.

Best place in Sydney. Frequented Zaaffran @ Darling Harbour last week and something I would recommend all to visit to oversee the most spectacular fireworks display every Saturday @ 9pm
Must visit place in Sydney

Still magical but changing fast. Wow how things are changing! The Darling Harbour of a few years ago is no more. The old buildings that used to line the waterfront are in the process of being replaced by modern apartments, theatre complexes, and ultra modern shopping malls.

Had a great time!. I'm a nearby local but haven't done the touristy things since I was in school. Took my Aunty visiting from overseas in her 60s and my niece who is 5 and walked around darling harbour. We went to the aquarium and they absolutely loved it! They were tired by the end of it but they were able to get through it and really experience it! Took us about 3-4 hours to do at their pace.

Being renovated - but still fun. Darling Harbour is being renovated so loads of construction going on but it is still a major restaurant hub. Loads of choice but a bit pricey. There is an Imax and public transport.
Saturdays 9pm fireworks!. Go and visit Darling hb, lots of bars, restaurants, shops, the aquarium, is always a nice view, and every Saturday there are fireworks at 9pm

My idea of harbour . Such a nice place to visit. Between mu favourite in Sydney. Full of people, colours and nice building. You'll find seagulls everywhere, IMAX cinema and big open space. It is a must if you are in Sydney for 1 day.

Great restaurants, pretty at night.. The harbour is surrounded by lots of restaurants, we stayed close by so ate here a couple of evenings. Very pretty at night. During the day there are some things to do such as the sea life centre or IMAX cinema.

Fireworks. Last day of your trip will not be a complete one if you miss the fireworks... ours was a great one indeed by enjoying the wonderful firework show.. Sealife, Madam Tussauds, Wildlife are situated here...one shot we can visit these attractions if you are here...
Busy but fun. Plenty to do and see, shops attractions and spoilt for choice with places to eat. Good place to take the kids

Must go . If Sydney is on your travel itinerary and you have 3 days in hand you will definitely visit this harbour for a lot of things. . I received positive Vibes when I first went to the harbour. . it is buzzing with people cycling jogging skateboarding or just simply sitting by the harbour with glass of wine.. lots of restaurants adorn the periphery .. it's a must do thing on the itinerary. . IT'S MANDATORY THAT YOU MAKE A DAY TRIP HERE AND A NIGHT TRIP TOO TO MARVEL THE NEOTS POST EVENING

A long walk on the harbour will refresh you. This is one of the best and must visit place in Sydney. A long walk on the harbour walk way relax in the restaurant and watch the lights on the harbour will get you a different experience. If you have time cross the harbour on foot over bridge and see the city lights from the other side.
Great night out. Darling Harbour can be accessed from the Circular Quay in Sydney and is well worth a visit. Plenty of bars and restaurants and shops - lots to see and do including a Chinese Garden.

Does't stop, always something to see. Very busy, lots of people but never felt crowded. Easy to walk around particularly with a wheelchair. Plenty to see, huge food options at various prices. Watch the ferries by day and the party boats by night.Visit the bars or sit in the park watching the children on the play ground, options are endless.

Beautiful Place with plenty to do and see. We love spending the day in Darling Harbour,there is so much to see and do,the shopping is great as there are lots of different shops that you only find in Darling Harbour...plenty to do if you have kids,the aquarium is fantastic,the restaurants along the whole waterfront are plentiful. Do yourself and your family a favour and go spend a day there.

Plenty to do and see. If you're visiting Sydney then a visit to Darling Harbour is a must. With plenty of places to see and things to do, this is a great area for adults, children, and families alike to visit. There is also a food court selling a medley of different foods, catering for everyone's needs and desires. No more squabbling, everyone can have exactly what they desire, and then you can all sit down and eat together.

WONDERFUL - so much going on. We enjoyed our stay close to Darling Harbour. There is always something happening. Heaps of restaurants to choose from, music, buskers, fabulous lights and Great fire works. Close to other key attractions, transport and very close to he central city.Overall a wonderful place to visit - can't wait to go back.

A relaxing afternoon, day, evening.. Yes, Darling harbour is touristy but it has a great feel with a wonderful setting, I love 30 to 50 mins away, depending on the traffic. Sitting in a waterside Restaurant and having a leisurely late lunch/early dinner, watching the passing parade with sooooo many restaurants to choose from. Then you can walk around and see what is happening, if you are a local make sure you go at least once when the Festival of Sydney is on in January as there will be lot's happening at Darling Harbour and an outside theatre. The water feature is wonderful for the children in any weather, you know what they are like when it comes to messing in water. We would wander down there at least 6 times a year, for tourists it takes on a totally different experience, just go an enjoy.

Always a place I love going back to when in sydney. Darling Harbour is one of the finest places I've been to. Last week we've been here again. This is the third time I've been to Sydney and everytime we go to the Quay, I never miss to have a walking tour of the harbour, always a must see place to visit, touristy and the view is always fresh to my mind.

"A must for all visiting Sydney". I live in Brisbane Queensland, yet whenever I visit Sydney I always stay in Darling Harbour. There are many first class restaurants at a reasonable price, however my favourite is China Town where you have a huge selection of restaurants with quality food. The Markets at Darling Harbour on weekends is also a must to visit

Great for Everyone!!! - always something on. Darling Harbour is GREAT for everyone, there is cafe's, bars and restaurants from all price ranges.There is always something one, check the websites for what is on. A kids park, a water play area for little ones, merry go round, fireworks at night, I love to go around Christmas time, where you can play "spot the Santa". There is also the Chinese Gardens a magical place.

So much to see and do. I went for a run on my first day staying here for work. I was glad that I did because it showed me all the local attractions nearby to the Star Casino.Amazing area, so much to see and do. Great area for a long run too.
A Great Surprise. We stumbled into this great place our first evening. A vibrant place with lots to see, do, and dine on a Sunday afternoon.

Another interesting harbor in Sydney. This particular harbor was designed by Rouse, the same man that designed the Inner Harbor in Baltimore,MD. It has a lot of shops to browse and a crossover bridge, plus an aquarium and an I Max theater.

Lots to do in Darling Harbour. Looking for an area packed with restaurants, bars, tourist attractions, this is it, all in short walking distance. Imax Theatre, Madam Tussauds, Aquarium, Wildlife place, boat tours from there. Short ferry ride around to Circular Quay and the city centre.

Great area to walk around. Variety of hotels overlooking Cockle Bay.A number of major attractions include Chinese Friendship Gardens, IMAX and Maritime Museum etc.Easy to reach by bus, ferry or light rail.Great location for breakfast, lunch or dinner.Some harbour tours depart from here.
Soulless. . Such a bland part of the city. Really hope one day it gets creative makeover rather than ordinary shops and food stalls.

Lots to See and Do. We stopped here from the Hop On Hop Off tour and found a lot of things to see and do here from shopping to visiting the wildlife zoo, aquarium and wax museum, which are all situated next to each other. Many restaurants with a variety of cuisine. Also found some restaurants serving kangaroo!

most beautiful happening place in sydney. loved everythng about darling harbour ......awesum restaurants , patios , wharfs , attractions like madam tussad , sealife aquarium etc. One thing that made me visit this place more than once was the awesum kids area free of cost for everybody....my kid just never wanted to come out of it......there are lot of activities to do in this kids area.......also lot of takeaway eating joints like subways , macdonalds etc....... we were there on halloween night and the whole place was bustling with ghosts ..........enjoyed the fireworks at 9 on saturday ............must visit place for all tourists and locals.....
The place to be. Darling harbour is the place to be for water view restaurants in Sydney. Huge selection of restaurants and bars to choose from including our favourite Hurricane's Grill :)
Great day out. whilst there is a lot of construction going on at the moment it is still a great way to spend the day in sydney. Great choice of restaurants, plenty of activities, shopping etc.

Great afternoon experience. The walk around Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay is will worth an afternoon, many small shops and a wide variety of eateries for either lunch and/or dinner. The Sydney Aquarium is also worth the trip. Ferries and harbor tours abound.

good views. Darling Harbour has nice views as it covers water on side, restaurant on the other side and also pyrmount bridge, boats, museum and cool breeze from the shore. It is an unforgettable experience.
Beautiful area in a beautiful city. You can spend the day walking around Darling harbour. There is plenty to do all day. Shopping, movies, restaurants; boats, sparkling water, just beauty all around.

Definitely worth visiting. Darling Harbour is such a beautiful place to visit with so much to explore and experience. Just the eateries alone are enough to draw you in. Among our favourites are The Hard Rock Cafe, The South Steyne, Pancakes on the Rocks, and many others too numerous to name. they all have deals on nightly so wander around before choosing. There is so many wonderful family attractions to choose from like The Sydney aquarium, the Maritme musuem where you can wander on the ships and subs, Pirate ships and Madame Trusades.So many Harbour cruises to Choose from and are excellent. The IMAX theatre is a must, as is The Chinese Gardens. It is also close to the Star City Casino where you can enjoy musicals as well as gambling.

Place for good lunch and dinner. Our most lunch and dinner happens here. The area full of restaurants, coffee shops and bars. For me I would prefer dinner here than lunch. Sunlight too strong to enjoy walk for digest foods.

Excellent Venue and Location. Must visit if in Sydney. Some great venues for lunch and dinner, walk to Chinese Gardens and other attractions. Catch the Ferry from Mosman, Manly, Drummoyne, etc, and then catch the Ferry from Circular Quay in the CBD which will drop you right in the middle of the action, Using the Ferry for your Public Transport really enhances your visit here. Or you can walk there from the CBD, lots of things to do and see. HIghly recommend this location if you are visiting Sydney.

Beautiful place. This is a beautiful piece of Sydney. We came here for dinner and had an endless amount of selection for restaurants. A nice walk around the harbour after dinner definitely completed the night.
Great place a must see. So much to see and do here so well worth a visit there is some great restaurants and attractions and lots f day cruise and tour booking offices based here as well

Something for everyone!. A beautiful part of Sydney that is still being developed so when it's finished it will be even better than it is now. Something for all the family and convenient boats able to take you all over the city and further afield. You're spoils for choice with bars and restaurants and there's plenty for the kids to do as well. Lovely place that is worth a visit.

Many restaurants and bars. There are plenty of restaurants around the Darling Harbour.
As well the IMAX is there and they have some giant wheels but they aren't giant enough as the buildings around the harbour are ways bigger.
Still nice for a walk if you around.
Amazing place. One of amazing place in Sydney , all activity around this area like restaurants coffee shop . Also the place suitable for running walking near blue water with wonderful view

A MUST SEE IN SYDNEY. GREAT FOOD AND ENTERTAINMENT.. this is a thriving harbour side there is always some thing to see even just sitting in a bar people watching. great variety of food and beer. while looking at a vibrant harbour.
Nice place for a stroll. Nice waterfront area with lots to do indoors and our. Restaurants in the area. Museums and aquarium at the harbour as well as ferries.

best family place I've been too. This would have to be the best family friendly place i have been to. Always something going on. Fireworks every Saturday night. The ferris wheel on the harbour. The massive playground. All the shops amd restaurants. Just an amazing place

Lots to see. This is one of the main centres to visit with good transport links and Restauants of every type. It's also where you will find the ocean world and maritime museum as well as lots of activities on the water including some of the whale watching trips.

A place to be any time, any day!!. One of the best harbours of the world!! Scenic with best views, lots of party stuff, loads of entertainment options, some amazing places like Madam Tussauds museum, zoo, maritime museum; and lots of fun!! As evening approach, the scenes become more amazing with lights and seaside bars!! A full day at this place a must do if in Sydney!

Fabulous location. Absolutely loved Darling Harbour. It is fabulous for its variety of eateries and also there is a great playground for the kids. The shopping centre is also a definite. They have an eatery downstairs with shops on all levels. Highly recommend a visit.

Always vibrant . I've been to this area many times over the years and it just seems to get better every time!!
The atmosphere is always vibrant and the variety of shops and attractions is amazing.. Many different types of public transport constantly coming and going to get you anywhere you want to go
Fireworks on saturday night!. They have a beautiful fireworks every saturday evening which it's beautiful! You can see the most amazing view with beautiful fireworks. Just awesome!

Amazing and busy place. Great location just by the harbour and water front. Enjoyed walking over the bridge to the city. Good views of the harbour and watching the people walk around the area. Close shopping although limited. Very busy place

Excellent bars and night life. It is very busy on a Friday night, most of the bars are packed. I went to Cargo Bar and Pontoon(I don't quite remember this one's name) but they are both very worth a go. Music is so loud, people are dancing and having fun.Both got outdoor smoking area. In Sydney they got a rule is that you are only allow to go to the bar before 1:30am then you can stay until 3am (last order) then they closed. There is a 24 hours across the bridge, the only one. With the red bricks.

Must place to visit. Darling Harbour is a must place to visit. It is a real buzzing place with plenty to see and do. It is especially busy on a weekend as there are many thing to keep children occurpied. Plenty of shopping and places to eat from the Food Hall to top class restaurants. On one of our visits on a Saturday night the had a firework display which was excellent, apparently they have one every Saturday night during October

The kids loved the playground. We had lunch at Darling Habour were there was many options to choose from. The playground was clean and safe for the children, and the kids didn't want to leave after spending an hour playing.

NICE PLACE. This is an entertainment and retail place to go if you are in Sydney. You can arrive by ferry or on foot. Here you have the Maritime Museum, the nearby China Town, the China Garden, and you are not far from the Sydney Tower and the Queen Victoria Building.
Darling Harbour. Great place to visit loads to see and do, variety of restaurants to enjoy a meal. Lots of shops. Fantastic firework display at weekend.

Great. walked Darling harbour, was just a nice stroll around, stopped and had the odd drink while passing as weather was lovely and made us all a bit thirsty, was nice and clean, and looking at all the boats etc is very relaxing,lots of bars and restaurants

A relaxing ,yet bustling meeting place for young and old !. Darling harbour never fails to impress and satisfy on each visit .It too has a variety of activities to gratify diverse interests from business ,education recreational and culinary needs. Progressive development around the harbour ,such as the new International Conventional Centre is typical of the futuristic vision of the City .!

A must see & do in Sydney. There is something here for everyone. Shops, restaurants, bars, entertainment & the famous Sydney harbour. You can walk a loop around the waters edge then up and over Pyrmont Bridge. Put it on your to do list in Sydney.
Walk. Just walked in the sun on a beautiful day, loved it, ther is so much work going on in the area but it is very safely organized.

A GREAT PLACE TO KEEP KIDS BUSY. SEVERAL shops, museums, attractions, restaurants and soon a new ICC and more hotels to be added to the already splendid Darling Harbour.. It will be easy to spend a day here and still be left wanting more.. BIG SECRET... EVERY SATURDAY NIGHT AT 9PM THERE IS A FREE 2 MINUTE FIREWORK SHOW.. YEAR IN AND YEAR OUT.. FREE TO THE PUBLIC!

A nice place for a visit. While we enjoyed the area around Circular Quay better, Darling Harbor has a lot going for it as well. There are a number of sightseeing venues located within walking distance from each other, now on both sides of the harbor. You could easily spend a day here, especially if you have kids with you. They also have quite a few of the harbor cruises that leave from the public docks here.We went over for supper at one of the restaurants that had outside seating and that worked out very well. To get back over to Circular Quay and our hotel, we caught a ferry after dinner and had a great ride back that stopped in several places around the main harbor. It was a well run operation, ran on time, and was pretty reasonably priced. Easy to tell which one you wanted and you could choose from a direct run or the scenic route.
lots of food. This is a good place to walk to and around on a nice day, there is a huge selection of bars and restaurants to choose from.
Saturday night fireworks. Loved the fireworks over the harbour and they have a free display every Saturday night. Loads of food places, lots of people and a really great atmosphere

Skip it. Extremely touristy. I have learned that anyplace that is near a hard rock cafe is generally a place to avoid. The restaurants have a strip mall feel and are overpriced. The rocks, although touristy, are much better.

well worth a vist. Plenty of restaurants, cafes, shops, cinema and water taxis. Just sitting and people watch. There is an old ship converted into a restaurant so a good mixture of old and new. Connected by a tram link

Lots to do. Great place for families. Lots of attractions for families, Madame Tusardes, Aquarium, Wild life Centre, maratime museum. Loads of restaurants and close to shopping mall and ferry terminals.

Restaurants and the maritime museum. If your a foodie or looking for somewhere with a good view to eat at then darling harbour is right up your alley. Also worth a look at the maritime museum next door.

Vibrant, family friendly, and surprisingly good value for money. Darling Harbour is quite rightly on every visitor's list. It's great for children, the play area is fun, and the bars and restaurants are good value in the early evening with special offers on food and drink.
Relaxing. Beautiful. Enjoyed a drink sat in the harbour and watching the world go by. A nice walk from our hotel

Darling Harbour plenty to do and see in the area. Found ourself in Darling Harbour after a short walk from Lyric and Casino.Spent some time looking at boats and replica sailing ships.Did not go in to Maratime Museum as about to close so save for next time as well as Madam Tusards.We had a meal at one of the many Harbour side restaurants.There are entertainers and fireworks at about 8.30 on a Saturday night anyway.Taxi not easy can be found on Tusard side of Harbour.
Fun for all. An absolute must for any visit to Sydney as there is a wonderful variwty of things to do and see from ferry rides to parks to Madame Tussaud's, the Imax cinema and Aquarium etc etc.

Gorgeous!. We stayed in the Darling Harbor Area and I'm glad we did. Friends have stayed in the Rocks and around Circular Quay which can get far too busy. Darling Harbor offers a perfect mix of shops, restaurants and other activities in a not too crowded setting.

nice place to have some fun. this is a place for all ages! take a walk , or enjoy your food or coffee in one of the restaurants, or take the kids to the Sydney wild life Zoo.. lots to do at this happening place..you can click some nice pictures.Its a 3-4 hours tour...Also there are lots of activities going on here which you can check with your hotel or online.... nice place would like to go again...
Beautiful little harbour. I stay overlooking Darling Harbour. It's a lovely area, not too overcrowded with plenty of options for a drink, food, relaxation and/or shopping

Paradise. This place is a real haven, very peaceful despite all the traffic on the nearby freeways. We just sat and soaked up the whole atmosphere and really had to struggle to tear ourselves away. There are some lovely restaurants along the quays and a good information centre.
Saturday night is awesome . If you're party goer then Saturday night is the time. Watch fireworks, enjoy great views n food and then get ready to shake it like Shammi.
lovely place. We had dinner here at a great steak house, weather, lovely view, lovers walking hand in hand passing by, what a nice place.
So cute. This is one of my favorite places in Sydney. So nice to walk around and relax. And they always have tons of things going on each month!!
Lunch At the Helm. The food was great and the service perfect, all with a great view and great value for money.Highly Recommended.
Happy hour haven. Great views, people-watching, eateries and drink specials! Perfect place to spend an afternoon walking about enjoying the downtown skyline and harbor scene.

Beautiful Darling Harbour. We enjoyed Darling Harbour a number of times during our 10 day visit to Sydney. We enjoyed a pleasant dinner at one of the restaurants lining the harbour, if is colourful, interesting and lively in the evenings. Boats are available to take tours etc. Also the Maritime Museum is located nearby.

Always some fun event going on here. Always some fun event going on here - visited several times during my stay and enjoyed a night out with friends, a fiesta festival and a free fireworks display.A nice place to chill out over some good food and drinks in the summer. I particularly enjoy watching the boats coming in and out of the harbour via the rotating bridge.

Not too crowded and excellent for ice-cream moments!. Love the gelato places and coffees and the seating to admire the view whilst enjoying time with friends is heaps cute! Sad to see IMAX going through :(

Lots of bars and restaurants. Darling harbour is definitely worth a visit. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants as well as an ideal location. Once the new convention center is complete, i expect things will definitely pick up in the area too.

Great night spot. This is a great place for an evening walk and meal with lots of bars and restaurants with happy hours that last for two or three hours ! if you do a bit of research you can hope from one happy hour too another. Day time is also good as the Maritime museum is located here, look out for the Octopus!
Shopping is going downhill. So many ugg boot shops, not a lot of anything else other than bars and restaurants. Good for a drink and a meal. Go to the city to do any serious shopping.

Lovely place to dine, relax, shop and people watch. Darling Harbour is a great place to spent time and enjoy the city of Sydney. Whether you want to have a coffee or freshly squeezed juice and just watch the passers by; or whether you want to shop and see what local attractions are on display that day either way it is a good place to visit while in Sydney.
Must go. Great place to go and eat and shop lots to see good for all the family. Must go and see when in Sydney can drive boat or bus.

WOW. Just like your in another world, everyone is happy and having a great time, just love the place have been her before but just as happy this time, must watch the fireworks display, real good and set to music (free too)
Plenty to do, with a bit of everything. Darling Harbour has shopping, tourist attractions, bars & cafe's, as well as the Casino. Tourist cruises depart from here as well as a Ferry on offer

Darling Harbour. Whenever we come to Sydney we stay near Darling Harbour. There are so many places to choose to eat, you are sure to find something for all tastes. The think that I like the most is that even at night you feel safe. There are so many people around. Families with children, couples, young and old. There is usually something going on to see. You can take tours from here, cruise from here. There is a kids playground and small waterpark to keep the little ones amused. Lovely atmosphere.
A stroll to remember. its a 13km stroll from china town to harbor bridge and back. But you wont realize it. beautiful views, little shops, something to see, do, eat and drink as your stroll around

Great options for entertainment and eating. I was pleasantly surprised by the range and quality of restaurants and bars. We were able to walk around and choose, and found friendliness everywhere. The area is large so can entail a great deal of walking. The outlook is fabulous so look for places where you have an outlook. Even when it is wet, it is enjoyable as there is enough shelter.

Good place for food and drinks. Short walk from Sydney center....it's full of restaurants and bars and some shops at harbourfront mallThere is even a food court at harbourfront mall if you don't fancy the more expensive restaurants.Nice evening walk along the waterfront is a must after dinner.

Great vibe for shopping, exploring, or relaxing. Darling Harbour has everything... attractions, shopping, food, and beautiful views. I really enjoyed my time and didn't feel at all out of place traveling on my own.
Changes. Visited the place after 5 years. Lots of changes , currently heavy construction going on. Locals tell us the place becomes more and more expensive.
Everthing you need in walking distance. We spent 5 days in Darling Harbour went to several attractions and ate out several restaurant's enjoyed the dinning experience and great food.
A good relax place. A peaceful day and night place to be visited. A good view and can take lots of photo there. A relax place,

Just a great place. We arrived on the weekend of the NRL Grand Final (which we didn't know until we arrived) and the atmosphere was fantastic as was the weather. We really enjoyed walking around the harbour and in the evening it was just as lively.
Very good place to visit...!. I was there for a night out and was very good... You got plenty of options to drink, eat or enjoy! This is a MUST in Sydney.
Came for the fireworks. Every Saturday at around 8.30pm, there will be fireworks display a the Darling Harbour. There are a lot of shops nearby and lots of bars and eateries, perfect for nightlife.

Will be much better when all the construction is done. The construction of the Convention Center is ongoing, so the vicinity is obviously a work-in-progress. Darling Harbour is really for tourists. Hard Rock Cafe, Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville and tons of other restaurants are here. I was told there are fireworks on Saturday night---ask the schedule at the information center if you're into that. We walked through, stopping here and there, took pictures and left to explore other parts of Sydney.

Fantastic place. First time to this area. Fantastic place, no .. a must to visit. The restaurants were great with a wide range of foods available. Happy hour at most resturants from 5pm. $5-00 beers & wines and one with 2 for 1 cocktails. Great place to "people watch" and enjoy the evening.
Darling Harbour.. Amazing, relaxing, ambient, friendly, has everything for the Food Lover........a must Visit . Interesting, Fireworks, plentiful Happy Hour in most places !
Lots to keep you interested. So much to do in Darling Harbour. Maritime Museum, ferries, water taxis, IMAX 3D cinema, so Many eateries for every budget. Great for families.

Remember Darling Harbour and you will remember Sydney. Darling harbour is one of the many ways to get a real taste of what Sydney has to offer. Good for families, friends, couples, business. Loads of fresh air and is just as magical on a rainy day. Well worth spending time in the attractions around the harbour or just taking it easy on a ferry or one of the harbour cruises.
Great place for families. Maybe not as popular as Sydney Harbour, but there was a lot to see and do (and eat!) here. Great way to spend a day with family or friends.
visited on saturday night. great place especially at weekends. nice place to hang out with family and friends. excllent eateries. excellent fireworks show on saturday nights

Much to offer on the waterfront. Walked all day and night starting at Cockle Bay Wharf/King St Ferry Terminal and walked across Bridge to the other side of Darling Harbour.Many indoor and outdoor eateries including Cafes, Restaurants, Ice Creamery etc. Good variety of food choices and although this area is always busy, you never feel crammed in.We love being outdoors so we don't come here to shop, but did spend time checking it all out. Felt disappointed with the shops as many are repetitious, selling the same 'Australiana' and Ugg Boots, mostly catering to the overseas tourists. It is still interesting to see their wares & you'll get a laugh.Love this area of Sydney as you have lots of attractions to see in this big area including the Maritime Museum, Aquarium/Wax Museum/Zoo, Tall Ship & Naval Vessel, buskers & entertainers, Imax Theatre, kids playground, skirmish, 10 pin bowling, galleries and you can book your cruises here (Captain Cook) or catch the ferry or water taxi.Easy access and can spend as little or as much time here as you want. Would recommend this area and what is has to offer.

The only place to Stay when in Sydney. I highly recomend Darling Harbour the choice of places to stay and eat are second to none.
I used to hire a car but now just get dropped at my accomodation and walk every where or catch the Ferry.

Relaxing day out. Darling is a great central location in Sydney. Beautiful views over the harbour and plenty of wide open areas to walk around. A huge variety of restaurants and eateries and bars, but be prepared to spend up as it is all a title expensive.

A little disappointed. My wife and I and another couple from Brisbane decided to walk to Darling Harbour for breakfast from our very central Metro Hotel on Pitt Street. It was a very easy stroll and we walked all around both sides of Darling Harbour and across the old bridge. There are lots of renovations and new buildings going on. It was about 9.30am and I was somewhat disappointed in the lack of beauty. We selected a place from the numerous establishments available and had a good breakfast. I think that it would be much much nicer and have lots more atmosphere if Darling Harbour was visited at night.

Stunning. What an amazing place!!! We were so lucky to arrive during the Vivid show..!! What a show..! Darling harbor was lighted in such an amazing way that I could sit all night and what's the show over and over again..! Loved it!!!

Great in the day and night. Not only is darling harbour fantastic in the day with it's beautiful scenic views, its nightlife is quite vibrant. Several clubs and bars are along the wharf near IMAX. There are sometimes fireworks at night too. Is a 10-15 minute walk from Town Hall station.

The Best Thing about sydney. If u r in darling harbour- u have harboured best of Sydney- so vibrant- so much to do-views- cafeterias- walks- water taxis- cruises- fun- can spend hours here without complaining- Love it all

Nicest Tourist Area in Sydney. Darling Harbour is great by day and by night. Always busy and energetic, there are great restaurants, bars, shops and things to see and do. Have dinner at one of the great restaurants and experience the night life. It’s an easy walk from almost anywhere but very reachable by light rail and bus. The walk to Circular Quay is also worth doing as is the Australian National Maritime Museum located at the north end of the harbor. And don’t miss the fireworks on Friday night!

Great place, always something to do. We stayed near the Harbour and so naturally spent lots of our holiday time in or around the harbour. It offers a lot of eating and drinking venues, as well as acting as a good hub for transport in terms of the numerous ferry stops it hosts.We also had the delight of experiencing the entertainment Darling Harbour has to offer in the form of the Fiesta festival. This was amazing, the atmosphere was brilliant, the fireworks were great, and best of all it was all free! Would definitely visit again in the future!

Filled with tourist shops and attractions. Darling Harbour is not really about the harbour itself as a tourist attraction, but the restaurants, shops and attractions which make up the Darling Harbour precinct. Nice to visit, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

Darling harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf. If you live like me in Sydney CBD and know Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf, you have been the luckiest guy on earth. This place is a lot of fun, relax, eat, entertain and a family day out kind of an area in Sydney.In the heart of the CBD and yet so beautiful and clean. The entire promenade (stretch of walk) which starts from the Cyren restaurant and perhaps ends now all the way at the best Asian Restaurant called MALAYA at the King Street Wharf, is a visual and a gastronomical pleasure.The eateries are amazing !! The Garlic Prawns in a Hot Pot at the 'Nick's" Seafood restaurant, are the best that I have ever had on this earth. Dip into the sauce with some sourdough bread. This eatery is highly recommended. The Malaya at the other end (at King Street Wharf) is the best place to eat if you love Asian cuisine. It is a living legend on Sydney waterfront.The activities for kids are ample and this place is also famous for its whale watching ferries that take you across for the experience....but heftily priced.It is so close to the business areas which have the big office of Commonwealth Bank, PwC Australia, and many great global firms and companies that line the waterfront.This area also has a beautiful walking bridge connecting you to the wonderful Pyrmont area which has hordes of attraction and restaurants. The very highly recommended tourist attaraction is the Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf areas and promenade.
Stunning Views. A great waterfront destination with so much to do. From its floating restaurants, cafe's, shops museum, aquarium, maritime ships its very relaxed place for all ages.

A beautiful part of Sydney . This is a great place to hang with friends, see the sites or enjoy a meal. There are often festival type attractions on so check the calendar. We often stay here when seeing shows in Sydney. Only a 10 minute walk to china town and paddies markets. Worth a visit.

Plenty of good restaurants. There are plenty of restaurants in this area to choose and at night it becomes very lively. We particularly enjoy the playground and the water parks which are open to the public for free. However, construction is on-going at the convention center. Once this is completed, this area will be one of the must visit in Sydney.
Enjoying the water. Don't rush here. So much to see and enjoy the outdoor dining and watch the world go by. Has a real maritime feel as you can visit the ships

Cool place with lots of character. A Sydney local showed me Darling Harbour when I was wandering lost around town. Beautiful views both during the day and at night. Lots of choices for food and drinking.
Nice and tidy. I enjoyed walking around this place and seeing all the tourist shops and harbor. Museum of Navy Transport is nice

Very touristy. I've been here once since I started living in Sydney 1 year ago. I suppose its something that you need to tick off the list but I wouldn't rush there, it's not the best place to be in Sydney by a long way!

Great buzzing place. Loads of places to eat, drink whatch the world go by or shop! Transport links good and it's nice and flat to walk around. Much off the area is pedestrianised so easy for those in a wheelchair or with pushchairs. Not the cheapest of places, but it's a popular place so you can spend much or nothing and still enjoy your visit.

A Harbour within a Harbour. We visit Darling Harbour as the site for the annual Boats on Water Sydney Boatshow. It is an excellent venue for this event. Boats can been seen up close from the shoreline or from above on the bridges plus going into the show.It is a spectacular and amazing sight all the many luxurious boats together! But Darling Harbour is an amazing place to visit apart from this with the many restaurants, walkways, maritime museum, to name a few. When the Convention Centre is finished it will also have an amazing entertainment and exhibition Hub.
Fantastic Harbour. This is a must on a visit to Sydney, access from public ferry and train. Great eateries and shops also entertainment.

Dynamic part of Sydney. Whether you are a tourist or a local visiting Darling Harbour is something not to be missed. The restaurants are all very competitive which is great for customers & the view is superb. It's even better now that the work on Bangaroo has progressed so you van enjoy a beautiful walk along the water all the way from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay.
Shopping and Downtown Excitement. There are all kinds of shops and restaurants in this bustling business district downtown on the waterfront.

Vibrant, Vibrant, Vibrant !. My wife and I recently holidayed for a few days in Sydney, N.S.W. We stayed close by to Darling Harbour, and whilst much of the Harbour area was under massive reconstruction work, we found the area immediately around Darling Harbour very `alive` .. we were visiting on the weekend of the NRL Grand Final and this only added to the excitement, with attractions having been built at the Harbour for the NRL fans. That by the by, Darling Harbour was a wonderful place to visit (even in the midst of all of the building work !), the choice of restaurants was just excellent and we enjoyed a few wonderful and reasonably priced meals, we tended to eat early evening and were always able to get tables near the walkways so that we could savour the mood, the passers-by and the wonderful mix of cultures around the Harbour. Additionally, we found a very good shopping mall down at the Harbour with some great shops and what looked to be a food mall offering a wide choice of international cuisine. We saw little or no bad behaviour down at the Harbour even though alcohol was being consumed in fairly large quantities by some visitors, and over our short holiday we returned to the Harbour a number of times, most early evening, for food and drinks. We really love Darling Harbour, a great place to visit when you are in Sydney .. if you want, there are many specific attractions down at the Harbour although we did not visit any, preferring to just take in the atmosphere generally.
Nice scenic area. Nice scenic area with lots of restaurants. Take the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. This route could give you the best view of the harbour.

One of the best, period. I will never feel bored to visit Darling Harbour as there is always something new to see and enjoy. It is the balance of features which make this harbour so lovely, even in rainy days.

A walk - a stroll - a run; just name it. If you like the loud crowd and the bustle of a city, this is where you should visit.The whole stretch of restaurants in this area might get you hungry yet confuse because you could not choose which one to try. For a first timer, you might got lost easily in this area but thankfully there are a lot of map in the area where you can look at and find your way. If you do not want to enjoy a meal, a stroll down this area is recommended - or just have a sit and observe what other people are doing (Gosh! I hope i do not sound like a stalker :)) But this is where you could be alone in a crowd.
Lovely birthday dinner by the water. Excellent service and food. Lovely being near the Harbour. Meals are very reasonably priced and beautifully presented . I loved being pampered on my birthday

Where the past meets the future.. Great for all ages, lots of attractions, weekly firework displays, bars, shops, restuarants in a friendly atmosphere. Dont forget to visit the old galleon, now a floating resturant in the harbour, great choice of menu, relaxing and amazing views. Children love it.

Fun place. Darling Harbour is a nice spot to stroll in the evening and enjoy scenes, cafes, restaurants and good atmosphere. I think it may be overshadowed by Sydney Harbour and yet has a lot of attractions to offer.

Most Lively Location in Sydney. If you are a party animal and love crowded area with happening crowd this is the place to be!Crowded bars with a romantic view! Has a shopping arcade to where you can find cheap deals!All in all a must visit when on vacation to sydney
1st time Sydneygoer. check closing times of the attractions different from the websites and got caught out a few times. very disappointed.

Soulless and Windy - Bit bland really. Stepped off the ferry at Darling Harbour for the first time, looked around and was, well, nonplussed. Lot of restaurants though it was difficult to see where one ended and another started. Some attractions though entrances weren't inviting. It was windy and no protection. Tall ships and Steamers added interest. Bridge across to CBD great idea. (Only sorry we didn't know about Chinese Friendship Garden, our bad.)Lots of construction going on so would be good to visit again once it's all finished to get the true lie of the land. But overall first impression - lacking in quirky character, lots of hard surfaces and uninviting. Bit bland really.
