A Darling place to visit. Darling Harbour is simply darling. We ate at 3 great restaurants, walked around and took great photos, and the Fiesta happened to be going on last weekend so we were able to enjoy it as well. Good times!

Aquarium great, Madame Tussauds cheap but fun. Zoo rubbish.. Darling harbour is an excellent place to eat. Cheaper than the main harbour round the Opera House. Happy hour too (but only 30% discount. Chinese friendship garden worth a visit .
Great place to stay. Good place to get a hotel and make homebase. Access to alot of hotels and attractions. Wax museum, aquarium, Wildlife place. Light rail station, 10-15 walk to Sydney Eye
Function at Dockside Pavilion. Excellent venue for large functions. At cockle bay wharf . Venue and service was fantastic. Table settings were to a very high standard.

Salsa dancing. Check out the Salsa Club on Thursday night. I think it was called The Cargo Bar. Loads of fun. Even if you are not game to dance just watching the dancing is fun and the atmosphere is classy and fun.

Nice place to stay for a couple of hours. Around the harbour you will find dozens of restaurants for a fine lunch or dinner. At one day we had a lunch at a tapas restaurant consisting a glass of sangria and a tasting platter.Another day we had a dinner at a steak house with a group of 25 persons and they could handle this very well. Enough, let's even say too much, food so went back very satisfied.At our last evening we had a dinner in an Chinese restaurant. While the food was OK their service was poor in that they couldn't handle the group size. While some were finished some others were getting their dinner. Our group were the only guests.

A lot of building work - will be amazing when finished . There are lots of restaurants round the harbour, so lots of possibilities for eating. When I visited there was a huge amount of building work going on, which didn't make for a relaxing stay. I do think that it will be stunning when complete. I hope to visit then!
Fun place to visit . You find here various family activities, bars, restaurants,.... So much difference between the day and night activities. Be sure to check it out at both times!
Close to everything. Love staying in Darling Harbour, partaking of the great food and the value for money accommodation. Just a stones through to awesome attractions and shopping.

The Beating Heart of Sydney!. I used to spend many a lunch break in Darling Harbor, and have taken many friends there to see for themselves the fantastic sights and sounds that await them there. There's an abundance of fabulous restaurants and eateries, a maritime museum that even has a Russian submarine you can investigate, one of the world's best aquariums, a major world-class casino, and the kick-off point for a host of terrific harbor cruises. Or you can just plain relax and watch the crowds pass by on their way to the host of shops. China Town is only minutes away, as is the "must visit" Fisherman's Wharf. Oh, and don't forget to use the monorail that travels through Darling Harbor to points beyond in Sydney itself. I could go on for pages listing all to see there but, you know what, it's best if you see it for yourself .... and don't forget your camera!!!
Awesome. a must when visiting Sydney! Eating can be a little expensive but it is a great experience.Saturday night 9pm is fireworks on the water.

Stunning. What a beautiful place, amazing views, amazing screnery, lots to do and see and look at. very clean and worth the visit. At night it lights up beautifully and the restaurant views are amazing.

Beautiful setting to relax in. Darling Harbour is a fantastic place to visit, you can just sit by the water and take in the waterscape and all the boats or you can dine basically to any cuisine you choose. A great place to spend a day.

The place to be. All the action seems to be at Darling Harbour. You can do everything from catching harbour cruises, going to the movies, shopping, relaxing in the park, having a great meal. I enjoyed just grabbing a drink a people watching.

Lovely place to hangout. First place i went at Sydney for my first time visit was Darling Harbour, the exact time was July 2013. And the traim just terminated by the end of June 2013. the area itself looks flash with lots of attraction surround. And it also was a ferries stop. Just one thing, food quite expensive here..
Party Land. A fun place to take the family. Lots of restaurants, bars and other facilities. Not for people wanting peace and quiet!

good place to have a meal. having a walk round Darling harbour is a relaxing lots to see plus good places to eat at, maritime musesum at one side of the harbour then across the harbour is Madame Tussauds..Plus as you walk to Darling Harbour you have the Chinese Garden of friedship
Food and a view. There are plenty of places along here for every taste from Asian toSeafood to BBQ. Great view relaxed location and reasonablePrices

Most breath taking place ever!!!!! Party on the streets. Darling harbour was one of the most amazing places i have been to, its like a party out there, i was staying at the Holiday inn Darling Harbour for 2 weeks, used to go there almost every day. There are a lot of carnivals,festivales etc. on the weekends, there is hardrock and alot of restaurants along the harbor. For tourist attractions there are Madame Tussads, Wildlife and sydney aquarium which are fantastic. My favorite time there was on a habour facing table at a restaurant at the far end of the harbor serving Sheesha and beer. Try and get rooms at either Ibis or Novotel darling harbor for a splendid time

Make the visit on Saturday. What I like about Darling Harbour:1. It houses the world's largest IMAX2. Every Saturday, Darling Harbour will have a display of fireworks. Escape the crowd by ascending up the stairs near the Imax to get on the overhead bridge along the expressway. 3. Harbourside shopping centre closes after 9pm. 4. Restaurants along the harbour operates late into the night with a decent variety food choices. Nice place to dine outdoor even in winters as they have heaters for alfresco dining.5. A good place for people watching with regular events. (e.g. when we went, there was a taiwan exhibiton on culture and food going on)
Stunning!!!. Loved walking around darling harbour. Especially at night must do while in Sydney. Loads of places to eat around it

Fun, vibrant precinct . Darling Harbour is filled with life, especially at the weekend. We enjoyed the restaurants and children's playground immensely. The old shopping mall part is all but empty, which is quite sad, but the outdoor areas more than make up for this. Easy, flat walking, well sign posted, with great views. Fireworks every Saturday night.

Very touristy. This was one of the most over crowded spots we visited. Can't see any reason to go there as a couple. I'd only suggest as a destination with young kids. Many restaurants. There is a zoo attraction and underwater world plus wax museum.
Dinner at Darling Harbout.. We walked to Darling Harbour for Dinner. We had 2 small children with us who were very interested in the Harbour and the surrounding area.
Beautiful place. Beautiful place to go crazy taking pano photos and also to chill and just enjoy the view. Good place to have some food and drinks also.

Relaxing area. Plenty to see for everybody. A lot of construction going on at the moment which will only improve the area. You can spend as much or little money as you wish here as there are so many options.

Great location for an overnight getaway!. My advise is stay at one of the many hotels situated at Darling Habour and walk in. There is a great selection of restaurants within the Darling Habour area, try I am Angus for steak and Seafood, with a view!. China Town is a short stroll away with the ice creamery N2, which is amazing.
All in one!. You can have everything here. Resto, mall and tours. Can be a romantic place or fun with your kids. MUST DO every Saturday night, fireworks. Beautiful.

Less shops. There are a lot less shops here than on our earlier visits.The food outlets in the food hall seemed to be mostly used by the maintenance staff, but in fairness to them it was early morning when we visited so they may have been busier later. The light rail makes it easy to get to now that the monorail is gone.
Darling harbor. The Darling harbor is s fun area with tons of restaurants, little shops and a Ferris wheel. There is a Hard Rock restaurant that is very good.

Plan for weekends with kids, dinners for couples, bars for wkd going outs. A very much loved place for Sydneysiders. Trendy area full of restaurants and attractions for families during weekends or friends who want to go out for dinner: zoo, aquarium, cinemas... They have some fireworks for kids on Saturday and Sunday evenings. There are some expensive restaurants but also some nice cozy ones where you can have a decent lunch for 12 Aud. Trendy restaurants like Hard Rock Café are here. There´s also the usual suspects Starbucks, McDonald's, Haagen Dazs, etc.Some bars offer kangaroo skewers but if you really want to enjoy this kind of meat, have a nice steak at ¨The Wine and Co. Around 50 Aud per person but it's worth it. From here you can also walk to Chinatown (a small little street but nice) and Paddy's market.
Darling Harbour. We stayed 3 blocks from the Harbour. The restaurants were outstanding and you can take a ferry to quite a few places. We would stay in this area again for sure.

Great nightlife. We visited Darling Harbour at night. The place was full of restaurant-goers and tourists. There are many restaurant options open to at least 10pm. Parking is too expensive - so take public transport.

Lots to see. We went to the Tourist Information Centre and the lovely girl on the desk managed to book us on a few excursions. We had a wonder around, there was loads of nice shops, restaurants and a fabulous children's play area, as it was the school holidays the area was really busy. Was a great place to explore.
Great holiday activities. Lots going on, great food, coffee and shopping. The best fudge shop ever and activities for children. Great harbour cruises
worth a visit. loved darling harbor, so much to see and do, we enjoyed going to the wax museum and the markets, had to buy a new suitcase!!!

Social life. It is worth to invest your time and money because all in one. If you like social life mainly drinks with your friend at night and it is live during the day as well then pay a visit you will love it and experience good vibes
nice scenery. another great place to walk around...you can walk from The Rock and then taking that way back to Darling Harbour...
Darling Harbour. This place is good to just browse or to shop. Plenty to see and do or just take a relaxing stroll and enjoy the buskers.
Museum, animals and shopping. Lots to do in one place, shopping, restaurants, maritime museum, Sydney aquarium, animal sanctuary, madam Tussaud's, IMAX, park.

Great Views and Lots of Things to Do. It's so nice to hang out in Darling Harbour. There are so many things to do here. You can go on harbour cruises, ride water taxis, ride a ferris wheel, go on a carousel ride, watch a movie at many theatres here like the IMAX Theatre and 9D Action Cinemas, go to the museums like the Australian National Museum and the Powerhouse Museum, stroll down the Chinese Garden of Friendship, visit the Outback Centre, and dine at the Cockle Bay Wharf. I highly recommend going to Madame Tussauds, SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium, and WILD LIFE Sydney Zoo if you're in Darling Harbour. Check online if you can avail of combo promo tickets to enter these attractions so you can save money.

in the mist of reconstruction and refurbishment. Currently in a full reconstruction mode with lot of construction noises and dust not a good time to go but otherwise very pleasant to patronise on a sunny day when finish,

A nice wander . We visited on am extremely warm October day. There isn't too many places to avoid the burning sun unless you take refuge in one of the many bars or restaurants. All in all, a nice experience though...

Great for eats and night lights. Good to walk around during the day but really best by night.So many restaurants you will find one to suit. Many are geared to one-off tourist visits so service can be a bit iffy. Take the Ferry from Circular Quay, even better!

My Darling. The Darling located just of the main city center is a great place to relax unwind and explore. There wide open promenades all around the harbor which features shops, restaurants, cafes and bars. Definitely worth a visit.
Many things to do. Beautiful views around the harbor with many restaurants and other tourist attractions such as Madam Tussaud, Sea World, Wild life Zoo..

Memory Lane........... Lots of things to do and see in this area including get the Aquarium and a ship museum. Restaurants abound, park benches and restroom facilities. Harbor rides and fireworks in the evening are other options. A must do while in Sydney.

Nice view of the harbour of sydney. Darling harbour is one of the best icons of Sydney that you cannot miss.In my experience it was excellent with a lot of good restaurants and photo attractions and to explore.Going to this location gets you to know more about the culture of Sydney.This area has a small chance for pickpocket. I recommend trying to walk to the Aquarium if you have small children. The environment is very friendly where you can walk through the Chinese gardens and go to the 4D cinema.

A great place for young and old. Only a short walk from the CBD is a very useful tourist spot, with a variety of choices in terms of what to eat and/or drink, as well as an Imax theatre, and, just behind it a well-stocked Info centre as well as a park with plenty of water-based interactive aspects, from water pumps to an Archimedes screw to locks to water wheels and water fountains. I believe that every Saturday night there is a firework display over the harbour itself, using barges moored within the harbour.

A Great Place To Be. Darling Harbour is beautifully situated on the water and is not far from the city centre irrespective of where you are.staying.Obviously it buzzes more at night than during the day but there is always something happening irrespective of the time of day. It is full of restaurants and bars with many styles of food and ranges of drinks available. You would be hard pressed not to find almost anything you need.Have visited here many times in the past and feel it is one of Sydney's best.It really is a must see.

Great choices in food and beautiful scenery!. Darling Harbor is a beautiful site to see! The restaurants in the harbor are wonderful and provide very good food. The restaurants in the harbor are a bit pricey but they are right on the harbor so it's not surprising at all. I consider myself a cheapskate and I still payed for every meal without batting an eye. Great place to spend the evening with good drinks and great people!

Not a lot to see but a few good eateries. Darling Harbour started well some years ago but seems to have deteriorated in the last few years. It was always an 'artificially constructed harbour' and so doesnt have the 'true ring' of a harbour..rather a 'converted dockyard' (which is what it is)Now that the main mode of transport..the Monorail, has been demolished, it is not an 'easy walk' as the adverts claim to get there and more difficult to get back to the centre of Sydney...quite a steep walk up the hill actually. Main attractions however, are the magnificent aquarium, and the Chinese Gardens. Apart from these two excellent features, the rest is just a lot of eateries and the IMAX cinema if one is interested. Probably good on a rainy day..well the aquarium and the cinema that is.! Better spend your time at the Museum of Natural History in College Street, Sydney.

Lovely area. This is a nice area with close access to Circular Quay. Good shopping and easy access to food. Be careful of the Seaguls. We were eating Subway and had to fight off the seaguls as they came in from above trying to steal your food. That was disappointing, but when you look over and see people feeding them, it's no wonder.

One of the prettiest places in Sydney is Darling Harbour. Absolutely love walking around Darling Harbour especially on a warm day. There are so many places to choose to have lunch or an evening meal and prices are competitive. Some places even offering $10 meals on certain days of the week. Plenty of bars to grab a drink. Ice-cream parlour. Attractions such as I-max theatre, wax museum, Maritime Museum are all there as well as several tourist offices to book tickets. We always stay somewhere on or around Darling Harbour as it is close to everything.
Darling Harbor is Darling. Great views activites for all to do and see. Nightime is lit up, and restaurants are plenty in area. Centally located and easy acess for walking, and public transportation
Cool place!. We really enjoyed wandering round and watching the world go by whilst drinking cocktails next to the water.....lovely vibe!

Lovely day or night. A great area to stroll along day or night. Safe, loads of restaurants. Take the ferry to extend the experience. Has fireworks and free performances during festivals like vivid Sydney. Easy stroll from Chinatown & surrounding hotels Queen Victoria Building and George Street. Loads of quiet spots to sit in gardens. Good play area for kids and wheelchair friendly. Martime museum is very interesting & imax theatre, waxworks and aquarium. I strolled on to sydney fish market but that may b too far for some non hikers!
Darling ;). Good experience of enjoy the ambiance of Harbour view with some cafes, not very easily accessible but good for spending a couple of hours.

Best place to go on new year eve. I visit Darling Harbour many times because very close from my apartment. Very kids friendly, because they provide place for kids to play. Many fancy restaurant are available here too. Any western food, sea food, steak, indian, and fast food are available here. When new year eve this place will be packed. Many people come and see the fire works. Very recommended place to visit.

Beautiful. Loved every bit of this magical place. A must see in Sydney both in the day And after dark too. Lots of choices of restaurants and very lively, a unique place where one can find quiet and hustle bustle together

a great change to the usual sydney harour. a fantastic change to circular quay, darling harbour offers more in way of affordable dining options and night life. Its where the young Australians hang out on a weekend so go and soak up the atmos.
Tourist trap. A tourist Mecca offering cheap tacky souvenirs and little else in the way of shopping. Lots of restaurants and cafés. Lots of activities to suit all tastes, museums, aquariums etc.

Must see in Sydney. one of the places to visit in Sydney, restaurants, aquarium, museums and other interesting places. A must see specially if visiting the city for the first time. Walking distance from CBD
Darling Harbour. a lot to see here, but all the shops and restaurants here are expensive, just for the tourists. Great time to just stroll up and down seeing all that there is on show

BEAUTIFUL FUN HARBOR. When I was thee they had fireworks at night. it was the BEST fireworks show I had ever seen. The harbor itself is so much fun. There are tons of stores and places to eat. Have a wonderful time.

where you can dine, shop and visit attractions. Darling harbour has everything you need. there are 4 top attractions here as listed follows:1 - SEA Aquarium2 - Wildlife Zoo3 - Madam Tussaud's4 - Maritime MuseumPlease purchase combo package for great bargain. Other than attractions, there are harbourside shopping mall, restaurants and cafes, Hard Rock Sydney and ferris wheel. Great place to spend your evening.

Pass through on a ferry but don't stop. In it's day Darling Harbour was good. Now that the monorail has gone, and the restaurants are over priced with average service I am not sure why you would venture here. Of course there is the aquarium and the maritime museum and a big commercial restaurant boat if that is your thing but I don't go out of my way to come here when I am in Sydney.

Great spot on a sunny day. Great location to enjoy the sun, watch the world go by and have a great feed and a few drinks and an excellent place to stroll around at night and pop into one of the many bars
Great place.. Darling harbour is a great place to vist and or stay. It has enough there to do. Mind you it is aimed more at the adults, but my kids ( 12 and 1 ) had fun too.

New Ferris Wheel is a hit. The ferris wheel appears to be a new attraction for Darling Harbour. The cost is $30 for 4 riders and we we able to ride around 5 times. The kids really enjoyed the view and you can rotate the gondola so each person can take in the 360 degree view.
Building site currently. Many new waterside buildings going up. Most shops are pretty sad and the cafes and pubs are just for tourists with little quality

Definately Worth the Trip, will be good when its finished!. Extensive building work is taking place but its worth the trip to look around here, it will be great when its finished as it was a bit tired before. The water is great and many restaurants, photo opportunities and buskers entertain in the area especially on weekends.
Grandkids in sydney. Had a great time in Darling Harbour with five small kids in the playground, especially the water maze. Except that everyone got a bit wet and the weather was cold it was great
Memorable. Darling Harbour is so lively beautiful place. And the festivals going on there's fire cracker shows and the view from ferry to manly beach was just lovely

For the Adults. Well there is no shortage of good restaurants and bars here although a bit pricey in some of them. Plenty of people enjoying all it has to offer day and night and a great place to catch one of the night time cruises. Next time I come down here I will book with travelhotelsbooking.com closer to here and maybe leave the kids at home.

Great place to go for a walk. Excellent place to go for a walk. My wife and I visited Sydney with our 8 months daughter. Is a great place to walk and there is plenty of restaurants (child friendly) to sit, eat and enjoy the harbour.You can get to Darling Harbour by train and/or bus from Surry hills (15 min).There are a few things to visit in Darling Harbour e.g. Maritime Museum and Madam Toussauds Wax Museum.You can also visit the Lindt cafe and get a hazelnut ice cream. Just incredible !

Lots to see and lots to do!. Lots if places to visit, eat and things to do. I came for a walk round on sunny afternoon and sat and had a drink in one of the harbour bars. Right by Chinatown, across from the Westfield shopping centre and sky tower ideal location for dinner or drinks or just a walk around. In the winter they have fireworks in the harbour.

A must on Saturday night !. Darling harbour is the place to be in the evenings! Lots of cafés, bars and fine dining. Saturday nights at 9 pm is a must to watch the fireworks. They are amazing ! We had a great meal at The Big Meat Company. There is a Zoo but we didn't visit this attraction. We say several party boats living the quay and it look really exciting. We will try this on our next visit.

A MUST see if you are in Sydney. Darling Harbour is a mainstay of ANY trip into Sydney and is full of fun, excitement and things to see and do for people of any age and 'visiting goal'... There are plenty of bars, restaurants and things to do, and whenever we have visitors from out of state or from overseas we ALWAYS take them to Darling Harbour as it is exciting and has a really 'good vibe' to it. You will absolutely find this place a great place to visit, and when the evening comes around and the lights come on it takes on a life of its own...HIGHLY recommended for any visitor to Sydney.
Expensive but a must. Darling Harbour is a MUST see in Sydney - drinks and food on the bars are in the expensive range. But it is worth a visit.

Lively area, the heart of Sydney's tourism. Lots to do here, lots to see and lots to eat. This is a fanatic area with the kids, with street performers, activities, boats, museums, sea life centres and lots of places to eat an drink. The place really becomes alive during the Vivid festival.

Sparkling Sydney Darling Harbour. On a stunning spring Sunny Sunday in Sydney, what better place to take a late afternoon wander than around Darling Harbour.For many years, the forgotten part of Sydney city Harbour.All the focus was on Circular Quay , the Opera House and the Bridge.Now as the Barangaroo development takes shape and the north headland park has opened, the views from the west overlooking the city stand out.The walkways were a buzz with people with cafes doing a roaring trade.Sure, the prices along Cockle Bay and King St Wharfs were a little steep (tourist prices) but the views were worth it.There are plenty of sights from old 3 mastered yachts, warships, submarines, the Maritime Museum and the Aquarium.A great few hours was spent just wandering around my city!

Sit, enjoy and drink. Here I was for a small walk to find something for my new experients. The time I spend here was at evening but stay there till nighttime, to see the beautiful sunset in this beautiful city, where I stay very long. There is so much to do that I could nearly not leave this area.
Darling harbour. Love darling harbour. So many things to see and do or just sit back and relax. Lots of great places to eat

Great atmosphere. Love visiting Darling Harbour, they are always very festive and decorate the place for every event. Fireworks on at least once a week, always on a Saturday, and sometimes mid week, depending on the time of year. Plenty of bars and restaurants around, so a very lively place at night.

A place for all ages.. Lots of see and plenty of places to eat as u walk around the harbour. If you want to have an overhead view of the harbour, then walk across the pyrmont bridge. There is a tourist centre at darling harbour which you can get a lot of brochures and information about visiting the rest of sydney.
Great to visit. Currently lots of development in the area. Lots to see and do. Ferries to everywhere around the harbor. Great restaurants and attractions

Lots to do for all ages. Maritime Museum, Aquarium, Wax Museum, Bars, Restaurants, Shopping need I say more! Every Saturday night at 8.30 they put on a fireworks display. Loads to do for all ages. Some of the bars turn into nightclubs on the weekend and have famously DJ's performing thought the year.

Take a walk in Darling Harbour. Wonderful place for a long walk and brisk walk with the family. Must day outing in your trip to do list when you are in Sydney. Summer and Spring is the best time to enjoy this walk.

Busy place with a nice flair. Walking across the Pyrmont Bridge in Darling Harbour you can see the boats on one side with the actual harbour area and the Maritime Museum on the other side while you leave the busy CBD behind. There are a lot of shopping and eating places all around the harbour.

A hive of Activity. Visited and stayed at Darling Harbour recently for a Hen's Party, the restaurant scene is alive and well, with some really nice places to eat and enjoy the ambience. It was Saturday night, the weather was warm, so it was very busy, and very noisy, the nightclubs were all in full swing, which is ok if your young, but the noise levels are up there, I thought it took away a certain charm. We wandered down for breakfast next morning, was fabulous sitting near the water and watching the world go by.All and all a great place to visit, plenty to do.
Great for the whole family. Lovely to walk around and often there are free activities available. There are plenty of restaurants and hotels nearby and Sydney City Hall rail station is close.
Sydney darling harbour. Beautiful place, the food is great, transportation made easy, cool weather and the people here are friendly.

Place to hang out in Sydney - fabulous. Managed to get an apartment beside this popular spot. Beautiful, developing area popular with both tourists and locals, Wide variety of cafe;s bars and restaurants with something for everyone. Was there during Taiwan festival so very busy and believe this is the place to be when festivals are on. Loved just sitting around the waters edge. Found it really relaxing considering how busy it was. Harbour Bridge and Opera House are beautiful but this is the place to hang out. Fabulous.
Full of things to do!. The darling of Sydney! Darling harbour is full of life and things to do. It is somewhere you need to bring the family for a fun day out!

Great place with a lively atmosphere. have been to darling harbour several times, always enjoyed it. So many places to eat and drink. The fireworks are great if you can battle your way through tourists! Tip- sydney wildlife zoo usually have 2 koalas on display out front and you don't need a ticket to go and see them!

Good mix for everyone. This place has a large number of eateries to satisfy everyones needs. For those on the good there is a food court or you can sit back in a resturaunt and drink beers or sip wine .. There is shopping. There are a number of hotels to stay the night and it is close to China town, Star city casino and a few blocks from the fish markets and George street sydney. Reccommended to venture here and enjoy.

Family fun. There is always something going on in darling harbour. I took the family there last night and we had street performers, acrobats and ferris wheel to entertain everyone. Lots of places to eat and drink. Finished the night off with fireworks as well. You must visit when in town. check out their website for whats on.

fun for every one. Was there visiting family and was amazed on how much it has grown. restaurants in the complex , some outdoor seatings. shops and shops and shops. All types of quisine to satisfy your palate. there is a park nearby and so you can make this a whole day experience.

Vibrant and Lively. I never tire of visiting Darling Harbour. There's always so much to see and do. Huge variety of eateries. So relaxing just wandering either through the Harbourside shops or along the waterfront. The whole precinct has an air of excitement at night with all the colors and lights etc. It's a great place for all ages.

The place that has everything. This is your one stop location for everything entertainment in Sydney. There are a variety of dining venues from fast food to posher restaurant. The weekend fireworks are a nice touch and the bridge is really nice to see when it opens.

Beautiful place. Beautiful harbour, with lots of things to see and do. At night this place is buzzing with people.
Lots of restaurants, and you can start your boat trip from here!

People's place . We stayed overlooking Darling Harbor. You see people night & day. Great restaurants line up both sides of the Harbor. An added touch is the colorful Ferris Wheel, & the cages rotates if you want to when it goes up. There are performers in the evening. On Saturdays they have fireworks. The bridge over the Harbor is for pedestrians only, so a good place to jog or walk. A must to visit if you're in Sydney. We'll recommended.

People watching hotspot!. Whiled away a couple of hours here before heading to the airport. A great place to sit outside with a beer and people watch, soak up some sun, and see the boats coming in and out. We used it to reflect at the end of an awesome trip. Lots of eateries, rather than pubs and bars. Drinks reasonably priced for the location. Didn't come here of an evening at all as it was mostly restaurants, but imagine would be a great backdrop to a meal and a few drinks.

Lots of different dining & drinking choices. Darling Harbor has a lot of different restaurants and bar, most with a excellent view on the harbor. Furthermore plenty of restaurants and bars have happy hour between 3 pm till sometimes even 8 pm. I highly recommend this place to go dining or just for a drink after sightseeing.

Looking a little tired.. Darling Harbour is one of those places every tourist wants to visit. It is certainly worth the time to pay a visit, but it is very touristy and looking a little frayed around the edges.

It's all about the view. Darling Harbour has some really great views. You get to see amazing views of the skyline, especially at night. Lots of photo opps here. There are many restaurants and bars facing the harbour on both sides, so you'll be spoilt for choices. It’s nice to sit outside and have a drink or meal. There’s also a shopping mall in the area. There was a Ferris wheel in town during our time there, so we were lucky to have had the opportunity to go on a ride while enjoying the awesome view from above – lovely!

Great evening venue. The place to go on a night, for your dinner, plenty of places to choose from and there was a lot of building going on when we was there so next year will be even better. Get your water taxi from there to the Opera House.

Give 1 day to Darling Harbour when in Sydney. Great place to soak up the sun, enjoy the museums, dine at great restaurants, enjoy the Sydney skyline and basically have a good time. Ideal for couples, solo travellers, families or friends, Darling Harbour has something for everyone. Great place to spend an entire day. Start early with Maritime museum. See the ships from bygone era share the harbour with modern sea warfare. Walk over the bridge to the other side to enjoy the wildlife zoo, aquarium, wax museum and other various attractions. Ideal for kids and equally appealing to grown-ups, Darling Harbour has host of attractions to keep everyone happy. Grab a bite at harbour facing cafes and restaurants that serve up delish dishes from various cuisines. Be prepared to walk a lot but its fun. The place looks enchanting at night and the tempo doesn't set till midnight. Do plan to see the fireworks that take place after 8:30pm on Saturdays. Highly recommended when in Sydney. The Westfield Sydney Tower Eye, Queen Victoria Building and neighbouring shopping centres are just a 15-20 minute walk away. This city has a lot to offer and Darling Harbour is where you would love to return time after time.

Lots of Dining Choices. Visited Darling Harbour again when in Sydney this week and although it doesn't have the same appeal as the Circular Quay precinct, it is still a very nice place. Lots of shops and restaurants and great for people watching and relaxing.
Bright and lively. Great to walk around day and evening. We arrived by ferry from circular harbour and walked back to centre town hall. Lots of cafes bars and restaurants but can be pricey
Darling Harbour. This was the only really "touristy" place we found in our trip to Sydney. Glad we went but other than to walk from there up to Townhall and St. Andrews no reason to return.
Relaxing. Darling Harbour is well worth a visit . It has plenty of eating places along the harbour . You can get various boat trips from here
Lovely. Fabulous shops and loads of restaurants. Few souvenir shops too - a bargain! Hard Rock Cafe is in here too!

Lots to see and do. There is lots to see and do in Dalling harbour, there is always different entertainment on and on a Saturday there is an excellent fire work display. There is a variety of different priced eateries for everyone's choice. It is also a short walk to Sydney town centre

Very enjoyable to watch the fire work and enjoying dinner and wine with your friends in the restaurant !. The Darling Harbour is situated near China Town ! Every festival season we have thousands of visitors to visit the area. Especially young man and young ladies . We have visitors visit the area from all part of the world , in lude they come from Melbourne and Queensland. There are many restaurants and many boutiques shops for shopping . Also there are exhibition centre for trade and exhibition for show ! There are many hotels for around the area. Including the Casino also near by the area . I used to go there every week end for lunch and shopping there . It cater all level of customers. Sometimes you can get bargain prices for clothing there ,which is cheaper than most of the area in Sydney ! Some times they have fire work in the area in the New year's eve . Million of people will be there !

Another must see place in Sydney. Anogther must visit place in Sydney, the joy of this city is that everything can be seen walking around. Darling harbour has loads of great restaurants and amazing boats

Must visit. Great fireworks display on the Saturday night we were visiting Darling Harbour. Not sure if they are on every Saturday night but we were fortunate to catch them on our weekend away. Darling Harbour has work being down on new buildings at the moment but this does not in anyway affect access to the restaurants or shopping area. There is a playground and grass area with easy access for all. Numerous choice of food and drink from cheap to expensive. Great atmosphere at night with all the music and lights from the many attractions along the waterfront.

Cafes, Seagulls and Cruises.. Lots of cafes line the Darling Harbour. Would be very nice to sit down for drinks and food. However we were there in the day and we got to see seagulls and more seagulls. Feeding the seagulls was lots of fun for the kids. The seagulls were definitely used to being fed. The some of the Captain Cook Cruises depart from Kings Wharf and it's a much nicer place to wait compared to Circular Quay.
Always lots going on. Even though Darling Harbour is incredibly busy on weekends it has a great feel good vibe and there is always plenty to see and do, and many eateries to check out.

Awesome location. A definite maritime flair fills Darling Harbour from the Old Maritime Museum and its dry-docked submarine, to the plethora of charter boats on the opposite CBD side. The bridge is a tourist place to visit and take snaps, especially at night with the the mini Ferris Wheel all lit up with neon colours.

Busy, vibrant area. An area with lots of bars and cafes plus things to see. You can easily lose yourself for a few hours. The Maritime Museum to one side with quite a few moored vessels to walk around. Spend time here.
Love it. One of my favourite places in Sydney, lots to see and do, lunch at Hard Rock. Dinner at Margaritaville, salsa da de lessons. Amazing place to see

Gorgeous on a spring day . We walked through Darling Harbour on a stunning sunny afternoon and it was just a delight. We were actually looking for a harbour cruise so that was a good reason to wander right along the waterfront. There are so many places to eat and also lots of entertainment for families - neither of which we were doing. Things were a little pricy as far as I could see but not unexpectedly so.Anyhow, we had hoped to do a harbour hop-on hop-off boat trip but it was early afternoon and they cease to be cost-effective at that point as you don't have enough time to maximise the ticket. So we just took a Majestic 2 hour cruise which was great - took us to most of the sights in the harbour and we enjoyed a glass of wine as part of the ticket. Pretty good commentary and nice relaxed pace.

Great Fireworks!. I think that there are a lot of offices in the vicinity but this is essentially an entertainment/tourist centre. The Saturday evening fireworks at 8.30pm weekly are a MUST SEE and were better than London's annual New Year's Eve fireworks, which they make such a big about. Shame on the Brits, the Aussies do this better every week of the year. Unfortunately, I had one bad restaurant experience at the Harbour. I regret not getting to go on the Ferris Wheel, for which I blame Cyren restaurant, where I wasted two hours waiting for my food when I could have been on it!.

We love Darling Harbour. The Darling Harbour precinct is one of the gems of Sydney and a great place to just wander around and soak up the sights and atmosphere. Dining and drinking venues are in plentiful supply as are shopping outlets. The Chinese Gardens are stunning and the Imax theatre is always popular. The western side is older and currently undergoing major changes. The eastern side is newer and more vibrant. Check it out. You will not be disappointed.

Great to sit and watch the world walk by.. The posh harbour in my oppinion. It is lovely on a sunny day( and there are loads of those in Australia) to sit with friends and have a glass or two of wine and chat.

Great for a feed and drink . Great area for good meals with a wide variety of restaurants and bars ... also you will find the hard rock cafe, museums, maddam tusaudes, aquarium and much much more.. good tip to save money as can be pricey there, happy hours for most venues run weekdays anywhere from 3 to 8. Times varey ... but a must for a nice evening of drinks and food ..

A cool area to wonder around. Many restaurants and cffee shops, great view (at night time) and some otjer things to do (cinema, museums...)
Don't miss the area when in the city!

Darling Harbour Shouldn't Be Missed. No shortage of things to do in Darling Harbour. It's also very easy to get to using public transportation/ferry. I went to Darling Harbour (and didn't even realize that it WAS Darling Harbour). It was my first night in Australia and I'd met some of my friends. We decided to go find a place to eat and/or get something to drink. I only found out that that was Darling Harbour about 3 weeks later. Spectacular....and by the way, we went to an absolutely fantastic bar for some drinks. I wish I could remember the name.

it was ok....... i made the trip here from the rocks area where i was staying because of some of the things people had said about shopping etc, but after spending an hour and a half one morning in this area, didn't find much that was special / different in terms of shopping / food.

Darling Harbour at Night a sight to see. This is a place for everyone . You can come here with the family for the whole day or night. There is plenty to do and see. Couples or singles are also well accommodated here. Good meeting place to catch up with friends. There are a lot of things that a free as well as museums, aquarium and the wildlife attractions that incur a fee. best to go online and pre book your tickets. There are plenty of hotels around Darling harbour for all budgets.

Nice place to walk around :). The harbour has really pretty views of the harbour, including the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. There are also plenty of cafes/shops/museums around so there's plenty to do. You can also get a ferry across the harbour which gives you a different perspective :) Overall a very nice place for a stroll with friends :)

This is a MUST to see when visiting Sydney. Every time I come to Sydney I make a point of coming to Darling Harbour, there is just SO MUCH to do while you are over here. Great places to visit, great restaurants. Its just a vibrant place to spend the whole day. Its only a short walk from the CBD
Great. Lots of great restaurants in the area.... It is great to sit outside a bar & just take in the view and the atmosphere. Always something going on here, lots to see and do
Darling Harbour at dusk. It's so easy to say that it's a romantic place. The view is stunning, the colours are vivid and the people friendly.

Darling Harbour is a must. Weekly Saturday evening fireworks are spectacular. If you find yourself here on a weekend, be sure to watch for these. You don't have to wait for New Year's eve and it is all set to music. Incredible cafes and shops which are open late also made our visit memorable.
Lots to do. Darling harbor is a buzzing place. There is lots of attractions and bars and restaurants here. It is a fab place to go day and night.
Fab spot. Such great memories here and we used to go here all the time. There is great bars and places to eat here. Walking around and relaxing here is the best.

Lovely to stroll around the harbour and people watch. I made a full day of it but I must say that as a tourist I was very put off by all the construction going on and the lack of signage to assist in navigating the area.I can see it being a great place to visit in a few years. Right now looks a trifle shabby.The shops are the usual tourist type but the restaurants are many and varied

The place where pleasure is. Just sit back and relax at one of the eateries there and have beer at anytime of the day will be the only thing you want to do here at Darling Harbour. No need to plan anything else. Just go with the flow is the best.

Worth the walk. Darling Harbour was a bit of a walk from our centrally located hotel, but well worth it - wonderful view, very peaceful. Really enjoyed watching the ships and the quiet walk around the harbour.

Darling Harbour for couples or families. Darling Harbour is Sydney's relaxed entertainment venue.Families with small children can find a fantastic children's playground underneath the highway overpass (this is nicer than it sounds!) with cafes and a McDonalds nearby for takeaways while supervising their fun.Harbourside shopping centre has a great food court and bargain/good value clothes shopping. By night the bars and restaurants in Cockle Bay Wharf and Harbourside come to life, maybe not with a roar, but there are plenty of options available.If you're on a budget I would recommend going upstairs (above the chocolate cafe) to Blackbird cafe where the prices are a little more relaxed and the views are better than the ground floor cafes.In general, while there are a few party venues, Darling Harbour is not the place to go if you're looking for a wild night out with great music, dancing or meeting lots of cool people - try the Rocks or Newtown if this is your thing. The atmosphere is ideally suited to families and couples. You can hear each other talk, people watch and sit by the harbour, there's lots of romantic spots to hide away in and enjoy each others company.

Ok for a stroll, but it reeks of commercialism and really average restaurants. Apart from Zafraan, and maybe Crinitis, the restaurants around Darling Harbour are average and below, and very very very expensive. The whole place reeks like a tourist trap. I guess one good thing is the free and imaginative children's playground, and this is why it makes it to three dots for me.
Darling Harbour. A great place to visit and some great restaurants and bars for lunch or dinner. Great shops and easy to get to.

GREAT AND ENTERTAINING WALK. We were walking in Sydney and decided to cross the bridge and all of a sudden we found a spectacular place!!! Darling Harbour with great cafes, shopping mall and wonderful places to walk and enjoy. Don´t miss it!!!

Lovely, enjoy the fireworks!. Very nice. Lots of restaurants. Don't miss the fireworks on some weekends. Long waits at restaurants at those times though, be prepared! There are take-out options too though. Get there by ferry for the scenic experience!

Just simply a Darling of a harbor.... spectacular and breathtaking harbor just to walk around is so calming and relaxing. Plenty to do from eating, to shopping, to people watching and relaxing. I'm from Miami and this Harbor is one to behold. I convinced that if the Opera House and Sydney Bridge where not at the Circular Quay harbor; people would live at Darling Harbor.

Picturesque historic harbor. We happened to be in town during the Australia Day celebration. They shot off an impressive fireworks display over Darling Harbor. A beautiful location, with thousands of people for the occasion.

Lively and interesting. An interesting place to visit busy with both locals and tourists from around the world. Many photograph opportunities, a handy food court and several souvenir shops. Another good place to visit.

Worth a visit, it's one of the ferry boarding area of Sydney. Touristy and expensive.. It is touristy with many higher priced restaurants. Can get very crowded, so nice place to people watch. It's one of the main docking area for cruises and ferries. It's worth a visit as it is a nice walk along the harbor.

One of the best parts of Sydney. If you have fine weather whilst in Sydney, then getting down to Darling Harbour is a must do. A lovely area to wander around and soak up, surrounded by restaurants and shopping if you are that way inclined. A great way to spend a few hours in Sydney away from the concrete jungle of the central CBD.
Relaxing. A very easy going and walkable area. The Harbour is a bit crowded view wise with all the boats and activity but there is loads to do for all ages. A family friendly spot to be sure.

Fab chilling area. Walked all the way down from the rocks to Darling Harbour, through a real depressed area and into darling harbour. Straight away the mood is changed and there's a real chilled atmosphere here. Pick one of tons of eating and drinking places to just chill and people watch. The view is spectacular with old ships across the harbour as well. Most of the bars have a happy our from 4-7 or 5-8 as well so everything is really reasonable. They are beginning to build up on the other side so the sun could get blocked out in future which would be a real shame.
Too busy too touristy too expensive!. The area is nice many restaurants and cafes.Just too many people at any time and prices can be sky-high.There are better places and better value around Sydney.

A little disappointed... I was a little disappointed in Darling Harbour. It is a lovely area, but the layout of the Harbour in a U shape sort of creates a separation. It's hard to explain but I just didn't get a nice vibe and atmosphere there, I wouldn't choose the harbour for a cosy Friday night drinks.

Sightseeing. Two words - just beautiful xxx what a great transport system Sydney has. To be able to enjoy your sights in such a relaxing way and for a great price is sensational. Can't wait to come back!!!
Must visit. A lovely place to take a walk and take in the sights. Some great restaurants and the starting point for a lot of cruises. Madam Tussauds, Sydney Zoo and Sydney Aquarium are located here.
Sydneys relaxation spot. Restaurants, families, shopping, away from the traffic. Its peaceful but still in the city. Surely its a favourite spot with most Sydney siders

ferry ride. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay $12 the green/cream boats travel round to Darling Habour wonderful opportunity for photos of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge and other views on the way takes about an hour well worth a visit.

Race car attraction. Inside the Harbourside Shopping Centre, Darling Harbour, there is a car simulator attraction that allows you to 'drive' anything from V8s to F1s. They are very realistic machines providing 3 screens of action around you and plenty of noise and movement. You can race solo or in groups. The guys that run it are helpful and recommend you work your way up to the really fast cars. Take their advice as they are amazingly realistic.

Lovely Darling. Can walk there from Town Hall station or from Paddy's Market. Very nice view harbor. A lot of activities can be done there. Enjoy walking along the harbor and there are a lot of restaurant and shop there. There is a bride that can be turn when the ship pass through. Must visit here while you are in Sydney.
darling harbour. darling harbour is a great place to take in the sights very relaxing just walking around,plenty of bars and restaurants to eat and drink at .
Everything you need in one area. Splendid area lovely marina, bars, restaurants, shopping centre , Madame Tussaud's, Sealife Center..
Love it!. Great place for dining chilling walking and meet friends. Lived just across the road for a wile and really loved this place.

Its a Darling all right. A great place to absorb the inner harbor and the attractions such as the Maritime Museum, take the ferry from circular quay and get off either at the maritime museum or king street wharf either way you can return by the other stop after enjoying a leisurely walk around the harbor front, there are plenty of choices for dining or just relaxing over a glass of wine etc with most establishments offering a lunch package at reasonable prices (competition is good for the consumer in this part of town).
Take A Walk About!. Take a lovely stroll around Darling Harbor. There are lots of restaurants and shops. Or just sit relax and watch the world stroll by. A must in Sydney.

Great hangout. We went here as soon as we dropped off our bags from the hotel. We found a lovely restaurant and had lunch. The atmosphere was friendly and great. The we just walked around. It was great.

Brilliant Waterfront With Eclectic Mix of Restaurant & Attractions. We just wandered along the waterfront enjoying the eclectic mix of restaurants, bars and other attractions. Staying out at the airport, we spent a sunny day just walking along the waterfront and enjoying the sights of boats, condos, sculptures, shops. Lots of places to stop and sit for a while.They have lots of additional attractions including the maritime museum, aquarium and a few parks. A most enjoyable day.

Come for the fireworks!. A little commercialized but good for a walk. The scenery is nice and the fireworks are really really good! Try to go early and get a spot in the restaurants so you can watch the saturday night fireworks.
Just walk around this place and enjoy it!!!. Lots of do here, lots of nice places to eat and drink, great place to spend many hours just wandering around taking in the culture!!!

Beautiful during day and lively evenings !. Walks around Darling Harbour are always great - what with all the dining options and stores all over. To make it even better, take a ferry ride from any of the wharf around city to Darling harbour to add to the fun... gives a fantastic view of the Opera house , bridge, and the Syd skyline.They even do regular fireworks every Saturday eve @darling harbour.
Lovely area!. A great area to sit and chill and watch the world go by. Several impromtu concerts were going on in the time we were there. Prefer here to Sydney harbour!

Darling by name and Darling by nature. Every time I visit Sydney I have to spend at least one day walking around and dining also visiting shops and attractions . There are lots of things for all ages to enjoy
Lovely. Walked all along Darling Harbour. Beatitiful views of the water way and gorgeous when lit up at night. We ate in one of the restaurants there after our cruise. A great place to people watch.

First Stop in Sydney. The first thing you should see in the city is Darling Harbour. It will give you a feel of the city, even before you have started exploring other places. This is one of the most famous attraction and very rightly so.

Darling Harbour. This is a lovely place to walk, talk eat, drink and people watch! the whole location is always clean.Darling Harbour has some great bars and places to eat and is best late afternoon and into the evening
Lovely in the sunshine ☀ . Went for a wander around the harbour just as the sun was setting at it was magical. Plenty of nice places to eat and drink too.

Undergoing an upgrade. Darling Harbour is an excellent venue on Sydney Harbour but is currently undergoing the major reconstruction of a conference centre. On a hot day the water park in Tumbalong park is my kids favourite park in Sydney. Food is average and pricy but it's worth spending a day cruising the foreshore. They have an aquarium, iMax theatre and wild-life park so there is always lots to do. It will be magnificent when the construction is finished.
Worth a visit.. It has become more like a business center with lots of nice restaurant nearby. Not as good as circular quay yet it gives somehow dynamic feel.
definately worth a visit. Amazing place if you like busy cafe culture lots of choice for restaurants etc deffinately worth a visit.
Look past the current construction works. Take the time to look past the construction works as this is vibrant eItpcentre of activity and a great place to eat and watch life on the harbour go by.

Evening Run. Darling harbour provides a fabulous series of board walks that you can run for a comfortable, flat 10 km circuit. You can stretch this to a neat 25 km if you do a loop over Anzac bridge and out around Black Cockle bay, then loop the other way out around Syndey Harbour to the Opera House and back. The whole run is flat, mostly well lit for night running and you can dream about the boats you may want to go,out in..... Always a pleasure to run the the area. Note if there is a special event on this can be crowded, but most of the time you have a clear run around the board walks.

Fireworks spectacular. The fireworks every Saturday night at 8:30pm were pretty spectacular. Was only expecting them to be a few fireworks considering they have them every Saturday night, but the fireworks went for about 10-15 minutes and didn't disappoint.
Wonderful atmosphere. Lovely environment to go for a walk, there are some very nice restaurants in the area, worth a visit

Awesome Fireworks. We took our visiting Japanese student to see the fireworks on Saturday night and were really surprised at how good they were. And they are on every Saturday night till the end of the year. Don't want to think about how much they cost.I live in Sydney and did not know about them until we looked into taking our visitor to some interesting places during her short visit. It was crowded but not overly so and there's the added attraction of buskers and a variety of places to eat.Try the overhead walkway by IMAX for a great view.
Nice outlook. Lots of nice restaurants which offer happy hours daily. Kids enjoyed the ferris wheel on the harbour. Lovely view of Sydney City especially at sunset.
Busy!. Central area with lots happening. Great play area for the children. Close to Chinatown, close to town. Lots of dining places. Lots of entertainment places.

Tourist Trap. Strictly for the tourists. Restaurants and eateries encompass the harbour along with souvenir shops and the Tussaud's group of attractions. Cross the swing bridge to the Maritime museum ans moored ships.
Excellent. A amazing and beautiful place. Prepare your feets for a long walk, but will be a fine rewarded.Totally recommended to all the world!

Darling Harbour, Sydney. Shop here.. It was abuzz with activity even though it was winter. Had lots of options to eat, shop and all at a budget. Vegetarians can visit this place with hope to get some good food.
Busy and crowded.. Very busy and crowded area. We went on saturday evening and all the restaurants had long waiting. A good boat show was there.

Nice place. With so much to do in and around the Darling harbour , this place is not to be missed in Sydney. With plethora of nice restaurants , mall , promenade ,tourist spots , there is something or the other to do for everyone here without getting bored.

Sufficient area for tourists to stay. Stayed in Darling Harbour for my entire time in Sydney. It is a little quieter than the direct center of the city, but gives you the same level of access. There are plenty of shops and restaurants to keep you busy, but the best are probably a 10-20 minute walk depending on where you are in Darling Harbour.

one of the cosy location in Sydney. Here where Young Sydney lives. Most happening place. Surrounded by all kinds of fine dine restaurants with all varieties of cuisine like Indian Thai Chinese Italian , Continental, Greek. Even cheap eats options like Subway, Mac Donald and a food court available inside the Darling Harbour shopping mall.Many attactions available here like the wheel ride, Maddamme Tussauds, Sydney wildlife, Imax, etc.
Breakfast . It's a beautiful spot to people watch and grab a feed. We had yum cha plus breakfast the next day. Love going here.

Very enjoyable. We stayed at a hotel at the Harbour for 4 nights and came here almost every day. There's a lot to do here since there are many really good restaurants and cafes here. There are also a lot of places to shop and buy souvenirs at a reasonable price. You can catch a ferry from here and take cruises. It looks especially beautiful at night with all the lights and the Ferris wheel. There's a pedestrian bridge to take you easily to the other side and it's a very safe area to walk around in.

Worth-while. Great place, museum (warship & submarine) worthwhile going through given the chance. You can spend as much time wondering around the exhibits or cruise through depending on time and interests.
Shines beautiful in the vivid time.. Nice place to be and walk around. Especially in the vivid time and all the lights around. Just beautiful.
Great food and location. So much to do in one location. Great shopping, food and views of the harbour. Loved the Ferris wheel too.

Beautiful view and a great walk!. Must visit on a trip to Sydney.
We spent 5 nights in Sydney, and our hotel close by, we visited Darling Harbor almost alternate night for a quiet stroll.
Lots of local bar options with decently priced alcohol.
Looks beautiful in the night lights.

Worth visiting. Plenty of things to do and see. It's one of the places you would undoubtedly be told to visit as a tourist. It's ok, it paid off. It has a zoo (not THE zoo - that would be Taronga), Madam Tussaud's, iMax, the turning bridge, a ferris wheel, loads of restaurants, the Star Casino behind and a shopping mall. I can't say we did all of those, but the kids enjoyed themselves and we wore ourselves out at the end of the day, which I guess is a sign of a successful trip.

So much to do. Love this place so much, there is so much on offer here. This was a very quick visit to Sydney but still we make shrewd spend one night in Darling Harbour. So many restaurants to choose from which are child friendly and the fireworks on a Saturday night start at 8.30pm just for 15 minutes perfect timing.

losing it's mono. What was once an essential part of a visit to Sydney is now being encroached by unsightly developments, construction sights, tourist trap restaurants & an "el cheapo" looking Ferris wheel

A Nice Evening Stroll for Dinner. We visited Darling Harbour for dinner and had a really nice walk from our hotel, it's pedestrianised and there are play areas for children, so the whole area felt very family oriented - even though there was some glam black tie event happening on one of the quays that night.

The Harbour. Darling Harbour is a "must to visit". Wonderful views of the harbour from many area, great restaurants to eat at and people watch from and the prices of the restaurants aren't too pricey for a big city.

Overrated. What on earth has happened to Sydney. As a tourist we felt we were an inconvenience to many of the eating places. Just another bunch of tourists taking up their valuable 'me' time. The rudeness and attitude was appalling. It was the first time I have taken my wife to Sydney. Our expectations were high, but poor hospitality greeted us at almost every location. We have visited many places in Australia and loved it. Save your time and money and visit any where else, but not Sydney. Very disappointing from start to finish. The most courteous person was the guy cleaning the tables at McDonalds, Circular Quay - he should be promoted in charge of hospitality for Sydney.

Weekend Fun. Last weekend my family & i went to Darling Harbour to visit some of the 'touristy' attractions. Most of these are located in Darling Harbour. The changes made to Darling harbour over the last 15 years are amazing. Its a more family friendly environment now and even after dark - feels like a safe place to be walking around with family /friends. There is always something going on and lucky for us we got to see the fireworks which were pretty awesome and topped off a great day out. There are so many places to eat, something for everyone. I do think more toilet facilities would be awesome though and maybe more of those little trains that take you from one side of the harbour to the other? Its a shame the monorail has been removed as that was an important part of Darling Harbour. We'll be back of course.
reaxing and pleasant. We just love darling harbour, we always catch the ferry whenever we are in Sydney. Its a lovely place to relax and enjoy the views.

Lots to see and do. We did all the major attractions, Sydney Sealife, Sydney Wildlife and Madam Tussauds. The attractions are very interesting but very crowded as you'd expect. The children loved them, especially the animal ones. Accross the waking bridge Harbourside has some nice shops and we even tried our hand at some ten pin bowling, only the lanes kept malfunctioning (but that's another review) The Ferris wheel was there when we were there too which gives you a fantastic view of the harbour and city. Several whole days could be filled quite easily in Darling Harbour.
Touristy but still fun.. Lots of great food choices. People mulling around having a good time. Central to the city so easily worth the effort for a visit.

Very nice place to hang out. I was there in April 2015. It was good weather, good scenery there. I did some shopping there. It is a great spot to dine with, a lot of restaurants available there and even Hard Rock Sydney. I enjoyed my food at Hard Rock cafe and also Pancake on the Rock. I love to chill at Darling Harbour at night especially, cool breeze.

Overcrowded, noisy but pretty!!. Have mixed feelings about Darling Harbour. I only visit it at night time and was lucky enough to watch some fireworks. But it was soo noisy and overcrowded that I had enough after 1h if pushing through the crowds. Restaurant are packed and serve average to poor quality food at maximum price, simply because the people are there at their doorsteps and need to eat something. Will probably visit again during the day time.

Go to Sydney Sealife and Madam Tsuards while in Darling Harbour.. Lots to see and do, Sydney sea life and madam tusards were close by and were well worth seeing! Loved the dugong at sea life. She is so clever.

What a spot. Darling Harbour is a great spot to visit, a lot to do in one day. Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner or snacks coffee or A drink of champers can all be found here. Lots of different eateries, bars or just a gelato. Great views of the water as you meander along. Great day or evening- something for everyone even an IMAX theatre.

Vibrant at any time of day.. Everyone should visit Darling Harbour at least once. Tourists yes, residents like me? Yes.Lots of food outlets, casual dining and expensive dining abound. Imax cinema, parkland for kids to let off steam, lovely ambient views, lots of trees and grassed areas to sit and relax. It can get very busy on the weekends and at night. Book restaurants if you want to go to a fine dining place to ensure your table. Take water, hat, sunscreen. It does get hot. Parking is tricky. You will need to find a parking station. Walk from city is steep but relatively easy and direct. Ferries from Circular Quay also drop off to Darling Harbour area too. It is larger than you might imagine. So allow time to wander and relax.
What a shame!. Darling Harbour is under construction, stay away if you can. Shame, more concrete jungle is on its way. Such a pity Sydney!
Amazing view. Awesome view of the harbour , lively and safe , good facilities around the harbour , worth a visit but not to miss the harbourside shopping center.
Great spot, people and nightlife. Darling harbour is an amazing place, which has free outdoor activities, lots or restaurants and a great night life. We will definitely return.

Free Fantastic Family Fun!!!. The Darling Harbour precinct is a must do for families that any families visiting Sydney - their is a wonderful waterplay area (my kids just rolled up their pants and took off their shoes, but there were other families who were clearly so much more prepared then I was and their kids had swimmers - depends on how wet you're happy to let your kids get I guess) and the climbing structures, slippery dips, sand pit, flying fox, giant chess and ping pong were also heaps of fun! There is stacks of free things for families to do here - If you don't have fun at Darling Harbour it is your own fault!
Pretty. One of my favorite places when i studied in Sydney. Darling harbour is surrounded by many popular restaurants and bars. The atmosphere is very chill.

Not as I remember. A nice walk to Darling Harbour but it's not as it was. It's full of cheap eats and lots of young people on skateboards, chasing seagulls etc. wasn't that clean either. Certainly not the best place to visit in Sydney.

Fell In Love. We went with a group and so much enjoyed ourselves but the only thing is it was raining. :( We ran from cover to cover. So disappointed that we couldn't get the full joy and beauty in this location. I just couldn't down star it because of a weather issue. All 6 of us LOVED this area! It will be one we visit again if we ever get back that way!

Disappointed. Usually a Great place to visit, Unfortunatley with all the foreshore redevelopment going on all you get to see is a maze of timber fences about 2 Meters high ,untill you are right at the water not good,Come back in About 2/3 Years when Finished??

Lovely Location. Lots of lovely places to grab a bite to eat. We enjoyed wandering around here several times during our stay. We also visited Madame Tussaud's and the little wildlife place right next door. Also a great location to hop over the lovely pedestrian bridge into the main city for shopping etc. My only advice would be to avoid the snooty Flying Fish restaurant round the far side of he harbour (see my other review)!!
Beautiful Harbour Views. We just love Darling Harbour, to stay and to play. There is so much to see and do. Restaurants, Cafes, Accommodation and much much more.
Darling Harbour. A very nice place with lots of activities, attractions and shops. You have beautiful views and lots to see.
Best Skyline views of Sydney.. Something is always happening at Darling Harbour. There's restaurants and bars galore. On the weekend their is also a free fireworks show too.

Lightning. Darling harbour is one of the popular place in Sydney, Australia. This harbour is so busy and crowded every weekend. At night time at 8pm there's always fireworks for the people to watch and enjoy.
Awesome. so lovely. Lovely to stroll along the seafront and people watch. Also lots of things to do including Madame Tussaud's

Too commercial. Darling harbor has become increasingly commercial over the past few years and is quite crowded and overly-built up now. While it does feature on lists of all Sydney tourists, it may not live up to what you may expect

Good Blend of Local and Touristy. Darling Harbor is packed with restaurants, some nightlife/bars, and tourist destinations. It is located near many offices so during the mornings and peak meal times it is bustling with locals but it also is home to many tourist destinations such as Madame Tussaud's and SeaLife so there are also many non-locals there. Would recommend trying the food there at least once and checking out the view, it is pretty spectacular, especially at night.

Great place to visit. We stayed at the Park Royal Hotel which overlooked the harbour so we had great views in daylight and at night. We had a fantastic view of the fireworks on Saturday night. The harbour area is really lovely. We had a couple of breakfasts and an evening meal during our stay there and it was lovely just to walk around and take in the atmosphere. Much nicer area than The Rocks.

Great at night!. Our hotel was quite close to the Darling Harbour so we visited a couple of times during our stay in Sydney.We particularly enjoyed the evening time, lots of bars and restaurants. We felt quite comfortable and safe to walk around, also found the area to be very clean.
YOLO take the ferris wheel. Lovely touristy place to walk around, take pics, get food. Very clean and pleasant. YOLO...take the ferris wheel...you know you want to.

Harbour. One of my favourite places in sydney. So much to see and do. There is shopping,bars,various resturants to suit everyone. There is a big imax cinema, also a ferris wheel for great views. There is a museum with warships,a wildlife park,aquariam and a madam tussards. Look out for the cheap offers that cover you for 5 attractions,there was great value,savf loads.You an also get ferries here. A must visit. Usually saturday nite as a firework display.
Tourist only. The tourist attraction (trap) of Sydney you have it all there ... aquarium, wild life park, Chinese garden Imax cinema and plenty of restaurants. better to avoid

A long walk. Darling Harbour is a beautiful place if you are willing to do a lot of walking.There are good hotels to stay in and plenty of places to eat and drink.The Star casino is close by if you are happy to lose money.But what I find about Darling Harbour it is long way from the city and trains.You can get light rail from central station.Also I prefer circular quay the harbour the bridge the opera house area better.

Great Family Stop. Lots for families to do here. There is an amusement park. Lots of shops and restaurants. Great area to walk around. Take the Ferry or get off on one of the hop on/hop off bus tours.

Cool to Stroll. Nice atmosphere and a nice bridge to walk into. Offers lots of restaurant and shops. Excellent view on both side of the bridge overlooking the marina. A cool place to stroll around and spend your whole afternoon.
Harbour sights and sounds. A truly great day spent wandering around the harbour. So much to see and do. Plenty to keep you occupied and interesting

A fantastic area to base your holiday from.. I stayed in the Darling Harbour area for my 5 days in Sydney and there is so much to see and do, you can live here and never get bored. Loads of places to eat and get a drink. People watching is awesome, tall ships, wildlife attractions, etc. A great place to stay when on holiday. Plus the ferries are pretty close if you want to venture to nearby beaches, etc.

What a big building place this year 2015. Since 1993 i traveled every year in July / August to Sydney and saw the big changes from Darling Harbour over this time ( Sydney Olympics 2000, than 2010 the new buildings behind IMAX, the new playground for kids, and now, the new exhibition center and Sydney Convention Center etc. ) May be there are many many people they enjoy the Darling Harbour.. I did not this year. And think some of the big changes hasn´t to be! But yeah, thats the way how it goes.

Australia Day. Great place to spend Australia Day. Tons of people, great restaurants and a nice atmosphere. There is a nice bridge to walk right across the Harbour as well where you get a better view of all the historic war boats that are stored there.

Plenty to do. Darling Harbour is a great place to explore regardless of age or interest. It really has something for everyone. There are things to do and plenty of restuarants. I would advise not going on a windy day because it's very open and gets cold with the wind and water.

Many interesting places to visit at Darling Harbour. It is really convenient that there are located the Zoo, the Sea Life -Aquarium, Madame Tussaud many restaurants, pubs, coffee shops, playground for kids! It saves you much time of walking!
Nice... Overall, nice. We can see the naval ships, ferry, hardrock cafe. The view is better at night. In winter, for all asian tourist that come from warm area, you should bring your windbreaker.

Construction everywhere!. A visit to Darling Harbour is somewhat bewildering, there's not much going except a lot of construction. Many areas are fenced off and there are working areas all over the place. Walking from hay Street (Paddy's Markets) to Darling Harbour, you can easily get lost. I ended up going up a ramp to The Powerhouse! Decided to u turn and go back and walked around the walkway in between construction fences and came across the Chinese Gardens Of Friendship, which are huge, and there's a fee to get in, and finally around to the main part of Darling Harbour, where there seems to be just a lot of lounges for people to relax and sit in, a high chess board, lots of restaurants, and not a lot of much else.I ended up walking from Darling Harbour up Sussex Street towards the city, past Sydney Souvenir Warehouse, and ending up at George Street opposite World Square Shopping Centre. Darling Harbour is the home of the IMAX Theatre, National Maritime Museum, Carousel, Sydney Aquarium, Wild Life Sydney and has a fireworks display, weather allowing, every Saturday night.

An afternoon arounf Darling harbor.. Great atmosphere. Great variety of restaurants. Somewhat touristy..In the gardens at the back of the bay, spend some time watching ibises moving freely among people. This where the aquarium and the Chinese garden are located.
Nice place for some dinner . We stayed in darling harbour and it's a fab location for the evening! Just a harbour with beautiful views and lots of choices of great reasonably priced restaurants!

Fun day out with plenty on offer.... Darling harbour is packed for a fun day out! You will find Sydney Zoo, the sea life centre and Madame Tusards all here as well as an erray of eating and drinking establishments filling the harbour. There is also a cinema and shopping complex and a food court for those in a hurry or not wanting a sit down meal. The choices are superb with something for everyone. A great place to people watch, enjoy a drink and watch the boats go by! A must do for everyone visiting Sydney.

favorite place in the world. darling harbour is one of my favourite places in the world!... by night it just lights up, such a gorgeous place to visit, you are spoilt for choice as far as restaurants and eateries are concerned, on the weekends, there is always something happening, A MUST place to visit when you come to Sydney.

Hidden gem. We stayed at Darling Harbour & found the area great. It is not so popular as Central Quay so prices are more realistic. There are lots of restaurants to choose from as well as bars. There is also the museum there too.

Great park for shop play n eat for all budget. I love my darling harbour..it got everything n set in the middle of busy city. U can shop in their shopping centre that has variety of shops,restaurants, food court,game place. They had hard rock cafe,mc Donald,yoforio,pancake on the rock,etc..that cater all ages,n budget. They also has one n only free park in city that kids n teen will enjoy..big giant slide,water park,sand spot,swing,climb stuff,etc..with toilet n free water refill spout nearby n free WiFi.. N Mc Donald just opposite it.Also has park for picnic n ping-pong play n some relaxing chair for adult. Which also sometime became the host of festival with Free outdoors movie or music or international food stuff.In the weekend night time around the water side has some kinda light show n fire work for special days for free entertainment.Its very close to china town,and big entertainment centre.Well position..If you a tourist with not much time to spend..this is the place that has most everything Sydney to offer..even aquarium,zoo,and madame Tussaud all in that place..You also can take giant ferris wheel. Which will be cheaper if you buy from groupon, internet shopping site.

A Real Darling!. Darling Harbour is a fantastic precinct for dining, socializing, entertainment, culture and learning what Sydney is really all about. There is something for everyone. My personal favorites are Cohi Bar for enjoying an evening cocktail overlooking the water and Braza for a mouthwatering (not for vegetarians) meal.
