Take a look at the Darling Harbour website to discover the regular cultural and community activities which take place in and around the Harbour, these range from Holi Festival Colour fun to every international good festival you could hope for. You won't be disappointed!

If you are short on time skip this. Darling Harbor previously was a goodsyard and has gradually been revamped over the last 30 years, with some office buildings arriving over the last 5-10 years. Whilst it contains nice parklands and waterside cafes and restaurants, be aware that there are massive construction works going on on the west side with the re-building of the exhibition and convention centre. I love sitting in the sun-drenched cafes during winter watching the world go by, but can get too hot over summer.

Beautiful Darling Harbour. If your in Sydney dont miss a visit to Darling Harbour beautiful shops and great food Many places to eat some with views of the water and then you can go to the Imax to see a quick show. There is a old Manly ferry you can also dine on and if you want to stay at Darling Harbour there is Motels overlooking Darling Harbour
Enjoyable destination but not unique. Nice place with some good restaurants and great views. Not as unique as other sections of Sydney like Manlynor the CBD.

Nice area and amazing view. We really enjoy this area there is a lot of Restorant and nice Cinema as well, and in the apposite side there is a nice shopping center with a big food court you can spend half a day in this area.

A wonderful part of Sydney. Love Darling Harbour! The hustle and bustle of this place, it's smells, it's multiculturalism, it's food, it's shopping all contribute to a fabulous place to visit. Grab a room in one of the many nearby good quality nearby hotels and you're all set for a great time.

Full of life and sound. Busy place :) with lots of people having drink in the many bars that are there, just grabbing a bite at its many restaurants or exploring the different attractions. The harbour a it self is not that great, no special view, and the spot can get a bit crowded and loud...

Definitely worth a visit. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling harbor. The National Maritime museum and aquarium are here. If you have small children, take them for a ride on the carousel.If you enjoy shopping, there is a 2 story shopping center that we enjoyed, bought some great sydney sweatshirts for AUS$20 (this was in February) as well as other reasonably priced souvenirs. We stopped at the food court for some quick refreshments before venturing back out and walking to the Sydney tower.

Great vibes day or night. Fantastic place to visit Lots of free things to do for families, great play equipment park for kids. Heaps of restraunts to choose or food court in shopping mall (had the best kabab) loved the boat show on the bay. Plenty of people sightseeing without being too crowded

Busy port area with restaurants and bars. Busy harbour for boat transportation to cruises, ferries and dinner cruises. Many people wandering into the many restaurants with outdoor seating to enjoy the views. Good place to grab a craft beer from King Street Brewery or seafood from one of the many places. Other attractions in the area including the Aquarium.

Great place in heart Sydney. Always visit here when in Sydney there are many restirants around harbour many with specials Thers Harbourside shopping centre bars aquarium etc Great place to just relax people watch enjoy activity around and in the harbour There's a train for ride around harbour From here there's the ferry to circular quay A gotta do in Sydney

Touristy but fun - worth a short visit. Compared to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour feels mush more touristy and crowded. There are lots of things to do including attractions, restaurants and people watching so it's worth a visit - maybe just not a long visit depending on your mood. Catch a water taxi for a cool trip to your next destination.

Awesome place.Must see!. I never heard about this place,but one person recommended it to me.Here you can visit different places:Maritime museum,sea life and some not so interesting museums like Madam T, wildlife as two first.

Busy and Changed. Whenever we're in Sydney, we always take a ferry to Darling Harbour and this trip was no exception. However, this place has changed a lot. While the Imax, Aquarium, and kids' playground are still there, the water fountains are gone, Harbourside shopping centre stores have changed (for the worse), and everything is busier (there was a boat show) and less clean. Still, there is always walkable access to Cockle Bay and King St. restaurants, as well as The Star (with its casino, hotels, luxury shops, restaurants, and theatre).
Lots to see and do. Walk thru a submarine , go tot eh maritime museum, see fish , Plenty of places to eat. caught the ferry from circulAr quay is easy. Visit powerhouse or the gardens

Bad timing. My mum took us to darling harbour as she's been there previously however everything to do is under construction at the moment and all that's left is a sea world, madam twoswords and lots of cafes. We're right by China town as well so long walk down George street to anything worth while.
Great sights, shopping & food!. Numerous cafes, restaurants and bars dot the lines of this harbour attraction plus a nice shopping mall with a foodcourt affords a beautiful experience.

Fun place for kids and everyone else. Many child friendly options, including Madame Tussauds, the aquarium and the zoo. But it is a fun place to hang out even without kids, with plenty of restaurants. Also, go to place for the whale watching tours.

Nice place to chill after a walk. Lots of cafés located just across the harbour with beautiful views especially during this month of early August approaching spring, weather not too cold but cool. After all the walk around, it's a great place to have a cup of coffee or lunch and the view out to the harbour is great.
Beautiful walking. We spent time walking around Sydney to get a feel for the city and the people. Darling Harbour was beautiful! There were several attractions and restaurants in this area, too!
family fun. We stayed at the Darling Hotel and were able to walk to the harbour ever day. Easy walking, lots of restaurants and things to see like the aquarium and aritime museum

Not to be missed.. we so nearly missed out darling harbour as we didn't know that much about it.What a mistake that would have been !We caught the ferry round from circle quay which gave us a great view of the layout.This is quite a modern set up with a large amount of work in progress but that didn't spoil our visit, there is so much to see and do for all ages.We enjoyed sitting in the sunshine watching all the boats and the people walking by.Do not miss!

Very nice visit on a sunny day. Come and stroll the shops. Have a coffee, a drink or a meal at the myriad of food shops and restaurants. See an IMAX film or take a ferry or a cruise. The only downside is very expensive parking, that is if you are driving here.

A pleasant evening experience. This was our first pit stop in Sydney. Lots of restaurants and cafe's. An assortment of other attractions including a museum, an aquarium, and some tourist shops. Beautiful view of the city skyline
Great for a drink in the sun :). This harbour is great! Catches the sunshine in the bars so you can have a nice drink in the sun! Great atmosphere and views :)

Darling Harbour precinct is the best place to stay in Sydney. Darling Harbour is the perfect location because -The Hotel Ibis is there with amazing views (in it's harbour view rooms)There is really good shoppingYou can walk to the Chinese gardens, Paddy's markets, the convention centre and the theatre districtThere is a ferry that will take you to the Circular Quay at the main city areaThere is a light rail transport from Darling Harbour which will take you to Central train stationThe maritime museum is there which is really good and has ships floating off it for inspection (don't go into the submarine if you are claustrophobic or have trouble going down ladders backwards)There are great restaurants and we walked to the Sydney Tower from there as well for dinner and amazing views across Sydney right out to sea and inland to the Blue Mountains.
Boat Show . What a great place for a boat show, the restaurants, the bars and the great vibe. There is plenty to do with shopping, museums and just watching the crowd. my favourite place in Sydney .

Great place to spend a couple of days. We stayed in Darling Harbour for several days on our trip back from Canada. It is the second time we have been around here now. Lot to do and see. There is a maritime museum if you are interested in boats. There is a navy destroyer and a submarine to look at if you like that sort of thing. Lot of small shops in the harbour side shopping centre. The Hard Rock cafe is there and they also have a retail shop there as well. Lot of cafes and restaurants. Wax works, Aquarium and also an aussie museum with a real koala out the front. Cinema there as well but it is expensive if you want to pay $34 each to watch a movie. You are better off finding a nice comfy spot and people watching. Yoou will get some laughs for sure.

Filling our guts. Darling harbour has an abundance of restaurants from all corners of the world,bars clubs and an amazing zest for living try and do a Saturday night as the also have a firework display for free cracking night even for the youngest family's

Most fun and happening place on weekends!. Lovely place to go, day or night. it has attraction such as sealife, a movie hall, as well as a variety of cuisines on offering. It turns into a very happening place at night, with weekends being the most busy. The place is light up beautifully at night, followed by fireworks every saturday night. They even had a fake snow hut put up for the July chirstmas. Definitely a place to visit, specially at night.

love it overtime i visit it. so many things to do at the darling harbour.the special park for kids to play free and sit in the sun with your picnic and enjoy the sun on the chairs provided there.china garden to see .delicious meals at reasonable price at the harbour and cheap drinks
Darling Harbour. Great place & very central. We went everywhere by ferry. Plenty of cafes & restaurants. Lots of shopping.

Friendly area to take a meal (b'fast, lunch, dinner, a snack). We loved this area and harbour - would definitely visit again. We visited at lunchtime and later in the evening for dinner.The area seems to be family, couple and any age orientated. We strolled around the harbour, listened, looked, people watched and had a super relaxing time.The harbour was very busy with people having fun - quite infectious. YAY

Cruise to the Harbour. While vising Sydney, do not miss a visit to Darling Harbour. It's just a short ferry ride from Sydney Harbour and there's lots of neat places to visit and lots of great places to eat. We particularly enjoyed the Maritime Museum. We spent the most part of the day there and when we return to Australia, we plan to return to this delightful place.

Darling Harbour Sydney. Darling Harbour Sydney is a place to visit whether you are a visitor or a resident of Australia.It has so much to offer to every age group.there are great eating places and coffee houses.The Aquarium, Chinese Friendship Garden and Imex theatre is situated in the place.there is something interesting going on everyday.children love fountains and play equipment at the place.I love it.
Nice Place To Eat. Some really nice restaurants and cocktail bars around the harbour, nice panoramic's of the city after dark and a good view of the fireworks.

An exciting location on a beautiful harbour. This is the place to go for action. There are so many places to eat and shop. There are cultural and educational venues here also. You can also get on the water by the water taxis and other boat services. An enjoyable place to be.

Fun place to visit and so much to do. If you are not staying a Darling Harbor you must take time to visit. There is so much to do that you will not be bored. The views, are great and all of our family of six, of varying ages, found something to do and like. Next time we are in Sydney I would like to rent one of the apartments down at the Harbor and be able to enjoy it at all hours.

Always something going on. Darling harbour should be on your list of things to do in Sydney. It links the Southern 'Chinatown' part of the CBD to effectively the inner city suburbs of Pyrmont and Glebe. So many things to do here with the Entertainment Centre, Chinese Gardens, Sydney Aquarium, Harbourside Mall... and plenty of fine dining.I personally love the now pedestrian Pyrmont Bridge. Formerly the main bridge from the west but now replaced by ANZAC Bridge for traffic it links East and West very well. Photos posted, mainly of the bridge.

A Great Place to Dine. After travelling by ferry from circular quay we enjoyed a leisurely lunch by the harbour. Good place to people watch, look at the harbour and see a seagull or two! Lots of food choices and plenty to see as well as take in a bit of shopping or sightseeing
Charming and amazing place.. When I was in Sydney this was one of the places I visited daily. I loved the shopping, people watching, food and views. Very relaxed and laid back place.

All in one. We stayed at the Darling Harbour. it is a great place with lots of tourist attractions, a brilliant Wharf with delicious food and is walking distance from the Market street, which is the place to shop in Sydney!
lovely. heaps to do, visit the maritime ships in Port, lots of things for kids and families to do, lots of restaurants and cafes, lovely walks, a really nice place, a must see.

Fireworks. This time I was in Sydney for Vivid Sydney and went to Darling Harbour for the Saturday night fireworks, very crowded but pleased I went. A few days later I went back during the day, it is a pleasant place to be but spoilt by the seagulls, a great many of these scavengers.

Well Worth a Visit. We stayed nearby in 2014 and loved the open water space inside the Pyrmont Bridge area. It was lovely to walk about stopping off at restaurants and bars, especially when dark with all the lights reflecting off the water, a little haven amongst the high rise buildings.To my horror this year the space is being in-filled. The marina at Cockle Bay Wharf is filling, There was some kind of ugly big floating pavilion in one corner of the Southern end which ruins the uninterrupted view that there was for a pedestrian is being lost. I hope this is temporary, there is some construction work going on in the open spaces nearby so maybe the pavilion will be re-housed in there.Darling Harbour is close to the CBD and well worth a visit. It can also be reached by ferry. There is a wonderful selection of restaurants with a wide variety of cuisines. There is a good shopping centre inside the lines of restaurants on the West side.Appeal to whoever is in charge: Just please keep the open space feel that worked so well. My rating has been marked down because of this.

Disappoiinted.. not the Darling Harbour it once was.. Went out with my family a couple weekends ago, and what once was a place I really loved going to.. really disappointed me. I hadn't been to Darling Harbour since the monorail (actually this was the most wheelchair friendly transport in town) was taken down... and all the exhibition centre was demolished to make way for more inner city apartments... Darling Harbour now is a nightmare for someone in a wheelchair... just simple things like getting across the road and into the shopping centre has become more challenging. We decided to get a ferry back to Circular Quay... walked/rolled all the way down past the Maratime Museum to find the Ferry wharf at Pyrmont Bay had been demolished as well.. so we then had to go all the way around to the other side of the harbour to get a ferry. Anyone in a wheelchair contemplating Darling Harbour in its present state.. DON'T! Unless you really have to go there.

Great Stroll. On a windy evening, when we decided to head for a walk it so happened our stroll took us to Darling Harbour. With water front, big hotels like Ibis, Novotel behind and a fabulous mall down with lot of options to dine n drink - what else one need. Place absolutely packed with people, it only reminded me of Colleyer Quay in Singapore. With wild life, seaworld and Mme Tussad around it is a place to visit and enjoy things around.

Fun place and beautiful place for photo opportunities. The beautiful waterfront is only part of the attraction here. There is also the biggest Imax theatre screen in the world, a large shopping mall, awesome places to eat or have a drink. We visited in July and there was a lovely snow display that the children enjoyed very much. There is also a lovely water play park for smaller children and table tennis. Across the bridge -nice photos taken from the bridge - is the museum and a nice shop where we bought t-shirts and other gifts.
Great Tourism Spot. There is so much to do here like the aquarium or small zoo, walk around the waterfront, visit and cafes, soak up the sun and take in the views
Vibrant. A busy and vibrant place. A great atmosphere. Fantastic for a meal. In a great location with awesome views. Would definitely visit again.
Uncertain. We were not over impressed with this area. Perhaps it was due to being a dreary grey rainy day. Will need to return to re review

Close to Chinatown and lots of tourism . As in this harbour is the madame tussaud, the mini zoo and aquarium it is always busy and lots of tourists are in the place. You can escape them in the Chinese garden (6$) or by visiting Chinatown and eat some 10$ lunch.

Beautiful Stroll. Darling harbour is definitely worth the visit. It is a beautiful place to walk around and there a lot of amazing restaurants and cafes. There is a lot to do and see. We were there on July 4th and got treated to some spectacular fireworks.
Great area. There is so much to see and do in this area. There are plenty of places to eat and shop and every Friday night there is a small fireworks display.

An other day in Darling you harbour. It is a local venue for me has my home isn't far I love walking around so many great restaurants & bardsBut avoid Nicks seafood no longer the great food that was served used to be the fresh seafood plateau, now frozen and alf of what used to be offered and ever so expensive for what you get and please staff do drop the attitude we pay your wedges.Two weeks ago I had lunch with colleague and find that the food was excellent at Bangalore 8 great venueAlso the marina. The darling harbour aquarium one of the best atraction and the am small indoor zoo are a must to visitAlso available is speed boat rides A day in Sydney that is a must

Wonderful . Nice place to sit and relax. Good place to eat if you want a view. Specially lunch offers are nice and not to steep. If I go back to Sidney again I will try to visit darling Harbour as much as possible.

So much to do here!. You can easily spend the whole day around the harbour and still have more to see! There is the sea life, madame tussards and the wild life zoo all right next to each other. You can take a nice ride on the ferris wheel for only $8. If you're hungry there are plenty of restaurants around to choose from. Even just sitting on the docks and watching the cruise ships are so relaxing and fun!
In love. I fell in love for this place, lots of caffes, restaurantes, museuns. It's just Perfect. You can setle down and relax looking people walking along the square.Sure I would go back there
Very busy. This place is always busy and the restaurants are expensive with foods that are average for the price. It's a great place to watch the fireworks though.
Beautiful place!. great place to see ,lovely things to photograph ,great eateries harbour walkways,very clean area ,lots to see and do .

Nice walk along the harbour. We walked down from Central station. It is a nice walk along the harbour, but as we were adults only and didn't want to spend money going to the aquarium, there was not a lot to do. Still, quite funny for a Norwegian seeing how Australians think it is winter in 15 degrees and go iceskating and put up Christmastrees.

Serene. This is probably the best, cheapest and quietest attraction in Sydney. There is a lot of construction work going on around and in Darling Harbour and that is over and above the normal high traffic noise around one.In exchange for $AUD 6 you can walk round the Chinese Garden of Friendship for as long as you wish. You take in earth for water, metal and wood as you walk around the many paths and quiet sitting areas. There are many water birds living in the trees plus duck and large carp. The most serene and tranquil place in the heart of the city a most wonderful e peril de and highly recommended
Wonderful Attraction!. Very lively place full of beautiful attractions and wonderful restaurants. Loved taking long walks near the harbour

Sitting By The Bay. There is a lot to do in this area. "The Rocks" house a bar at about every doorway. Tour excursions leave here by the Opera House and in the Harbor itself. Many tropical birds not normally seen at your home and all over the trees and lawns. Wild Parrots everywhere. A great place to have lunch and a beer. Easy place to meet people.
Nice!!. Really nice and clean harbour at Sydney. Located very close to the main market. There are lot of activities for people of all age groups and the place is always lively.
Busy but good!. Lots to see and do, Definitely pop down in the evenings to have a bite to eat or a drink. Enjoyed a stroll and didn't once feel uncomfortable or unsafe.

Fun Day out. At Darling Harbour they have lots of things to see and do. For the grown ups there is the many fancy restaurants. For the teens and young at heart there is the IMAX theatre and for the little ones there is the play ground and water play. Darling Harbour is the home of Madam Taussads wax museum, sea life water world.

Sydney's tourist showcase. Darling Harbour has to be part of any walking tour of Sydney. From this vantage point you have easy access to: the Aquarium; the Marine Museum; the Chinese Gardens; IMax Cinema; and, a huge food and shopping Mall. Some of Sydney's better restaurants are located in this massive precinct, alongside of budget food outlets. Nearby is Sydney's China Town; Paddy's Markets and UTS complex. There is a mini-train for those who choose not to walk, there is access by water for those with a creative bent, there is tram for those coming from the Inner West suburbs, or you can simply walk from the city proper from where there are walkways aplenty. Don't forget your camera.

Plenty to see and Do. Beautiful views of the Harbour with lots of tourist attractions along the way.Plenty going on, from board walk entertainment to having a meal at the restaurants or drink from the barsPerfect place for familys or a couples getaway.Will be back again.

Brilliant. I recommend a visit to this wonderful place, all the attractions you need, bars/restaurants/fast food/ice cream etc etc you name it,we took the short ferry trip from there under the harbour bridge to circular quay an amazing experience going under the bridge then the opera house coming into view,one of the most fantastic places I've ever been.

Nice place to stroll and visit. Lots of restaurants and cafes and nice walk around the harbour. Try catching the fireworks on Saturday. We managed to catch it and it was awesome! Restaurants are expensive but there is a foodcourt in Harbourside shopping complex that offers cheaper alternatives. Good to visit and experience the burst of activities there.

Beautiful Sight. The beauty of Sydney city is its harbours. Darling Harbour did not fail me. I love hanging out by the water and looking at the serenity and calming effect that a body of water emits.The breeze, the smell of the sea, the birds that hover around - just give me great pleasure!We talk a Captain Cook Dinner Cruise from this harbour which was a 90 minute cruise between Darling Harbobur and Sydney Harbour.Even if you don't take the harbour cruise, this is still a great place to visit and spend an evening or afternoon or any time of the day for that matter. The backdrop is the picturesque Sydney skyline, perfected by Sydney Tower.

Fireworks weekend. We went there on Saturday evening at 7.45pm. was vibrant...lots of cafes and restaurants. ..was quite full but managed to get good seats and table...enjoyed the fireworks at 8.30pm.enjoyed the outdoor play a too.definitely a must place to visit in sydney .good to go in the evening

Amazing part of Sydney. We stayed within walking distance of the harbour. Perfect attraction with plenty of beautiful cafe's & restaurants. Madam Tousades wax works, sea life aquarium and plenty of other attractions to delight the young and old at heart.Highly recommend you add this attraction to your itinerary.
Beautiful city on the harbour. Darling harbour is beautiful and so central to everything in Sydney CBD. So many eateries and bars with great views.
Nice place to visit and chill. It is a very nice place.lots to see and do.it will be even better once the construction has finished. The kids will love it.even at night it is good to goto.

darling harbour visit. very good for bars and places to eat very clean lots of things to do one of the must see places in sydney went in early may tempriture was about 22 degrees all week slight breeze with it if you eat on the go there the cheeky seagulls might try to steal your food from you

Always great. We always enjoy turning up here to see what is happening.. The childrens park is always a favourite, as are the restaurants and bars for my wife and I.. There are plenty of shops to browse through.. There is a bit of construction work happening at the moment, but that doesn't ruin your day
Stunning, great food, lots to do. Beautiful walk with many attractions, eateries and during certain times (we were there for Valentine's Day) they really jazz it up with lighting and events.
Wonderful evening walk. Its an wonderful experience to take a walk in the evening on Darling harbour, have couple of drinks at variety of restaurants available with choice of food.

A good place to spend a day.. Darling Harbor has plenty to see and do, there are shops, (the lolly shops are the best) restaurants & fast food. outlets. Near by is the Martine Museum which is worth a look, so is the Chinese Gardens, & Imax theatres, always changing ,always something to see and do..

Truly a darling. This is my favorite place to hang out in. The view is just so relaxing. the waters are not as busy as Circular Quay. Many hotels (both cheap and expensive) abound. There's also many restraurants and bars and they don't close early. There is harbor mall that has a food court incase you wanna go cheap. The Prymont bridge connects the 2 sides of the Harbour. I choose to stay here all the time.

Darling harbour. It is school holidays and we have had the best time they have a frozen thing set up where you can have snow in winter and the kids enjoyed that there are a lot of fun things though out darling harbour but they have winter them through a grate day out with the kids and was not overly expensive

Nice harbour. Darling Harbour is a great area to stay - lots of hotels and LOTS of restaurants. Nice area to walk around at anytime of the day and evening. Free fireworks display every Friday evening - arrive early if you want to sit on the edge of the boardwalk. A great childrens park nearby, Aquarium, maritime Museum... Walking distance to the Japanese gardens and much more. Easy ferry ride to the city
Always fun to visit!. We regularly walk around Darling Harbour, there is so much to see and do. Always a must for the traveller, come along and take a look.

Sydney's little Gem. Great place to visit - Maritime Museum on Pyrmont side. Few ales on the top balcony of the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel. Cross the road to great shopping Plaza. Meander across the bridge to Aquarium and Madame Tussaud;s. Spoilt for choice with excellent restaurants and Bars - easy access by ferry or walk from city centre. Right on waters edge - lovely to relax at sundown. Great spot during VIVID festival and New Years.
Fun little harbor. This is a beautiful little harbor in Sydney. Fun things to do, see and eat. If you have an extra day, don't miss it.

Fantastic. Darling harbour is a fantastic place to stay at one of the many great hotels, or to visit for the day with the family. Many great restaurants and bars to suit everyone's taste from fine dining to take away food. Boardwalk entertainment. Great children's outdoor equipment & in summer water fun. Easy accessible by road, train, water taxi, bus etc. take a lovely Sydney Harbour cruise. Short walk to Star Casino, Maritime Museum & the newly created Barangeroo. Chinatown & Japanese gardens are also a leisurely short walk.

Great place to stay!. We stayed at the Oaks, (just behind Darling Harbour). It's a great place to visit as it has plenty of attractions, from Aqarium, to IMax theatre, Chinese Garden and many many restaurants. At night they have fireworks, and it's very beautiful with all the buildings lit up.

Awesome fireworks, eateries & entertainment. Free fireworks the weekend we stayed in Darling Harbour- Friday & Saturday nights. Very festive and bright. During the weekend we witnessed Dragon Boat racing & enjoyed the pedestrian bridge turn for tall boats. It was always very busy- day & night. Lots of eateries, entertainment (aquarium- madam tussauds- plenty of "dinner/cruise" boats ect...) it's a nice area.

Awesome!. This was a great place to be, as there are many people here especially for the party scene. We came for the fireworks which they do on many Saturday nights. We also saw ice skating for Cool Yule.

Weekend getaway. We just loved darling harbour, there was so much to do, see, relax around the harbour, take in the sites, and see the fireworks on a Saturday was an awesome treat. We had the best winter weather to do this in and so many places to eat at be it cheap, midrange or expensive. The atmosphere was just divine and to take a ride on the merry go round bought back memories.

Darling Harbour viewed from Ferris Wheel. On a recent trip to Sydney, we visited the Darling Harbour precinct and found a new addition to the foreshore, the Ferris Wheel, which we decided would be worth taking a ride to take in the views. You get about 5 or 6 rotations on the wheel which is a great opportunity to take in the sights of Darling Harbour and surrounding areas. The shopping complex is always a great place to visit with many boutique shops and a variety of eateries. It a reasonably short walk from the City centre to Darling Harbour via the footbridge. We did miss the monorail, as it was convenient for visitors to get around from Darling Harbour to various parts of the city and we always enjoyed a ride on it.

Really nice . Me and my family went there for christmas and new year's eve, so besides the really nice walks we took during the day, the fireworks were astonishing. Furthermore the places and street shows there are really nice, entertaining and time-worth.
Fantastic. What a bustling place it is. It is full of life with shopping complex, hotels, restaurants and IMAX. The Maritime Museum is excellent. It is stunning at night as well.

Fire works. Stayed in Darling Harbourat The For Seasons and watched the free fire works that are spectacular every Saturday night from the roof top bar ... What a sight WOW If you are not staying at Darling harbour you can make your way there to view from the waters edge with the many who gather there and still have a wonderful view.
Relaxing walk. beautiful atmosphere. Lots of lovely places to enjoy a meal or coffee. Its a must. Plenty to do and see

Not Bad. Much to see there including SeaLife Aquarium, Wildlife Zoo, and Madame Tussauds. If your looking for something to eat, lots of water side restaurants to dine in. Not my favorite place in Sydney but worth a visit.
Stunning. Beautiful harbour located in the heart of the city. Short walk from Town hall station, with many great bars, night clubs and restaurants surrounding the water.

Takes at least a day to explore fully. Darling Harbour is the home of SEA LIFE Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, WILD LIFE Sydney Zoo, Chinese Garden of Friendship, IMAX and many restaurants, cafes and night clubs. There is so much to do it, you could easily spend a day or two exploring everything on offer. A hugely popular place for firework displays as well, so head to the information centre to get more details about what's on. There was an outside cinema there when I visited and they were showing Christmas movies for the month of December. There is always something happening, so go check it out for yourself.
Must visit when in Sydney. Great area for food & shopping, especially food. There are numerous eateries around. Great walk from there to Circular Quay.
giv it a miss. ok for a quick look, but pretty much a tourist trap.....many overpriced shops/restaurants better off to catch a ferry around to balmain

The bright lights of Sydney, for a little less.... We stay in Darling harbour when in Sydney, you can get rooms with views for considerably less than the rocks/quay area. The selection of restaurants is fantastic and a safe, short walk from your accommodation. A short walk from the train and the ferry is on your doorstep. You could spend a day here, eating and shopping and its just so pretty!

Great place. Great restaurants, bars and attractions. The restaurants are on the more pricey side but the quality and location more than make up for it. More lively of a weekend but still a nice atmosphere mid-week.

Happy Hours, top view, great vibe. Spent a few hours in Darling Harbour last weekend. For a Sydney local, I should have been coming in more regularly. Lots happening... buskers, boats, fireworks, Happy Hour specials.... best few hours I have spent in a while. Lots of choice for food, drinks and activities.
What a great place. What a great location ,View all the city lights at night,heaps of great food outlets,Walk by the harbour,Visit the japanese gardens

Buzzy Place. Darling Harbour is such a vibrant buzzy place. I remember coming here heaps in the early 90's when I lived in Sydney, and it was buzzy then. It has improved heaps with the Imax Theatre, The Hard Rock Cafe and even more eating places. Darling Harbour has something for everyone. Heaps of eating places, a ferris wheel, shopping and at night a fireworks display. A quick walk from the city, makes it handy to get to.
Need to Clean the water. Used to be nice place, they need to clean up the rubbish in the water.But still a must-to-visit in your list while in Sydney.
Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour, best place to go as there is so much to see and do. Plenty restaurants, cafes. Shopping galore. An ideal place to sit and just watch the world go past.

Everything you need. Darling Harbour truly has everything you would want or need, an it is so pretty! Lovely little restaurants, and coffee shops. There are also bargains to be had if you're looking for souvenirs. Pitt Street mall is a short walk from the Harbour.
Great place for shopping. It was very good and had some great places for cocktails/mock tails, the atmosphere is just amazing in this places,

Amazing and exciting place full of life and activities!. Day or night this really is the place to be! Very centrally located, just a short walk from the city this place has everything from shopping, bars and restaurants, free entertainment, attractions and festivals, a kids playground and sometimes fireworks in the night all set around a beautiful harbour. Yes so many wonderful options to enjoy especially for visiting tourists or a day out with family and friends, great place for photos. Simply amazing place to be and see!
So much to see. This is another great part of Sydney Harbor. There are many restaurants, attractions, and shopping. Nice fountain too.

Nice place.. Lovely place to see.Quite busy when I visited but plenty of ferries to get you about. Fireworks display was once a week and worth seeing. I visited via ferry and walk. It's an easy walk, but quite a walk. About half an hour.

Extraordinary . A very happening place at night and the cruise are great here for the city tour ! We enjoy the time here in the cruise and walking around ! Spectacular fountain and good food can be found here !
has everything you need. There are really good restaurants, hotels, monorail system, shopping, an aquarium and more. We found eating about 3 pm better than waiting untl 7, and less expensive

Most happening spot in Sydney. I call it the most happening location in Sydney. I have been there several times with family or friends. The best place to spend your evening/nights. Lots of Pubs, bars and restaurants. Ideal for families too as this place has 4 best attractions of the city - Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, wild life zoo and the biggest IMAX screen. Waterside views makes it even more wonderful place to spend your time.

Wine, Dine , Walk and talk. A great place to stroll and stop for a meal at one of many restaurants along the waterfront , including fine dining, bar restaurants as well as children restaurants.The Harbour is very clean and there is always plenty of entertainment for young and old.

Darlling Harbor. This is a good place to get a quick introduction to Sydney. There are numerous attractions and entertainment in the area plus a great place to walk and enjoy the sunshine and fresh air.

A great day out. Darling Harbour is a must on any tourist trip to Sydney. It is years since I had been to Darling Harbour and it has changed dramatically. Restaurants cater for all tastes and surround the harbour. Arrive on a ferry from circular quay to take in the view and stroll along the waterfront around the harbour. Visit the Aquarium and Wildlife Centre and walk around to the Maritime Museum walk back across the oldest swing bridge still in use. Allow a full day or more if you intend to visit all the attractions.

Worth a Stroll. Home to the worlds largest IMAX theatre, Darling Harbour is also where you will find kiosks to make arrangements for harbour tours and plenty of other things to do. There is a tram station close by, making it extra convenient. If you are in Sydney, be sure to get to Darling Harbour.

you cant get bored...cant get enough. its a beautiful waterfront..... scored in every department:very sceniclively....good crowdmulti-cultural cuisineneat cleanvery good public amenitiesexcellent recreational activitiesAND BEST OF ALL....ITS A FANTASIA DURING "VIVID"
Beautiful Experience !!!. Darling Harbour is one of my favorite places in the city. The walk by the Harbour, the restaurants, the fire works, absolutely brilliant.
Lovely place. Darling Harbour is a lovely place to unwind and grab a bite. The largest IMAX screen in the world is located there too, and it's awesome.

City Center. Darling Harbour is a great place to base your stay in Sydney as everything is located right there or there's a ferry every few minutes. It is especially awesome during Vivid! There are a lot of restaurants, shopping, cruises and attractions. Great view of the Harbour from the Four Points even though the hotel is just average!

Your one stop destination!. A must visit if its your first to Sydney, Although Darling harbour is touristy but convenient. All the attractions from the aquarium (book your tickets online to save time and money) to the famous restaurants - hurricanes grill (please make an advanced reservation) and pancake on the rocks are all here. Spend $20 on a receipt and get a free ferries wheel ticket! :D Great facilities like baby changing areas too!
Love the Ambiance. Love walking around Darling Harbour and having something to eat and relax. Can,t wait to go back. Been there 4 times and still love it.

A Darling of a Harbour. THE hub of Sydney. Fabulous in every way. Visually....seeing the iconic bridge and Opera House. Gastronomically....great selection of eateries. Strolling around the harbour and taking it all in.

Easy and excellent walk-about especially late in the evening..... The Fun Place and great experience too! The evenings are fun with some of the best fine dining experience. We traveled by ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour... and it was exciting! Snapped a lot of pictures especially at the bridge.
The Gastronomical Hot Spot. The Fun Place and great gastronomical experience too the evenings are fun with some of the best fine dining experience apart from that the place has great acqurium too
Nice area. There are many cafes and restaurants. And there is a play ground for kids. We went to there on weekday. So not too busy at all.. My boy enjoyed playing with other kids.

A nice place in Sydney to relax and visit other tourist attractions. The harbour is centrally located and contains various attractions like Madame Tussauds, Aquarium, Whale watching cruise, Imax and many more. There is a small shop where you can buy iventure cards if you want to access multiple attractions at a cheaper price.

Darling harbor. This place is buzzing with activities excellent restaurants of various types and Indian restaurants Shopping can be done for various things prices are reasonable very good place to visit and can spend 3 to 4 hours easily
Great place to stay and visit. Close to everything , great hotels nearby, close to the city and circular quay. Casino there too. So it is a hub for many Sydney stopovers.

Good place for tourists. As a tourist you can walk around the whole harbour area, on both sides of the bridge. One side you can visit the Aquarium and Wild life which kids will love. The other side there are many shopping places, eateries and also a giant ferry wheel.

Bicycle travel with trailer and 3 year old child. A MUST do for travellers especially if you have kids. Theres an open air park plus water play area (BRILLIANT) near the Chinese Friendship Gardens, the Maritime Museum w submarine, Powerhouse, IMAX theatre, Sydney Aquarium, and a stack of cafes all on the harbour. Its also a great "launchpad" to visit other areas via ferry (Cockatoo Island, Homebush Bay parklands/cycleways) if you were staying nearby. I live on the Central Coast NSW but we head down to Sydney once a month to see something new. Easily accessible by train, as a walk or ride over the bridge, ferry, taxi and carparks. Bike parking near the Imax theatre (though not very much).
Darling Harbour. Very clean walking around and a beautiful place. Stop an take in the scenery because it changes every minute. Lovely shops and cafes .

Walk around marina. Visited darling harbour and marina surrounding it on the night of 17th june15. The entire walk around is paved with anti skid wooden flooring and connected with numerous overhead bridges for pedestrian which have stairs,escalators and lifts to facilitate them come to it from across various roads and street. The entire marina is dotted with nice pubs,restaurants,dance halls,merry go round,and famous sea world,jungle world and Madame Tussaud. You can catch ferries and water taxis as well. Full of gaiety,life and fun. Strongly recommended.

Sweet sensation. This is our first trip to Australia. Being a newbie, there are so many places we want to see within the short period of time. Lucky for us that our hotel is situated at the end of George St. Whenever we are lost, we just need to go on George St. and we are able to access to all places within walking distance. It is a good city to do our walking tours. We walked to Darling Harbour in the evening and it was such a beautiful sight. We just love the freshness of the air and the unhurried life of a city. Since it's the annual Vivid Festival, we are able to enjoy the view of different by going on board one of the cruises around Darling Harbour. Beautiful place to be at this time of the year. Glad that we done it.

Great cafes, friendly service in a gorgeous setting.. What can I tell you about Darling Harbour, it is a lovely location, usually in summer and spring the weather is stunning and it is well worth a visit if you are in Sydney. It is quite cosmopolitan with fantastic cafes lining the walkway, it can be a little on the expensive side but you are in a major city so I guess that is to be expected, I enjoyed a walking through Darling Harbour during my lunch break, however, I rarely bought lunch there, way above my general budget and close by there are so many fantastic cheap eating places. However, if you want to indulge or it´s one of those days where you feel like treating yourself, the amount of restaurants and cafes will give you choice fatigue.... I have never had a bad meal there. I lived in Sydney for years and it´s a favorite with us locals as well as the tourists, it never seems to lose it´s appeal and there is always something interesting happening down there. . it´s a great place to get away from the bustle of the city and enjoy the scenery, although in the tourist season, it can be very busy.
Best Stop. It has EVERYTHING! nature exhibit (one of the best I've seen), great restaurants and central to the city. Beautiful harbor views. Can't beat it.

Nightlife!. As I went in Sydney near the Christmas period, it was lovely to experience the lovely atmosphere surrounded by lots of people! You are spoilt for choice of restaurants and bars here so be prepared to have a good time!
Fantastic. A beautiful scenic harbour . .It's a must on anyones to do list. Would recommend it. Also good to read up on the history to really appreciate. Fantastic.
Nice place to walk about. With the harbour area, it's a nice sight. Good place to just walk and look at people as well as boats and birds. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes.
A Must on Fireworks night.. This was a beautiful experience for us especially on New Years Eve. Really enjoy the restaurants and scenery. It also has an Imax theater.
Darling harbour awsome. From fireworks on Saturday nights, great swing bridge, great exebitions, great cafes, great resturants, great shops, great setting, great everything.

A night to remember. Darling Harbour has to be the gem of Sydney. We walked down on an evening. The vibe and the people ...it was absolutely electric. We eventually decided we would sit down and have a drink. After about 30 minutes there was the most amazing fireworks display. We were totally unaware that this was going to happen. We had the most amazing place to sit and watch. All was so safe and one did not feel threatened in any kind of way. The range of places to eat and drink, one had such a choice. Nobody could be disappointed. Don't miss Darling Harbour on your next visit to Sydney!!!
love the Harbour!. The harbour is the gem of Sydney! there is so many things to do and see, lots of restuarants and bars and attractions surrounding the harbour, a must when visiting Sydney!

Brunch on Sunday. We ate the full breakfast at The Watershed Restaurant. Stunning location right on the water. The food was fresh, delicious and a substantial serving. Staff were friendly. Great spot!

Great Family Day Out. This is a great place to take the family for a day out. We pre-booked our parking and drove in from the Western Suburbs. We went to the Chinese Gardens and let the kids play in the huge and well equipped play area and had McDonalds for lunch, the kids loved it!
Great place to visit. Went there for part of the VIVID SHOW. The place was full of energy and pumping. So much to see and do. Great eateries, cafes, restaurants and museums and attractions.

People watching fun. Loved just sitting around and watching everyone do their thing around the harbour.. so many options for food drink and entertainment. Could spend a day just exploring the area. Had the rehearsal of Vivid Sydney, which was great to see. Everyone around enjoyed watching it to0. Must see on your Sydney visit.

Loads to see and do. We stayed at Darling Harbour and didn't expect so much variety of things to do. You can eat, drink and visit many museums and the Aquarium. It has a relaxed vibe and there's no pressure from anyone to visit their attraction.Take some time to wander and choose what you'd most like to do. You are spoilt for choice. There is also the opportunity to walk round the harbour if you want to get away from the crowds. We visited during Vivid Sydney and it had plenty to see and was very impressive. Well worth spending some time in.

Vibrant Place. Went there with my son, what a place, haven't been here for over 20 years, wow has it changed. Stunning place. Choice of many food outlets. Once all the renovations are complete it will be fantastic.

This place is full of life. What a bustling place it is. It is full of life with shopping, entertainment, hotels, restaurants. I stayed in Darling harbour and hence everyday was wandering around this area. A nice place to spend evenings and you will not get tired. Weekends they have a nice fire works

What a fabulous night!. Went to Darling Harbour on Saturday night to see Vivid. It was packed with families and everybody was happy. The light show was spectactular and the fireworks were awesome. Loved the Ferris Wheel, for $8 per person I think it was well worth it. a beautiful view of the city especially from up high. Darling Harbour is always a beautiful place to visit day or night.

Beautiful Part Of The Harbour. We visited during the Vivid Light show and we lucky to see the spectacular lights being displayed during our walk thru Darling Harbour. We had a few drinks earlier there and strolled thru the evening, ending with dinner. Such a lovely place to be. So many people having fun. Please be sure to visit Darling Harbour when in Sydney.

A whole day is not long enough. Easy to spend the whole day there, we went for a tour on all the boats, A replica of Captain James Cook's Endeavour, and a submarine. There is also the Maritime Museum. Lots of eating places, and expensive shops to browse through. There is a fee to tour the boats.

Always something going on down at Darling Harbour. Well worth a visit if you are in town. It is always busy and chock full of Cafes, Bars and Restaurants with excellent water views. It is a tad commercialised, however, this is balanced with lots of free events on and around the water. Good to stroll around the area. The Maritime Museum is well worth a visit if there are children in your group.

I have always loved this area. Full of activity.. This place never stops. There are ferries. Cruises. Restaurants. IMAX. Hotels. So many things to do and not enough time. Easy access from City. Well connected bridges.

Area almost has everything you need. Restaurants, cafe's, museums, IMAX, a shopping complex, light rail near by for access, and pretty much anything else that might be of interest is located here. You must spend at least one day at Darling Harbour if you're coming to Sydney.

Pretty but too commerialized. The harbour itself is quiet pretty, but there are way too many shops and restaurants along the waterfront, none of which look particularly interesting or appetizing. There are even fast-food chains.

One of those places you must visit whilst in Sydney.. Darling Harbour is a quality restaurant precinct overlooking the water at the bottom end of the City.It has a number of walking bridges over and around the harbour making it easy to explore the area.

Yahoo!. What a great place! On our first night in Sydney, they had fireworks at Darling Harbour, so we spent the evening there. What an amazing place! There are a ton of restaurants, side acts of entertainment, museums, aquarium, and yummy gelato. And let's not forget, just how beautiful and grand this Harbour is.
Something for everyone!. An amazing place - gas flames at night, the wheel, restaurants, walkways, lots of people for people watching - go to Darling Harbour.

Great. When I was a youngster Darling Harbour was the part of Sydney where people didn't venture. It was then the rough end of town mailnly wharves , pubs, and cheap accommodation. What an outstanding job they have done to this place. Great places to dine and wine, relax, bring the kids, imax theatre, powerhouse museum. Its all here

Wonderful Entertainment. There is so much to see and do at Darling Harbour with the Maritime Museum and the floating collection of vessels . The Madame Tussauds , Aquariam, etc will thrill you.
There is a huge number of restaurants catering for all tastes and reasonably priced.You need all day to check out the place.

What a Place!. We were surprised by the variety of attractions and restaurants. There is so much to do in DH and surrounding Pyrmont. The restaurants are reasonable $$$$ and the food of an incredibly high standard. We recommend Nicks and the Cyren. Don't miss calling in at the iconic 24 hour PBH pub to go back in time to an era when DH was the import/export hub of Sydney. In close proximity to the Casino, the National Maritime Museum, Jackson's Landing and the Chinese Garden there is just so much to do and a wonderful spot for families with many free attractions to occupy the kids.

Pyrmont Bridge . The bridge opening was the highlight of my day at the Darling Harbour. Went over to the Powerhouse Museum afterwards and learnt a lot about the history behind the world's largest swing bridge. Beautiful view of the Sydney skyline from the Darling Harbour. Loved the people mover trains, takes about half an hour for a full tour.

MOST LIVELY PLACE OF SYDNEY DARLING LUV YOU. My visit was in march 2015 and really it is darling of all fun lovers.The most lively and fun making place in Sydney.You will find bars,restaurants,tour organizers,cruise , fun creating atmosphere.You will found all the major hotels in Darling harbour.The night view and night life with DJs and bands were fantastic.To explore Sydney you must visit Darling Harbour.

Eat, Play, Dance & Have Fun...Darling Harbour. This place in Sydney you have to visit without fail. So much activities, Madame Tussade, Maine life, etc etc. Also amazing food at numerous restaurants here. Hard Rock cafe too...This place is right in the middle of the city. A short walk will take you to the best shopping centers.Happy journey and exploring...kudos!!!

Wonderful area to stay in Sydney. We stayed on the 7th floor of the apartment we rented and the view, location and are were all perfect!! We were close to fantastic restaurants just across the bridge almost outside our door, shops everywhere, about a 15 minute walk to the shopping district, a bus ride to Chinatown, the Sydney Harbor and 30 minutes from the airport. On Saturday nights there are fireworks that can be seen throughout the Harbour whether your have outside seating at a restaurant along the water or just walking around.

Best harbour visited till now. I have been to 11 countries in 4 years & I must say the Sydney harbour is one of the most organised & very well developed harbours so far. The restaurants & the bar area all are so well located.

Spectacular Vivid. I was staying at the Ibis hotel overlooking the Darling Harbour. Very nice ambiance and i loved the evening performance, the sound and the lights. It also has attractions like the Aquarium, Zoo, I max Theartre. Amazing restaurants as well overlooking the Harbour. Great location to stay in sydney for a vacation.

lovely place for family during weekend. The Darling Harbour offer very nice place for family relaxing during weekend. We were there during Chinese New Year, they had boat racing on the water. The restaurants on the harbour sides very convenient for a cup of coffee and lunch. There is also park for children. Love the atmosphere in this area.

DARLING HARBOUR HAS EVERYTHING. Darling Harbour is a really beautiful part of Sydney. There are so many good restaurants and it is right in the middle of Sydney. There is the light rail to get there or you can get a ferry from Circular Quay or other local wharves. Try a bucket of prawns from Blue Fish Restaurant, a great meal at the Waterfront restaurant or walk across and eat at one of the Nick's restaurants. You can even get a boat to go whale watching. If you want a really fantastic experience, book a table on the Sydney Showboat and enjoy the wonderful food and sensational show. Or visit the Maritime Museum or Star City Casino.

A must visit when in Sydney. Possibly a little too manufactured or commercial for us, but some good restaurants and heaps of activities for the whole family and a must visit. Could do with more casual food option and we couldn't fine a decent bar (one with craft beer) , but I suppose they need to make the most of the location.
Vivid 2015. Had a fabulous day I took kids to Hard Rock Cafe for lunch and stayed for vivid what an amazing place Darling Hatbour can't wait to come back
Best Harbor ever!. This iconic place is simply too stunning and complex to review. Let me just say if you are traveling to Sydney, this is the place to be! You cant go wrong here!
Fun, food and variety. Whether you are lookin for cheap eats or a slap up meal, classy cocktails or a cheeky pint you can find it on darling harbour

Vivid. Most happening place in Sydney. Very nice ambiance with attractions like Sydney aquarium and Madame Tussads wax museum. Sound and light shows were excellent and spectacular. I am running out of adjectives.

Exciting and vibrant. My wife and I walked the length of Darling harbour from the Chinese Garden to the beginning of Barangaroo 3 times while staying in Sydney. every night was alive with people enjoying the precinct, the bars and restaurants.There was a large variety of places to eat and drink and at every price point.We enjoyed Chicken Caeser salad and a pasta, quality ok, price ok.

Shops and restaurants galore!. This is a wonderful area to walk if you are staying in the CBD area of Sydney. The pedestrian bridge gives you wonderful views of the harbours. We spent a half day in the area walking around the entire harbour including Cockle Bay wharf. There are lots of shops indoors to keep you cool and endless eating spots with both indoor and outdoor seating. Wonderful place to spend some time while in Sydney.

Darling Harbour is darling!. This Harbour is so nice. Very clean. Many restaurants directly overlook the Harbour and have outside dining so you can enjoy the view. It is stunning at night as well. Lots of places to eat. There are shops there too.
It's all here. Great place to relax with cafes restaurants and plenty of shopping. Within walking distance to the entertainment centre and close to China Town.
Fun despite the construction. I'd go back after the construction was completed. We went for dinner during the VIVID festival and it was a bit of a zoo. The light show however, was amazing'

Great place to relax, shop and eat.. Just a shortwalk downhill from Town Hall railway station or take the half hour scenic ferry ride from Circular Quay. Abundance of restaurants and good quality shops are waiting. Suggest to visit at Christmas for light display and also during Vivid Sydney Lights.

The Heart of Sydney. Always love visiting Darling Harbour, such a popular place for all the tourist to visit lots of fun things for kids to do and lots of lovely café/takeaways to suit all, Kiddies loved going to the Aquarium an the Wildlife world. Sydney Darling harbour is only a short stroll from China town and Paddy's markets and Centre point tower which is a must see to all. also Circular Quay is not to far away either making your visit to Sydney a Fantastic one. At Circular quay you have an AWESOME view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. You could jump on ferry and go on a relaxing trip across the bay..

Cute little harbour. The smaller harbour in Sydney (and less crowded). Still tons of restaurants that you can sit, eat and enjoy the scenery. There was construction going on, but you can still enjoy the harbour. Definitely worth walking around and perfect place for people watching.

Early in the morning. I went to Darling Harbour for a walk in the morning. The place had a totally different character to what I have usually seen during the busy day time.Very quiet and clam, with empty restaurants all around. Everything was so clean and neat, ready for the busy day ahead. Although there are lot of construction work around lovely to see shining buildings in the morning sunlight. This is a nice place to have a walk around in the morning if you are staying in a nearby hotel.

Great diversity. Everything you need from cafe's, dinning, nightlife, to specialty shops & hotels!Special attractions year round & recommend doing the Harbour Jet boating! Did it last year in June, brrrr.... but heaps of fun! Worth the chilly factor! LOL...

Not Circular Quay but a Beautiful Place. Lacking the action packed boating traffic of Circular Quay in Sydney, this is a much quieter place in the city. Plenty of shopping, lots of restaurants, gorgeous views, and soon to be the new home of the Sydney Convention Center. The Sydney Aquarium is located here and the Imax theater is nearby. Also home to the Star Casino, it seems like everything you need or want can be found here. I prefer to stay near Circular Quay because of the action and access to ferries and water taxis to get anywhere in the Sydney area including all the good beaches. This is definitely an option although it is quite pricey to stay in any of the hotels located here!

The other harbour. One recent reviewer says wait until construction has finished - it does take a little away from the harbour, but there are still great bars and restaurants, the 4 Points Sheraton and Novotel there are both good locations to stay and tend to be less pricey than the city centre hotels.It is a short walk uphill to George street and the main harbour, and if you are staying in the city centre, it is a really nice walk to Darling and around the bay there.Street performers, old ships and a great view into the harbour all make it a worth while visit.

My preferred area to stay for a holiday!. Whenever I visit Sydney, Darling Harbour is my preferred area to stay. Accomodation can be expensive in this area but fortunately as a timeshare owner I can stay at a local Club property called Sebel Apartments Pyrmont. This property is only a few minutes walk away from Darling Harbour.The area is vibrant has a small Shopping Centre (Harbourside) with lots of eating and drinking options located on the waterfront. Eating options can be upmarket to the cheaper food court type fast food. Its great to sit on the timber benches near the water to have a look at the city skylineLocation is very convenient as its only a short walk away to the centre of city to Sydney Tower, Westfield Shopping Centre etc, as well as close to Chinatown and Paddys Market.
Outstanding views and entertainment. Darling Harbour has had a big make over and is looking good. Loads of entertainment in a small area. Superb bars, restaurants and dancing, go for it.

Darling Harbour - Beautiful. I would recommend staying around Darling Harbour. Great (and numerous) restaurants, beautiful outlook, Aquarium, Imax Theatre, short walk to Casino complex (with more restaurants), has its own ferry stop plus many day trips leave from here or can be booked here.

Wait until the construction is finished. Darling Harbour has lost all its ambience during the construction project to build a new convention and entertainment centre. Right now all the tranquil walks and beautiful open spaces have disappeared and it's just a pathway past hoarding after hoarding. The space around the Maritime Museum and across Pyrmont Bridge is still nice but, for me, it's not worth going there or taking out of town visitors there, right now. There are loads of other parts of Sydney town to see that are much nicer.
Quaint area. Great place for groups, couples, or families. Lots of street performers. Carousel nearby. Gelato, coffee, and other shops close too.

harbour. Darling harbour is a nice walk for a afternoon plenty to see old ships in the harbour, there is a Darling class destroyer which you can walk around also there is a wall of all the people who have emigrated to the country. Plenty of restaurants and café for something to eat plus plenty of shops as well

A Vibrant Place to Visit. Our hotel was just across the road from Darling Harbour, giving us the opportunity to spend some time exploring the area. We were very impressed with what was on offer, there seemed to be something for everyone - parks, water features, shops galore, restaurants, cafes, amusement centres etc. We especially enjoyed the Saturday night fireworks. They were amazing and we really enjoyed be among the well behaved crowds that gathered by the harbour to witness such a spectacular show. It is well worth spending some time here.

All you can have place. This place is excellent place to hang up when you have done your museum, hop in and other activities.Should be your last day destination. Come from late afternoon, start with good late lunch or dinner at china town area. There are halal chinese muslim restaurant. Beef noodles and the lamb serving are excellent dishes. Then you can walk slowly via bridge towards the habour. stop by at starbuck to update your Fb status and nice pic for your instagram.walk arounf the harbour, you can dropby at hard rock cafe, lots of restaurant and malls to. Or just relaxing at the harbour site .

Excellent walking area. I stayed in Darling Harbor. It has great restaurant access and is on the quieter side of Sydney (compared to the Quay area). It has great walking along the harbor and into the Chinese friendship garden.

A relaxing break. A great place to visit; good atmosphere and a good setting among the high rise buildings. A tremendous variety of bars and restaurants. A busy little harbour and a great place to start your whale watching experience, or take a water taxi or ferry to Circular Quay.

Crowded and Overpriced. This is definitely an attraction you should try to avoid. The laser and water show was pedestrian. Restaurants are even more overpriced than elsewhere in Australia. The restaurant I visited charged AU$4.50 (US$3.52) for a small glass of Pepsi and the server did not even bring the bottle. There was an AU$10 surcharge because I visited on a Sunday. What is up with that? If restaurants have to pay employees extra for working on Sunday by government decree, they should bear the extra cost, not the lowly consumer. All in all, a very unsatisfactory experience.

Always enjoyable with heaps to do!. We always enjoy spending time at Darling Harbour. On our recent trip we just walked around in the sunshine, sipped coffee in a beautiful little coffee shop overlooking the harbour, and generally enjoyed the scenery and atmosphere. We wandered towards the adjoining park and playground area, which has the most fantastic water and sand play area as well as other climbing and playground equipment. It was buzzing with many family groups enjoying the sunshine, and having a wonderful time. We really wished that we had our grandchildren with us to have an excuse to play too! Later in the day when the cold wind came up, we escaped to the shops and browsed through the shopping centre before enjoying another coffee and churros - yum!

Great spot to see. Lovely large area that has plenty of activity and action going on, lots of places to eat and drink. Boats on the water to see and generally a great place to spend a few hours.Would recommend a visit here.

Plenty to occupy you. Lots to do in the Darling Harbour area. There's a waxworks, an aquarium, a naval museum, tours coming and going from the dockside, restaurants and the Chinese garden and Paddy's market close by. Definitely worth a look. Th tourist information office there is also very good.

Must see. Sydney has developed a magnificent "must see" at Darling Harbour. There is something for everyone - including a fantastic children's play area including water features. A 3-4 minute stroll across the pedestrian bridge and you're in Sydney proper. Development (and redevelopment abounds).

Darling Harbour. Its a lovely place to spend time. Darling Harbour was named after Lieutenant General Ralph Darling who was then a Governor of New South Wales. At night it looks spectacular with all the lights lit up.

Fantastic place.. This is one of the highlights of Sydney. There is so much to do and see around this part of the Harbour and it is so beautiful. Shops, restaurants, food halls, children's activities. Ferry rides starting from here to other parts of the Harbour day and evening. The Sydney Aquarium is situated here and lots of other attractions. It is a must see and you can easily send a few hours or a whole day.

Interesting Darling Harbour. Our hangout at night. Locals and Tourists hanging around here. Pleasant place to cool down after a whole day. There are street performers, food, children playground nearby, peaceful harbour. Every Saturday, there is fireworks at 8:00pm lasting for about 7 miinutes.
Lots of things to do!. Definitely spend a whole day here. Lots of things to do and attractions to see. A great place for families with kids to visit. The kids will surely have fun here.

a great harbor section, and a beautiful view in the sun or with the fog. We were staying in the Novotel Darling Harbor.One morning, when we woke up, we had an extraordinary view with the fog covering the harbor.Other times, we walked around the harbor where there are several attractions, restaurants, and a pathway enabling you to walk over.The area surrounding the water has a lot of shops and restaurants. It is very commercial, but I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It is casual, entertaining and beautiful.

Lovely Place, Free Firework Display on the Friday. Stayed in Sydney last October and came here for a couple of nights out. We came here for drinks and meals and enjoyed both occasions. Plenty to choose from in terms of bars and restaurants.One thing to bear in mind if you want to go for a drink late in the day bring your ID as you won't get in anywhere.

Darling Fireworks. Darling Harbour, potentially could have been a great venue, now consisting of a ugly shopping mall, over-rated and overpriced restaurants. With that said, still worth a visit, especially on a Saturday night when there's a spectacular firework for free! Take the ferry from Circular Quay and take in the harbour views for a small fee. If you don't have any shopping to do, stroll up Union St away from the hustle and bustle for something less pricy to eat or drink. Sydney Aquarium and Sydney National Maritime are interesting museums located waterfront in the harbour. Time your departure, take a stand on the footpath bridge and enjoy the fireworks before you leave!
Darling harbour. What a wonderful place, the aquarium, the wild life park, the restaurants and cafes, I love the Chinese gardens

Darling Harbour - excellent. Has everything, excellent hotels, restaurants and bars. Sydney Aquarium. You don't need to spend money. Free play area for children. Free entertainment on weekends. Harbourside shops. Fireworks 9pm Sat. Great part of Sydney.

Darling Harbour..just awesome!. If you are thinking of visiting Sydney and in particular Darling Harbour you will not be disappointed. This is truly an amazing place to visit. If you are getting here by car try parking at the Star City Casino, it's relatively cheap and if you PLAY a little, you can ask at the desk for your parking ticket to be validated free of charge. It's just a 5 min walk to Darling Harbour from here. In Darling Harbour you can enjoy a wonderful lunch at one of the many licensed restaurants. Try walking down to the southern end to visit the Chinese Garden of friendship, if you like nature this will blow your mind..so much to see inside for a very small fee, you can even get dressed up in authentic Chinese clothing for a photo shoot. Nearby is Chinatown for wonderfull food. There is a 3D Cinema near the many restaurants within Darling Harbour and you can even hop on a mini train to get around easier and rest those tired feet. If you want to go to see the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House just hop on a ferry and it's a short but sensational ride into Circular Quay. Enjoy!!
Stunning. Everything you need from shopping to restaurants, bars to the IMAX.Darling Harbour is also great at Sunrise and Sunset!A must when visiting Sydney...

A casual sitting. Nice place to relax on a beautiful day in Sydney. IMAX cinema, the chinese gardens, playground with a carousel, a variety of food and coffee shops, water features, Sydney aquarium and wildlife park are just some of the facilities there to enjoy. On Saturday nights, both kids and adults can enjoy the fireworks display after dinner. A lovely magical place in the heart of a beautiful city. Enjoy!!

Cockle Bay (Darling Harbour) is excellent. Great restaurants and heaps of shops. Kids are catered for with the adventure playground at the southern end of Darling Harbour. Always an enjoyable visit. Plenty of things to do and see such as the Sydney Aquarium and Maritime Museum (costs involved).

Great Family Day. Wow, what a great family day. So much to do or just relax. Been a while since went there during the day and my 10 year old loved it. Only short nice walk to Sydney markets and above shopping levels. Can't wait to visit in warmer months either.

lovely place. Superb place to mill about just soaking up the sun, loads of lovely food places at some great prices, water taxi/ferry base and a nice shopping centre, also has a zoo, waxworks, Museam and loads more !
Nice place. If you are looking for relax time, enjoy the view, see the fireworks every saturday night, DArling Harbour is. Many shops, restaurants, etc.Come and prove it!!
Fireworks . I went to see the live firework display last Saturday evening and it is defiantly something I suggest to go and see! It really was amazing to watch

Nice place to relax and enjoy. One of the best spot during our vacation to Sydney. Darling harbour offers shopping, dining and some attractions you can visit all at the same place. If you went there during special occasions, you might also get to catch some special events held there. On our visit, we manged to catch a fireworks display while enjoying our dinner at harbour side.Definitely a place worth visiting while you travel to Sydney

Wonderful walk around!. There is always something going on in Darling Harbour and this is all part of the attraction of this Sydney gem. We have been coming here since it was built and it just keeps getting better and better. There are so many fabulous restaurants, shops and it's just great for a nice long walk at any time of the day or any time of the year. One of our favourite places to go to in Sydney.
Must do!. Darling Harbour is an amazing place to visit on your trip to Sydney! it has so many attractions including Madame Tassauds, the aquarium and the IMAX. Only a short walk from Central station.

nice restaurants and a great place to chill. i went there at night and the skyline was very beautiful, though i preferred sydney harbour. i wanted to take a ferry from sydney harbour to darling harbour, but the timing was a bit off, so do plan in advance if you want to make full use of the time. else you can also take a tram to this place, it stops at the market city (which you can find some cheap asian eateries). if you go there on a weekend, you may see some buskers. good to just chill.
Central stay. We stayed here at the Novotel and went to the Sydney Boat show on another occasion, great location almost walking distance to anything worth doing and transport at hand.

Nice Place for a walk while killing your time in Sydney. Nice place to walk and you can also go to Museum (Navy) very close and fantastic Casino The Star. also good for view of metropolitan city and harbor together.

As charming as I remembered <3. Darling Harbour was always where I stayed with family while visiting Sydney. It was so nice to come back years later with my husband & have him love it as much as I always have. A little bit of peace in the busy city :)

lovely place. The walk around the harbour is a lovely expereince, you can enjoy variety of food with so many restaurants around...visit it during the evening time and you can have a lovely view and have a very relaxing time there.....

A must visit. There's heaps here to do both for children or adults. The I max is great with its huge screen. On a Saturday night there were free fire works. There are convention centres which often have different expos. The Chinese gardens are here also and a great choice of food places.

Spur of the moment visit... Darling Harbour was our first 'port of call' on arrival in Sydney after checking in to our hotel. So much to see here....lots of inviting and reasonably priced eateries, magnificent boats to gaze upon - including some of historical interest - pretty fountains, marvellous family areas for a rest or a picnic, and easy access to ferry transport for comfortable and leisurely sightseeing of our glorious Sydney Harbour waterways.
Favourite Place. The Hard Rock Cafe offers happy hour until 7 and fireworks on a Saturday evening in the harbour, its a must! Do not eat in Margarittville!

A must to see!. Sydney Harbour is great but so is this area. It has a lovely atmosphere with the naval museum there. We went on Saturday evening as there is a free firework show every week of the year. It really is impressive! One thing I love about Australia is how much free stuff there is to do. There are a wide range of eateries and it's only a short walk to Chinatown from here. It takes you right under the bridge so you can see how great that is too!
Visit to Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour was a great place to visit. The atmosphere was vibrant. The food was great at Nicks Steak and Seafood restaurant.

Great place for fun. Nice big area to walk around, go to Aquarium, Wildlife, drinks, food and overall entertainment. A lot of tourists and locals mingle around for fun and have an excellent time. We took the ferry from here for the Sydney harbor tour and went to the wildlife park, aquarium and spent the whole day around there. Must go when in Sydney.
The place to relax. Great place to go for a drink and something to eat. Chill out in one of the many bars or restaurants and watch the world go by.

Great place for a walk. I was in Sydney on business and was staying at a nearby hotel. I got off work at 5pm and had some time so decided to take a walk to Darling Harbour. The view was spectacular, especially since I caught the sunset! It was also nice to just sit on a bench and relax. There are many restaurants along the harbor, although many seemed to be tourist places that were quite pricey. There is also an IMAX theater nearby, which would be a good place to stop by. Worth a visit if you are staying nearby.

SightSeeing. Fresh Air! - has the best weather down there, great place to watch the boats coming and going, Madame Tussauds, Aquarium - gotta go see the dugong, the Wildlife. The weekends are very popular with the families so if you want the quieter, slower pace, go during the week. Easy to get tickets and board the boat to head out to the harbour, Taronga Zoo. Loads of restaurants along the pier, take your pick.
