Lovely place for relaxing and dining . This is my best favourite in sydney.You get all the food and view.There are regular fireworks throughout the year and vivid sydney is amazing with fireworks here. The best fireworks of my life wAs Australia Day fireworks lasting around 20 mins.

AMAZING- take xthe children!. where do i start? lots of places to touch water and get wet and feed ducks, now there is a wet playground for those HOT days as well as a lovely playground to tire those legs and spirits on a windy daywe ate at (i think its called) eat love pizza ( just near the IMAX) yummy pizza and salads, delicious coffee and the girls loved their pasta and polenta chips. There is enough to keep children happy all day without any paid activities but if you want to there is also a lot of wonderful things to do. My favourite is the powerhouse museum, if you havnt taken the children (or if you havnt been yourself, find a niece or nephew and take them, you will have a ball!!!) the IMAX, the maritime museum, there are rides and so many gelato bars, my head was giddy with greed. just GO
sunset. Stunning spot to stop for pre dinner drinks and watch the sun go down then walk on to one of the many fine restraunts

Great Nightlife and Cruises. There are a lot of great bars here along the water, the nightlife is very cool. A lot of the Harbour cruises leave from here as well, so you can drink a pint while you wait for your boat. The Star casino is also just a short walk away.

A great place in the 80´s - but under redevlopment. This place is BANG on the edge of the city. So location, location, location works out here. But years and years of bad management, this will hopefully become a great part of the city. For now, I say avoid it.
a good walk. I always enjoy walking around this place. With great places to just stop ,rest and grab a beer or food, it is an ideal place for families or friends

Cosmopolitan. So, we ended up in Darling Harbour quite a few times during our stay in Sydney and really enjoyed it each time. Firstly, this place was not anything like his the last time I was in the icy and had had a huge and very effective facelift. This makes it a pleasant stroll nowadays - a bit like what's happens to the South Bank in London. Classy pubs/places to eat; clean and sophisticated marina and well kept gardens make this a smashing place for a dander. The last time we left we ended up in the middle of a Friday evening happy hour with cut price cocktails... so that was 'smashing' too! :0)

Magic at Night. Darling Harbour is a great place to dine out daytime and evening. Has more atmosphere in the evening, with all the lights sparkling off the water. And on Saturday nights they often have a fireworks show at 8.30pm.
NICE STOP IN THE HEART OF THE CITY. Good for a walk in the middle of the city but without being too chaotic. A lot of nice restaurants, playground for kids, close to the Chinese Garden.
Enjot the atmosphere. For such a touristy sort of place the vibe was great and the choice of places to eat were endless. You can just walk around or sit and enjoy what is happening around you.

Just OK....... Frankly, did not find the place that great. The scene from here is just ok. The zoo, aquarium, Madame Tussauds are here - but they too did not appear that impressive. The eateries in this area are however, interesting - lots of options and you will not find any shortcomings in this respect.
Nothing much. When u r in Sydney, Darlig Harbour is a must-go. It's just five-min walk from Queen Vivtoria's Building so just go, take a photo and then you can back to Geogre St foe shopping!

Great Location. We stayed at the park royal DH hotel. We enjoyed being based at DH. So many restaurants, shops and a fantastic park for children. The IMAX is the largest in the world and was awesome! Great base for sydney with regular ferries/boats from here to anywhere. Walking dis to town hall station too and pitt street with great shops.

Nice bay!. At night time the lights of the restaurants and pubs around the bay, makes it a lovable place! Is nice have a walk there and in the center of Sydney...hard rock is right there (1 of the only 2 in Australia) and many other pubs and restaurants...if i remember right...there are a few attractions like zoo, aquarious, on the other side of the bay!
Hate the place. Locals don't go to DH as it is awful. If you are a tourist please note this is a tourist trap.The Maritime Museum is good by the bulk of it is horrible.

Aussie Break. This is a must for all Sydney visitors particularly the foodies amongst you. A great place to check out a variety of restaurants with a pleasant view of Darling Harbour to enjoy while dining.
Darling harbour. Great place for cafes and also mini train which is quite cheap that travels around the area for children . close to the boats are anchored there. Also Wildlife park, Madam Tussaud
Darling Harbour great restaurants. Great restaurants and good food. Very good discounts during the day for an early dinner. A very busy harbour that is excellent to visit as plenty to see and do.

Very touristic, very crowded. The bridge is pretty nice but other than that, it's too touristic for my taste. My favorite 'attraction' are the small parrots that breed in the palm trees. They're funny, colorful and simply a joy to observe.

Perfect for breakfast. Staying in the CBD we would walk to Darling Harbour in the mornings for breakfast. Most of the cafes along the harbour offered a good choice at reasonable prices and sitting in the sun by the water is a great way to start the day. We also popped back once or twice for dinner too.

Take it from a local : It's not the best Oz has to offer but .... Look, Darling harbour / Cockle bay ain't the best this beautiful country of ours has to offer - it's your classic tourist trap where the waterfront is littered with pizza, faux bistro, cocktail (served in plasticware - classy), sushi and choco cafes joints (oh, there's even a Hard Rock Cafe to set the tone) - but it's a safe environment with enough distractions if you have a very young family. If I were you however, I'd elect to traipse through the Rocks head for the base of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and walk the length of it (takes about fifteen minutes) because the view from the Northern base of the Bridge is the best - with the Opera House framed under the Harbour Bridge. Better, in my opinion than, Lady Macquarie's chair.

Pure entertainment. I love Darling Harbour. During the day it's bustling with people, families, couples, friends just hanging out. It's great for people watching. There are so many great places to eat from cheap eats to seriously elegant restaurants. There are plenty of bars too, all offering happy hour and a scrumptious endless list of cocktails. It can be a bit pricey to sit and drink for a few hours but hey we don't tend to do it that often so when we do we splurge. We have a favourite bar Znicks, it is right in the waterfront on the marina side. There is a table all on it's own, away from everyone else and as luck would have it every time we have been there we have got the table. I just love it. It is right near the bird fountain which changes colour in the evening and on a Saturday evening at 9pm you get fireworks which are lovely. It's just fun to wander about, watch the buskers and the dance crews. The shopping is a bit pricey but I have also got some really lovely bargains too. The food court in the opposite side to the Marina is fantastic and has so many dining options, all of which look so good. So when you are next in Sydney you can easily spend a few hours eating, drinking and strolling about. You'll be glad you did.

Simply Beautiful. Simply beautiful by day and stunning by night. You can easily stroll through both sides of the harbour taking in the sites, the stores, the attractions and many quality eating establishments

Relaxing part of Syney CBD. wonderful place to wander around and check out the food and attractions, Wax Museum etc. and not far to stroll along to the rocks area for markets and viewing historical buildings still in use,

Food, bars, atmosphere. It's fun to stroll around here at night. It's clean, modern, safe and beautiful. A bit pricey, but hey, you're on vacation. After a night or two though, I'd work my way in to some of the neighborhood pubs.
Soulless & dull. Don't bother.. Life is too short to spend any time at Darling Harbour. Go anywhere else in Sydney but here. Very touristy, poor food, overpriced restaurants, and nothing interesting.

One of my Favourite places anywhere. Have been to DH several times, mostly in past 3 years. I know there are those who say it's too touristy, too expensive...but hey, it's Sydney :) I absolutely love the atmosphere, love the harbour...there is a lot to see and do if you can be bothered to take the time.
A morning at Darling Harbour. Good location by the water, ferries etc., very busy with tourists and families alike, lots of places to eat at. Unfortunately, Bangaroo will steal it's space.
our oztrip. Lovely part of Sydney with lots of eating houses and restaurants ideal to sit and people watch , bit touristy but nice ambience

Gentrification of Darling Harbour. I had great expectations of Darling Harbour as I had been told a lot of nice things about it. However the reality was very different in that all the character had been sucked out of the various Quays and replaced with generic modern buildings and chain restaurants so that you could almost be anywhere else in the world. Bangaroo seems to have taken over a large chunk of the Harbour and they are building more high rise offices so that in a few years time it will be like another Canary Wharf - soul less. They are even pulling down old buildings with character on Millers Point to replace with more office space.

Needs a refresh. Very touristy of course, but a nice water-based opportunity to skoll a few beers while drinking in the gorgeous views of the city, particularly at night. Darling Harbour is around the other side of the main Sydney Harbour, so no views of the Opera House, and has a totally different feel. Also boasts the Sydney Imax theatre of you were so inclined. 3-4 star hotels abound in this area for those inclined.A refresh is needed though as it is looking very tired. the pedestrian bridge needs repaving and some of the accoutrements adorning it to be fixed up &/or replaced. The old (now disassembled & removed) monorail stations still stand there, disused and boarded up - they should either be repurposed or dismantled.

Lots to see and do here. The Darling Harbor area is an ideal entertainment and leisure zone for the whole family.The laser shows and spectacular Sydney skyline are impressive and just strolling across or resting on one of the benches on the Piermont bridge are amazingly relaxing. The Promenade Mall offers attractive and reasonable shopping and a wide range of eateries.

Tourist area of Sydney. We visited during school holidays and this is the place for children and families as there are many attractions suited to children here( at a cost). Here you will find Madame Tussaud's Sydney,sea life aquarium, a wildlife park and much more. Walking along the waterfront past the hundreds of restaurants keep us busy. We caught the FantaSea hop on/ hop off boat from Sydney harbour and found this an excellent way to see the variety of things darling harbour has to offer.

Fascinating. Lots to see and do here at Darling Harbour, huge choice of restaurants and bars, the Maritime Museum is very very interesting or one can just sit and watch the world go by with no shortage of a huge assortment of boats to see or just people watch. The harbour is easily accessible from the city centre.

Fantastic View. Though it was bad weather on the day, we enjoyed walking from the hotel to China Town and Paddy's Market; through beautiful Darling Harbour Park lined with cafes & restaurants. The harbour view from our hotel room is beautiful with the backdrop of tall buildings. At the dark of night the lighted buildings is magnificent panorama.

Wild Life Zoo Darling Harbour. I visited the wild life zoo Darling Harbour, with a Chinese visitor on 7th April...hoping to show our unique animals or some of them...At the entrance to this supposed "zoo" has a Tasmanian Devil in a very small enclosure that is totally deprived of any semblance of NATURAL Surrounds...this very Australian Animal was running around in a circle...we watched it for more then 30 minutes...this is horrendous treatment of one of our unique species...the Tasmanian Devil we saw was in a horrible situation...around & around in a circle all day to just make a few dollars for the absolute greed of the zoo owners...I will never go back there or take any visitor there ever...the rest of the "zoo" was not that good either...the Koalas can't be happy caged up in small areas...and a large crocodile in a very very small pond..."Mmmm" didn't like it...the staff were all friendly though...

Modern Sydney at its best. Must see part of Sydney sporting new buidings and modern facilities. The walk to Fish market reveals interesting layers of the city’s history. Too many attractions to list here, sufice to say you will not regret the visit
Nice place to spend the afternoon. This is such a pretty place. Lots of eaterys and attractions nearby. Close to central city and it a good walk to the opera house.
nice neighbourhood. nice neighbourhood, lots of shops and restaurantstrendy neighbourhoodcan take a ferry from circular quay to darling harbour

Everything . It's the place to be for tourists! It's a lovely harbour with such a huge number of attractions! Museums, shops, gardens, the Sea-Life aquarium, the Wild-Life zoo. Go and spend your time! Enjoy!
Touristy but Fun. We were here at Christmas time and they had mini Santas floating in the Harbour! There are ia lot of restaurants, an aquarium and a museum so there is something for everyone.

Nice place for a lunchtime stroll. Lots of attractions close by.. This was the first place we visited in Sydney on a Sunday morning. We arrived early from London and our room wasn't. Lots to do here (Sea Life, restaurnats, shops, etc.), we just opted for a stroll across the bridge and a little walkabout in the sun.Make sure you have a sun hat and sun cream!
touristy but a good place for shopping. Darling Harbour is a very touristy site but offers great views of parts of Sydney´s skyline and some nice shops.

Could have given it a miss.. Totally overrated and not conducive to having a pleasant visit, this time.
There is too much building going on and not enough information to help new comers feel that they are getting a good visit.
Darling Harbor. Everything in one place .. an aquarium, museum and an excellent choice of restaurants, from McDonalds to five star dining.

Tourist must see.. Darling harbour is a tourists delight! Great bars/restaurants/nightclubs and the Star Casino combined with beautiful harbour views from nearly every angle. Through the day you can enjoy the Maritime museum, Widlife centre or just people watch and make the most of the locals who entertain thousandds on the harbourside daily.

It is our Darling. We are Darling Harbour lifetime support members- if such a club exist. We stay in Sydney only in hotels where we get to view the harbour irrespective of price. This jewel of Sydney has been looked after well by the local authorities and is ever continually being improved. For overseas and even Australian visitors, a visit to Sydney without going to the Darling Harbour is an opportunity lost. Its a very inclusive (lots of culture), heaps of entertainment from street shows (what a lovely aspect), dinning nirvana spoiled for choice and every so often spectacular fireworks - just like the one my family watched today. Its like Christmas again.
Worth the time. Pretty area to walk through and lots of nice restaurants, was a bit disappointed in the shopping. The maritime museum in area is worth a stop.

happening place. A good place to hang out post 7pm in the evening. We enjoyed the lovely fireworks at 8pm and then there were some street shows by some volunteers/professionals. The mall has many eating and shopping outlets. eating options are especially a lot and serve a wide range of budgets and cuisines. Seems like the young and happening of the city visits here all the time. A fun place !

Shoppers Paradise. Darling Harbour is a fun place to visit no matter whether a local or a traveller, with many attractions such as u der water aquarium, Lego world, IMAX theatre, great park for kids, lots of shops, and many eateries. Great place to spend a day, and easy ferry ride to and from Circular Quay.

night life of it's best. This is the place to go for great restaurants and bars, pubs of all kinds. Enjoy a cocktail and watch ferries navigating through the harbour. Walking around at night is beautiful as all the places light up.

Loved going to Darling Harbour!. Darling Harbour has a plethora of things to see and do. If you aren’t into crowds, early morning would be the best time to visit because as the day went on, the number of people increased considerably. There are many places to eat and shop, several attractions to see (museums, small zoo, IMAX theatre, etc), small boats to rent, and a good place to catch a couple of the different ferries. Apparently, there are fireworks each weekend and we enjoyed the show. There’s a great information center at the south end of the harbor where we received some great advice about the transportation system. Darling Harbour is a must see and do when in Sydney.

Visit it several times. We have visited this harbour first time in the early morning and enjoyed the whole calm atmosphere here, we visited this place again during lunch time - and the place was overcrowded with people having lunch, chatting, hanging out, singing, dancing and etc. Great information centre here, lots of information. Could have spent there all day eating ice cream and watchin ferries and ships coming and leaving.

Mixed feelings. Couldn't make our minds up about Darling Harbour?Seemed very built up and claustrophobic.Lots of restaurants seemed pricer than other parts of city.Generally an impersonal place perhaps needed more time there but visited both night and evening.Good ferry sail out under the Bridge.

Good walking area day or night. Enjoyed several restaurants on the Harbour during visits over the last 9 years. enjoyed walking around the area during the day as well as night. If fireworks are still being shot off Saturday nights, try to get a seating at a restaurant with a view to watch them.

Nice area. It's a nice relaxing spot, though personally, I think there are better hot spots in the city. The Harbor, Manly, and Coogee offer similar relaxing vibes but have more to do. If you only have a few days in the city, this is one you can skip.

Great place to relax !. Beautiful harbour to relax in the evenings! There is the 9PM fireworks every day and if you have the money , then the STAR casino is nearby as well. Take a stroll in the harbour and the WORLDS BIGGEST MOVIE SCREEN IMAX is next to it as well! Catch a movie if you wish to!. Dont miss the China town as well.

Very Fun Waterfront Area. Darling Harbour is a fun waterfront area with many restaurants, sea life park, IMAX and great views of the harbour. Many restaurants have great lunch and happy hour specials and some restaurants specializing in seafood platters. The maritime museum is on one side of the harbour and well worth the visit. darling harbour is a vibrant area with lots to do, very different from circular quay. Both areas are great but different.

Fire works!. This place is very commercial with a lot of good restaurants and clubs. There is something for everyone and I will not go in detail. I must mention that the fireworks is amazing. It was one of the longest "weekend" fireworks that we have seen before. A must visit if you are in town when they have a show. Make sure that you check the schedule and DO NOT MISS the show!
Beautiful. One of the nicest places I have been. Loads to see, do and eat! Stunning at night. Boat trips leave from the harbour regularly, I would recommend viewing Sydney from the water.

One of my favourite ever places. I can't fault this place. I love it. Great night life and brilliant places to eat and the scenery is just amazing. Very busy on the weekends which is understandable with the fireworks on a saturday night which is great because its so different and you don't get that in many places. Really happy i got to come here!
Darling Harbour, Sydney. Darling Harbour has a lot for everyone. Plenty of food choices, museums, and views. Boardwalk has fantastic views. A definite thing to see and do while your in Sydney.

Great views, great food. We came for a special lunch and a look around Darling Harbour, although we have been here before each time we come we seem to find something different.What is very noticeable is the sense of excitement and anticipation you get on arrival. To see all the people obviously enjoying the day out, seeing people enjoying a nice meal and /or a quiet drink, the children playing in the parks and water gardens all this in a built-up area like Sydney is a sight to behold, make London's Hyde Park and New York's Central Park look old hatThis time when came there was as special display commemorating the 100th year anniversary of Anzac. this was something special to see. Another highlight was the naval submarine moored in the harbour with a giant octopus smothering it, what a sight for the kiddies to see.Darling Harbour is truly a marvellous transformation from the old shipping wharves and railway shunting yards that it used to be.

Great place to hang out. Go early on Saturday for a fireworks show at Night around 7-8pm for a nice spot to sit on. The whole area will be crowded with lots of people all around the world. Mall nearby, from restaurants to cafes and bars.

A good place to visit!!. Darling harbor is massive since last time I visited it, there is so much to see , lots more eateries and activities to do. Always something going off there. I noticed they have built a children's little fair ground which is very good.

Plenty of restaurants, a zoo, Australian Maritime Museum. Watched the Dragon boat races, then my grandchildren visited the zoo. Lovely area with lots of restaurants, family had lunch, prices were very reasonable for good quality food. There is a naval museum to visit, we sadly did not have time. You can catch a ferry which will take you around to Sydney cove passing under the harbour bridge. Further on a great photo opportunity as you pass the Opera house. Finally you arrive at the ferry terminal at Circular Cove.

The perfect location to stay in Sydney. Plenty of hotels to choose from and plenty of top class restaurants too. Activities galore including the sea life centre, madam tussauds and the maritime museum to name a few. The ambience on an evening is awesome with buskers all around the harbour and plenty of trendy bars with good entertainment. There is a lovely park for kids and it's within walking distance (for the fit) to China town and paddys market. Love staying here on my sydney trips!
Amazing Place for Hangout. Amazing place to spend an evening.. the atmosphere is fantastic, the restaurant choices are really good.. Lots to see and do.. Very clean..

Great for restaurants. Rubbish shops. More of the same old tourist shops. Moving away from that area there are some terrific restaurants. Worth a stroll on a warm day. Unpleasant when its cold and windy. Not worth the effort.

Really nice feel here- even in the rain. We enjoyed walking around this area- stopped for a bite to eat at Pancakes on the Rocks. Also enjoyed the arcade- almost made the movies but we were a few minutes late. The restaurant choices are really quite good-even in the rain a nice stop
wine and food. loved Darling Harbour they have their happy hour from 3-6 at most bars, atmosphere is fantastic, some restaurants are a bit pricey but would be paying for the view, kept very clean.

Lots to see and do. Lots to see and do....or just to sit and have a coffee or a meal. Restaurants around Darling Harbour were very reasonably priced. Very clean. Great kids park. Ferries and water taxi's can also be caught from here. Felt very safe walking around here any time of day or night with a family.

Must Visit. Darling Harbour is a place every person visiting Sydney must go. The ocean view is a must in the middle of the downtown Sydney. There are a lot of attractions available. Sydney Maritime Museum, IMAX Theater, Restaurants, Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tusseau, shopping and much more.For the kids is also nice, there is a huge playground for them to play. Make sure, if is a hot day, to bring some spare clothes for them as they can play with water and get very wet.Lind Cafe is a must go place if you like chocolates. Restaurants are a bit expensive, but, worth it to seat down and relax.Make sure you check if fire works are on on the night and book an ocean view table to make the most of it.If you want to have a huge feed, try Braza Barbecue, all you can eat meet, excellent, If you prefer a burger, Hard Rock Cafe is a cool place to go.

One of my favourite places in Sydney. I loved the atmosphere here! There is so much to see and do around here! To me the best part was just sitting around the harbour and people watching! It is well worth the visit, whether your a young family, couples, or just traveling solo!

Better restaurants than Sydney Harbour.... We visited Darling Harbour 3 out of the 4 nights we were in Sydney. The restaurants here are much better than Circular Key and much less expensive. There is also the Wildlife Park and the Aquarium to see and lots of shops. It is gorgeous at night with amazing views. Loved it!
Amazing. Go to a bar at night and look out across the harbour. It's gorgeous. Every Saturday at 9 there are fireworks too which are always pretty impressive.

LOTS TO DO AND SEE!. There are many attractions to see and visit at the Darling Harbour: King Street Wharf, Madame Tussauds, Sea Life Sydney Aquarium, Wild Life Sydney Zoo, Imax Theater, Tumbalong Park and Chinese Garden. As I continued my walk, I also noted the Powerhouse Museum, Paddy City Markets, then Chinatown. Most attractions indicated above charge entrance fees, except for the Tumbalong Park, City Markets, and Chinatown. Restaurants and bars are also present at this attraction.Ferries to other places outside of Sydney can be boarded at the Darling Harbour. Offices of these ferries selling tour tickets are located at this place. Note that due to the number of attractions available at the Harbour, devote at least 2 to 3 days to see and visit most of these attractions. Enjoy your visit!

Cool place. Darling Harbour has everything you need and more. It is such a cool place full of restaurants, bars, shops, eateries and wonderful views of the city. Take your time and walk around and you will se stores and little cafes that will definitely catch yor attention, Great places to have a beer in the afternon and enjoy the Sydney skyline as well.

Great for all ages. Really enjoyed the area. Great for an early morning walk or run before it gets busy. Entertainment for young and old around the harbour. Huge range of restaurants and cafes to choose from.
Stunning!. Lots to do through the harbour. Very pretty - especially at night time. Great atmosphere in the evenings.

Lots to do and even more to see. Darling harbor is a very developed area with the Naval Museum, the Aquarium, and many more attractions on its perimeter. If shopping is what you like there's plenty of that as well. We enjoyed a stop at the Lindt cafe for a hot chocolate but there are many places to eat or just stop for a coffee or a drink. The harbor is easily accessed by the hop on hop off bus or even walking. Plan to spend a few hours there.

Name your dish. An unbelievable selection of restaurants from around the world. In a 100 metre walk we saw Greek , Italian , Steakhouse , Seafood and Japanese. Without doubt the finest fish I have ever tasted from Barramundi to John Dory. We also saw fantastic firework displays on the two Sunday evenings we were there. Not inexpensive if you include a bottle of wine but still worth every penny. Can't wait to go back.

Lots to do here, a little touristy though. This is a excellent location with perfect access to everything. From the Sydney Aquarium, to the Imax Theatre, the Lyric Theatre and the Chinese Gardens, there is something for everyone. It is extremely easy to catch a ferry to Circular Quay or The Rocks. There is plenty of shopping and great places to eat while enjoying the views, especially early evening when the sun begins to go down - the reflections on the water and the changing colors on the backdrop of buildings is spectacular.
Main mode of transport to the islands. Very good infrastructure, boats leave on time and there are plenty of them. Saw 3 cruise ships in the harbour during our stay in Sydney

Impressive Skyline. In the centre of Sydney a 20 minute walk from Central station via China Town the harbour gives an impressive view of the city's skyline. The fountains leading into the harbour are modern and go well with the feel of the area. There are good places to eat and some great attractions such as the Sealife Centre ( the best I have ever been to ) and the National Maritime Museum.

Dazzling Darling Harbour. Great place to eat and drink and the atmosphere in the evenings during February is buzzing - they celebrate the month of love and there are lots of things to do and see around the Harbour. Wonderful places to eat and who wouldn't enjoy the free fireworks on Saturday nights. Very colourful and wonderful atmosphere.

As a night scape what better could you wish for!. Besides the lovely nights ape and photo oprtunity there is a real depth to this place. Lovely restaurants ( we have tried three in our stay) to the children's pak and play area and a really romantic venue! There is a food choice for every taste and as mentioned already a lovely scenic area with great and romantic photo opportunities! Can you ask for or find more anywhere ?

Always worth a visit. I love strolling strolling around Darling Harbour on a sunny day! So many restaurants and thing too see and do, it is a lovely place to visit. Water view eateries are always a favourite in this part of Sydney! First time visitors would spend a whole day here, so much happening, especially on Saturday night when the fireworks finish a great day!

Many Many times in darling harbour. well they have a great shopping centre in darling Harbour, also there is the ferry south Steyne which is a restaurant, and cockle bay which sort of runs off darling harbour is just full of great eating places. You can go down to King Street wharf right on the water sit and eat and watch the ferries come in and heh take a ride it's cheap and you look at the best harbour in the world

Beautiful Harbour. A beautiful harbour to visit. Do check out when is the date for harbourside firework.Stunning view at night and with the magnificent firework, you will definitely remember it for life.
A must when in Sydney. This is a must while visiting Sydney. The entire area is jam packed with shopping, restaurants and lots of little places to check out.It can be VERY crowded tho

Lovely Place. Each time we go to Sydney we either stay at or visit Darling Harbour. Just strolling around or eating in one of the many places is so relaxing. Walking across the Pyrmont Bridge with nice views of the harbour. Down below the bridge there are nice parks and play areas for kids.A definite if you are visiting Sydney.

Lots of Things to See and Do. Several tourist attractions including an aquarium, wax museum, wildlife park and maritime museum are located here. In addition, there are numerous restaurants and shops all connected by a pedestrian only bridge. You could spend half a day or all day here. Within walking distance of most downtown hotels or by train or ferry. We did the wax museum (see separate review) and had dinner at Pancakes on the Rocks (see separate review).

A little Touristy, but still Quite Nice. Nice harbor with a lot of fine boats and some interesting architecture. It is a bit touristy especially on the east side, which is pretty much filled with copies of the same bar, all serving the same drinks at the same prizes while playing the same semi-loud music.Still, it does not detract from the view and the interesting activities in the area.

Fun- Good Attraction point. Lot of things to do. IMAX, Madame Tussads and Wildlife zoo. Lot of Restaurants around, Lively place till midnight. Connected by ferry from Sydney Harbor- 15 minutes or 15 mins walk from Town-hall railway station.

Nice place. We walked one way and caught the ferry back, great way to see lots. Plenty of places to eat & drink & we found that was the place to get happy hour drinks & good meal deals. Ferry ride back was nice and relaxing. Sydney is a great place to visit as lots of things to do.

Wow the place comes to life after 8pm. We arrived early morning and ate breakfast in a cafe overlooking the habour, we were staying in the park royal so a perfect location for the habour. There is a shopping mal with a fabulous food hall if you want to eat on the cheap. We ate at Aria an Italian style restaurant , the food was lovely and not expensive. WE Took a water taxi at night to see the bridge, opera house and lunar park, and what an a amazing sight it was. Loved darling habour, loved Sydney!

A tick off the bucket list. Went here to spend a few hours walking the land marks and enjoying the culture. Enjoyed a skit put on in the auditorium with lots watching. Had a lovely meal at 5 o Clock Somewhere. So many multi cultural characters to watch and smile at and of course the tourists on tight timeframes edging in to see everything, if they would only smile through the experience ...
Good to visit. Choice of activities.. Pleasant just to stroll. Lots of choice regarding activities, restaurants, etc. Maritime museum, aquarium, imax cinema, cruise boats...

Bustling Harbour. This has everything from eateries and cafes and restaurants to the Japanese Garden and the not be missed Maritme museum.On Saturdays there is usually fireworks early evening as so many families are at this harbour to eat or to enjoy the atmosphere.

Average, made for tourists. i don't love it. This is a tourist destination. Food is average because they don't rely on repeat trade. Actually, everything only gets average as far as the fixed attractions go. What is great is the buskers, local entertainers who rely on their skill. They get 10/10. You have to go, but be prepared.
Amazing place . One of the best attractions of Sydney. Couple of restaurants are there. Something for everyone including iMax cinema etc.
A good place to visit. Lots to look at including naval ships and submarine in addition to all the resteraunts. A must see visit

Shopping and Dining. We took a taxi to the area and found many restaurants and cafes with nice water views. There was an IMAX movie theater and lots of shopping further down. There is access to the maritime museum which has a submarine. The Aquarium closes at 5:00 pm. We left the area sooner than planned and walked into the CBD.

Charming place. One of my preferred places in Sydney. Lots of good restaurants and bars, IMAX theatre, small shopping mall. I used to spend some time there every week. I strongly recommend visiting this place.
Eating. Great views again, plenty of reasonably priced restaurants . Had a meal and bottle of wine .$ 52 for two of us. Also walking distance from the Meriton.

Great place to visit. Whenever we stay in Sydney we find a trip to Darling Harbour a must. There are many places to see for example the Maritime Museum, Chinese Gardens plus many shops & restaurants to visit and enjoy.Darling Harbour is only a short walk from the city or take a ferry and take in the sights & sounds of the harbour life. There is always plenty happening.

Something for everyone. A fabulous place to spend time around sunset on a summers evening. Restaurants & bars galore. A great place to sit & relax over a meal then after you can take a lovely walk around the promenade.

Worth a visit.. Darling Harbour is worth a visit even if it is just for a look around and to watch people. We visited several times and found it a relaxing experience but we were there during the off season. If you are visiting you must walk right around it. On our first visit we walked through from the Friendship garden and coming into the Darling Harbour was amazing, such a contrast. On our other visits we arrived by ferry. We did find that the shops were quite expensive but it is a tourist area. Lots of different eating options with great views. We would visit again.

A must harbor to visit , do not miss it !!. Darling Harbor is a fun and entertaining place to visit. There is a big mall and food court inside. Restaurant is abundant by the prominade.. We have try a Vietnamese restaurant call PHO (photo enclosed),beside the Pho is Mexican Grill opposite it is Subway for a quick bite, its on the second level near the Prymont bridge. Near the Prymont bride is a big Maritime Museum. On the other end of Darling Harbor is Madam Tussaud and a Seaquarium. You could also take a quick ferry ride to Circular Quay and vice versa to bit traffic on a busy day.

It has everything you would want. It has all of the ferry's, cafe's, shopping, Maritime museum, aquarium, In door Wild Life Sydney Zoo (highly recommend), great if you are 5 or 85! If you want to try an excellent dining experience we loved The Meat & Wine Co. at the end of the pier, I even tried Kangaroo and it was excellent!!!

Loved it. Came here with our son and grandaughter on one of our last days in Sydney. Parking was fairly horrendous, very expensive, but our son works fairly close by. There are a variety of places to eat and drink and plenty going on. A great experience.

Place to go any time of day or evening. There are so many restaurants, attractions, and sites here we had to go multiple times. Places with cheap food and drinks, upscale dining, and the wonderful Harbourside shopping center (arcade) are all places to go. If you continue around the west side of the harbor there is more shopping and some nice walking areas around a newer, upscale neighborhood. It was laid back and fashionable. Must see if you are in downtown Sydney.

Darling Harbour for Everyone. Darling harbour is within walking distance of Sydney City Centre or you can take a scenic ferry there from Circular Quay. It's a place to eat, drink, shop, visit historic maritime museums and enjoy a variety of other attractions suited to all members of your family. Definitely spend a few hours there in what can be a great family atmosphere.
WORTH THE VISIT. Place of many restaurants/cafes and The Maritime Museum.On a sunny day it is colourful and worth taking a table and watch the world go by.
Darling harbour. I like its being complete, everything is there already. Very lively and vibrant be it day or night. There is museum, aquarium, shopping center and lots of restaurants.
Good for a visit. Plenty of bars and restaurants good way to spend the afternoon,evening and night. Priced for tourist but relaxing must see for a visitor to Sydney

famous Darling Harbour.. Darling Harbour has something for everyone from bars and restaurants to eat in to a warship and submarine to explore!There is so much to see and do both day and night, the bridge across the harbour gives great views of everything and gives access to the Star Casino.many boat trips leave from Kings Street Wharf to suit all requirements from whale watching to dance and also dinner cruises.There is at the moment quite a lot of building that detracts somewhat and will do for the next year at least but the harbour is still a must visit!

Lots to see and do. Whether you want to see tall ships, catch a ferry, eat, drink, walk, shop, see a film, its pretty much all here. The naval museum has something for everyone too. Restaurants vary in quality, from average to very good.

A Gem of a Place. This is a fabulous place particularly at night. There are loads of bars and restaurants and the atmosphere is is great. It seems most of Sydney turns out and on Saturday nights they usually have a fireworks show which is launched from a barge on the water. Well worth a visit.

great views of harbour. Went down to Darling Harbour just about every day we were in Sydney. Lots of shops and places to eat. Try to go to the I-max theatre. We saw the last Hobbit movie in 3-d. Awesome. We found that the best deals for shopping were here. Prices were the best in town and the Hard Rock Café is also here.

wonderful place to chill out. Magnificently presented activities to enable to spend all day with an eclectic array of restaurants and eating establishments. So clean and a pleasure just to take in the laid back atmopshere

Fantastic!. We went to a restaurant called Huricanes in Darling Harbour, but that's a different review - great steak and ribs though. On Friday. & Saturday nights there are fireworks in he harbour at about 9 p.m. Which were great, so I would recommend eating there at least once during you visit to Sydney. Not cheap to eat, but for a last night or special Neal it's worth it.There's shopping and dining, and the Chinese Garden was really nice - it cost $11 AUD each (about £6) for the garden plus tea and scones!

Exciting and interesting place. We went to Darling Harbour 3 days in a row as it was very close to our hotel. Even though we went at different times of the day and night, there was always so much going on, it was an exciting place to go to. The wonderful mix of entertainment and dining options added to the buzz of the area. Great fun for everyone.

Worth the evening !. Darling Harbour and its adjoining areas (parks, Harbour, eateries and attractions) are a must visit for any Sydney tourist. There is so much to do for all ages (and so much to eat) that you will never run out of options. The Madame Tussaud' s is located in Darling Harbour adjacent to the Sydney Zoo (a small one I must say) and the Sea Life Aquarium. The array of pubs and restaurants all along the route serve great food and drinks. You will want to come back again !

Not what it was....... We were there some seven years ago, and it was beautiful, classy with quality restaurants. Now it's loud music with tipsy and loud holidaymakers and bars to pull them in. If your a drunken holidaymaker it's great, if not stick to the opera house area in circular quay

Family friendly. what a fantastic place to take the kids, free big park for kids to run around play with water and has sun shelter easy access to amenities . Take your own picnic, sit on the huge grassed area, or take advantage of the extensive choice of food outlets to suit all tastes and budgets. Great space and entertainment.

Cheerful. If you are looking for attractions, restaurants, bars and cinemas, they are all there. You name it and sooner you are going to explore it. I like the playing ground for children. Even the night life are delightful with several night clubs. Go on weekends not the weekdays.

Lots to see, do and eat!. Stumbled upon this area by mistake, so glad we did. Anytime of the day or night, so much is available. Variety of restaurants on the marina, park and play area for kids, water activities and shopping. We did a lot of people watching and wandered in and out of the many little restaurant/bar areas along the way.

Fireworks Saturday Night at 9!. While you are staying in and around Sydney, make sure to walk over to Darling Harbor for dinner and their weekly Saturday Night fireworks show. Always a fun way to spend some time in the city. Easily accessed from the city and a nice place to spend some time during the day. Both sides of Darling Harbor have lots of restaurants and things to do. Don't miss it.

Nice area for restaurants and bars early evening. We stayed near here in Kent Street so it was a natural, close walk in the evening. Nice restaurants, a little pricy but you are on the waterfront. Hard Rock Cafe has some good harbour views if you get an outside table. Relaxed atmosphere. Not as impressive or lively as being around Circular Quay / Sydney Opera Bar area, but a nice change from that area if you've a few nights in the city. Outdoor movies playing when we visited.
A good evening out. Worth visiting. plenty of places to eat. Visit the Hard Rock Café, 3D Imax Theatre, Aquarium, take a boat trip.

a walk here. is a place for fireworks....
nice place and nice view
have a walk around this area...
nearby also have some wildlife, sea life and
can see some yachts also....

Restaurants closed too early. After hearing Darling Harbour was "24/7", was disappointed to arrive there around 10 pm for something to eat and fine most restaurants had closed. Finally found one which could serve us but we had to be in and out fairly quickly. Not the impression I had been given.

Always something interesting going on.. There is always something new and different happening in Darling Harbour. From free movies on the grass, to romantic little row boats. Attractions are constantly changing each month. So many bars and restaurants to choose from and just a nice place to walk around. I use to attend the old convention centre several times a year for industry expos but that is currently being rebuilt.

Go here to experience Sydney's nightlife. Teeming with people on a Saturday evening, this place is full of life! makes you happy just to go there. Gastronomical paradise (as is all of Sydney), this place turns into the hip nightlife hangout with parties going on till much late in the night.Don't delay your dinner too much cause open restaurants may mislead you into believing that there are options. Most of the places turn into pubs after 10 PM and donot serve any food. The crowd is young and bright and you get plenty of interesting cocktails - dont miss this place when in Sydney, esp during a weekend.

A great place to visit with entertainment and Bars for all the Family. A good number of attractions and restaurants on Darling Harbour to keep you amused and also a lovely walk along the waterside. Try the Aquarium as full of excellent exhibits and very realistic underwater tunnel.

Lots to do. If you are in darling harbor on Saturday be there at 9pm for the fireworks. Very nice. The food is cheaper here as well. Most restaurants have breakfast lunch and dinner specials. I enjoyed walking the harbor too. Lots of attractions. Stop at one the ticket vendors to buy a discount package. 3 attractions for 90.00

What a lively place to visit...... Darling Harbour is an area with every form of activity for young and not so young. Darling Harbour is surrounded by countless eating and drinking establishments as well as numerous attractions to entertain the young and the more mature amongst us. The easy way to find Darling Harbour is to take one the ferries from Circular Quay, and when you arrive you feel a bustling harbour with countless opportunities to entertain you, from museums to shopping centres to the Sydney Aquarium and the Wildlife World. The Exhibition Centre and the Chinese Gardens are also attractions worth exploring, although a fee may be payable for some events/attractions.

Fantastic place to stretch your legs. This place was quite nice. My friend and I strolled about here to stretch our legs after a long flight in from the USA. Very much worth a visit. Plenty of restaurants along the harbour itself, but a short ways off the harbour you'll find some more non-touristy spots that all looked quite good. Water ferry worth taking a ride on, for the views if nothing else.

Not the best of walks.... It's majorly ruined by the restaurants and bars pumping out music & hoards of drunken people around in the evening, while in the daytime it's swarming with tourists but ok for a stroll around i guess.Tokoi Bar was a good spot but i wasn't much for anywhere else around.

good place for food, party and attractions. we took a ferry from the circular quay and it was during the Chinese new year. so the place was too busy with lot of fireworks, street shows and it was the lantern festival where the whole place was lighted up colourfully. allow yourself a lot of time at darling harbour where there are plenty of things to do and a perfect place to enjoy attractions, food and party.
a place to avoid. This is an area for the masses, lots of bad eateries, face harbor feeling - everything artificial. It's exactly what I don't want to see when getting to know a city.
A Darling Little Harbor. Another nice harbor with a Maritime Museum and many shops. A nice place to walk around and people watch.

Give yourself plenty of time. There is so much to explore in Darling Harbour, give yourself a day. There are places of visit - national maritime museum, wildlife zoo, sea life centre, Madame Tussaud's, Chinese garden among others. If you visit these get discount vouchers from the visitors centre or use the places booking online service (even on the same day) as it will work out cheaper.Some Harbour Cruises go from here. There are loads of restaurants throughout with a lot of choice. Also from here Paddy's market is worth a visit for souvenirs if nothing else.We went to Lindt chocolate shop with is in Cockle bay wharf. Heavenly but we had a platter (groupon voucher) which was a overload to the senses.

Darling Harbour's a fun place to be. Kinda reminds me of Inner Harbor in Baltimore, Maryland. Got everything to keep you busy for the day: lots of shops, food places, and museums. From the Sydney Train, we got off at Town Hall and walked 2 downhill blocks. You can also reach it by ferry---it's the first stop on the ferry going to Cockatoo Island/Woolwich. From the Light Rail, you can get off at Darling Harbourside. By the way, from Darling Harbour, it's an easy 10-minute walk to Chinatown.

lots to see and do. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay and then discovered the next day that we could walk there in about 15 minutes from our hotel.We visited the Chinese gardens, Madame Tussauds and the Imax cinema, there's a great play area for children( As Grand - parents we tend to notice these things) We ran out of time and missed the Maritime Museum's submarine and warship tour which had been recommended to us. Lots of places to eat and drink and great for our favourite pastime....people watching...

Loved Darling Harbour. we walked from our hotel down to Darling Harbour just sit down at one of the bars and just while away the hours . we would like to go back in a few years time once all the building work is finished

Worth going to!. Busy bustling hub of boats, hotels, eating places, very popular area to look around, take a boat trip or just have a leisurey stroll along the harbour.Plenty to see and do.Madame tussards found along the harbour.
Great place to brunch. Or lunch or dinner....I went for a late lunch at one of the many eateries in the area...fabulous choices and because of the hour, 2pm, not too crowded.

Very busy. Very busy and extremely noisy and mainly restaurants and caffe's . But a great maritime museum and only managed to visit one ship so would love to return . Fabulous Aquarium as well . Easily spend a couple of hours there . We did return one evening for dinner at an Indian restaurant as it was a pleasant evening walk from Hyde Park where we were staying .

Water park a must. After needing to head into the city for a work function, I was left with our 3 year old who wanted to just run and playafter lunch on the strip, we headed over to the water play area at Darling Harbour, this is my first trip there with my son, who was mesmerised by all the attractions, it was a very hot day, so what better way to cool of with under a water fountain of sprinklersthere was plenty for him to do, he could run through the water, play in a sandpit, pump water into a channel, change water directions, play on a swing, climb a spider web or ride a merry go round,the only down side to the day, was that there was not a lot of shade around, the slides were boiling hot and the paths were hot on his feet, it did not stop him from having fun thoughthe hardest part of the day was getting him to leave as he was having so much fun,great for young kids, but no so good for toddlers, as there was no shade, no easy walking tracks or room for mums with prams everywheretake plenty of water with you as it is not cheap, take sunscreen, hat and a few changes of clothes as well as a beach towel and enjoy the sunshine
Nice area. We went on a cruise from here and had a look around there are quite a few shops and the aquarium is good, especially if you have children.

If you like quaint quiet neighborhoods (Mchmahons pt)- then avoid Darling. Disappointed the minute I stepped off the boat. Kids running around, every venue with a bad lunch special, no charm what so ever. If you like crowds with no ambiance and a large dash of american capitalism, then run from this place.
Great tourist spot. We were staying in the Mercure on George St. so this was close for us - a load of good bars, restaurants and Imax - in a harbour setting - really very good

Great atmosphere. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour, and then strolled right around, past the Aquarium, the National Maritime Museum and lots of restaurants. We returned in the evening for dinner, when many of the buildings are illuminated, and the atmosphere gets even better.

Agree at buzzy place day and night!. We stayed near here and when we discovered the Harbour we were so pleased, there are many, many resturants to choose from, always entertainers and every Saturday evening at 9pm there is a fireworks display. The Sydney ferries come into the Harbour too, so great way to get to any of the many places worth visiting including the opera house and bridge

Lots to do and see. we went there for lunch. Ended up going back for dinner another time. Lots of restaurant options and entertainment options such as aquarium. There is shopping as well. Easy to get to.

Currently a building site!. This place is being partly overhauled so there is a lot of building works going on. It is nice, but I woudnt visit during the day while they are out doing work. If you approach via the Chinese gardens, there is no works going on. Good few restaurants in the harbour area.

Different than Stdney Harbour. Don't be mistaken in thinking that Darling Harbour will be an extension of Circular Quays. The darling Harbour area is now very much it's own tourist area, The footbridge across the middle is great with the Maritime Museum at the other side. Restaurants are good value and large. Many have happy hour drinks in the afternoon.At the end is now a man made "stream" leading through to a round grassed area near to Chinese Gardens.Shopping centre with Hard Rock Café below Ibis/ Novatel. Well equipped with many food stores including McDonalds.

I love Darling Harbour. I wish I lived here.. We gave a boat ourselves and I wish there was a way to get it here. I truly love it. My husband and I came and had lunch at one of the restaurants and wanted to return on another occasion for te "sunset dinner". but our family had arranged other surprises for us. Don't be put off by poor reports, even if you just want to sit with a coffee and people-watch it's a lovely place. We enjoyed.

Brilliant views great restaurants. Our hotel in Sydney overlooked Darling Harbour. It has lots of restaurants, bars and cafes of varying price ranges so there is something to suite all pockets. There is also a shopping mall at the alongside the harbour which has shops and a large food court. We ate breakfasts in the mall and evening meals in the harbour side restaurants overlooking the harbour. There is a regular ferry service which takes you to other bays : circular quay is the next bay to darling harbour where the opera house is situated and to get to it you go under the sydney harbour bridge !. There is also a maritime museum at Darling harbour and a sealife centre. It's also within walking distance of the major shopping centre and the Chinese gardens.

lovely. IT is a very lovely place! we feel comfortable there. The view and atmosphere there is great.
When we visited, there was a big Xmas tree deco! loving it!

Must for all visitors to Sydney. A must do for all those who visit Sydney. So many thigs to go and see, I really recommend 2 things the Syydney Aquarium posibly the best in the world and the wildlife centre which is well worth it for those on a short visit with no time to visit Taronga. Lots of good bars and restaurants, a Little on the expensive side.

Family oriented place and tourist hot spot.. This place was a family destination in the city, great park and play area for small and big kids. Near China town and star city.Plenty of food to choose for. From MacDonald to fancy Asian or western restaurant...there are so many choices...some weekend. Night there are firework spectacular,..its a must for tourist,
Ruined it. This area used to be so nice, now all the development has made it a noisy, disgusting, hot and barren concrete jungle. The loss of the monorail killed it.

Beautiful! Ignore bad reviews!!. I really don't understand some people's expectations and why some reviews are so negative.Darling Harbour for us was a gem of a place and we were so envious of such a city facility. We visited a couple of times during two separate 4 night stays in Sydney. Enjoyed every time. So much going on in the evening with everyone having a good time and relaxing in the numerous restaurants and bars. Very impressed with all the preparations for Valentine's Day. Real happy laid back feel about the place. Great weekend fireworks display. Made our stay in Sydney - a must for everyone!
A great visit. There is always something happening around Darling Harbour. A great place to visit with lots of attractions close buy. Good eating places.

Keeps Improving. Every time we visit Sydney we end up in Darling Harbour. It just keeps improving. The gardens are now finished and it is just a great place to visit, even with young children due to the new play area.There is always something happening it seems.

Exciting and Beautiful. Do yourself a favour and take a walk around Darling Harbours water side, many wonderful Restaurants, Ferries, Boats of all sorts .Usually there is always something going on at Darling Harbour, don't miss it.

What to see in Sydney. If you are visiting Sydney, Darling Harbour is a must. Plenty of cafés and restaurants, and a beautiful walkway right around with a large play park for kids.Just sit and have a drink whilst watching all the yachts in the harbour or just people watch.

Noisy sister of Sydney Harbour. Went one evening and it was heaving with people. Why do they have to play corny old pop songs on loud speakers as you walk over the bridge? I really felt for the poor animals in the wild park below having to tolerate this every evening, and probably even the fish in the aquarium needed earplugs in.Probably better for families as most of the family friendly activities centre around here. It was difficult to find a restaurant that wasn't chock full, but it was Chinese new year so maybe it is not usually so busy. The fireworks in the evening were great (again worried for the animals in the zoo), as were the decorations in the Chinese garden.

Fun area with lots to do. We arrived via the train and toured the Queen Victoria Building on our way to the harbor. This is a must. It has been renovated and is now an upscale mall with many designer shops and fine eateries. The harbor itself is also accessible by ferry. The zoo, aquarium and other attractions dot the wharf as well as restaurants such as the Hard Rock Café and a mall.

Great place- Nightlife a little average though. Darling harbour is a great place to visit if you're only in Sydney for a couple of days. The scenery is magnificent and there is always something happening. The only down side is that the night clubs are average around their and play terrible music from 5 years ago.
Simply amazing!. We had a marvellous family get-together - so many good restaurants and sights - the views are incredible... and the fireworks at night are brilliant. Love this place!
Darling Harbour. I just love Darling Harbour it's so interesting & I can do heaps of things so can't wait to go back with my friend in April 19th 2015...
Great day. Had a great day yesterday at darling harbour. Watched the dragon boat racing , weather was great atmosphere wonderful. Watched some of the fireworks you couldn't ask for a better day

Lovely atmosphere day and night. This is a lovely place to visit both in the day and night. There is always something going on. When we were there a firework display was on leading up to Christmas. It was worth getting a table at the Hard Rock Cafe on the balcony for the fireworks. There was all sorts of Christmas related activities taking place to keep all of the family entertained. This is a must do when in Sydney.

Cozy. Great relaxing environment close to Town Hall station. Darling Harbor offers various cafes and restaurants around the water. There are steps close to the water where you can sit down and watch the magnificent fireworks everyday Friday and Saturday evening at 9 pm.
Great atmosphere day and night. Darling harbour was a hub of activity when I visited at day and night. I found it much better than Circular Quay. Definitely worth a visit at night.

Why can't there be a Darling Harbour closer to home. Loved Darling Harbour. Lots going on....everyone sitting outside being sociable. Keep walking and you keep finding something different. Suddenly came across a children's playground with a water theme.So many restaurants and places to sit....great atmosphereLoved it

Fantastic. Stayed in a hotel a short walking distance from darling harbour which has every type of restaurant or bar you could require for your stay in Sydney, in addition to numerous attractions. Great for all family members worth a days visit you won't be disappointed. Water taxis and ferrys readily available to circular key etc

Wonderful nightlife. When you are there in Sydney, after you've been to the beach and to the harbour and to the ferry and about the CBD, you gotta rest man . . .then go to the Darling harbour, that has an impressive array of restaurants. Go to the Lindt cafe for chocolate heaven.

favourite place in Sydney. We just love Darling Harbour, we pick our accommodation so we are walking distance to it. Love the selection of restaurants, the entertainment around the harbour. we happened to be there Valentines weekend. BIG hearts lite up on the bridges, lots of lovely things going on. Fireworks very Saturday night, we got it Friday and Saturday this time. Just AWESOME

Beautiful. I love this place!!! So beautiful in every direction. So lively and fun. Activities are happening all the time. All my nephews and nieces enjoyed the walk through Darling Harbor and the boat ride. We took hundreds of pictures and my 3 spare batteries came in handy. I would recommend wearing walking shoes. My flats did not work out for me at all. But the experience was worth the pain lol. Loved it here.

Lively Darling Harbour. Very lively place to be at, lots to places to eat, sit & sip a cup of coffee, the ferries are available to take you for a beautiful ride, fireworks in evening & walk by the harbour is simply amazing.All major attractions are here & its lively 24*7.

Very romantic. After visiting the IMAX cinema, me and my boyfriend took a stroll in the park next to the harbour and then went to one of the many restaurants that can be found along the water. There's a very nice vibe going on with a lot to see and do. Writing this makes me want to go back even more.

Great place. You never know this is a great kid's playground, they are so humanized design, even me as an adult like that. Very good and suitable for a family to stay whole day there. Food and toilet were so handy to reach. Aquarium and wildlife just located nearby. Conference building too. This is a great place for tourist to do their shopping too although it's a bit costly. Normally firework display at this area. Great attraction to go. I love to come here and sit down to rest until sunset. I would say this is great place to eat seafood and enjoy the night view. I remember I visited 3 times during the vivid music show on end May 2014, gosh, stunning stunning...incredibly amazing watch show here. I love it love it.

Darling harbour. The hustle and bustle of tourists and business individuals is the first thing you'll encounter. There's plenty to see and, with a wide range of activities being featured here throughout the year available (most at no extra cost) it is a great day out for friends, family and couples alike. There's plenty of eateries spotted around the place with plenty of cute cafes to discover.Recently it has undergone a renovation around the harbour itself.

So much to see at every turn. I loved walking down around the Harbour during warm weather. Every few steps was something fun to look at: outdoor entertainers, gelato shops, outdoor restaurants, ferry services, great sitting areas for people watching. Often an outdoor festival sets up for a few days. Of course, the Sydney Opera House is an important stop!
Lovely lively harbour.. We stayed overlooking this harbour and loved it. There are lots of places to eat and on Saturdays a firework display There is a good atmosphere there..

Daling Harbour. Our stay at Darling Harbour was great with all the attractions it offers. The shopping, the different attractions, ferries to get you to different places and all the different bars and cafes to go to. Enjoyed the maritime museum and Sydney wildlife as well as the Aquarium. Plenty to see and do

Our first port of call. This was the first place we visited in Sydney on a Sunday morning. We arrived early from Singapore and our room wasn't ready so we were advised to go here.
What an amazing place to take the kids, to chill out and have Sunday brunch.
Well worth a visit.

Great places to eat, shop and enjoy. Mixed variety of things to see and do here - Maritime Museum, Aquarium, Sealife, Madame Tussauds, Lot of ferries and other pleasure craft leave from here. Pyrmont Bridge has a demonstration opening on the hour on Sundays. Many bars and cafes to choose from for drinks, food, music etc.

Go here quite often. A great place to spend with the family and loved ones. So much to do, and for people from all walks of life. Shopping, cinemas, go on boat rides over to the Zoo, Luna Park, and other destinations around Sydney. Plenty of food places to wine and dine, and you will even find a local event on now and again around Darling Harbour. Plenty of things to do for the kids, awesome outside playground, and even in 2015 they are currently upgrading to make Darling Harbour bigger and better.
Darling harbour. Trendy place,lots of very good bars and restaurants. good atmosphere. Great for people watching and chilling.

Fun for the adults and children . Have a meal or a drink or both. Then chilax watching the many things going on in the harbour. Then you can go to the aquarium including the koalas etc too if you want to. Even go to the cinema

Great day out!. We went here for our visit to wildlife Sydney Zoo, Sydney aquarium and Madame Tussaud's. Whilst in the area we walked all the way around the harbour and down to the star casino. The harbour is stunning. We had beautiful sunny weather to enjoy. There's loads of bars and restaurants around and there's a very relaxed tourist/holiday atmosphere. The ferry from circular quay was less than £4 and takes about 20 minutes.

Good in parts. Darling Harbour has the Maritine Museum, Aquarium, restaurants, IMAX theatre and shops. The Maritime Museum and Aquarium are great, but it is an expensive day out.There is also the Chinese Garden.For people with small kids, there is a great playground with a terrific water section from the 2-10 age group - and that is free. Darling Harbour itself has too much paving and not enough trees for my taste and the shops are rather lacklustre.There are free fireworks every Saturday night at 9pm.

Valentine's Day Celebration. as Inrelated on The Chinese Garden revue.the two events coincided and complimented each other. I enjoyed the delightful entertainment and light shows in the Garden leading on to Darling Harbour where a Firework Display took place.

The little harbour bay. Enough to keep adults and children alike entertained throughout the day with the wildlife park, the waxworks and enough cruise adventures to make you dizzy then the multitude of cafes to re-energise!

Great choices to eat. Darling Harbour is an easy stroll from the centre of the city and has a bevvy of restaurants, bars to sit and people watch from. There is usually quite a bit of activity with buskers and pop up events and aquarium. It is close to accommodation and the Casino on one side. The shopping is more aimed at the tourist, but there are a few places that would suit locals as well. Definitely worth a visit.

Awesome place. Darling harbour is so awesome so much to do and see you need more then a weekend to do it all. My daughter and her friends had an awesome time then the following weekend my hubby and I and the kids had the best day ever

Lively location. Full of things to do and things to see this is a great location for the family. The Maritime Museum has to be one of the highlights here with its fascinating collection of historic vessels many of which can be visited. Loads of eateries line the harbour too. There are some great play activities for children as well and even some for those who haven't quite grown up yet! The beautiful Chinese Garden of Friendship is also worth a visit

Great place to go!!!. Darling Harbour is a very vibrant and interesting area with restaurants, shops and pavement entertainment! It has such a nice happy atmosphere and I would highly recommend a visit!

One of my favourite places!. A buzzing, vibrant area that provides an atmosphere to suit any taste as well as the comfortable feel to just stroll around, night or day. Too many places to choose from to eat or drink and if you can stay in one of the hotels with a view......well that's just a bonus!

Entertainment. Darling harbour has a lot of entertainment. A lot of things you can do here. Movies, submarine, individual entertainers, the aquarium is really good, Chinese gardens and animal park. Restaurants, entertainment centre too.

everything for everyone. Fantastic restaurants of all kinds,nearby Chinatown and ships and a submarine to visit. Darling Harbour is a great day out, lots to do for kids & adults & some of it free.Well worth a visit.

Will improve. Darling Harbour is a beautiful place to visit, but there is a lot of construction work there at present. When this is finished it will make the whole area 10 times better with more for people to see.

"Love Darling". Loved the atmosphere, plenty of entertainment, we took a ride on the jet boats which was very thrilling for the kids, and the amazing restaurants so many choices - Loved our day at Darling.

Lots to do in Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is great. Its so relaxing just walking around. There is lots to see. Great having a coffee and people watching there are lots of cafes, bars and attractions like the National Maritime museum, Aquarium, Madame Tussards or the Wild Life Zoo. Just great sitting watching the boats.

Scenic views of Sydney. Full of restaurants and cafes and also the aquarium close by. You can stroll along the bars and gardens and have a variety of cuisines to chose from for your lunch or diner. It's a great place to have diner and look out over the harbour and onto the Sydney skyline at night with the buildings all lit up! The restaurants vary in prices from café style to high end quality with fresh seafood and awesome steak on offer.
Great spot on the harbour. Lots of great bars and cafes to sit and soak up the atmosphere. Usually lots happening around this area - people watching is always interesting here.

Its all action. This is a fantastic place to visit, walk around, sit down and have a bite to eat - lots of places to choose from, have a coffee or a hot chocolate and watch the world go by. Always seems to be something happening all the time. If you can be sure to be there on a Saturday night to watch the fire works - just great. Check out the menus and pricing as one side is cheaper that the other for food but we ate at lots of different places and it was all good. Make sure you go to the Chinese Garden, just beautiful. All in all a good place to be.

Under Construction - But still worth a visit. There are a lot of works going on in Darling Harbour at the moment with the new International Convention Centre being built. But there are still some great lil gems to visit in the area such as the Chinese Garden of Friendship, Darling Quarter (playground), Wildlife Sydney (Zoo), Sealife Sydney (Aquarium) and Madam Tussaud's.
worth a visit. great location going through lots off renovations currentlyso many food opportunities from take away to superb seafoodgreat to just wander through & simply enjoy the vibe
nices places to eat. walking around the habour eating places are good and many things to do there for kids and adults plenty night clubs lovely shops
Night at Darling Harbour with family. Spent a sunday night with family whilst visiting Sydney. Good quality restaurants and cafes in the precinct with lots of varied entertainment

Darling Harbour is stunning on land and dazzling on the water.. If you truly desire an unforgettable experience jump on a boat and if you desire one of the most unforgettable memories of your life jump on a boat on New Years Eve and witness the most dazzling of celebrations. The harbour is buzzing with glittering boats of all shapes and sizes and the atmosphere is electric. There's an instant camaraderie on the water, everyone's singing (Aussie Aussie Aussie Oy! Oy! Oy! ok its not really a song.) and calling out Cheers and Happy New Year! Its a blast and I love that Aussies guys will wear a tutu as long as they have a beer in their hands. Australia Day also a wonderful event to experience on the water, there are ferry races and yachts performing ballet, and people all letting their hair down and being silly like me.
A little tired and touristy!. Ok if you like tourist shops with Made in China on everything.Some good restaurants, and sometimes you might catch some good performers, check what's on.

Darling Harbour, Sydney. A great place to spend a few hours while in Sydney. There are many restaurants, cafes and food outlets to satisfy all tastes. Children are well catered for as there are play areas, fountains and activities to keep them busy. I love the IMAX theatre and the shopping is good too.

Vibrant city experience. Spending a day in darling Harbour was a fantastic experience. We were very impressed with the lively nature of the area. Great food, a relaxed atmosphere and at lunchtime it was great to see so many people exercising (jogging,cycling) in and around the area. Plenty to do for peiople of all ages. A real jewel in Sydney's crown.

Australia Day festivities. Trip to Darling Harbour from Central Station was by light rail and well patronised. Unfortunately the festivities at Darling Harbour were restricted due to rain on Australia Day 2015.
Take a slow walk. Take a slow walk through Darling harbour and enjoy the waterfront also go to the shops and other attractions just take your time no rush
Darling Harbour. Lots to do from great restaurants and bars to the Aquarium and indoor zoo. Busy with lots of people and a good vibe. Convention centre also right there...

good venue for the family. Darling Harbour has a multitude of activities cafe and bars. A short walk will take you to China Town with a delicious array of fine restaurants, the Markets where you can purchase nick-knacks, clothing, electrical goods, fresh meats, fruit and vegetables. For the Children there is the Naval Museum and the Aquarium. After all the walking take a break on one of the cruise boats and admire the views of Sydney

Darling Harbor is amazing. We went out with some friends had a blast there are many restaurants to eat at the views are truly amazing all the way around I'm truly blessed to live in such a beautiful city.
Entertaining. A great place for all, bars, boat hire, movies, outdoor grassed areas and close to china town fun and more fun

Favourite place. This is one of our favourite places to take the grandchildren, visit the Zoo and Aquarium. Have a leisurely lunch, enjoy the going and coming of people. Great place for kids to enjoy.

Busy busy busy. always a buzz around Darling Harbour and a great vibe. Plenty of eating places, cheap and up market. There is the odd busker to entertain you often in the area. Lots to see. You could go on the cheap with the kids and have a wonderful afternoon or just stroll and look at the shops and ponder. Whatever you fancy there is something for everyone at Darling Harbour.
Family Fun. Darling Harbour has something for everyone. We love to walk and take it all in before we decide what to eat as there is so much variety.

Must see for visitors to Sydney. Darling Harbour is friendly, well laid out and provides varied and affordable tourist information, shopping and dining experiences. There are visiting cruise ships moored together with Sydney's famous ferries, an IMAX theatre, aquarium, restaurants and shopping areas within 1km. If your feet are tired there is a mini train to take you around. A must visit on my itinerary.
Nice atmosphere. Nice place to have a wonder. Nice food venues, some entertainers around. Awesome free water park for kids near by.

The month of love. The harbour looked great with all the lovely decorations up for Valentine's Day :) at first I was walking through wondering why there were hearts everywhere and why everything was red *blonde moment* once it clicked everything looked great!

Darling Harbour. Darling harbour is a vibrant spot. There are many outstanding dining venues. There are boat trips that will take you round the Sydney harbour . There are movie houses,gaming venues an aquarium ,wildlife centre,-,in fact everything that a visitor to Sydney could possibly want.

Jus at wonderful Sydney area to visit or stay. Darling harbour is a short walk from town hall train station.
There are lots of restaurants with plenty of night life etc.
Walk to the other side being Harbourside that again has plenty of restaurants as well ,with shopping available.
Both sides have indoor and outdoor restaurants available to enjoy this harbour view.
👍👍👍. It was so relaxing to go here you can have a peace of mind somehow take a fresh air and dont worry abour paper works for the mean time
Not so Darling. Darling harbour is for tour pickups, and naval mooring, there is a zoo of sorts, it was an uninspiring walk from town via a flyover

Go back in time or forward. Darling Harbour would have to be a place ofa wide variety of activities! lots of cafes, bars and attractions like the National Maritime museum or the Aquarium or the Wild Life Zoo and then there are the various party cruise boats... Wow!

sour faces. This was my first stop on my weekend away and it was a bit disappointing to be greeted by people who didn't seem to want to serve me or to actually work.
