The view of the harbour was breathtaking to me, however to the people who worked there, I guess it was a bore because that is how they acted. It did not inspire me to want to go back - not even a smile. The food itself also lacked personality. How disappointing.

So much to do. Something for everyone. A brilliant playground for small kids - bring a beach towel. Lots of sights, good restaurants and bars - sit with a wine, some tapas and people watch for hours.. there's always an event going on. A definite for Sydney tourists with Chinatown at one end and the casino just a walk from the other. Catch the tractor- trains if your feet get too tired.

One Stop Destination.. Darling Harbour has pretty much everything. Great restaurants, shopping, water transportation, an Imax cinema, aquarium, nightclubs, and nice walk. But, according to locals, it's a little more expensive than other areas. My girlfriend and I went on Valentines Day. They had glowing hearts all over the place. It was great for romantic photos. But, if you have only one day in Sydney, and can only visit one water destination, head to the Circular Quay (Sydney Harbour) to see the majestic Bridge and beautiful Opera House.

Full of things to do. Darling Harbor is a lovely place to spend a few hours or even a day. There are countless restaurants (off all different varieties) to eat in, all overlooking the Harbor. When we where there the tall ships where in Harbor, and you could board and have a look around. As well there were several navy ships to look at.Their are also countless attractions to take advantage of.

The Happening Area of the City. The question is not whether you'll like it or not, but what's there not to like in here.It's beautiful , it's happening, it is crowded but then MORE THE MERRIER. From food joints to fine dine, from IMAX Theatre to shopping arcades, you will be occupied to the brim. Having a choice go for your hotel booking at any of the hotels situated at darling harbor, preferably Novotel.

Darling Harbour. Sydney wouldn't be Sydney without Darling Harbour. The atmosphere was incredible and even if you just people watched you would be well entertained. The range of up market restaurants makes dining a hard choice and a few offer specials on certain days. My only gripe is I couldn't find a restaurant open for breakfast early Monday morning but George street is only a few minutes away. We dined at Darling Harbour most evenings as the food was so nice and the view spectacular.

Interesting stop for a Sydney Harbor Ferry. While visiting family in Sydney, my wife and I spent a day riding various ferries on the Sydney Harbor. We spent several hours walking around Darling Harbor window shopping, eating, and visiting the different attractions. A fulfilling way to spend the day.

What's not to like.... What's not to like? Another beautiful harbor. Another beautiful quay.Maybe I'm getting a lil jaded and used to the spectacular Sydney harbor-side areas. More great and not so great restaurants and bars. More shopping. More hotels. IMAX and maritime museum and the aquarium. Fireworks at night. Similar yet different from circular quay an easy 30 minute walk away.

Busy and bustling - but tick it off your list!. Visited DH 13 yrs ago and was surprised how much it had changed! It's a lot busier now and very built up with high rise office blocks. There seems to be a lot going on. The restaurants here are very ' themy' - burgers, pizzas, sushi, etc not really fine dining. The maritime museum was worth a look especially the chance to go in a real submarine, a warship and a replica of Capt Cooks ship too- very interesting. We spent a cloudy afternoon mooching round but 1 visit is enough unless you have kids and feel obliged to take them to The Aquariam and Mme Tussauds etc

A great place to linger over a meal. We travelled from Canada on vacation and spent about 2 weeks in Sydney. Darling Harbour, with all its restaurants is a great place to wind down the evening over dinner and drinks. Its a very quick walk from downtown. The harbour is picturesque, and the people watching is great. We were lucky enough to spend Australia Day 2015 down here, and the weather cleared long enough for an amazing fireworks display, to cap off our final evening in Australia. This is a great place to visit & build happy memories!
Beautiful setting and views. So much to do around Sydney harbour. The place is always buzzing with excitement. So many nice places to eat. The fish is so fresh and delicious.

Fun.. We met our family and thoroughly enjoyed watching out two year old granddaughter playing in the water channels. Who ever designed that should get a bonus or something. I've always loved darling harbour for kids, since it was opened in 1988, now I take my kid's kids

Nice resturants. Darling harbour has very good restaurants and I tried an Indian and Italian. They have fireworks on every Saturday night at 9:00 PM for 10mins... Make sure you there by 8:45 to get your spot to get the best view of fireworks.

Nice harbour, best viewed at night. Darling Harbour is a very nice dockland, which has many shops restaurants and attractions such as the Aquarium.
I had dinner here at night and it was beautiful, seeing the buildings lit up around me while I ate.

Don't waste your time. Don't waste your time- I thought this area was very touristy and reminded me of an icky US mall for teenagers - kids and teens would probably like it but time is probably better spent elsewhere in Sydney
Food city. Loved the different options for dining out. We had breakfast, lunch and tea in various eateries around the harbour, all very nice.
Really nice place. Really nice and interesting place to spend a day or night ,nice and leisurely with historical context.

Darling Harbour. Great resturarants eateries bars or just walk around it has something for everyone . Easy to get to by ferry or train and a short walk . Just kick back and relax and watch the day go by.

Tourist must visit. I love Darling Harbour, we always took the kids here when they were younger & I often dine here with friends & family as there are many great Restaurants to choose from .We are so lucky to have such a beautiful Harbour

Great spot....... For lunch or dinner. Plenty of restaurant/bars to choose from and a Food Court in Harbourside Shopping Mall. Easy to get around as there are tram stops nearby and also a Maritime Museum. Paddys Market nearby as is Chinatown.

Darling Harbour. It is another side of Sydney you see at Darling Harbour. Near by is a relaxing playpark where children enjoy themselves, Harbour tours start here and the Naval museum is located here. A walk about is pleasant with lots of cafés and restaurants.

Lots to do. Busy area with various attractions, Aquarium, Zoo, Imax & restaurants & bars. Nice walk round the Harbour & just a short walk from the city centre. Large shopping mall also with plenty of restaurants
great place to spend the evening. great restaurants during the evening, clubs for the adults and hips of activity for the kids during the day

another interesting place. was so impressed by darling harbour as it had changed a lot from my first visit in1986 and they had made it a family place.lovely parks and gardens near by and loved the park for the kids.water fountains
Loved it here. So much to take in as you stroll around the harbour....great 3D cinema...lots of eateries where you can people watch and try and take it all in.
Easy to get there. We took the Municipal Ferry from Circular Quay earlyin morning on a sunny day. Great photos all the way there. Inexpensive and no traffic.

Just a Must.. What a nice place.
Lovely cafe's restaurants and bars.
Street artists, boat trips, maritime museum.
China town nearby....great meals.

Maybe better at night.. This is an entertainment area with bars, restaurants and a cinema which surely comes alive at night. During the daytime there are city workers having lunch and families enjoying the well equipped play area. However, there is a lot of construction work going on and, despite the name, not much of the area is on the water. With more time at our disposal we might have gone to the maritime museum but preferred to move on to another part of the city.

Good for families. With Darling Harbour at our doorstep we were able to really explore the shops and restaurants and not worry about parking. We took our time and I found places I didn't know existed. Awesome

Restaurants, night life, fireworks, family friendly. Darling Harbour is a great place to go! Restaurants aren't overpriced, have brilliant views and free fireworks on Saturday nights - really family friendly place!

great for kids. the playground is amazing! Not often kids can spend a day having fun for free!.My girls were a little old for the playground but they went on the caurousel (price $7 for two tickets so pretty reasonable) But there isn't enough shade! it was so hot we left early! We bought 4 single scoop ice-creams and it was over $20 so a little expensive. I love the colourful displays and water features. Worthwhile but please do something about shade

Alive and hopping. We walked around Darling Harbor, Cockle Street Wharf, and King Street Wharf on our first night in Sydney. What a nice orientation to the city. It was bustling and since it was Chinese New Year and Valentine's Month the decorations were unique. Really enjoyed the area. A must see. The area has been built with the city residents in mind!

Great vibe, lots going on, kids loved it. The kids play area itself is priceless. The kids (11 &13) loved it and the waterplay area was just fantastic. As for the rest of Darling Harbour, plenty going on. Great place
Vibrance of Darling Harbour. We enjoyed walking through Darling Harbour on the way to and back from our restaurant. The lights were dazzling and the place for a Sunday night was very vibrant
Great experience. Great things to see, beside over looking the harbour you can also see shows at the Entertainment Centre. A short walk and your in China Town where you can have a great meal.

bright lights. it is a lovely place, hustle and bustle, lots of lighting, lots of restaurants, street entertainers, with the IMAX cinema as well.there are some lovely views, especially at night. i would recommend a trip there when in Sydney

Cozy area..... Darling Harbour is a very cozy area with a lot of things going on. You will find a lot of restaurants, bars, stores, mini-malls, etc.. It is a great part of the city from where you can experience nice views of the skyline, while zipping a drink.

Lots to see and do. Darling Harbour is one of those must visit places for tourists visiting Sydney. There's lots to see and do and the atmosphere is lively and exciting. Some of the bars and restaurants are a little overpriced as you might expect in such a touristy area but overall we had a lovely afternoon there.

A lot of Tourist Attractions. This area has a lot of tourist attractions from the Maritime Museum, over the Wildlife park and Madame Tussauds. Additionally there are a lot of restaurants and even a huge IMAX cinema. We also quite enjoyed the area in general as it offers some nice strolling around.

Hap Place. It is a happening place even at midnight. The food, lights, people, river, and other activities take this place at the top in Sydney. We were staying at the Casino nearby and enjoyed coming here every day for fun.

Be careful. Stayed in Sydney 1st to 5th February and spent some time at Darling Harbour. Scenic and pleasant to walk around sadly most bars are overpriced, be careful of surcharges on weekends and why keep happy hour boards out when happy hour just doesn't happen. Often food was a little above canteen standard, there are better places to eat for the same money. Not enough room for tiny trains and pedestrians.
Reccomend this!. I love Darling Harbour, there is so much to do and many places to stay. The place is full of exciting views and amazing people.

A Must Do. Great place to spend an afternoon or evening with the family. Many things to do and we always have a great time. We also loved when they had the boat show in the harbor always lively and fun!

A busy spot. It seems to all happen here. We had dinner here 3 nights in a row and enjoyed watching all the goings on. Plenty of restaurants to choose from and plenty to see and do. Fireworks on a Saturday night

Not great. It had been six years since I'd been to Darling Harbour and I didn't like the changes at all. They've built a couple of flyovers in the interim and it makes the whole place feel dark and enclosed. Where before I enjoyed some pretty water features and Chinese garden, now I walked in a darkened cramped space now given over to a children's playground. There are more expensive eating places but nothing much to see. Not worth the visit unless you're going to the aquarium (not open in the evenings)

Hasn't Changed Much. We visited exactly 12 months ago also and it looks relatively the same, still nice bars and scenery, shopping centre and maritime museum around the other side, one addition (well didbn't notice them last year) several small trains and carriages that carry people around the pathways, the go from about Madame Tussauds to the shopping centre and have a few stops along the way inckuding the Chinese Friendship Garden, the cost is $5 hop - hop off so if you do one stop and hop off then hop back on then it's another $5, never used them but handy on a hot day if your doing the full walk to museum or shopping centre.One annoying thing about Darling Harbour is the lack of shade and undercover, it rained a bit this year and nowhere undercover or very minimal and same when sun is beating down so remember hats or umbrella's, the call WA the nanny state but who cares they do shade sales and cover from the elements very well.Darling Harbour is a great place to visit several times and a nice ferry ride from Circular Quay
Darling. Cute little harbour with lots of scenic places to eat. The kids playground was awesome I highly recommend taking kids there for a plat break. The views are really nice at the harbour

My saturday night attraction. This became my saturday night attraction because of the firework. The firework was so amazing and I loved the shopping center too. I went to a couple of restaurants and they are recommendable. But just sitting on the pier and watching life was so nice.

Pleasant but nothing special. It's terrible to write these things about your home town. DH is a pleasant place to stroll, watch a movie at IMAX, visit the Maritime Museum or go to the Aquarium etc. I used to take my young kids there to the playground, have a coffee and watch the world walk by. Nowadays I am horrified by the price of everything, and pity tourists looking for a reasonably priced meal. As others have said, young people love to go there for partying. It used to be The Rocks area decades ago, which has lovely old pubs with tons of character. Times change !

Darling Harbour - while refurbishments in progress a NO NO. Darling Harbour is not the best place to visit while the refurbishments are in progress. I would suggest any intending visitor should go the the Botanical Gardens and enjoy the harbour foreshore in preference at this time.
Worth a visit. Stayed in this area for two days. Easy going area with restaurants galore and good access to ferries. Saturday night was heaving with youngsters and eateries were noisey.
Don't bother. This place has never really got a "soul".it all seems quite tacky and " fake" to me.If you are a tourist there are so much better places to go/ experiences to have.
Somewhat touristy, okay otherwise. Nice area, but too many souvenir shops and tourists; spoils the feel for me. Still, a good place for a stroll and a bit of people watching.

Wonderful!. Lively, crowded "boardwalk," with endless variety of restaurants, many attractions--aquarium, Madame Tussaud's, Wildlife Sydney (a small zoo with only Australian fauna) naval museum and great seats for Vivid Sydney, an Australian winter light show.

Bustling. A busy harbour, full of shops, eating places , boats and even a zoo. An interesting walk around the harbour, boats coming in and out all the time, the usual tourist shops. Cross the river and you arrive at the maritime museum. Darling Harbour, a place with plenty to do.

A bit commercial/touristy!. There are multiple reasons for visiting the harbour area, inc. restaurants, Madame Tussaudes, the IMAX and the waterfront.The area is sometimes difficult to navigate and find what you are looking for
Great. Wonderful walk round harbor loads of attractions plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by either with a coffee or glass of wine great place to chill out
Everything in one place.. Loads of excellent restaurants, places to visit like the Sydney aquarium and fun things for young and old alike.
Seafaring history. A most interesting day here. The Maritime museum sets the scene for exploring the history of early settlers. On the harbour a tour of Endeavour completed a most educated day.

Restaurants galore. Hard to please if you don't find a Restaurant to your liking. A large Mall with heaps of Shops undercover. Maritime Museum worth a look. Casino 5 minutes walk away. Great views and the City Centre 5 mins away too.

Lots of action, great for kids too!. I was pleasantly surprised by the broad demographic to which this area caters - there's an adorable playground and carousel for children, fireworks and cool lighting effects, lots of restaurants to choose from... Fun place to hang out for an evening.

Great family entertainment area!. We walked along the Darling Harbor area and while we didn't do some of the individual entertainment venues, it is a great family area but also has lots of restaurants and nightlife as well. We did an evening harbor cruise and Darling Harbor was vibrant and rocking!
Wonderful vibrant place. The harbour comes alive both during the day and the evening. Wonderful place just to stroll around but too many restaurants to choose from. over 60 I believe.
Awesome. I haven't been since the renovations but I am keen to see what its like. Its always nice for a walk or just to chill on Darling harbour.

Fire Works and Dining. Beautiful place. Good atmosphere. Great shopping arcade. excellent fireworks. Great eating joints. One can enjoy the fireworks standing on the Pyrmont Bridge, a swing bridge or sitting in one of the restaurants in harbour side restaurants. Some of the restaurants have baloneys from where you can enjoy the harbor view and fireworks. It is advisable to book your table in advance.

Still exciting. Yes its still a great and entertaining place to fill a day in, even though it is having a massive face lift, but in the future it will be even better.. just wish that the majority of the shops weren't souvenior shops, not everyone is looking for that type of thing
Great Atmosphere . The views by day and night are beautiful. The at night the pubs and clubs come alive. They are investing in the area and it continues to expand. A great visit.

Enjoy the beautiful weather!. Darling Harbour reminded me a lot of the harbor in Baltimore (Maryland, USA). It's a lovely walk around, with lots of restaurants to sit and enjoy a bite and a lovely view. You can pick up ferries to just about anywhere from here.

Great place to go and spend a couple of hours. Darling Harbour is a great place to go and spend a couple of hours. There is a vast number of shopping options as well as a range of food outlets ranging from simple takeaway, coffee outlets, dessert offerings to high end 5 star restaurants. There are multiple options for public transport including light rail, taxi, bus and harbour ferry. Parking is a little pricey during the day as is usual in Sydney. A favourite of our family.
Best Place in Sydney. Best place to hangout. In the evening this place is the best for dining with family. You can pass all night here just sitting facing the sea. It's awsome just love it.

Beautiful Darling Harbour. One of my most fav places in the world. The restuarants and bars are very good plenty to eat and see. Wonderful seafood. And the street artist are fantastic. Can't wait to go again. The steak house on the corner was superb

Great fun.. tThere is plenty to see and do at Darling Harbour. There are regular ferries which for a small price take you around the harbour and under the bridge,passing the Opera House. There are an abundance of eateries. We had breakfast here most mornings. There is access to The Maritime Museum,the Sealife centre, IMAX ,and many more. Some days the walkways throng with passengers from the visiting cruise ships. However there is always a lively atmosphere and welcoming air.Plenty to see and do!
Great ambience. Had lunch and dinner at different restaurants, watching the people, the boats, the views.....always something to get your attention. Walked around area and over the Bridge.
Touristy. Crowded and touristy, but lot's to do. Good place to go with kids. Lot's of restaurants, aquarium, museums, wildlife zoo, imax.

Plenty going on.. Lots to see in Darling harbour including the Sealife Centre. There is a regular ferry up river as well as one around to Sydney harbour which takes you under the famous bridge. There are a number of restaurants although breakfast was hard to find.

Favourite place in Sydney. Darling Harbour makes you feel alive....there's so much going on and no two visits are ever the same. Amazing restaurants and good shopping and then the adhoc street performers that you come across are always an added bonus.
Vibrant. Of course this is one of the key area of Sydney but justifiable so. It is alive with restaurants, bars etc. Great in the day and fantastic at night
scenic. went to darling harbour in the evening as heard that is the best time to go, restaurants were great and lovely to sit out and have a drink with great view of the city.

Great day out. Great place to either chill out or dine. Everything from McDonalds to fine dining!
You can sit in a bar & watch the world go by while enjoying the sun shining on the harbour!
Caters for everyone.
If you have a family there is a wonderful playground.

Most Relaxing in Sydney. We became localised because very often we have visited this place because of its spectacular view surrounded by all tall buiding including sydney tower. More option for dining, wax museum etc. Night at Darling Harbour was speechless. Crinitis was my favourite for pizza and first fime we had tested pizza with eggplant.

perfect scene day and night. Beautiful place to sit and people watch, drinking cocktails and having dinner with a perfect view of the harbour.
Quite expensive in comparison to other areas but obviously this is due to it being so touristy.

Pulsing with Activity. Darling Harbour is primarily a tourist location similar to San Francisco's Pier 39 and loads of fun. There are many tourist attractions and great restaurants with views of the harbor.
Go there. Eating options are endless.People watching fascinating. Buskers and street theatre performers are very entertaining. A safe environment to be in late at night.
Part of our 3 week Honeymoon in Australia. Loads to see and do very clean and well maintained very good. Went here on a boat trip back to the city would visit again and explore more not enough time.

So Much in So Much to See. The restaurants and bars surrounding darling Harbour along with all the boats and other attractions makes for a fantastic setting. One downside we were late going out one night and the kitchens in the bars and restaurants close t 2200 hrs. We know now and visited earlier the next twice. Take time to walk around day and night relax and watch the world go by
Very active area. Loads to do around here...The Star casino and entertainment centre...Imax cinema...Aquarium and loads of shopping and cafes..around the harbour.got to be visited
Awesome Place to Visit. We love staying in Darling Harbour when we visit Sydney. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance with Hard Rock Cafe right on your door.

The best area.. Darling Harbour is an amazing place and a must see if your in Sydney. Great location, heaps of restaurants, good night life and a couple of bars/clubs nearby. Definitely worth a visit, sometimes you get to watch yatch and boat shows. A great restaurant to visit is Hurricanes, which are known for the ribs.

Weekend at Darling Harbour. Spent Australia Day weekend there. Lots to do and places to eat we virtually didn't leave the area. Bought a Sydney attraction pass there are several to choose from online we did the 5 attraction including Madame Tussaud's and Aquarium, it also included Sydney tower which is only a short walk away. Lots of great restaurants with excellent early dinner menus.

Loved it!. We went at Dusk on a very warm evening and the atmosphere was fantastic, there are so many places to choose to eat from cheap to expensive or some takeaway and sit on the steps would be perfect too. really want to go back and sit on the Harbour in a boat and take it all in from the water.

full of activities... There is a bridge...which connects north n south part.. while doing down from the bridge there are few attractions like madam tussades, aquarium, wild life park..which is full of fun.. I did not like madam tussades..as not much of Indian..people statues in that..aquarium is full of funs.. and it was so nice to be inside..further u can walk along the coast..and enjoy light breeze coming..some shops for sovenier and also few shops to enjoy bar n snacks..overall good place to spend time with family...or friends..
Get the ferry!. The ferry ride from Darling Harbour to circular quay was awesome!Darling Harbour itself not that interesting for me.

Great Atmosphere!. Had a great time at Darling Harbour during our visit in January, full of people all enjoying themselves, and to top it off the fireworks were great. A great place to spend the evening.

Summer Festival Place to Be. We were so fortunate to be staying close to Darling Harbour during Summer Festival in January. There were activities everywhere. A fabulous Children's park - we are seniors but still enjoyed watching all the kids play in the water park. The restaurants are great - outdoor seating, good beer! If in Sydney, be sure to get to Darling Harbour.

Good space to relax in after sightseeing. Our hotel was a 5-10minute walk from here and our windows looked down onto this area. We used it quite a bit as a place to let the kids unwind after a day sightseeing. They had open space, could run around, get an ice cream. They loved the adventure playground with its sand and water activities as well ask slides, climbing frames and flying fox.

Good atmosphere. We were pretty skeptical before we visited Darling Harbour as we'd heard it was 'artificial' and a little tacky, but we were pleasantly surprised to be honest. Sure, it's a purpose-built tourist trap, but it does what it says on the tin. There's a great selection of restaurants around the harbour with a huge choice that will cater to all tastes and budgets.
Great Food. We had a meal at Nicks Bar and Grill at Darling Harbour. Service was great and the food was superb. Open air eatery so had a great atmosphere - worth trying.
Overpriced food. Waterfront restaurants and bars cashing in on location are a let down with overpriced pedestrian fare and tired décor. Move on from the 80's Darling Harbour.

Darling attractions. I will totally agree to all the reviews, this place is lovely and centrally located to most of the attractions in Sydney namely sealife, wild life and madame tussauds,chinatown,sydney fish market,QVB and ferry terminal.Was so convenient to walk to all this places. Every Saturday night there is a display of fireworks in the harbour and is worth watching.Ferries can be taken from wharf No 3 and also from opposite the sealife.It is a must that you view the opera house and harbour bridge not only by land but also from the sea.The view is scenic and magnificient but catch it between sunset and night so you get to see both views.You can take the boat from darling harbour and return back with the same ferry.What is more the ferry comes with free wifi.Buy the tickets to the attraction on line and combo packages which is much cheaper.
Loads of things to do. There are lots of things to do around Darling harbour and there are lots of restaurants; hotels etc nearby.

PLACE TO VISIT. Absolutly can't miss that place. Place is full of different attractions- shops, restaurants, museams. I was very surprised to see there big park for children. By the way Imax Theatre is just in the center of Darling Harbour.
Must see in Sydney. When in Sydney of course you are visiting Darling Harbour.A maritime museum, an aquarium, lots of restaurants and shops, an IMAX cinema, Darling Harbour has it all.

Trial and error. We had the impression that here at Darling harbour there's still a trial and error finding process ongoing.On the one hand there was a really tremendous playground for children with watergames - on the other the lady at tourist information was so stressed and of little help (arrrggggglll another tourist help me get rid of that)... lots of working areas, not so many people and yet restaurants being picky enough not to accept everyone... well if you can afford it.We stayed close by the place so it was ok for a nocturnal walk before sleep - the shopping center however was rather turn off than compelling...

Central Area. Great area to stay in. Central for virtually everything. There are some great restaurants and bars.
One side of the area is being developed with loads of building work. When it's finishe it will be superb. Can't wait to come back to see it
Beautiful;. Lovely area to visit with shops restaurants and museums such as the Aquarium. We stopped here as one of the stops on the Open top bus tour

Darling harbour. I stayed in a hitel very near Darling Harbour It was very enjoyable to walk round many places to eat and drink Very convenient for picking up ferries to many places and the stop fior the Hop on
hop bus very close by
Lots of activity for all afes

Always Pulsating..... Sydney’s great celebration spread-out. A lively harbour side precinct. One of the must visit when in Sydney. It offers largest dining, shopping and entertainment space. Wax museum, Aquarium, Carousel ride, catching a flying Fox, Rolling a casino dice are few of the places to name to enjoy.Harbour is like a beautiful playground during festivals and events. The energy and vibrance you get to see here on Ausi day is unbeatable.

Great place with something for everyone. Darling Harbour is a great place - part of Sydney Harbour near the CBD - with many options to keep you entertained. Not only are there plenty of cafes and restaurants to enjoy for food and drink, there is also plenty in the way of entertainment including cinemas, museums, cruises, the Chinese Garden of Friendship (recommended!) and loads more.One tip - if you're there on a Saturday then make sure you catch the free fireworks display in the evening, it's a good show.Highly recommended as an entertainments venue.
Brilliant place. So busy but still so relaxing.Plenty to do and look at and some excellent restaurants - Hurricanes is a must.One of my all time favourites is Darling Harbour

Great place to visit. Darling Harbour is an amazing transformation of an industrial area into a lovely waterfront promenade. We found one good restaurant but the best are a couple of blocks back in the Pyrmont area.

Not handicapped friendly. It is not handicapped friendly if you approach it form the train station and walk over the bridge down. No elevators and the escalators were broken the first two weeks in January. It was miserable trying to get my elderly parents down the steps to get to the zoo, wax museum, and aquarium. Once on the level of the shops, museums, and restaurants, you could spend all day at Darling Harbor. It is serviced really only by the water ferries. As stated earlier, if you come by train, you have to walk a short distance downhill, but it takes you to up high and the only way to get to the museums, shops, and restaurants is to take stairs down. On the Hard Rock Café side, there is a small trolley that takes you to the central train terminal, but the trolley comes every 30 minutes, crowded, and to get to that side is 20 minute walk up steps. It was not handicap friendly unless you arrive via water ferry and that is walk to the shops and restaurants.

It's nice, but there are nicer places to go with better views in Sydney.. Darling harbour is full of restaurants, shopping and places to hang out. There is also the chinese garden within walking distance of the darling harbour. It's a cool place to hang out and dine with friends, but I wouldn't do it as a tourist thing. As there are plenty of better places to go in Sydney that have far better views. The entertainment centre and the casino are within the precinct though, so if you're into that sort of thing do go here. Otherwise, enjoy your walk through this concrete metropolis with a bit of harbour.

Great place. Loved walking around here at night, fireworks 9pm on Saturday was amazing ! Very good quality and free ! Lots of street performs, altough the one we watched wasn't that good at juggling fire.

Splendid evening. A must see place in the heart of the Sydney CBD. Teaming with activity for all ages. Lots of things to see and do or just walk around and absorbing the beauty. Lots of restaurants for all palates. Great place for families. Beautiful at night.

beautiful place, relaxing and peaceful. I had a fantastic stay at Sydney. A walk to Darling Harbour was a relaxing way to spend the day. Many attractions to see and do. I enjoyed some lovely cocktails at a bar there one evening. I can't remember what the place was called...but I went to many places! there was also some nice places to eat... The only thing I wish I did was buy an ice cream from the ice cream man. They looked so tasty and I wish I went on one of those diner cruises but frankly thats not much fun on your own! but theres always next time!

Fabulous. From Cockle Bay round to Wharf 5 Darling Harbour is a must visit if you are visiting Sydney. With great views, a park area, water features, a Zoo, Waxworks and Aquarium along with all the water borne traffic there's plenty to see and do and if that doesn't suit then there are the numerous eateries and drinking establishments to choose from. There are also the street performers to entertain throughout the hustle and bustle of the harbour. Plenty to see plenty to do; don't miss it.
Great spot. A very busy area and full of atmosphere. Great to wander around and look at all the sights or just sit and watch the boats.

Wonderful spot in the CBD in Sydney. Darling Harbour has a very special atmosphere. It's hard to describe, there is so much space, it's green, modern and no matter where you look, you are greeted with such a great view of the city. There are Restaurants, Cafe's, the Aquarium, a movie theatre and in the evening the lights of the city go on over the water and people are walking around enjoying the stroll, the air, the atmosphere... magical.

place must be visited. wide and beatifully planned harbour spread over considerable area.so many restaurants where you get all sorts of food varieties of fresh food of world,madame tusade museum replia.even whole day spend is less.close view of harbour bridge and many more

darling harbour sydney australia. 31st december 2014 well come to new year by grand fire works an unforgetable,unique and only one of its kind in the world can not be missed.splendid ans superb show gives immense pleasure to watch.one of the major attraction on Australia visit

Bustling. As we only had a short stopover in Sydney and were staying in the Park Royal Hotel Darling Harbour was ideal as a location for dining out and entertainment. New Years Eve Fire works in the harbour were the icing on the cake. Area though lively and full of people never felt intimidating as it was a mix of families,couples and singles.
Nice place. This is about a 20 min ferry ride from Circular Quay. It's worth the trip plenty of places to eat and things to do.
Bit of a tourist trap....... All a bit light weight with just the normal day out target audience. Could be appealing to families, but frankly doesn't float my boat

Entertaining. We visited darling harbour for shopping and lunch. The shops were ok not a huge variety and your typical food court. The entertainment outside was great and fun to watch, however it's always annoying to be pressured to give money. You almost feel like you don't want to watch because of the harassment at the end. Fireworks were an added bonus!

Getting an overdue facelift. One of the tourist centres of Sydney, with loads of bars resturants and chops, sometimes a bit touristy, but worth a visitUndergoing a major renovation, so hopefully will be become even better in the future
Always something happening in January. Lots to do all the time around this area but choose your eating place carefully - we have experienced a few bad ones.

A real Sydney gem. So much to do here. Harborside mall is enormous and boasts many shops and restaurants to eat at, with stunning views. Take a walk along the harborside to see museums, attractions and currently have a giant water swing which is interesting to see. Favorite place to hang out so far.

Warm Summer Delight. Darling Harbour was busy and "alive"on Saturday night. It was a good atmosphere and a busy warm summer night. The Harbour fireworks were an unexpected pleasure. It was a lovely night, with a safe, friendly feel!

DO NOT PARK HERE. We went to darling harbour for a day out! Speedboating was absolutely incredible- great views and lots of fun, wish it when even faster!! Then saw an imax movie which was the largest imax theatre in the world! Comfy seats, great picture! Went for lunch to hard rock. Nice restaurant although steak was fatty so sent it back and gave a free new one plus an on the house wine- that was an unexpected surprise!! Then we were all on a high after 4-5 hours of fun and darling harbour- then got shocked by the 58 AUSTRALIAN DOLLAR BILL!!!!!! DO NOT EVER PARK HERE CATCH THE LIGHT RAIL OR EVEN TAXI!!!!!! ONLY PARK HERE IF YOU WANT TO BREAK YOUR BANK!!!!
Nice Walk.... Plenty to see and eat at Darling Harbour. Take a ferry or a tram or a bus. Sixty or so restaurants with Sealife, Wildlife and many other attractions.

Awesome and Vibrant!. My fiance and I went here on several occasions during our stay for lunch and dinner! It is vibrant, lively and full of people (young and old) Only if we found it earlier in our trip, we would have gone more often. They hold an excellent firework show every Saturday night from 9pm which is worth watching. We had dinner at a lovely harbour view restaurant for our anniversary. The food, atmosphere and fireworks made it all the more special.
lots to see. Loads of things around the harbour. Many eateries, lots to look at. A great place to wander around. Wasnt overly busy to hinder walking around.

Something for everyone. This is a beautiful location with easy access to everything. From the Imax Theatre to the Sydney Aquarium, the Lyric Theatre or the Chinese Gardens, there is something for everyone. Easy to catch a ferry to Circular Quay and The Rocks. Plenty of shopping and fantastic places to eat while enjoying the lovely views, especially early evening as the sun begins to go down - the reflections on the water and the changing colours on the backdrop of buildings is stunning.

Darling Harbour. The in place to be, always busy, plenty of bars and restaurants.
Sealife Aquarium and Wildlife Adventure along with Madam Tussaud's to be found here.
James Craig Tall Ship and The Australian Maritime Museum all very interesting places to

Great place to relax and enjoy the surroundings. Me and my husband stayed at a hotel within walking distance of Darling Harbour whilst on our honeymoon. We went for breakfast at a couple of different places around the harbour costing between 25-50 AUD depending where you go. Very relaxing harbour and not too far from other attractions.

New Years Eve. It is easy to book a table at any of the restaurants at Darling Harbour. Some have packages for the night, for others it is business as usual (sort of). You can really only see the 9pm fireworks here but it is really good if you don't want the crowd crush of Circular Quay or you are there with kids.

Nice surroundings. Personally I preferred Darling Harbor over the Sydney Harbor. Easy to reach the Sydney harbor too by catching the ferry. Lots of yatches you can hire from here for day trips. You can get into the Naval Meuseum and see the ships. We went when there on Australia day and the celebrations were going on and so we got free entry tickets to the meuseum. The Sydney aquarium and other attractions are nearby so you can spend a full day here and yet not cover all the attractions.Best to be here early in the morning to avoid the rush. We went there around 2 and it was very crowded.

Great place. This is a beautiful location with everything located closely - from the Imax theatre to the Sydney Aquarium. Easy to catch a ferry to Circular Quay or organise a cruise. Fantastic shopping centre and the Monorail also stops there.

Makes me miss Sydney. As an ex Sydney girl I always head down to Darling Harbour whenever I'm in town. Breaky by the water is always lovely and you really are spoilt for choice here. It's also got a great nighttime vibe and it makes me miss Sydney a little more each time I leaveIt can get crowded on weekends, especially during the day on long weekends and holidays but there's always so much going on its worth the effort!

Heaving with people. I found Darling Harbour a great place to be - just sitting people watching, eating and drinking. So many families meeting up doing their thing. Street entertainment. Always something to do, listen to, watch. Great visits
Lots to do and see. Fantastic location worth several visits. Loads of places to eat, drink and just look at. Regular ferry to Harbour, tram nearby
Great place to visit. Very busy lively place some great restaurants and bars, some lovely views and spectacular at night, street entertainment every night we have been there. Worth a visit deffo

Great city. My family and I visited Sydney over NYE and particularly enjoyed walking round Darling Harbour,There's a great wet play area for kids and lots of nice restaurants and cafés to choose from.

Not really my kind of place. I find this a bit touristy. Lots of cafes, shops, and people! Near china town. In a pretty spot, the water and boats are nice to look at and there is an aquarium, but not really to my liking.
Fabulous vibe. Darling harbour is a buzzing place to be at any time of the day. Filled with loads of lovely restaurants, shops, things to do and see.

Relax and Eat. The harbour is lovely and relaxing. I was lucky enough to experience the fireworks for Australia day at the harbour which were amazing.There are loads of restaurants around the harbour, from which I tried 2. A lebanese and Indian as they were both halal. The food was delicious in both restaurant and was priced the same as what you would pay in the central London in the UK (About £10-£15 for mains).There are also Greek, Italian and continental restaurants situated around the harbour. Walk around and take your pick.

Has everything you need and more!. A fantastic place in Sydney - still in the city, yet like a city in itself! It has popular attractions, great shopping places and some fantastic cafes! Imax is super close and so are some cute playgrounds! A short walk to Paddy's Market and to the city - there's even the Light Rail which runs straight through it to make transport super easy! The absolutely perfect place to stay!

Not for the shopping. If you want to go shopping head for the Pitt Street Mall or the Queen Victoria Building. If on the other hand you want to check out one of the places that makes Sydney one of the worlds greatest harbour cities it is well worth a visit. Opposite at King Street Wharf you will also find some of the best restaurants in a city that is packed with very good ones. Darling Harbour to King Street Wharf is a fantastic harbourside stroll on sunny day - it does not get much better.

Place to visit. What a fab harbour, so much to see and do, it as something for every one of all ages, the bars are brilliant and inexpensive, great to go and have your breakfast as their are so many good places to eat, a must visit!!

People watching. It is a wonderful place to visit. Watching people sat in the sun. Seeing children playing, enjoying the view. Heaven. The shops are wonderful, and the staff so helpful. A magical experience to savour in the sun.

nice afternoon. This District of Sydney is a nice place with several attractions: the National Maritime Museum, the world's largest IMAX-screen, Madame Tussaud's museum, aquarium, zoo, childrens playgrounds and plenty of bars-restaurants along. Worth to spend a half day or even a day there.

Great place for everything!. Food, stroll, explore...close to everything and your palate will salivate for all things Aussie! Eclectic, fusion, steaks, fish and chips...eggs Benedict!!! Wonderful views of this great city!!

Plenty of Stuff. I have visited the Darling Harbour every time I came to Sydney. The place is fully of shops, bars, restaurants with lots of things to do. Maritime museum, Sydney Aquarium, some amusement rides, hotels are around. Entertainment Centre for concert and China Town are just nearby. A lovely beautiful place in Sydney.

Nice views and lots of stuff happening. The view of the city is really nice from the western side of Darling Harbour. There's a lot of restaurants around, and generally there's a lot of stuff happening around there: regular fireworks on Saturdays, different festivals and seasonal attractions. Most of them tend to be somewhat cheesy and touristy, but all in all worth spending some time there.

Great Place to Spend a Day or Two. The Darling Harbour has so much to offer! There are many great eateries. I recommend eating at Pancakes on the Rocks. This joint was great. The Harbour also provides access to the marine museum, aquarium, zoo, and wax museum. I also recommend taking the train tour around Darling Harbour.

Lots to do. So much to see and do in this area. Lots of restaurants and bars, hotels, and tons of shopping. There is a great area for kids with a water park, playground, and a few amusement rides. Some great museums in the area. Walking distance to Sydney Harbour to view the Opera House and bridge. Also catch the ferries here to see more of Sydney.

Food food food .... and drink. Darling Harbour buzzes. It has all the attractions that tourists love...but go just beyond and venture into the Sydney Fish Market. The atmosphere is great, and the prices are amazing. The only thing better is the quality of the fish.....superb.

Romantic stroll. Nice walk along darling harbour ...plenty to see & enjoy .i liked the openness of the place to walk hand in hand and enjoy the atmosphere ...very romantic ....dislike that i couldn't find a coffee shop open late ...

Some good attractions. The merit of Darling harbour is the variety sites packed in easy walking distance - the maritime museum, wildlife world, aquarium, wax museum, chinese gardens. Shops and eateries too - but I found it hard to get excited about these. Transport is a bit trickier now the monorail has been removed. The light rail works well on the Western side of Darling Harbour, but only provides transport on the North-South axis, but if you are going to or from the CBD be prepared for a hike.

Darling Harbour is full of Life. We visited the Darling Harbour and found it to be fun interesting and beautiful. So much to see and the people themselves vey cosmopolitan. We didn't want to spend to much money so we bought something nice from Woolworths and sat down and enjoyed ourselves. We could ahve stayed at least another day just so much to see.

Have A Mini-vacation Here. We got off at the Museum Station and walk towards the Darling Harbour along Liverpool Street. This way we could visit the Chinese Garden of Friendship, the Tumbalong Park (great place for kids), the Cockle Bay Wharf, the Sydney Aquarium & Wild Life, the Madam Tussauds Sydney, then cross the Pyrmont Bridge to reach the National Maritime Museum on the otherside of the harbour. But you will need to spend the whole day here if you want to visit all the attractions. Be there at the Sydney Aquarium just before 10am if you want to avoid the long queue.

Interetsing place to wander around. We had a wander here on a sunny afternoon. The swings with the showers above them were operating and that was fun to watch. The kids would love it on a hot day. We had a happy hour drink at Cyren's and that was great, too. Good place for a bit of people watching!
Vibrant. Much more busy than Circular Quay.Plenty to see, the wax works, shops, boat rides, eating places a plenty, a lovely modern art fountain.Nice change.

Quite busy, but lots to see and do.. You could spend most of the day just wandering around this harbour. There is a large shopping centre on one side and dozens of eateries to choose from on the other. Cross the bridge and it becomes a full circuit. Always something to see

NYE Fireworks at Darling Harbour. After the year before getting squashed trying to get a view point for the Sydney fireworks we decided to stay home and have a party and enjoy the fireworks at darling harbor from our balcony, they were amazing, a lot better than i thought they would be compared to the Saturday show every week. for anyone with a large family or dont want the crazy hassle or th main attraction at the bridge, Darling harbour is a great substitute
The night life. Is the place where you have to go if you want to spend the whole night without sleeping, but there are too many drunk people.
Nice place to walk around. Nice fireworks display on Saturday night.. Had many things to do there.. Caught a movie.. Had Kebab.. Visited the Sea Life Aquarium.. Nice vibes

Great place to stay. Staying in Darling Harbour was the best decision we made on our trip to Sydney, there is so much to see and do and it is close enough to everything whether you choose to walk or catch a ferry. With all of the attractions at Darling Harbour there was so much to see and do (and eat!). We stayed over Christmas and New Years Eve and the view of the Harbour was absolutely fantastic. We didn't even have to leave our Hotel to watch the fireworks as Darling Harbour had a great line-up of fireworks, laser light shows from 8 pm to midnight.

Lots to do for everyone. Enjoyed our amble around. Caters for couples and families. Entertainment - street and organised. Lot of places for refreshments. Catch a ferry to and/or from. A bit "touristy". Sit at a bar and watch the people. Stroll around and watch the people. A bit busy at high season.

One of the most beautiful harbour in the world. You can have the best view of Sydney there. You can also take ferries from the harbour to different part of the city. When you're bored, you can also stop and watch all the different street performances there. Great spot for tourists to visit.

Great spot. If you are in Sydney, do take a day to explore. They have so much to do, singles, couples or families. There is a great aquarium, loads of places to eat and drink, suitable for all budgets. A cinema, shops, easy enough to walk from here to all sorts of other spots. Cruises, ferries and so forth all easy. So, coffee, lunch, drinks, day time, night time, it is all right around this area any time of year I would say. excellent spot, give it a try
great family walk. A great walk with different activities for children and easy to push prams. Lots of different cafes and places to eat. Nice boats in the harbour

Must see. Excellent location, lots of shops bars and restaurants. Every sat night, and special occasions, there is a fireworks display in harbour, very popular. Chinatown is literally 2 mins away, and Paddys market is nearby for all your bargains.

Darling harbour or Sydney harbour?. Sydney harbour has its two icons, but take a twenty minute walk or the free bus and head to Darling harbour. It has something for everyone, it suits all pockets from the higher price top quality restaurants to the more affordable one. The Helm is a really vibrant bar / restaurant which has specialist nights all week, we ate on a Tuesday and paid $10 for a steak meal which was cooked to our exact request. Steer clear of Nicks bar if you want just a drink from the bar some of the staff are not very helpful. For breakfasts and other food try the Plate great poached eggs (ask for Katrina) she will make you feel at home. For something different try one of the Captain Cooks dining evenings, great food at a reasonable price, also check for vouchers which you can also get upto 15% off. The hop on off ferries are good value but although it is a 24 hour pass you will need to be on an early one to get best value. Overall 9/10 will definitely return.

Plenty to see and do. This should be on everyone's agenda when in Sydney (just like The Rocks). Lots of good food, great views and various forms of entertainment. Give yourself at least a full day if not more and if you can stay in the area.

Favourite place in Sydney. This is one of my favourite places in Sydney. I was here a few times during my trip and the atmosphere never disappoint me. A lively outdoor place where you can laid-back, enjoy the weather/sea view, watching the flow of people and dine in one of the restaurants. I could literally spend a day here without getting bored. It is also within walking distance to Chinatown and George Street. If you want to travel to Circular Quay from here, you can just take the ferry which is another highlight.

One of my favourite places in the World. Does not matter if your passion is shopping or relaxing by the water with a drink in your hand you are definitely going to let be this place.My Sydney visit is never complete unless I visit Darling Harbour.I visited this place numerous times but still I love to visit DH more.Highly recommended.

Great Tourist Attraction. We stayed and visited Darling Harbour over Xmas New Year 2014/15. It as the busiest place in Sydney and thank goodness for the restaurants down here, as most of the Sydney CBD was closed! Lots of harbour boat trips to choose from, a public ferry comes in here and the jet boats operate from here too. Kids love the Aquarium and other wildlife attractions. Restaurants were extremely busy though, so for couples wanting a quiet night out you can pretty much forget that down a the waterfront level. There are a few restaurants on Lime St which have a 2nd level which is quieter. Enjoy!

Watery heaven. Great place to enjoy a beer, a meal or simply to shop to you drop. Lots to see and do without too much hassle. The National Maritime Museum is well worth a visit (fee for entry required) and something for the entire family. Always on my list of places to visit when in Sydney.

The amazing Darling Harbour. If you are visiting Sydney you should base yourself in Darling Harbour, it has everything so much so it's hard to get out of it. Darling Harbour offers everything you would want , interesting shopping , great eateries and nightlife, whether you are old or young Darling Harbour has something for yoy

Just love Darling Harbour. We never tire of Darling Harbour, its flashy and fantastic, lots of fun to just people watch while relaxing in one of the many waterfront restaurants. Suitable for every age and I love watching the families from all over the world enjoying one of our amazing city's. We were there for the Saturday night fireworks and it was a fantastic show, free for everyone.

Great place. fireworks on Saturday evenings we pitched up in a restaurant ordered our meal drinks and watched a very colourful display. Sadly we weren't there over a weekend this time but still a great place to visit also the hop on hop off boats take you round to Sydney harbour manly and watsons bay which made a delightful day out

Tourist trap. Darling Harbour is for tourists, and not really the real Sydney.There is a lot of nearby construction and it is very close to good restaurants across the water at Cockle Bay, which I would recommend instead.Darling Harbour is a bit dated from what it was in the early 90's, but has the Hard Rock Cafe which struggles with customer service standards wen compared to other Hard Rock around the world.Nice central location to stay, close to the Star casino and restaurants but overtly targeting tourists with cheap and nasty souvenir shops selling at high end prices.Would recommend crossing the water to visit Cockle bay, heading to Haymarket for souvenirs at a reasonable price. The one good thing is the children park!

Love Sydney. Love going home to Sydney I've lived away from Sydney for years and this is the first time I got to be a proper tourist information the city not just a day visitor love darling harbour so much to do there great place to start with when in town

Tourist hub but too touristy. Interesting location for tourists- but is very much a 'tourist price and tourist service' location. Better restaurants elsewhere at better value. Shopping is tourist orientated- not for locals. Scenic location right in the heart of things and close to CBD. A bit old and tired now,

Generic and Crowded. Granted we visited during the busiest season of he year, so the crowds may be seasonal, but the whole area is very generic! Weather you are in Southern California or in Genoa, Italy, there are contemporary harbour areas like this all around the globe. There is nothing outstanding or typical Sydney about this place! The coffee shops, restaurants and attractions are equally generic and way overpriced. There are much more and unique neighbourhoods in Sydney, so if pressed for time, give this one a miss!
Worth visiting. There is always something to do at Darling Harbour. Although there are shops, there are often free events on and just walking around is an experience in itself.

Awesome atmosphere, eateries and views. All was good here. Spent a few nights pub and restaurant hopping, taking in the atmosphere. The views are also great. Most places have happy hours between 3-6pm but be careful to ask for these happy hour menus.

Awesome!. We thought nothing could beat the Sydney Harbour waterfront at Circular Quay until we stumbled upon the Darling Harbour, which offered many restaurants & attractions in the heart of Sydney! Wonderful spot!
great harbor nice view. We had ourselves a good time while we were here and you would too! Give it a go while you are in town!

Always a lovely lively spot to visit. We had the added bonus of watching the pedestrian bridge open to let a yacht through. It swings open. Fascinating. Walked right around the harbour and was astounded at the extent of new developments. Most great. However the under construction bangarra has to be part of the local bribery industry. Disgusting and tasteless. Another casino- australia has a huge gambling problem??!!!!Worth a visit. Spoilt for choice of restaurants.

Trendy place. Very tourist Sidney's area, very well refurbished, with pier walks, trendy restaurants, parks, museums, a future casino,etc.... Our hotel (Four points by Sheraton) is very near and we recommend it. Te harbour cruises (big or small) most of all began a and finish there. There is also a ferry stop. And is 10 minute walk to the city center.
undergoing refurbishment. Not very charming at the moment because of the construction of the new exhibition centre. however it's still a nice relaxed space to visit on weekends.

Lots of nice restaurants but crowded. We visited here in December 2014 during our family holiday to Sydney. There are a huge amount of restaurants to choose from here and also a lot of bars, however when we visited it was very crowded and there was an enormous amount of construction going on here. It will be interesting to see what it looks like when they are finished as there are literally cranes in the sky everywhere!

Great place with lots of restaurants to choose from. For those who are fond to eat, he/she should not miss this place which have lots of restaurants on the seaside of Darling Harbour. It is also great to have a relax walk there in the evening or at night.

Harbourside.. Love it here, has something for everyone. We had drinks in a bar and just looked out over the water. Then dinner in one of the many restaurants available, the choice is endless, something to please anyone. We did some shopping there and I found an amazing little dress shop tucked away in a corner, which I will revisit every time I come to Sydney. You could have many pleasant hours enjoying your-self at Darling Harbour.
Nice walk. Nice walk around you shopping centers and restaurants, cafes, pkayground for kids.. and it's near to Sydney Fish market and few miles away from Harbour Bridge. Worth the visit

Nicely planned tourist venue. In Chicago we have Navy Pier, and this is very similar. This is a modern tourist and entertainment venue that will work really well with the new 43,000 sq meter convention center when it opens. Tons of restaurants, an eight story tall IMAX theater, shopping, the attraction of the water, maritime museum, proximity to Chinatown, the awesome Chinese garden, the Powerhouse museum, auditorium and easy access to/from downtown. If I lived here, I might not ever go here unless I worked downtown, then I would do lunch and entertain customers here. As a tourist, it was something to do and not a bad 'tourist trap' at all.

Bubbling activity. A harbor walk not to be missed. Great shows for all - adults and children. Well decorated and ready for Christmas. Full scale construction to expand. Great restaurants - visited MALAY for dinner - so great food. Lamb was the best

A place where the entire family can enjoy together!. There is a lot for everyone! The information center staff are very helpful in planning a holiday. Imax- the biggest screen in the world running through the day! The harbour itself is beautiful.Children can enjoy the park with good play equipment.The family can enjoy different types of fountains in the park The shopping complex is quite reasonable, may have some really good offers. Worth checking it out. A must see. Get a view of one of the happening places in Sydney!

Iconic cluster of opportunities and sleek-sling. overworked transmogrification from what used to be an organic system to a freak verandah with lots of outlets going for the view + plush consumption - an idealised icon of Australian idolatry- hype with the backdrop of the high rises- good to think about how property developers work eloquently and sometimes flagrantly

Great little water play area and park. We found a great little water play area for kids to enjoy next to a playground.. It is quite fun and safe for children of all ages to explore.. In the shopping centre of darling harbour there is a cotton on kids store if you don't have fresh clothes for your children to wear after getting wet...
Wonderful Harbour with a lot of fun. Casino is near by, fish market is near by, there's even a shopping arcad here. No WIFI this area, public toilets not easy to found.

Commercial. You can walk for hours around Darling Harbour. There are plenty of shops and restaurants. It really gets lively at night time. I am not into shopping, so this area wasn't that appealing to me.

Kept coming back here... This place is just beautiful. The sights at night are spectacular when all the lights come up. Has lots of places to hang out eat and visit including the aquarium, madam tussauds and imax. The restaurants are pretty neat too. Can't have enough of this place.
for food lovers. great place that just doesn't go to sleep. Sit, have a good food and enjoy the views and atmosphere.

Fireworks. Free fireworks display on a Saturday night @9pm. (5-6 minute display) I wouldn't recommend any of the restaurants around the harbour and the Santa Fun Run down to the Opera House was great fun!

Darling backwater. As a long time Sydney resident, I've tried to avoid Darling Harbour unless it's unavoidable. It's Sydney harbour's ugly backwater, where the surrounding architecture is definitively 80's and jumbled with more recent contrived structures. The scene is geared to middle of the road, and somewhat overpriced dining and gaudy entertainment. It is a tourist attraction, with an aquarium, a wild life enclosure, where people line up to see imprisoned wallabies and koalas, along with captive birds and what not. Across the way the Maritime museum offers some substance to what is really a mishmash of restaurants and bars and most anticipated of all, not, is the wax museum, where if on a hot day, you would hope the air conditioning doesn't breakdown while you're posing next to an effigy of Nicole Kidman or Hugh Jackman...it may result in a sad looking selfie. At night, the under dressed crowds of young women and testosterone pumped yobbos, participate in the fine Australian tradition of Blotto, drinking as though one has just won lotto and jumping or falling or being pushed into the dark harbour... Every year people drown in this vacuous harbour.

Everything in one place. A bustling yet lay back oasis in Sydneys CBDSo many restaurants and bars to choose from.Great hotels give fabulous views of the city.Lots of shops to find those special gifts for that special someone.Tenpin Bowling, Amuzement Centre, Flight Simulators, Madam Tussards, Wildlife world,Sealife and many other things to keep the kids happy with the Powerhouse Museum in walking distance.Too busy, then lose yourself in the pease and tranquility at the Chinese Gardens.so much for everyone of all ages
Sydney's best. Best time to visit Sydney... Good weather.... Lot of shopping discounts.......more foreigners than local
Darling darling. Very cosmopolitan . Great places to eat and plenty to do. Easy access to all part of Sydney. Water Taxi will get you to any part of Sydney Manley Watson bay fast

A must to do and stay there. Darling harbour is a fab place to visit and stay in one of the multiple hotels nearby . It is a hub of activity, beautiful restaurants to eat in , gorgeous waterfront views, so much to do there. You won't be disappointed
Got to do this place. Darling Harbour is so easy to walk around with all the restaurants, bars, shops and harbour cruises available who wouldn't want to come here and people watch.

Wonderful at night. There are so many bars and restaurants at Darling Harbour. There are people doing weird and wonderful acts from just singing and dancing to fire eaters . Could spend hours there just people watching. Friday / Saturday it does get very busy, and of course the boats are all lit up too.

Love at First Sight!. While traveling in Sydney we happened onto Darling Harbor only by accident. We didn't know such a place existed like this, anywhere on earth. It felt almost surreal, like out of some movie or something. It is the place to meet people in Sydney, this is where everyone in Sydney goes to enjoy a good meal, a cold beer, do a little shopping, or just relax and enjoy the lawns and scenic harbor with all the masted boats. The famous Sydney Sea Aquarium is here. What is so appealing is not only the layout, but the beautiful and seamless way in which it is all presented. One can see that it was well-planned from the moment they walk into the area. Do not miss the Saturday night fireworks, it is a full blown display that will leave you breathless, and it happens every Saturday night.

Awesome. I think it wouldn't be Sydney if you haven't visited Darling Harbor. They got park, hotel, yacht, restaurant, pub, club shop, cafe, great view, it just awesome. A place where you got space in the middle of the city.

Great place to eat and drink. Darling harbour is such a awesome place to spend all day and night in our case! We had a few drinks in the afternoon, took a walk around and then had a great meal at night. (Check out a place called Hurricane Grill) They do the best steaks ever, IMO. Amazing atmosphere around the harbour, highly recommend if visiting Sydney.
Awesome Place for everyone!!. With all the restaurants, cafe's, transport why wouldn't you want to go here!! Highly recommended for anyone who likes Sydney!!

Darling Harbor - Owesome Place to visit and spend time. This is in the center of Sydney City and surrounded by Sydney CBD Area.Very nice restaurant and the pirmaunt bridge is very nice view. Overall it is a very nice place to visit and nobody can miss it if in Sydney.

Highlight of our trip. What a place! Darling harbour was the best part of our trip to Sydney and we spent many hours at all the attractions. At meal time there were plenty of choices with deals to save you plenty. Would love to go back.

Just Darling!. My friends and I adored Darling Harbor! There are plenty of shops and attractions in the area (such as the Aquarium, wax museum, and maritime museum), and we had a blast walking around and taking it all in!

Delicous food complemented by stunning views at night!. Excellent view of the harbor especially at night. Lots and lots of places to eat. Can't remember the names of the two restaurants I went to but I tried a spicy kangaroo at one and fish n chips at the other. Mouthwatering!

Great place for adventures. There are lots of things happening in Darling Harbour for all ages at different times of the day. Darling Park next to the IMAX theatre has great park for the young and not so young. Its an easy down hill 10-15 walk from Town Hall. I recommend walking back through Chinatown

Lots to see and do in one location. This is a great area that offers the seaquarium, madame toussads wax museum etc. The pedestrian bridges are very helpful to cross between both sides of the harbor. We used the ferry service several times and thought it was a fun alternative to walking, never took a taxi during our week long stay. The one think we did miss was the Firework Show that is done every week, I believe it's a saturday, checks with your hotel. Lots of waterfront restaurants to choose from.

eating at darling harbour. Bustling place with loads of restaurants. The food at almost is your average fair at fairly high prices . It s a fantastic people watching place but dont expect anything innovative in the menus
Lovely food. the excellent view of the harbour, and so lively, with music and with a lot of people around there, very cosmopolitan

Something for everyone. Beautiful harbour surrounded by shops restaurants , and lots of activities including a sea life centre and Madame Tussards. We ate breakfast and dinner here most days during our weeks stay in Sydney. Great choice of restaurants and range of prices all with fantastic views.Very helpful tourist information office and good children's play area.We really enjoyed the fireworks display on the Saturday evening.

Absolutely worth a visit. There is something for everyone - great shopping, VERY many food outlets (cheap & expensive). Great views, often live shows, sometimes fireworks, good street entertainment, close to Star Casino, iMax Theatre, etc......

Such interesting life.. Bustling and interesting at any time. Sit in a bar and watch the people (often in fancy dress for functions) enjoy themselves. Walk around and feel the atmosphere. Visit the naval museum, aquarium and animal attractions. A good full day and evening.

Amazing - one of my favourite places in the world!. Darling harbour is in the heart of Sydney and has a prime location. It is beautiful and there is so much to see and do! Love all the attractions like the IMAX, wildlife park, aquarium, wax museum, maritime museum, jet boats. There are so many bars/restaurants that vary in price/food so there is something for everyone. At Christmas the decorations are extravagant and they often have fireworks displays over the harbour in December.Cannot rate this place highly enough.

Many, Many Restaurants. Darling Harbour is located on the opposite side of the harbour from the bridge and opera house. It has many boats and yachts moored at the docks along the harbour. There are a plethora of restaurants and bars long this harbour area. Like most of Sydney, they can be a bit pricey, however many offer "Happy Hour" specials. The choices are endless. The harbour has an inside area with many shops and food court type areas. I went during the daytime and it was quite full, however during the evening it is one of Sydney's hot spots.
Full of life!. The place is full of life and beautiful. The main tourist place in Sydney. It has a lot of good places to eat and also few ferries start from there. More like a place to chill.

THE PLACE!!. I only had one day in Sydney. Darling Harbor was a recommended destination . Not only is the harbor beautiful, great souvenir shopping and FANTASTIC RESTAURANTS!!! Not to mention bars. It's the place for " happy hour" crowd. It is a great visit during the day and Nite! Don't miss it!! Only negative is restaurants a little pricey. Again, DONT MISS IT!!

Best Harbour in Sydney. We found the Darling Harbour and Darling Quarter one of the best places to be in Sydney and much better that the main Sydney Harbour (although without the Bridge and Opera view). It was full of people, paces to visit with good restaurant choices all around the harbour. Just go for the view, to people watch or to eat.

Great day. We are spoilt for choice with so many lovely restaurants on the water. Darling harbour is a great way to spend the day walking around, with the city skyline ...something for everyone.... Even the Casino.
Saturday night in Darling Harbour. As it's close to Xmas Darling Harbour was alive with attractions for kids and families. I always love looking around Harbourside for shopping.

Base for exploring sydney April 2013. We stayed in darling harbour as a base to explore. There is so many evening eatery's to keep you busy, along with fireworks every Friday night in the harbour. Trams are fantastic to get around the city too. Watch the seagulls they steal your food straight out of your hands!! The big Irish market is worth looking at, however they are not all Irish in there lol The harbour is only a 10 min walk from Sydney centre

Safe clean and spectacular. Darling harbour is one of the best tourist locations in Sydney great resteraunts bars and many other attractions within walking distance and the price and choice for lunch and dinner is great also most pubs and restaurants are doing happy hour prices on beer and wine some all day , well worth a visit we went on an abba tribute dinner cruise with Rhythm boat cruises and had a great night food was great and abba were good and the host had everything running like clock work , all in all darling harbour is great value with style

Great end to our vacation. We were a group of 6 Canadians visiting Sydney at the end of our New Zealand/Australia holiday. We picked Darling Harbour for our final dinner as we had heard there were fireworks each Saturday night at 9:00pm. We were fortunate to get a reservation at Nick's Seafood Restaurant despite it being extremely busy (see my review entitled "Attentive Customer Service"). The entire Darling Harbour was buzzing with life. Many, many people out enjoying themselves. A great area to enjoy the fireworks and a great place to end our vacation. This is a terrific area to go for dinner, especially on a Saturday night. Book a reservation though, we were lucky to get in given we only booked a restaurant in late Saturday morning.

Best place in Sydney!. We loved going to darling harbour to chill out, grab a beer and watch the world go by! There is a great atmosphere and lots to do! Also it's convenient for the boats and you can all over the place from there!

Amazing. Lots of attractions, bars and restaurants to visit , and absolutely buzzing on Friday and Saturday evenings. Wonderful firework display every Saturday at 9pm Ferries to Circular Quay. Looks really good at night when everywhere is lit up.

Lovely area!. Darling Harbour is a lovely neighbourhood just adjacent to the city center of Sydney. It has a great selection of restaurants, cafes, bars and shops. An area that has undergone some renovation, many of the buildings are quite new. A nice area to spend time walking around in.
Darling Harbour Sydney NSW. We have visited here many times staying at Novotel Darling Harbour. Surrounded by lovely restaurants both casual and more upmarket. There are fireworks on weekends.

Exciting. Darling Harbour is such a great place to visit when you are in Sydney. It is really beautiful, great to walk around, and has an abundance of restaurants and shopping options to keep you busy. there always seems to be something happening there as well, so it is never quite the same twice, but always a favourite place to visit!

great for a walk with your special someone. Great for a walk with your special someone, a nice place and has a romantic feeling at night. The restaurants are pricy but have a verity of foods and drinks. a must do while in Sydney.

Great selection of restaurants - very crowded. Great selection of varied types of restaurants -chains as well as independents. Also, good variety of entertainment - bowling, laser tag, movies, and simulated car racing. Very crowded with long lines for activities, restaurants.

Love this place!. I recently visited here with a group of friends who live in Sydney with their small children. Very convienient to the city with lots of entertainment including Madame Tussauds, Sea life aquarium and Wild life Sydney zoo which you can purchase a ticket to include all or more of these and other attractions. Plenty of restaurants/bars etc and also an outdoor play area for children with water fountains and sand with small park (free of charge). Darling harbour has its own website where the latest 'what's on' can be found. Would highly recommend visiting especially the Hard Rock Cafe!!

Excellent vibe and ambience. I lived at Darling Harbour for some time and never tire of the precinct's great vibe. Plenty of places to eat from budget to expensive. Great to sit and people watch over a drink with friends. Easy access to many different tourist attractions. There is a shopping complex and also fantastic kids play area for families. Whether it's day or night, Darling Harbour is a great place to visit.

Vibrant and busy hub. Darling Harbour has something for everyone, from the Animal Zoo to the varied restaurants. It is a great place to walk around. It has many places to eat ranging from a quick take-away to a sit down fine meal. At certain times of the year it hosts sound and light shows that are terrific and has regular fireworks on the weekend. Ferries stop near by and a little people moving train take guests who visit, to both sides of the inlet. A heritage listed bridge joins both sides or you can walk around the edge. There is an eye max theatre and the Chinese gardens near-by.A visit here is well worthwhile.

Wonderful place to take your grandchildren. I have been taking my 4 grandchildren to Darling Harbour for the past 3 years & each time they have enjoyed this activity wanting more each day. I live in the city so there are very few places to take them to where there are so many activities to amuse them. They have also a variety of different restaurants to choose from.
