Could spend hours here!. So much to do in this area! so many cafe's/restaurants and when we went it was near xmas time they had a lot of festive decorations which were gorgeous! Theres also some sort of kids water play area which was huge and there was a lovely gelato shop and a macca's close by. There was also a lovely japanese garden which you had to pay to enter but it did look nice from the outside. But just a lovely area to walk around and explore! I will come back here everytime I come to Sydney!

Spent short time in area. Many shops and attractions in this area, we only went to the aquarium which was well worth the visit ,Not to far to get to or walk from the main centre.Some of the boat trips go from this area so check first before you buy trip as all the others go from circular quay.
Great little spot. Last year we spent a few hours shopping and looking around,nice to be inside or out and about the water side.lots of things to look at and plenty of side shows.

Mixed bag. This is not a place for everyone. Those looking for tons of touristy type stuff will love it. We're not those people, but did enjoy looking and walking around to experience this part of Sydney. The wax museum and wildlife exhibit are there along with tons of restaurants and shops. It's pretty but not for us. We arrived by taking the Hop-On Hop-Off ferry just to see it but didn't spend much time there. Again, those who like that type of thing can actually spend the better part of a day or more there.

Lots to see.. In the maritime museum you can visit a submarine and climb to the top of a lighthouse. You can soak up the atmosphere in one of the many waterside cafes. Best of all it is an enjoyable ferry ride from Circular Quay.

Pretty but pricey. Lovely views, nice to walk around any time of the day and handy to catch the ferry from! Easy to walk to from the CBD but restaurants are pretty pricey. Happy hours from 5-7 are good.

My regular hangout as a student. Loved hanging out at darling harbour as a student with great places by the water front to dine and drink. Also, students can make use of discount coupons if you manage to get your hands on them.Almost everything one needs for a fun night can be found here, from bowling to laser tag, to street shows and pool tables in pubs. Saturday nights are lovely with the fireworks. And weekend parking is also available at a reasonable price. Cant forget the 2010 football world cup being screened on large screens floating on the water. Still feels like home every time I go back there.

It's always beautiful and there Is always something on!. A beautiful place to chill out or have FUN all year round. The best things in life are free!Don't Miss Vivid Festival, NYE fireworks And saturday night fireworks.

Darlingharbour good or great. My wife and I walked around Darling harbour one evening following dinner at a nearby restaurant. This was at about 8.30pm and the night a lovely Balmy Sydney evening. Even at that time there were lots of shops open and of course many bars and Restaurants. It is hard to imagine that there would not be things to interest many visitors here. From Hard Rock Café style places to Top Class Restaurants in Cockle Bay as well as King Street Wharf. Like it or not one has to go there but I suggest avoid the New Year type timings.

Visit with friends from Melbourne. Last year we had friends from Melbourne we had good time on the habour bet problem parking is not free you have to cam orly we went to one of the restorante is a lot of they
Day trip. Had a trip to Madamme Toussard wax museum. Great place to visit. Lots of interesting figures. Some very famous, others just as important. Able to have photos with them

Plenty to do but very crowded. Darling Harbour is hugely popular. There is plenty of free stuff like buskers (well if your to cheap to tip them its free) and a play ground for kids. Usually something special in the area happening. Lots of restaurants as well as supermarket food hall food. If you got money and want to do something there is the IMAX, Aquarium, a small Wildlife Zoo that's good, the wax works, 10 pin bowling ans a laser skirmish place. There is also the Maritime Museum Its close to the Powerhouse Museum close to the city and close to Chinatown so its a great place to drop in for a meal or just to wander around.

A Great location on the water. The location so close to the city it is ideal for tourists and locals to enjoy the atmosphere of the international food and restaurants with views of the water. The restaurants on the City side which is the Cockle Bay are generally a bit more up market with the Star side a bit more casual. All you need for a good meal is to look at how busy the restaurant is which is normally a good sign the food is good quality. The shops in the pavilions are just normal shops with a smattering of tourist shops.

A great place to people watch. Darling Harbour is now a great place to wander around, have a meal, have a drink or embark on one of the many harbour cruises that leave from the area. There is an abundance of restaurants with a wide range a prices. Due to the high competition, many restaurants offer good special deals. Many of the restaurants/bars also have a happy hour from 3.00pm to 6.00pm at which time you can buy a good selection of drinks for $5. A great place to find a nice bar and watch the passing parade.

good restaurant choice and plenty things to do. After our team meeting we had a wonderful time spent around the darling harbour. Big surprise to see a well equipped bowling called Kingpin tucked away in the shopping area. We had dinner at Cyren Bar-Seafood which offered excellent menu and drink.
Beautiful City.... I love darling Harbourside, food is great, excitement and enjoy the view, there's always entertainment around.
Everything here.. This is a great place to visit. Things to do see eat or just sit back and relax. A whole day to really enjoy this area of Sydney. Must do!

Nice place. Nice place to spent a delightful evening with your family. There are many things happening at that place. Please check online for the upcoming events so that you can enjoy. I have visited the place several times and my kid loves to play at the kids park there. He specially enjoy the water features of the park. I like to walk around and spend my time in any of the wonderful restaurant beside the harbour. Strongly recommended place for people who want to spend time at sydney city with family with kids.

Darling Harbour- something for everyone.. Wether it's your first time in Sydney or your 100th there is always something to see and do in Darling harbour. Great for all ages. Fantastic park located nearby, loads of shopping, restaurants and street performers to see. Perfect for a day out

Darling Harbour...great for "kids" of all ages.. Darling Harbour is an excellent place to visit. At the southern end is the Sydney Information Centre. Excellent information and discount offers can be accessed here. First port of call. Cafes and restaurants, pubs and nightclubs abound all around Darling Harbour.There is a main shopping centre on the west side. In the main shopping mall there is a food court for quick, cheap and cheerful, many shops, eateries. Attractions around DH are the Aquarium, iMax theatre, Madame Taussauds Wax museum, native animal zoo and Chinese Gardens, Maritime Museum with great interactive activities for all ages. . Tickets can be purchased there but a multi pack can be bought on line or at the Info centre and this is cheaper. There is a children' water park found outside the info centre. Reported to be the largest in the Southern Hemisphere. This is for younger children so don't expect huge water slides. At the southern end past Tumbalong Park and the Entertainment centre can be found Paddy's Markets ( a large Chinese Food and general goods market) open Thurs thru Sunday. To get there:- bus or train to Wynyard, Town Hall or bus to the Queen Victoria Building and walk down the hill ( 500 metres) to Darling Harbour. Or train or bus to Central railway station and walk . But this is a lot further. Activities in Tumbalong Park are held most weekends . Look up the ?Darling Harbour website.

Darling Harbour-Great Attractions and Food. Darling Harbour is an excellent place to visit while in Sydney. Its only a 10 minute walk from most of the Sydney CBD and hotels or very short taxi fare down there but I prefer to walk. Great restaurants, both sit down and take away as well as shops like Lindt chocolates which is great for desert or a hot chocololate/coffee. The Imax 3D theatre is here, Chinese Gardens, shopping mainly for out of town tourists and along the walkway at Cockle Bay Wharf are the bars with food and better restaurants. On the way to Cockle Bay Wharf you pass the Wildlife Sydney Zoo (not to be confused with Taronga Park Zoo on the other side of the harbour at Mosman), Sydney Aquarium and Madame Tussauds. Most of the Harbour cruises leave from here, and there are Water Taxis and Jet Boats that also leave from Darling Harbour. A great spot to spend all or part of your day. I suggest having breakfast on your way there, a harbour cruise for lunch and then spend your evening in Darling Harbour.
Sydney Harbour. One of the most glorious harbours of the world! Beautiful scenery and access to many attractions and restaurants.

Purpose Built for Tourists. Just like that crazy expectation people have for New Years Eve...where the expectation usually far exceeds the reality...Darling Harbour is comparable. City planners have given the masses somewhere to go and that's to be applauded. Overpriced large scale restaurants and bars abound - just don't expect intimate or highly rated gourmet. Saturday night fireworks are an attraction so if you're celebrating with friends they will be an added bonus. Highlights of the area are the Chinese Gardens (open in daylight hours to the public) and Imax. Perhaps the main reason why this place exists will become apparent once the Conference and Exhibition Centres are rebuilt. The plans look good so we're lookin' to the future!

fun for the family. Darling harbour is a great place to meet up with friends or take out of town relatives. It has lots to eat, places to shop, and even a play ground for the younger kids. Best of all its just a short walk to the city or China town, so you can pop your relatives somewhere fun, go to town and meet them up later

A mixed bag.... Darling Harbour is, to a large extent, your classic tourist trap with many overpriced restaurants, slow-moving visitors meandering around in groups taking photos, and shops selling tat to those anxious for gifts for relatives before they fly home. There are some upsides though such as the excellent Maritime Museum, IMAX cinema and Darling Quarter kids playground so it's worth spending some time there if you have those in mind. If your idea of hell though is to sit outside shooing away scavenging birds from your food, getting poked in the eye with a 'selfie stick' whilst dealing with a merchant who only expects to see you once then this place is best avoided.

Play park for kids, sunlight, cinema, waterworks, restaurants and all the works!!. This place is perfect for kids because of the play area near Imax. So young parents can relax a bit. Variety of chocolates and ice-creams to buy them! Even Maccas. It's a great hangout for friends because of all the restaurants and the waterside seatings in the sun! Amazing coffees and wines! And if you like the evening lights, its a great romantic place! Has some great places for dancing. And Saturday's fireworks are breath taking. A friend popped the question to his girl in the backdrop of those gorgeous lights! It's a nice place for solitude lovers too. Allows plenty of space by the water itself otherwise with the choice of cuisines and restaurants.  You don't need a reason to go to Darling Harbour! I take every newbie friend to this place lol! And my mum loved it! So take your parets thr for a relaxed evening! You can hop on a ferry and go to the Circular Quay from there, or to Manly even. Ten mins walk from Townhall station and you're there! As easy as 1-2-3!

Darling Harbour rocks. Make sure you board the 'hop on hop off' double decker tourist bus. Full commentary. Do the round trip on the bus then decide where to get off next time around. Tickets are valid for 24 hours from the time you board the bus on your first trip. A must for tourists.
A great place to spend sometime. Darling Harbour is a great place to explore plenty of places for coffee and cafes everywhere. sS5t down an relax and watch the world go bye.
Best Place for family with kids on a weekend. Living in Sydney, we still feel good when ever we go to Darling Harbor. So many restaurants/activities. Kids love this place...

Must visit. Must visit in Sydney for a walk, icecream, drinks or lunch! Lots of great people watching ;) fabulous restaurants and you can walk all the way around to Cockle Bay and King Street Wharf ;)

Fantastic view & relaxation. I work in the city and I'm very grateful to be able to sit by the harbour and eat my lunch. The view is simply relaxing, the surroundings are enjoyable and the crowd of culture is engaging. Definitely recommend a visit down to Darling Harbour.

A must to do. After a day out in Sydney,we caught a ferry from Circular Key to Darling harbour.going under the Harbour Bridge & passed Luna Park is a beautiful sight especially at night.had a relaxful stroll along the harbour edge before eating at one of the restaurants.returned by ferry,certainly worth a visit.

Many restaurants and things to do. Was on our to-do list but not high up there. Yet after the first visit we realized it would be a mistake not to return. What's the difference between Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour? I don't know. But lots of energy in the area with the numerous restaurants fronting the water, and therefore lots of choices. Easy to spend day and night there - a warship and sub appear to be anchored on one side of the bay and on the other side are a wildlife park, museum and acquarium.

Drive in sydney with PM25 friends.. I went to sydney on 9-19 October 2013. I drive by myself everywhere I visited with my Toy, Honey and Tan family. We had a grate time togther. thsi can say the explorer will strat . Next destination is Melbourne, 5th time for me.

Lots happening. We stayed at the Park Royal this time, which is just a short walk to Darling Harbour. There is always something happening here; from entertaining buskers and street acts in the large central areas, to vibrant eateries around the perimeter and in the Shopping Mall itself. There isn't much too exciting in the way of shopping in the Mall; mainly standard food and retail outlets, and some souvenir type shops. Our girls enjoyed some of the shoe stores and cotton clothing shops, but no different here to anywhere else. We took the kids to IMAX, which is always a popular option for them (they are teenagers), and at the other end is the aquarium. We find ferries a bit of a hassle to catch from here, and would prefer to walk into the city and catch the free 555 bus to Circular Quay from all along George St, and catch ferries from there.If you walk the other way, you get o the Chinese Gardens, which we love, and walk a bit further and you are right in China Town, which is another whole experience!Well worth a visit!

Nice weekend stroll + Xmas fireworks. Sydney, is quite dead at night except for the pubs and bars. Hence, the best place is to stroll along darling harbour, enjoying the nice breeze, and the eateries along the stretch. Free fireworks every Saturday. The Xmas fireworks this weekend was great, got to watch it from a great view. photos link below ;)http://fabuloussimpleme.blogspot.com.au/2014/11/fireworks-at-darling-harbor-xmas-mood.html

Really Impressive. We stayed about a block away and where at Darling Harbour every day. It is beautiful especially at night. There are many many restaurants right next to each other with different kinds of cuisine all with outdoor cafes.... We really enjoyed many of them. Also great Happy hours!! The aquarium is there also as well as many of the ferry boats. Great place!!

A Lively, Newer area of Sydney. There is a lot of new construction in this area, which includes offices, retail, and residential. The esplanade along the water has a lot of restaurants and other entertainment venues (aquarium), with ferries also making a stop here.

Great Mix of Activities. I like the Darling Harbour area be for just walking around, eating or catching the free fireworks at Christmas time or the entertainment on offer. Best to go at night time as less on during the day. Walk around the harbour take in all the sights and grab a bite at one of the restaurants or fast food places. Sure there will be something to meet your tastes.

I don't see the hype!. I don't really love Darling Harbour, I've given it a try a few times and find it to be a little bland and don't really see why so many people love it!There are lots of restaurants but for me, I've never found any that are really very appealing, they seem a little stark.I can imagine when a major event is on the place would come alive, but for me I've never seen this.I'd still say go take a visit, as I know friends of mine love it and prefer to stay in Darling Harbour. I guess I'm just a little old fashioned and prefer the old feel of the Rocks.

Brilliant venue with lots to do and see. Superb venue with everything from shopping to restaurants, bars and a wildlife centre and sealife aquarium. There is so much to do here and it's quite a busy venue. They have a fireworks display every Saturday night from 9pm and it's well worth going just to see this display.You can also get a water taxi if you need to get to circular quay etc or take one of the harbour cruises.

Fireworks!. We went to the Darling Harbour to view fireworks on Saturday night. It was nice and cool walking from our apartment to Darling Harbour. Many people were there waiting to see the fireworks as well. A very festive atmosphere...And Wow! When the fireworks exploded over the clear sky! The sky was so clear you can see the moon as well.A must see if you happen to be in Sydney on a Saturday. My boy enjoyed it sooo much.. And so did I!

Lots to do. We loved Darling Harbour - it was within walking distance from our hotel (Holiday Inn) - the place was a buzz with loads of restaurants - catering for all tastes - and all vying for business offering various specials included with your meal ranging from a glass of beer to a bottle of wine! The Maritime Museum is also here which is a very interesting place to visit and is the home of 'The Welcome Wall'.

Darling...Darling Harbour. Scenic view at night, i enjoyed my 7days stay at Sydney. I stayed at Malaysian Hall so it was cheap and traveled by public transport. It was very exciting to see the Sydney Tower & the monorail during 1997 as Malaysia does not have anything close to this before. As a student i was over whelmed but the sad part is to see some graffiti in the washroom in the University of Sydney, most of it was cruising the Asian.

A Nice, Scenic Neighborhood with Reasonably Priced Restaurants. I enjoyed Darling Harbour. It's a great place to walk not far from the Central Business District and everywhere you look is an interesting view. The area is lined with view restaurants, all competing for your business with decent meals at more reasonable prices than in many other touristy areas of Sydney (e.g., Circular Quay).

Cute area. Enjoyed strolling along the walk of this area. Restaurants & cafes galore. Also an indoor animal zoo-type attraction there, which would be fun for children. There are ferries available to bring you to Sydney Harbour and other areas also. I would recommend to do a ferry-ride tour; you will see beautiful homes facing the water.

Short Break. We stayed at the Hotel Mantra on Kent Street our room was a studio which had hob, washer, dryer and all that you would have at home.. We were on the 17 floor so had a good view of the Harbour , it was some distance away over a walkway but there were lifts and elevators to get you down to the Harbour once there spoilt for choice for eating places, best times at night watching the night life all the ladies teetering along on their heels most needing help from their partner going to the night clubs. Plenty of ferries going to the Rock.
Great Place. Beautiful place for an evening stroll around cafes and bars. Not cheap but worth a look.Seeing Darling Harbor at night all lit up amazing.

Nice place to chill. It is a nice place to chill, alone, with a lover, with friends or with family. There are numerous street performances on at times. And for certain Saturdays night at 8:30pm, there is the firework display, which literally, the fireworks are right on top of your head. So make sure you don't miss that one!
Great place to stay. Our hotel overlooked the harbor and Sydney skyline. Easy walking distance to shopping and restaurants. Fireworks over harbor every Saturday night.

Restaurants galore. Right on the waterfront, two levels, 1-2 city blocks of restaurants of all types of cuisine and price ranges. You can't go wrong when trying to find a decent meal with a great view of the harbor and the harbor activities including the Saturday night fireworks display. Most, if not all, have outdoor seating.Also adjacent to a large mall, convenient for shoppers.This is however a popular and very busy place, so expect the crowds and if possible, do some research in advance on the restaurants and make a reservation. Otherwise you'll likely be waiting 20+ minutes for a table.

Great vibe. Darling harbour is a vibrant happening place. During the festive season fire works over the water are a nightly highlight . You are spoilt for choice when it comes to dining and free street performance.
I love Darling Harbour!. So much to see and do. Great restaurants. A great place just to stroll around. It never gets boring.

Scenic run. I have recently arrived in Sydney and wanted to go for a run, I found myself running around the darling harbour, it was lovely. Great atmosphere and many little cafés and restaurant to grab something quick to drink. A place to go when you just want to people watch.
Nice place to walk around. This harbor has many restaurants and they did fireworks at night. I think they do fireworks every Saturday night. Also has one of the only Starbucks in Sydney.
Darling place. Great area of Sydney to wander around, so many places to eat or have a drink. Visit the maritime museum, go on a submarine, people watch, relax, enjoy the sun. Have a great time.

Beautiful spot in a beautiful city. I love the atmosphere of Darling Harbour and the fact that it is so well laid out. It is easy walking (or pushing a pram or wheelchair) and there is always so much to see and do. There is nothing better on a nice day than walking around and getting a bit of sunshine and exercise near the waterfront. There is an abundance of cafes and restaurants and surprisingly you can get meals at very reasonable prices. I love watching the free entertainment and just soaking up the atmosphere. Of course Darling Harbour is also the home of many of the city's major attractions such as Paddy's Markets, Sydney Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife World, Madame Trussards, Powerhouse Museum, Australian Maritime Museum and the Chinese Garden of Friendship to name a few. You could spend a week just exploring everything Darling Harbour has to offer.

darling harbour. it is the place where one should be during weekend evenings. it has all the interesting places for the people of all the ages. there are attractions like wax museum, playgrounds for the children and there is star casino for adults. there are many restaurants and bars. there are ferries and show boats departing from the darling harbor.
Scenic. Lots of lovely restaurants and cafes to visit during the day and evening.Shopping complex to spend money.Very easy to walk around to see some of the sights.

Beautiful Sydney. Lovely spot, one of the best in Sydney so a must for every tourist, this place is always packed with people and usually there is something going on. Great view, lot of restaurants and coffee shops to enjoy at just be aware prices are slightly higher.

Touristy (from a local) but check out the fireworks. I live around the corner from here, and the place is very touristy. A lot of overpriced restaurants with mediocre food. But there are some hidden gems including the regular free festivals and free fireworks display.If you are a tourist, I recommend checking out the aquarium, wildlife park and Madame Tussauds. You can purchase a combined ticket which makes it affordable to see 2 or 3 of them for not much more than the cost of 1 ticket.If you have children, I recommend seeing the fireworks which happen ost weekends at around 8:30pm / 9pm. The children's playground and water feature behind the iMax cinema is another popular place for kids. The iMax cinema, bowling, karaoke and laser skirmish are also popular and regularly discountedIf you're a little older and are interested in bars, I recommend sticking to the King st Wharf side and seeing Bungalow 8 or Cargo Bar. The bars on the Darling Harbour side are over priced and a little more rough. Bungalow 8 and Cargo Bar are also good for lunch / early drinks and have an extensive cocktail and food menus.

Sydney's Jewel. Darling Harbour has long been an asset to Sydney. Having been there at it's birth in the late 80's I have been interstate for many years and every time I am in Sydney head down here for a drink, a meal or just to relax. It really has reached iconic status I think.

Something for Everyone. Great to visit Darling Harbour again but amazed at how much development is taking place. Always a great place to dine and watch the world go by. Food is very expensive but the location makes ir worthwhile. Take the ferry to Circular Quay and thr Opera House. About A$4 (£2.50). Try and avoid the water taxis as they cost upwards of A$15 for the same 30 minutes trip.The National Maritme Museum is always worth a visit.

Extremely Expensive and Touristy. Many of the locals say that this place is for tourists only. I totally understood that after visiting this place. Yes, it's beautiful and you can get some nice pictures but the price of the food was extremely expensive and the servings were so small. On top of that, once you eat dinner, that's pretty much all you can do here except maybe have a drink. It's worth one look and then focus on other coastline places where there aren't so many tourists.
A typical harbour. There wasn't much. The mall is small and nothing much to see. The harbour is the same. There is a park between the harbour and the Chinese garden. My kid had fun there though.

Happy Hour's'!. So many different types of restaurants & bars. We could've probably worked our way around the bars from 11am until late taking advantage of the Happy Hours!!! Always bustling. Nice & clean. Lots of places to sit & watch the world go by. Interesting vessels docked and can go aboard for a charge if wished. Sealife is amazing. It will be interesting to see what the new development of the 5* casino & more bars will bring to this area. All in all a great place to go back time & time again

Was here for NYE. Was here for NYE a few years back. The trains run late on NYE. One word of warning, this is a patrolled area so you cannot take or buy alcohol in there. But it is a cheap way to see all the fantastic fireworks in one of the iconic places in the world.

Poor cousin to Sydney Harbour. Worth a look, but really it is not on the same scale as the main harbour. The various restaurants and other attractions all seem somehow a little tacky. Not my favourite part of Sydney.

Best of Life. What a place and what energy level. After full days work you want to recharge yourself come to Darling Harbour. We stayed in North Ryde and though the distance looked too much but the lovely public transport facility made it easy. We got to see lovely firework show as we were there just before the new year and it was an awesome site. Take a coffee from starbucks and sit on the stairs and you can spend the whole day at Darling Harbour.

THE place to stay!. So many great things to do at Darling Harbour. The Navy Museum is really nice. The mall has all the shopping you need including more Ugg stores than any other mall I've ever seen. Great restaurants including the Hard Rock, Margaritaville, and other local fine (or nearly so) dining. Why would you go anywhere else? On top of that, the ferry service is regular and covers the entire Sydney Harbour area.

Fun place with lots to do. This is a fun area with lots of restaurants, shops, museums, and many other forms of entertainment. It's also a beautiful setting, with great views of the harbor and skyline. There's so much to do, see and eat that you'll likely go more than once. There are also places to get some rest and quiet time, or to just be alone. Whatever you decide to do, leave yourself plenty of time because there's lots to do, and you'll probably want to stay longer than you had planned.

So Many Restaurants. There are lots of restaurants in Darling Harbour . Quite crowded on Saturday and you need reservation for the good one. Very lively place . Good for family and friends dining place.

Lively location with wide choice of eateries and hotels. We stayed at the 1888 Hotel (reviewed separately) and spent most evenings strolling round the harbour, usually stopping for a drink and/or a meal. Vast choice of bars and restaurants, some of which were a littlenoisy for our taste. On our last night we were treated to a firework display.

Something for everyone. This is the tourist hub of Sydney has fun things for kids to do for toddlers, teenagers and adults. A fun raising walk was on while we were there which was well supported but did not close down the city action just blended in. Lots of choices to eat from expensive to cheap all well presented and good value. Kids easy to feed and amuse in this harbour area. We enjoyed the vibe and did felt very comfortable and safe walking around at night there.

Vibrant Place. We had a constant view of Darling Harbour from our hotel room and it is lively and colourful.As currently I live in a small town of Australia where everything is closed by 5 pm, an I am more used to vibrant life...........it was a relief.Restaurants,shops,happy people,road side performers.Of course if you visit Sydney as a tourist you will Visit Darling Harbour and it is worth it.We missed the firework on Saturday due to some other programme.

The place to be on Friday evening.. This is the action place to be on Friday afternoon. Seems men and women by the group arrive to PARTY. From well dressed to casual dress, they have something for everyone. Even families can fined much to do for themselves and children.
Tourist Mecca. Families don't have far to walk to visit Wild Life, Sea Life and Madame Tassaud's, something for everyone.

A Must Visit. A must visit when in Sydney. Stunning...... sorry we missed the fireworks as we visited on a Sunday it was buzzing with people, food and shops. Maritime Museum fascinating we needed more time so will return definitely.
Fireworks to watch. Great place to be during the weekends. Lots of street performances and eateries to keep you entertained. There is a 10 minute fireworks every Saturday night at 9pm.
Awesome. Darling harbour is an awesome place if you are looking to dine out. Has so many lovely restaurants. So central to everything. The ferries are running all day. Love it here.

Fun to walk through the waterfront. Many restaurants and sights. Clean and attractive; quiet new area. Good places to eat seem available; but we only strolled through the area and went to the Maritime museum

FIreworks every Sat night at 9:00 pm. 160 restaurants so lots to choose from so plan dinner to finish and watch the fireworks. Street entertainers are good too so nice family fun but can get crowded so be early or make a reservation

Great place to eat out and see fireworks. Saturday evenings at 8pm there are fireworks all summer long in the harbour. There are great places to eat and drink in. Arrive by water taxi and see beautiful views of the bay on the way.

Best Harbour attraction in the world.. Darling Harbour has so much that appeals, interesting architecture, both the main building and the surrounding hotels motels and general buildings. The shopping, restaurants attractions (aquarium and maritime museum) are as good as any in the world. Just and exciting place to be near the centre of Sydney City.
beautiful. this place is not very big but it's clean, pretty & not too expensive, and it's not too far from Sydney central. you have to visit the Lindt café.....oh wow.....chocolate heaven!

Unique. We went there during the evening and got the liberty to witness many amazing street performances. It was better than any I have ever seen before! Unfortunately, many shops were already closed in the shopping center nearby but you could always chill with a cup of coffee. (Starbucks nearby) I could feel the vibe the place radiated and it was really good, like a mixture of lively and chill.

Interesting place and a lot to do. Went to darling for sea aquarium and to board a boat for whale watching. Magnificent view, a must go place in Sydney. So many things to do and see there. Very windy at night when I go there end oct, so remember to bring a sweater or a good scarf :)

Darling Harbour. As a Sydneysider, I really like wandering around Darling Harbour. If you have never been to the Aquarium (fee) that is wonderful. The IMAX Theatre is also fabulous (fee) - check what is on in the newspaper or ask at your hotel. My favourite is the Maritime Museum which usually has a special exhibition running (fee) but there is a smaller fee for just walking around looking at the boats in the Museum. Darling Harbour is only a short walk from Town Hall across the old bridge or you can get light rail transport from Central Station, depending where you are staying. Young children love just running around chasing the seagulls and running through the fountain getting wet. There are plenty of places with interesting food ranging from cheap to expensive.

A must do when visiting Sydney. Anyone wanting to see the key sights of Sydney has to visit Darling Harbour. A bit of everything, maritime museum, great restaurants and plenty of other attractions. Best time to visit is early night.

Lots to do. We recently enjoyed all the things to see and do in Darling Harbor. Yes it is touristy but there were many different options for many different interest. From the Wildlife and Aquarium to the Maritime Museum. Lots of shops and eateries throughout the area. Seek and you will find reasonable priced meals or snacks if you are budgeting. Also everything is well marked by street signs and maps throughout. Little areas to rest and just enjoy the surrounding area. The Japanese Gardens, Paddy's market and China Town are all accessible by walking from Darling Harbor with many transportation options if you should choose. Darling Harbor seemed to be the best place for us as everything we needed was close or just a ferry or bus ride away.

So much to do, so little time. Great atmosphere, a multitude of choices of places to eat, and the food variety was great. There are boat excursion options, the shops were a little expensive, but thats to be expected from tourist attractions. The aquarium was nearby, and if you like to people watch, grab a coffee and sit on a bench- this is a great spot.

So much to do with youngsters. Best 5 things to do at Darling Harbour with kids <10. #1 Chinese friendship garden (free). #2 Ferry to Circular Quay. #3 Sea Life. #4 Maritime Museum. #5 Luna Park (Coney Island). Other notable mentions: Madame Taussades (fantastic for > 11s & adults), Wildlife.
Darling Harbour. Appalling place. Plastic in every way. Expensive shops and restaurants. The only relief is the Chinese Garden; the only part of Darling Harbour worth visiting.

not to be missed. darling harbour has something for everyone .plenty shops restaurants,sea life world ,japanese gardens,the list is endless it is always buzzing the only downside is its sometimes too busy

Bustling with activity!. If you are hungry and like a variety of cuisine from varying cultures, then this has to be your destination.
Don't expect anything cheap in this area but the atmosphere far outweighs the $.
So much to do!. Such a great place. Water, fireworks on some weekends - so much to do!! - I love Darling Harbour- great for family and for romantic dates

A must go place in Sydney. Good for young and old alike .Sydney at it's very best particularly when the weather is nice.
Suits all budgets and all tastes. If you want to walk around, sample nice food and enjoy a lively
atmosphere this is the place for you.

Love darling harbour. This is one of the best parts of the harbour for me, so much to do and see we had the fun of watching the South american music fiesta on the Saturday afternoon ,also the Sunday but we were wandering around doing other things ,the weather was superb, great evening feed at the South Steyne, and then we had wonderful fireworks as well ,all for free ' AWESOME' !!!!!!!, lots and lots of people around and the atmosphere was terrific, just love Darling Harbour,!!!!

over priced but nice veiws. i go alot to darling harbour, stayed in surrounding hotel, eaten in most of the resurants, and even worked there on projects.its over priced. you cant deny that. the food is priced for tourists that have $$ to burn.in saying that its a tourist spot for a reason, a good looking reason. the views on a nice day are great.

What a great place to visit. Darling Harbour is great place to visit with kids or if you like the night life it has many things to do and is easy access by water taxi or ferry from the quay . would recommend a visit if in Sydney
Nice tourist Spot. Nice tourist spot with restaurant and Bars. It is overcrowded and here is where Bars, Pubs and kids playground is not far apart.

luxury lifestyle. People living in Sydney have it all at their doorstep, great views, entertainment, restaurants, night life , healthy vibe and family atmosphere plus theme parks. Locals and tourists are drawn to darling harbor where the action is and you can party on the harbor. The place with the lot . Fun and entertainment.

Darling Harbour a place to see. I love Darling Harbour at Christmas time there is always a show happening on a barge in the middle . The Harbour is small with good vantage spots especially the footbridge. Great restraunts and a 5 minute walk or less to the Syney casino

Darling Harbour - being upgraded at the moment. Darling Harbour was established as a space in Sydney for the people at the time of the bicentenary of Australia's settlement as a colony of England (1988). It's been an attraction for tourists and locals alike with many attractions and restaurants within walking distance of the general area. However, it is in maintenance and improvement mode and is somewhat disappointing for the complete experience. Look out for signs and building happening and be aware there is less 'fun' to be had. Nevertheless there are peaceful spots and grass as well as water fun on hot days. Free.

Very, Very Expensive. There is plenty to see around Darling Harbour. It offers a vast array of shops , restaurants and harbour views; however, the down side is that everything is frightfully expensive.Most restaurants are at best a bit above average. Be prepared to pay twice what you would pay in other parts of Sydney if you dine at Darling Harbour. If you are visiting Sydney, and want to dine at a good restaurant, go to Newtown, Leichhardt, the lower North Shore or the Eastern Suburbs - the food is better and better priced.

Darling Harbour - paradise in a box. Darling Harbour has everything. There are stylish restaurants and the good old golden arches too! Plenty of space for the kids, with structured playgrounds and water fountains to entertain them. Magnificent Chinese Gardens for adults to explore. And much much more............

To chill out in Sydney. Darling Harbour is one of the must Visit in Sydney. Come at Saturday for the firework. Start your evening in Madame Tussaud or zoo. For maritime enthusiast don't miss the Maritime Museum. For dinner, try 1 meter pizza in Crinitis, but on Sat night its no way withiout prior booking. Instead try Pancake of The Rocks Of course after waiting for some minutes. If you want a value dinner, just go to the food court for Indian, Oporto, sandwich, KFC or McD (??) Or Gloria Jeans for Coffee.Don't miss the firework on Sat night at 9 pm at Spring / summer. Different schedule on winter and fall. After firework, the street dancer performance around Crinitis is worth to see.Finish your night by dessert in Lindt chocolate or chill out for beer in the bar around. You'll find Starbuck and Hard Rock Cafe nearby.
Even the Brat loves Darling Harbour!. Something for everyone - and a great view too.Food, shopping, fresh air and views - what more could you ask for?

Harbourside fun for the family. Had a great day out with the family at Darling Harbour. Plenty to eat and see. Food was a bit overpriced, but that was expected for this popular tourist destination. Parking is very very expensive - catch a train in if you can.
Always a good vibe here!. Teeming with life, lots happening or just for people watching. There was a Latin music fiesta, street performers, a flameco performance and heps and heapsmof people.

Beautiful landscape!. Sydney Harbour is surrounded with restaurants, a massive playground, IMAX Theatre and much more! The best time of the day to view this magnificent landscape is in the evening when the water is gleaming and the sun is casting its shadow over the hotels and buildings. To view the spectacular landscape is best from the bridge that connects the two sides of semi-circled harbour together. I absolutely enjoyed the evening scenery and it is a great place to relax and just watch the sun go down.

Modern Aussie!. It's one of my favorite places in Sydney. It's an image of modern Australia. A busy place with a bunch of shops and eateries. If you want to spend a day in an area with a touch of modernism, this is the right place to be.

Lovely Place. Lots of restaurants, bars, fireworks at the weekend, some good shops and a vibrant atmosphere. We had several meals at different types of cafe restaurant, ice creams all of the service was very good. The people at the information centre were most helpful.

Good place to take in the sights. Darling Harbour is a nice mix of places to eat, shop and sightsee. With attractions like the Maritime Museum, Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife Zoo and Madame Tussards all located there and numerous restaurants, cafes and coffee shops it's possible to spend a whole day wandering around and enjoying the sights and sounds of the Harbour

Good place to chill around in Sydney. I had gone for lunch to Zaffran and after a good lunch spent some time at Darling Harbour. The weather was extremely pleasant and the wind was cool. Have good memories here with friends.
Definitely a must visit place.

We love it every time!!. I love this place very much, heaps of nice food, nice drinks, nice view.. Definitely a must do if you are in Sydney..
And the story about Darling Harnour is so cool!! They did a great job!!
Nice atmosphere. Great place to spend half a day, would recommend going at night when the place lights up. Lot's of restaurants, cafes, attractions nearby.

This is the area to stay when touring Sydney. If you are visiting Sydney, Darling Harbour is the area where you will want to stay. You can easily fill three days just walking down to the harbour each day and taking in the various sites and activities. We also enjoyed the hop on hop off bus which was fun and informative. We used Sydney Harbour for our launch point for the bus as there are several convenient stops nearby.Be sure to take a ride on the ferries. It is a scenic ride and will help you familiarize yourself with the area. It is also a good way to get headed in the right direction to your hotel after a long day of play.
Really nice place... Lots of restuarants/bars/clubs and a few shops jotted about too, also great scenery and everywhere is really clean and also close to china town

A one stop shop for lots of attractions. We went out for lunch and had a. Few drinks after visiting the aquarium and wax museum what an amazing place enough to take the whole day visiting great shopping too.
Darling by name & nature. Wonderful place not to missed accompanied with the best lemon meringue pie ice cream I have ever tasted watching the world go by; a little break from the lots to do & see.
Interesting sites. Great place to wander round, with shops, restaurants and other attractions. Restaurants were cheaper than I expected bearing in mind the location

Good in the evening. I was around Darling Harbour on a Saturday evening, before the fireworks display. I needed an activity for the evening, and most of the shops were open, the bars and restaurants were nice and busy and it was a nice place to walk around. It seems like there are plenty of festivals happening around the harbour in the upcoming months. I took the ferry there and back, and the journey back was lovely, with great views.Make sure you check online for the fireworks times, they are worth watching

Harbourside Fireworks Were Best. The Darling Harbour is a great place to just pass the time, and there is something for everyone. Known as the "entertainment area", I enjoy doing shopping, going to restaurants and other entertainment events. If you have a chance, I highly recommend the harbourside fireworks which are absolutely gorgeous!

Great place for a morning stroll with many eateries and a bit of shopping . If the weather is great you simply can't go past darling harbour if you're a tourist or just visiting Sydney. There are many eateries from entry level low priced options to the more extravagant. The shopping is a little ordinary and just seems a bit tired however the maritime museum, aquarium and imax will keep you entertained. Easiest way to get there is walking or public transport. Accommodation is available at a price. You will spend the best part of a day there.

Awesome!!. Darling harbour was one of my favourite places. Unlike the crazy streets of Sydney the kids could safely run and act like kids. They have a huge park awesome for kids of most ages. Lots of restaurants and shopping. Short walk from central station. We spent a whole day their and will be spending our final day in Sydney Tomorrow there!!

Afternoon stroll. My wife and I caught a ferry to Darling Harbour and walked the length of the sea front.There is lots of attractions and restaurants to choose from.It's ideal for a drink inthe early evening after everyone finishes work.The bars get extremely busy at this time.We only spent 1/2 day in the area.It's a modern vibrant area.
Nice for a stroll. Great place to spend a weekend wandering around. Always something to see and do not to mention a cazillion restaurants to choose from.

I love this place. Beautiful sights, lots of shopping, bars, food, takeaways, Aquarian , places to sit & relax have a drink, coffee, icecream , food & take in the amazing views of the water. You can catch a ferry from here too. Lots of hotels at doorstep too. My favourite place in Sydney is darling harbour.

activities galore. There are a lot of attractions in Darling Harbor. We only scratched the surface and walked around Harbourside, watched the street entertainment and watched a movie at Imax theatre. There is so much more to see and do.

Very nice. Thoroughly enjoyed walking around Darling Harbour during our holiday to Sydney last week.The weather was great and even found a Brittish Lolly Shop in the shopping arcade accross the Harbour. Lots of restaurants and seemed reasonably priced when we checked menus on offer outside some of the eateries. We had come specifically for Hard Rock Cafe though.It's a shame the monorail was closed down as we would have loved to experience it and also enjoy not having to walk back uphill from Darling Harbour back to the Sydney CBD!!
Take a Day. Beautiful area, plenty to do and see. Loads of shops and cafes to stop at. Really clean area full of culture and atmosphere.

Fireworks!. Well last two weeks i went to Sydney. So i try my best possible to cover Sydney top attractions. We went to Darling Harbour via Light Rail from Central. Such a calm and peaceful waterfront (comparing to Circular Quay). They do have Fireworks show every Saturday at 2030h. You cannot miss that one. World's largest IMAX 3D cinema also located here.

Such A Darling!. Darling Harbour such a Darling indeed.
Been there twice during Spring & Autumn.
Loads to do here and plenty of eatery places & loads of Asian foods as well.
The best is free wifi along the harbour😊
Just walking distance to paddys market... 👍

Awesome atmosphere!. Great restaurant s, great bars, good shopping.
Fun atmosphere , always something going on, would definitely go back for a girls weekend

Somewhere relaxing amid the bustling city. When you go to Sydney, you HAVE to go to Darling Habour and just experience it. There is so much to do, so much to eat, so many people to meet. It's one of those places you don't get tired of visiting every time you visit the same place. I am not sure what's calming but I think its the tranquil waters amidst all the hustle and bustle around. It's a good place to go for a romantic walk or just a stroll on your own.

Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is very darling indeed! I loved spending my days here, there's lots to see and do, plently of cafes and bars to grab some food and drinks! Even though it's in the CBD it's very chilled and relaxed here and it's nice to get out of the craziness of the Sydney streets to come and chill on the grass or by the water, Every saturday night they do a free friework display which is lovely to watch. I could spend hours here just wondering around or sitting down with a book!
Pretty Cool!. Darling Harbour is pretty sweet, plenty to do and lots of things to see. I enjoyed spending time here, and there are heaps of places to eat and drink.

Okay. I so wanted to like this area. It was clean and close to my hotel but the fireworks were not good and only lasted like 4 mins. My husband and i ate at the Hard Rock Cafe before hand ( don't go...food was horrible and waitress claimed they are entitled to a 10% tip) then we waited for almost 2 hours for the fireworks to start at 8:30. We saw a few good performances on the street but the fireworks to me were not worth it. Trust me being in Aus was my dream come true but the fireworks were nothing to write home about. The restaurants are extremely expensive with nothing getting you under 60 aus for two. For me that is ridiculous. I would rather spend that money on things that will last longer than food.

Fireworks on Saturdays!. Most Saturday nights, the Sydney sky would be lit up with fireworks at Darling Harbour. A great viewing spot would be on the jetty in front of Harbourside, across Cockle Bay. My friend and I sat there and we got a front seat view of the whole fireworks with plenty of space for ourselves. I didn't even notice of the crowd until after the fireworks. Alternatively, Darling Harbour has a lot of restaurants and some of these are said to offer good spots for fireworks watching.

An easy walk.. The pedestrian bridge is an easy walk from hotel's to the Darling Harbour action, even using a cane. There are some of the original bridge supports and a plaque telling about the bridge at one end.

Love the events that go on. If you chose it right this can be amazing such as NYE or christmas or bonfire night and so on. It is gorgeous views and harbour cruises and so on. It is a harbour and along the wharfs are some great performers/artists.

Lots of cafes and restaurants. Not as scenic as Circular Quay, but still has lots to offer. There's lots of attractions such as the IMAX, Aquarium and Maritime museum and there are cafes, restaurants and drinking holes everywhere, Keep walking right down and you'll get yourself into Chinatown which is a nice spot too.

Still worth a visit, if for nothing other than the view and sourvenirs. As the title says, still worth a visit, but has suffered with the short-sighted action of taking down the monorail. Normal city dwellers might not have used it much, but it was very useful for tourists to travel around the CBD above street level and down to Darling Harbour. This is still a good venue for shopping and eating, with a brilliant view of the city skyline from the immediate west. The shops here are still very competitive on their prices and eating is not pricey. Also worth a look nearby is the old Sydney institution of Paddys Markets.

Great day out here. Very good place to visit. We caught the ferry at Circular Quay & it dropped us right at the harbour. We visited Sydney Wildlife & Madame Taussauds. If you do two attractions together you get it cheaper. Both were really interesting. You get to see a lot of Australia's wildlife up close. Whilst there, if you like ribs go to Hurricane's Grill, right on the front, first floor. The most amazing ribs I've ever eaten, huge portions as well. We spent a good three hours there. Plenty of shops to browse around as well. It cost 6 dollars each way for the ferry which is not bad, as you get great views of the bridge & opera house as you sail passed.
Once the construction is finished it will be awesome. Lots to see here, and the playground is awesome for the kids. Once the construction is done it will be an awesome experience for visitors.

Darling Harbour. We had a good time looking around also the Opera House, is vast but lovely to look around in and outside.We looked round all that was on offer also did a boat trip by the opera house. Lovely Ice creams around. sun and hot weather. We also went to Bondi Beach. Manly that was a really nice place to go

Usual suspects............................. You could be anywhere in the world, it is a developed harbour front that now plays host to all the well known fast food chains throughout the world, there is absolutely no originality whatsoever, a totally impersonal place!

Nice place...clean surroundings. It is a must visit on your trip to sydney. Lots of options- aquarium, maddame tussads. Make sure you pick up a day pass to save money or I venture card which has an office at darling harbor

Fantastic place. We spent 6 days here after a 23 day Carnival cruise last week.(Sept. 2014). We stayed at the Raddison Inn Suites which was exceptional, not only for service, but location as well. We wish we would have planned 2 weeks instead of only 6 days. There is so much to do. It's not only a safe area, but exceptionally clean as well. China Town & Pattys market were great, but the walks up & down the warf on both sides were spectacular. Many, many restaurants/ bars & shopping stores. We did the Whale watch as well & highly suggest that attraction. For all tours/ attractions etc., check out groupon/ Syney for some great savings( some up to 75% off). Some dining is quite costly, but look for places like Subway or McDonalds for family savings & get the food to go & find one of many park benches & enjoy your food with a view! Darling Harbor is a fantastic place, don't miss it.

Short visit. Unfortunately, we only had a brief visit to Darling Harbor on our last night in Sydney. We took the ferry from Circular Quay. (Good value, relaxing trip, great views of Opera House & Harbor Bridge.) We were dropped off at King Street Wharf. The area had an abundant number of outdoor cafes and restaurants along the ~ 10 minute walk to Cockle Bay wharf. Cockle Bay had even more restaurant and bar options with indoor/outdoor seating. The aquarium, Madame Tussaud's, and IMAX theaters are located on this side but were closed during our evening visit. We only encountered one open shop (adjacent to the aquarium) that had a nice variety of souvenirs. Most eateries were packed and the place was crawling with with bachelor and bachelorette parties. At 8:30pm on Saturday nights (which our visit happened to fall on), the Harbor produces an ~ 15 min long firework show which was quite enjoyable. We didn't make it around to the other side of the Harbor (Harbourside Shopping Center) so we can't speak to the quality of shopping there. We also regret not making it during daylight hours to visit the Chinese Gardens as we've heard good things. We randomly chose a restaurant for dinner and really regret that choice. I will write a separate review for them - Baia the Italian. (Horrible!!!!! Stay away!) Overall, we enjoyed our stroll through Darling Harbor and wished we had more time/energy to more thoroughly explore the offerings. At night, it's a very vibrant area with mostly twenty-somethings that are dressed in a variety of smart casual and LBD (little black dress) attire.
Darling harbour. Darling harbour is a short boat ride from Sydneys main harbour, water taxis run to and fro. There are planty shops and restaurants to keep you busy at Darling Harbour.

I love this place. I had the pleasure of living by Darling Harbour in 2000 for 3 months and I can honestly say that I love this place!!I rented an apartment in the Grand Mercure (not sure if its still called that) and the hotel back entrance was straight out onto the bridge. In my opinion that place just has the "vibe"! There was an abundance of restaurants and bars, access to the monorail and strolling distance to the city centre.The hotel/apartment block had a roof top pool that overlooked the water. I spent many a days chilling out and watching the world go by,If you are heading to Sydney, head to Darling Harbour and feel the "vibe". Fantastic place!

Great little harbour. Really enjoyed wandering around here in December last year. The christmas decorations were amazing and the collection of boats and ships outside the museum were really interesting to look at, even if you didn't go on board. Lots of great eateries on both sides. Could have spent lots of time here.

Pretty good and lots to eat/do. I stayed nearby in 1888 hotel (see separate review it is excellent). The harbour is a bit of a building site today as it's being redeveloped. It's still pretty good with nice shops and places to eat. Worth a visit and ok to stay nearby. The building works don't get in the way too much.

Snack, Stroll, Wine, Dine.... There is a myriad of things to do here, day or nightHotels abound, as do bars and or restaurants. But you do not need to spend up large, take a packed lunch and watch the harbour, and people.Stroll over the hill and visit the fish markets (well worth it), or meander around and visit the aquarium or martime museum (opposite sides)Many days of the year there are activities on, look out for these great examples of free entertainment

My favourite spot in Sydney . I really like darling harbour, there's so much to to there. IMAX cinema, sea life centre, wildlife centre, waxwork museum, maritime museum and casino. Plus lots of cool bars, it's really nice drinking there as you have an amazing view of the city.

Lots of places to dine and stay. Darling Harbour is a convenient area to stay in Sydney, with a good range of hotel options. It is very easy to walk around the area and safe - I walked backed solo from the CBD about 10pm after dinner one night across the bridge to Pyrmont, and also walked between 5:30-6:30am most mornings and there is always security guards, other people walking etc. You feel very safe.Darling Harbour also has lots of options to have a drink with a view or dine out.
Lots of things to do. Museum, Casino, restaurants are all around the area. Great place to visit for food and attractions. Great variety of food around there too!

Something for Everyone. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit in Sydney. It has a good range of shops, bars, restaurants and attractions within close proximity. Even a casual stroll around the Harbour to take in the sights in the area including the city's skyline is a pleasant way to spend the late afternoon. There is generally a good vibe throughout the area as people enjoy themselves with the options available. Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.

Beautiful. It was filled with people but the place is just full of life and character. Get loads of restaurants there. The sunset against the Maritime Museam was awesome. A nice place for people watching too.
Nice cruise in the harbour. A boat ride in the harbour is a must do - you get great views of the Sydney Opera House and views of the city

Amazing night view!. With the calm waters and reflection, the place transforms into a picturesque photo opportunity. The whole place is lively and has a fun, cool and hip vibe and exudes class. There are plenty of top restaurants within walking distance. Many of noteworthy - hurricane ribs, lindt's and so on. Do your research carefully so you don't miss out the good food!

Great place to walk, eat and visit tourist attractions. Darling Harbour is a very pleasant and picturesque area of Sydney, attractive in and of itself and offering great views of downtown. There is a multitude of restaurants and eateries of all categories - including some themed restaurants such as Hard Rock Café and Margaritaville, as well as the Australian National Maritime Museum, and tourist attractions such as the Sydney Acquarium, IMAX theatre, Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum and the indoor WILD LIFE Sydney Zoo. it is a great place to walk around and to entertain adults and children alike. A walk across the historic bridge that traverses the harbor takes you right into downtown. You should be able to walk to Darling Harbour from many of the popular hotels in Sydney's CBD (Central Business District).
Darling Harbour. Good view. Restaurants and cafes are available. Short walking distance from the Chinatown and the Paddy's Market. Friendship Garden is nearby too.

Lovely Vibrant Area. Our hotel was in the Darling Harbor area, quite the vibrant spot. On our arrival we went for a stroll and it was quite a fun introduction to Sydney. Lots of restaurants and cafes, the Chinese Garden at one end of the Harbor and the Maritime museum at the other end with so much entertainment in between! There is a lovely park, playground for children and fountain. There is also a cinema.The giant inflatable turtle in the harbor was a fun surprise. In the evenings, the bars were bustling with locals drinking after work-happy hour galore. We really enjoyed the fire works show on Saturday night and just people watching.

Went during Australia Day celebrations, loved it!. I was able to go during the Australia Day celebrations and sit right on the Harbour and watch the fireworks and the displays. I absolutely loved it. Lots of food nearby and fun for everyone!

Changing and improving. Having been to Darling Harbour quite a few times, I was surprised to see the exhibition centre gone, and work started on new development. Hopefully it will be good, at the moment it is a bit of a shame to see the large construction site instead of the buildings that were there which always had good events going on. Nice idea to have peep holes in the construction walling so you could see in and watch some progress rather than being a total eye sore. Look forward to seeing it finished.

Beautiful area to stay.. Stayed in the Darling Harbour area for a couple of nights, lots of restaurants bars and places to visit like the maritme museum madame tussauds and Sydney aquarium there are also a range of cruises that depart from here we went on the showboat cruise which included entertainment and meal, which was fantastic. Well worth staying here and Sydney is beautiful at night!
Love it. Always something to do at Darling Harbour. Lots of shopping and dining options, and great attractions close by too. Love the weekend fireworks.

Love Darling Harbour. We visited Darling Harbour a few times over our four day trip and love all the activity there. Loads to do and lots of great restaurants. Leave yourself enough time to spend the day
Romantic Place. A place with lots of good restaurants and nice environment. There is also a nice fireworks display every Saturday night!

Visit at least once...... The Gadigal people are the original inhabitants of Sydney Cove however now Darling Harbour is on the hit list for tourists and day trippers - it's lost touch with how other inlet coves and waterways look in terms of natural beauty.Commercialism, residential high rises, water craft and other concepts to attract visitors have taken control of this beautiful inlet. However It's great visiting (at least once) the Maritime Museum, Aquarium the Friendship Garden, shopping for high end souvenirs or eating at the obligatory eateries.Explore something interesting on their website about the timeline and history of this place and get a better idea how this small inlet was transformed. If overnighting there are several hotel and apartment complexes to admire the pretty lights at night (the Sydney Casino is relatively close too). On the ferry stop across from DH there is a very unique monument called the 'Welcome Wall' outlining our immigrant history - families have a chance to include their names and where they came from - brilliant!We came by ferry but you can also reach it by train/bus (with a short downhill walk) or even by water taxi - the Light Rail from Central Station also has a few stops on the way to Darling Harbour to include Paddy's Market and the Powerhouse Museum - look up their schedule.Enjoy your experience!
Darling Harbour. Great place to stay around Darling Harbour as close to everything. City a short walk Darling Harbour lots of Restaurants close to Ferry access and also Train.

A beautiful promenade. Darling Harbor is a spot you must go; otherwise you cannot say you have been to Sydney. The skyline of the city, the restaurants, the museums and the vessels in the harbor create a beautiful environment you will never forget.
Night lights at Darling. Fantastic night life at Darling harbour. Many food outlets and scenic spots. Saturdays fireworks still captivate many visitors.

Lovely place and thousands of things to do. I had the pleasure to live near to Darling Harbour, because of that I've passed through it everyday so I could enjoy almost everything from it. At Darling Harbour you can just look the CDB in front of you, you can sit down and see the bay, go to some restaurant, eat some ice cream, go to the iMax, feed the birds or just walk and enjoy every second on that beautiful place. Lovely!
Nice spot for a drink and a bite. If the weathers good then great place to people watch while relaxing. Have a beer and grab a bite yes lifes tough, enjoy.

Fantastic. Darling Harbour is a place that you must visit. Having lived in Sydney for a very long time, I can never get enough of going there every weekend if possible. It has great delectable dining experience with varieties of food from most nationalities! It's just a foodie and shoppers haven. As it's a walking distance to Chinatown, which is a stone's throw away it's a great place. Let's just say that a great place to spend time with friends.
Great Attraction!. Great place for couples or families. Very vibrant and easy to get to other points of interest via good ferry services. Easy walk to CBD.

So much to do. Anybody who comes to sydney has got to have a look at Darling Harbour? There is so much going on & so much to do,there are lots of really great places to eat most of them i thought well priced with the occasional one a bit more expensive,but thats up to you!!!! Also around the harbour there is a great place to take young kids for a play at a great park & on a warm day,even alittle water park where the kids were having a ball & dont worry theres lots of places for mums & dads to sit & relax watching there kids in safety. Also a bit further around there are great attractions like sea world,wax museum,australian wildlife etc..... Which i may add are well worth a look in there selves. Across from them (short walk) is a really big Maritime museum which sadly we never had time to see but it will be one of the first things i look at when i return SOON i hope??? Do yourself a favour & go have a look cos its a really great day out!!!!!

Cool and playful, a darling of a place!. I recently returned to Darling Harbour after four years and found a newly renovated place. The Harbour has several playful yet very artistic areas, including swings, fountains, and water-themed parks. Bars, cafés, and restaurants are also on site. It has something for everyone -- couples who can relax and stroll by the Harbour, kids who can enjoy the playground, even business people who can discuss matters over lunch or dinner. And the place has more things under construction! Don't miss it on your next trip to Sydney.
Beautiful Harbour. Just loved walking through Darling Harbour, great atmosphere especially in good weather, lots of restaurants and shopping - just great!

Plenty to do. You can enjoy your visit to Darling Harbour with plenty stuff to do. You can eat, shop, walk or just relax and enjoy the view. It's a cool place to go and it's defiantly a must see place whe. you travel to Sydney
Outstanding Views!. Beautiful views of the harbour. Lots to do for the entire family - walk way, restaurants, mono rail, Imax and pubs. One could spend hours and enjoy the area.

Not much to see. Darling Harbour is the white elephant of Sydney's foreshore ... very touristy without much of genuine interest. Lots of food options but nothing you'd really go out of your way to eat. Cockle Bay opposite is a tiny bit better - but with the closing of Chinta Ria in october 2014, won't have much to offer. Stroll across the old Pyrmont bridge and view it from above - that's about all you beed to do.
Fantastic Tourist Area. Darling harbour is full of nice places to eat and drink. The worlds biggest Imax screen is excellent as are the Whale watching and other tours.

A good place for children and lovers. Darling Harbor is a perfect place for children, who can see wild life, sea life of Australia. It's really an amazing and impressive experience. It's also a good place for lovers. On Saturdays, there are fireworks show. You may enjoy food, wine and music during the date. After dinner, you may have a walk or watch a movie.
awesome. Awesome views and also family friendly Environment, some of fast food chain open 24hour. Near imax, the biggest 3D movie theater.

Plenty to Do. All in one area. Darling Harbour is one of those places for the young and not so young, where you can do plenty or nothing. It has the aquarium, wax works, chinese gardens, shops, restaurants parks, cafe's merry go rounds or open areas to lay in the sun. Whatever your pleasure, you will find soothing here. A Must Visit

Must-visit. Darling Harbour is attractive during day and romantic and fun during evening time. There are many attractions like aquarium, zoo, and IMAX with the world's biggest screen which I was very impressed by. On the left hand side (close to George St.) you will see alot of bars, pubs and cafes also!
Bridge Climb. Fantastic, not scary at all. Well organised and safe. Will do it again. Next time I will do the might climb.

Cheap Day Out. This is a great way to send a sunny day. You can walk around and visit the sites and there is a fun playground for the kids to enjoy.I enjoy walking along the Pyrmont bridge to get from one side to the other. It also provides great exercise.

Such a wonderful place. I just walking around and dinning at waterfront view . It's so fantastic . You can see the big turtle and a lot of boat or you can cruising to see the opera house from darling harbour to circular quay

I love Darling Harbour. What a magical place. We arrived during vivid so the buildings surrounding the foreshore were alight with colour. The bay had it's water and light show that was a must to see. Restaurants and entertainment and shops to delight the senses . Loved the light rail through to Paddys Markets and Chinatown! Will go back next year for sure !!
Something for everyone. Good range of restaurants and Bars and continually refreshed. A Sydney city playground. The district is about to undergo an upgrade of access and exhibition facilities.

Go on Saturday for Fireworks!. Darling Harbour was a great place for stroll. There were many shops selling food/drinks and clothes shops. There was a cinema and bowling centre too. When I was there on Saturday 8pm, there was firework show! Awesome view!
MUST see. you can do a lot of activities. you can do plain strolling and just looking around, get bloated (lots of restos around), have a lot of photo session (of course, if you're a tourist)

Beautiful Place to spend the day. Darling Harbour is a beautiful place to visit with shops, bars, restaurants and the maritime museum. Unfortunately we visited on a day when the HMS Endeavour was out at sea but there were other boats to visit and a submarine which was fascinating. If you buy a "big ticket" for Aus$39 each it allows you access to the Maritime Museum and all the ships, the lighthouse and attractions in dock there. Some restaurants are a bit exclusive and pricy but most are reasonable and there is plenty to see and do inside and out. Parking in the area is very expensive so take public transport if possible. It's further than you realise from the bridge and opera house so don't try and walk it like we did! Bad idea ! And watch out for the seagulls if you're eating outside - they're very accurate with their beaks and you'll lose your food if you're not careful! There is some development taking place at the moment so some areas are closed off but the parkland will be much larger when it's finished and there will be more parking. Get an hour's free wi-fi from Starbucks with any purchase and reception is excellent!

Lots of good restaurants. This is a place you can spend your nights, with lots of good restaurants along the sea. We ate here almost every night during our 5 days stay and always enjoyed good seafood or steaks in different restaurants. There are lots of events along this stretch but thats fine, it just makes it even more fun if theres music. Good for families of course, the Sealife Aquarium is there too, so you could show your kids some cool stuff there ( buy tickets online to avoid the super long queue) and then enjoy great dinner in one of the restaurants.

the place is so nice. when you are in Sydney, australia be sure to stay in the nearby darling harbour hotels like novotels four points. the place is so quite and peaceful and no traffic. you can just walk around the westfield tower. and at the darling harbour there are lots of restaurant besides the sea and you can take some cruises or the sea taxis.

Great area for walking and shopping. My husband and I thought we were going to miss Darling Harbour because we were getting ready to leave the next day for an 18 day cruise home. We decided to jump on the bus at 7AM and go there for Breakfast. We were so glad we did. Lovely area to walk around and pick up those last minute souvenirs to take home. Plenty places to stop and eat. A lot going on, with plenty to do.

Lovely. As it was mid week and pouring rain, there were not many activities happening but it was lovely to eat and stroll around. A wide variety of food outlets and restaurants to cater for all budgets.

fabulous area. This area has lots of charisma. We had dinner close by on our first evening in Sydney and then took a stroll along the nearby bridge, we really enjoyed the beautiful sights of the harbor in the evening. We felt very safe while we were walking as there were lots of other people doing the same. The area is also very busy during the day with lots of sights to see, if we ever return we would like to stay in this area as a base for sightseeing ....
A tourist must-see. Darling Harbour is a Sydney must-see! Many attractions, including the zoo, aquarium, IMAX, and maritime museum. Many nice restaurants and cafes, as well!

Fantastic way to spend afternoon. Darling harbour is a beautiful place to visit in Sydney. Many hotels and restaurants on the water front. A convenient area to with ferries commuting to Circular Quay and the harbour.
darling harbour, sydney. Cafes, bars and shops surround the harbour. Calm, charming and full of characters that made sydney a great liveable place to live in
Lovely. Great views, bars and restaurants. It is a place to hang out and chill. It is really the embodiment of Sydney charm and is a must do.

Fantastic Location. We stayed here in April 2014. The hotel overlooked the harbour so we were delighted. We unpacked and headed straight out, there are many restaurants and bars to choose from (all as great as the next). On the Friday we arrived there was a wonderful fireworks display which we watched while having our dinner. As we were there over Easter we had breakfast in the Lindt Cafe on Easter Sunday :) There is so much to do in this area from all the restaurants to shopping (Harbourside) to The Aquarium and water taxi's over to Sydney Harbour. It is a really great base location

What a welcome. We arrived at Sydney on a Saturday and as our apartment was 200 metres from Darling harbour , we made a bee line for the bars!A great location , with breathtaking vistas all around. We had a great meal at one of the fan restaurants and watched the sun set over the epic skyscraper skyline. The area seemed to fill pretty quickly one it got dark and we soon realised why..... A massive free fireworks show erupted and lit up the night. Must have gone on for 40mins with booms of cheers and applause at the end. Apparently it happens every Saturday night! Only in Sydney eh...... Great.

Beautiful!. We stayed about 5 mins walk from the harbour and kept going back to visit as it was so lovely!! Great views, shops, bars and restaurants! I loved the little train which took you from one end of the harbour to the other (only $5), which was great as every now and again the driver would stop and give you some information about what was going on etc. I had probably the best steak I have ever eaten in the Angus steakhouse there, and I wasn't the only one of our party to say that!
Just so pretty. Brillant place especially at night, clothes shopping, food shops, well priced,just so pretty at night with lights on water, fireworks most Saturday nights too

Perfect area to spend a family day!. Fantastic area with plenty to do. Our family enjoyed taking a break to play at the fun playground. The shops in the harbour area are great, too. Safe and affordable family fun - loved it!

Wonderful place to visit and stay!. We were staying in a hotel in the centre of Darling Harbour so we spent a few days here exploring. We absolutely loved it as it's got everything! Wonderful bars and restaurants serving different types of foods from all over the world, cafe's, aquarium to mention just a few things to do. We caught a few harbour cruises from here too which was so convenient especially with a 2 yr old. The shops here aren't too bad but I wouldn't just come here to go shopping. Everyone seemed friendly and helpful. It doesn't take long to walk to Sydney CBD from here.
