We loved Darling Harbour so much, we booked into another hotel for the last few days of our holiday as we felt we had more exploring to do! Definitely worth a visit if you are in Sydney!

The best place to choose for a stay in Sydney. This is one of the best, well connected places to stay in Sydney-The Darling Harbor. The harbor is bustling and crowded on weekends and evenings. Yet, it has some of best eating joints in Sydney. The connectivity to various beaches and the Circular Quay is great. If you're a shopaholic from Asia, Sydney is probably not the best of shopping hubs-choose asian getaways for shopping.A must visit are the Opera House, Blue Mountains, Bondi Beach and Manly Island and Beach.While Bondi is connected through bus services, Manly being an island, can be reached via ferry services only. Bondi is crowded, but a beautiful beach with chilly waters. For secluded and quiter beaches, you could check the local maps and then choose the bus routes accordingly. There are a number of options Sydney has to offer for beaches.The Opera House is a must see for all. You could reach the Opera House by taking a train for Circular Quay. The Sydney Harbour Bridge is right there too. If you're an enthusiast and travelling sans babies, you could try climbing the bridge too.For those travelling with kids, the sea world at Darling Harbor is a must visit. Sydney has some beautiful parks too, like the Hyde Park, again a walk away from Darling Harbor. Dinner is early at most restaurants in Sydney- 7 pm is the ideal time. Most restaurants close down early and the streets are desrted by 9-9:30 pm. Best to be back to your room by that time, to avoid miscreants.

Great location but its starting to become crowded!. Working in the area i have seen the area change alot with time. Darling harbour is becoming smaller each year and the Sydney Harbour Foreshore Authority are to blame. You can still find decent shopping at the Harbourside complex including a range of food options. My advice is visit Darling Harbour early and avoid the major crowds!

Lovely Darling Harbour. We have not been to Sydney for several years and could not recognise Darling Harbour. However we loved the changes and enjoyed the walk from where we got off the ferry to the Chinese Gardens. It was well worth going into these gardens which we thorougly enjoyed. We have a very similar tourist attraction in our home city of Dunedin, NZ, but the Sydney gardens are much larger. When visiting Sydney, it is a must to spend some time walking around at Darling Harbour.

Tourist hot spot. You can't really come to Sydney and not venture down to darling harbour. It is full of over priced places to eat and drink but gives you a pretty good view. Saturday night (every Saturday) they have a pretty good firework show, bit of course expect crowds

Love the vibe, bars and restaurants. I love Darling's harbour for its restaurants and bars. Some places get very busy in the evening, so reservation is a good idea. I wouldn't go there for shopping, but just to enjoy the atmosphere and have a good time. It has got very different feel to the Rocks, and I like them both. It's a bit more relaxed and casual, but really enjoyable.

Plenty to do in Darling Harbour.. It has a swag of things to do and an easy walk to the Sydney underground.Just wandering the harbour for views and food is enjoyable, then there are the attractions such as the Powerhouse Museum, Aquarium, Maritime Museum, Chinese Garden, harbour cruises.I think it's easy to lose a day in Darling Harbour.

Touristy but worth a visit :) and I don't mind the UGG Boot Shops ;) . Lovely place to spend your precious time with family and loved ones :) relatively safe, nice people everywhere...tons of shops and beautiful restaurants.. Lovely atmosphere and nice aquarium to keep the children happy :) Regarding the UGG boots shops, since we're coming all the way from a tropical place and try to find a nice boots was quite a struggle in the past (every women should have at least one nice boots even in a hot tropical island...because fashion) finding plenty of UGG boots shops as an alternative around the area (before heading to big W or Pitt Street Mall) was a pretty nice experience :)

Worth a visit!. Darling Harbour is definitely worth a visit if you're in the area. It's a beautiful area with great views. There are many attractions in the vicinity as well as shops and eateries. Great place to spend the afternoon, would recommend!

Favorite place to visit in Sydney!. Our family visited Sydney Australia last summer.We found this little harbor while sightseeing. It has a very nice two-story mall, rides for small children, food, a movie theatre, and an animal sanctuary. It is beautiful in the evening and a definite must-visit for any trip to Sydney, Australia.

Give the shopping a miss. Really touristy shops at darling harbour. If I see another UGG Boot shop I'll scream!
We were there for about 15 minutes - as long as it takes to walk from one end of harbourside to the other and back. It was 15 minutes too long!

Good place to go if you're short of time. Darling Harbour has restaurants, shopping, the Maritime Museum and Aquarium, IMAX cinema and the ferries. As well as the sparkling waters of the Harbour. For first time visitors it's a good place to stroll round looking for a place for a meal, soaking up the sun and the view. For families the museums and cinema have plenty of things to see and do - and the Food Hall for a burger and ice cream. And the ferry ride from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay takes half an hour and gives you a feel for the space and beauty of the Harbour. If you only have a couple of days in Sydney, this packs a lot in a single venue.

Not a fan. Darling Harbour is a great idea but just doesn't quite pull it off as a great destination or attraction. Too commercial and touristy - not somewhere you pass through - you need to decide to go there - The best thing about Daring Harbour is the Restaurants - you can't go past Nick's Seafood for the best Snapper you will ever eat

Food and fireworks. We went to the Hard Rock Cafe on Darling Harbour for dinner one evening and had a lovely table by the sliding glass doors leading onto the outside deck. The food was lovely, far too much though, and as we sat there, a fabulous firework display was held I. The harbour itself, making it a truly magical night :)

Worth visiting. Sights are good plenty of places to eat from the small cafes to the 5 star restaurants ....you ca. Get a ferry to circular quay where you can visit the opera house and the rocks Great location and atmosphere You can walk across the bridge to the Sydney aquarium and wild world which are both a must to see Once over the bridge take a walk down to king street wharf where they are plenty of places to eat along the waters edge with beautiful views of Sydney harbour .Visit star casino if at darling harbour worth a visit to seeThe best restaurants are on the on the ground floor not actually in the Casino itself as I didn't rate the restaurants inside the main area ..

Shop till you drop!. We took a cab to Darling Harbor but you could take the ferry too. The harbor is lined with many shops, restaurants and a movie theater. There is a great deal of construction going on around the water but they have activities going on day and night along the waterside. We just went there to eat at the Hard Rock Cafe and to go to the aquarium.I think once the construction is complete it won't be as confusing.

Gorgeous View. I had a wonderful experience there with my family. The fireworks were grand. But I think the most beautiful of all is near the sunset. The view is just unbelievable. I really want to sit beside the Harbour for the whole day!

Scenic lights view of CBD. Located at the city centre, this is also another good place to hangout with family and friends regardless of the occasion. More restaurants crowd the area and with lots of entertainment, you can never get tired here. Ferry cruise trips are also available. Various artists show their performances that you may or may not donate money to.

Lots here for the visitor. Even with the convention center all torn up during July of 2014 (and it still has a long way to go before the work will be done), there is a lot happening on Darling Harbour, in terms of things to see and do. There are lots of food choices here, but like Circular Quay, they tend to be expensive and aimed at the well-heeled, or tired tourist! If you're in the area and looking for lunch, the best (and tastiest) deals close by can be found in Chinatown.

A MUST WHEN YOU GO TO SYDNEY. Darling Harbour would have to be one of the best attractions in Sydney. Plenty of great eateries and lots of shops and sights to see. You can spend at least 3-4 hours on the harbour and wont want to leave.

Good by day or night. I had not bothered to recently visit Darling Harbour (until now!) and regret the lack of attention I'd previously given it.It is an enjoyable (though touristy) place to visit day or night (provided the weather is good).I loved Pyrmont Bridge that once had lifting spans. The lift house is preserved on the bridge.There is a good selection of restaurants although Harbourside shopping centre is 'just another mall.'
Beautiful view. Darling Harbour is amazing at night. Loved it! Definitely come here if in Sydney, and they have fireworks on Saturdays. Great city!
Fantastic. I just LOVED Darling Harbour, something for everyone! Great shops, Check out the fudge shop, toffee apples to die for! cool food court. Water fountains, grass, good views, plenty to see!
What a beautiful place. I love Darling Harbour. Its not like Docklands in Melbourne, no wind, calm and quite. But yet, lots of good restaurant. Every time I go to Sydney I must go there for dinner.

Lovely place to visit. We really enjoyed the hub of darling harbour.The fireworks at night lit up the cockle Bay AreaWe went to a few bars and museums, and generally enjoyed the sunshine in Cockle bay.The light rail was handy to get back to our hotel too

Commericially developed, but worth it if you have time. The Harbour is nice, but doesn't offer the same views as Circular Quay (which I'd recommend seeing first if you only have time for one). Tons of modern restaurants, stores, museums, and tourist activities. It felt like a really big, nice, shopping mall. Not so different from South Street Seaport in NY or the Inner Harbor in Baltimore.

Fireworks at Darling Harbour. We were fortunate to patron one of the restaurant at night and had an opportunity to enjoy a fascinating fireworks by the bay . My 16 months old boy watched with astonishment . He likes it anyway.

Very Touristy - but worth a look.. This is tourist central, so if you only have a couple of days in Sydney then it is worth a look. You'll find the Hard Rock Cafe, Aquarium, Madam Tussuads, Casino and (currently!) the world's biggest iMax cinema. The harbour is lovely to hang out on and watch the world go by. Watch out for the jelly fish coming into the harbour - you can't go in the water, but there are so many of them that crowd in instantaneously, it is incredible. Also, there are fireworks all year round on the Saturday evenings - worth hanging around for!
Family weekend adventure in Darling Harbour. Fantastic place to walk around with the children, diverse food options, attractions, ferries, Pyrmont Bridge...has something for everyone!

Great place to stay. We stayed at the Ibis on Shelley St, King St Wharf.Darling Harbour is the perfect location to stay as it situated in the perfect position.Ferries are very frequent and on time, the ambience is brilliant and it is nice to just stroll around for exercise or leisure.

A must visit part of Sydney. A great visitor destination year round, with various events and festivals (small and large) held throughout the year. Be sure to check out the Saturday night fireworks (year round). There's lots of restaurants and bars, Festival Place Shopping Centre, the Maritime Museum as well as the Aquarium, Sydney Zoo (not to be mistaken for the much larger Taronga zoo), the World's largest IMAX cinema and Madam Tusauds.Tip - in day time if the weather's good (it usually is) and you enjoy a walk you can walk from Darling Harbour along to King St Wharf, through the Baranagroo development, and up through Walsh Bay and under the south section of the Bridge and through to The Rocks. About 2-3 km.Note - just now there's some construction works in Darling Harbour due to the redevelopment of the exhibition and convention centre but it's fairly well screened off.
Beautiful fireworks. We went to darling harbor on Saturday night and there was fireworks performance. The fireworks last for about 10 minutes.

Excellent for night photography. Night lights were stunning. C curves are possible - but there are little pillars around, so it may not be possible to take nice photos. There's also a lot of good food around.

Darling harbour. So many things to do and see there. Beautiful scenery. Wax works aquarium cruises restaurants bars night clubs. Maritime museum and lots more. Cruises around harbor to view our beautiful harbour. A must see.
Darling Harbour treat. So many restaurants and bars to choose from, great shopping and I loved the winter theme. We went during the day but had to go back at night to explore the nightife

After shopping stay for the fireworks. Darling Harbor is a very touristy area with shops, bars restaurants, some great museums. What's extra nice is the fireworks just after sundown. Wonderful display, so find a table with a view and enjoy a drink or meal or just stand on the sidewalk for a good view.

Popular. Haven't driven there, but access by ferry is excellent. Two ferry wharves... one at the western side at the Maritime Museum, which is a 'must see' for any maritime/navy type person, also on the second floor there is a shopping mall. The other ferry wharf is on the Eastern side, giving access to many bars and restaurants, also the Aquarium and Madame Tussaud's wax museum. Darling Harbour is a very popular place, especially during school holidays, and yesterday (Sunday) there were several groups doing 'street theatre'.
If you like chocolate. Very nice place to go. Lots of restaurants and cinema, with a beautiful view. You can eat and drink a delicious chocolate.

Best plase to visit. Best attraction to visit in Sydney as Sealife, Wildlife and Madame Tuassads is situated here. We took the captain cook hop n hop cruise with the Sydney pass. U can use for 24 hours. Walk to the entertainment centre and you will pass by playground, Sydney winter programmes all the way.

Surprise, Surprise. If you haven't visited the Harbour in the last few years, you have missed out on a number of new attractions. The Harbour is clean and well policed, generally full of friendly locals and tourists and cries out for more.
Cool Yule festival simply awesome. Fabulous festival for children in the city. Ice skating, fireworks, snow cannons, snow pit and icebergs, it was a little piece of wintery bliss in July.

Excellent. What can I say I have been going to darling harbour for years and it never disappoints , it has a magical feel just like sydney harbour and the opera house. Very lucky to live in this great city.

Perfect take-off point for anyone traveling to Sydney. The Darling Harbour is officially one of my favorite places in Sydney and we were lucky to be staying just a few meters away from it during our recent trip to the city. Darling Harbour is lined with restaurants, pubs, cafés and I guarantee you will never run out of gastronomic options in this area - some of them are very reasonably-priced even. You can take a relaxing stroll along the harbour in the morning and just admire the beauty of the ferries and water taxis docked here. And just when you think it can't get any prettier than how it is in daylight, Darling Harbour will take your breath away at night, when all the lights are reflected on the water and the whole stretch is just vibrating with cool music coming from the shops and restaurants. At Cockle Bay Wharf, you will find the famous Lindt Café and after just a few metres, you will find Madame Tussaud's, the Aquarium/SeaLife and WildLife - and IMAX, too. If you love taking photos, you will surely find great subjects to photograph at (the) Darling Harbour.
Always something to do. Soo many restaurants and sights to see along Darling Harbour, my friends and I spent most of our time here. Always something to do and see

The greatest night view I've ever seen. I truly recommend the night view of Darling harbour. It's fantastic.It may be very, very good when you just sit on the deck and look at the sea. I've heard Starbucks is very good point to enjoy the night view of Darling harbour, but I couldn't find that. That is just one regret of Darling harbour.

Lots of restaurants + nice stroll. The Darling Harbour is nice during the day and it is magnificent during the night. Espcecially the Sat evening firework. One should walk all around the harbour and enjoy the sea breeze and the surrounding restaurants. Or take another 5 minutes walk to Chinatown! It's touristy, but worth it!

Great Central Area for Things to do in Sydney. The Darling Harbour area contains more of the tourist items to visit while in Sydney. The Darling Harbour area is on the far side of Cockle Bay, but is the general area for a lot to do.Sea Aquarium, Wildlife Exhibit, Madam Tussad's, IMAX, Maritime Museum, one of the two Ferry areas of Sydney, shopping malls, hotels, restaurants, water taxi's, etc. There is so much contained in this area that you could easily spend 1-2 days here. I will write separate reviews for the activities that we visited.Most things shut down early for American Standards. Most activities are up and running by 9AM, but shut down from 5-7PM. We spent one full day in this area, and wish we had more time. Parking is easy to find on this side of the Bay, and there are several of the large hotels. Reserve your parking in advance, and you will get a much better rate than a per hour rate. This also gives you a nice gps address to target, as downtown Sydney has no shortage of traffic, and exits.Awesome area!!!! A short walk across Pyrmount Bridge (scenic by it's own), and your on the edge of the downtown, and a short walk to the Tower Eye.

a bit of fun.. We loved the walk and all the things to see as well as the fireworks.We greatly enjoyed our dinner and ice cream.It is disappointing that the monorail is gone and no service has been made to replace it as the construction made it a very long walk back to our car. During the day there is the little people mover trains and perhaps something like that could be there for special nights too.
Darling harbour attractions. Cosmopitan venue with many attractions for both young and old. Excellent eating places well within the normal price range for Sydney.

Beautiful as ever, lovely to stroll around. Darling harbour is a really nice place to take a leisurely stroll by yourself or with friends and families. It offers nice view, sunshine and breeze that reminds you how great it is to be in Australia! There;s quite a lot to be see, Chinese garden of friendship, Hard rock cafe, maritime museum, sea life, wild life and Madame Tussaud museum etc. Plenty of eateries too. One can easily make a day out of it. Easy access from China town.
Fun. Kids loved the free slide also loved the lights. Great place to visit in the school holidays with the kids. Big ice skating ring

A must while in Sydney!. Each time I go back to Darling Harbour, there is always something new, first time I was there was twenty eight years ago.Each time we go back it has changed (eg) new restaurants and shops etc. at the moment there is still construction going on, but hey that those no stop you for walking around etc.There are plenty of different places to eat and drink, and to shop, plus tourist attractions like the Maritime Museum. We went there this time on a Staturday in early June the" Harbour" was still very busy with couples and family groups.the place is a mad house on Sundays! there is something for everyone at Darling Harbour so if you are a first time visitor to Sydney and have a spare day this is this place to GO!
Great place to visit. Every time we go to the city we end up at darling harbour, plenty of places to eat at or to stop & have a pre dinner drink or just to walk around .

Mecca for tourists. We didn't do any shopping at Darling Harbour but it looked like there was plenty to be done.Lots of tourist attractions including a Wildlife place.Madame Tusauds and Sea Life.Expensive but good way to spend the day.
vibrant Darling Harbour. always love Darling Harbour with its activity, lovely bars & restaurants, the atmosphere is always upbeat with many options to eat & drink at various prices
Winter Festival. The ice skating, hot potato on a stick, pretty lights display and fireworks on the Saturday night made this a great place for families to visit.

Darling Harbor. This is a great must see Harbor. They have waterfront restaurants, bars, museum, movie theater. and plenty of street entertainment. There are party boats and tour boats you can go out on. The harbor cruise and lunch is a good one. You can spend all day and evening at Darling Harbor. Evening there are bands and music all over the harbor.

Superb area to relax, to eat and to drink.. Darling Harbour is a well developed mecca for tourists and locals alike. It is extremely well set out with a multiplicity of attractions for young and old. The Maritime Museum is excellent as is the Aquarium. There is a great number of bars and restaurants with terrific views and covering most tastes. A variety of tours is on offer and the Harbour Tour and the Hop on Hop off ferry are good value, the first sedate and the second quite speedy. It is a great walk around the harbour inlets of Darling Harbour with lots of seats to stop and have a rest apart from the cafe and restaurant seating. This area is well worth a visit.

A weeknight is nice and quiet with city lights aplenty. We went to the Darling Harbour part from where you cross the bridge down Market street to Darling Harbour. As it was a weeknight, few people around but plentiful restaurants offering wide array of choices. Also within the complex are a fair few shop and prices seemed compeititve.

Great way to spend the day. If the weather is fair this is a great place to spend the day, lots to look at and do and a huge choice of restaurants (Nicks is good if you like fish) or grab a coffee and people watch! At night it has a totally different feel walk across the bridge and take in the lights and fire works if you are lucky!

Australia Day Weekend. Stayed only a 5 minute walk to Darling harbour.
There are many restaurants and cafes for eating and drinking.
Several attractions including the Australian National Maritime Museum.
Very easy to reach other points of interest around Sydney.
The fireworks performed in Darling Harbour for the Australia Day Celebrations was sensational and well worth the effort to attend.

Rocking night. This place is very vibrant for nightlife, either you can just hang around the harbour or choose to visit a pub or a bar. Loads of eateries around & all kinds of food. Many attractions like Madam tussauds , aquarium etc. Along with adults, kids will love it too

Lots of hustle and bustle. Darling Harbour offers the visitors plenty of shopping and eating options and is centrally located. The entire view of the Sydney skyline and the walk by the water is breathtaking. There are private water taxis that you can rent for a group of four to take you around town but they are expensive at AUD$160+. One can easily spend hours walking around admiring the city's beauty. A must see spot for any tourist.

This place was buzzing. Our accommodation was overlooking Darling Harbour so we spent a lot time here. There are a lot of dining options to choose from. Some great shopping can be experienced inside the Harbour town shopping centre which also had its own food court. The shops were open until 9.00 each night we were there. We were also lucky enough to experience a wonderful fireworks display on the Saturday night which was part of a winter festival. A portable ice skating had also been set up as part of the festival as well. Darling Harbour has so much atmosphere with so much to do. Highly recommend a visit
aquarium. Great place to visit with the grandkids, interesting and educational. Buy your tickets beforehand to save the lineup

Delightful and Leisurely Wakk @ Darling Harbour. My family and I enjoyed our leisurely walk from Chinatown to Darling Harbour as we stopped by at the playground for kids as well as captured some shots. There's a the miniature fountain nearby, to the delight of the kids. Darling Harbour is beautifully spacious and with a cooling walk during winter June, it was a pleasant experience.

Something for everyone. Loved Darling Harbour. Many fabulous places to eat at reasonable prices, either for a meal or a quiet drink while taking in the views. Plenty of shopping on one side along with loads of activities for the kids if you are going as a family. The Aquarium is first class and well worth a visit. Water taxis that can take you to the Opera House or Luna Park etc. run from the harbour. The water taxis are cheap and a fun way to see the bridge, opera house .... There is a Maxi Theatre which sounded amazing but the times didn't suit us this particular trip. Plenty of accommodation options or a 10 minute walk from China Town. Will definitely revisit next trip.
Great location. Plenty to do and great restaurants. Try a walk in the morning it's so peaceful at that time with few people to interrupt the tranquil morning

Family friendly visit.. This is a very family friendly location with a great selection of dining. It is a very scenic and relaxed area of Sydney with access to many public transportation options. The aquarium and wildlife world are both here and many other attractions including the casino and paddy's markets within walking distance. There are usually always street performers and special events including fireworks during school holidays and public holidays.

Wonderful eating places overlooking the water. So much for everyone, playgrounds, Chinese Gardens, restaurants, bars, great for people watching. Maritime Museum is worth a couple of hours, especially if you have children.

Interesting and exciting. We were lucky that Vivid Festival was going on. There was a light show and fireworks on a friday. So much to see. A lot of good restaurants and bars. This area is more of the high end. Very interesting and exciting. You can walk around or just sit down on the steps and listen to the music playing nearby. I feel in love with the place.
Plenty to do. Lots of nice restaurants and cafes in the area and plenty of activites. My 8 year old loved the Saturday night fireworks
Fun. Great place to sit outside and enjoy watching everyone. A lot of great place to eat. Very convenient to walk around.

Sydney-Darling Harbour we are Here. Great Day -Excellent Interest to fill your Day- Very Relaxing Atmosphere- Fun & Exciting Day Lots to See & Do Lots of Different Interests to Suit Everyone-Families-Friends

Sydney Harbour Break. If you do nothing else on your trip to Sydney, take a trip on one of Sydney's old double-decker ferries (partly for heritage value, partly so you can sit outside). Whether you are a tourist or on business, give yourself an hour or so's break and go down to Circular Quay, find which ferry is going next, buy a ticket and go. And sit outside. If you are tight for time, the Neutral Bay ferry is one of the best for this bit of R and R as the round trip takes only half an hour. Unless the rain is pelting down you enjoy spectacular views of the Bridge, city Opera House etc: get some time in the fresh air to clear your head; and have a true Sydney experience as these are working, commuter ferries and not tourist attractions. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED to all first-timers to Sydney. I have recommended to overseas friends when they are visiting and to a man/woman they have said the ferry trip was a highlight. And although I have been visiting Sydney several times a year for many years I still try to make time for a ferry trip when I am in town,
Great stroll. Strolled around Darling Harbour.Lovely sunny day and plenty of choice for great food.Walk to Star or back to Chinatown or catch the ferry to the quay.

Under construction - watch this space. Enjoyed the walk and speculated on the changes being made. It's obviously an attraction for families on the weekend.But restaurants target the tourist rather that the "repeat customer". I doubt they would survive in the suburbs.

Excellent attraction. Plenty of restaurants and cafés, shopping, IMAX theatre, lounges and bars ....all in a beautiful and scenic site. Other tourist attractions included the aquarium, etc. and you can catch a ferry to other Sydney points of interest. Definitely worth a visit.

Walk, eat, drink and enjoy. On our recent trip to Sydney we spent some time in the Darling Harbor precinct. Lunch at Baia Italian, drinks at King Street Brewhouse and breakfast at Cockle Bay were all delightful. It would be difficult not to find somewhere to eat, drink and relax in this area

Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour with lots of place to dine and drink during the whole day and night, plenty of shops to explore, Nite life is great, places for children to exploe and have fun, or the whole family can just walk around the harbour, A old Manly ferry is moored in the harbour permantly take a tour and also the ferry is a resturant. Maritime Museum only afew mins walk from Darling Harbour.
Must see is in Sydney. Great place for a walk in a sunny or cloudy day. There are restaurants and snack bars and the sound of the birds and water is soothing.
Great location. Plenty of good restaurants and relaxed friendly feel great for families. Aquarium very interesting and informative.

Go there for Australia Day!. Definitely go! Went here a lot when I was living in Sydney, really nice atmosphere, some great bars and restaurants and very pretty. We went there for Australia day and it was amazing, the fireworks came off boats and looked fantastic, almost equalled watching the New years ones over the bridge and Opera House.
Lots to do. Many things to see and do at darling Harbour including Australian Maritime museum as well as shops eateries and the Aquarium

Great part of Sydney. It's not that touristy, so don't be afraid. There are some great spots to eat and have a drink, the fireworks on the weekend are very cute, and there are lots of lovely areas to explore around the harbour (including the gardens). Sad to see the old convention centre torn down, I hope the new one isn't too tacky. The mall is looking a bit tired now, having said that, but nothing a bit of renovation wouldn't fix, rather than tear down and start again. Lovely to walk around day or night. Agree the train should be free - I don't see how you can pay for something so daggy. And the monorail will be missed, as much as Sydney hated it, but Darling Harbour isn't quite the same without the poor old thing. Can get a bit tiresome with the 20-somethings after dark (once they learn how to drink, they'll be a lot more tolerable) but there are plenty of nice, cosy places to relax.

Maritime Museum. plenty to see and do, good access for disabled people and the maritime museum is great and relaxing, take your time and get to see as much as you can as you will find out plenty of stuff that you didn't know about Australia and Captain Cook

Great relaxing day trip. We took an excursion day trip to visit the Harbor. It is quite unique as been the smaller harbor next to the bay harbor, it is charming with plenty of restaurants, boutique, and coffee shops to walk around and spend the day
Darling Harbour. Just awesome. Will be going back to explore more :) I do think the train should be free though as it can be a long walk,
Go in Summer. Darling Harbour is a must see while in Sydney. Great Restaurants and shopping, beautiful Harbour and Mono Rail stop.

Beautiful area. We stayed at the very end of the Darling Harbour precinct and used the walkways everyday. No matter what time of the day or night there were a lot of people around, dining, drinking or just sitting looking at the water. Easy walk to Fish Markets, Star and the city. It is easy to spend many hours there the are is huge.
Sydney's gem. Nice place to stroll around during the day, watch some street entertainment, look at some ships near the ship museum, .... Beautiful place to have diner in the evening.

Its Darling. Walked through the area during a winter festival. I arrived on Sunday and missed the regular Saturday fireworks. Home to the Aquarium, Madame T. wax museum, Maritime museum and more. A leisurely walk from George Street and the QVB.
Have lunch here. Many restaurants, cafes and shops to choose from to have lunch while spending the day sightseeing. Just a short walk from Sydney Harbor.

Glad to see its getting a face lift. A good location that sydneysiders should be proud of having as it offers so much potential. The area is undergoing a major facelift that is long overdue. Worth a visit and definately go there to see all the new works that are in progress once they are finished in about 18 months time. They should have had a live site set up like in the past for the world cup.

enjoyable. darling harbor is a must for any tourist, great bars and places to eat, wander over to star city and visit zumbo, sensational! The maintenance works happening are a little distracting but still wort a visit.

An easy walk. Go over the foot bridge and you have a lovely area to stroll around, we went to the Maritime Museum and enjoyed it. It's a cheap entry fee for the basic museum or you can pay extra to go on to the naval ships. The food court is a bit blah, nothing exciting and very busy at lunch time. A bit over priced compared to other eating areas in Sydney. Better places for lunch than there.

Ah well, an entertainment place. My experience of Darling Harbour was one of an entertainment place with a lot of nice scenery, maritime settings, nice attractions, urban life. A nice place, clean, fun, risk-free. And maybe a little bland. Too much nice.

Great Base for Exploring Sydney. 9D Cinema, Flight Simulator, Laser Tag, Maritime Museum, an easy walk to Chinese Garden of Friendship, Ferries to Circular Quay, Sydney Eye, ChinaTown, Powerhouse Museum
Aquarium. It was awesome. The best day and I felt like a little kid. I was with my two childhood friends I grow up with. Mary and Kellie. I was amazing.

A little bit of magic for visitors. Love Darling Harbour. Love meeting up with family there and experiencing the atmosphere during the day and the lights and entertainment at night. A must do for visitors to Sydney
Darling Harbour. We loved it. We went to Madame Tuassards and a wildlife park. We had lunch on the waterfront and took a cruise around the harbour to the zoo.

Wonderful area!. Visited during Vivid festival, we stayed at the Ibis, which was so convenient for travelling to all the many events. Such a great vibe around this area, walk to Star casino, city, shopping, China town, Opera house etc. Absolutely love it!
The retail therapy needs updating!. Darling Harbour shopping precinct is looking a little tired and not what I feel international shoppers would like, could really do with a revamp.

Whatever you need!. Darling Harbour has every entertainment and food option you might want: a great selection of restaurants, shopping, the aquarium, the maritime museum, and the foot bridge. Really a great place to stroll and have dinner on a nice evening.

Winter Festival Austrlia - Ice Skating. Terrible! I was left BLEEDING on their faulty makeshift carpet floor before getting my skates. It took 10 minutes for an employee to actually asisst after I had practcally faceplanted into the floor. To make matters worse there was no visible First Aid Booth. I'm just happy I didn't get a blade in my face!And no- no one from the Winter Festival Coroprate Office has contacted me, as promised! This happened 20/6/14People please becareful as this venue has not reviewed the Health and Safety Laws.

Spoilt for choice. So many restaurants and cafes that it's really hard to choose which one to eat at! The views are lovely, the shopping centre has a great variety of stores, and the fireworks every Saturday night are an added bonus.
nice and relaxing atmosphere. this place is nice and even better on lazy afternoons or early evenings. the sights are good and food is available in abundance. will go back again.

Very nice spot by the water. Whether you're looking for food, drinks, shopping, a museum, or even to catch a movie (IMAX) - Darling Harbour has it all right there for you. It's easy to get to (I stayed at ParkRoyal most recently) and has plenty to choose from. I enjoy Blackbird Bar and the Maritime Museum (among other places) and the fact it's an 8-10mins walk to The Star

Darling Harbour. While visiting Sydney from the States, Darling Harbour is a must see especially as evening sun sets upon the area and the lights appear a lovely walk we had. We stopped at Jimmy Buffets to enjoy a beverage before our walk back to the hotel. Romantic.
Must do!. Darling Harbour has much to offer with a huge array of eateries, tourist and shopping venues but best of all the People Mover!

Lots to do.. Lots of lovely places to eat. Great places for children to play. The little people mover trains were fun and gave you a good overview of where everything was.
The Winter festival attractions were good and we enjoyed a great fireworks display.

WOW! Beautiful and Entertaining. We stayed at a hotel on Darling Harbour, and the views were simply amazing. Convenient to many things and the wharf area is hopping all of the time.
We were lucky enough to see the fireworks, and while short in duration, they were still pretty neat

Best destination for dinner. Imagine a place that’s always open, always pleased to see you and always looking for bigger and better ways to have fun. This is what you get every time you come to Darling Harbour.

Winter Festival. Had fun at darling harbour during the winter festival lots of fun to just walk around and take heaps of photos fun to pretend we were at the snow with the bubble machines watched people ice skating and took more photos in the tent with the lit up trees etc it was also really fun to walk across to circular quay and through the rocks and take a ferry back at night lots of great photo ops when with family and friends. Have a great time and if it all gets a bit busy at darling harbour go and take in the lovely Chinese friendship garden for a small entrance fee it's a little slice of peace in a busy location.

Great place. I did a cruise along the harbor during the vivid festival, which gave me some good views of the Harbor Bridge and Opera House. After that went to some of the great bars in there. All of them pretty good.
Buzzin. Visited here when Vivid 2014 was happening. Great atmosphere. The place was alive with activity. So glad we were in Sydney when this was happening. Wld have hated it if we had missed it.
Beautiful harbor. Great place for walking, cafe life, playgrounds for kids and aquarium was great too. Easy access to ferries and water taxis, a wonderful place to choose a hotel for your stay.

Worth the visit.. Draling harbour was lovely,it was a great place to send time.It has plenty to look at and if you cant be botherd walking you can jump on a little train and ride around for 5.00. There is a food court and resturants,a cinema ,and other attractions there,easy to get around from by water taxi or ferry and on some saturdays there is a fireworks display that really wont disapoint ,but beware there will be loads of people,all in all ,worth a visit.

Great place at night. Darling Harbour is a success story as far as restaurants are concerned - it is difficult to get a table at a restaurant on Saturday nights. The vibe is good with views of the water and the lights on the water look great.I feel it has a better atmosphere than Circular Quay which will suffer with the closure opf restaurants to extend the overseas terminal.
Tacky and Commercial. Really disappointed with Darling Harbour. It was really distasteful and overcrowded with families. Not exactly a great place for a romantic dinner date.

Interesting place. When you walk across a footbridge to get there you can see many hotels, and restaurants there. Hard Rock cafe is located at the far end in a shopping center. After I crossed the bridge I spotted a Swiss ice cream Movenpick which also operates hotels in Switzerland. You can take a nice leisuirely walk by the water , and pick a cafe to dine at there.
Popular area. After Sydney harbour this is good to see Interesting but touristy shopping mall but plenty of nice restaurants & an Imax cinema there
Love the atmosphere. Its a bit crazy at the moment with all the works going on, but I love Darling Harbour, it has some great restaurants. It is a little sad that the monorail has gone now.
Interesting. There's lots to do in the area. We went to the Aquarium on one side and the Maritime Museum on the other, accessible by the foot bridge. Many restaurants and gift shops too.

Great kids play area in a scenic location. If you find yourself in downtown Sydney with a seven year-old who needs to burn off energy, the kids playgrounds at Darling Quarter and Tumbalong park (basically the end of Liverpool St.) is extensive, safe, busy and free!Water-based activity, climbing frames, swings, etc etc plus a range of (pay-for-use) merry-go-rounds. Enough to tire an active young lad!Highly recommended!

Darling, Darling Harbour. We undertook our first visit to Australia last October and discovered the beautiful city of Sydney where we spent 17 wonderful nights. Resident at the Meriton, Kent Street we found ourselves a stones throw from the fantastic Darling Harbour. What a fabulous place. We spent almost every night there for dinner. We know that it is expensive but when you have saved for a holiday of a lifetime you go for it.We had some great meals there, dining at The Helm,various other eateries and one that became a firm favourite,South by Steyne. The whole place had its own magical ambience and we couldn't get enough of it.We enjoyed a lot of the attractions therein but also missed out on a lot. Amazingly we were sent details of another holiday to Aus which means we can't just visit Darling Harbour again but will actually be based there. This time it encompasses my partners 65th birthday and we will be lucky enough to spend another 21 nights there in February and March next year.Everything we could possibly want and another chance of a holiday of a lifetime.

So much to do here!!. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour for dinner one night and we had so many choices. It is so relaxing to sit at one of the outside tables and eat. We happened upon a special with steak and the works for $10.00 USD and thought we would give it a try. It was one of our best meals of the trip! I forget the name of the restaurant, or I would post it too. You can eat and people watch or just look a the harbor. We walked across the bridge from the dock and went to the Hard Rock for dessert (I am on a mission to go to all the Hard Rock's in every country I visit) and then shopping in the attached mall. There are lots of things for families with children, many places to eat and so much to do. Definitely worth an afternoon or evening visit to Darling Harbour. There is a little something for everyone no matter what age you are.
Great spot for families. I love darling harbour the cafés & restaurants are terrific, the park/playground is amazing, walking around the waterfront is relaxing & the shopping is great!

One of my favourite things in Sydney. What can I say, if you're in Sydney, go to Darling Harbour. Great for restaurants. Good for scenery. Good for evening entertainment. Good for Children. Boats, sealife centre and Ice Cream. To reiterate....GO TO DARLING HARBOUR!!

Great fireworks. Every Sat night you get free fireworks at Darling Harbour. So go and enjoy. There is shops and restaurants to look at and go to. The Wax musuem. Wildlife Santuary. Sealife Aquarium. Little train you can hop on to go around Darling Harbour for a fee

Exciting and vibrant at night. We try to stay at or near Darling Harbour on every visit to Sydney as the atmosphere here at night time is always really enjoyable. The walk along Kings Street Wharf to Cockle Bay and around past Harbourside and back across the Pyrmont Bridge (or vice versa) is a must do in Sydney. The city skyline is spectacular and the atmosphere around the water and along the wide selection of shops and restaurants is terrific. An exciting and vibrant experience!
VIVID - Unbelievably good. If you didn't/don't get to see it in 2014, book for 2015. Stunningly amazing. 3D images that seem to come alive.
Nice place. Went there twice at night time. The beauty of the harbour duribg night time was nice specially because of the building lights reflecting in the water.
Breathtaking. Every spot of sydney is so beautiful, and darling harbour is included. Shops, restaurants, cafes and tourist attractions are all excellent.

Lots of ambience. This area is currently having an upgrade and when finished will surpass what is currently available. The Chinese gardens are excellent. Food around Darling Harbour are varied and enjoyable whether fine dining or take away. Excellent sights including Aquatic Centre, Museums, what more could you want!

Darling Harbour. Our hotel was situated at the entrance to Darling Harbour so this was the obvious place for us to spend some time. It has numerous cafes, bars and restaurants so was an ideal place to eat. Also, the Maritime museum is situated in the harbour - well worth a visit! Lots of activities and plenty going on so was a perfect place to relax with a cool glass of wine and watch the world go by.

Certainly not to be missed. This is a lovely harbour, with lots of restaurants and a shopping mall. There is a maritime museum and all sorts of ships of different eras there too, we spent hours on this harbour and although in some places the food and drinks are very pricey it is worth walking around to compare prices. While we were there they had fireworks in the evening that went in for some time. All in all a very busy and exciting place. Recommended!!!

A must if your visiting Sydney. I love Darling Harbour, the atmosphere and the whole vibe of the area. So many fantastic places to have a bite to eat and drink. A fun place for all age groups, there is always something happening. There is many attractions, you can easily spend an entire day here.

A must see.. Darling Harbour in Sydney is a great eye opening experience. Plenty of restaurants, activities, ferrys, and only a few minutes walk down from the CBD.Plenty to see and do. Take the children down to fill in a few hours or sit in one of the restaurants or pubs and 'watch what happens'.

Nice setting to relax after shopping in the CBD. If its relaxing you want you can just sit back and enjoy good food and a coldie after pounding the pavement shopping. The harbour however is surrounded by lots of things to do. You have the Chinese Gardens, Aquarium, Madam Tussauds, Wildlife Park and plenty of offer stuff including good eateries. Great place for the kids to enjoy an adventure at the Maritime Museum and a visit on a Australian Submarine plus old sailing ships. Expect to spend the entire day here. Ferries stop here and you can easily walk to China Town to. We enjoyed our visit here on more than one occasion very much during May 2014.

Always something to see and do.. Being a Sydney-sider, Darling Harbour is my 'go to' place when the kids are itching to do something. You can visit Wildlife Sydney, Sydney Aquarium, National Maritime Museum, Imax cinema and the Chinese gardens which are all excellent. Paddy's isn't far away and there's heaps of cool restaurants, bars, pubs and your generic take away joints. With the kids I always go to Olivo for lunch! Last visit we dined at Hurricanes and the time before that we went on board the South Steyne. So many things to do and see.
Lively place. Darling harbour was full of hustle and bustle something for everyone. Definitely a place to go of an evening to eat and enjoy

Take the ferry to Darling Harbor. Taking the ferry to Darling Harbor provides not only a fun ride to another part of the city, but it also affords great photo opportunities of the Opera House and Sydney Harbor Bridge. Darline Harbor itself is quite picturesque. We visited the Wildlife Park and Aquarium. Both were very interesting and loads of fun, especially if you have only a small amount of time and wish to see iconic Australian wildlife and sea life. We also ate at a spectacular seafood restaurant, Nicks, which we highly recommend.

THE place to go for Everything!. Darling Harbour has food, fun & fashion! From quick & easy fast food to wonderful restaurants there is something for everyone!! The views are spectacular & the Saturday night fireworks are gorgeous! The IMAX & other attractions make it a great destination for everyone!!

What a way to spend a few days!. This place is brilliant, easy to get to, jump on the ferry! It has a fantastic shopping precinct with all sorts of shops from $ shops to cute boutiques and heaps of food places. The attractions were terrific, we bought a multi ticket that let us go to the tower, the aquarium, the wild life park the Manly Sanctuary and Madame Tussaud for about $68. Great value and 3 were located all together at Darling Harbour. The Maritime Museum was really worth a look and the big shops in the harbour were great to look at too! We ended up spending 3 days at Darling Harbour.

One of my favourite venues. If you come to the City you have to visit Darling Harbour. There are river trips, the Aquarium, Imax theatre plus lots of inexpensive restaurants and bars for either lunch or dinner and it's a great 'people watching' place.. A trip to Sydney is not complete for us without " a punt 'round the 'arbour!"

Great Place. If you're tired of going to the Sydney Harbour, then the Darling Harbour is a must also. Alot of restaurants and bars all over the place. Youll also find a couple of museums right around there. Great walk!

My favourite place in Sydney. Darling Harbour is a place I visit frequently. I like when it rains, when the sun shines, I like it at night, I like it in the day. I prefer to be there with my wife or family. I am never disappointed by going. Special occasions are great as they always have a fireworks display. My favourite restaurant here is the Meat and Wine Co.

Darling Harbour Sydney. I always love going to Darling Harbour, the atmosphere, the places to see are a credit to Sydney, I love to see the Welcome Wall near the Maritime Museum looking at all the names of people who have arrived to start a new life in Australia. There are so many places of interest there, go see it, it is worth every minute. Lots of places to eat and drink. Enjoy!!!

Beautiful place great to stop and chill out. . Well this area has it all. Shops, cafe's, restaurants and a great playground. We had a weekend in Sydney with our 4 young kids and if you asked them what they did they would say they went to a cool playground. Enough said. Lol. Also the Japanese garden is right in this area. Not enough time but looked beautiful from the outside. It's a must area to go and see.

Fireworks and a great family outing. Saturday night at 8.30 or 9 and Darling Harbour comes alive with fireworks. It's easy to get a front row seat and you feel like you're in a theatre, with the fireworks performing for your benefit. People of all ages - little kids to older people - enjoying the spectacle with plenty of Oohs and Aahs. If you'd like to have a meal before or after the show, there's plenty of options, with a variety of price tags. The atmosphere is fun and friendly and it makes for a good night out.

Beautiful view. Even though they have demolition going on, they are very good at making it less disruptive for the tourist. They always have something on. View of the city skyline from the Harbor is beautiful specially in the evening.

Everything is here. If you want to experience a whole lot of Sydney in 1 day, this is the place to end you day. After shopping and sightseeing, come to Darling Harbour & enjoy dinner at one of the many restaurants or cafés. I have & was impressed. Lots to see & you can plan your next outing from there

Hidden treasure. Great place to see the city from and very popular but beware the tourist traps. Shopping can be quite pricey compared to other areas of Sydney. Plenty of places to eat covering all types of cuisine but again you will pay through the nose at most establishments. The highlight of Darling Harbour is the views and a great walk.

We were down for a walk and stopped in for dinner at a harbor side restaurant. Much to our delight the evening turned into a fi. We were down for a walk and stopped in for dinner at a harbor side restaurant.much to our delight fireworks began and we had a fantastic time at Darling harbor for hours!!
Vivid light show at Darling Harbour. Exceptional, I recommend using the hop on hop off ferry to get to and from Circular Quay worth every penny ($10)

There are better places to go. The body of water and general outlook at Darling Harbour is quite lovely. But it's a pretty touristy area: the shops in the darling harbour shopping complex aren't great, and better food can be had in neighbouring cockle bay wharf/king st wharf (on the other side of the water), darling quarter or china town.
So Much To See. Darling Harbour during Vivid Wow. Dancing waters so much better than 2013. Places to eat too many to count, just a great place to be.

Love the bars by the water. Love this place, great views and great places to eat,they have a great duck pizza at the helm bar so check that out, and Hard Rock Cafe is loads of fun as well.Can get very busy on weekends.

It is what it is..... I live in Sydney and have done for some time, but this visit was unusual for me as DH is not somewhere I usually go to. And the are reasons for this - mainly that there are better places to go to in sydney. But, if you're at a loose end, the actual harbour is pretty and you may see dragon boat racing there, or paddle boarders, as we did. And in fact, that would be a much better way to see DH - by kayak or paddle board (though you'll needed to watch out for sharks!). The shops and restaurants themselves are overpriced & ordinary - for food, walk back towards the city and grab something from Chinatown for better quality & value.
water water everywhere. great spot. Get there on a river boat for the best impact. Very cheap.I loved coming down the river and the harbour gets more and more close

Best way to feel the size of the harbours, the bridge and see the sights.. We went by ferry between Darling Harbour (where we were staying) and the main Central Harbour area by the Bridge / Rocks / Station. Very useful / best value to get a day or longer rover pass. We went by ferry to Manley Beach (great surf) and Watsons Bay (Doyles fish restaurant on the beach - brill - have the flat fish). Ferry under the bridge is amazing as is going past Opera House / Lady Mcs chair etc just get a completely different perspective than from land. As it eas winter it was blowin so need an extra layer than on land if you are on the outside decks but worth it. Take your camera - you wont be dissappointed! Also my daughter left her camera case on one ferry trip and the staff were brill tracking which boat number and searching for it and retrng it to her. Top marks all round :)

A Local Playground. There is much to see and do around Darling Harbour, but the degree of enjoyment will depend purely on what one wants from the place. The major attractions are the Aquarium, Madame Tussauds, Maritime Museum and the IMax theatre and the Chinese and Japanese gardens. Darling Harbour is really all of the above and the restuarants and shops dotted around the waterfront. Then there is Chinatown and the Casino neaby. It easlly accessible by bus ferry or light rail. Allow several hours to walk around and explore.Currently, (May 2014) the Convention and Entertainment Centre are undergoing a makeover so there are unlikely to be any major events here in the coming months.There is no entry fee to the precint, but attractions mentioned above have their own charges.Not sure about wheelchair access,lockers and buggy parking, but expect there will be facilities in keeping with the Sydney commitment to cater for all.

Lovely to stroll around. Darling Harbour is a lovely place to stroll around. Plenty of restaurants and bars on both sides of the harbour . Often there is live performers with crowd of onlookers watching in a large circle. At around 8.30 pm on Saturday nights there is a free fireworks display lasting 10-15 minutes - worth watching. Overall a great place to visit.

The place to be. If you are looking for restaurants, Darling harbour is the place to be! There are restaurants lining each side of the harbour. There is also the Maritime museum and an information centre, Imax theatre and plenty of kids play areas. Gorgeous area! Must see.
Cosy walkaround. A good place to scroll around in the evening time. It has the best food and best night view in this area
Beautiful Bay. I really liked Darling Harbour to wander around, relax and have a meal on the harbour side. Ferrys from Circular Quays are frequent and quick.

Darling Harbour Rocks. A must visit and a great vibrant place to spend a evening.If you are in Sydney go where ever you want but you should dedicate your evening to this lovely place.It has everthing for everyone..food, café, entertainment..Bravo for the place...A must to do.

An All Around Attraction. Darling Harbour was our most frequented place on our Sydney vacation. Our hotel was a short stroll away so it was certainly convenient particularly with the wealth of things to see and do. We went to Sea Life and Wild Life, ate at one of the varied food establishments, did some shopping and strolled on the boardwalk. A truly all around attraction that is worthy of multiple visits be it day or night.

Very aptly named - the Darling of Sydney!. Wonderful place for spending a day and enjoying the night life too. The museums, the bridges, the shopping and eating places make it a busy and fun filled location in the city. We really enjoyed the spectacular laser and music sound and light show put up for Australia Day on 26th Jan! That was the only time that I saw crowds in Australia... About 50,000 people had congregated to watch the show. Very well organized transport systems and well behaved crowd. A must see place indeed!

Great hangout place. Darling Harbour is gorgeous. Whether you are on a casual hangout with friends or on a romantic date, it has everything for everyone. There are so many restaurants to pick from and the vibe is just so fun. The aquarium is there and it closes late as well! When we went it was a Friday night and they had fireworks. It was pretty amazing to watch and then grab some delicious and fresh seafood dinner afterwards. We got there by ferry from Sydney Harbour and then took a cab back to our hotel.

Darling Harbour is a great place for a walk. This is a good place to go for a walk about. Interesting things to see, lots of shops and restaurants, and a nice harbor setting. You can catch a ferry or water taxi to get there or simply take a short walk from downtown Sydney.

Pleasant place to watch the world go by.. We go to Sydney a lot and Darling Harbour is one of our favourite spots to grab a meal or just chill out by the water's edge or in the park. The restaurants along the footpath are reasonably priced considering it is a tourist hotspot, plus there is the option of cheaper fast food items inside also. Watch out for people on bikes though- there are many who speed by or try to do tricks when it is too congested with people to do so, and people are constantly trying to quickly dash out of the way so they don't get hurt. Hope to see Sydney council implement some sort of ruling here as we saw many unhappy tourists surprised the cyclists cutting in front of them of almost knocking them over at high speed.

Modern. I approached the harbour down some steps and what is the first thing you see, paddle steamer and dinner cruise ships, both looking very elegant. The other side of the walkway is dotted with very popular restaurants, the whole place seems buzzing. On the opposite bank is the Maritime Museum and a naval boat. Walking further along you approach the corner where the aquarium is located, it becomes obvious that a lot of time and money has been spent enhancing this harbour.

Nice area, not as crowded as the Circular Quay. Definetely more enjoyable to walk than the Circular Quay harbour, and quite a few attractions here too: Maritime museum, a large shopping building, restaurants, aquarium, etc.

Need a day to appreciate this beautiful harbour. Madame Tussauds, Sea life aquarium, In house small Zoo, meritime museum, IMAX and lots of restaurants are located on Darling harbour. You need a full day to enjoy all of it. There are many street artists who performs here and one can enjoy that as well.

A lot happening in a beautiful setting. Darling Harbour is a beautiful place for all kinds of people, especially families. It features a diverse range of restaurants, parks, playgrounds, shops, attractions and bars. A peaceful setting by the water, I've enjoyed multiple dining experiences in this area, making it my go-to place when after a restaurant in Sydney. Both day and night, Darling Harbour has something new and exciting to offer, with talented street performers helping create a constant festival-like atmosphere.I would definitely recommend a visit to Darling Harbour when in Sydney and with the large amount of hotels located nearby, make sure you stay in the vicinity!

Food, fun and fancy. I stayed just up from Darling harbour with hubby and 2 daughters 10 and 11. We loved the food, the shopping, the view and atmosphere and the aquarium is awesome. It seemed more friendly and versatile than other places we visited in Sydney. Would so recommend it! Close to china town too!

What a place to visit. WOW is how I can describe this place. Food is in everywhere, parks, museums, etcYou can simply spend 2-3 days at this place. I liked it alot and will keep going there daily to try different delicious restaurantsThere are activities for the young ones as well

Get there early to spend the day. Not only is Darling Harbour visually attractive by day and by night but there is so much to do there. Be prepared to spend a few hours at the Maritime Museum and see a replica of the Endeavour, a submarine, and destroyers. Then pop across to the Wildlife Centre to see lots of Australian creatures (a great place for children) before going on to Madame Tussauds. Visit the IMax Cinema and watch a £D film. Make sure you don't leave before visiting the excellent Sea Life Centre which stays open until 8pm.

Great Place to visit. We go to Darling Harbour regularly-there is always something on here.The food and drinks are awesome and there are always specials and happy hour.If you are there at the right time there are fireworks and the ferry stops here otherwise its a short walk from the station or there is a large car park.Recently we have been to strike bowling,Imax theatre and the 9D cinema.There are always street performers and events and its a great place for children to play.For tourists there are the 3 big attractions and a shop which sells discounted tickets.Everyone should sit down and have a drink and soak up the ambience of the view on a regular basis.Never tire of walking around here and its perect for bringing visitors.

A very lively place. Been to Darling Harbour in Feb 2014 and I must say I never had enough of this place, no matter how many times I went there.This place is packed with restaurants & bars. The harbour in itself is very beautiful. And at night it is quite lively. Also you have Hard Rock Cafe too at the harbour.You can reach harbour by ferry, using the day ticket (if you are out exploring the city) and have a fantastic time here and head back to rest place.A must see place if you are in Sydney.

Beautiful harbour with fireworks. Suggested to go there on Saturday which there is firework display. You can even reserve table in the Harbourside. A great night with a walk in Pyrmont Bridge and had dessert in the Pancakes on the rock.

Vibrant. The lively Darling Harbour with its street theatre, restaurants, eclectic crowd and amusements will be of interest to folks of all ages. Some great eateries including 'Eat Love Pizza' and 'Meat and Wine Company'

A little commercial but fun to visit. This is an average tourist-type attraction next to the water with many restaurants and shops. It is pretty however though there is a lot of construction also going on at present that can be noisy.

Stick to the City side. Our last visit to Darling Harbour was spent on the city side, where there are lots of attractions and reasonably priced eateries. In particular, we can highly recommend the Lindt Chocolate Restaurant and their tasting plate! A treat not to be missed by chocolate lovers.
Nice. Lot of restaurants, bars and shopping in a very beautyful area close to citycenter and a great atmosphere

crowded but cant miss this if you are a tourist. Its always crowded here.. expect a lot of tourists... the bars and restaurants are nice and there are a lot of new restaurants and play areas for kids expect to pay a lot for the drinks and food but thats expected as its a touristy location
Vibrant harbour. Lots and lots of cute little restaurants. Loved the hard rock cafe and the firework displays during summer time!
Go there by ferry. Very interesting with plenty of shopping, food outlets and we were lucky enough to get to see Strictly Ballroom the Musical at the theatre there too.

What a disapointment.. Taking an overseas visitor to Darling Harbour when most of it is being demolished. The demolition of the convention centre was noisy and dusty. I'm only glad we didn't stay here this time.
A great walk at night. It's best walking around Darling Harbour at night, you will have a great view of the city skyline and it's the perfect backdrop for your photos

Must see in Sydney. This is a must see vibrant place in Sydney town.
It is well worth a stroll around in the evening to watch the entertaining street performers, have a meal overlooking the water or to catch a 3d movie in their massive cinema.
Go in summer and watch the fireworks that they have on every night :)

Needs an urgent makeover. Darling Harbour should be the magical centrepiece of Sydney and for many years it was. Sadly its upgrades have not kept pace with the ever changing Sydney. A good place to visit, certainly not a great place

Panoramic view. Nice place to visit for a better sight seen and recommended to visit before 10 AM of after 05 Pm. that is the best time to visit for a nice scenery of the Harbour. Donot forget to carry your camera .

Vibrant lively nightlife. Darling harbour is fabulous day or night but a lot more life on a night. Some lovely restaurants and great bars for all ages. Visited several times for lunch and dinner, the night before we came back home to England we went to watch the firework display which the have every Saturday night. It was fab to just sit on a nice warm evening watching this display which only lasted about 8 mins but was really good, thoroughly enjoyed my last night in Sydney at darling harbour.

Sunny Afternoon. A great spot to sit and watch the world go by. A light lunch and a wee drink and watch the Launch's come and go and people walking by. If you are lucky there is a busker or two yo entertain as well.

A 'must see' for kids. Best water playground for kids I have ever seen! So much to do, watch the street performers, play in the water, people watch and eat ice-creams. Wander to the Chinese Gardens and onto bargain hunting at Paddy's market. Free firework display every Saturday night!! Tons of shops and restaurants. Something for all the family.
Nothing great. Reminded me of the Victoria & Alfred Waterfront in Cape Town, heaving with tourists and tat. However the view from the ferry was spectacular.

Great night life and awesome view.. Me and my partner stayed here just after new year. we went to a bar called the bungalows down the harbour which was really lively. There seemed like there were lots of things to do like sea life etc but we didn't go to any of them so can only recommend nightlife. beautiful place would go again.

Don't miss. Spent 2-3 hours walking around the harbour. Very relaxing! There was a kids play area at 1 end which had quite a few activities. My son loved it there! We took a ferry from there to Sydney Harbour. lovely views on the way.

Not much in Darling Harbour. We went to Darling Harbour on our last day in Sydney. It was raining and gray. A gentleman approached us and asked if we had seen any souvenir shops. We replied "No" and then noticed that the marina features lots of overpriced restaurants and bars but not one shop. Not much to do, we left before eating dinner. Disappointed that there is not more to see in Darling Harbour.

nice place. I really enjoyed my visit to the darling harbor, though I merely spare it. the same week, there was several festivals or something like that, which I found very enjoyable.at the harbour, you get the feeling of out of the city for a while, and it is very unique.this place is very nice for hanging, and seems that a lot of families with little children were attended.
Very busy and Very expensive. Even though I lived close to Darling Harbour I found it too touristy and expensive for regular meals. I went to the Imax which was excellent.
just beautifull. It was just lovely relaxed and the atmosphere was great just to walk around the the restaurants were lovely.

active nights. Night life was very active when we visited Darling Harbour. There was a concert also, we get a wine from a store and just sat there and enjoyed the music. Restaurants are expensive and food quality is average.

Nice ferry ride. I caught the ferry to Darling Harbour from circular quay with good views of Opera House, the bridge and the skyline Sydney harbour. There were many restaurants, cafes, shops museums and bars along the harbour so there is plenty to do, I had bought a day travel card so I returned by the ferry.

Brilliant and Fun. So great at Darling Harbour. Great places to eat or have a drink. Great park for kids to play at. Plenty of attractions. Great street entertainment. We went a few times and never got bored.

WORTH A LOOK. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour to see how it had changed in 30 years!!! Obviously heaps of restaurants which weren't cheap going by the displayed menus. Arrived directly outside the Maritime Museum which looked pretty impressive from the size of the building. We walked past a number of boats/subs from 'days gone by' on display and continued along the walkway. Just on lunchtime as the entertainers were beginning. If your happy to pay the food prices here you'll be fine, we decided just to wander and look.

Beautiful. It's a scenic and happening waterfront, with a variety of dining options and events taking place every other day, not to mention buskers catching the eyes of the visitors. Very lovely place to hang out and relax.

'Don't miss Darling Harbour'. A short ferry hop from Circular Quay or a leisurely stroll taking approximately 25 minutes from the rocks area. We did it both ways and both were enjoyable. Lots of bars and restaurants along the waterfront and plenty of places of interest to see. There is a lot of development going on a the moment and when this is completed it will take this area to a new level. It is not quite as busy as Sydney Harbour but every bit as interesting so don't miss out.

A bit of everything. Darling Harbour colourfull, energetic and full of life. Got everything to keep you happy, bars, restaurants, cafes, cinemas, shops, museums. Fireworks 9pm every Saturday night, except the Saturday night I was there! Cancelled for Earth Hour - Google it.

Expanding, but still splendid.. Just a short hop on the ferry from Sydney Harbour, Darling Harbour is the on-trend sister. There are bars and restaurants lining the board walk from one end to the other with lots of modern building expansion going on, including yet another casino being built. But the marina also features an historic museum and a very interesting array of moored boats, including a replica of the Endeavour. There are piers a plenty, a small lighthouse and for the more serious tourist, a genuine and touching tribute to those who first came to Australia lines the main ferry harbourside. An all round must see.
Beautiful. A beautiful place to eat, drink and explore. So much to see and do we have to come back to finish it all!

Darling harbor. Lovely to pick a good restsurant among the buildings to sit outside and take in the summer weather and the good resaurant eith a view of the sea. The beaches all over Sydney are just a perfect mix of plenty of sand and scenic resaurants.. The food maybe just fair but the scenery is what you want.

Absolutely Stunning!. One of the best and liveliest places in Sydney! Would recommend the restaurant, Casa. Awesome Italian food. The IMAX theatre, Sea Life Aquarium and Wildlife are also located here. A must-do in Sydney!

Ever vivid and magnificent place. This one site houses so many attractions, that you can spend days and nights there.There are so many cafes and restaurants there, that you will definitely find your favourite.Always something new. Just recently we saw a circus festival there.Among other attractions you will find the biggest IMAX cinema and the best ever playground, where your children will completely lose their sense of time - be careful!Maritime Museum with all these ships you can walk through and touch the history.Of course, one of the best attractions is the Darling Harbour itself, a part of Sydney Harbour - one can hardly stop looking at this wonder.
Lively. Lots to see and do, plenty of restuarants to choose from. Sea Aquarium was good, Hard Rock Cafe expensive!

Take a stoll and check out all the attractions.. Well worth a visit - the Chinese Garden of Frendship ($6 admission, $3 concession) and The Maritime Museum. Walk over the Pyrmont Bridge (and if you are lucky get to see it open), also free play equipment for the kids. You will spoilt for choice if you want eat here or stop for a coffee (and cake). There are many other attractions that I have yet to visit at Darling Harbour. I hope to check them out on another trip to Sydney
Sydney darling. The Darling harbour is full of life.Vibrant at anytime of the day especially at night when all the drunk druggies go about their business.

Chic and Cheerful. This must be the place to be in Sydney. The harbour is a safe and exciting place to be for families of all ages. There are restaurants and bars to suit all budgets. We like to eat early evening and as a result we found bargains galore in the bars and restaurants. There were a number of choices of restaurants to suit all diets and the views were spectacular across the harbour, especially as the sun set and the building lit up for the evening

Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour the heart of Sydney...one of the awesome place and must visit place.Every night during my stay for a week i spent my time roaming around, sight seeing and excellent bar and restaurants.

Multiple attractions close by in this area. If you're pressed for time, or overwhelmed with choices on what to see and do in Sydney, try visiting Darling Harbor first because it has almost something for all tastes.For the kids there's:-the Sydney Aquarium-Wildlife World -Powerhouse Museum (nearby)For Dad and the guys there's the Maritime Museum with HMAS Vampire, the Oberon class sub, HMS Endeavor and some smaller military boats...While for Mum and the girls there's Madam Tussauds and various shopping outlets.No more fussing over what to see or do next, and at the end of a long day, everybody can just meet up for a zen moment sipping tea at the Chinese Garden of Friendship!

Walking distance to city. Just a short walk from city centre, and there are 3 major attractions within the Darling Harbour concourse. Places to eat, walk and take in the sights, including the maritime museum if it takes your fancy.

Darling Harbour. If you visit Sydney it is very unlikely that you will not come across Darling Harbour.Very picturesque,with lots happening both by day and night.Take the ferry to the Rocks for great views of Sydney. Recommended

Darling Harbour Walk. Lovely place, lots to see and do. Some fantastic bars and some beautiful paddle boats/ bars. Was here to pass time before rugby match but what a really fantastic area this is. Definitely a place to visit and spend time in whilst in Sydney. Absolutely fabulous place.
We love it. Almost every night during our week in Sydney ,we spent there.excellent restaurants and beautiful strolling and sights.we enjoyed the fireworks on Australia Day.

Night Visit. We visited at night and it was picturesque to say the lease. The food is a little expensive but almost worth it to enjoy the amazing view the harbor has to offer! Defiantly go now and check it out yourself!
Plenty of food on offer. The restaurant prices are all very competitive and well priced for the area, plenty of variety available. Music at some of the bars was great

Great place to hang out. This would have been a place we would have spent more time if the weather had not been so bad. It is nice to sit and chill and there are lots of places to eat. It has a great vibe and is just one of those must do places in Sydney.

Darling Harbour is a must see place to visit if you are in Sydney. Darling Harbour is most see place to visit if you are visiting Sydney. It has a great atmosphere and heaps of restaurants. In recent years they have extended the promenade and it is truly a great walk. Every Friday night there is a fireworks display and on public holidays.
fantsic. We spent a couple of days in this area so much to do see or just chill and watched the world go by. There is plenty of places to eat for any budget and any age.

Quite attractive but heavily commercialised. There's plenty to see and do, but it is so tourist-oriented that it can be difficult to avoid the overwhelming pressures to spend money. However basic access is free and easy, and it's pleasant just to stroll around. Great for 'people watching'. Do a round trip walk from the city by going over the Pyrmont bridge at the bottom of Market Street, and return via the southern end and Chinatown. Fortunately the ghastly monorail has been removed.

A must place to visit when in Sydney. Darling Harbour has so much atmosphere in the evening, great promenade to walk along and many restaurants so much to accommodate all palates. Top off with a firework display in the evening. When in Sydney a must to visit.
Great. Fantastic restaurantsGreat free playgroundWill look fantastic when completedAll the sites close to each other
