great kids playgorund, good amenities. near the chinese gardens at darling harbour is a huge kids playground. My kids are 10 and 12 but they still loved it. there are large climbing nets, slides, tunnels and swings all set in beautiful lush gardens with a water feature alongside it. There are plenty of seats for the parents and ther are cafes and toilets nearby.

It is what it is!. Darling Harbor has something for almost everyone. It is a destination in itself and is easily accessible by foot or public transportation. It costs nothing to enjoy the views and people watch. They have plenty of stuff to do for the kids and adults alike. Some of it is a little tacky. All of it is touristy. There are many restaurants although none would be rated as fine dining establishments. That said you can get a good meal without breaking your budget if you take care to research the restaurants first. It's a busy place at holiday time so if large crowds are not your bag then stay away. Our group found the place fascinating and I would always recommend others to visit Darling Harbor at least once.
Site seeing Darling Harbour. Great place to take the kids. So many free things and sights to see. Aquarium and reptile park right on the harbour. Its the best.

Fun and Clean. I preferred Darling Harbour to the area around Circular Quay. We liked entering the harbour area from the south end through the Chinatown. Here, you walk by children's parks, turfed area and lots of restaurants. Yes, they are probably overpriced, but it is fun to be on Darling Harbour and there really is a restaurant for every taste and price range. This is where you will find Sydney Aquarium, Wild Life, and Madame Toussad's. We didn't go to these, but we were there for the fireworks at 9:00 pm on Australia Day. We sat on the edge of the pier in the pleasant evening air and enjoyed a very well done fireworks show. Leaving the show afterward was a crowded nightmare after, but that was a small price to pay for a great place to hang out.
Absolute Magestic !!!. The aquarium and zoo is worth the watch...The best part is that everything there is so close to each other that it saves the hassles of moving around :)

Fantastic Playground. If you have kids you must visit the playground at Darling Harbour. It has one of the best playgrounds around and the kids can interact with water. Right across from the playground is plenty of good cafes and a great ice-cream store. Darling harbour also has a brilliant aquarium to visit and an Australian zoo. They are quite expensive to get into but worth the money. Lots to see at Darling Harbour.

Food, family fun and shopping - the place to be at night. During the day Darling Harbor was filled with folks enjoying the wharf. At night, it was the danceclub scene for the young and dressed for a night out - a place to see and be seen.

Great location with views and a few attractions. Easy to get to on the ferry from Circular Quat. Once you're there, you can visit Wildlife Sydney, Madame Tussauds, Sealife Aquarium, Maritime Museum and a few other attractions. Worth a visit if you have only a short time in Sydney with no car.

Another good place to visit. Plenty of tourists, photo-ops and even a view of Sydney's infamous New Year's Eve fireworks. There's a lot to do around so you make sure you put on your walking shoes and give yourself plenty of time.
Modern, new, active. New neighbourhood where there are always people enjoying drinks or food or just lay in the grass. Relaxing atmosphere. Add to your to do list!
Touristy but fun place to walk around. This place is very touristy but fun place to walk around and soak in the views of downtown. Fun sights to see in and around.

Great place to enjoy family day. You can entertained everyone in Darling harbour regardless their ages. It has a beautiful harbour view, a Sealife aquarium, wildlife adventure, kids playground, theaters, cafés, nice park, a beautiful Chinese garden and a you-must-visit maritime museum. A really great place to take the whole family day out.

A Wall of Average Bars & Restaurants Around a Large Pond. As a tourist from America who read about Darling Harbour, I was sorely disappointed by it. First, it's not really a harbour. True, one of the Sydney ferries does stop here, but there is no mariana and no form of shipping other than small pleasure craft--not even yachts. The water is not an attraction here, the attraction--I guess--is the horseshoe shaped concrete quay around this small basin on which sit innumerable bars, cafes, restaurants, ice cream shops, souvenir stands, and an iMax theatre. And yes, the Sydney Aquarium is there. We walked around the "harbour" two or three times just to see what we were missing, and we never found anything that we would have been sorry to have missed. It all reminded me of a huge food court, like you might find at a major retail outlet in the USA--only bigger and with taverns. Part of the reason I liken it to a mall or outlet food court was the presence of so many teenagers--all very pleasant and well behaved mind you--but the fact that this place has a huge draw on teenagers gives you good idea what it is like. Unless you want to see an iMax film or are going to the Sydney Aquarium, I see no reason for a grown adult to make any effort to visit Darling Harbour.

Of course it's a must see!. This is an iconic section of Sydney with something for everyone to look at. There seems to always be something going on. There are great views and if you aren't in the mood for one of the many, MANY cafes on the water, there is a food court near the convention centre. (Also a good spot to escape the heat!)
Loved It!. Loved it! So much to do and see. Dining options were varied for tastes and budgets. Madame Tussauds is amazing and the ferry to and from the zoo was great.

SSix in Sydney. We spent two evenings dining in this area. On the first night a Saturday we were spoilt with a great fireworks display (apparently happens every Saturday night) and some performing acrobat guys who were pretty amazing. Great party atmosphere in this area, pretty with awesome night views of the city.

General Review. Sparkling clean waters coupled with stunning scenery, making it one of the best places I have ever been to in Sydney! Tourist who wants a beautiful photo, don't forget to visit this place in the morning and night, the atmosphere is entirely different. Cheers!

All in One Complex. Well, if you are expecting nice and charm view of harbour, this is not the place. You must look some other place. Here is the place where tourists get all their needs, from variety of restaurants, attractions like Madame Tussaud, SEA Life, Wildlife, play ground for small kids, maritime museum, and shopping mall. Don't expect quiet place here as everybody goes here because it is convenience to go around and do what your family members want to do at one place. They even opened on New Year day while most shops somewhere else were closed on that day. They also have a train ride to go around and only cost $5 per person. If you find eating here too expensive, then you can ride this train to Chinatown which is close by and get something there. It is also close to Paddy Market where you can get cheaper price for souvenirs. For me, this place is great for the whole family members.
Always a Joy to visit.. What isnt there to like about Darling Harbour. It has everything!! Lovely dining and beauitful scenery and lots and lots of shopping!

Had a fabulous summer evening walk here ..... I worked at Darling Harbour when it was first built and have visited regularly over the last 20 years. However it was the first time I had been there at night time for years and was just blown away by the fantastic ambience and vibe. So family friendly, kids everywhere at 9pm, families of all shapes and sizes. Restaurants not full but most with a good level of custom. We felt perfectly safe walking from The Entertainment centre to Harbourside, accross pyrmont Bridge and back the Entertainment centre via Cockle Bay, not something I would have happily done alone after 9pm 20 years ago particularly on a week night! Highly reccommended.

Boring harbour.. Nothing much to do here except spend a pile of money eating at restaurants that are too expensive. Massive crowds of tourists, mostly from Mainland China, come here.
I recommend Newcastle Waterfront, about 2 hours' drive up north.
excellent. love this place ..everything in one great place!!! the mdm tussauds, wildlife zoo and sealife aquarium.

Disappointing. Wish I had read some of the less enthusiastic reviews here before wasting our time. We were expecting charm and interesting things to see and do. Instead it was a bleak, over-crowded, stinky place. Mostly paved over, hot and dirty, and really just a lot of expensive stores and eateries, with a sad, small, smelly waterfront. No nice views, no shady spots to sit in, and nothing to photograph. Didn't even see any good shopping - but we left before making the full circuit.

Fantastic. What a place to be whilst away, so many places to eat and drink all offering different cuisines and lots of different happy hours offerings, beautiful harbour and departures point for the ferries. Tours too of aquarium, madame tussauds and more, it is almost a crime not to spend plenty of time in and around the area.

Great area. Sydney was amazing to explore, and I loved Darling Harbour. We visited the maritime museum which was cool, I liked the submarine although I don't think I could be in one underwater in the ocean haha. It's one to tick off the bucket list :)

Fantastic base for a holiday!. Darling Harbour is the perfect base for a Sydney holiday.Close to all of the major attractions,surrounded by a wealth of restaurants and bars,access to transport of all kinds both land and water based and fireworks every Saturday!! Whats not to like!!
Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour. Hotel is right next to Chinese Garden, China Town, Entertainment Center and all amenities for kids and restaurant at all budget.

The "OTHER" Harbor. This is the other harbor in Sydney after Circular Quay. You can walk here or take the ferry from downtown. Plenty of restaurants and right near the museum are of the city. Fireworks in the harbor several times a year, as well as street fairs on weekends. we like to go here for dinner when we visit. Great spot.
Amazing Area!. Just amazing and I loved the area with lot´s of restaurants and things to do! And don´t miss the cinema :)
A great place to watch the world go by in beautiful Sydney. Lots of bars and restaurants to choose from - lots of room for the kids to play near the water features

Great area with many fun activities. We loved the Darling Harbour area! We spent an afternoon an evening in the area and participated in several of the attractions while there. There are plenty of food and drink options, too. The area is very pedestrian-friendly, and there are some street performers that make walking around the area a fun experience. We walked around the National Maritime Museum, Sydney Aquarium, and the Chinese Garden of Friendship while we were there. If you stay in the area for dinner some of the restaurants quickly accumulate long wait times so be sure to sign up early if you want to eat quickly. There is a food court with MANY options, however, and that's where we ate because we did not want to wait and wanted a cheaper meal.If you want to walk to the Star Casino, note that the casino is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Darling Harbour area so it is not in the immediate vicinity.
So much to do. Had a great dinner. Loved the futsal completion. Great photo opportunities fairly well priced. Great chocolates at Lindt

worth the walk. Darling Harbour area now has so much to do its a must, restaurants museums, aquarium, zoo, parks and good restaurants and bars, we love it. its a shame they never connected the now defunct mono rail to Circular quay as it would have then been perfect. very close to China town and Paddys market, its a great location to choose for a hotel base. there is very often free fireworks in this area of an evening.

Well worth a look.. Well worth a visit, nice bridge over the harbour, some good shops and dozens of restaurants. You can link to Chinatown and Paddys markets too. Upmarket and pleasant strolling, but extremely popular, you will not be alone.

Cool Place with an awesome vibe. Darling Harbour is so pretty both day and night and its a must do. Plenty of places to eat from fine dining to a food court and everything in between. Plenty of shopping. Very easy to get to. Johnny Margueritas was great for a cocktail. Also there is the aqurium, wildlife place and Madame Tussauds. There is a magnificent fireworks display every Saturday at 9pm that is well worth seeing.
Great family day out. The views, attractions, food, drink, location what's not to love? Brilliant for all the family. The Aquarium is a must do!
Tourist Hotspot. Full of places to eat at a variety of prices. Tourist hotspot so very busy and noisy, particularly as we were there during the pre-Christmas period

Darling Harbour. It's simply a place to gravitate to, either to eat, to sit and watch the world go by, even take in a film at the IMAX or visit the Aquarium. PLenty to do and see her and a must visit venue if your first time to Sydney.
A haven. I was so mpressed with what was happening on the harbour, so much free stuff for the children to do, water park, films etc well done :)
Chilled place, lots of bars. Nice space with many restaurants, some better than others but worth a chilled walk around the marina.

Saturday night in Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is so much fun! A great activity for a Saturday night. It was packed when we visited in November. Already gearing up for Christmas, the atmosphere was festive. Many bars and restaurants, great views of Sydney harbor, with night boats coming and going. Also great place for kids for it offers a number of well planned out kiddie parks that looked really innovative and real crowd pleasers. thoroughly enjoyable evening.
Lively. Unfortunately only went there once but it was fantastic, we went one evening, just wish we had more time to visit it again

Something for the whole Family . Fantasic water front destination! What a delightful surprise ,This was a wonderful area for a Family, wonderful kids park, water play area, carnival rides, entertainment, attractions like Aquarium, Wildlife Zoo, Wax Museum, mini train rides, cafés and Restaurants. The Paddy Markets. The Darling Harbor is a very clean Sydney area. Very impressed. Fire works every Saturday night 8:30pm. A must see !

Fireworks throughout January 2014. Take a walk after having a nice dinner and enjoy the fireworks. It's not overly crowded but it would be better to be there 15-30min before the show. The fireworks lasts about 5 min, not as big as the new years / xmas ones but still very nice. Upcoming fireworks time:9pm, Saturday 18, and 25 January8.45pm, Sunday 26 January
Fun!. Darling Harbour is where the fun is, check out the amazing aquarium and make sure to have dinner or cocktails at a chic restaurant at night to see the gorgeous night lights!

Boats, ice-cream and poker!. Darling harbor is nice to go for a stroll. It looks a bit like Barcelona's Maremagnum. I think they also have a cinema somewhere. We went there for a walk a couple of times. It is nice to see the boats, have some ice-cream and, if you push it, make it to the Star to see others wasting their money in games ;)))
Great Atmosphere. Full of life, shopping and restaurants. Enjoy an evening watching the views and people around. Many tourists around the area.
Great place to have dinner. There are alot of restaurants to choose from. From Mickey d's to fancy candlelit dinner places. Alot of bars also and coffee places for after dinner gimmicks.

Restaurants Restaurants Restaurants. The Darling Harbour and the walk to it (from CBD) is full of all kinds of restaurants. Full of people and energy, parks, a circus tent nearby. So much to see and explore.
Free fireworks every Saturday night!. Great restaurants and free fireworks every Saturday night. The various street performers will also keep you entertained

It is Darling. This little niche just a short ferry ride from Sydney's Circular Quay is filled with restaurants of every style and entertainment for all (Aquarium, Zoo, Wax Museum, Maritime Museum and the Chinese Friendship Gardens). The ferry service is wonderful, affordable (get the multi-pass if you plan to visit many places) and views of the various harbours are great.
Well laid Out. Has a few bars plus Madame Tussaud's and other attractions like a small zoo plus paddle boats and nice views, nice place to relax

best place in Sydney. great views, great atmosphere, great buzz, great free firework display on a Saturday night, great street entertainers (particularly on a Saturday night), great places to eat and drink

great place. there is so much to see & do a whole day is hardly enough on this beautiful harbour. walk around first & then decide where to visit. we went to the chinese garden which was amazing. if you really want to enter the spirit of it you can hire out a chinese costume & off you go !!!!! of course there are several restaurants right along .we had dinner at Nick's restaurant which was excellent & great looking out when the sun goes down & everywhere is lit up.

Excellent entertainment. the entertainment on Darling Harbour was excellent. The food was not value for money and maybe establishments need to rethink their offerings. Out of all our experience the best was lunch @ Pontoon.

My favourite Sydney location. Lovely modern harbour with lots to do, a good place to have a coffee or a meal. Lots of different types of vessels use the harbour, and the Maritime museum is superb. Darling Harbour is also the location for Sydney Sailing, for a superb sailing experience on an America's Cup yacht.

very nice. We walked to darling harbour on the Saturday night they had fireworks they were great. My only dislike was they need more sitting & shaded place for people to just take a load off. But nice anyway

Darling harbour.. A short walk from Sydney harbour or, better still, a ferry ride, taking in the sights of the bridge and opera house, brings you to an area that has something for all. From it's harbour-side restaurants and cafés to it's excellent shopping centre, via the Australian maritime museum, you will not be sorry to visit this charming area of Sydney.

Walk, eat, walk, sit, lots of attractions!. Lots to do for families, pleasant to sit and relax, good range of bars, restaurants, cafés and fast food outlets. If you're lucky enough to catch the fireworks you won't be disappointed.
Darling Harbour. Where it was "happening". Restaurants, clubs, boats, aquarium, Wax museum, wildlife museum. Lots of energy.

Excellent playground at Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour has the most wonderful playground for kids. There is great climbing equipment, swings, a flying fox, sandpit and even water based activities. Best of all, it is free!

A must for the night life. We visited Darling Harbour on three occasions and fortunately we went one night during a firework display, boy what a sight as we sat eating our dinner at a waterfront resturant top class !!!

The naming of the location is just RIGHT!!!!. The harbor has just so many things to offer, that its even hard to list them all.The Darling Harbor has some of the finest dinning of the world with several being crowned best in different categories.Besides there are many fast food shops with different cuisines.There is an IMAX for movie lovers.3 of the visitor attractions of Sydney- The Madam Tussauds, Sydney Wild Life and Sydney Aquarium are also at the Darling Harbor. Also there is the National Maritime Museum.If you don't want to get in the above places or the numerous ones I couldn't mention you can enjoy a stroll around the harbor and walk over the foot bridge enjoying the sky scrapers and the hustles and bustles of the harbor.Almost round the year the Harbor holds special events and fire works which themselves are something amazing.

Interesting area. Bustling place, with lots to do and a great choice of places to eat, or just get the ferry to another part of the harbour. Nice spot to wander around at any time of the day or evening.

Very very busy little harbour. Really just a shopping centre with eateries and a hotel. Very crowded. beautiful location right on the water, and just a short walk across Pyrmont Bridge into the Sydney CBD.

Time well spent. Darling harbour was at walking distance from my hotel Travelodge and hence my destination for evening strolls which used to end only after it was properly dark. Darling harbour is a very lively place, lots of restuarants and bars, aquariums and other attractions, shopping places, and not to miss the Madame Tussauds. The daily ferries up and down the harbour, specially Captain Cook are worth to be taken surely. Please do not miss this :)

Fantastic Darling Harbour. A great harbourside location, with loads of eateries in a fab setting. Great by day and enhanced by night with Christmas lights and fireworks. Enjoyed early morning walks and late evening meals, and only 5 mins from our apartment, so doubly enjoyable.

Beautiful. The Darling Harbour with the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are all spectacular especially nice when crossing over on the ferry. The gigantic Ocean liners berthed in the Harbour as you walk by are absolutely massive and awesome to see close up.Walked with a young man who does the free tours and was really impressed by his knowledge of Sydney and his great personality. Would recommend this to anyone visiting the city.
Great for Friday/Saturday hangout. Center of social and cultural activities. Cinema, restaurants, bars, cafes, street performances, etc.
Lovely Area. Very relaxing area with a fantastic mix of cafés / restaurants and places of interest,Great to sit have bite to eat and people watch. Wonderful scenery
Shops and Views. Use to Hop on Hop Off bus a take time to walk through the shopping centre and big variety of outside eating places.

Fantastic. Visited during the day and did the maritime museum, went on 3 ships including a submarine, there were 5, and had a lovely barracuda lunch in the cafe, and went again at night for the night time sky line and dinner.

WOW. We could spend weeks in this area. A myriad of great restaurants or for those that don't wish to spend the high prices, dine in at the food court. Great buskers, romantic walks, giant aquarium, IMAX Cinema, Madame Tausauds, ferry rides and much more

Great area. We are staying at the Novotel Darling Harbour, which is a very nice hotel and a good starting point for a few days in Sydney.The Harbourside area is very nice with a bunch of good restaurant, which though are a little pricy, as it's an popular area.Hard Rock Cafe Sydney is also located here.It's a half an hours walk to "the Rocks", Harbour Bridge and Oprea House.

Staying at Darling Harbour. What a great area of Sydney to stay in. We had been to Sydney once before and stayed in The Rock, which was good, but there are so many more restaurants, situated all round the harbour, also very good for shopping, the Oueen Victoria building is a must, for the serious shopper !!!

The modern Australia. If Sydney Harbor is a mix of old and new Australia, the Darning Harbor is undoubtedly modern Australia. The atmosphere gets electric by mid morning and continues till laye evening. Many attractions around the place for kids, young couples and even grown ups.a must visit for a day, at least.
Great vibe. Highly recommend an evening visit. Vibe is awesome with plenty of bars and restaurants. Cargo bar is a great place for a drink.

You cannot escape, might as well enjoy it!. there's no escape...if you’re going to Sydney you have to enjoy the Darling Harbour – but be aware – it’s a touristy place, as touristy as can be.Don’t skip the water features if you’re carrying your kids – that is a must.
Darling Harbour. Fantastic precinct, close to all amenities, a must stay and see. Shopping, restaurants, Cockle Bay, Sky Tower (5 minutes away),

Worth a visit. Yes, it's full of tourists, but aren't we all tourists? There are loads of bars, restaurants, shops, an aquarium, maritime museum, and great people watching. And at 10 pm on Saturday nights there is a great fireworks display. You can't come to Sydney and not see Darling Harbour.

Fireworks. What a wonderful location. The Harbor is horseshoe shaped with bars, restaurants and activities on the shore. There is also a huge IMAX theater. There are street performers to boot.
On Saturdays at 9 there is a fireworks show (at least in the summer)in the harbor that was one of the better ones I had seen.
Great place. Nice restaurants, great shops a real nice place to visit.plenty of good hotels for a variety of budgets

Wait for the firework at 9pm:). Darling Harbour is so beautiful! I am not sure whether they have firework every single day but they should have it very often at 9pm. Make sure you wait for the firework when visiting Darling Harbour:)
Plus, try Lindt Cafe in Darling Harbour if you are a fan of chocolate. Pretty expensive but worth give it a try:)

Nice place, just too hot to enjoy it. We had a very pleasant ferry ride from Circular Quay, but for me this was really the best part of it. It was a stinking hot day (not Darling Harbour's fault I know) so we just wandered from the ferry until we found a cool spot to have a good cup of coffee, then walked to the light rail station to head back into town. Picturesque spot, lots of people, just wasn't the right thing for us to do that particular day.

The best place to be in Sydney. i can't say enough about Darling Harbour. There are numerous hotels and restaurants to choose from. We went to several restaurants for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and always had a great meal for a reasonable price. There is so much to see and do. I always felt safe and walked around leisurely during the day and into the evening. We were there for 7 days and wish we could have stayed longer. It is easy to get to Circular Quay by taxi, ferry, or walking. The place to stay in Sydney!

Everything a holiday needs!. Darling harbour has it all! Great restaurants, excellent shopping, beautiful set out and loads of attractions. We really enjoyed this location. We went there often as it was only a short walk from our accomodation. We could do something different every time we went. Loved the IMAX experience and Madame Tussaud's. and the Saturday night fireworks were beautiful.

Something for Everyone. Darling Harbour has it all, great attractions for all ages such as Sealife Aquarium, National Maritime Museum,Huge 3D Cinema and very near the Fish Market. There are loads of great places to eat and drink and the view of CBD is great, what a skyline, play areas for kids and plenty of street performers. In the evening when sunsets the lights over the harbour are worth seeing and on certain Saturday evenings they put on a spectacular firework display.
Real Chill Out. A place to simply walk and gaze, while the world goes by. The Royal Australian Navy band was performing while we were there and it is just beautiful to sit down and watch.
nice!!. nice area with a great ambiance, vibe , shops and restaurants from Mc Donalds to Hard Rock.it is a must see whenever I am in Sydney, even just to see the multicultural environment.

Very toursity. Darling Harbour is a must-see place in Sydney. It is full of street performers and families enjoying the attractions. Every Sat night at 9pm there is a firework display which is a nice touch. If you want the best view then the places around the IMAX are the best but book ahead in the restaurants if you want to eat.

A nice place to stay. We stayed at the casino and its nice and close to the ferry. Also close to all the restaurants, buses, stops and lite rail stops. There's a nice shopping centred as well. This area is a bit upmarket and some restaurants are bit overpriced.

Lots of shops, restaurants and activities. Once you have seen the Opera House and Harbour Bridge I would recommend the Darling Harbour over Circular Quay. There are more activities, restaurants and shops to see. Going at Christmas it was decorated beautifully.

Stunning. Fabulous Restaurants. Great attractions. Amazing facilities for all the family. Highly recommended. Lunch cheaper than dinner so worth doing a switch for your main meal for the day. Check out happy hours, again well worth it.

New Year to Remember..... Darling Harbor is breathtaking.... It was decorated so beautifully for Christmas. There are many restaurants to chose from. Don't forget fireworks on Saturday night at 9pm. My hotel had a entrance way that went right into the Harbor. (Novotel Sydney Darling Harbor). It went right into the Harborside shopping center as well. There are street performers, a cute train ride around the Harbor and many lively activities. I bought some cool boomerangs that were hand painted for 10 dollars. There are gardens and parks for your children to play and bars for you to play too. Hardrock, Margartaville are in the Harbor. There is something for everyone there.... Have fun in Sydney!!!! I will return real soon...

Kid-friendly destination. Yes, Darling Harbour is a very touristy area, but it became a favorite of my family's through the combination of its proximity to our hotel and the great park with water feature. The park is appropriate for younger kids, probably up to 11 or so. It has nice rope-climb structures, swings, a big slide, a zip line ("flying fox"), a sand area with smaller slides, and a very nice water play area. There are also a teacup ride and carousel adjacent to the park. The public bathrooms around the area are clean. Other attractions in the area include an IMAX theater, the Maritime Museum, and a water taxi stop to take to the Circular Quay (pricey, but worth doing once).

Fireworks!!. Darling Harbor is pretty touristy, but every Saturday night at 9 p.m. there is a great, great free fireworks show. There is also a maritime museum, aquarium and pyrmont bridge to walk across.

Stunning. We stayed in Darling Harbour, which is the most stunning place the buildings are amazing there are bars and restaurants all the way round and a lovely park too. perfect if you have young children. They have street entertainment to watch while you stroll around. Loved it there.
Madame Tussauds waxworks. Some incredible realistic figures. Great to pose with Jimmy Barnes and John Farnham. Recommend this.
Great Fun. A great place in summer especially for families. Fantastic free water park for the kids, street artists and performers, food options galore and some interesting (mostly tourist) shops.

Such a Darling little Harbour. Darling Harbour is a mecca for tourists to Sydney. The Imax theatre. The Restaurants and cafes. The water and views. The Hop On Hop Off Explorer Bus stops here for passengers. Always lots going on. Fantastic spot for Chinese New Year too.

Lots to do - very crowded too. Darling Harbour is very very touristy with the Aquarium, wax musuem, Chinese garden and many other activities happening including street performances and the Star nearby. The whole place was decorated for Xmas which was nice to see and the cafes were surprisingly really cheap offering 5$ beer and wine upto 7 pm so enjoyed it thoroughly with the super modern view of Sydney.

Casual atmosphere in beautiful harbour . I was glad to visit Darling Harbour during my first encounter with Sydney. It helped me beat the jet lag by offering me a huge selection of restaurants and shops in a nice environment. I was afraid it would feel artificial, but was proven wrong - locals and tourists alike enjoy an evening stroll around the harbor, people watching, kids playing in the playground or just having a bite. Don't miss it if you're around.
Beautiful at Christmas. We stayed in a hotel right in Darling Harbour just before boarding a cruise ship for Christmas. It was done up beautifully for Christmas, the kids will never forget it.
One of my favourite places in Sydney. It's one of my favourite places in Sydney, lot's of cafes, places:)and nice to spend time on your own and with friends!!!nice place to watch fireworks!!!

Busy as Always. HAving been here a number of times whilst on holiday, I am still amazed by the amount of people that are in Darling Harbour whenever we have visited.The place is always clean and tidy with no sign of rubbish anywhere, regardless of the time of day.There are numerous activities and restaurants to visit making it a day trip at least. Darling Quarter is well worth a visit for those with young children as they have a small water themed park that the children (and adults) can play in.Always worth a visit on a trip to Sydney
Nice Christmas decoration. The Harbour is very nice place to chill out. They had lots of Christmas decorations and it looked very sweet.

Darling harbour. Enjoyed my visit to Darling Harbour, very pretty area. Spent a couple days looking around and visiting some of the attractions it had to offer. A good place to visit on your trip to Sydney.
Wide selection of restaurants. Great area for a wide selection of restaurants which line both sides of the habour. Would defintely do this area at night.

Busy tourist hub. Always busy around here. Heaps of restaurants and bars to choose from, although mostly on the pricey side, but you're paying for the location of course....Lovely place to spend the afternoon or evening. Maybe a nice dinner here after a trip to the Aquarium.

Goodbye to Darling Harbour. Starting in January 2014, the demolishers move in to destroy most of the west side of Darling Harbour. The Convention Centre and Exhibition Centre together with the Entertainment Centre carpark are to be demolished in a jobs for boys scheme which will result in them being rebuilt over 3 years in a very debatable new concept.Darling Harbour has spent more time under construction or demolition in the last 40 years than functioning as a construction free zone. It's a pity since we have just enjoyed 3 dustfree years.The next stage, starting in 2014, will be the destruction of the Entertainment Centre which will be redeveloped to produce 1400 units over the next 10 years.So farewell Darling Harbour and hello to dust, noise and overshadowing high rise. Enjoy it in the next 2 weeks.

Darling Harbour-worth the visit. This is a great place for a walk, dinner or to enjoy the aquarium. We also saw fireworks on Saturday night at 9 p.m. Not sure whether they do this all year or just during the holiday season as we were there over Christmas. Enjoyed a good dinner at one of the many restaurants.

A favourite place with plenty of shops and places to eat.. We took the ferry from Circular Quay and enjoyed the atmosphere of Darling Harbour. There is the maritime museum, many restaurants and shops and the IMAX theatre or enjoy a stroll around the harbour soaking up the sights.
Ferry to Darling Harbour. We enjoyed the ferry trip but Darling Harbour itself was loud and brash. Probably better suited to a younger age group. I was glad we were not staying there.

Family Friendly & Very Safe. First time to Darling Harbour & loved the experience. So much for families & couples alike to do both indoor & outdoors. I would totally recommend the Chinese Gardens of Friendship & the cafe restaraunt culture for foodies. We will return as soon as we can.
Restaurant choice is great. The choice of Restaurants at darling harbour ./ Cockle Bay is great. Have had several excellent meals at a variety of restaurants on both sides of the harbour

Lacking charm or character. just another commercialized and over-developed waterfront area with no charm or character. it is akin to any big city's tourist trap full of poor quality big restaurants, etc. like fisherman's wharf in SF, it can be completely avoided while you search for the real heart of the city.

Grand.. Must reach there with adequate time.So many things to do.Sea life,Madam Tussaud,Animal world all under one roof.Numerous cruises and ferries including hop off and hop on start from there.Lovely restaurants and nice sights will keep you busy throughout the day.

The Hub of Tourism in Sydney. Darling Harbour is without doubt; the hub of tourism in Sydney. Currently; it is being updated and therefore it is a changing outlook with a new building project under way. Not to be missed while in Sydney with plenty of attractions such as Sydney;s Madame Tousards, the beautiful Chinese Gardens of Friendship which provides a tranquil setting within the city; and the aquarium to note a few. Apart from the attractions there are many fine restraunts and; of course; the scenery. Well worth a visit while in Sydney. It is free to walk around the Harbour, but of course there are entry fees to the attractions, including the Chinese Gardens.

Darling harbour. Nice shops and eating places all around..Again, can get a little bit crowded around the area. Lots of places to eat and everything although it can get a little bit pricey but then again its a tourist attraction. Visit if there is time in your hands =)

SO MUCH TO DO HERE!!!!!. I stayed in a Hotel next to Chinatown, which was a very short walk to Darling Harbour. The harbour seemed to have everything close by like the Sydney Aquarium, loads of restaurants and the Sydney Casino. There was also a huge walking bridge that connected the city side with the Casino side, which was really nice to walk over at night.

Darling harbor on New Year eve 2013. WOW the harbor tremendous. Crowded but entertaining. Tremendous vista's in any direction, bridges,ships Sydney skylines,opera house,flags,fountains,wharf,children's play park and much more. Food and drink available everywhere (most we're fairly expensive). Worlds largest IMAX theatre. Easy access via bus and train (buy the all day transit pass, we'll worth it). Definitely a must do.

Must see. One of the must see places in Sydney. Smaller than Sydney harbour but lots to do - also for younger kids. Our kids spends hours here enjoying the time. Lots of good restaurants here as well.

Pretty but food not great. Darling Harbour is very pretty to look at and is great for some drinks or a walk however I find a lot of the food places down there are pretty hit and miss. However they do now have the Meat and Wine co which is supposed to be pretty good. If it is anything like the one in Melbourne it would be great! All in all good place to visit but if you are looking for an amazing restaurant there are other places! :)

Stylish. There's lots to do but its also nice enough just to sit a watch the (stylish) Aussie world go by. Have a sandwich and sit is the park or visit one of the gazzilion restaurants, look at the boats, watch the birds, admire the art and the architecture, Darling has it all.

Darling harbor. This is "the other harbor" in Sydney. It it smaller than Sydney harbor and does not have a view of the Opera House or bridge. What is nice is that it is easy to stroll and has many restaurants bars and ice cream places. There are places to sit and watch harbor. There is a fantastic playground for the children that is quite large. This whole area is fun to enjoy as a way to be on the harbor but not in the crowd of Sydney harbor. There is plenty going on but most of it is centered around the restaurants and all the many tour boats coming and going to different sights. You can also take a ferry from here to Sydney harbor which is a nice ride.
Great Fire Work Display. Nice area to walk round and have lunch or dinner at one of the many restaurants. Fire works display on Saturday night is not to be missed.

Enjoyed the wander around. Nice area to wander around - shops, museums, zoo, restaurants and IMAX theatre - spent the afternoon there and then caught a ferry to the sydney harbour bridge - easy to get a ticket, cheap and helpful ferry staff
Kids Love It. We visited with our 7 and 5 year olds by recommendation from a friend who lives in Sydney. The kids loved it! They could have spent hours there if not for the time limit we enforced.

amazing place full of things to see and eat. Darling Harbour has some wonderful tourist destinations, like the aquarium, but also many, many cafes, bars and restaurants. There is always something going on or happening that is fun to watch.

Very touristy but pretty skyline of Sydney. Darling Harbor was extremely touristy with the rows of restaurants on one side, and the theatre and boardwalk rides on the otherside. Nontheless, it is worth a visit for the beautiful view of the wharf and the skyline of Sydney!

Felt very touristy. The harbour is attractive but we repeatedly were told by the locals that Darling Harbour was mostly for tourists. I'd rather spend time experiencing things that the locals partake in.
Buzzing Harbour. Many places to wine and dine or simply take a wAlk along the harbour. Also recommend viewing a movie in the mega IMAX screen there.

Place for family gathering. Darling Harbour is the most happening place in Sydney with so many things to see and do. It is very easy to access via different transportations. You will be very surprise that there are wildlife zoo and aquarium there. It is such a great place with so beautiful view of the harbour though it can be crowded during weekend but it is good for family gathering, shopping, hanging around and you can even see the street performers. Itis a perfect place for outing during weekend.

Nightlife and Fun!. We found Darling Harbor to be a great place for nightlife and fun! There are fireworks on Saturday nights, and some restaurants have boats that do dinner cruises on the harbor that end with the fireworks display. We took the ferry over and watched from the boardwalk and we could see that all the restaurants were packed with folks having a wonderful time.Another night, we went to the IMAX theatre, and the following day we enjoyed lunch outdoors followed by a visit to the aquarium, which gives a great idea of the aquatic life found in the Great Barrier Reef. The Maritime Museum is also located here, with a pirate ship and WWII battleship floating out in front.
the heart of Sydney. A lively place with plenty of restaurants and at walking distance from any major attractions - the best area where to stay while visiting Sydney
Darling Harbour has many attractons.. We enjoyed the Sydney Aquarium at Darling Harbour very much. It was quite comprehensive and entertaining. We did not do the wax museum or the wildlife park.

DARLING HARBOUR. We took a walk around Darling Harbour and enjoyed soaking in the lovely atmosphere and ambience.There were many beautiful restaurants around which it made even more appealing.Worth visiting!
Briliiant for a meal and drinks. Take a stroll along the harbour and venture into some of the many bars and restaurants many of which are offering happy hour drinks.
Trendy and vibrant. Great area that seems to be undergoing a renaissance. Lots of great restaurants and shops. Great for walking.
Good harbour. The harbour and the areas surrounding it are what define Sydney and make it such a wonderful place to visit anytime during the year
Santa. Visited there for the santa on water and the fireworks. Besides that, there is nothing much. Walking distance to the aquarium and there are rolls of restaurant.
Fantastic atmosphere. A fantastic family atmosphere with playground, water features, restaurants to suit all budgets- magical at Christmas.
Great place to visit. It was lovely to get out of our overpriced Hotel and head down to Darling Harbour for breakfast. The atmosphere was great with a huge variety of eating places.

Did I miss something?. One of the things I guess you are supposed to see, but why? If you are interested in the aquarium or the maritime museum then there's a reason to go, but otherwise - it's a row of restaurants that all look alike.
Tumbalong Park. Must not miss Tumbalong Park, further down south of Darling Harbour. Fun place for kids to spend an afternoon!

love it. every saturday evening you have a firework - thats lovely, never done and always fun! where on earth do you have that?ferry service, biggest cinema, shaded playground, water games and wells, chinese garden, mall, massive amount of restaurants, cruises, bars, close to the CBD and close to the fishmarket - quiet little parks around (direction of pyrmont) - as i said: just love it!
Christmas!. While visiting Syndey, we stopped in Darling Harbour. It was festively decorated for Christmas. Lots of restaurants and the SeaLife Aquarium was very interesting.

So much going on. We've only been in Sydney a month but have visited the harbour over and over again.Although there are a number of expensive restaurants theres plenty of cheaper places to eat and lots of deals if you look.We saw Santa fest at the start of December which was amazing and also plenty of fireworks. We also desperately want to go to tge imax there which is apparently one of the biggest in the world.

Love Darling Harbour. Our hotel, Novotel Rockford was a 2 block walk to Darling Harbour. Beautiful area to walk around. Lots of restaurants and shopping. Easy access to wharf and ferry rides. Looking for souvenirs, check out Paddy's Market. Very reasonably priced and just a couple of blocks from our hotel.

A great area. This is a really pretty place to visit with loads of attractions to keep you amused for hours. It is a stroll over to the main CBD although I was disappointed to see the removal of the skyrail option, progress I guess??We love the shopping centre, the restaurants, walking around the harbour, the maritime museum, the casino, the list goes on.We almost always stay in one of the Darling Harbour hotels on every visit to Sydney and really enjoy the location and the experiences. It is great attraction

Like going to Epcot in Sydney. Darling Harbor is very much an attraction made for tourists that is just too many restaurants and malls. There are many more cool things to see so close by that I wouldn't recommend spending too much time there (if any).

Good place to hangout - Friday/Saturday Nights. Its a very happening place on weekend nights. A lot of pubs known for having good music and good drinks. This place has a good food court for the budget conscious. Dont miss the fireworks every Saturday evening.

Fun Harbor!. This is a lively harbor side pedestrian area with attractions and activities to entertain the entire family, especially if you have children. Great Maritime Museum, lots of bars and restaurant.

Great place to hang out. Day or night, this is a great place to spend time; full of life. Lot of attractions and restaurants. You forget time passing as you keep walking around or sit and relax. This is also the place for kodak moments.
Amazing. fantastic area - plenty of restaurants and bars to suit everybody, very clean even when busy, looked lovely with all the christmas lights

Australia. Very colourful harbour you reach this after having come through a fab park that seems to have all sorts in it, loads of bars cafes and the australian animal wildlife adventure at the harbour well worth a visit just to see all the different yatchs boats and worth taking a ride in the water taxis.
Food and entertainment - don't miss out. Loved Darling harbour - food choices are very good as are attractions like sea life and the Maritime museum

So much to do. Very scenic. Vast amount of eateries which get filled up late afternoon/early evening. Well designed water features in the area near the Chinese Gardens before you hit the rectangular harbour basin. Really good atmosphere. Natioanl Maritime Museum there as well as Zoo/SeLife and Madame Tussauds. Further building work taking place out to the Point

Very nice area. Clean and modern area with all kinds of shops and restaurants. Always something going on. Sunday was a great day for the family and a lot of different small attraction with different artists.

Great place to wander, eat or relax.. We love Darling Harbour as it is vibrant, plenty of restaurant eating options and the Harbourside food hall and shops. Great park/play area for kids, teens and adults and attractive water features.

Fantastic night life. Just tourists, we wandered around during the day and night. The atmosphere was great. Street performers, kids playing, fountains, loads and loads of food options. We really enjoyed just wandering.

Great place to spend an evening. You are spoiled for choice selecting a place to have lunch or dinner. All seemingly good restaurants were jam packed and you needed either prior booking or long wait to get a table - I was there on Saturday night.
Amazing fireworks display started at around 9:30 or so.
Pretty but not much else. Darling Harbour is pretty and the Aquarium is great for the kids etc, but I found for adults at night the bars were over priced and really not that much fun!

Star Attraction. I can remember the old wharfs, that used to be here. What a transformation. Museums, hotels, harbour cruises, restaurants and apartments now pre-dominate. Lots to see and do and a very pleasant walk round the periphery is a must if you have a few hours to spare.

Favourite Place. so many restaurants, bars and entertainment happening all year round. keep an eye out for happy hours and grab a bargain. recommend : wax museum, maritime museum and so many other places to visit all in the one area.

A gem. A total contrast to sydney harbour. This is the tourist attraction although it is very beautiful with plenty of things to see and do . Gearing up for seasonal festivities wish I was still there to experience this

Lovely place to eat and play. I was travelling with only my young son on way to New Zealand but felt safe in this area, even in the evenings as it was bustling with families. Great choice ofvrestaurants and of course we had to visit the imax cinema situated in the harbour.
Always fun!. This visit we experienced IMAX for the first time, a couple of new restaurants and the Chinese Friendship Gardens. Loved the Christmas themed Santa Fest. Brilliant spot!
Great Place. Great Views and lots to do. Has plenty of restaurants on a beautiful waterfront setting. A must see if you visit Sydney. Great people watching place too.

Food, drinks, dance. I love Darling Harbour, spent a whole day there. Went to Madamme Tussads which was fun but short. Then had dinner there and had a drink and a dance at one of the bars. Great fun and great company!
Love this place. We were lucky to be there on Fleet Review day so saw all the battleships docked right across the Darlinh harbour. Love getting the ferry to explore everywhere
awsome place to stay. loved the restaurants and places to see transport was easy with ferrys and trams great holiday plenty to keep you entertained

Must visit place. If you visit Sydney, then it is the place to visit. Its a bustling place with a huge number of restaurants to choose from as well as a beautiful waterfront setting. My favourite place for people watching in Sydney
Be careful on the bridge.. Great view. Aquarium was fantastic but expensive. Luckily we had a 2 for 1 coupon. Almost got run over by a cyclist on the bridge.
Just your average harbor area.. Dirty and packed with of people. Bric-a-brac galore! Not much to see that is worth the crowds and noise. Not the best food for sure.
So much to see. Just to see the Sydney bridge and Opera house was great bit of a walk from one to the other,but you got to see every thing inbetween.

Lots of things to do and see.. Built around this Harbour are a myriad of shops, attractions and restaurants. There is something for everyone. Just doesn't quite join together and was quite dirty in places.

Always a great day out!. Babysat my niece took her for a walk through Darling Harbour. This place is so vibrant, fully charged and packed with things to do. Sunday, they had free Henna hand painting, live music, camel rides AND an old school circus carousel. We had lunch at Darling Quarter and played in the massive playground for hours! Highly recommend a visit if your in the city :)

The Buzzling Waterfront. Whether you want to relax your legs after a strenuos visit to the Maritime Museum (Big Ticket) or you want to wander through the Aquarium, the Darling harbour is buzzing always with something or other to do.
Touristy but worth the visit. Plenty of restaurants and pleasant promenade beside the water. Good place to find decent sea food and a cosy place to enjoy a drink or two.

Well worth a visit.. I really like Darling harbour. I've stayed there on both my visits to Sydney. There is a wide selection of bars, eateries and shops and there is always something going on. Of an evening it is quite pleasant to sit in one of the harbour side cafes and watch the world go by, you don't get bored.As well sat the big attraction of the Maritime Museum there is the Chinese Garden and if you've got young kids there is a great playground for them at the back of the Harbour not to mention the land trains.

Lively and Bustling with Activities. Lots to do here. Take in the sights, visit the aquarium, madame Tussaud or just sit and have a nice lunch and beer. Located right in the middle of town and makes for awesome night life as well.

The views, the restaurants and the people watching. A lovely way to spend the day, checking out the great bars and restaurants that are along the shoreline. Great place to people watch and sit and look at the water.

Great area...must go..!. Just wandering around Darling Harbour is a lovely experience. We spent many evenings here at the various bars and restaurants. There are also the shops, zoo, museum etc. The food court is great, lots of choice! In the evenings there is a good nightlife and a great place to just people watch and enjoy the sunset with some delicious food and a few drinks. Miss this place!

Lovely atmoshpere. The harbour is packed with all sorts of fine dining. You can literally get any cuisine you wish. There was a kids play area. Beautiful for a jog or a walk. They have the largest IMAX theater in the world. Lovely place

An amazing experience. Just to walk around the harbour is a joy at any time of day or night - but especially at night and at the weekend. It is so vibrant with many delightul restaurants, great shopping and many seats just to sit and people watch and take in the atmosphere.

Picknic harbour. Darling harbour is a beautiful place for entire family. You can enjoy cruise, monorail, zoo, aquarium, food, sailing restaurant, shops, museum etc. You can enjoy full day with family and kids.

Not really worth the trip. Darling Harbor didn't feel or look very special to us, on a weekday afternoon. Perhaps we missed the happening nightlife. Circular Quay seemed to be much livelier, at least during the day.

Darling Harbour transport. The review "NO MONORAIL" dated 10-Sep-2013 is misleading as there IS transport to the Maritime history Museum. Bus 443 operates from Circular Quay via George St, QVB (Town Hall station), Pyrmont, The Star casino and terminates at the Maritime Museum. It runs every 15-20 min all day, every day. The Pyrmont Bay Light rail stop is across the road from the Maritime Museum as well. It runs approximately every 10 minutes from Central station and Chinatown.

stunning!!. Darling Harbour was the jewel in the crown of our visit to Sydney.. we were so lucky to have chosen a hotel within easy walking distance. Our first breakfast in Sydney was at Blue Fish and was our first taste of the excellent food on offer at very reasonable prices along the waterfront. In four days we only got one dud service (not Blue Fish). With Sydney gearing up towards Christmas we were very impressed with the effort put in with inflatable Santas and free events for families. Darling Harbour by night is breath taking.. beautiful place to visit and hope to again.

Something for Everyone!. Darling Harbour occupies some of Sydney Harbour's best waterfront spaces. Originally part of Sydney's working harbour, Darling Harbour has reinvented itself as a tourist destination and city workers big space to repair to. There are precincts within the space that are special in their own right. The Chinese Garden, IMAX Cinema Complex; Convention Centre; the Aquarium; Parking; the Pyrmont Bridge; the Maritime Museum.; access to China Town; the Entertainment Centre; the Pumphouse Pub, just to name a few. Almost the Harbourside One Stop Shop! There are many restaurant options on both the City and the Pyrmont side. On the City side there is Coast, and Puri Cinta, as well as bars. On the Pyrmont side is the Darling Harbour complex offering restaurants, both indoor and outdoor, as well as shopping opportunities. On the water itself you will find water taxis and the odd water tourist. This is where the Boat Show is held each year. There are also boats on display to explore. To flesh out the space, you will find the mega buskers and at festive times quite a lot of really good Street Theatre. All this and you are still in the City. The space is well served by walkways, parking for cars, and the casual coffee seeker. If you find the space too large to comfortably get around, there are small precinct trains to assist you. Office workers use the space for lunch breaks or after work drink meet ups. Darling Harbour is used equally by tourists, visitors, locals, the city office worker commuter public. Bring your hat, your money and your camera. Leave enough time to enjoy.

SightSeeing. Disappointed that the idiots took away the monorail rather than making it free for tourists. Great open area. Powerhouse museum was great fun! Though people are a bit self important bureaucrats who forget they are their for the public.

Fun walk about. Darling harbor is fun. I walked to Chinese Garden, paid entry and enjoyed tea and dim sum. If walking is a problem, there are five dollar trains..that chug along and you pay every time you get off. Or you can pay $40 and do the Hop on Hop off bus. They have a couple stops at Darling. One rather close to the Aquarium which was fun..but lots of walking. Skip the glass bottom boat, at the aquarium it is hot and hokey. Darling Harbor was great for a walk. There is an info center there. A few bathrooms here and there. You can walk across a bridge. There are several entries to Darling Harbor from the city..and yes spell correct changes to harbor.

What a buzz. Recently spent 2 nights in Sydney after a cruise and on both those nights we went to Darling Harbour to find a restaurant to have a nice meal. The place is huge and has a great atmosphere. A lot of after work get togethers in some of the bigger restaurants which were pretty noisy but there was a decent selection of restaurants to choose from

Lively and intersting. Darling Harbour has many attractions, there is a museum plus all kinds of shops and a small shopping mall which also has a food area serving many different types of take away food. We had pancakes at the special pancake shop - delicious! There is also a cinema and many waterside restaurants and gift shops, walk over the bridge from the city to get there.
A great day out.. Wonderful day out so much to do and see. Just walked around had a meal and a few drinks as well as did some shopping.

A destination in itself. Plenty of things to see and do in this area. It's an easy walk from the city area and the rewards are plenty - lots of cafes and restaurants, various activities, the Maritime Museum, Madame Tussauds, IMAX, and the great old bridge over the harbour. Shame they're removing the monorail, that gave a different perspective on the area too.This is a very popular area, there are always plenty of people here. Well worth a visit as there's something young and old.
Unbelievable views from the water taxi. Make sure you take a ride on the water taxi and see all the sites along the harbor. So much history.

Fab place to get the feel of Sydney. Darling Harbour is the place to get the feel of the Sydney social life. Every Saturday night their is a firework extravaganza and the place is packed!! There are circa 20m people in Aus and it feels like they are all here. Party with them - they love it till the late early morning - then go for brunch!!

Night place. We enjoyed this place a lot more in the evenings than in the day. Though the food options are slightly more expensive, having good food by the harbour is still a wonderful experience that must be had. The lights from the buildings are also reflected well on the still waters by the harbour, providing the perfect foreground for your photos.

Another "Must" while in Sydney. Darling harbour used to be a derelict rail yard until it was redeveloped some years ago to become the hub of entertainment in Sydney. Allow at least half a day to have a look around and take in the various activities available. These include Sydney Aquarium and Australian Wildlife, the Maritime Museum, Madam Tussaud's and the IMAX Theatre. Restaurants of various types abound and there is also a large shopping mall. Highly recommended.

Really nice to walk around here. I love taking a walk around here. There's a circuit all the way around Cockle Bay and always lots to see - whether it's daybreak or late into the evening. The atmosphere is always really pleasant and the view to the Sydney city skyline is magnificent. Take the time and soak it all in as you walk along.

Pleasant, peaceful Walk. I like walking around Darling harbour. Plenty of interesting shops and eateries, but the aquarium is an absolute must. The leisurely walking around Darling is not spoilt by the crowds you get around circular quay, a much more visitor friendly area with plenty of interest.

Very predictable. It's OK if you like expensive shops and restaurants. It is better at night with all the lights from the tall buildings etc. giving it a nicer atmosphere than during the day. It is not as interesting as the Cape Town equivalent I visited but still a nice place to go but gets quite noisy at night.

Best restaurants ans bars. There are heaps of restaurants and bars, maybe its just me, but having the view of the bay, the water and the boats, make everything better. it is also amazing to watch the fireworks each saturday night, its just inspiring.The is also a big shopping mall, with a bunch of stores, and food court, including the hard rock cafe. So you'll find anything you are looking for.I go very often with my friends, we just love to try new restaurants each time, and every single time is excellent.

Weekend at Darling Harbour. Restaurants, pubs, cinemas, casino & play areas in the park for kids. You can catch ferries, water taxies & other means of transport from here. Also the home of Madame Tussauds & the Aquatic Centre. Love the place :-)

Something for everyone. From the young to the elderly, rich or poor there is entertainment galore.There is a shopping centre with a food mall or the most gorgeous places to sit and eat or just have a drink and take in the atmosphere.Playgrounds for children IMAX theatre and free fireworks on a summer night and sideshows of some very talented people. Have dinner on the Steyne ferry,visit the Maritime Museum, Madam Tussards or Australia Wildlife or just around the corner is the Star Casino. You can also go around to King St Wharf and catch a ferry to other Sydney Hotspots.Have a wonder around and I dare you not to find something you will enjoy
Needs to be done.. You really need to tick this from your bucket list. The warmer months are the best as you can enjoy a drink as the sunsets.

Dinner at Darling Harbour. Dinner last night at Darling Harbour spectacular view fabulous Christmas lights, the area is so pretty with all the lights wonderful place to walk around, any many choices for dinner.

Tranquil. This area of Sydney attracts thousands daily and it is obvious that the traffic of pedestrians flowing through it is immense, yet when a part of it you still feel the tranquillity that comes with its position by the waterside.Some of Sydney's better restaurants are situated in the precinct or very nearby as are numerous of good hotels for easy access to accommodation.You could easily spend an entire day here and not get to see everything.it has major function/entertainment centres and is home to the world's largest 3D cinema known as IMAX.

Seafood and ice cream ... yum!. Have garlic prawns at Bluefish, wander around to Gelatissimo for Hazelnut gelato, or my very own favourite, Baskin & Robbins Pralines & Cream ... yummmm!With lots to see at Darling Harbour from souvenir shops to clothes, shoes, food and recreation shops, there's lots for all the family to do and indulge in.Stay until after dark in summer and see the fireworks on Saturday nights. It's so nice to wander around from one side to the other, over the bridge or just the walk around Cockle Bay.No matter how you like to travel around, it's a great place to spend a few hours or so on a Saturday or Sunday night.

My Favourite spot in Sydney. We love this place. Its a family place of the first order. Playground for the little ones and not so little. Restaurants everywhere, low cost and gourmet. There is a Carousel, and often some sort of entertainment. Ferries to other spots in Sydney and of course there are the warships on review and the Maritime museum. the shopping has improved and the atmosphere is excellent. this is where we go for Australia Day, New Year and our Wedding anniversary lunch.

The classic tourist trap. Darling Harbour is a classic tourist trap: expensive, bland and soulless. Except for the Chinese Gardens at the southern end, it is best avoided unless you are a sociologist wanting to see the worst features of Australian "culture".

Good for an Excellent Day/Afternoon. Fun and active place to wander through, have a drink, see an attraction or two, and enjoy a meal or two. It's pretty large but be sure to see the attractions on the periphery, too, such as Market City (the building especially) and the Powerhouse Museum.

Yes Darling. We stayed close to Darling Harbour and were glad that we were so close. Some very good bars etc here and plenty going on. There is a good atmosphere too - glad we have seen Darling Harbour
I'd leave this until last.. It could be anywhere at the end of the day. Go see a national park instead: Katooma/Wentworth Falls, Royal National Park, even Lane Cove NP - nice and close to the city.
boring. nothing to do.except walk around in circles.food extremely expensive and poor quality.would not recommend this place.

Lots of fun at Darling Harbour. On my first visit to Sydney, we stayed near Darling Harbour and were able to enjoy so many attractions, shopping and restaurants. It made a great morning or evening stroll. Definitely the heart of the action in Sydney!

Entertainment galore. If you stuck for somewhere to go while in Sydney( highly unlikely) then this is the place to be for Restaurants, cinema etc.Fireworks every Saturday night.We missed those as the Saturday we were there the bush fires were still going so they were cancelled out of respect.
Best Harbour. very well planned. Lots of attractions, cafes,hotels. Best to visit during day & night as well.Excellent place to sit,walk, eat and drink
Great Atmosphere.. Clean, friendly, atmosphere both day and evening, restaurants all good memories, NOTHING we disliked.
Nice. Place very well planned, with good restaurants, cafes, and many options to entertainment as IMAX, Aquarium and Madame Tussauds. Great to sit and see the time pass.

Darling Harbour. Had a fab day there. Don't go to early if you want to shop as the shops there were only opening at 10am.
We got tickets to 3 places and by far my favourite was the wildlife park.

If in Sydney don't miss Darling Harbour. What a fabulous spot. A myriad of restaurants, shops and other attractions set around the most picturesque waterfront vista. Lovely to just stroll around and people watch.Highlight for us was the kiddy water play area (which is free) with little flowing canals and fountains aplenty. Our toddler grandson had a ball. Be sure to bring dry clothes for them to change into :-)

Fun place for every age. Darling Harbour is a beautiful place to be with the great view off the office towers, the water, entertainment, shopping centre, convention centre, endless opportunities to dine, cultural festivals and the playground for kids. The weekly firework on Saturdays brings so many people together and is amazing. Go there as soon as you can to see the current "version" of the harbour before another redevelopment starts in the next weeks for the next few years. As usual with those premium locations, be prepared to pay premium prices in restaurants, bars etc even though the quality and friendliness of some places is questionable. An alternative is the Harbour shopping centre food court.

Cute Cove. Darling Harbour is going under some reconstruction at the moment but it was so lovely! The restaurants there have an amazing and cheap breakfast menu with the Aquarium, Wildlife, and Madam Tussards right there by the ferry stop. The bridge takes you across to the shops and behind the huge IMAX movie theatre there are wonderful little shops and cafes as well as great playgrounds for the kids! Not to mention a whirpool fountain outside the convention centre there. All in all, a cute cove to escape to for breakfast!

Great Place. lovely setting, especially on a sunny day, with plenty of things and activities to do from shopping to eating and drinking or just sitting people watching.one of the prettiest harbours that you will ever see

A bit touristy. I find this a bit touristy. Not really my kind of place. Lots of cafes, shops, and people! Near china town. In a pretty spot, the water and boats are nice to look at and there is an aquarium, but not really to my liking.

Nice place!. A nice place to have a stroll at, went during the sunset and walked around for a bit. There are attractions like Madamme Tussaud's, SeaLife and lots of restaurants around. It's alright to visit for an hour or so otherwise nothing much really.
nothing great about the place. No need to visit unless you need to catch the ferry, want to go to an attraction, or want to shop. Otherwise nothing of interest.
Good spot for a date. If you are trying to Mack it this is a good spot. Nice walks , nice restaurants , good times. I reckon I would check this area out if you can

Concrete Jungle meets wastelands and past its useby date. Darling Harbour is nothing special, its got all the fountains and fake grasslands, but lacks the appeal for myself to return or buy or consume anything. Again Darling Harbourside shopping centre is a mall its speciality overpriced shops are not worth it. Darling harbour has been recently transform its created a children's playground and has incorporated Commonwealth banks HQ making the area for business, boring!!. Compared to other places around Australia like Darling harbour. Melbourne's Docklands is much better with a DFO with shops you would consider buying from, side walk cafes, jetties to park the boat, ornaments and funky street furniture. Darling Harbour lacks that its more of a giant waste land were the express ways divert on top of you, corporations purchase huge amount of land for their boring business and giant playground that is more childcare centre for City workers and employees, and a lack lustre chinese garden. Southbank in Brisbane is a better alternative for playground or Docklands in Melbourne would be for sidewalk cafes. Allot of the pavement around Darling harbour is tired, tis like it stuck in the 80's they keep trying to update tit but I think it time to run the bull doze knock the shopping mall, the aging pedestrian bridge, all the cafes, the aquarium, the play ground the Imax, the eyesore entertainment centre and start again this place is a wasteland. if you want to go back in time in Australia Darling harbour hasn't changed since it was first built and to think this place is still used for major events.

Scenic vistas of the Sydney CBD. Darling Harbour is the home to the Australian National Maritime Museum, which was at the top of my "must see" list for my day in Sydney. Great ships to visit and fascinating displays in the Museum.
Nice but plenty of flies. Great place to take pics, shop, eat, etc. It's a little dirty and has flies/bird droppings all over.

DARLING HARBOUR SYDNEY. December 2012, in the cold windy night, the harbour was spectacular bathing in colourful lights. Take a slow walk on the bridge. The reflections of the lights were illuminated by the water. Superb time for photography sessions. The Christmas decorations and various lightings added more to the festive cheer. A place not to missed by anyone in Sydney.

Exellent. The most beautiful bay of Sydney with many restaurants, attractions, shops and magnificent views of the surrounding buildings.At the weekend evenings is a unique destination for walking and recreation.

Pretty, but quite artificial. Entertainment complex built for tourists. However in it you can find many interesting things to see, like the Aquarium or Madame Tusaaud's. Avoid the restaurants and bars here if you want to get a feel of the authentic Sydney. Local Teeenagers seem to enjoy hanging out here on the weekends.
Beautiful area!. I like being near the sea, so this place was great for me to chill. Plenty of bars, restaurants and attractions. Lovely views too :)

Go for the Saturday evening fireworks if you can.. Busy, lively area, lots of restaurants. The fireworks on Saturday evening at 8ish, are free and a really good show. We watched them from the bridge over the harbour and this was a good vantage point.

Come here for the harborside restaurants and cafes. Definitely one of the areas to go if you want to dine and drink with the trendy waterfront ambiance. You would think a touristy area would be overcrowded, no ambiance with mediocre offerings. Not so - you can score some good options such as Blackbird restaurant and the Lindt chocolate cafe. Those were what I had while there, though I'm sure with the range this place has to offer it will cater to a wide range of tourists and locals alike and have something for everyone.

I just loved it!. We went to Wildlife Sydney Zoo and we can see so many things along the way. It's a perfect place for family and there were so many people as we went during weekend. It seems there are a lot more other places nearby but we didn't go but for sure it worth it.

Excellent location to stay. This is a nice part of Sydney to stay as it is handy for shops tourist attractions and cruise boats to see all the sights, the night life is vibrant and everyone should visit the Star casino and designer shops just for the experience if not to have a little gamble!

I can imagine this place really goes crazy on warm summer nights.. I was in Sydney for five nights and we came to Darling Harbour three times. That either means it's fantastic or convenient or perhaps a little of both. Getting there during daylight helps you to get a better sense of appreciation for the place and warm calm evenings help the cause and we had two of those. There's a whole range of dining options and then there are the city lights as a backdrop. It's certainly worth a visit.

Darling harbour. We have just spent the weekend in sydney with our 3 kids, aged 13, 11 10, our guys loved darling harbour so much, all the food was amazing and the whole environment of the harbour is just so beautiful

Mecca for eating and entertainment. A 30 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay brings you to Darling Harbour which is a large complex of entertainment places as well as all types of eating places - we tried 3, Olivo, Meat & Wine Co and Blue Fish - all provided good meals in an excellent location. Saturday night, the harbour also puts on fireworks.
You have never seen a harbor like Darling. Shops and stores and boats and restaurants and street entertainment, grocery stores, malls and of course lots of boats and yachts.
Eat, drink and relax. Spoilt for choice with so many great eating places. Easy access to so many other attractions too. Great daytime or night time - and the fireworks made it even better.

Worth a visit. Darling Harbour has places to go, e.g. The Aquarium and Madame Tussaud's, places to eat, from the economical to the "fine dining experience", and shops to browse. Thoroughly recommend a visit.

Nighttime pleasures. A walk around darling Harbour at night brings opportunity for food of all description, price, and taste, shops to buy gifts for family and friends, and night caps in busy bars or cozy lounges. The lights twinkle on the water and people mingle, kid friendly (if you have them) , lots of space for walking, sitting, and watching a world of diverse people all doing the same....a great way to spend the evening.

Darling Harbour - mark it on your travel plan. In Darling Harbour, you can have all sort of fun and entertainments, from cinema to aquarium, from fast food to fine dinning, you can spend a whole day there.It's like a city inside Sydney city centre, where you have a completely different feeling, it is just relaxing!!! Don't miss out this spot, make sure it is on your travel plan.Recommend to stay after sunset!
Great ambience!. There were fireworks on Saturday night just when we had dinner on the terrace of one of the restaurants - it was amazing!
More a tourist haven. Lots of shops and restaurants and it has a wonderful aspect of the inner harbour. Has no emotional feel though, more like an airport shopping centre or Westfield mall.
Awesome to just sit and watch. What a great way to spend an afternoon! So much to do but even just sitting watching the boats and the people was spectacular!

Saturday night Fireworks. We walked from our hotel down to Darling Harbour for dinner. The weather was perfect and the Harbour was buzzing with people. We dined at a restaurant called Olivo and they went out of their way to get us a table outside at the front so we could view the free Fireworks which are put on each Saturday evening. Very enjoyable!

always entertaining. It is a great day out with family or friends to see all the different things taking place at Darling Harbour. They have wonderful festivals all year round. Something different is always happening.

Lovely walk - lots to see. We stayed on darling harbour, it was lovely of an evening to wander round darling harbour finding somewhere to eat, and looking at all the thing going on at the harbour. We managed to catch fireworks over the harbour, which were amaze!

Busy Harbour but well laid out with lots of eateries. Great place to visit and we usually do everytime we go to Sydney. Lots of eateries, Imax Theatre, Maritime Museum, shopping and other things of interest

Good Times. very pleasant experience at the darilng harbour. there were many nice restaurants. good place for evening walks to soak in the atmosphere. we walked from darling harbour to cockles bay to harbour side. enjoyed a few glasses of wine along the way. nice place to spend the evening.and great fireworks on saturday. be sure so get an outdoor seating to enjoy the view.

Modern water front. Great for evening walks and lots of top restaurants to sit and enjoy a meal with a lively atmosphere. Ships of all sizes are docked here and it is a trendy place for people to meet. Great Italian and Chinese food available..everything really, the choice is tremendous and the skyline is impressive.
