Most happening place to be.. we were in Sydney on friday & saturday.Darling harbour is where ships, cruises embark & disembarks. fullof cafes & bars-decorated nicely to attract people. All wre doing brisk business--filled upto brim with enthusiastic Aussies. Last ferry to returns was at 11.30 pm.- so we were witness to vacation mood of people.

Don't Miss Darling Harbour. We visited Darling Harbor several times during our stay in Sydney. It is a great entertainment and food district. There are some great restaurants and coffee shops including a Starbucks.
Most of the harbor side restaurants offer "early bird" specials for some great meals at reasonable prices.

A wonderful location to stay. A wonderful location to stay and the hotels are probably cheaper than Circular Quay. A short cab ride away from the Circular Quay cruise port when it is not rush hour. There were lots to see including the Aquarium and Marine Museum. Lots of old ships around and two stops for the ferry to Circular Quay running about every half hour. The harbor is ringed with restaurants, bars, and outside seating with beautiful views. Check the placards outside for happy hour ads and special early dinner prices. Also there is and inside mall with a food court for quick meals.

Been there done that Darling. Expectations were high but when we got there it was a tad short and a bit off the mark. Setting was nice, but a lot of the area looked like it needed a good scrub. The shopping mall/s needed lifting (same as all the rest) The Pyrmont bridge is a fabulous piece of Victorian Era engineering wonder and should be promoted...nice to see the monorail gone, shame about the graffitti and the aggressive cyclists on the bridge during the day. At night the drunken louts spoiled the place during what should have been an enjoyable warm late nights stroll....
Lots to do.. You can see the Aquarium and see the huge movie theatre and eat at some nice restaurants. The chinese gardens were nice to relax. What a lovely place in Sydney.

Great Place for night out. You should visit Darling Harbour on Saturdays nite as it has this beautiful fireworks attraction. Don't forget to try the Ribs in many restaurant outlets that offer this menu around the harbour. Definitely a good place to share the Saturday nite with friends or family.

OK spot. Darllng Harbor has a lot of things going for it. There are lots of restaurants, a Chinese garden, the maritime museum, harbor cruises and even a carousel. The monorail will take u here. Easy to spend a full day, esp if you visit the museum.

Great vibe.. This place has a good vibe to it, with the harbour offering fireworks on weekends, and plenty of entertainment, from wax museums, to an aquarium. Plenty of dining opportunities, and some nice clubs/bars. When the sun is shining, this is the perfect place to be. In fact its a wonderful place to be at night also. I quite enjoyed the Vibe of the harbour.I did complete a review on the Sydney Harbour which was meant for the Darling Harbour. Sorry.

Lovely walk, with good restaurants, attractions and shops. Tourist trap, as expected. Lovely way to spend a few hours (or longer if you want to visit the aquarium, Madame Tussauds etc). Very clean and scenic, with plenty to see/do, and a lovely playground for kids as well. Plenty of restaurants which, surprisingly for this tourist trap (plenty of Sydneysiders, too), don't charge over the odds for good quality food. Very close to the CBD, so good for time out during a day of shopping
so much better than the circular quay. Darling Harbour is a fun place with some nice views. The shopping is more affordable than most places in Sydney and so is the food. a must see.
Great harbour. I always try to be here whenever i visit sydney along with the Opera House. Its always nice to see these great landmarks.

Another Must See when in Sydney. We love the vibrant atmosphere in Darling Harbour. A favourite is the "Lindt Cafe", absolutely delightful! There is always something to see and you can stroll all the way to circular quay.

Worth the ferry ride!. Location of the pricey but "worth it" Aquarium. A nice, picturesque stroll along the water, A great variety of restaurants. A half day plus lunch is adequate time to see the best of it,
Very Colourful, full of fun, and fine dining. Great evening out, lots to see, and great food options, fireworks unfortunately were not on the night we were there.

Grab your walking shoes and enjoy the day!. Great day for the whole family, stop by the Hard Rock Cafe, sit on the steps and watch the ships and boats go through the harbor. There is a naval museum (although we didn't go in) the boats outside are fun to look at. Lots of places to eat, grab a 10.00 lunch at many of the restaurants. Remember no tipping in Australia!!

Attractive Harbour. Very attractive area around Darling Harbour with eclectical little restaurants, pubs, and shops. Can be reached by Hop on Hop off bus or even walked to fro the Rocks area. Don't miss it.

Darling Night Life. We stumbled on Darling Harbour by accident and very easily could have missed one of the great bits of a Sidney visit we did recently.Darling harbour is 'round the corner' from the big famous ( bridge/Opera House) harbour that you will have researched and visit on your trip to Sidney. A cab or better still, ferry, to Darling harbour will give a choice of hundreds waterfront resteraunts, shopping mall,museums, night clubs and cinemas. The place looks great in the day but magical at night time with the multicolured lights. DONOT visit Sidney and miss out Darling Harbour.

Best part of Sydney!. Darlin harbour is modern, clean and vibrant. A vast collection of bars, restaurants and shops. The harbour is full of boats, ships and whilst we were there, many war ships celebrating the australian navy. Had several really good meals in impressive restaurants on the harbour side. Our favourite part of Sydney>

Do not miss the fireworks here!. We stayed near the Darling Harbour and came here most of the nights. There were plenty of restaurants and cafes here, but be prepared to pay more for a view overlooking the harbour. It gets pretty crowded on weekends and the harbour bustling with activities. Do check out when the fireworks were taking place and do not missed it! We caught the fireworks display at the beautiful Darling Harbour and it was absolutely stunning!
Dinner with a View. Lovely atmosphere, sitting at one of the harbourside restuarants eating fresh food and watching the world go by.

Great to walk around. Although its a little bit touristy its still a great place to walk around. Beware of some over priced restaurants in the area though. Although we missed out we were told there are fireworks there on a Saturday night

Fantastic - Great Day or Evening Out. Darling Harbour has so much to offer, lots of shops, restaurants, the Sydney Aquarium, Zoo, Martime Museum etc, its an amazing place, well worth a visit, we ate at 2 of the restaurants overlooking the harbour, excellent food, great views
Darling Harbour. This was a stones throw from our Apartment .Always something going on ,The tall ships were in on our visit and the weather was great.
Great place to go. Darling Harbour offers plenty to do, places to eat and shop. It's very lively especially at night. The view of the city is also a nice back drop whilst eating or drinking.
Just ok. This area is really touristy. Most restaurants seemed overpriced with mediocre food. We much preferred the opera bar area for both views and atmosphere.

Dont rate Darling Harbour. Don’t really like it heaps. Restaurants are all over priced and all have the same feel. Trying to capitalise on the location. Actual harbour is nice to walk around at night, but so many more locations for better food and atmosphere.

Great seaside Attraction. Darling Harbour is a harbourside entertainment area which features a variety of restaurants, entertainment and shops. Located by the water, has great views.Attractions here are the IMAX theatre, Sealife Aquarium, Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum, Sydney's Wildlife Zoo, the Harbour View Mall, Sydney's Convention Centre and lots more.

Picturesque and lively. There's so many things to do here and so many places to visit. We visited the Seaworld Aquarium, Madame Tussaud and Sydney Wildlife. We tried as many eateries as we can and were extremely excited to see so much variety. The place is even lively at night. It was a wonderful experience and if I ever visit Sydney again I shall definitely visit this beautiful harbour again. The only inconvenience was the massive crowd during the weekend and the pestering seagulls.
Whaw!. When visiting Sydney, try to find a hotel close to Darling Harbour. The evenings are very nice over there with plenty of bars and restaurants with just perfect views.
Energy!. One of the most stunning examples of urban renewal I've ever seen. Amazing array of bars, restaurants, street musicians, all overlooking a beautiful harbour.

Vibrant Darling Harbour. lots to do at Darling harbour. Shopping good. Having a good meal at Blue fish restaurant. My favorite places to visit were the Madame Tousades wax museum amazing wax figures so real, Maritime museum, Liked the Viking exhibition very much and to see the inside of a submarine was awesome.The Chinese garden was peaceful, the right place for an afternoon break!
spent the whole day here. traveling with three kids, decided to spend the day in this area. was a wonderful day, doing the Chinese gardens, meals on the harbor, maritime museum and such.
amazing place. Excellent dining spot, variety of restaurants and bars, but prices a bit expensive but i guess all sydney the same.
Worth a stroll. Darling Harbor is a great place to stroll after taking the ferry from Circular Quay. The Aquarium is also here, and should not be missed.
Great. What a scenic views , awesome . Several ferries can be hired. Lot of restaurants . Sydney aquarium and Madam Tusauds located there

Great place.. What can I say. Without doubt my favourite place in Sydney. Here you can eat/ drink all sorts at all prices. Open from early morning till late on. Unusually pleasant atmosphere here though with none of the "lager louts" you may often encounter at this type of venue elsewhere. Boat trips galore from the harbour (check out the whale watching) along with a mini zoo, sea life centre and Mdme. Toussauds wax works. Plenty to do...great place.

Amazing. During our 6 days trip to Sydney - we were at the Harbour several times as there was so many things to do here. And you are spoilt with the selection of food here. You can simply sit down by the harbour and enjoy a nice cup of coffee.
Very modern. Could be improved, very busy good to look at the ships and a good food court, not far to walk to Queen Vic buildings from here.
Chill and people watch. Loved all the little bars and hustle and bustle, great for day or evening. Plenty in the area for children too

Lovely part of Sydney!. Beautiful area of Sydney that is worth a visit! We were within walking distance and visited often for breakfast, lunch or dinner and to explore the area. The fireworks on Saturday evenings (I'm not sure if this is a regular occurrence) were great! Some really great restaurants and a lovely area to walk around!

The happening spot!. Everyone mentioned that you've got to be in Darling Harbor to be seen and man, were they right!When we headed to Darling Harbor with a couple of my wife's friends for dinner (on Saturday night), the crowd in the area was just amazing! It looked like everyone in Sydney just decided to head to the Harbor and either hang out or grab a meal.Furthermore, since our stay in SYD coincided with the Fleet Review, while having a sumptuous seafood dinner at Blue Fish Restaurant, we had a close up view of the huge fireworks display, which was shown on the next day's news!
great view of harbour. We walked across, It was an easy walk with great views. We aren't into climbing so we didn't do that; we saw others who were really enjoying the thrill.

Great place for outdoor entertainment. Lots of options for eating and shopping, right on the water's edge, Good variety of shopping options as well but the food really sets the area apart. Museuams and Aquarium add to the enjoyment Very short walk from central downtown, for convenience.

Darling Harbour great for teenagers. My teenaged grandchildren absolutely loved Darling Harbour. They went to the Aquarium and loved it, went ten pin bowling and did laser tag, then dined at Hard Rock Café. The latter was too noisy for me, but we sat outside and that suited me better. The kids loved it. Food is substantial and well presented. Drinks are very expensive so be warned.I really enjoyed the Maritime Museum but the teenagers chose not to do that. I would recommend Darling Harbour to families. It is particularly beautiful at night.

Must go if you are with your darling!. Lots to do at darling harbour. you can go aquarium, the park and wax museum, then walk about the wharf to have a waffle at Lindt chocolate cafe, then walk to national maritime museum. Finish the day with a meal at The meat and wine co for a steak and then gelato!! What a day at darling harbour for me!!

Great place to go at night!. I liked Darling Harbour a lot better than Sydney Harbour! Plenty of great restaurants and cafes to go to and enjoy at night, wished we knew this was the place to go eat before our last night in Sydney!
Nice in the Eveing. Went for a Saturday night dinner at The Watershed on Darling Harbour, lovely food followed by fireworks

Relaxing waterside venue with lovely bars and restaurants.. A must see and visit is Darling Harbour. From the Pyrmont bridge you get a great view of the harbour with all the flags and colourful restaurants. Walk around and grab a coffee and a meal, not at all expensive. Then the worlds largest IMAX is there!

Great Location, Great Food. We spent quite a bit of our time in Darling Harbor. There's plenty to do including some great restaurants, maritime museum, Imax, Madam Tussaud & Aquarium. It's a beautiful part of the city with a fantastic atmosphere.

Great variety. Darling harbour is a great destination for a wide range of activities & getting there is half the fun. We arrive by ferry, and leave the car elsewhere, although there are good parking stations nearby. There is a huge range of activities & dining options to choose from. A favourite for us is simply eating ice-cream & watching the world go by on the waterfront, but we have also enjoyed fine dining and all points in between. Go with your kids ( great play spaces) or your parents (mine love the Chinese gardens), or with another & have a great day!

Has had some nice renovations. Darling Harbour has undergone quite significant renovations and looks pretty good. The shopping centre could do with some further work. Plenty of cafes and restaurants to keep amused. Big cameras attract the Rangers as pro-photographers are meant to have license (stupid but true).

Fleet Review. Congrats to the maritime museum, the display on the roof of the museum was outstanding. I was in the restaurant across from the museum and the majority of the diners were impressed, so well done.

A must visit area. Lots of restaurants and bars all of which have a fantastic view of the harbour. I'm sure the area must win awards in town planning. Away from the water front there is a pleasant seating area where you can catch some sun, or just relax in the freely provided wooden deck chairs. Or if you fancy - play table tennis on the permanent concrete tables. There is an innovative children's playground with shallow water features designed for the children to play in.

Great Area with heaps of Restaurants. We went here for dinner at different places a few times while we were in Sydney for the week. Its a beautiful area overlooking the harbour, very child friendly with some great parks and open areas to relax at.

This place has everything to offer. Sydney Darling Harbour has improved so much over the year. Not only is it so much more attractive it has everything for everybody. It's a great place for a family day out, and friends or couples getting together. For overseas travellers who wants to explore Sydney then come here to relax over coffee. ice-cream or lunch and dinner, this is the perfect place. It is welcoming and it's here that you can really see multiculturalism at its best. Well done Sydney!

A must visit place when in Sydney. Darling Harbour is one of my favourite city spots with so many things to do, awesome restaurants, great views, excellent facilities & the perfect atmosphere for families, couple & groups

Fantastic Location. Everytime we go to Sydney we stay at Darling Harbour..Great location...Within walking distance to many restaurants whether you want a quick bite to eat or enjoy a fine dining meal..We walked into the CBD...walked to Paddys Market...Chinese Garden of Friendship...and if you want to catch a water Taxi or Ferry its all there in the Harbour...always buzzing with excitement and things to see and do....Great for familys and kids too as there is a little train that takes you around the harbour and also aquarium...playground and wildlife park...and if you want to get to Sydney Harbour Bridge or any other area of Sydney or the beaches very easy access...Just Love it!

highly recommend for accomodation and things to do for young families. We stayed at Adina Harbourside - great location and affordable 1 bedroom apartment - great for young families. request a quiet room away from road noise with glimpses to the harbour. There are plenty of restuarants, the aquarium, wildlife park and a little train that can take you to the other side of the harbour. We found it easy to walk to the other side and the kids loved the train also. The best part of the Darling Harbour experience is Tumbelong park for kids at the end of the Harbour. It is a water park, sand park, with slides, climbing things and a water playground - no pools - so it is really really safe and the kids just loved it. and its FREE!

Great locality. We were at Darling Harbour during the Fleet Review so it was absolutely buzzing with thousands of people. It was all really organised though and you never felt unsafe. Harbourside Mall is good too and there are heaps of eateries on both sides. Check out the Happy Hours at the bars and also the restaurants because you can get some fantastic deals.

Darling Harbour. We were at Darling Harbour in 2012 and again in 2013. This year we were there at the Firework Display which was spectacular. It is such a beautiful place and you just can not visit Sydney without going to Darling Harbour.....
Relaxing. Excellent place to pause and watch the world go by. Interesting, clean, trouble free. Watching the ferries and boats was a special pleasure.

Go!. great place to walk around... lots of shops and eateries... close to fish market and chinatown... HUGE playground for kids... great way to kill time. PLUS there's a starbucks and a hard rock here for all your souvenier needs!
You Gotta Do It. Had fun walking around here. Did not visit the Anzac Memorial. Nice cafes and pleasant folks. Well worth a visit.

Love it. We were lucky enough to be there on a Saturday night to watch the fireworks display.
Apparantly, it is on every Saturday night. No doubt, it was crowded but everything was under control.
Lovely setting on the harbour. Lots to do here, starting with breakfast, delicious options here at good prices. Also Aquarium, Chinese Gardens, tours.
It has improved since our last visit.. It seemed more vibrant since our lsat visit. Plenty of full eating places and throngs of happy people around. Also much more cleaner. We enjoyed ourselves.
Great food.. Fantastic variety of food available. Great bars, great entertainment with buskers. Easy to navigate with a pram.

Perfect Day out in Sydney. There is so much to do and see in and around Darling Harbour that one full day there hardly does it justice. Firstly, there is the harbour itself together with Cockle Bay from whence many day trips, short trips, whale watching, water taxis and Sydney Ferries are constantly departing and arriving.Then there are all of the restaurants and bars surrounding the harbour serving every imaginable type of food, especially seafood. For the children two small trains run continually around the periphery of the harbour. Then there are the permanent attractions: the Sea Life aquarium, the National Maritime Museum, an IMAX cinema, the Convention Centre, The Powerhouse Museum and the gardens with the ubiquitous ibis, the list goes on. No visit to Sydney is complete without a day spent in Darling Harbour.

Great place with HUGE diversity. Visited over long weekend of 100yr Fleet Review with 100,000sssss of people. The restaurants, tourist spots and casual seats/lawn areas display great mix of things to do for all types of visitors

navy fleet review. The fleet review is taking place on Sydney harbour from 3-11 October.There is going to be more then 40 warships from 20 nations to commemorate the centenary of the first royal Australian navy fleet entry into Sydney harbour on 4th of October 1913.
Could do with a face lift.. Darling Harbour was fantastic 20 years ago. It had great quality shopping, but not anymore, better for dining.

Great place for adults and kids!. Excellent play area for children with spider net and many other active things to do, mostly under shade. Also the Aquarium, wildlife park etc are nearby, but expensive!!

Morning till night. Great place for brunch with so many restaurants offering very reasonably priced meals and options. There is often something on at the invention centre and of ourselves there are attractions such as the IMAX theatre and the aquarium. At lunchtime the crowds arrive and the place is buzzing. At night it's happy hour and you are spoilt for choice as to where you want to party. Shopping as well...this area has everything. Check for what entertainment might be on and in school holidays there's heaps for the kids...

So much to do!!. Fantastic restaurants & cafes, all with wonderful views of darling harbour, including Hard Rock Cafe. Good shops and worth the walk to the Aquarium, Madam Tussauds and the Imax theatre. The park is great for kids and its always fun to take the little train around Darling Harbour to the Chinese gardens. A favourite!!

great place to see alot of fun things all in walking distance. we went everywhere we had time to. shopping, parks, Imax, zoo, aquarium, maritime museum, lots of restaurants to choose from. We wish we had more time.

Place to be seen. Stayed at Novotel in Darling Harbour and could not have found a better location. This is the vibrant area of Sydney with several bars and cafés as well as shopping. Excellent location for a stroll around followed by something to eat or drink. The Maritime Museum and Chinese Gardens are also close by for a visit. The Hard Rock Cafe is also located within the harbour which was excellent. We'll worth a visit to the Harbour if you get chance.
Pretty. While you're here, you might as well stop by... there's a Lindt Chocolate Cafe here and there's attractions like Madame Tussauds, etc.

Vibrant and full of life. Vibrant full of life , Darling Harbour is a great place to shop or dine overlooking the harbour on the balcony of the Hard Rock Cafe, if its shopping you want there are shops ranging from the big designer names to small specialist shops selling souvenirs.You can take to the water in a river taxi across the harbour, with great views and a photo opportunity for the Opera House. If you are there for New Year you also get a great view of the fireworks too.We loved it at Darling Harbour can't wait to go there again.

so many restaurants. If you love Chocolate there's two amazing cafes you must go to, one is Lindt the other Guylain. Absolute wonderful not just for a hot chocolate of coffee but a great meal in Guylain. Not a chocolate person? That's OK there's seafood, Italian, Pizza, fish n chips, steak. There's restaurant after restaurant that faces some of the most calming views of the harbour. My suggestion is to head past the wax museum right and there are a row of restaurants that are brilliant and not so well known, I have walked up and down so many times over the years never knowing these existed.I could spend all my time for a whole week at this one spot.
Food. Darling Harbour has the most amazing food, breakfast, lunch and dinner all covered. Reasonable prices and heaps of options.
Lovely spot to head to for brunch. Take a lazy walk around the waterfront, maybe go and have a look in the submarine, or go to the Fish markets.

Vibrancy and Joy. The Darling Harbor area is an ideal entertainment and leisure zone for the whole family.The laser shows and spectacular Sydney skyline which looks extra special at night ,are impressive and just strolling across or resting on one of the benches on the Piermont bridge, a unique walkway across the harbor , are amazingly relaxing. The Promenade Mall offers attractive and reasonable shopping and a wide range of eateries. On the other side of the bridge are the famous attractions of Madame Tussauds and the Zoo etc. Ferries connect to nearly all the mother main attractions of the city, as do tour buses. Wholesale shopping at Market city for good bargains and Chinatown for the culinary treats of the Orient.Definitely the place to be in Sydney!

Darling Harbour - International Fleet Review. The helpful people staffing this event need to be congratulated.Except for one fellow hawking tickets for private ferry rides, who was rude and unhelpful.The harbour lunch and dinner ferry cruises running from Darling Harbour were fabulous and we went on two of them.The Harbour Ballroom was one...very crowded inside, but apart from that a stable platform to view events and the scenery.Not as good as the large catamaran 'Ocean Spirit' which had more room inside and probably road the waves a little better as well. We thoroughly enjoyed this vessel.The eateries and bars around Darling Harbour are brilliant.Just loved the place!

Great place for some photo shoot and dining. Lots of restaurant and shopping around, and nice boats parked at the harbour. Prices, of-course, on the high side. Great for photo. About 15 minutes from the Town subway station.
Lovely Spot. Great location for dinner and entertainment. Close to everything and has a great atmosphere. First Class
Loved, Loved it. We stayed in a Hotel that was at Darling Harbour. You can find all kinds of food, shopping and many things to do. It is beautiful at night too.

Relaxing Walk, Beautiful view. Nice place to relax and have a good view. Walked down from the expressway and seen the view that is spectacular. There are aquarium and national museum inside. Can walk to Haymarket area for 15 minutes.

Lots to see. We took the ferry from Circular quay to Darling harbor where we strolled along the whole waterfront, enjoying the scenery. Walked past the Seaquarium, but we didn't feel like yet another seaquarium so we continued on and enjoyed the walk, the crowds and ths sunny weather. Worth it
More for kids. A lot of what is at Darling seems geared more toward children. I went to the Maritime Museum on a free day, but really didn't see much at Darling Harbour.

The place to be..anytime..everytime... Less can be said about this place. It has everything..wonderful restaurants, pubs, disco, museum, movie theater (IMAX) and the place is teaming with life. People partying everywhere, live musicians playing in the corner..Great food..And then you want on the harbor, move away and you find peace and solace..while admiring the wonderful boats and yachts parked. A place to be, experience and then experienced again..
Good for a stroll. Great walking around the harbor ( watch for the tourist train). Good options fro lunch. Very busy with night life.
A must see!. Darling Harbour has a great selection of restaurants, whether you want fine dining or burgers. We visited at night and the lights were spectacular, we managed to take some great photos.

Darling Harbor 24 September 2013. Very nice spot to relax, many restaurants and cafe.
The wind breeze is nice, and there are a bunch of birds. If you eat at the seaside, those birds will come to you asking for foods.
The view is good and very nice place to visit.

WOW factor. We were encouraged to see Darling Harbour, but we were not prepared for all it had to offer! The spectacular views and the array of restaurants were something we were not prepared for. This is a must do when in Sydney!
Lots of places to eat. This place is full of great places to eat, from Snacks to full meals. There is a quick way across the harbour and that is to use the bridge. Take your time and walks around.
Nice walk. Great place to walk around, nice day out, lots to see, easy access to various attractions, lots of places to eat and enjoy the view

Don't go if you don't like crowds. Very very busy little harbour. Really just a shopping centre with eateries and a hotel. Very crowded. beautiful location right on the water, and just a short walk across Pyrmont Bridge into the Sydney CBD. Such a shame the monorail has gone!

So much to do!. What a great place to visit, so much to see and do all in 1 place.
Very family friendly, the atmosphere was awesome and we didn't want to leave.
Activities, food, ferry and accommodation all in one place.

Darling harbour - top park for the kids. If you are looking for a great park for the kids to play in, then Darling harbour is in the heart of the City and was very highly rated by our two (10 and 7). Lots of climbing apparatus, but the highlight is the water play. We enjoyed an ice cream and rested touristy-feet that had covered a lot of miles exploring. This was obviously a great playground for adults too - shops, restaurants, cinema, hotels, and people watching. Would love to go back (without the kids) at night time!

The hub of Sydney. Darling Harbour is teh modern part of Sydney. Somethinsg always going on.The restaurants are quite high end with all varieties.If your not so fuss! go to the food hall at the bottom of the shopping mall or behind the milkshake bar if you are on the outside of he mall. Somethings always going on in Darling Harbour
Great tourist attraction. Lived this area. Lots of variety in restaurants and many activities ranging from a ferry ride to museum visit.

I love the environment. Walking around, having some coffee, taking picture, or just sit on bench and seeing other people activities are the things you can do in here.
The environment was good. I do really like spending my time there.

Worth visiting. I stayed at Darling Harbour, was a bit doubtful as it wasnt near circle quay. Neednt have worried, it was great with loads going on and café s and restaurants to suit every budget. Getting ferries around so easy and you get the added bonus of the views of harbour bridge and opera hose every time you get the ferry. Recommend staying there.

Something for Everyone. Darling Harbour has undergone a lot of changes recently and all for the better. You need to allot a few hours even a day when visiting because there is just too many activities and sites to see. You can either walk the whole way through or take one of those mini trams that goes around. There's a whole strip of new restaurants from different country origins called Darling Quarter and there is more available parking. The Cockle Bay Wharf is another strip of restaurants in the other side. There are so many attractions to visit like the Chinese Gardens, Madame Tussaud museum as well as The Australian Maritime Museum. You can also hire some speeds boats for a nominal fee to take you around the harbour and see the Sydney Opera House, Luna Park and the Harbour Bridge from the water. Passing under the Darling Harbour Bridge is also an experience not to be missed. Enjoy the restaurants overlooking the harbour. Try also not to miss the fireworks in the harbour on the weekends. Shopping is another thing to enjoy with lots of shops for souvenirs.
the heart of the city (for tourists). I had an hotel in that area. Very central, making simple dining, taking public transportation or just having some rest looking at the bay

Activities for all. Our tour driver said that Darling Harbour is part of a huge city revitalization project. Darling Harbour is a success story of that project. The harbor walk starts at the Chinese Garden of Friendship. There was a festival going on at the garden which is the reason we got off the tour bus to explore on our own. The festival turned out to be mostly food. With no indication of gluten content, we didn't stay at the festival for more than a few minutes. Our walk took us to a childrens park with water features. Beyond that, there was a zoo, a wax museum, an I-max theater, Gelato shop and cafe's without number. There is a naval museum, tall ships, submarines, paddle boats, etc. You name it, they have it from the Hard Rock Café to Spanish Paella. What a huge find.

Great for a night out. It's worth taking a walk or ferry hop to Darling Harbour. It's smaller but packed with attractions. Shops, restaurants, a massive maritime museum and a fun Madame Tussaud's where you can take as many cheesy photos of yourself with famous figures as you like. The Cockle Bay Wharf side has the best restaurants but there really is something for everyone. Just people watching with a coffee is great way to pass the time. Stay until dark and see it come to life with everywhere lit up. I loved it!

Fun afternoon. This is a great way to spend a few hours or a few days. It us full of activity and people. There is a lot to do, or you can just wander around and people watch. It's very beautiful and very large. Many great pubs and restaurants, ferry boats, sightseeing boats, and shopping.

busy area. lots of restaurants and shops, caught the ferry from near the opera house. went to the Hard Rock Cafe Sydney and did some shopping (good shopping centre) and visited a bar. very heavy rain so cab back to hotel

Darling Harbour. Our tradeshow was in Darling Harbor. The eateries and pubs were fantastic. We enjoyed how close they were to the Exhibition Center and how clean and well maintained the area was. The nightly fireworks display were simply awesome!
Worth a visit. A must visit both day and night, the lights of a night time are great, and so many restaurants and bars to chose from.

Fantastic.. Darling Harbour is getting better and better, some of the best food in the world, great attractions such as imax, wildlife world, museums. Having a beer at night in an alfresco pub or restaurant here cant be beaten. Everyone is happy and full of life. I LOVE SYDNEY

Colorful and vibrant. Great selection of food. Next to the maritime museum where you can see some warships including the old oberon class submarine. The food here is pricey. There is a bridge you can walk across the harbour. You can take good photographs from here. With yachts in the foreground and skyscrapers behind.

Lovely place to hang out.. Lovely place to hang out. Great little restaurants and bars. Good views. Lots of boat trips go out from here. Check out the Maritime Museum which has a submarine, a destroyer and a replica of HMB Endeavour which was Captain Cooks boat.
love it here. you have to come here even just to look.Plenty of places to see and eat,by the ocean its so relaxing

Excellent place. Walked round Darling Harbour and everything was beautifully well kept. To see the amount of things to do was great as well. Loads of restaurants and bars and the area had a real good buzz about it

Enjoy the walk. Great, just great. We would walk and then sit and eat, walk and then sit and have a drink. Walk again and eat a little bit more. It was wonderful. You can spend the day and thoroughly enjoy yourself.

Excellent place to visit. A stroll around Darling Harbour is always a relaxing way to spend a couple of hours. We took the light rail from Central instead of walking which only takes about 15 mins and is also very enjoyable.
Beautiful setting, plenty of places to eat. There were loads of places to eat and drink at quite reasonable prices (especially in Australia) and the setting of the bay is just beautiful

Vibrant and bustling. Loved Darling Harbour, a great spot to people watch while you grab a meal. So many dining options to choose from on both sides of the harbour, along with a shopping centre open til late.

Buzz of activity at night. The Darling Harbour and the surrounding precincts seem to be doing well with the Darling Park development. It is great to walk around Darling Harbour, meander through to Darling Park and in the evening you could watch the lights change on the buildings.During the weekends, starting from Thursday evenings, there is a buzz of activity from the restaurants along the promenade.There is also a fireworks every Saturday night from 8.30pm until the end of the year.Great way to show your visitors around - to see our city skyline and be part of the harbourside before it makes way for new developments.
Lots to do !. There are many restaurants, bars, clubs, activities in the area as well as parks and a modern children's playground ( that has a flying fox thats fun for adults too)

Nice place to chill. Considering there's probably nothing much in Sydney, this was probably one of the places I enjoyed more. It's generally a nice place to chill and relax. Some cafes, shops and pubs around, great view of the city etc.

Perfect spot to escape from your daily routine. The view are amazing,held many events through out the year
heaps of selection for restaurants and cafe
favorite spot,since I live nearby
Somewhere you must go. Loved Darling Harbou - so much to see and enjoy. Various museums etc but also many places to eat whether for lunch or dinner

A great place for a stroll around the harbour. What was once a forlorn part of the city when it was first redeveloped from an industrial area back in the 1980s is now an interesting, integral and vibrant part of the city. Years ago the eating places and restaurants in this precinct were mostly over priced tourist traps offering only mediocre food, but what a transformation, now there are plenty of good quality dining options that attract Sydney residents and tourists alike.Along with the Maritime Museum the Darling Harbour waterway itself is the main attraction of the area. A great place, almost city centre, to meet up with friends for a coffee and something to eat, as well as enjoying a relaxing stroll around the waters edge.

Come if you have time, but don't make this a priority. One side of the harbour is surrounded by Accor hotel chain (Novotel and Ibis) with Harbourside shopping centre. Another is by the business park complex called Darling Park (IBM and Commonwealth Bank).This is really a tourist area, with all attractions built specifically for tourists: Madame Tussauds, Wild Life zoo (a zoo inside a building, better to go to Taronga Zoo or Featherdale Wildlife Park), Sydney Aquarium, IMAX cinema. The rests are restaurants, bars, tourist souvenir shops, night clubs. The only thing Australian is the National Maritime Museum. And a children's playground with carousel and monkey climb.Hence I would not make this a priority / must see destination.
Outstanding place. Gorgeous place especially at night all the amazing sights and buildings are breathtaking. Boat trip is a must to sail under the bridge and see the opera house

One of the best areas I have stayed in!. The hotel I stayed in was right next to Darling Harbour so I spent a lot of time walking around it. It was one of the best city areas I have seen. There were great parks for walking and for kids to play in (okay, I might have played in them also) and many unique fountains. There were tons of restaurants to eat at, great night life and as a bonus it was a perfect place to go running!
beautiful darling harbour. I loved darling harbour, they have the most amazing fireworks show on a saturday evening, that is just astonishing. Its a busy little place with so much to do and see.
worth visiting. I usually come to Darling Harbour to unwind or to whenever there is an exhibition in Sydney.I love watching the public go by while I am concentrating on candid photography.

Great Atmosphere, Amazing Food. Brilliant. Was here for business and absolutely loved the place. Unfortunately I was travelling alone but still enjoyed the evening walks along the harbor and the restaurants are amazing. The view across the harbor from the restaurant balconies is excellent. Definitely plan on coming back but next time it will be for pleasure and not business

Good Night Out!. Darling Harbour is a great place in Sydney, they have all sorts there, and it is a good place to have a night out, although the many restaurants there were a bit expensive for a mere backpacker!

Picturesque area. Really well developed area with lots of things to tempt the senses. Partner visited the Maritime Museum and spent many happy hours there. Loved the way the park area had been set out with grassed areas and water fountains.
A must visit in Sydney. A pleasant area to wander round. From the maritime museum to the aquarium and lots of restaurants with excellent views of the harbour.

If you are reading this in the UK then you cannot afford to stop here. Darling Harbour remains a very attractive spot to sit and people watch on a sunny day, but with the state of the exchange rate, and all of the cafes insisting that you buy a meal to enjoy a harbour front seat, it will cost you hundreds of pounds for a front row seat. (Alternatively bring your own drink and sandwiches and sit on the sidewalk with all the other wheinging Poms.)

well worth a visit. Just great ferries coming and going all day and well into the night. Hop on a ferry to where you need to go. Opera house just at the side and easy walk to look at it .Some nice restaurants to eatat or just have a drink.
great spot. There is something for everyone here weather it be playing at the waterpark with the kids, grabbing a drink by the water, doing a little shopping or just enjoying the view.

NO MONORAIL. Being a member of the Australian National Maritime Museum I go there often, but now there is no longer the Monorail, there is NO public transport from the centre of Sydney. It was very short sighted of the government to get rid of it before having something to replace it.I went onto nsw/transport and was told that best replacable transport was to walkI have walked this route many times and as pensioner I find at times I am unable to walk it

A great place for children. Darling Harbour is an easy walk from the CBD and from the overhead walkway provides great views of it's surrounding facilities. It is sad that the monorail no longer runs but the presence of the Aquarium and other attractions still makes it a great place for visiting families.
Buzz and atmosphere!. Busy area of waterfront buzzing with people, shops and restaurants. Great place to sit with a coffee and watch the boats, see the world go by or browse...

Exciting and bustling area of Sydney. Darling Harbour offers an assortment of bars, restaurants, and shopping. The waterfront location is excellent and well situated. The Saturday eventing (8:30pm) fireworks display is outstanding. I highly recommending strolling down to Darling Harbour to watch the fireworks.

A "must visit" when in Sydney. Whether you're looking for great food, somewhere to relax, watch street performers, go to a museum or just meet up with friends, then go down to Darling harbour.
With its buzzing atmosphere, great restaurants and magnificent city skyline it's got something for everyone.

Great place. Really nice waterfront , lot of nice restaurants, bars , nightclub, also museum , wild life and the biggest cinema screen in a world.
You have everything you need , couples, friends, family or even by yourself , that's the place to go in Sydney.

Good and getting better. The shopping is a bit lame and touristy, but the views, pubs, bars and restaurants are great. I was surprised that beer/drink prices were cheaper than other areas of the CBD, but perhaps that was happy hour?? Nice place to wander around for a few hours.

Darling Harbour-something for everyone!. A must visit to this waterfront, whether alone or a couple or a family, DH has something to offer each visitor..from the Chinese Garden of Friendship to the great restaurants (loved Blue Fish for seafood to Pancakes on the Rock to Zaaffran) cafe's,, food court, playground, shopping a galore, Sydney Convention Centre, Annual Cultural Events, Harbour side fireworks, luminous sights, the romantic atmosphere and yet still enticing to the little kids, sports activities, civic activities, the big screen IMax Theatre, the Wildlife Sydney Zoo, the Sea Life Sydney Aquarium, the cruises n showboats, a different attraction guaranteed every visit!

Darling Harbour. We stayed in a hotel @ Darling Harbour after our arrival in Sydney. It was a really nice starting point with water taxi to all main attraction (Sydney Opera, The Rock, Zoo, ...). The Water ferry driver took the time to provide some tourist information and fun stories of Sydney.We also went to the Aquarium. At the harbour itself they have lots of restaurants, aquarium, which we visited and the a Madam Tussaud’s exhibition, which we passed. I really enjoyed the Aquarium which was way larger on the inside than on the outside.

Scenic and Fun. Darling Harbor is a must visit if you are in Sydney. Great restaurants, events and views make it a leading place to take a walk that's not too far from the inner city. Featuring attractions such as Madame Tussauds, Harborside shopping centre, A wildlife park and aquariam and a bowling alley, Darling Harbour can be a great way to spend a whole day, or an afternoon.Only a few minutes walk away, you will find Darling Quarter which features a playground, interactive water feature and several more fantastic restaurants.Darling Harbour features frequent events, most recently, the international boat show and small boat building competition.Ferries, water taxis and floating restaurants and function boats depart from the area.I highly, highly recommend a visit.

VISITING. A nice place to visit for the day.Its family friendly as well.I was visiting the country and staying with family and it was suggested that Darling Harbour would be nice to visit.To be honest i didnt go only once but many times.Plenty to see and do.From sight seeing to taking a meal something to drink.

Clean and beautiful. Many great restaurants. I was in Waterfront restaurant and love it. Cheap good food and beer. And great for people wathing :) Just love the athmosphere and people. Romantic place when sunset.

beautiful at night. The Sydney harbour is great at the dinner time. You can find lots of delicious restaurants. Many people around and a few bars and clubs if you are in for a fun night. The whole Harbour is perfectly illuminated to have a nice walk after dinner.

Nice place to spend an evening. I stayed in Sydney for about 5 days on a recent business trip and my hotel was at Darling Harbor. I managed to stroll down to the harbor for dinner on the last day and found it to be a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.The harbor has a decent vibe about it. I actually spotted a large boat that was hosting a big party while it was docked at the harbor. That meant a fair bit of inebriated folks walking around. Luckily, no untoward incidents though.There was a Madame Tussauds museum and since the last admission was at 19:00, it wasn't very crowded. I noticed an IMAX and an aquarium nearby as well.There were a couple of souvenir shops but these closed relatively early. I don't think though Sydney has shops open late anyway.The main attraction of the harbor is the number of restaurants along the walkway. There is sure to be something for everyone.

Place for everyone. It is a great place for everyone. Kids would love the Aquarium, indoor Wild Life Zoo and the public playground with its water play. There is always something for everyone like the Imax theatre, Madame Tussaud, Maritime museum, and Harbourside shopping centre. Generally it is less busier than Circular Quay. Plenty of choices for dinning from bars & restaurants to fast food chain like McDonalds, Pizza and Coffee shops. It is a great a place to spend time with family anytime. and watching the boats harbouring. Within walking distance from Paddy's Market in Chinatown area. If you do the walk from Chinatown to Darling Harbour you will pass through nice Chinese Garden and the Exhibition Centre. Information Centre for Visitor/Tourists is also available at Darling Harbour.

Fisherman's Wharf Down Under?. We're from San Francisco and mean-spiritedly dubbed this the Fisherman's Wharf of Sydney. While true it has a Madame Tussaud's, Hard Rock Cafe, Margaritaville and several other key landmark components that make the comparison worthy, it is also an unfair comparison in that the scope of public lands, parks, water features, pedestrian-features and orientation to the heart of the City make this combi-resident/tourist zone a substantially classier and cleaner component of urban life that Fisherman's Wharf might ever dream of being. The full scope includes the stunning Chinese Garden, Tumbalong Park and the Pyrmont Bridge in addition to the more touristy elements such as the Maritime Museum, Harbourside Shopping Centre, Exhibition Centre and the Convention Centre. The Cockle Bay Promenade is as lovely as any part of the Embarcadero excepting the beautiful view of San Francisco Bay. However, the stunning skyline of Sydney and the Darling Harbor waterfront along with the cuteness of Cockle Bay are nearly suitable exchange. We toured this section on foot in less than an hour as a side step from our walking tour of the Central Business District/Town Hall and Hyde Park areas. Well worth the stroll downhill via Market and then returning up Liverpool.

Great Place To Be. Darling Harbour is fantastic. So many restaurants, the IMAX theatre, the Sydney Aquarium (note if you go in after 6pm it is cheaper and see my review of it for more info), Harbourside shopping centre which is open until late and full of great places to eat, Chinatown and Paddys Markets not too far away, and on a summers evening any of the outdoor seating at any of the restaurants is a great place to sit, have a drink, people watch. The one downside for me at least, is that they have removed the monorail. I loved that thing with the fire of a thousand suns. Sometimes I would just get on and go round and round, because I could. To me, Darling Harbour is incomplete without it. Now the only option you have to get around is to walk. Which is fine, but you better bring comfortable shoes, this is a big place, there is a lot of walking to do.. :)

Soak up the atmosphere!. Quite a different vibe from Sydney Harbour, but great nonetheless, and beautiful in its own way. There is something for everyone here, many restaurants, stores and tourist attractions such as Madame Tussauds, the Wild Life Zoo and the Aquarium. Quite a good place to spend the evenings.

Gorgeous!. Preferred here to Circular Quay. Less busy and much more scenic. Maritime museum is worth a visit, as is Hard Rock cafe. Chinese friendship garden is great and there is a lovely play area and water gardens if you have younger children. Also a great food court so that everyone can eat different food but sit together.

What a great vibe. Darling Harbour has something for everyone. Families with kids have a sensational playground with water park...all free. Teens and adults can hang out on the lawns seated in complimentary timber chairs. There are heaps of great restaurants, IMAX is here as are other museums and attractions. Buskers kept us entertained throughout the afternoon.

for tourists. I do not understand peoples reviews, this is the worst area of the CBD area. Average restaurants give or take one or two, lots of tourists making the place unbearable. Yes a few good museums, but why would you want to see a Koala in a makeshift building when you can go to Zoo or see them in the wild. This is where the out of townies come for a night out, and Sydneysiders go elsewhere. Overrated on a busy day, average on quiet day. See it by boat.

Busy bustling harbour. Great buzzing busy harbour, lovely at night with all the lights. Very friendly people. Only place where I've ever had a vegetarian sandwich which consisted of grilled carrots . Sat for hours just people watching here & had the biggest & best ice cream too. Fabulous atmosphere. Definately one to visit when in OZ.

Beautiful spot to spin around. If you have some free hours in your tour in Sydney, spend them at the Darling Harbour. You can also have lunch or dinner in the numerous good restaurants and bars in the Harbour.

Lovely area. What a lovely place - we went on a Wednesday and it was buzzing with people ! Lovely shops in the Harbour Side . We walked towards the Maritime Museum, we were too late to go in & enjoy the exhibits - but we were able to check out the ships in the harbour - HMAS Vampire, HMB Endeavor which were great ! Definitely like to check this out on another visit. There is a 'train' which goes from one side of the Harbour to the other, kids would love it . We then walked to the other side, following the sun, Cockle Bay Wharf has a great range of restaurants as well as Sydney's Wild Life, Madame Tussaud's & Aquarium . Happy Hour was calling so we stopped for a drink. Had some dinner in China Town, about a 10minute walk and as there was a firework display we headed back for 07.30pm. The fireworks were very impressive, some guy was using them as a proposal - lovely way to end the day !

Truly magnificent part of Sydney!. First visit here...we loved it! Very clean and offered so much variety in dining venues. Loved the Saturday night fireworks whilst dining at one of the many restaurants at the Harbour. A very vibrant and lively part of Sydney.

Fun place. Lots of places to do things like bowling (US style), IMAX and Maritime Museum. Fun place to eat and people watch. If you not close catch the train to Circular Quay and ride the ferry. Fun ride to and from
Place to eat and shop!. Perfect place for shoppers and foodies. Variety of reasonable shopping (if you are not interested in very big brands), good food and harbourside view!

Great if you like modern. Lots of entertainment options, places to eat, but I found it a little soulless. The harbour itself is fine, but the rest of it didn't have anything unique. There are places like this all over the world, I preferred the Rocks.If you like modern and lots of identikit restaurants, you'll like this place!

Famous Sydney landmark a must to see!. Darling Harbour has so much to offer...major hotels, shopping arcardes, hundreds of places to choose from for meals, buskers and entertainers and beauty.We started our day at Paddys Markets then took the light rail to the fish markets at Pyrmont then on to Darling Harbour. It's also a short stroll to China Town.Lots to do there. Marinetime museum, wax works or try a ride on the water taxi or ferry to Circular Quay. Not far from the Casino either. Explore at your own pace. Lots of fun for kids too,

Lovely doings by the harborside. You would not believe that as late as 1980, this was a grimy industrial rundown backwater. Darling Harbor is an extension of the city center with a mix of museums,shopping and open green spaces. It is without a doubt, the most popular and lively area of Sydney. Grab a swig of harbor oxygen and head for the Australian national maritime museum where you can explore the seafaring history of the nation. While on a nautical bent,the aquatic life of Sydney Harbor can be explore at Sydney Aquarium with its massive tanks and underwater walkway. Nearby is a wildlife exhibition with flora and fauna of the region. You are now in eating territory. Cockle Bay Wharf is a vibrant and colorful entertainment & food precinct. Work off the excess of lunch by relaxing at The Chinese Garden for a haven of peace and tranquility landscaped with winding pathways,waterfalls,lakes and pavilions. You could now head for the Powerhouse Museum which explores technology,decorative& domestic arts emphasizing Australian innovations and achievments. For a finale,head for harborside Complex with its array of views over the water to compliment the restaurants and bars that are found in this retail area.

Convenience, easy access and great place to chill out. Nice place to chill out and rileks. Various types of restaurant, ones could have just pick and choose for the lunch and dinner. We spent one full day in Darling Harbour, enjoyed the Sea Life Aquarium, Wild life Centre, Madam thausso, watched movie and many other activities. It is only 7 - 8 minutes walking distance to Chinatown....from darling Harbour, ones could have just take a ferry to many other hot spot I.e : Circular Quay, Opera House, Luna Park, Tarongga Zoo and many more.
Favorite Place in Sydney!. 1. catch the free firework show every Saturday evening2. book Hurricane's Grill weeks in advance to avoid disappointment. This restaurant serves the best grilled beef ribs!

A must see in Sydney!. I just love the atmosphere of Darling Harbour! It's amazing and offers tourists and visitors an abundance of things to do. Great choice of bars and eateries, wax museum, maritime museum, Chinese Gardens, Aquarium, buskers, colour and entertainment.Many restaurants offer lunchtime and dinner specials for approx $15 pp or choose one of the beautiful seafood places, not too far to walk to Chinatown either or Paddys Markets if you have the time.Take the time to sit and watch the passing parades of people if you are a people watcher, lots of places to have coffee.Parking is sometimes difficult so suggest you get there by public transport as an easier option if you are a visitor to Sydney.

Wonderful walk around the water.. This is a beautiful area next to the harbor, plenty of restaurants to choose from, and a romantic place to walk with your darling. We ate at Nick's but probably should have gone elsewhere, since the waitstaff seemed to think their meeting was more important than the customers, but we enjoyed the people- and birdwatching, nonetheless.
Lots to see and do. Amazing place, couldn't believe how busy or popular it is. Lots of restaurants, movies, playground, attractions etc. Great place to walk and see many sights of Sydney Harbour
Great!. Great selection of bars and restaurants, wish we had been in the evening but didn't manage this time.

I love Darling Harbour. Have visited Sydney twice now and always stay at Darling Harbour. It is the most beautiful place in the city I think. The view of the lights on the water, the interesting places to eat, great shopping, the aquarium, wildlife park, ships, museums. Oh so much to see and do in one area. It is a must see on your trip to Sydney.

Very nice. Darling Harbour is a very nice part of the Sydney waterfront. There are lots of restaurants where you can sit - night or day - and have a view of this part of the Harbour. There are some shops and, in the vicinity, there is the Chinese Garden, the Wildlife 'park', the Aquarium and also the Maritime Museum. A number of boats leave from this part of the Harbour to tour around the Sydney waterways. I particularly like the brolga statues and fountain. There are often fireworks in the evenings (check the Darling Harbour website for dates and times).

Lively entertainment quarter. Darling Harbour is packed with eating and entertainment options, music and usually lots of people. There are many restaurants, cafes and lots of fast food and shopping.. as well as big ticket venues such as the aquarium, Powerhouse and and Maritime museums and mini zoo. However there are quieter, less touristy sections away from the Harbour front with a children's playground, some beautiful water installations and the Chinese gardens to give a restful break.

A must for all travelers. Living not too far from Sydney means that I have often visited Darling Harbour with friends and overseas visitors alike. It is picturesque , has many good ( not cheap) restaurants as well as a food court if that is more to your liking . At weekends there is often free entertainment and always something to catch your eye. You can access the Maritime Museum, the IMAX , the Aquarium and various other attractions for a price . Just looking at all the boats is a pleasure and that does not cost anything. Take a stroll, you don't need to shop but don't miss it's beauty.

Experience Sydney best as the locals do.. An easy 10 mins. walk from any hotel in central Sydney, Darling Harbour can be the place for a sunny afternoon of strolling, taking in the world class Sydney Aquarium or Maritime Museum or Imaz Theatre while your absorb the sparkling beauty of the glistening small harbour water and boat traffic. There's buskers, childrens train rides, water fountains for the kids to splash in during summer or just an idyllic stroll on the board-walk.It's a place full of restaurants open day and night for any cuisine.Night time the area is alive with people out to enjoy the mild Sydney evenings and dining in the many restaurants overlooking the sparkling waters and city sky scape. Night clubs abound in Kings Wharf.Any visit to Sydney has Darling Harbour as a must enjoy location.

Only if you're a shopaholic. Let's get one thing straight: I hate shopping and I hate theme parks. Darling Harbour seems to meld the worst features of both. Why tourists come here, I don't know. There are better bargains to be had in nearby Paddy's Markets and better (and cheaper) food anywhere else in Sydney. This over-rated confection exemplifies the brash, money-grubbing side of the Emerald City. The aquarium and National Maritime museum are, however well worth a visit. I am often here because I take my French classes to the Little Snail restaurant for excursions (now, that's a very good restaurant!) so I have become somewhat inured to the joint. A lot of people like Darling Harbour, I don't but don't let me put you off visiting and making up your own mind.

Darling Harbour Sydney. Lots of attractions in and around this area of Sydney suitable for all ages. Adventure playground and Olde Worlde Carousel.Lots of touristy shopping in main Centre ,Western side of Harbour.Lots of outdoor Cafes and Restaurants , some pricey but most reasonably priced. Fireworks at night most weekends and occasionally water shows.The Australian wildlife /Sydney Aquarium is also here on city side.Come by ferry from Circular Quay or Light rail from Central station but easy walk from the city.

Lulls you in. We first clapped eyes on Darling Harbour when we did our first HOHO bus loop and through it looked really nice and welcoming and proceeded to spend a fair bit of time in the area doing various activities. Fast forward 5 years and our recent holiday in Sydney and the place still has that pull for us especially the ferry journey round from Circular Quay.

A great day out. Every visitor to Sydney, either from interstate, local or overseas should visit Darling Harbour at least once. There is something for everybody....... great restaurants (from budget prices to high end), magic views........ good people watching.... somewhere to get a drink........... the IMAX theatre... the list goes on. Now that the Monorail has gone, you can get to Darling Harbour by bus, ferry or light rail. Enjoy.

The place you must visit in Sydney. If you are in Sydney, you must visit Darling Harbour. Beautiful views all around, I dont know where to start. Both side of the harbour there are numbers of award winning restaurants. Some of the finest sea food restaurants of Australia are there. There is a nice foot bridge to cross the harbour from one side to another. This foot bridge can be moved away for big boats to sail away. There is a nice view of city sky scrapers from there. There are good numbers of beautiful looking, fully equipped boats and cruises on the harbour. You can have a close look of those modern high-tech boats. There is an aquarium, a 3d cinema/theatre (Imax), a geometrically designed fountain, Chinese garder, Sydney converntion center, harbourside shopping center and so many things. The architecture of the whole place is excellent. So many things and events are happening all the year round. You can also found few quality pubs and night clubs there. During my few years stay in Sydney, I used to visit there many times. I’ll never be bored to visit Darling Harbour.

Stunning. We stayed at a hotel not far from darling harbour and visited almost every day after falling for it on our first night. As evening falls it becomes a hive of activity with restaurants, live music, and people sitting on the steps by the water chatting. With the lights of the building reflecting on the water it left quite an impression on us and would definitely direct any other travellers there to share the experience.
Great views, great food, imax, entertainment.. Just a great place to be day or night. Good food everywhere, imax theatre to keep you entertained, and good views of the magnificent harbour. Must go

Darling Harbour. This is one of the must see places when you visit Sydney. It is a beautiful harbour and has something for everyone. There is an array of restaurants and clubs that suit families and people travelling or looking to party. The imax movie theatre is a fun option with a massive screen its a great 3d experience. If you walk along the harbour to the other side there are more bars and restaurants on the Cockle Bay side and on the way you will pass by the Maritime museum and get a great view of sydney harbour.

Roses grow with thorns.. For international and interstate visitors, take a quick look around the precinct, eat, see and go.Bag thieves loiter in the more crowded, daytime open air places like the Cockle Bay foreshore and Kids Playground. Weeknights are more quiet than weekends where the precinct is visited by local street kids where assaults and robberies are common.Friday and Saturday evenings can get ugly after 10pm when drunken behaviour is rife.The street kids are still there as well, but can be overlooked by the unsuspecting. Initially as a visitor, I thought Darling Harbour was a bit over rated. Now, as a frequent worker throughout the precinct, I can only advise tourists to enjoy the area as recommended by other posts, but be aware of your surroundings during certain times as described above.
Beautiful scenery. Darling Harbor was beautiful. There were lots of shops and restaurants and the scenery was awesome. My visit there was wonderful and checked off my bucket list
Restaurants & Bars. If you want to go out for dinner in the city - Darling Harbour is the place to be. You will find live music at a lot of places and amazing ambience at every restaurant or bar.

Good coffee great shopping. The changes from what this area used to be is amazing plenty of good shopping areas, a walk along the waters edge is a great way to get rid of any stress and just a short walk over the old Pyrmont bridge and you are back in the city, a look over the old South Steyne Ferry or the new Madame Tussauds wax works is a must

Love Darling Harbour!. Plenty of restaurants, from pubs to high end, a cute little shopping mall, bars, playgrounds, theme parks, and it's all based around the parramatta river which is nice! Definitely recommend on a trip to sydney!

For children, shoppers & foodies. Darling Harbour (DH) runs down the outside of Sydney's central business district and is home to a number of attractions and places of interest. It can be reached by foot, public or private ferry that leaves from Circular Quay. To start with the children, in particular the younger variety.At the far SW end of the DH district is a series of major playgrounds with all associated equipment (free) During the summer the water features are a hit but at all times of the year this is a place children can spend a day. Plenty of fast food outlets around not to have to cook for the day. Anchoring the Western side is the exhibition centre where major events are held however this facility might soon be pulled down for an updated version. This facility at the Northern end runs into three levels of shopping and eating options. The Imax theatre is also just around the corner from the playgrounds and also a hit with the young at heart. Then there are the multitude of restaurants and bars from every denomination.At the far Northern side of DH is the Maritime Museum which is worth a visit. It includes some old navy vessels that can be visited.Across the water from the Maritime Museum a short walk over the bridge are number of other places of interest: The Wax museum, Australia Park where you can cuddle a koala and the Sydney Aquarium are all on that side. This is also the place where you can catch one of many private boats that dart around the harbour during the day or evening.All in all a full day for DH is on the agenda if you have the time.HINT: Select a clear evening (preferably with a full moon) and have dinner at DH looking into the city (on the Western side of the water). The moon comes up over the city and looks spectacular. Oooh and don't forget to bring that ring if you wish to impress.

Very big with good open space areas.. If you are in Sydney and would like a meal then this is the place for you. There are numerous restaurants with a wide variety of dishes. The area is reasonably large and modern and there are good views of the water/harbour and also of the city. This site also contains the Aquarium and a number of tourist attractions.

Darling Harbour, a bit of a mixed bag.. Darling Harbour has two sides to it. Or more really. Harbourside as it is known is a collection of tourist shops and fairly ordinary food outlets in a rather dated building on the western side of the water. I understand it is due for a refresh before too long. The Novotel is on this side and beyond it the short walk up to Pyrmont or around the other bits of the waterfront towards the Star Casino make it worthwhile being across this side. The Maritime Museum is on this side too which is worth a visit. Also along this side is the Exhibition Centre which is big and empty if there are no shows on or bustling if there is something on and worth visiting. Heading south along this side takes you into Chinatown.The view back across to the city from Harbourside makes it worth the visit and the walk across the pedestrian Pyrmont Bridge provides easy access.On the opposite side of the water is Cockle Bay which is definitely worth a visit if you like to stroll and eat. There is an excellent selection of restaurants and bars along the waterfront over two levels. The tourist boats and some impressive private boats moor over this side so there is always something interesting to look at if you are seated outside during the summer. The promenade along the waterfront is always busy with people strolling up and down.The Aquarium is on this side. Again, this is worth a visit. The access from the CBD to Cockle Bay is an easy walk.If you walk north along the waters edge you will come round to King St Wharf which is another strip of excellent quality eating establishments. Beyond King St Wharf they are building the new Barangaroo precinct which will not be ready for some time. Because of this you need to leave the waterfront and go along Hickson Road if you want your after dinner walk to take you round under the Harbour Bridge and to The Rocks. Either way it's not far, it's level and the sights are great, particularly on a summers evening.

Great place to Relax and walk. A favourite place of mine to walk though and relax. My wife and love to go down and sit, watch and wander about the area up to King Street Wharf and back.Plenty of eating places or just a great place to take a home packed feed to simply sit by the water and graze on your lunch or dinner at night.Plenty of attractions particularly at night and especially Saturday nights. Fireworks every Saturday.A place to go.

Best view of Harbour. Darling Harbour is a must see for everyone visiting Sydney for the first time. World famous attractions, fantastic views of Sydney, hundreds of cafes, pubs and restaurants to choose from. Plan to stay for at least 2 days to experience the whole place.

Fun place to visit. Living in Sydney, I've been to Darling Harbour many times over the years. It is a fun place to wander around on a weekend when there are lots of buskers and entertainment going on. The shops and restaurants are on the pricey side but hey, it's a tourist place! The Maritime Museum is really good, Japanese Gardens pretty, and Star City our casino--is just a few blocks away as is the city center . You certainly won't want to spent more than a day there but it's worth a look see.

We love Darling Harbour. We love going to Darling Harbour for lunch, we catch the train from Woy Woy to Central Station and then the local train, so easy transport. We have lunch at different restaurants each time. The atmosphere is great and always something to see

Nice Public Space. A short bus ride back from the City/Harbour or take a ferry ride, there is Darling Harbour. A nice place to relax, take in the sight, have a coffee or lunch, let the kids run around as there is a 'playground' where children can stretch and burn off some excess energy!Take a look at the Oriental Garden (Fee), Imax Cinema or go for a little shopping, it is all there. It isn't far from Chinatown, another Sydney attractions nearby,eg: Sydney Entertaintment Centre, Capitol Theatre.

Everything in one place. Darling Harbour is the meeting place for many tourists and locals alike.There are restaurants and cafes for every taste and pocket.You have the Sydney Maritime Museum ,The Sydney Aquarium,The Exhibition Centre ,Star city Casino,Sydney Entertainment Centre and many night clubs and Bars.All within a easy ten minutes walk of each other,it's about 15 minutes to the city centre shopping area .Check out The IMAX cinema in Darling Harbour with its 80 feet high 3D screen and sound system

A Beautiful Gem in Sydney.. Darling Harbour is a beautiful destination for a full day out in Sydney. It is here that you will find the Sydney Imax, many "Jetboat" attractions depart from Darling Harbour, as do many other harbour cruises.It is also where you will find "Sydney Wildlife World", the Maritime Museum, Sydney Aquarium, and the Sydney Convention Centre.There are plenty of places for fine dining, covering all possible tastes, as well as a nice food court for something quick.There are typically street performers scattered around the harbour, and many festivals and out door exhibitions make Darling Harbour their home.At night, there are many nightclubs in the area (including Home Night Club), and the entire harbour takes on a magical feeling.

Tourist trap. Loads of bars and restaurants, slightly cheaper than the Rocks/Harbour area but quiet simply is a tourist hotspot. There are better bars and restuarants around the city so don't spend too many days here

lots to offer. Darling Harbor is in Sydney CBD and offers an array of restaurant and bars on both sides of the Harbor as well as a few wonderful museums and the aquarium. There are also dinner boat rides and ferries to various venues as well. The Star Casino is across from the CBD side in the Pyrmont section of the city. They have free fireworks on Saturday nights. Darling Harbor is a nice place for families as there are the museums and wildlife park to visit. Restaurants abound.

lots of reastaurants, the maritime museum, and the Aquarium. if you're in the area at lunchtime there are numerous waterside luch restaurants. The Aquarium is here as are some other tourist attractions.
brilliant. amazing food, beberages, environment, views, service, fire works , really a pleasure to be there with family and friends.

The Mall Road of all Cities. Though many people will say its opera house, darling harbour had been the center point where all cruises leave, star casino is there and childrens playground , in special events there is fireworks and stall delaing with culture and arts. All in all I never get bored going here any number of time . For tourists sydney aquarium, wildlife park and star city casino is there , there are various hotel nearby too Novotel IBIS, monorail station and markets too. All in all I think Darling harbour is the heart of the city and Imax standing tall is a good point to see 3D movies or if nothing else just sit by the steps near the water and enjoy the sunlight the tourists, boats and lot of time music ..I love Darling Harbour

A must for tourists and a place for locals to enjoy. You have parks, shops, restaurants, cafes, fast food and bars. There's Sydney Aquarian, Madame Tussauds, Sydney Wildlife World, Maritime Museum, Chinese Gardens and much, much more. Also a short walk to the Star Casino. Lots of locals and tourists love to go to Darling Harbour to hang out and enjoy the atmosphere. A a beautiful marina with great views of Sydney's skyline during the day and the Sydney's lights at night. Great to walk around during the day and beautiful on a Summer's night. Also a short walk to Chinatown. Catch a ferry around to Circular Quay.

Loved it !. After spending all day exploring, it was nice to come back to Darling Harbour as a base. The younger kids played in the park, the older ones used the free Wifi at Star Bucks. We used Darling Harbour as a base and not a destination visit, it felt clean and safe.The highlight were the street preformers and fire works.

Relaxing. Sat back and relaxed in the park. They were putting out wooden recliner type chairs with side tables in the sun. Was fantastic for sitting back and looking at the view. Fabulous for people watching. We stayed there for at least a couple of hours. You could tell others were itching to do the same thing.

Combine it with shopping in the harbour mall. In case you want souvenirs, is probably even better to buy them there than at the souvenir shops. You don't even need to go to Bondi beach for a souvenir, you can all buy it there. Some nice bars and restaurants are there, too.

Great area, with attractions and good bars and restaurants. If you go to sydney you must go to the darling harbour.
Great area, with attractions and good bars and restaurants. Go to sea life and madame Tussaud and have a good dinner in the many restarants here.
The best. I simply love this place, beautiful scenery together with the Sydney opera house & harbor bridge. Nice place to just hang out and chill and enjoy the moment.

Beautiful in the afternoon/evening. Darling Harbour is a very nice area, with a beautiful marina and lots of nice buildings it's beautiful to take pics in the afternoon and evening. Also, there's a lot of restaurants, IMAX and other things to do, so it's also worth visiting with children. The touristic information office there is excellent as it is the chocolate milkshake from Lindt. Also, walking around the area of Pyrmont, in the back of the harbour, is very nice to know a less touristic area.

Blue Fish Restaurant. Service, Hospitality and Food is absolutely AWESOME... There is nothing to dislike about Blue Fish at Darling Harbour.Glenn Boyland is the perfect host. We will definitely eat here every time we visit Sydney.

Spectacular place a must when you visit Sydney. Darling Harbour is amazing, its my first time. I couldnt believe what Darling Harbour offers. I only wish I had taken another day in Sydney.
