Loved the atmosphere. I was amazed by this nice place. I went be ferry from Sydney harbour and the scenery is nice along the way. Good attractions there, the Hard Rock Cafe and the Maritime Museum.
Very Busy. Nice place a short walk from where we were staying ie Darling Harbour Plaza. Nice meal...and a lovely place to sit down have a chat and watch the people and the world go by.
Enjoyed night life at Darling Harbour. There was firework at night. Kids enjoyed playing at the playground oppsite the eatary there. Lots of people just spending time there.

Fireworks on Sat night in November. We walked from our accommodation to Darling Harbour. Did a fair bit of walking around the area. Plenty of place to get a beer and feed. We went back in early evening to watch the fireworks which were a fantastic show. Nearly standing room only.
Great attraction. Darling Harbour has improved over the years. The gardens have plenty of safe children's areas and there the food places as well as tourists shops to keep everyone happy

Lovely. Neat wee harbour. Lots of x-mas decorations & blow up santas around. Cool fountain thing to wet your feet in & cool yourself down. There were fireworks one night & they were amazing, some of the best I have ever seen.
Great atmosphere, handy attractions like movie cinema, wax museum, aquarium & shopping mall.
vibrant surroundings. Darling Harbor is a nice area to explore. It's vibrant, many spots to visit. Enjoying the bridge and Opera House while having a gastronomy experiences in the neighbprhood.

Avoid if you can. Really nothing to recommend much here, the walk is nice but the restaurants and the shopiing is pure tourist ville. If you must eat the Cockle Bay side is much nicer than Darling Harbour but be warned, nothing is cheap.

Love It!. We love this place and stay here or close by every time we are in Sydney. As it was getting close to Christmas, there were fireworks displays and some Christmas festivities happening that added even more to an already exciting and vibrant part of the city. Go there and feel the fun!

A nice way to spend an evening. Darling harbour comes alive in the evening, a beautiful place to go for a meal, plenty of choice (if a little overpriced). Have a couple of drinks and soak up the atmosphere. Theres a restaurant right on the waters edge that does (or did) an all you can eat ribs evening. (can't remember the name but it advertised outside on the boardwalk). A number of the restaurants open early for breakfast on the waterfront. Can't wait to return to Sydney!
Great fun.. Had a ball at Darling Harbour. Good food but read the menus carefully out front. The Italian was excellent as was Nicks Seafood.

The place to stay is the Novotel or Ibis on darling Harbour.. Many and varied restaurants right outside the hotel.
Recommend the Blue Fish and the Dish restaurants.
Toros tapas were expensive and disappointing.
Great area to explore. Its really got it all. A nice shopping area, great views, lovely walk, really good food, water and sunshine. Enough to keep you occupied all day.
Harbourside. What a great shopping centre . . . Loved the restaurant Margaritaville, I can not stop talking about the fun and the great service

Nicely Built But Way Too Tourist-y. If you want to see "real" Sydney, don't spend much time here. As such, I recommend allocating only about an hour.
If you like concrete, mediocre restaurants and chain operations, then by all means, spend more time here.

A Sydney must do. Darling Harbour is a wonderful tourist area, lots of shops lots of food and many things to do, the Chinese garden is a most inspiring, calming and beautiful place to visit. The ice cream from the Movenpick shop is amazing especially the black currant one. Just to sit, eat, drink & people watch is a great way to fill in a few hours.

Nice place for hanging out!. It was my first trip to Australia and I was very excited to go to Darling Harbour. When I get there, it was more than what I expected. The harbour is very clean and near tourism spots. Its nice for hanging around. It was windy when I went there. Its just too many pigeons around it. When you're eating those pigeons will try to steal your foods. haha. I had fun anyway!miss the fresh air in AUS!

Playground fantastic with children. The best playground I've seen anywhere. Period. Stuff for children of all ages, and so, so much variation. Not just one water thing for children to play with but dozens. Just amazing. Also free wifi!

Very lively.. Darlin Harbour in Sydney is quite simply a magnet for both young and not so young. I was fortunate enough to stay overnight in the novahotel in november of this year(2012) Both my wife and myself walked around at around 21:00 to about 21:45 and found the place to be absolutely crowded with people of all ages either going for a meal, a drink or just simply strolling along hand in hand. Darling harbour has literally hundreds , well perhaps i exaggerate a little, it certainl has plenty of restaurants which seem to cater for all tastes, the prices seem to range from expensive to extortinate(Sydney is an expensive city if you want good food) however the atmosphere is simply terrific, and the sydney skyline at night is quite simply out of this world, so take a stroll have a beer and perhap's just sit along the waterside and take in the views and people watch, it is great. I am saving up for my next trip.

Good place to be!. There is lots to do here so do not know where to start!!!Just a few details:-There are a lot of resturants here so your options are unlimited.-The majority of the resturants have "happy hour" from 4-6 and this includes cheap drinks. (drinks can get expensive)- The aquarium is not from here and a nice place to visit- There is FREEE WiFI (no need for McDonalds)- Most of the time there are events happening in the evening, always nice to site down and watch.See if for yourslef to expireance this location as there is lots to do!!

Overpriced but very nice. Darling Harbour does seem to be filled with very expensive restaurants and bars and the attractions like the aquarium and the navy museum seemed very overpriced so we just wandered around the walkways. This in itself is fun to do as there is lots to see (the submarine in the harbour was probably our favourite) and there's lots going on. We watched some street performers and had fun in the fountains. Great place to meander through.
Fun!. Its a great place - tons of restaurants, an imax, etc - really fun place to spend an evening in Sydney. Highly recommend going there

Great restaurants, late night shopping. We stayed in The Star and walked over to Darling Harbour almost every night. Lots of dining options, with an entire row of restaurants facing the harbour. Harbourside Shopping Mall offers great restaurants and a food court. And although it's not a big mall, we loved the late night shopping till 9pm daily. Don't need to wait till Thursdays ;-) The IMAX screen is the largest in the world, and the kids would love the films there. The adults however feel that there could be more movie choices instead of the same documentaries. There's a really nice playground just outside IMAX, and the kids were happy playing while the adults were happily drinking coffee at Starbucks. We caught the Xmas fireworks. Pity the Xmas music could hardly be heard.

Something for Everyone!. I loved the variety of restaurants and shops. Whatever cuisine you like, you'll find it. A wealth of stores inside the mall as well as a movie theater. There's a playground for children and many street performers. There are water taxis that can take you away.
Spectacular. Good vibe,great bars.A family friendly venue with something for everyone.Some things are looking a little dated however that is a minor complaint.

Go - But don't stay long. Way too touristie. Crowded with tourists and street performers darling harbour is one long water front area with over-priced bars and restaurants. There's a small shopping centre with the worse shopping selection in town! Good things? nice views of the city perhaps - the Aquarium maybe. That's it
lots to do. We stayed near here and there were lots of good resturants and small attarctions to do during the day. And at night there were always different street performers and a great feel about it
Lots to do. Darling harbour has something for everyone. Good places to shop and great places to eat. Stop off at IMAX to see a 3D show or visit one of the many places to hit around the water

It filled our day.. The Sydney Aquarium is a delightful experience. One of the best aquariums. Everything is clean and there is no musty / salty smell. The condition of the tanks is pristine making viewing and photos excellent. The Powerhouse Museum was disappointing. Again it has been geared to short excursions. Everything was pristine and informative but getting to the venue was difficult.

The most awesome-nest playground for the young and young at heart. The last time I was at Darling Harbour was 8 years ago and it was a good walk through to get from point A to point B. This time I was pleasantly surprise to find a the new play area which had some super cool 'toys' to play with - such as a giant slide, rock climbing, a zip line (super popular with the kids), a water maze structure, giant swing, huge rope climbing maze, sand pit etc. The young and active can spend a long time here. My boys played for more than an hour and we actually came back another day to enjoy the playground. For the older ones chaperoning, they are many places to sit and to enjoy free wifi. Also easy access to the bathroom and if you are hungry there are many options, including a McDonald's nearby. Truly an ideal place to hang out. Tip: Bring along a change of clothes for the children because they will be tempted to get wet. Also try and go during the weekday since it is jam packed during the weekends.

Nothing Special. if you are looking for restaurants and shops then Darling Harbour ticks the boxes but you could be anywhere in thecworld in a modern harbour redevelopment. Nothing special by comparison with Sydneys many other attractions. If you are tempted to visit take the ferry from Circular Quay for some spectacular views of the bridge, the opera house, the Sydney sky line and the harbour.

Fun,fun,fun. We love going to Darling Harbour, everything is there that you want/need, the parking is great normal city prices and central to everything. You'll love the stores and pancakes on the rocks Darling Harbour is super yummy.

lovely. went this month,all done up with christmas decorations,went for a meal to a reastaurant called the waterfront which is right in the corner on the front of drling harbour,meals there are great and not expensive,highly recommend.

Good day outing. Plenty to see and do on this side of the Harbour. Interesting shops, good Cafe's and restaurants. Also nice just to walk around and enjoy the culture. Suitable area for children, with places to play or rides to enjoy

Don't bother. Very disappointing. We went for breakfast on a Sunday and nothing was open. We got off the ferry at the first stop as it was going to be a long wait and the walked and walked until we found a couple of "Tapas" bars that were serving breakfast. We should have stayed at Circular Quay.

Darling Harbour. Fabulous area, wonderful views, lots of activity and good restaurants and outdoor eating. Try the King Street Wharf side, the older part is not very appealing and needs upgrading to restore to former glory. Forget about shopping there - lots of Nail parlours, amusment games and massage parlour type activities.
Great atmosphere. Really nice to stroll round with plenty of places to stop to eat and drink although some of the restaurants are a bit pricey.
A little something for everyone. Lovely restaurants along the harbour. Shopping mall is an added bonus and a short stroll to a huge playground for the kids.

All the food you could want!!. Great spot just to stop for a cold one in that 35 degree heat on the day we were there!! Fntastic just to sit in the shade and watch the boats coming and going and all the people.

The place is so exciting.. Darling Harbour is full of life. There are fabulous bars and restaurants. They do deals at lunch time which are well worth taking up. The aquarium there is a must. It is very informative and very well stock. I didn't dislike anything.

Stayed at darling harbour oct nov 2012. Lots going on here , fireworks at the weekend , and various events on the harbour as well as music events in the nearby Chinese garden.plenty of shops and places to eat although its pricey and you pay tourist prices.attractions include maritime museum, madam tussauds , aquarium and IMAX .

Restaurants at Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is just lovely and worth a visit. We took the monorail there and you can do the full round trip before deciding to get off. There are a number of restaurants to choose from but on two occasions now I have eaten at Nicks. Gorgeous fresh seafood. Cant fault it!

A place that has what a tourist needs!. We went to Darling Harbour to board the ferry to the Taronga Zoo. We realized that they had other attractions there as well - a wildlife world, an aquarium, Madam Tussauds wax musuem and a lively dining place. Had dinner at I'm Angus at the Cockle Bay Wharf with a beautiful view of the harbour and the Sydney Bridge. A happening place.
Spectacular shopping and entertainment. WE shopped at the many shops in Darling Harbour and after that was entertained by a juggler and dancer on the harbour. Very good day had by the whole family.

great place to hang out but watch out for the gulls. This is a beautiful harbor. Be sure to see the boat exhibit that is outside the maritime museum it is great. Watch out for the gulls. We took our McDonalds outside and we were literally attacked. They took my wife's hamburger right out of her hand!

People watching is a blast. We were here the afternoon of a costume party. Not really sure why, but there were lots of people going across the bridge in costume. There were all types. It was absolutely, fall over laughing hysterical. If you could imagine it, you could see it. Make time to just sit and hang out on a bench and soak in some fresh air and do a little people-watching or have a snack at one of the ourdoor cafes.
Only average. A nice place to walk around but for me there really wasn't anything great to write home about, only something average to right tripadvisor about.

Food and more food!. Had a couple of evenings wandering through Darling Harbour. First night had a lovely meal at Stacks with impeccable service - great deals for rumps on Tuesdays. We then enjoyed some gelato a little further on which was fabulous - went traditional skipping the creamy chocolatey options for mango and lemon - Mm MM!
Must see the Harbor from Darling Harbor. Just walking around the Harbor was fantastic. So many people, restaurants and just taking in the sites. It was great

Great but a little tired. Darling harbour is an exciting place to be. I love the free concerts and frequent activities here. It is starting to show its age a little and I don't shop here anymore as it is really just a tourist mecca. Hoever there are some good eateries and the ambience is good. It is so accessible to the city centre and has such a relaxed feel that it is agood place jut to chill out. My favourite venue for New Years Eve. A good place to come on your own and not feel like it.

Great place for a weekend stroll. Darling Harbour offers a range of experiences.It's worth a visit to stroll around the range of attractions.There's a range of cafes and restaurants, a naval museum, Chinese garden, a range of free entertainment, children's play attractions, as well as the view. Also, there's a modestly priced scenic trolley "train" to help you get around.It's a short stroll from the Central and Town Hall railway stations.Well worth a visit!

Great place for Happy Hour. Great atmosphere any time of day. We went for Happy Hour. It was super lively with 30 somethings (and older) hanging out. We ended up at Pontoons and had $4 drinks and they passed around free appetizers. A lot of people around but a great place to hang out.
A great place to relax. The area has a relaxed atmosphere and there are heaps of restaurants and casual dining venues. Most certainly a must do, for anyone visiting Sydney.

Busy and bustling at the weekend.. Try Saturday night here and watch a fabulous fire work display at 21.00 hours from your dining table. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit with every type of restaurant and cafes. Weekdays are easier and all is a bit quieter. But Saturday night rocks!!

Favourite part of Sydney!. I love Darling Harbour, there is always something happening! It's a beautiful place with great restaurants and bars, Harbourside Shopping Centre, amazing views, cinemas, aquarium, ferries and cruises, parks, water features and performers scattered around. Truly an amazing place with something for everyone. I will warn you though, it can get very busy! It's definitely worth it though. Check it out around Xmas to see the massive tree!

Great Advertisement for Sydney. You can spend hours walking around playing tourist or just sit & watch the world go by. Plenty of places to eat or drink with some fabulous restaurants along the waterfront.

A place to hang out. Darling Harbour is an amazing place that you have to visit when in Sydney. Located a mere 10 min walk from the city centre, Darling Harbour offers a variety of event thorughout the year, and has amazing views and shops as well as cafes. Sit at the harbour as you sip your coffee and enjoy the view

Picturesque with great food and attractions. Darling Harbour is very picturesque and a nice place to just stroll around. We found ample opportunities for great food and coffee although it is a bit pricey as expected for the area.For those looking for attractions it houses Wild Life Sydney, the Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tussauds Sydney and the Maritime Musuem so there is lots to do. The kids loved riding on the monorail around the harbour as well.The ferries run regularly, but not as often as the trains which are about every 5 minutes, although there is a walk of approximately 5 minutes from Town Hall station.We didn't visit at night though due to having young children.
Good for fine dining and a nice place to wander. Good location for outdoor restaurants. More for young people, Shops a bit pricey. More a conference location

Eat and Walk, This is the spot to hangout in Sydney. Anything we can find to satisfy our tastebuds in this spot. So easy to access from public transport, and full of eatery havens. After heavy meals, just walk along the harbour scenic path, and made a perfect night to remember. Loving it

Loud and lively!. Darling Harbour is very much a Mecca of modernity for tourists visiting Sydney and there is a handy Tourist Information Office there as well as public toilets. The level harbour side is easy to negotiate, important if you are using a push chair or are accompanied by toddlers. Prices at the many and varied waterside restaurants are on the high side, however. With an eye on the past, the National Maritime Museum is well worth a visit but souvenirs are expensive. At one end of the harbour is a terrific children's play area with high quality apparatus. It is entirely free. One particularly popular feature there is a system of shallow water courses, where kids can change the direction of flow by using sluice gates - great fun for our 4 year old grandson. There is quite a lot to entertain younger children, including a train ride and older ones seem to enjoy negotiating a spiral, stepped water staircase along the north side of the harbour. This is a lively and sometimes very noisy venue with music blaring out from some of the restaurants. Special events are often staged there as well. Each Saturday evening, visitors are treated to a superb fireworks display, lasting around half an hour. All good fun and well worth visiting.

Playground for kids and adults. There is an amazing, modern playground here for kids! Tons of water features and toys all free.... Of course, there are some main tourist attractions IMAX, aquarium, etc. for adults plus a Hard Rock Cafe. Easy access from CBD over pedestrian bridges on Liverpool street. Don't miss the helix, water feature near the hard rock.

EXPENSIVE BUT WORTH A VISIT. Vibrant, Loud, brash and very, very busy, that's Darling Harbour. Just a few blocks from downtown Sydney, within reasonable walking distance. But beware if you are a tourist, as the price to eat, for us Brits anyway is pretty steep indeed. At a waterfront eatery we paid £70 + for Fish and Chips and three small bottles of lager, but then Australia is not a cheap place for anything.
Entertainment overload!. Food, fun and festive cheer. Santas everywhere and beautifully set out, there is something for everyone at Darling Harbour.

Darling Harbour. It's has to be the hub of downtown Sydney. Buskers, restaurants, this area has the lot. You can grab a wine, an ice-cream, have some takeaway or head for a restaurant. If you can't find something to please you here you should have stayed home. My wife and I loved it.
Lunch Specials. This is a great place to spend some time, it is very relaxing and you can chose some great places for lunch, I went to Nick's and had the AUD 10 special which was very good value.

The entertainment area of Sydney.. A very interesting place. Completely renewed the last ten years, the seawall around the harbour is full of bar, cafe's and restaurants. Plus the Maritime Museum which is well worth the visit. Also take the last chance to take the monorail around the city, it is being phased out.
very touristic. if you are not afraid by the massive people during the week end this is the place to stay!But restaurant are expensive prefer the king warf

Lots to see and do. A very bustling harbour. This is where the Aquarium and small zoo is situated. It's a bit of a hike from Circular Quay so we took a ferry back. The Aquarium is well worth a visit we got a combo pass where you can visit up to 4 places. We took the 2 combo and did Centrepoint Tower as well
nice place to spend weekend. Do not miss firework on every saturday at 9pm. perfect place to walk around and have drinks and dinner.

A must see. Great place to hang out. We went to see Madame Tussauds, Sydney Wildlife and Sydney Aquarium and enjoyed every minute. Imax is fantastic! Starbucks is as always great. Don't miss the National Maritime museum though, there is a lot to see and it is great fun to get on board the ships.

Location, Location. Surrounded by restaurants, bars and other tourist activities Imax, Jet Boats, Wax Museum, this area comes alive on the weekend evenings. On Saturday night fireworks were set off around 9pm, apparently this happens every saturday over November and towards Christmas
awednesday walk. shops and restaurants looked fine great, but not much atmosphere. Walked around then back across Pyrmont bridge, had lunch over there

Amazing. A Must!. Easy to get too by foot, bus or ferry.This place is just great. Full of life, full of activity. Great food and bars. Everything you would want to choose from in terms of food.Saturday nights are excellent and they have fireworks every Saturday free of charge. SantaFest has also been brilliant. They really know how to enjoy themselves in Australia!
Great Harbour with lots to see.. Darling Harbour was about a ten to fifteen minute walk from our hotel so we explored it the day we arrived. Very nice walk. Beautiful views along the way.

Great for eating and Visitor Centre. I found Darling Harbour a little too touristy, but it was our favourite spot for dinner. Lots of options, even for vegetarians like us. I also recommend going to the Visitor Centre there on your first day to collect information and to buy the iVenture Card. There are various versions of this card, so talk to the very helpful staff at the Visitor Centre so you can choose the best for your needs.

A lively harbour for all seasons. A very well planned harbour with easy access from land and sea. Recommended to take a ferry from Central Quay to Darling Harbour to take pictures of the Sydney Bridge from afar as well as underneath the bridge and Opera House as well as the approach to the harbour. The harbour is in the form of a horseshoe with shops, food outlets and parks and gardens around it for a nice stroll both during day and night. I was really impressed with the children's play area where technology was presented in such a unique way for kids to learn and apply hands-on.
Always a top spot. Darling Harbours alsways a great place to wander around and spend a few hours. Good food and wine to be enjoyed also.
Loved it. Loved this place, lots to see and do, and the food was amazing. Went to Nicks for seafood, yum yum yum

People Watch.. My favourite part of going to Darling Harbour is the journey there, through Chinatown, past Paddy's, down by the Chinese Gardens and then you're there. Probably the best place in Sydney to people watch, grab a good book and watch the world pass you by. Oh, and I would highly recommend the chocolate turtles from 'The Fudge Shop' located in Harbourside shopping centre!

Darling Harbour. Fantastic choice of Restaurants and Bars, amazing views, great 3 mile to Darling Harbour walk all the way from Circular Quay and the Opera House under the Bridge and along the shoreline to Darling Harbour and the Chinese Garden

A great place to visit. Love to people watch? This is your place to visit. Plenty to see and do. There are a ton of restaurants. The big downfall was that the wait staff are not Australian but mostly backpackers on short-term jobs who do not speak English. The service was much to be desired, and people should know that food and drink are expensive in Australia. Much more expensive than the States. Be prepared to spend like you are eating all of your meals at a hotel in NY City or San Diego.

Impressive. For what was formely a wasteland and industrial area, it quite an achievement. Visited the Sydney Aquarium which was impressive with some scary looking great whites. Doesnt disappoint. The architecture works in great harmony. Aussie´s really make an effort the look after their waterways. Saw a new Casino under construction. Its all happening down under.

So much to see and do. We spent all our free time exploring the sights and sounds of Darling Harbour - the sad part is that Sydney is getting rid of the monorail system which we thoroughly enjoyed using to get around the harbor. The Aquarium and Maritime Museum are especially worth visiting!

Beautiful harbor and lots of "meal deals". Walk the entire harbor and enjoy people watching when you finally pick a sidewalk cafe to eat/drink, as there are tons of choices and most were offering drink, lunch/dinner deals. Just look at the sidewalk boards to see the specials. Found $10 complete steak dinners at Cargo Mon-Wed. nights. Hard to beat that!

Love it. Just walk from the train station, cross to Paddys Market and passed the Chinatown and walked straight to the Darling Harbour. This is my favorite route and lots of happenings along the route. Darling Harbour is a huge place with the biggest information center with lots of souvenirs available there. You can sits for hours just to watch the crowded and the harbour. Lots of restaurants, mall, the convention centre, playground and lots of other activities. During the weekends it is always overcrowded

Great place relaxed atmosphere. Great place and a really relaxed atmosphere. People seem really friendly and willing to help. I took the little train which was $5 which took us around darling harbour, it is a great way to see the place if you have children or just if your legs are getting a bit tired. It stops at the ferries, China town and the darling harbour shops.

Maritime Museum worth looking at. Make sure ylou have a look at the war ships and the submarine docked in the harbour. Very interesting being able to see what the sailors conditions were like whilst at sea. The museum is also very interesting.

fabulous. there is everything at darling harbour. aquarium, wildlife of sydney, madam tussades all of which is a must ! great shopping centre walking distance to paddys market, something on every weekend including fireworks every saturday night

Interesting area. Lots to see here. Apart from the many boats there are a plethora of lovely restaurants - to suit all tastes. Visit the Maritime Museum which is not just a building, but there are a variety of ships to go over - including a submarine and a couple of historical ships. We were there for Remembrance Sunday and attended a lovely outdoor service outside the Museum. Lovely area.
What a Place. This is a great place, so much to see and do, very tidy, clean & safe. Kids secure to play on the playground at 10 pm

Needs a bit more entertainment apart from restaurants. I have visited Darling Harbour many times over the years - it is a lovely spot but a bit more entertainment during an evening would be good. The restaurants are very samey and not great value but it would be great to have a light show on the water, I know this has been done in the past and it would be great if it was a regular feature. Nice area but to be honest getting a little boring

Lots to do. There are many stores and many restaurants to choose from in Darling Harbor. The Convention Center is right there as well. Also a shopping mall. In front of the mall you can catch the Hop On-Hop Off bus that takes you around the city.
Circular Quay is better. Lots of interesting things to do and see but not as good as circular Quay if you are short on time. A base for several luch time cruises and proximate to the downtown.

Great People Watching. Darling Harbour - on a warm sunny day - is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat and watch the world go by. There are lots of places to eat and shop and just spend the day. Make sure to visit the Aquarium and take the overhead tram.

What's not to love?. Okay, it has been conferences that have brought me here over the years. The Convention Centre is so good, so comfortable and so well-situated in a brilliant part of Sydney. It's a great place for anyone, the kids' playground is probably the best I've ever seen ~ and to be surrounded by water always makes me feel like home. Do yourself a favour. Go. And try the Aztec for a chili hot chocolate...
A day at Darling Harbour.. + Harbourside Mall with many shops & restaurants.+ National Maritime Museum - lots of vessels on the harbour including a warship, a submarine & a sailboat/ship.+ Monorail

Always something to do. Love Darling Harbour, lots to see and do and Matilda / Captain Cook cruises have some good deals to get across to Toronga Zoo as well as hop on hop off boat excursions very handy from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay Toronga zoo etc. ... Sad to see the monorail being taken down.
Simply lovely. Large boats on the harbour with the back view of Sydney Harbour bridge. Lovely restaurants, buzzing with people.

Great place to relax, have a meal,and a drink. Great place to visit and spend a few hours, always something going on, lots to see, plenty of places to eat and drink, shopping, everything you need for a pleasant day or afternoon out. iMax theatre and playground for kids, plenty to do and see.

A real find the playland. The kids and adult playland! There is a flying fox, climbing centre, water area, sand pit its great you could set up for hours with a coffee or a picnic and let the kids run wild. We really enjoyed this FREE spot! The rest pof darling harbour is also good but this little spot was the best!

Easy boat ride from the Opera House. Very cool tourist area to visit the aquarium or finding a place for lunch. The ferry boat ride is the best way to get here from the opera house and an excellent way to see the Sydney harbor.

A fantastic place. Lots to enjoy.. There is lots to see and enjoy - something for everyone. There is an excellent kids playground. Lots of attractions, like Sydney Aquarium, Maritime Museum. And lots of shopping choices. So many restaurants, with terrific views.

Fabulous sky line. Visited during the day and did the maritime museum, went on 3 ships including a submarine, there were 5, and had a lovely barracuda lunch in the cafe, and went again at night for the night time sky line and dinner.

Eating and drinking at it's best.. Not the actual Darling Harbour but on the other side of the water - Cockle Bay Wharf and King St area. Brilliant selection of places to eat and drink. Tip - good deals to be had if you get there early.
Darling Harbour. Beatiful spot to go. Gets very busy mid-day would reccomend earlier in the morning. great eating places and resaraunts. A must!

Australia Day. Visited on Australia Day after a wonderful day on the harbour. The crowd was celebrating our special day it was a wonderful feeling of being Australian. The entertainment aand the security was very good

Brilliant! Lively place by day or night. Love this place - lots to see and do and watch the world. Take the train to Town Hall and walk down Bathurst. You can take a lift to get up to the raised walkway. Enjoy wandering around, visit a museum, look at boats, have a meal. Great children's park adjacent and lots for them to do. Would especially recommend going on a Saturday night in Oct-Dec when there is a free fireworks diisplay at 9pm. Fabulous setting.
Lively and fun!. Darling Harbour has some fab bars and restaurants and a lively atmosphere. There is a free fireworks show at 9pm on a Saturday night - well worth seeing.
Way too busy. Some nice eateries here, but most are very busy all day and night. Not as good value as other places. Easy to get to on the monorail or by the shuttle bus, or an easy walk from the CBD.

Dining Mecca. We took in the "Legally Blond " stage show (great)and had early dinner harbour side before hand. There are so many restaurants to choose from both at the Kings Wharf side and near the Convention centre you feel spoilt for choice.If you just want to people watch it is mesmerising too.Went back for a second dinner just for the atmosphere

Very commercialized. Lots of stores and things to see, but expensive and chain oriented. Almost feels like a mall. Directional signage could be better. Took suggestion of one store owner and went to Fish Market (about 15 minute walk). Really good food.

Could happily spend all day here. Loved the variety, from museums to monrails to eating establishments. Highlights were the Matitime Museum with its wide variety of crafts and artifacts, and the promenades, which were clean and lively. Wide choice of cafes and restaurants to suit most tastes and pockets.Felt the monorail was an opportunity lost, with trains too small, too slow, too infrequent and too expensive. An essential destination for every tourist with a little time to spare.
Dazzling by day or night. Great atmosphere both day and Night, many things to do with cafes resturants and eatery's in abundance. Beautiful scenery everywhere you look, and lots of fun to be had.

Do what ever you want. Darling harbour is just amazing. Bars, restaurants, IMAX cinema, exhibition center, night clubs, party boats, tourist information, a park where the kids can play on a sunday afternoon.

Afternoon stroll around the Harbour. Took a stroll down Pitt st all the way across the bridge, offers great view of the CBD. Be careful of the seagulls, they can tell quickly if there's any food around for them.

Conference, business or pleasure - a great place to walk, eat and shop. Sometimes if you attend a conference you don't get much time "out" But if your conference is in or near Darling Harbour it doesn't take long to find something to eat at just about any price from $ to $$$$. Something for everyone - on your own or with a family. Plenty to see and do even if the weather is not the best. If it's nice out - wow, you are in for a treat.Enjoy one of the entertainment centres of Sydney, whether for business or pleasure.
beautiful. beautiful at night as well as day time , beautifully lite up in all colors of the rainbow , amazing loved every minute of it april 2011
Darling Harbour. we liked darling harbour very much,its a better area than the harbour,much more going on,nice place to eat,plenty to do

Amazing place with so many bars and restaurants but not tacky. Really cool spot for getting food or having a few drinks, there are so many restaurants to choose from. The fireworks every Saturday night are lovely too we really enjoyed darling harbour just walking up and down it is lovely in the nighttime it's really safe too.

Free, fun for the kids and the coffee shops are OK. What I really love about the Darling Quarter part of this very touristy area is the thought that has gone into the kids play area. Loads and loads of creative tasks that involve water..waterwheels, pumps, waterfall, lots of machines the kids can turn, hit, jump on, pull....all to get the water flowing into the next part of this very large game. Just near this area is a couple of coffee shops...if it is a fine sunny day, try Taste as they have good Campos coffee and the outdoor tables are right near the play area so you can watch the kids. BUT if it is cloudy and grey sky don't bother as the interior of this coffee shop is messy, feels grubby and is very dark. When I was last there I asked the staff to turn some lights on as it was very stormy outside and the room was very, very dark dark. The staff member tried one lamp..said "oh the bulb must have blown" and went away never to be seen again. I am normally a fan of this company Taste - their other restaurant are very well run but this one is a big disappointment.
Shopping, Food and Entertainment Mecca. Shop and eat till you drop. At night, there is always something on somewhere to kick up your heels and dance the night away.

Hold onto your lunch!. Darling Harbour has undergone extensive refurbishment in the past couple of years and I think it may be on-going. The restaurants are all at the pricier end of town as are the boutiques but if you're after people watching, this is the place to be. However, a word of warning, those pesky, smelly Ibis are just waiting for you to leave your sandwich/fries/ice-cream unattended!
Plenty to do and see.. There is any number of places to eat and drink as well as family activities on offer so it is the perfect area to visit while in Sydney.

A must for Sydney visitors but ban those mini-trains. A must visit for anyone visiting Sydney. A nice area to hand out, eat, drink and sightseeing. Plenty of restaurants and even a play area for kids. Evenings are the best and hang out. However, those mini trains are a nuisance and should be taken off this area where people enjoy walking. One of those mini-trains almost hit my 7-year-old son, luckily the driver jammed the brakes just on time. It is one of a few vehicle free areas in the city and should be left like that.
Great place to do nothing. We sat around watching all the different things going on from kids dancing, rowing races, car shows and loads of Ely fish

Good but will get better. It is already good but will only get better once the new park is finished. We stayed near here so we got to really find our way around. If you go through and past the fountains at the back of the Harbour you come to some beautiful parkland and more restaurants.

Go on an empty stomach. We couldn't believe how many restaurants line Darling Harbour! Bring your appetite because all the restaurants have great food and wonderful views of the bay. We visited the Wildlife Zoo while there and recommend taking the escalator up from Harbour to downtown Sydney through the walkway.

Lively Place. Its a lovely area with loads of casual stylish restaurants and shops.The view is great as you can see the boats cruising by and seagulls flying around.Beautiful to spend a couple of hours.
Days out in Sydney. Good location to while away half a day. Plenty of eateries with some good $10 lunch menus available.

Stunning View of the City. Walking along Darling Harbour can take as little as 15 minutes or as long as an hour. There are so many things to do. Plenty of restaurants, a few clubs, an Imax cinema, bowling, and even laser tag. At night is probably the best time to go because you can see the reflection of the buildings on the water. In the day time a lot of workers will sit along the harbour and have their lunches. A really great place to visit with heaps of things to do.
People Watching. Our hotel was on Darling Harbour, so we would go down there in the evenings to "people" watch and to eat. Lots of restaurants with a variety of foods. Enjoyed our time there.

Most beautiful Harbour in the World. Excellent atmosphere, very vibrant, charming harbour, fantastic, and all the good things about this harbour, Sydney Darling Harbour. A lot restaurants, boutiques, and tourist object, such as Sydney Aquarium, Madame Tussaud, etc. We just love this most beautiful harbour. And not to forget the great fireworks.

Vibrant. A great place with plenty of bars and restaurants, a perfect destination to stay and explore Sydney and the surrounding area. The Sealife centre is well worth a visit. For a limited stay in Sydney it is worth taking one of the day coach tours that take in the north and south and lunch on a river cruise.

Darling of a Harbour.. Quite modern architecture but executed with flair and style. Love the eateries to satisfy all tastes. Great Chinese theme garden. Modern exhibits. V good transport links to Sydney centre and Harbour. Lots of space so one should not feel hemmed in. Great for families as well as single trippers

Worth a visit. Previously on coming to Sydney I didn't think Darling Harbour was worth my time but boy how wrong was I!? Perfect for food, great choice of bars and restaurants.Fabulous maritime museum, and amazing boats to climb over.Stunning gardens and features to enjoy.All in relatively peaceful surroundings.

Pretty Harbour. Darling Harbour is very pretty and comes to liife at night and here one can find many restuarants offering all kinds of cuisine to suit all tastes. There are nightclubs here as well and ithe whole area has an amazing atmosphere.
Typical. What a complete waste of time. Very commercialized with large restaurants and mediocre food.. Preferred getting lost in Surry Hills or Balmain instead!

Vibrant. Love the place, lots of restaurants and some many types of food styles. China Town just around the corner. Street entertainers, boat trips and fireworks every Saturday in October and December. Young and old will love it.
Something for everyone. Great place to take the kids, have a romantic dinner or meet up with friends. A variety of bars, restaurants and cafes

So much to do at Darling Harbour. We took the tram to Darling Harbour and rode the monorail back. Caught a show at the Imax theatre, lunch and discount shopping at the mall. Spent time at the Chinese Gardens and the aquarium too. A previous time we visited the Maritime Museum.

Great area - but expensive food as it is a tourist area. There is lots to see and do around Darling Harbour. The Aquarium is great, as is the Maritime Museum and the kids playground is absolutely fantastic. It will keep them entertained for hours. Although there are lots and lots of eating options, I found most overpriced for the quality you were getting. However, there is a nice outlook and lots to look at.

One of the Best places on Earth. You can sit around all day and people watch or go to the cinema, restaurants, shopping, beautiful childrens Park, carousel, street performance and music and on and on. The view of the city from your seat at the waters edge is spectacular any time of day and the fireworks on Saturday nights just tops it all off.

Beautiful Darling Harbour. You can spent the whole day at darling harbout with a lot of happening around the area, visit the Aquarium, Whale watching, visit the Chinese Garden, Museum, Exhibition Centre, etc. There are a lot of restaurants and foodcourt around the area, very convenience for all. The night view is magnificent and beautiful.

Great for people watching. Never seen so many people in one place before as Darling Harbour on a Sunday. Was great for people watching, eating and drinking. A couple of resonable places for meals and drinks but they tend to get packed very early on and you'll have to wait a long time to get seated.
Great bars. Darling harbour loads of great restaurants and bars .Great views over the harbour lots of very expensive boats .Yearly sociable place to be day or night.

Spend a week just at Darling Harbour. A FUN place. First time we took our daughter, she was about 2 and enjoyed rides at Tumbelong Park, Monorail, Sydney Aquarium, Chinese Gardens, and the great views from restaurants. Now she's 14 and pretty much the same. Great place.

great place to walk around. Shops are good value and the restaurants offer everything I take all my OS guests here for the food and the view, fireworks are a regular occurrence and there are enough things to keep you occupied all day

Love it!. So many things to do here. I recommend taking your partner here for a romantic night out. Or your family if there's an event on. I like just walking around, people watching. Or sitting by the harbour and taking it all in. It's a great place to visit!

Taking Time. Darling Harbour is an area in downtown Sydney where you can stroll along the waterfront, admire the boats, the fashion, decide on what sightseeing trip you might take and then decide on what will be for dinner. Lots of decisions to make or just enjoy the wander.

Touristy but interesting. If you like Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco, you'll like Darling Harbour. There's a Madame Tussaud's, an aquarium, a marine museum, lots of restaurants with some offering dinner at $10. There's a children's park under the bridge and you can board the monorail there for a tour of Sydney.
What a place. So much to see and do and so clean. Numerous restaurants of all types, Boats going to all sorts of places, play areas forkids, casino .....

Great day trip. It was beautiful. Lots to do and see and spending the day there would be great. We had a great walk from the Rocks area and then shopped a bit, ate and went on a speed boat tour. Super fun!
Great atmosphere. Lots of places to eat and drink and just a fun place to walk around. Early evening was particularly enjoyable.
beautiful place. one of the nicest parts of city, nice bars and restaurants on the waterside.you have to have a wander around darling harbour if in sydney!!
Just darling!. This is just such a lovely harbour by day and by night - so prettily lit in the evenings. There are lots of places to stop for a coffee or a meal - you are spoilt for choice.

Usually lots to do over a weekend. There's always something to see or do in Darling Harbour as the park hosts countless festivals.
The fireworks on the weekend are well worth a look.
Fun touristy experience. Spent time walking and snacking around the harbout. Great views of the bridge etc. eateries were busy and all tourists seemed to be having a great time.
As always - best place for food and fun.. I love the darling harbour and I wish we, in Melbourne, will have something like that. Great views, nice breeze and very good food.

Plenty to see and do. Lovely. We wandered around the harbour, watched the sun set with the boats passing by. There are plenty of bars and restaurants plus a place for the kids to play in water fountains.

Beautiful area for a posh lunch. Took time to enjoy a relaxing and modern lunch whilst taking in the views from Darling Harbour - not as spectacular as Sydney Harbour but still worth a visit if you fancy good food, decent wine offers and a spot of people watching.

Touristy and expensive. Not our thing. Too expensive and disney like. Lots of restaurants in one place as well as tourist venues like Madame Tussauds, aquarium. But felt contrived and were better options elsewhere

Expensive drinks but nice atmosphere. We were staying in The Rocks when we were in Sydney and we walked to Darling Harbour one evening. On route we were amazed by the really large fruit bats (big as Blackbirds) that were flying around at the tree line. The harbour had a lovely feel to it but drinks were really expensive about £10 for a pint hence we made them last!

Tons of choices. We arrived in Sydney on a cold, rainy day and decided that it was a good day to get to the Aquarium and Life Park. Those are just 2 of the dozens of choices of things to do and places to eat at Darling Harbour. There are museums, restaurants, and people watching! Fireworks on Saturday at 9pm.
Darling Harbour. Great for shopping, wide range of shops and the Maritime museum with sub and ships to look around worth a view.

A favourite pre-flight visit. Darling Harbour is a tourist trap in many ways. However, we enjoy a drink overlooking the harbour followed by dinner in one of the many restaurants. It has become a bit of a tradition before going on international flights.
Fantastic Eats. There are so many places to chose from , could be there a week and not go to the same restaurant twice

Beautiful by day, spectacular by night.. Darling Harbour has recently been renovated. It is a beautiful, interesting spot where you can spend hours just strolling around the shops, enjoying any kind of meal at the many restaurants or eateries, as well as opportunities to enter the many attractions that are on offer. By night it is just spectacular as you look across the water to the lights of the hunderds city buildings in the distance. It is beautifully landscaped with lawns and waterways, and there is a very nice area now where children can play and climb on structures and slides that have recently been added for their pleasure, It is an excellent family venue, and excellent also for those who like to dine out, relax and enjoy the views at the same time.
What a beautiful area. It is nice to walk along Darling Harbour and watch the boats, stop for a bite to eat, and then just continue with a nice stroll.
Saturday Fireworks. Go here to see fireworks every Saturday evening, Aussie style off the back of jet skis. There are other attractions here too, like a cinema.

Nice morning. Lots to see and do here, loved the aquariums and the big picture screen at IMAX.
Some nice shopping and very good food to have for lunches.

Stroll downtown's quaint harbour!. Both sides of Darling Harbour have fascinating sites, from the Maritime museum to the secluded Chinese garden. There are magical playgrounds loaded with children most days, outdoor cafes spilling onto the sidewalks, and fascinating waterworks that appeal to all ages.
This walk can take from 20 minutes to two hours. Enjoy it!

Darling Harbour. It's a great place to visit and enjoy the view all around. This place is always alive and busy with people, not only tourists but also locals. I love the buzz and the many restaurants to choose from. Chinta Ria is one of my favourite.

Darling Harbour is a Real Darling of a Place!!!. Darling Harbour is a great place to hang out at any time of the day.There are excellent breakfasts at the many cafes, and great lunches and dinners in all styles and prices.The Harbour is pretty and offers lots to do including the Maritime Museum (Beautiful!!), the Aquarium and additional museums.The local Imax theater boasts to be the largest in the world!! (We didn't measure it....).There is alwasy stuff happening here. On one of the days we were visiting (A Sunday) the Corvette Club of Australia was here in full force on the promenade, showing off magnificently maintained specimens of this great American icon.Whatever your reason for visiting Sydney, be sure to stroll down to Darling Harbour. It's a Darling Place!!!!

SMELLY. Some awful odurs woft in on the water at times off putting when eating otherwise an amazing place in close proximaty to the hustle and bustle of the city chillout can occur ast the many eaterys and yum the Lindt Chocalate shop takes the cake
A Must to visit while in Sydney. Nice restaurants & Bars. Walk along by the waterfront and experience Sydney and what it has to offer. Wonderful views of Sydney's skyline
Love it love it love it. Beautiful area of Sydney. Lots of cool places to eat/drink/be merry and take in the atmosphere of the harbour. Great little stores for the shopoholic too.

A Must See. All visitors to Sidney must visit Darling Harbour, why? because the guide books say so, and they are right. Starting from the mouth of the harbour it is a long but interesting walk past bars and restaurants on one side and the pleasure boats nestling in the harbour on the other. Further along is the excellent aquarium and the Monorail station. If you continue you come across the Chinese Garden and furthe still Chinatown itself. The harbour is of course a tourist trap so if you fancy eating there be prepared!
Fantastic choice of eateries. More than enough choice to find bars and restaurants to suit any taste. Also great atmosphere around the harbour.

Touristy malls and restaurants. Lots of shops and very touristy with the usual touristy restaurants. Once there, we had a challenge finding restaurant options that were well reviewed. Many advertised early bird specials though and winter specials. After one visit to Darling Harbor, we decided to explore other areas of Sydney instead.

Love the variety of eateries. This is a great place to people watch & watch the world go by. A large array of bars & restaurants something for everyone while taking in the nice views of the water or park.
Have been to Darling Harbour a number of times but always enjoy taking a stroll around & trying different restaurants.

Overrated.. The setting is wonderful, and they have great fireworks regularly. But it doesn't BEGIN to compare with, for example, the Victoria and Alfred Waterfront in Cape Town. It's tacky, touristy, overpriced and unimaginative.
Darling Harbour. Fantastic to walk around and lots of restaurants. Took the little train which was delightful. Lovely park for the kids to play and the Animal Park is also worth a visit

A bit too touristy but lots to do and always interesting people to watch. It feels very safe and is kept very clean. Nice to walk around. Plenty of Cafe's and restaurants. Fresh air in center of city.

A real multi-cultural experience!. Fabulous area developed for all-round entertainment and enjoyment. Plenty of eateries covering a wide range of cuisines. Entertainment provided - it was Peruvian dancers that drew my attention the day I was there. Loved walking around and taking it all in!
A nice relaxing place. Great restaurants here and the price isn't too high. Good variety and a brilliant people watching place. Sit, relax, have a beer and watch the sun go down.

Pick your venue and day as it varies (reviewed by a local). I'm a Sydneysider and i'm reviewing Darling Harbour because it's marketed as a key tourist destination but your experience of it will vary significantly unless you pick a venue / activity and date that works for your needs, and I know when I travel o/s I appreciate honest help from locals. The bad stuff first: Darling Harbour is widely derided by Sydneysiders and often regarded as a 1980s town planning disaster, full of kitsch mainstream tourist attractions and a now decidedly shabby looking shopping centre, with the usual tourist horrors like a "mini train" and human "sculpture" performers (ugh!) Note: shoppers should head to George St, Pitt St, Market St and Castlereagh St for high-end mainstream shopping, or King St Newtown for alternative shopping. Darling Harbour has a freeway running through it which physically disconnects it from the city proper (you approach via series of bridges) and serves to give it an isolated atmosphere. That said, there is a lot of work being one to improve it including a rebuild of the outdated convention centre as well as reconstruction to rid some of the more 1980s aspects of the attractions. Families with small children are served by a good playground with fountains kids can splash in and the aquarium and maratime museum are also good for this segment. The Powerhouse Museum is pitched at children but check their website for frequent adult-orieneted exhibitions (eg Kylie Minogue's wardrobe, various fashion, music and photographic exhibitions). Singles and couples will likley prefer the King St Wharf side which has excellent bars and dining on the water and is away from the maddening crowds. You can reach these by foot from the northern CBD. The southern end (family central) frequently has free concerts (jazz, blues, rock) in summer so it's worth doing an online search before you get there, especially if you have limited time in Sydney. Pyrmont is a historic inner city suburb at the western edge of Darling Harbour which is well worth a visit for its excellent pubs and restaurants. If you are visiting late at night be aware that the casino is right there and can be dangerous with drunk angry people who've lost their money at 2am looking for a fight. Perfectly safe during the day and early evening. A few blocks further west and you are at the Sudney Fish markets - extremely recommended. Enjoy and stay safe.

cockle bay and king street wharf a lot better. bit too touristy for my liking with overpriced tourist menus in the restauants head for cockle bay over the other side of king street wharf better value better restaurants and better food....

Tourist central at Sydney. Cockle Bay and Darling Harbour are one of the top tourist destinations in Sydney, and definitely a must do. There are a large range of tourist, eating and drinking activities with a large selection of bars, restaurants and other activities including a fascinating water park for kids and adults, and an activities park with ropes, swings etc for kids. Ready access by foot, monorail (until 30 June 2013) and Light Rail, and huge car parks under the Ibis and Novotel Hotels on the western side. Luckily we live here and enjoy it every day, but for others it is well worth visiting, allow at least half a day and come for a drink, a meal, a film, play in the arks, a stroll around, and on most Saturday nights - the fireworks.
Dinner Cruise. Fantastic ! We had a seafood Buffet and glass of champagne each included plus a DJ. Great value from Pearl Cruises.31/2 hrs of Sydney 's sparkling harbour lights very romantic.

Great Place in Sydney. Do put a day in Darling Harbor on your "to do" list in Sydney. We went to the Aquarium, the Maritme Museum, the Harborside shops, the not too far away Sydney Fish Market and just enjoyed this part of Sydney very much. Taking the ferry into this area or back to Circular Quay is a great way to experience it.

Fantastic area especially for family friendly fun and dining. Darling Harbour is fantastic for families, in fact everyone because of its dining and entertainment options We were staying in the CBD unfortunately but next time in Sydney will stay near here. Our son loved the free water playground and we had to bring him back , it was a favourite place for him. The area is packed with families and there is so much happening - free and various other entertainments. There is a huge range of dining options at various price points. Don't miss coming here.
Beautiful. An interesting place with things to see and nice places to eat. Watch out for those pesky seagulls, they'll steal your food right off your plate.

darling harbour - the place to be. A great place to visit no matter what time of the week or year always busy. Fantastic restaurants cheap $ 10 lunch time meals mid week specials at Cargo bar Mon-Wed or Nicks bar and grill on a Thursday

So much to see and do for the family. Aquarium, Wax Works, Wildlife Zoo, restaurants, cafes, shopping, jet boat rides, ferries, palygounds, the list goes on and on easy transport options and with China town next door the fun goes on.. A family could easily spend 2 days enjoying this area. Well done Sydney.

A Fantastic Playground!. Darling Harbour is constantly evolving. It always has plenty on for adults and kids alike. The most recent edition to open was a new outdoor playground for kids. It offers a great location for kids to let loose for a couple of hours, but unfortunately, there aren't many places for parents to sit, dine or drink while the kids play.

Awesome!!. This is a wonderful place to walk around and wonderful restaurants. We out every day and it was great just being able to walk from our apratment down onto the harbour at night. We had some wonderful meals and if you are lucky enough to get there before 7pm most of the restaurants have $30 meal deals for dinner. Great!

Touristy, but does have restaurants surrounding it. Nice harbour to walk or stroll with plenty of restaurants and tourist traps. I went to the Meat and Wine company to try to kangaroo steak and it was delicious and worth it. Other attractions are nearby, but I heard from my friend that the Aquarium was a waste of time and money as they weren't much to see.
Darling Harbour. Lots to do and see. Great walk around to the harbour bridge and opera house. Many people used this path for their daily run.

A tourist hub. Great spot if you like life, always busy, lots of restaurants and cafes, the Maritime Museum is here, plus the Aquarium, plus the Imax Cinema, plus, plus, plus!! Heaps of accommodation, it is a real hub of Sydney, you can get there by ferry from Circular Quay or walk down from Sydney City if you are fit.
Can spend Weeks there. What a spot...must be one of the niced places in Sydney. Lovely Restaurants and Bars, beautifull created on the Harbour with plenty to see and do.
A must do in Sydney. Spend a day wandering around Darling Harbour. Great restaurants and lots of interesting things to do.

A jewel in Sydney.. Not that many years ago (i.e. WW2), this was the "red light" district of Sydney. By 2002, the area began to change and kept on improving ever since. It is clean, the walk around the harbour is very pleasant. Now studded with great restaurants, surrounded by magnificent office buildings, a shopping area and a new childrens water park the place is as attractive to children as to casual visitors, from honeymooners to retired folks. Simply a place suitable for all tastes and ages.

Not as impressive as you expect it to be. Circular Quay is the better quay of the two, darling harbour is basically where you pick up a boat it is not very touristy, on the otherside there are great restaurants and a shopping centre!

Pleasant Sunday. For a really pleasant Sunday this has got to be the place. Walk around the Harbour stopping off for an ice cream on warm day or even stopping for a cool drink at one of the many places in Darling Harbour. And if the fancy takes you go shopping at any one of the shops that are here. A short walk over Piermont Bridge and you are back in the city, or catch a mono rail into the city.

Almost missed this. Maritime museum, aquarium, food, shopping and some of the best kids open playgrounds I've run across. Don't miss the Chinese friendship garden. It is a quiet oasis to sit a bit and sip some tea. The Paddy Markets are a short walk away.

All happening at the Harbour!. It's bright, vibrant and busy with bars and restaurants plus attractions, shops and boat rides. There is an IMAX cinema although we didn't visit. If you get the chance spend five minutes watching the fudge maker - mesmerising!

Don't miss it!. Darling harbour is the place to go, with numerous attractions, including the National Maritime Museum, Madame Tusauds and the Chinese Garden of Friendship. Numerous bars and restaurants overlooking the water.

So much to see and do. You'll need at least 3 or days here to fully explore and experience all that's on offer. Great to walk around and soak up the buzz. Climb or walk the bridge, visit the iMax or Aquarium. Have dinner at one of the numerous restaurants. Treat yourself to a hot hazelnut chocolate drink and brownie cheesecake at the Guerlain chocolate cafe and people watch. Bit expensive but absolutely delicious.
Go at night. Good in the end of the day and stay untl late. Good Restaurants and nice service . All tipes of food and prices
Lots to see and do. IMAX theater and Power House Museum and Naval Museum are all located near here. Tons of restaurants and we enjoyed good food and sitting outside watching the boats come and go.

Darling Harbour. The place was beautiful, very clean, there are lots to see,it is a lovely to visit.The mall - I did not like some shops, they looked cheap, nothing special, it is a pity as this is such a privileged site.

An area for tourists. Darling Harbour is a very touristy area, and is particularly busy on the weekends and school holidays from our experience. On one side you have Cockle Bay and it's attractions such as restaurants, Imax theatre, Madame Tussauds, Wildlife and the Aquarium. On the other is Harbourside Centre which is a mall with many restaurants outside. There was a good range of shops in the mall from clothes to souvenirs, however the souvenirs are very overpriced and can be picked up cheaper in the markets and Chinatown (one item was $30 at Harbourside, $10 at the market). There are lots of good eateries in the Harbourside Mall, from healthy, fresh and reasonably priced food court food, to restaurants. The mall doesn't open til 10am so it can be a bit boring, but Pancakes on the Rocks restaurant opens at 7am which can fill in some time. The food is reasonably priced but it is hard to find.
Spending frenzy. So many shops and entertainment. It kept the family happy for hours. I would really recommend this for anyone. An easy walk or mono rail ride from many public transport.

Nice place but a bit overdone.. There are many good things about Darling Harbour like the Maritime Museum and the scenery but it always gives the feeling that it is an expensive place to visit. If you look at the price of the beautiful looking restaurants you can see what I mean. This is a big open public place for people to come and enjoy and not pay through the nose for lunch.

Hustle and bustle of the wharf. Love this place especially walking the stretch from Darling Harbour to Cockle Bay Wharf. There's always something going on around here and it's my favorite haunt anytime of the day
Good place to visit. Good place to visit good shops great resturants it has the imax theater and also so much to do there

Great Atmosphere. This harbour has it all. Including the world's largest movie screen at IMAX. great gelato place and great atmosphere at night. There are countless things to do. One of the nicest places in Sydney.

Modern and pleasant, Darling Harbour has it's big pluses but not as good as the best. Plenty of good shopping and a great park for families, Darling Harbour strikes me as the sort of urban renewal project you see in a lot of Cities. There's a convention centre and so on, with modern monolithic architecture. The park is a huge asset and the place is user friendly. Simply that it is just like a lot of other urban renewal projects around the world, so if you want something uniquely Sydney, perhaps look further than here.

Good place to visit. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit and take in "the touristy vibe". There is lots to see and do in this vicinity. The buildings on the side away from the CBD contain many souvenir shops and cafes and restaurants of all types. Lots of Harbour Cruises leave from this vicinity. There is also a small train ride that can take you from one end to the other for a fee. There are many grassed areas to sit and relax and play equipment for the kids. Often there are buskers providing entertainment and sometimes even free concerts that you can relax and enjoy. You can probably find a schedule for these somewhere on the net. Most Saturday nights yo can also view free fireworks that are magnificent in this vicinity.

Plenty of eating places to choose from.. When you need a break from all the places to see at Darling Harbour (Madame Tussauds, IMAX Theatre, the different museums, etc), then there are plenty of places to choose from to eat from cafe style, high quality restaurants and fast food outlets. Recommend Blue Fish seafood restaurant which serves excellent food at reasonable prices.

World Class. Sydney is truly one of the world's most beautiful cities and Darling Harbour provides the essential dining and entertainment hub by the water. Absolutely spectacular at night. AW (Tony) Scott

Urgh, gross harbour. Don't get why people go here. food is over-priced and average, the harbour itself isn't that pretty (although maybe a quick stroll if you must, stopping in ChinaTown for yummy snacks. Actually the Chinese Gardens here are nice and worth a visit). If you're keen for a nice water view, try Circular Quay, or if you're up for a longer voyage, then Watson's Bay, or Manly.

Worth a visit. Spent an afternoon here just walking about. It was a Friday so not overcrowded.It rained for a time and there was little shelter unless you made it to certain areas such as restaurants etc.Caught the ferry from Circular Quay - one way $5.60.Plenty of food options - fast food and more expensive. I had already decided I was going to check out the Lindt Chocolate Cafe. About $21 for a piece of cake and an iced choc. Not cheap, but you don't do it every day - especially when u live in a remote area.Didn't go to the aquarium this time but it has been refurbished so may be worth a visit especially if you buy your tickets online and get them cheaper.

enjoying sydney. a very pleasant place to just walk around and enjoy the sights and shopping if you want. there are toilets here too.the only negative is the lack of public seating in the shopping area.

Lots to see and do. We walked around Darling Harbour for a few hours and were amazed by all the activity. Everywhere people were having a good time. Children were enjoying themselves and people were sitting around relaxing. Everywhere was very clean and the gardens were all immaculate.

Great place to spend a day relaxing. Plenty of open space to sit and relax while watching a live act.Has a great play ground area for Children, and quite often has a stage show on for free entainament, Great shops and Dining.

Only if you are sick of the Quay. Being so near to the Star Casino and Chinatown, you can already guess what I am going to say. Nonetheless, on a sunny day, it is a nice place to sit and people watch. The restaurants by Cockle Bay and Kings Wharf left little to be desired beyond the touristy price.Bring your own picnic bag and you'll have a better time.

Lovely view, lots to do. A great place to spend a day shopping and relaxing. Plenty of places to eat and lots to see. We had a delicious breakfast right on the Harbour and then went shopping in the mall, which is huge. There is accomodation on the Harbour and the Chinese Gardens are close by too. All in all a lovely place to visit.

What a spot!. With all the attractions, eateries and transport links Darling Harbour is a great place to spend time. Just sitting and observing people is a great past-time and this is a good place to do it. The restaurants we visited were reasonably priced considering their position and the fireworks on Saturday night were worth freezing for!

A fantastic place to walk or relax. There is always plenty to see and do at Darling Harbour. IMAX, restaurants a plenty both at Harbourside and the new Commonwealth Bank improvements to Darling Walk. Lots for the little ones to do or if you just want to sit by one of the many water features or sit around the wharf area of Darling Harbour you won't be disappointed.

you must go here, its where its all happening.. starbucks, hard rock cafe, beautiful water features, the market, live street entertainers, shopping centre, the imax theatre (biggest cinema screen in the world) cafes and resterants all along the harbour and just all together beautiful views. very lively but yet peaceful at the same time.
Best atmosphere in the CBD night & day. Food & drink deals - excellent food Firework displays at the weekendsDinner cruises set off from hereLove this place, a must!

We always stay here. Whenever we visit Sydney we always stay at one of the hotels at Darling Harbour. Such a lovely place visually with plenty to do and lovely walks around the harbour. Easy to get around and access to the city with lots of lovely restaurants.

A buzz. Tourist shops ...A sad fact of lifeAmazing selection of cafes on both sides of the waterAttractions to suit all family members... but my fave has to be the Maritme Museum.I just love taking it all in....Its a great place just to walk or to sit and watch the world go by, weather alone or with friends.

Great people watching and eating options. Darling harbour is a must see, and great place to grab a bite, and people watch. It's a convenient location to start a boat trip (whale watching, harbour tour etc..) and to walk down to China Town, cross bridge to Pyremont, Visit Exhibitions and Conference Centre, Maritime Museum and to explore the CBD. The restaurants can be good value if not a bit touristy.

We will be back. I met some friends here and we had coffee and chatted and then moved onto lunch and continued talking. Darling Harbour is a great place for meeting friends there are numerous easy landmarks to meet at, lots of choice for somewhere to eat, and lovely scenery to wander around and look at. I will be coming back with the kids as the number of free child friendly things to do was fantastic.

What a great place...!. I hadn't been to Darling Harbour for a few years & I was very impressed..... what a wonderful place just to observe harbour views, the city skyline just the general buzz of the whole area... it's wonderful.There are lots of varied restaurants & cafes, the Aquarium, Imax theatre, Powerhouse museum, the harbour Ferries, Convention Centre, there is a great childrens playarea which includes a very innovative water way for them to play in & divert the flow also there is Maritime museum.Also lots of great accommodation, hotels & apartments nearby.
well darling harbour wow. Darling harbour is a must for tourist and the locals ,shopping,entertainment,fod restaurants,boating,excibitionsImax ect and much more ,layground for the kids aquarium

lots of cool Restaurants , cafes etc.. When visiting Sydney its worth a trip to Darling Harbour there are lots of cool restaurants , cafes etc.. also the convention center, Imax theater, live entertainers & maritime museum to visit .

A tourist hub. Darling Harbour is mostly centered about eating out. There are some good restaurants around here, and the prices ranges are from cheap to expensive. You can also find an aquarium, Madame Tussauds and similar attractions. A bit further south, you can find chinatown and Paddys. Paddy's Markets is a must if you're looking for souvenirs, don't look anywhere else. They sell the same souvenirs at quarter price that other shops around Sydney. So keep your souvenir shopping until you get here, and you will find everything you want, from Kangaroo leather to Opera house miniatures.

Tourist Haven. With all of the hotels, restaurants, 2 ferry stops, museums, shopping and water views along the promenade, this area of the city is popular with tourists for a reason. Easily accesible, and welcoming both day and night. Definitely worth visit, and a great place to stay near during your visit.
A bit sad. Darling Harbour is slipping into a funk, relying on retail and food for its appeal. Unfortunately, there are not many shoppers so it is going down the discount shopping path.

A Fairly Touristy Area, But Still Quite Nice.. Darling harbour lacks when it comes to showing you the real Sydney where the locals hang out, but its still a great place to visit both during the day and night. The entire area from here to Chinatown has also been made very kid friendly.Festivals such as the dragon racing and world cup screening are done here and they really aren't occasions that you should miss.

Stacks to do, eat and drink and attractions. Plenty of eating options, from cheap and quick to expensive and exclusive. Plenty of bars. Also close to Chinatown and entertainment centre. Handy to Star Casino and it's many attractions.

Nice area to walk around and kid friendly place. Nice place to walk and eat if you want to. There is a nice free playground where my daughter and her friends (8-15 years) enjoyed. Kids need their own time and attractions and the beauty of the Harbor bridge and Opera house will not hold their interest much. But after exerting themselves in the playground they let loose their extra energy and become more relaxed when adults have their fill of Sydney.
Darling Harbour. Long time since I last visited there, again I found the place interesting but expensive both for dinning and the retail stores.
Lively Nightspot. Heaps of restaurants and bars to choose from, some offer very competitive combo deals, and the fireworks on a Saturday night are a real treat.

Darling Harbour. Visited Sydney at end of August, the weather was find and while the sun shine, the air was cold and refreshing. At Darling Harbour, we've visit Madame Tussauds, Harbourside Shopping centre and few more attractions within the area. My kids love the fire work by Harbourside Shopping centre, Maritime Museum which featuring its Submarine and war ship. While in Madame Tussauds we took pictures of the famous people in the world which includes US President Barrack Obama, Australia PM Julia Gillard and famous celebrities i.e Kylie M, Michael J and Angelina Jolie. The night ferry ride from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay was very interesting with nice view of Luna Park and Sydney Opera House. I think the place should be in a must do list on any trip plan.
Great Tourist area.. Very busy with tourists. Really nice on a sunny day. Also ferries available to get around Sydney. lots of places to get a bite to eat.

Avoid, ugly bland tourist trap area. This is not Sydney. A tired tourist trap area, with a dated harbourside tourist mall, cheap tatty looking buildings, ugly grey military boats, boring hotel facades, rubbish floating in shallow water's edge. Not a lot to offer by day or night, unless you like drinking with 'suits' on friday nights around King St wharf side. Lacking character, there is no real life here. Best thing to do is: get a local government ferry from here to Circular Quay. The ferries are the wonderful. Or if you have the misfortune to be stuck in Darling Harbour then the childrens playground area, spiral water feature or Chinatown nearby are recommended. There are many, better areas of Sydney around the harbour than Darling Harbour, don't get caught wasting time here.

Great area for the kids. This is just next to central Sydney, and has various places, such as the Aquarium, the Wildlife World, and the Maritime Museum that are great for keeping the kids entertained (and the parents). The IMAX theatre is also great to see a film in (we saw Dark Knight Rises there and my son was convinced the film was much better seen on an eight-storey high screen).
Darling harbour. Good excursion, good choice of restaurants , the harbour mall was disappointing, mediocre quality/ choiceEnjoyable walk in the Chinese gardens
Another great Landmark of Sydney.. Always a great day out. Walking around the Harbour,just watching the boats and people is what a visit is all about. Many Hotels close by and great cafes.
