Nice Place to Hang Out. Many activities we can do here : Aquarium, museum, monorail, Imax theatre, near casino. Good place to eat & Shopping. Crowded of peoples.
Great way to spend the day.. We visited Madame Tusaauds and the Maritime Museum. Both fantastic. Plenty of places to eat. We will be going back to explore some more.

Terrific playground. Just wanted to let people know that the playground at Darling Harbour is brilliant. It's got loads of fun stuff for kids of all ages. Cool climbing frames, flying fox, a big slide and fun water play to name a few features. It's also well positioned between the Powerhouse Museum and the aquarium. Definitely worth a visit.

Could be better. I'm a Sydneysider currently living in Singapore. Darling Harbour could be so much more. Singapore has a light and water show every night, twice a night that the tourists and locals flock to. This would be so easy to do in Darling Harbour and become a real drawcard. There are things to do there - the Aquarium, the Wildlife Park, IMAX, the Maritime Museum and lots of restaurants but it kind of misses the mark. To me, it's an expensive tourist trap.

NO WONDER IT'S CALLED DARLING. Darling Harbour is the place to be anytime of the day or night. It doesn't matter when you come it is still beautiful, anywhere in Darling Harbour. In Darling Harbour everyone is very nice and sweet. The restaurants and cafes are petite and everything else is wonderful. If you come to Sydney come to Darling Harbour!

Very touristy. I'm not fond of Darling Harbour as it's now a tourist trap. The restaurants are mediocre, most of them with bad service and nothing out of the ordinary food wise. The exception is a steakhouse called Meat&WineCo which is worthwhile and has nice views from some of the tables.
Strolling thru Darling Harbour. great cafe's and restaurants and we enjoyed a stroll along the foreshores with the tourists appreciating what a beautiful city we live in.
I would not recommend. It's too touristy, not much to see. The fast food is poor, the restaurants are very average. Sydney has many much better attractions, don't wastenyour time there.

Great way to get photos. Darling Harbour is a well organised, cost effective way of seeing Sydney from the water. The ferries run on time and are easy to use. We used it to visit Taronga Zoo and were planning to visit Manly as well. The ferries themselves are well maintained and pleasant enough to ride on.

The place we tell tourists to go but we don't go ourselves. It's very pretty at night, and of course on a sunny day it's lovely, but on the Pyrmont side we find it very ordinary in terms of food and shopping. On the opposite side - Cockle Bay - it has a few more decent restaurants, but nothing spectacular either. More good restaurants on the King St Wharf end but that's getting away from Darling harbour.Still its pretty for a walk at night, and at least there's Lindt chocolate cafe to keep me on a chocolate high!

Great spot to eat and people watch..... Love the bustling atmosphere! You can eat cheaply if you choose, plenty of reasonably priced restaurants to take the family to. Pontoon, does $10 meals all day, great if you have a few people to pay for. My favourite cafe is the Llindt Chocolate Cafe at Cockle Bay Wharf, they do the best ice creams in Sydney, try the Excellence (70% chocolate) or the Black Forest, my favourite. They are a bit expensive, but well worth the price.

Exciting in the Daytime, beautiful at Night. A great place to stroll around, lots of restaurants, shops and live entertainment by talented buskers. The shops stay open until 9pm every night. You can walk to The Star casino from here also. You will definitely enjoy the atmosphere at night. It is to place to be and be seen, but great for a casual walk as well.
Walk. We liked the all day pass for the monorail.We liked the close proximity to the shops.We liked all the darling harbour attractions.

Fun for all. This is agreat spot to take kids, lots of water features to run around and a fantastic playground. Also a lovely spot to just take a romantic stroll, maybe grab some fish and chips and sit on the waterfront- but watch out for the seagulls they are exceptionally bold! will grab the chip right out of your hand!!! Exciting luch date that's for sure.

Beautiful <3. I used to live 5 min to Darling Harbour. Its a nice place where u can have a nice meal, coffee, beer, go shopping or just walk around. It has a BEUTIFUL view of Sydney cbd at night. I love see the fireworks on the weekends. Also I like to see the street performer that are so cool. Its a good place for families or go with ur mates or even by yourself. You can seat close to the water and its soo relaxing.... <3

Absolutely amazing. If youre going to visit Darling Harbour, you might as well go on Australia Day! I have been to Darling many many times. I love the place, the atmosphere, the people, the restaurants, the lovely shops - especially that English Sweet shop, the harbourside bars and everyone is so happy and friendly. The last time I was there we walked from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour. The are little pieces of history as you make your way round, and for those of you fleet of foot, and with the time available to make the one hour's walk. I highly reccommend it! Absolutely amazing

Great for a stroll a meal and taking in the city lights. Does not have the Sydney feeling for me as Circular Quay does, but probably better for a meal or a drink. I enjoy eating on the Pyrmont side, you get lovely views of the city lights across Darling Harbour in the evenings. Plenty of eating choices. If you go earlier in the evening quite a few of the restaurants have early bird specials. Can feel a little empty at times, but if you are there when an event is on the place can be packed. The park towards China Town is a good spot for a sit in the sun and a break from the city crowds. Lots of families their on weekend afternoons.
Great place to hang out. Loads of paid attractions to walk in between. Nice place to have lunch and people watch. The kids playground is awesome.
Always buzzing. Even in winter cool lots of people out and about. Night time was great too, especially dining and people watching from restaraunt.

Great Shopping!. Well, darling harbour is indeed a darling when it comes to shopping, I loved it! I got off the ferries and took a stroll along the water walk-ways towards the i-max theatre, spectacular palms grove (a mini kids haven) towards the shops, bought a few things and had the most amazing coffee here overlooking the harbour!

Visit once again the Darling Harbour. I might say, when you visit Sydney. It's a must to visit & stroll along the Darling Harbour (DH). I do enjoyed strolling around the DH then to Circular Quay, see the Sydney Opera House. It's one of the most photographed place in the world & most iconic building in this country. If you want to visit the other city called Manly, just hop on the boat. There is a train station closeby and as well as there's a bus. The downside it can be crowded but it is ok. Find your way around. I have been to this place a few times. There is a Chinese Garden, shopping center, aquarium, monorail, flight center, etc. Every time I come to Sydney, I always visit the Darling Harbor.

Love this place..........I spent almost 70% of my weekends here during my first visit. I don't know but I love this place. You can spend your entire day here. There is alawys some thing happening in Darling Harbour. Some performances or dance or Music. The Fire works are aewsome.You should definitely go to the Musem over ther and THE STAR. The casino there is awesome. You shouldn't go always but once you should go.You can also sit near the Shore and enjoy the beauty of the city in night.Sydney glitters in night.You will find all sort of people in Darling harbour so u will really enjoy.Awesome place. I love it.
A Great Place to do some shopping. Get the Darling Harbour Ferry over from Circular Quay stop at Sydney Aquarium and Sydney Wildlife world, or walk across the bridge over to the darling harbour shops

Social Hub. Darling Harbour has the convention centre so there is always something on. There are a lot of cafes around and it's easy to catch a ferry to circular quay then across to Taronga Zoo if you wish to. You can easily walk here from Central train station and there are a lot of specialty shops around. We stay in Darling Harbour when coming to Sydney since it is so beautiful and the monorail is great. It's a great place for families as well as young people who want to do the nightclubs.
Love it. The habour is such a wonderful place to walk around so much to see and just sitting around the water front or having a meal in one of the resturants or just site seeing.

Many things to do and see. Great atmosphere, many tourists...madame Tussauds, hardrock café, aquarium. Get there by ferry or monorail. A day pass for transport might be cheapest solution, still approx. 22 dollar.
Great place for dinner. There are lots of eating places there. There was supposed to be fireworks every Sat in Aug, though I missed that....
Nice. Beautiful place, nice restaurants and shops. Near to the aquarium, world life museum, maritime museum (free)

Great great great..... It's the best place to be. For romance walk, superb food, spectacular food, enjoying street performances, the mono rail, all in all, a great hang out place. The monorail stops at Darling Harbour. You can get down here and enjoy the night life as well.

The Sydney Boat Show. The boat show both inside the hall and outside on the water is the best boat show ever.
It helps that the weather was a perfect winters day.
weekend stay. The best harbour in Australia. great range of restaurants and a wide variety of shops and busking entertainment

THE INDOOR WILDLIFE ZOO WAS GREAT.. We went to the Wildlife Zoo there and got to learn about Australia wildlife while we filled in time before our flight out of Sydney. Then for a pizza at the pizza place not far from it (sorry can't remember the name - but if you come out of the Wildlife Zoo and turn to your right, there are a load of restaurants - and the italian/pizza one is there. Nice people at both places - and great service. Only wish we had more time to see more of Sydney.
Excellent. So much to do, good atmosphere, restaurants and activities. I loved the Wax Museum, Aquarium and Wildlife park and shopping and the waterfront. Awesome
Great atmosphere and place to eat. Great atmosphere and place to eat, plenty of choice to eat and fireworks on Saturday are a nice touch
What a fantastic place. Visited for the International Boat Show - packed out but still plenty of places to eat for a family.

Try to get a table on the verandah. Extremely pleasant even in winter.. Absolutely loved Darling Harbour. It has so a great variety of dining and the views accross the Harbour at night are every so dreamy. Jafaar Indian Fine Dining is a must. The best service and food every.

Always plenty of action here. Eating. Sightseeing. Passing through. Conference. Event. Day out. Night out.
There's so many reasons why you might be in Darling Harbour.
My favourite reason - watching the world go by.
Entertainment Capital of Sydney. Every type of food you could imagine. Entertainment in abundance - gorgeous location. Madame Tussauds, Sydney Aqarium and Sydney Zoo - Fantastic
Wonderful. Can spend a whole day or more just wandering around the shops and the harbour and the Aquarium and the Imax theatre and taking in the view.

Very good at night time. Darling Harbour seems to have a different visitors to The Rocks. The latter frequented by tourists and the former by the locals. There are lots of ethnic restaurants as well as a few shops selling souvenirs. Very good atmosphere with crowds if there is a fireworks display.
Sunday evening restaurants. CockleBay sid restaurants have a sameness about them. Need more variety. Considering the location, I thinkthey could improve their service

Cockle Bay. This is a congregation of attractions including taverns, restaurants and the aquarium. I attend as I like the atmosphere and the restaurants. The food served is not spectacular but the tourist event overcomes this short coming.

Darling Harbour is Darling!. I was there on a weekend. We road the ferry from Circular Quay and I would recommend it to anyone. There are a lot of restaurants, and things to do. If you are looking for movies, wax museum, maritime museum, wildlife, aquarium, shopping, chinese gardens, or just overall fun I would recommend taking a walk around Darling! The street performers (on the weekends at least) drew a crowd and were great performers and everyone had fun.

Lots to see here and to eat and drink. I visited on Saturday and it was really busy. There's free entertainment from dancers, magicians and singers. There's lots of places to eat and drink and some great views.

Overpriced. Apparently this area is relatively new and I guess better than what it used to be. It was very pretty and nice to sit out by the water at night. That being said, there is not that much else happening in this area. Lots of restaurants and some shops but we found everything to be overpriced and not that great.

A lovely walk.. We had a nice walk around Darling Harbour on our first night in Sydney.It was chilly, but still lots of people wandering around, as we were.The boats, all lined up for the upcoming Boat Show looked majestic in the Harbour.We looked at a number of menus as we walked and finally decided on one that didn't seem quite so expensive. It was a very basic, underwhelming meal, with the usual high priced Australian wine.We won't be back to eat at Darling Harbour, as it is too expensive.

Over priced touristica. This is where you go when you want to be among other tourists and have your wallet sipphoned in many different ways. Rest assured, you will not learn what Sydney is about over there.n
The place to stay. I think it is so good even at New Year. Some great food. Convention Centre. Things to see and do. The Monorail, get to places quickly.

Darling Harbour. We spent a very relaxing day on a beautiful boat with family, stopped at the fish markets and bought prawns, lobster, oysters etc then berthed at Darling Harbour to eat our lunch on the boat, what an experience....fantastic

IMAX. Nice place to go and watch a 3D movie in IMAX, the have dinne kf
R lunch in ourof the restaurants. There's an assorment of restaurant and it is a really nice place for everyone.

Tourist-centric harbour. This is a lovely harbour-side shopping and eating area, but since it tends to be more "touristy", it also feels a tad boring and contrived, and perhaps a bit over-priced. The better options for food are along the eastern side of the harbour near King Street (near the ferry terminal). You'll aslo find an aquarium, an iMax, yet another shopping mall, and a casino in this area. The best thing to do is take a stroll to take in the sights and people watch, maybe a beer at one of the outdoor bars, but head elsewhere for a full meal.

Lots of food and shopping here.. A favorite hotel (Novotel) is located here. Lots of food and shopping available. An easy walk across the bridge to visit either side of the harbour. A great place to stroll on a sunny Sydney afternoon.

Plenty of buzz on a Friday night. When the weather is mild in Sydney plenty of visitors enjoy the sights from Darling Harbour. Starbucks is back and in a set of revamped eateries. The water fountain is worth a look
great place to stay. Darling Harbour is a wonderful place to visit. Great hotels, eateries (both casual and more formal) and good shopping. So much to do and see here. Well worth a visit.
Great weekend. Loved the cafe's along the boardwalk, and the bars. Loved the way the gardens in the centre made you feel like you were no where near a big city.

great place. great place to hang out with friends.. however if your in sydney only for a few days you can skip this place.. once you are there.. you must watch a movie in the imax theater.. its super cool.. great food in the food court. you can catch a ferry to the opera house as well. China town is very close to Darling harbour.. so if you want some cheap souvenirs then just walk to paddys market which is about 10-15 min walk..

A little touristy. We felt the Darling Harbour area to be a bit more mainstream tourist destination. However, we would recommend visiting the Maritime Museum. Get the big ticket so you can see the Endeavour!

Entertainment Central. A great part of Sydney you must visit. Take in a restaurant or show and enjoy the water views of this wonderful Harbour. Every Saturday night, fireworks are standard at around 8.30pm. Plenty of bars and eateries - you just can't go wrong.

very picturesque, plus good dining variety. Take the ferry to Darling harbor for a scenic ride, then do a long walk around all the waterside dining/patio places. Even if you don't have dinner there, it's still very scenic for touring.

A fun place to hang out. Always fun: street performers, museums, the view of the harbor and the atmosphere. We lived in a hotel across the harbor and walked by it almost every day. Ask your hotel about the firework schedule at Darling harbour. I think it varies according to the seasons. It is very festive!
So much to do. Kids playing in the water park, having a win in one of the bars, child being part of a street performance, riding on the train it is a fantastic place.
Darling Harbour. Don't miss Capt Cook's relica ship in the harbour, and the aquarium / zoo. Easy to reach by ferry.
Just loved it!!. A lively energetic place and full of marvellous eating places from fast food to lovely restaurants
Tired and boring. Not sure why you'd bother unless you're attending a conference as we were...overpriced restaurants, average views, and not a lot else.
Always so beautiful. Stayed at the Four Points Shertaton Hotel on Darling Harbour and the view as always is so beautiful! A must-see for every visition to Sydney!
My favourite place in Sydney. It is bustling, lively, touristy, vibrant, and has great views. The weekend fireworks are a must-see also.

Another great sauntering area. Although we've been to Sydney a number of times, this is the first time we have visited Darling Harbour. Took the train there, had a good walk around, there was some live entertainment by young people & lots of places to eat. Was very enjoyable to walk around & take in the sights. No dislikes.

a bit of a man-made feel. i didnt dislike darling harbour...but i won't rave about it either. if you are only here for a short time (2 days) there are other places nicer tio visit. here for 3+ days then i'd stick it on the list. we did however find the maritime museum a worthwhile visit. avoid the futuristic shuttle system. bit of a waste of money and just as easy to walk across the harbour via the footbridge
Great place at all times. We came to this place many times, at morning, noon and night...all are giving different types of experience and memories
Fun. We walked from our hotel to Darling Harbour to explore the restaurants and attractions. We had a great pizza at Docks and a cocktail at the Hard Rock Cafe.
Has alot of things to do. The harbour has wildlife, aquarium, madame tussauds, Maritime museum, and the monorail to Paddy's Market. I think the monorail is a bit expensive

The Wax Museum. If you always wanted to get up close @personal with an Aussie music,sport,tv or celebrity you have to see it to believe it.The wax figures are so amazingly life like you almost expect them to talk to you.Visitors are encouraged to touch interact or take photos of them.Truly astounding make sure you have plenty of time when you go there.

Museums Shopping Gardens Theatre It has it all. From the best restrauants in Sydney to the IMAX Theatre, Japanese Gardens, Shopping and much more. Take a ride on the monorail or the light rail to the Star Casino.
Upcoming area. Nice area of developement with plenty of attractions. However it is expensive
Satrated with restaurants. Commercial as they come, saturated with restaurants and a couple bars. Beautiful at night and have some good events on but if you don't like people and tourists avoid.
World class for a reason. World class beautiful, and just keeps getting better if you see it from a lunch cruise and are under a couple of glasses of wine.

Varied Treats to Eat. So much to choose from - fast food to expensive. Had a few lunches at varied places on the waterfront. All touted lunchtime specials. Make sure you go inside the building and buy some fresh fudge for dessert. Bon Appetit.
Love Darling Harbour. I love just sitting and people watching. There are lot of great place to eat and there is always something to see
Stunning!. Amazing place to walk along and enjoy a great food in the different restaurants or a treat at Lindt Chocolatier.
Nice. If you havent been, go. Good play area for kids. Lots for the kids to do as walking around Darling Harbour. Water fountains, buskers, food, activities.

Safe, vibrant and entertaining.. street theatre, food and coffee to suit every budget, places for the kids to release some energy, boats, ferryies, the aquarium and marine museume all in the one place. You just 'gotta' visit the Darling Harbour Precinct

Many Attractions. Great place for the kids to visit, nice restaurants.
Went to Sysndey Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife and Madame Tuasadds

Winter Night Concert Season. What a surprose find. Every Saturday in the Australian Winter (July/ August) there is a harbour concert. The audience line up along the sides of the harbour and on the road bridge that passes above. What a treat! However I recommend you book a place to eat before you go as everyone streams off the quay as the concert finishes and every restaurant in walking distance is overwhelmed by the influx of diners.There are a variety of decent shops just off the harbour and usually there sis a great choice of places to eat morning, noon and night
Sydney. darling harbour is beautiful, full of life and entertainment and also you feel very safe.

Darling harbour: the diamond in the rough. On the last day of our weekend away, my partner and I went to Darling Harbour. It could not have been a nicer day. After our experience in the hustle and bustle of the extremely busy parts of Sydney it was so nice to have a stress-free day walking around the harbour admiring the views and the interesting water attractions. Darling harbour also has a fantastic playground and water park for the kids, do not miss this place on your next trip to Sydney.
MUST SEE. Make sure to visit the Quarium, The Wild Life Park and Madam Tussards.....buy your tickets on line for a discount and you miss out on the lines.

Great resturants & activiteis for the kids. Overall we loved the darling harbour area, the food and the areas for the kids (young & old) to be kept interested was great nd we had a couple of good days of weather so the water play area was a hit.

So much to do. We were there in February and again in April. It is easily accessible by the tram and monorail but we walked over from the free CBD shuttle bus. There are many restaurants and souvenir shops, but there are other attractions, including the Marine Museum and the Aquarium. We walked around the harbour area just to see. It was clean and well marked.
Nice to visit. Part of the cultural tour. Good to see but can be expensive for eating and can get very busy.

Great fireworks. Enjoyed our Saturday night visit. Busy but not overwhelmingly. Food quite expensive but most restaurants were packed. Great fireworks display every Saturday at 8.30pm. Only went in the evening so didnt visit the aquarium etc. Worth the visit!
I was surprised by it. The size of this place and how great it looked. Great eating and a place to enjoy family and friends .I need to see it in Summer I think it would be even more amzing

A lovely place to visit. This is a beautiful area to visit . You can wander around the harbour and visit some of the wonderful bars & restaurants . There is a wildlife centre there too where you can see a selection of Australian animals in very close quarters which is lovely .

Don't miss it!. it packed with hustle and bustle and happy people enjoying the sites. DO VISIT THE MARITIME MUSEUM (takes about three hours, but really worth it! Go on and inside the exact replica of Captains Cook's voyage to Australia
A feast to the eyes..... Been there a lot of times.... and there are lots of activities to do... Enjoyed every bit of time
Restaurants!. Restaurants everywhere! we had a great time walking around Darling Harbour, shops and restaurants, we were looking at the ferry but ran out of time, next time!

Even as a tourist trap, its a very cool place. Always so much going on at Darling Harbour. I would just say with many of these tourist areas be sure to look at T A for reviews on restaurants and bars as you can find a gem, but could also end up being served some overpriced tourist meal if you dont go prepared.

Great family area. This is a great place to visit day or night . There is some kind of activity always going on. Visit their website for updates.There is a great children's play area and lots of water features that the children can actually dip there toes into.There is plenty of places to eat [ all budgets] and enjoy the harbour view. There is also lots of paid attractions surrounding the area.
Must see for all the restaurants.. Beautiful harbor to walk, especially around 8:00 PM when theyhave fireworks. Restaurants a little pricey for what you get.

A Must. Went to the New Madam Tousards Wax Museum totally Fantastic. They are 4 great attractions, Madam T, Aquarium, Wildlife Centre and cannot remember the other they are $35 AU each or all 4 for $70 definetly check them all out.
fun in the sun. it's a great spot to hangout in the sun and watch all the busker!
Shops galour. It is very pretty and plenty of eateries but I prefer bargain shopping.

Tourist Attractions Abound in Darling Harbour. Sydney Aquarium is excellent: nothing like gazing up at the rare and bizarre saw-tooth shark while he glides overhead, along with sharks, manta rays, and giant turtles. A few blocks away is the superb and immense Powerhouse Museum, full of fascinating displays covering science, popular culture, and stellar art exhibits.

FAMILY FUN even on a tight budget!. Darling Harbour is great fun for the whold family even if on a budget with plenty to see or do for FREE!! Our kids enjoyed the free entertainment and the playground was a huge hit while we relaxed and watched them enjoying themselves. Saturday night 8.30pm fireworks were great for young and old and easy to see from various locations. The toilets were clean and we didn't find any line ups on either Saturday or Sunday.Lots of food outlets from the usual McDonalds, KFC etc through to really nice restaurants, something for everyone for every occasion. HINT - if visiting the city on a Sunday buy the $2.50p.p ticket for unlimited rail, bus and ferry trips, great value.
It has everything. We didnt allow enough time to see the whole area - so must return!Clean and not lacking any facilities.Next time we will stay til evening and take in the areas light displays.

Try the chinese gardens!. You can get all dressed up in Chinese gear and have photos taken, it was so much fun we laughed so much!Darling Harbour has lovely restaurants too, and is very scenic at night
Beautiful. So much to do for every age. The vibe is great and very lively.

lovely place. the sydney aquarium and wildlife sydney are here....both are amazing my children loved both the places... also there are lots of restaurants but oyr favourite was 'Eat Pizza Love".....excellent pizzas

Darling Harbour is definitely a Darling!!. Darling Harbour is a very relaxing and enjoyable place.
With lots of entertainment and restaurants to enjoy or even as simple as you just want to have a quiet walk!
darling harbour. only managed to visit at night, plenty of joggers to look out for.
Darling Harbour. Very family friendly during the day with great activities available for the kids. Adult friendly playground by night, good food and entertainment aplenty.

Exciting Darling Harbour. What a joy it is to go to Darling Harbour,just to take in the atmosphere, the lights and the great Restaurants and shopping complex of Harbourside. We went by a short taxi ride, but you can also get there via Ferry. A fun thing to do.
Party place. This looks like the party place in Sydney, interesting with many places to eat and have fun, Some great shops and a great park for the children to play. Worth a visit!
Good Tourist Attraction. A great tourist attraction, very pretty, good food and wonderful for kids to play.
Lots going on. We were there during June and they had Fireworks every Sat night so that was great.

Stunning. Sydney Harbour is magnificent and the planners have done a great job of making the most of the natural attractions. Darling Harbour is a vibrant and trendy spot, with walkways along the waters edge and all sorts of restaurants and shops nearby. The Pyrmont Bridge passes over the harbour and provides some great views. A muse-see in Sydney, especially after dark when the lights are magnificent.

Brilliant View. A perfect place for a couple to be...you just love the way its been lightened...the way the water sparks in the light of the city people walking around the fountains enjoying the cool breeze around the harbour...the feeling is just out of this world man!

Miss it already. Free playground for kids, lots of Great resto n shopping, beautiful scenery... Just perfect to walk around, spend time enjoy life... Very clean. Miss it already... Wish to comeback soon.

Sydneys popular destination. With many great restaurants that allow you to eat from the best to the most affordable. other attractions like the maritime museum, the sydney aquarium and a great walk around the cove to the harbour bridge and opera house
Enjoyable Day. Going all around Downtown Sydney this is one place that is not to be missed!
Favourite Place in Australia!. Darling Harbour is one of the best places to visit. The food, attractions and general ambiance are the best in Australia!
amazing. the weather was great so i spent 3h walking at the Darling harbour! Amazing place and there are may options as well: coffee places, restaurants

Great atmosphere of an evening. Darling Harbour was very close to our hotel and was a lovely walk. Lots going on with restaurants, bars and IMAX cinema. A little expensive to eat as it is so popular but we had some amazing steaks.

Lots of excellent eateries!. I appreciate this area more for its eateries than its shopping. I find the shopping very touristy which is understandable as it is marketed as a tourist attraction.The eateries in this area are varied and in a beautiful location around the waters edge. We had lunch in one and it was excellect, their was 4 of us varied ages.I seem to prefer this area to the Rocks as their seem more eating choices and loads of attractions.We viisited the Aquarium this time and was very happy with the experience.
madame tussauds. not great,too many people,not really value for money
Very nice location. We stayed here at Four Points by Sheraton Hotel and is very well positioned. A decent sized shopping mall opposite the hotel with plenty of shops and restaurants.
Love the atmosphere here. I love to wander around Darling Harbour. Its also great just to sit down after a day of walking with a coffee and watch the world go by
Great place to visit. We enjoyed our visits to Darling Harbour, good restaurants, nightlife, and lots attractions for the whole family.

Crinnits. Really a great location, extensive Italian menu watched the wonderful fireworks display on Saturday night. The outside heaters are great and they also provided blankets. Glad we had booked in advance. Even we the booking we still had to joina queue for about 10 mins but very enjoyable nice atmosphere has a buzz about it.

Choices. Loved the activities, variety of eateries
The energy, The colour, The Water
Loved It

Something you must see while in Sydney but not that much there. Darling Harbour is very Sydney. Located right on the water, the area is very picturesque. Lots of restaurants, bars, and cafes. The aquarium is also located down here and a few other bits and bobs. The monorail stops here and can be worthwhile catching if you are a visitor to Sydney (stops at places like Paddy's Markets) and gives a good view of the city. You can also catch some ferries from Darling Harbour but only selected lines. I like to come to Darling Harbour for a walk around (over the bridge and along the wharfs) if I am down that end of the city. However, overall as a destination I don't find there to be that much to see and do (unless you want to visit the aquarium or animal park). There are better bars and restaurants elsewhere in the city, but nonetheless you should visit Darling Harbour if in the area.
Great place to spend a day. Fantastic place to lose yourself in dining, drinking and shopping..Love it and we always stay at Darling Harbour every trip to Sydney...So much to do and see

DARLING HARBOUR FOR THE BRIDGE AND THE RESTAURANTS. We have found Darling Harbour very well done with easy access by ferry, by bus or by monorail. Restaurants serve very good quality of food but take care of your wallet... it could cost a lot of bucks!!! Bridge views are spectacular. Monorail ride from Darling Harbour is not vey expensive (5AUS$) for the full ride and is interesting but not very exciting except crossing the bridge.This is also the place you find the Aquarium which is impressive, espacially for white sharks and the great barrier of coral room.
Perfect place. Hundreds of restaurants, cinemas, shopping centres, Maritime museum, aquarium, wax museum... Simply you can spend whole day here

My office view. Darling Harbour, always different activities happening - I especially like the boat show. The views are lovely and the selection of bars and restaurants is excellent. The Australian Maritime Museum is also worth a trip, but give yourself a full day for a visit to the museum.
Obviously a "must see" in Sydney. I loved the submarine, the aquarium and just walking around by the water gaining different views of the fabulous Harbour Bridge.

Excellent place for everyone~bonus with Sat 8.30pm fireworks. Great view of the city, lively waterfront and heaps of hot nightspots, plus super location just 10-15 min walk from Townhall. Sometime can be too packed.

go in the late afternoon. Do catch the mini train service if u have kids.At $3.50 each and it will bring u around the entire harbour area and let u decide where to dine. My kids enjoyed it very much.I like it the the very special atmosphere to be when the sun is setting.

A bit of fun close to the city. The King St Wharf end is the newest part of Darling Harbour- great restaurants, some are very expensive, but all with gorgeous views. The older part of Darling Harbour which I think is about to be renovated is tired. A nice reprieve from the hustle of the CBD.
Too touristy. Most of Darling Harbor is now shopping or eating or drinking. The shopping is standard "mall" type. Was hoping for something a little more native.

Quite a lot to see here. Although there are numerous restaurants and other attractions such as the Aquarium and Shipping museum my famly find the precinct a bit tacky and tired. We understand that there is going to be a much overdue major reneal of this area in the next year or so - long overdue

Lots to do.. Plenty to see and do in Darling Harbour. There was a Jazz and Blues Festival on at the time of my visit. Other Highlights were the Aquarium, and nearby Powerhouse Museum. There's also plenty in the way of shopping, restaurants, and bars.
Enjoy the food and the view. Good place to eat and hang around. Enjoy the sea breeze while sipping your coffee while chatting with friends.
Vibrant!. the most vibrant part of the city at night, the whole harbour is lited up. catch the fireworks at 8.30pm every saturday. wonderful experience
Lots To See. Been here a couple if times now. Love walking round the harbour. So many choices of bars and restaurants.
Beautiful. This place is amazing at night and central. If your staying at a nearby hotel you can get easy access to a number of dinning options whilst taking in the beautiful view.

Dive Dive Dive. A great cool place to go and hang out, bars and reserants all around. and the odd submarine and battle ship to take a look at.
Its easy to get to in the city and i wish id had more time there.
My favorite. It just felt good! Sorry dont know how to describe it better. Good food, the fireworks on Saturday night, just vibrant

Fun area with much entertainment. This is a really cool part of Sydney. There are many, many bars, pubs and restaurants, some with really wonderful food, others with fantastic views. The restaurants are always full of people, specially at dinner. Highly recommend this area. It is easy to get to and once you're there go grab a beer and then go to dinner at one of the many nice restaurants.

A thriving water front area. Lots of pavement cafes and restaurants with views of the inland harbour, accessible on foot or by ferry (both large and small). If you are in this area make sure you take in the Chinese Garden of Friendship, a typical chinese city garden in all its tranquility.

Great place to visit a night. Historic boats, the aquarium and places galor to eat this place just bizzes at night. You can walk around and people watch and then take a boat back to circular quay, for even more food!!
great spot. lots of things to see and do .Plenty of food outlets you can go cheap or posh,

Everyone should see Darling Harbour. Easy to get to, you can take the monorail or go by ferry, which will land you at the National Maritime Museum. There is so much to see there, lovely shops, great eating places, we really enjoyed it.

Lots of choice for restaurants. Always lots to see on the weekends. There are so many activities going on around here on the weekends. Its a great family place, but also good for romantics! There are all sorts of restaurants, ranging from a dining hall to the upmarket/silver service restaurants. There's something for everyone.
Stroll along. Good to take a stroll. Lots of restaurants and attractions (Aquarium, Sydney Wildlife, etc.)
Activities!. Too much choice! Plenty of cafes, restaurants and attractions. Could easily spend a few days here alone!

Something to warm the cockles of your heart.. Either walk here from the CBD or catch the monorail. Admire all the restaurants and cafes around Cockle Bay, stop and have a coffee whilst watching the world go by and allow time to visit the Imax theatre and/or the tranquility ot the Japanese Gardens. Don't go if you are short of time.You may want to consider the Maritime Museum or the Sydney Aquarium as well.
Take a ferry and see all places from the water. It is by far the cheapest way to take all of it in, will definately take a trip there again next time!
Lots to do. I had a chance to visit both the Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife World exhibits. Lots to see especially one of largest crocs in Australia. This is definitely a touristy area.
Excellent Food and fireworks display. Wonderful places to dine and great fireworks display on Sat night!
Madame Tussauds Wax Works. Extremely life like & very interesting. Able to take your own photos with the figures.
A beautifull place to visit.. A walk around and about, the buskers of a weekend, buy some fish and chips and go sit in the sun, just a lovely place to visit.

Great Spot!. I enjoyed walking around Darling Harbour at night. It has a wide variety of great dining options to choose from, scenic views, lots of activity going on, and even fireworks on the Saturday night I was there (not sure if that's a regular occurrence or not!) The Harbour has a great vibe and I found it a very cool place to hang out, walk around and people watch.
Nice walk. Pleasant walk around the harbour.. Lots of restaurants, with outside seating.

So much to do. We stayed near Darling Harbour and spent a fews in and around the area. There are so many fantastic restaurants for breakfast, lunch, dinner and afterwards. Fireworks on Saturday night are well worth planning in the itinerary. The newly built kids park at the end of the harbour is brilliant and we spent a few hours there - some really inventive kids activities. and all free!

Relax, wine and dine! Enjoy the best of Sydney!. Darling Harbour, once the ugly duckling of Sydney, is now sparkling! Over the past 10 years the area has developed into an iconic area, which includes shopping, festivities, tourist attractions plus scenery. Starting from the Northern end of Cockle Bay walk down the boardwalk and see the many glorious restaurants which over look Darling Harbour. Stop in the centre for a couple of hours and experience two hot attractions, Sydney Wildlife World and Sydney Aquarium. You can even meet two of only five captive Dugongs at the Aquarium! Continue on down south and venture past more restaurants, before stopping at the IMAX theatre. The walk then splits and goes westerly where you can venture to further restaurants (including Hard Rock Cafe) or Harbourside Shopping Centre and the Maritime Museum. Otherwise conitune venturing south past and you can visit the Entertainment Centre or Chinese Gardens. This is a great day out, and one could spend at least two days exploring! Only the person who ventures can be the judge of that.

buzzing with people and music. Everything was within walking distance. Shops, people and the music all contribute to the atmotphere. The smell of seafood (it is nexxt to the sea) makes you hungry. Easy to catch taxis back to the hotel even though it was just over the bridge!!
Beautiful!. Darling Harbour was a beautiful harbour. A lot less crowded than Sydney Harbour and the view is incredible. There are a lot of nice restaurants lining the entire harbour.

Iconic location in Sydney. A great place for a walk. For us, it's a hidden gem for a cycle tour with the kids along the waterline. This is where they learned to ride and avoid traffic. They love it, and so do we.

cool place for festivals. There was a Jazz Festival the weekend I was there. Great to walk around and hear music and fireworks at night. Nice to walk around but not much to see/do here as an adult. A good place to grab dinner at any of the outdoor restaurants on the water.

Pleasant view, nice food outlets, boring shops. Darling Harbour is a lovely place to just wander around in and either people watch or relax. There are plenty of food outlets here with a wide range of foods to choose from. The shops in the shopping centre are a bit boring and limited though.

One of the best locations for choice of places to eat and drink with spectacular bachdrops. The harbour is full of boats of all sorts and on two sides filled on upto three floors with bars and restaurants that serve good food in a very friendly atmosphere

Food at a great view!. a wonderful, beautiful harbour with lots of shopping and attractions like mdm tussud's wax museum, the maritime museum and the sydney aquarium.
also has many mid-price eateries by the bay, where one can eat while enjoying the sea breeze.
also do not miss the nearby park and the chinese garden of friendship right beside the convention centre!

Great area to fill some days and nights in. The area is great and of course the Entertainment area is good to go threw when there are displays open. The shopping is mainly directed at tourists, but there is a good cafe area there with heaps of choices to choose from, so you won't go hungeryTry the Hard Rock Cafe which is now on that side and I'm sure you won't be dissapointed
So touristy. But if yuou stuck for things and crowds here is your spot loads of Bars Restaurants IMAX Cinema Maritime Museum and beyond that the Stunning finger wharfs and "The Star" Casino.

Good Rainy Day Activity. Last day in Sydney, much cooler today so we took ourselves over to Darling Harbour to hit some of the museums - had also planned to hit the Aquarium but didn't make it (not worried since we are going to the Great Barrier Reef on Tuesday.) Started off going up in the Sky View Ferris wheel to get a nice overall view of the Harbour and the Chinese Friendship Garden - could see a wedding party getting photos taking. Then walked over to the Powerhouse Museum as they had been advertising this Sydney Design exhibition all over and Ron was excited to check it out - "False advertising". The Powerhouse looks like a great place to go if you have kids under 12, it is a bit like a mini-museum of science and is very much about how things work. Most of the "design" display was artist making things that looked "lacey" it was a large museum without a lot of stuff in it, $10 was too much, 1 hour was too long. We were more than ready for lunch when we got out of there.By comparison the National Maritime Museum is free and fabulous! (there is a fee to go on the ships docked outside but we didn't do that) we went there specifically to see the exhibit on Scott's last expedition to the South Pole - it was a successful failure - he made it, but the Norwegian Roald Amundson beat him there by a month so he wasn't, and then Scott and the other 4 men with him all died on the way back, but they all kept journals which were found with them 6 months later so we know exactly what happened - fascinating. It takes a special kind of crazy to do what they did. It was also very interesting for me since we went to Norway wen I was 10 and I remember (albeit vaguely) being in a museum with triumphal displays about Amundson's successful bid to be the first to reach the South Pole.We also had a guided tour through the rest of the museum by a volunteer docent who took us around - they even have a US gallery to show the close ties between the US and Australia formed during WWII , saw the display of a German who did not wish to stay in Hitler's Germany so he somehow KAYAKED! to Australia where he was promptly interned with the rest of the germans fort he rest of the war but allowed to stay afterwards), and I actually got to go on board the First Lady which is the boat sailed by the first woman to sail solo around the world (an aussie!). Looks like a big boat fromt he outside but that is a tiny space to spend 6 months in ALL ALONE! Very cool.Started to rain alot so it gave us an excuse to try out the monorail and ride it back to our hotel - very cool. It runs at about the 2nd-3rd floor level of buildings, right above the sidewalks, and is about as noisy as a Prius!When the rain stopped we walked back to the harbour and had a final fancy dinner out at I'm Angus - I had a delicious Sirloin with garlic butter and mash and Ron had the grilled Barramundi special (local fish, very tasty). Then we went to the Lindt store for some more fancy hot chocolate - sadly I have been spoiled by that one taste of Italian Thick chocolate and even the Lindt hot choclate seemed thin.

Less expensive but just as nice!. We stayed in Darling Harbour instead of in Sydney Harbour to keep our expenses down. Its a quick ferry trip or a nice walk over to Sydney Harbour and the downtown areas.It has some great places to eat there too!
Tourist Trap. By all means go and look but DO NOT be tempted to eat here. Very expensive and poor quality as they do not tneed to rely on repeat business

Darling Harbour Needs An Overhaul. The Darling Harbour complex is looking a bit shabby since I last visited and shopping is mixed. Some seams good quality and some are starting to look like Paddy's Market - overcrowding and unappealing. Good for a meal in a restaurant or quick lunch if its near your hotel and last minute shopping before you go home but don't go hear first - head up town to Pitt St Mall / Myers / David Jones / QVB for shopping or to The Rocks
Tourist trap. The view of the harbour is pretty, however typical tourist trap.
Always fun to visit. Always refreshing to visit with easy access and a great variety of shops and restauarants

Night life in Darling Harbour is awesome!. I prefer to go to Darling Harbour at night because it is full of life and the night view is great! It is packed with partying people during weekends and there are a lot of restaurants/bars/clubs along the harbour. Even if you are just taking a walk, you can already feel the vibe of the party scene with the music blasting.

Great place for a night out. All through the year Darling Harbour has a lot to offer, with beautiful views over the water, fantastic restaurants and is just a really nice place to walk around at any time of the day.
The place to be. So much going on here and lots of good eat places and see the Imax theatre and Aquarium- its all there and we had a well spent morning in this part of town.
SO MUCH TO SEE AND DO. Biggest decision is which restaurant to dine at. The IMAX theatre is amazing

MORE OF A WATERFRONT. OK so it may be a harbour but it's primarily leisure with loads of entertainments, museums, conference centre, restaurants, firework display. Well worth a visit but doesn't have the buzz of Circular Quay

Beautiful night view. Wasn't sure what to expect, our friends took us on the ferry in drizzly rain. But I have to say that standing outside was well worth the trip. Beautiful skyline while riding the ferry across water and going under the bridge provided plenty of photo opportunities. Lots of eating places on the harbour, some even provide $8 rump steaks, so watch out for those places. A little pricey on the ferry ride, but the fireworks on saturday night made the trip worthwhile.

An absolute must. From Circular Quay we caught the ferry to Darling Harbour which was an enjoyable experience.
Having been there, I can understand why its called Darling, because thats excatly what it is.......
Take the time to read THE WALL that captures the stories of recent and not so recent immigrants. Touching and poignent.
Visit the Maritime Museum. Very friendly, with fine display vessels. The Dutch sailing vessel was intriguing and demonstrated the skills and hardiness of the explorers.
Wonderful place. Shops, bars, restaurants, plenty sights, fabulous views. A must to visit on your trip to Sydney.

Explore it fully to get the most out of the area. The Darling Harbour area is a really nice part of Sydney, with lots of attractions surrounding the harbour such as the aquarium, IMAX, maritime museum etc. There are also lots of restaurants and cafes and bars looking out onto the harbour. The Harbourside shopping centre is worth a visit, but explore behind the main harbour area to find some gorgeous water features and the hidden gem that is the Chinese Garden of Friendship.
best harbour in the world!. It's a must, don't miss it. It is breathless, trust me.
Beautiful seafood, relaxing views. Really enjoyed strolling around Darling Harbour and found some great restaurants in which to enjoy the local seafood!
Great evening spot for a stroll, drinks and dinned.. Lots of choices for drinks and dining or just people watching. Week days draws the Sydney workforce there to mingle with workmates.

Fun place to go at night. Great place to visit at night. There were more restaurants with so many choices. movie theaters, an aquarium and even a casino. We were so jet lagged the first night that we spent the evening walking around the harbor and over the bridge. Grab an ice cream at Gelitissmo and you won't be sorry.
Lots to do. Bustling, cosmopolitan area. Lots of waterfront eating and things to purchase. Not far from the famous fish market. Definately worth a visit and lunch!
Plenty to see and do. Darling Harbour has plenty to keep you occupied on either end of a ferry trip or just to explore on its own. It's easy to navigate and there's something for everyone.
Good Place to enjoy evening. Nice Place to walk and enjoy the evening. Those who like shopping, games etc.. there is many options there.

ship tour and aquriam. There were 4 boat i think you could look at. We saw the navy ship and submarine there was a museum about the sea to which we spent about a hr in that was interesting you could probably spend a lot longer here. The aquriam was nice to see spent 2 or 3 hrs here not the best I've ever been to but a fun way 2 or spend some time especially if you had children to entertain. kinda wish i had gone in to the wildlife place next door the sounds out of it would have been interesting to see what animals were inside. Had dinner at a bar in the habour was 10 dollars for stake was fab cant rem the name of it tho.

Just lovely!. I love darling harbour. visited it many times, often just to walk around on a nice day. There are quite a few tourist attractions in this area such as the aquarium and wildlife park, both of which i have been and would recommend. Also the lindt shop is especially good with all the amazing chocolate and especially the hazlenut hot chocolate. There is also the imax cinema, showing all the latest movies.You can walk from town hall down to darling harbour in about 10 minutes and it's all downhill!Hope this helps :)
Lively and fun. Definitely a fun place to walk around with tons and tons of restaurants, bars, and activities for kids. Really lively in the late afternoon with families everywhere.

well laid out - efficient and interesting. easy access for pedestrians - lots of water ferries and taxis to take you to manly, or toronga zoo etc Good dining opportunities too. all very clean and well maintained

Our favorite.... Home away from home. See the historic navy at the museum, Australia's proud naval heritage for generations to come. The Chinese Garden, the mall, great food and wonderful people, who could ask for anything more?

Cool place with a relaxed and inviting atmosphere.. This was the first place I walked to after checking into my hotel. It's a modern area with lots going on. The cafes and bars are nice enough and the waterside area is particularly pleasant for a stroll on an early autumn evening. I took the ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay. If I remember correctly, this was just five Australian dollars, yet it gave a great view of the harbour, bridge and opera house. Money well spent.

What is the fuss about?. Darling Harbour per se is your average shopping/eating tourist precinct. In my view it is overblown. It is a bit impersonal and over-priced for both eating and shopping. It's harbour-side location does offer a different perspective on the city, especially at night. It does have the wonderful Maritime Museum which is always worth a visit.
Picturesque. Allways lovely to just meander along the boardwalks, take in the views of the water and surrounding buildings, restaurants etc.

Over-rated tourist trap. Darling Harbour is good to visit once, some people like it others see it for what it is; an over crowded tourist trap. The restaurants are over priced and generally serve adverage/bad food. The bars are quite pretentious and bouncers, again generally, unpleasant (especially in the evenings/at night). Not recommended for repeated visits.

Fantastic Night Out. We go to Darling Harbour regularly - from anything to after work drinks, taking the kids on a day out or a great dinner with friends this is the spot. So many bars and restaurants to choose from and not one misses the spot! For a day out with the kids the park has been refurbed and the kids will have hours of fun while you relax and watch them.

Great park , nice cafes ,restaurants- easy to hotels. Looks very touristic but many locals here as well at weekends in the park with their kids and enjoying sun easy to go around and find a place to sit relax, enjoy a coffee of just walk around
Vibrant. Loved the Maritime Museum, atmosphere, the bustle, cafes.
Maritime museum. Well done - exhibits are interesting and well interpreted. Take the tour of the destroyer and the sub.

Our children loved it here!. After walking in the city a couple of days, it was a true pleasure to find our way to Darling Harbour! It was lively, yet quiet, with a lot to see and places to play! Our children loved jumping on the rocks in the water, playing with the water canals, and we all just relaxed on the cafes and watched people passing by. We chose to leave the area by monorail, a funny and new way to see the city :-)This is the kind of place you find in many cities, like Aker Brygge in Oslo, but we especially enjoyed all the space and many places for playing and pleasure.
not bad, but won't rate as very good. carpark problem, food too expensive but overall good view

Great fireworks show!. We sat and watched the fireworks over the harbour here one night and they were amazing. It's busy day and night but it's such a great spot you can see why. Tourist attractions, boats, shops, food, drinks and when the weather is good, ice cream!

great palce to spend the evening. wonderful harbour side experience, great clubs, shops, bars and restaurants right on the water with real variety of price and style. best place to spend evening in Sydney

More for Tourists than Locals. Nice restaurants, bars and some upmarket shopping, but the whole area is more aimed at tourists than locals. It's clean and safe. There's some nicely landscaped parks and a nice water setting. This makes for a nice afternoon walk but I would not say it represents the real Sydney.Soon the monorail that runs through the place into the city will be dismantled. The Chinese Garden is interesting to visit if you have never experienced a similar place elsewhere. There is an admission fee for the garden.

A place for a nice stroll & to enjoy the breeze. I love it here. There are lots of sculptures littered here & there, so it is photography time for all you tourists. The water is clean, not like some harbour which have a yucky murky colour. There are also a lot of eateries here, just do not expect the prices to be cheap. And when you walk, be careful not to walk too near the edge of the harbour because there are some parts which are not barricaded, so watch your steps! And don't fall into the water!

Full of fun. This place has something for everyone. There is a Japanese Garden, a shopping mall, Imax, dining establishments, a wild life habitat,Aquarium, Madame Touuauds and more. We didn't do any of it but walk around and enjoy the water and the views.

Gorgeous setting, bit busy for running. Darling Harbour is a great setting, especially early morning or late evening when it's a bit quieter. Lunch time=busy! It's also great to run around this area although I prefer to get past the harbour area and kings wharf to run on the quieter wharf area. But a must see, quick visit for a tourist.
Disappointing. Heard so much about Darling Harbour but it wasn't for me! Very artifical and lacking in atmosphere but we visited during the day so perhaps it's better at night.

Very pretty & lots of restaurants. We ate in Darling Harbour several times. Great place to walk around and your choice of restaurants. You will need a reservation at the more popular places on the weekends.Favorite restaurants - Breakfast - Pancakes on the Rocks - FABULOUS!!!Lunch -Blackbird Cafe - great pizzaDinner - Olivio - Delicious Italian foodDinner - Eat Love Pizza - expensive but DELICIOUS

great day out. Spent quite a few hours wandering around Darling Harbour, had a few drinks at different restaurants, looked at a few stores and just enjoyed the sunshine and people watching. There is plenty to do or you can just sit back, relax and enjoy the view.

very nice and clean. Harbor is a nice place to visit. it is over commercialized but very clean and safe to walk. Great places to eat and have a drink. Safety cams everywhere. Nice play area for the kids and great water features
Plenty to see. Loved the spaciousness of Darling Harbour, the great cafes, Casino, Madame Tussauds.
Lovely.... Again its just another one of those places you need to visit while travelling through Australia.
Good choice of places for a glass of wine. Darling Harbour is great for promenading, and watching the world go by with a glass of Tasmanian prosecco in hand.
So much to do.. A good half day here to see the aAquarium and the activities for one and all. Of course good shopping too.

So easy to navigate. What a location and facility. We stayed in DH to attend an exhibition at the SCC. The exhibition started at 10.00 a.m. but we were out of the hotel at 8.00 a.m. and I was worried how we would kill the time. But it was easy. We just walked to the harbour and enjoyed a leisurely coffee and breakfast at one of the numerous cafes there. We then took in the sights, some photos and walked back to the SCC via the Pyrmont Bridge. The facilities are great at DH with benches for seating, toilets walking, running and cycling paths as well as the shopping. Also everything is sign posted so it is very hard to get lost. DH is a real asset for Sydneysiders and all its tourists and viistors.

A bubbling mass of humanity enjoying the setting at all hours.. To visit with time to spare - there is so much to look at and explore - eateries and that ever entrancing smell of rich coffee competes with the glasses of wine both red and white and an amazing range of beers. There are shops that sell all manner of goods. Food from so many ethnic back grounds - time melts happily as you go from one attraction to another. Movement on the water is also fascinating. Water taxis are there to give you a view that is different. Huge screen theatres - so many exotic eateries and bars - fountains and at every turn something of photographic interest. A must for those visiting Sydney as it shows off clearly how International the City is.

Hideaway. Great cafes, restaurants, views of yachts, walking pathways and cycling, great views all round. Easy access from the monorail via steps or lift.Close to the city via Monorail.Would like to explore more.Very clean and friendly.

Darling Harbour. With so much going on in Sydney, this is a great place to start a day out. While parking is a bit hard to sort and then remember where you parked along with bloody rediculous pricing, the rest of the experience is brilliant.

Great Shopping Center. Shopping on 3 Floors. walk around check prices first some stores are much cheaper than main floor stores.. also I found that money exchange locations were cheaper than downtown Sydney itself..

Night at its best. Darling Harbor is at its best at night!. With the lighting it is such an amazing view to sip a coffee and sit on the steps. The numerous waterfront restaurants and the pubs add on to it. It is mostly busy on Fridays and Saturdays; some times a little messy with few drunkards. But it is quite safe and a great way to spend your evening! I was living in Sydney and found this place quite amusing and still feel like going back. If you want to feel the city you need to be here!A great photographic loctaion too ..Tip – There is no railing to seperate the water and hence you need to watch on your kids

The place to be on a weekend. An absolute fantastic place to be on a night. Have a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants in the area and then hit one of the bars/ clubs and the next things you know the sun is up! You pay to get in most of the bars/clubs from $10-$20 but they are worth it and the drinks in clubs such as Retro are about $7 fot a beer. Not bad for sydney centre.Great night out!

Spectacular. We stayed around the corner from the Darling Harbour area at the Novotel Rockford Darling Harbour. The pedestrian walkway along the harbour and the harbour itself were beautiful and provoded very handy way to get around! The Zoo and Aquarium are right there and this is where the harbour tour boats depart!
Ok. I don;t know why so many tourists go there. Not as nice as circular quay, needs a face lift.
Fabulous location. A must do when in Sydney. Beautiful scenery, and heap of fantastic places to eat or grab a cocktail.
Tons of things to do. This is one of the fun tourist areas of Sydney. One can walk for hours, checking out bars and restaurants, shops, museums, the activities on the water, etc.
Wonderful. It's very spectacular at night all lit up, with all the office blocks surrounding the hotels

Great place. Love going to Darling Harbour - manage to get there quite often during the year as we go to a lot of shows at the Lyric Theatre in the Star Casino. Have taken a visitor from the UK and she enjoyed the atmosphere there. The maritime museum is worth looking at as are the Chinese Gardens. Plenty of places to get something to eat or drink and prices vary from fairly cheap to expensive so will suit all budgets and tastes.
Great place to chill out in the evening!. Darling Harbour has great eating joints with a great view of the Sydney skyline. Absolutely brilliant!

Great place for shopping and Fireworks on Sat. Darling Harbour is a great place for the entire family. There are plenty of shops, restaurants, "parks" (Wild World and acquarium), and cinemas. On Saturday nights around 2000, there are free fireworks and it was spectacular!! Be sure to get a good seat ahead of time.

I think it's the ideal spot to stay/discover Sydney from.. When i first tried to book my extended 3 day stay in Sydney on Saturday November 6 in Melbourne i was sure that i wanted to stay at a hotel at the Sydney Harbour Bridge Area.Trust me Darling Harbour is just as good if not a better option that's not too far away to stay at/visit and i don't think there's much difference in price.This is right next to the Sydney Monorail,a bridge that has lot of people crossing it at all hours of the day,nice pubs and restaraunts everywhere,National Maritime Museum,a shopping mall right next to the Monorail and the LG IMAX Theatre within walking distance plus near one of the main ferrie terminals.The Hop On Hop Off bus also travels and has stops through this area so that's very handy thing as well.

One stop destination for family fun. Let's get the pet peeve out of the way. Too much concrete for my liking. That said Darlo harbour has a lot to offer. We have at various times gone to Imax, music festivals, the laser tag and bowling and many realestate, mind body spirit and and home based mega show/exhibitions on at this large arena of entertainment. We have also boarded a tall ship cruise and splashed our way through the fountains. We've seen the chinese gardens and Australian animals (zoo?) plus of course the aquarium which is great.It's a one stop destination for family fun.TIP Only approx 7 mins walk away is chinatown. Great myriad of food options.
loads to do. clean, bustling area with plenty to do for all ages!
Hoopla!!. We visited the Hoopla Festival over Easter and went with our grandson and son in law. It was a great day out and the free entertainment was amazing and very exciting. Wonderful experience!!

Atmosphere. Great atmosphere around the harbour. A bit on the expensive side but very nice and there are a few places offering deals for early diners. Spent most evenings in and around Darling Harbour with a couple of visits further in to the city.

Really worth visiting.. It lacks user friendly things that we found in brisbanes south bank, but the attractions are second to none. The aquariumis great- don't go during school holidays because you will wish you could climb into the tank to avoid the thousands of kids. Shark attack would be preferable!!!! The wildlife park with the big croc is worthwhile too. The croc is massive, but the best attraction is the national airtime museum, with the real life submarine and war ship to walk through. Love it, Ben ack 3 times.

Great place to go for families. There is a brilliant playground and unique water playground which would keep kids entertained for hours. The view of the harbour is gorgeous, especially at night with a very wide walkway around and a bridge across. Endless options for dining and drinks, as well as a grassed area to enjoy a picnic.

So much to do!. We visited the Maritime Museum, the Aquarium and so much more. The Museum is really well presented and well worth the price of admission. We saw great displays, learned loads about the early days of Sydney and surrounds and loved the expanse of the place.The Aquarium is right across the harbour and is well worth the time and money to visit as well.Great shopping and masses of dining options.
so much choice. great harbour and beautifully lit up at night. so many restaurants to choose from its hard to make up your mind! great for a walk at night or even sit by the water people watching!

A new lease of life. The recent addition of restaurants (city side) and the amazing children's playground has refreshed this tired place. Now there is outdoor dining of good quality and a great place for children to play safely. The only negative is the badly placed cafe/toilets... it blocks the direct (safe) view of children playing from where parents can sit.
Eating. This is a lovely harbour, with lots and lots of restaurant and shops.

Trolley ride. My trip took me to visit Star City casino, where a $5 go on the pokies turned in $15 so I left then to find a nice meal back at Paddy's market.The wait between the trains was the only dislike.
very nice. Looking at all the boats in the harbour and all the hotels you could tell that it was the tourist center.Not a lot there but nice all the same
A little bit of everything. Aquarium, great restaurants and clubs, huge imax, casino, lots to do in this area, don't miss it! lots of harbour cruises leave from here

Great for all ages. This is a beautiful area to spend some time whether it be with family, friends or by yourself. The range and style of the cafes and restaurants is excellent. They suit all tastes and budgets. There is a huge playground in the area which is free fun for little and big kids! There are many attractions to keep everyone entertained, interested and educated. Well done Sydney council!

Spend some time here. The Chinese gardens are like stepping into a bit of China.You can even get dressed in emperors clothes and have a photo or just relax watching the koi. Around the DH grounds are usually many attractions including very talented buskers. I saw a machete juggler with a wonderful sense of humour! and laughter is the best medicine.Enjoy.

How a Waterfront should Be. The Authorities have done a great job over the years in developing this area, Although geared mainly for tourists with uneven quality in its restaurants, it is apparent that efforts are made to respect higher norms. They will need to keep monitoring this as other areas are developed or else this will become only a tourist location.
beautiful. visited the aquarium in darling harbour and walked around. nice restaurants and shopping area.
well named. enjoyed the lovely homes in the area and had a good coffee
Darling Harbour. The Harbour is beautiful with the fountains and pools. The ferries and everything is close.

daring... Spend some time here since my office was overlooking the harbour - so got a change to get out a few times for lunch in and around the place..the view from the 27th floor of the office was great.. so is the place face to face..If you get the time you can have a look at the aquarium and also take speed boats around the place.
A must do. A great place to wander around and eat, lots of choice

Fun place to spend an evening. We visited here on Saturday night to watch the free firework display. We spent a few hours having a glass of wine and enjoying the atmosphere. It does get very busy as the time approaches for the fireworks, but there are lots of seats for everyone. Good fireworks. Quite a few jugglers and fire eaters to keep everyone amused. We found the restaurants and bars eye wateringly expensive, but the display is free, so well worth a visit. Take the train to Town Hall station and walk about 5 min to the harbour.

Past its use-by date. When it first opened, this was a thriving area. Now, it's much quieter with a lot less to do. There are few areas to eat inexpensively, making it less appropriate for families than it used to be. It has plenty of attractions in the area (Imax, aquarium etc) but not somewhere I'd specifically go unless I was going there to visit one of those attractions

Darling Harbour. I was disappointed in Darling Harbour - perhaps I expected too much. I was disappointed in the shops, and also the aquarium. I had my intellectually disabled brother with me, and perhaps this was not the best choice of activities for him. We did really enjoy our lunch in one of the restaurants which open to the mall and also to the wharf. We sat on the wharf side, virtually outside, and it was an extremely pleasant experience, very relaxing.

Good place to spend half a day.. Darling Harbour was interesting because of its maritime museum, the submarine one can tour and the significant ships used in past wars. It is quite modern, doesn't really have the charm of the older parts of Sydney, but is definitely worth ferrying over to; Darling Harbour was Sydney's bi-centenial gift to itself.
Darling Harbour. Sunshine, clear blue sky and as much entertainment as you could ever wish for. Buskers, bands, restaurants, cafes, food halls, scenery and people -- thousands of them.
Busy but delightful. Get the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and enjoy the delights of all the eateries, shops and, at night, the lights on Cockle Bay.

The Beauty of Sydney. Darling Harbor has undergone dramatic redevelopment over several years and it shows. The whole area is beautiful and right on the water, so you can see the skyline of the city reflected in the water at night (great photo spot). Additionally, there is a truly clever play are for children as well as many restaurants and bars offering outdoor dining to enjoy the picturesque surroundings. Be on the lookout as there are often special events taking place in this area as well.
Magic spot. Darling Harbour is such a busy bustling place with everything at your finger tips and a very pleasant place to watch the world pass by.

Come here for a feel of Sydney.. If you had only a few hours, I would recommend Darling Harbour for a feel of Sydney. There is a fantastic playground for kids, many restaurants to choose from, a museum, an aquarium, a shopping centre and just great atmosphere generally.

Plenty to see-& close in. Here you'll find shops, restaurants, The Exhibition centre,IMAX and National Maritime Museum. Chinatown at one end, Powerhouse Museum close by and about 1 km long. Ferries from Circular quay, Sydney or 10 min walk up to the CBD. Old ferry South Steyne now a restaurant and the Heritage fleet runs 1874 James Craig from here if you've booked. Aquarium worth a look and all of this close in so transports not a worry for most. Monorail is a last chance as it's being demolished soon.
Playground. Must-see for families. And it's free! Climbing, flying-fox, and the best water playground we've ever seen.

take the tram. take the tram at least once around the city....food is great at darling harbour and reasonably priced...nite time brings lots of free entertainment...u can walk over to star city casino and enjoy a fabulous buffet and gambling along with wonderful live shows.

A day well spent. We found a wide choice of eateries for whatever your budget. The weather was fab so we strolled around the boats at the Maritime museum, past the childrens park and spent a lovely few hours in the Chinses Garden of Friendship. Had planned to visit the aquarium but, in the end, felt there was more than enough to see without doing so.
Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit. Great shopping & fantastic restaurants and eateries and lot's to do
Exciting, Scenic and Lots to Do. A wealth of attractions set in a scenic location. Everything in the area is very pricey. Recommend eating elsewhere.

Relaxing spot. Just because it's Sydney's #2 harbor doesn't mean it's not a top-notch place.Nice little harbor, plenty of sculptures to check out, a museum, an aquarium, a zoo(ish), shops, bars, restaurants, ships, a nice bridge to walk across and use to look out from.Spent time just walking around the place. Worth stopping in to, the harbor itself is not a huge attraction, but there's plenty of attractions right there.
lots to see. To us the restaurants here seemed very expensive, but the children's playground is just great fun, even my 12 year old liked it. Sadly we did not have time to go to the Maritime Museum.

Entertaining. The perfect word for Darling Harbour is "entertaining". The walk from Sydney to Darling Harbour is definitely worthwhile. Once there in Cockle Bay, there are loads of things to see. A great kid's area, lots of places to eat, fountains, docks, boat rides, the National Maritime Museum, the Sydney Aquarium, people watching, etc. We were just happy to walk around and sightsee. Having been in many aquariums and had already gone on a snorkeling trip to the GBR, we skipped the aquarium. Didn't go in the Maritime Museum either, but there was a huge navy ship and submarine docked right in Cockle Bay. Lovely place to walk around.

Fish and Ships!!. Re- developed and opened by Queen Elizabeth in 1984....so much to see and do...allow a full day!! Maritime museum and ships ranging from Captain Cook`s "Endeavour" to Destroyer HMAS Vampire. Sydney Aquarium...just amazing walking in glass tunnels under sharks and stingrays. Next door..Wildlife Sydney with kangaroos and cassowarys, koalas and crocodiles.....so well presented and informative.....just fabulous!! Lots of bars and restaurants for eats/ drinks. Please don`t forget the Chinese Garden of Friendship......simply beautiful......an "oasis of calm" in the middle of the City!! We loved our day.....took lots of photos!!
Busy but fun.. A nice spot to start your day and people watch-would recommend.
Romantic Harbour. I guess the title suits the warm feeling of visiting this harbour with your special soul mate
joyfull. lot of people, place for good entertainment, food and shoping. had a wonderful day there

Nice way to spend a relaxing day. It is just a giant park set around the water with great restaurants and bars all around it. The kids love the park. I go here every New Years Eve as they do great fireworks and it doesn't get as crowded as the Harbour.

Can't Miss This Area. Darling Harbour is a vibrant and fun place to centre your Sydney experience around. All your adventures...ferry ride, bridge climbs, the Casino, Aquarium, Maritime Museum, Restaurants, and the only Starbucks I could find....are near here.......nearby Chinatown has the most inexpensive places to eat....ask your locals or the Tour Bus Driver....I recommend Boris.(Yes, that's his name)...he was awesome......This is also a great place to hang out, relax and people watch.
Darling Harbour. It was beautiful. A lot of stores and eateries. Went almost every day we were in Sydney.
Monday Steak. Nice ferry from Darling to Circular qUAY. But on mondays in Darling Harbour you can get a very nice lunch for $9.99 which includes a steak and salad at one of the restaurants there.
Nice place to shop.... Large place for shopping, lots of restaurants and many variations... You'll find some of your favorite foods there...
Must see!. Beautiful scenery, lovely homes...take the ferry and spend the day!
Darling harbour must see. Really nice area, easy to get to from city. Mixture of cheap and dearer food places. Highly recommend
As always great place to walk around and grab a bite to eat. Great area to walk around at night with a great selection of eateries and bars.
