nice place to hang around. nice place to hang around with ice cream in your hands with geese and birds strolling along with you.
Fantastic. Amazing area with so many restaurants, bars and cafes to choose from. Very modern and 'user friendly'.
Darling Harbour. More modern than circular quay with nice views and shopping. Another good place to people watch
The Walk at Darling. We walked all over Darling Harbour, Did a little shopping at the quaint little shops
Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is a great place to visit.. Full of wonderful eateries and you can shop till you drop. Always soething happening here.Worth a visit.
relaxed. we always eat in this part of sydney mainly for the atmosphere ,great resuarants and food is always varied

Fun for the whole family. We visited the Darling Harbour area this past weekend and there were all kinds of activities going on. There was a corporate soccer challenge finals with 6 V 6 playing on a small grass turf field on a dock. Next door was a Men's Health Magazine 13K obstacle course race around the harbour with several thousands of participants. All this was surrounded by shops and restaurants, a pretty harbour, Acquarium, IMAX theatre, and a kiddie playground with streams and squirting water. Note that the weekends are MUCH busier than the weekdays so if you want to see all this - plan your trip to be there on a weekend.
Holiday Down Under. Great restaurants to eat at and shopping is good. Found some of the attractions good to see.
Wildlife. The wildlife place in Darling Harbor was a better spend than the whole Zoo.
What to do. see the aquarium and wildlife experience at Darling Harbour, totally worth it

Can't miss it. Always worth a visit when you come to Sydney. Full of life during the day and night, you'll never run out of things to do. Luckily there's also a range of things to do depending on your budget as well, so anyone can enjoy it. I've also found it to be a family friendly environment even when people begin to go bar hopping and clubbing. Check it out, it's lots of fun.

The Darling of Sydney.. Its the darling of Sydney. Darling Harbour has so many attractions restaurants, bars, walks, near by parks and worlds biggest IMAX theater. Grab a movie in this massive theater. Hard Rock Cafe is there with some nice views of the harbour. The Sydney convention centre located here holds some concert / seminars frequently. If you go to Sydney Aquarium or Wild Life, try to relax here at Darling Harbour. Its the best place to relax after some activities. Just go and love it.
nice area. lots of restaurants, a little expensive but great choices and nice area
South Steyne harbourside meal. Evening meal on the South Steyne dockside looking over Darling Harbour - Fabulous setting and best meal of our holiday set our 2 boys up for us leaving them that night

Darling Harbour. Catch the monorail and do one full lap befor getting off at Darling Harbour to see the Aquarium or any of the other many attractions. Then catch the ferry round to Cirular Quay via the Harbour Bridge.

A happenin' place. A lively, noisy, expensive and vibrant area aimed at tourists. Good attractions in the areas. Wickedly expensive restaurants, but all forgiven during the fab fireworks display on Saturday evenings

Great place to hang out. Loved this place, so much to see and do everyday. Great for old and young.Great choice of restaurants.Watch the free firework display on a Saturday evening around 8pm. We had a bonus as it was on again on the Sunday!Free deckchairs and mats put out on the grassy areas to watch musicians. Lovely well maintained play and sitting areas.Great for passing a few hours on a sunny day.

Nice during night time!!!. Visit on the evening and spend until mid night. It is a nice place to enjoy as a couple or family. There are plenty of restaurants available around this place. There are lot of water taxis, ferries available to travel to other part of Sydney through water. There is a Chinese garden is also near.
Visited the Sydney Aquarium nearby. Had fun at the Sydney Aquarium, which is right at the Harbour

Wonderful. One of our families favourite places. There are bars and shops as well as an aquarium and the wonderful Lindt Cafe who serve the most amazing hot chocolate! Nice selection of shops here too as well as a great childrens play area .

Really Nice. Lots of things to do over there for everyone. There is the Aquarium that my husband & I enjoyed very much. The shopping center looked good but we weren't in the mood. The view of the sea with the boats was relaxing & I enjoyed really. It's a good place to hang out for everyone; singles, couples & families.
Worth a trip. We went there by boat, and returned to the Rocks by taxi. There are lots to do and see and an unbelievable number of places to eat.
Fun family day out. With plenty to see and do here, it's a destination not to be missed when visiting Sydney. The 'Darling Quarter' park area is particularly great for young children.

The Beautiful Darling Harbour.. We spent about 80% of our time on the harbour. The restaurants, were delicious. The walk along the boardwalk was very engaging. So much to see and do. Plenty to entertain the the littlies , and the not so little. You can spend a full day there and still not see it all.
Sightseeing. I think I may have got confused with my reviews on this and Sydney Harbour. This has excellent shops and restaurants, very helpful staff, lovely atmosphere.
Tacky. It's just a tourist destination with expensive average restaurants and souvenir shops. Don't bother.
Great atomsphere. fantastic place for people of all ages great views and lots of restaurants and things to choose from
Never fails to disappoint. Beautiful harbour...great shopping....excellent for children with parks and play areas.

The harbour has a real buzz about it. A walk around the harbour was almost a daily event during our stay in Sydney. There is always something going on and early on weekday evenings the whole place fills with people from the local offices enjoying a relaxing drink before departing for home.The food court provides a wide choice of good value eating if you do not mind the canteen style of dining.
Great for families. This area has something for everyone, from the tranquil Chinese gardens to the children's water play area and all the restaurants and pubs. Lots of buzz!
Darling Harbor. Yet another great place for a walk or stroll and breakfast or lunch on the harbor.
Shop eat sight see altogether. Lovely place to visit well worth the effort of getting across the bridge if you are not staying there
Exciting atmosphere, great playgrounds. My son adored the playgrounds. Very attractive surrounds. Lots of entertainment and atmosphere.
Dine & Wine. Darling Harbour harbors many restaurants. I like the side where you can see the skyscrapers. One you are in the Harbour, make your way to the Casino on a limited budget!

Enjoyed the free Hoop-la carnival at Easter. Darling Harbour has lots of great food outlets (the kebab place are very very generous with their beef kebabs - yum) and each Easter there are lots of street performers, who are very entertaining. Really enjoyed the Beat the Streets performers, especially the very appealling guy from the Bronx.
excellent darling harbour display. went to imax and walked around seeing the acrobatic performances.
IMAX. Saw Titanic 3D here and the experience was pretty awesome on such a huge screen

Buzzy area. Darling Harbour can be reached via ferry from Circular Quay - a very pleasant trip or by mono rail from Sydney City.Once here you will find a huge number of restaurants - all very large and somewhat touristy with prices to match. There is also a big indoor shopping mall called "Harbourside". Sydney Acquarium, the Power House and Maritime museums are also situated here and well worth visiting (see separate review on Maritime museum). It is a pleasant area to walk around and there are lots of places to sit and relax and watch the world go by. There is a faboulous very large childrens play area and its FREE! the cafes/restaurants overlooking this are more reasonably priced than the ones overlooking the main harbour area.The ferry stops at two places here - Darling Harbour stop - best for Acquarium and Pyrmont - best for Maritime museum - these stops are on opposite sides of the harbour but it is a very pleasant walk to get off at one, have a potter around and then walk across the Pyrmont Bridge to the other side and pick the ferry up again there. Pyrmont bridge is accessible via lift, escalator or steps - so ok for puschairs etc.When visiting Sydney, you should certainly go to Darling Harbour but avoid week-ends - too busy and too many big noisy crowds in bars/restuarants!
FUN AND VIBRANT. Nice shops and bars, great harbour, the best and most exciting thing there are the jet boat rides, doughnuts in a boat are great fun.

Interesting place with many attractions. Particularly liked the Chinese Gardens which were really tranquil. Took the ferry from Circular Quay, so saw quite a lot of things on the way. The aquarium is very good.
Great for everyone (and kids). Great playground for kids, laser skirmish, bowling and great restaurants and spaces (might want to wear thongs for water features)
Interesting Area. Lots of cafes, restaurants and shops. Sydney Aquarium and WildLife Sydney and National Maritime Musuem close by.

Great shops, restaurants, views. I've been visiting this place for over 20 years. It has conference centres, a chinese garden, IMAX theatre, museums, aquarium, zoo, shops and restaurants in a small area.
We always love Darling Harbour. There is SO much to do, every time we come, we find something new. The restaurants are all top quality too

loved darling harbour. loved darling harbour - so many restaurants and shopping centre - much more going on than circular quay! took a water taxi to the Opera House which was really worth doing - more of a guided tour than just a water taxi! lovely view of the city from the harbour too - got some great pics.
Atmospheric. Stopped here many times during my visit particularly when the rugby was on. Fantastic frenzy of atmosphere, hospitality, and enjoyment.
Family Fun. Another great watch the world go by spot. Plenty of food ranging in prices, great ice-creams and spectacular sights and sounds

Entertaining. Darling Harbour is an area full of restaurants so you will never go hungry. You can visit the Chinese Garden which are very pretty. There is plenty of free entertainment or you can just sit and enjoy your surroundings
Lovely place to walk. Big range of restaurants - some better than others. Avoid the Harbourside Food Court. We bought from 4 different restaurants and food was poor and service rude and peremptory.
Just Beautiful of a night. Easy stroll, lots of sights and sounds. Plenty of eating and snack options, transportation on ferries.

Nice Attractions and fun people watching. Went to both the Sydney Aquarium and Wildlife Sydney. Enjoyed both although Wildlife Sydney was a little pricey for it's size. After done with those 2 - sat down outside and listened to live music while eating king prawns and people watching. While most of the CBD was empty - this place was packed ( this was on a Saturday).
Easter Sunday was vibrant. The hustle and bustle is great. Lots of happy people around
Shops, museums, bars&restaurants in one place.. The designer of Darling Harbour did his research using Baltimore's Inner Harbor. Darling Harbour is on a much grander scale.
Great restaurants. Lots of great restaurants and sites in the walk around. The Harbourtown shopping centre was a bit limited and expensive.

night and attractive. it was very nice at night and morning and evening
nice restaurant at afternoon to have lunch , like nicks evening you can have a nice cruise and evening nice diiner and drink

so much happening, so much to watch. People everywhere, all types, all kinds & its better than going to the movies.. If you aren't a people watcher you can join in with the buskers or sip a cold beer & watch the water traffic....

An exhibition and conference centre. Walking distance from the CBD with several good restaurants. It is often used as an event station for concerts (on platform boats) or fireworks. On weekends it can be a bit dead if there is nothing special on. On week days it is well used by the CBD workers. It is a light and airy space. Major roads roar above it but beneath there are fountains, restaurants, parks and stores. The star city casino is at one end. They put on fireworks at New Year and Australia day. It was developed in the late 90s prior to the olympics. Prior to that it was not a very nice area. More and more high rises are being built in the area, improving the general quality of the area.

Western Side needs a refresh. The newer part on the east is fabulous, but the shopping centre is really looking old and tired on the western side... The harbour itself is lovely, and a walk across the old Pyrmont bridge is just great

Plenty to see and do. Yes it's a tourist trap, but well worth exploring for the great variety of shops, restaurants and attractions in the area--there's something for everyone, young and old, day and night!
always something to do. Has Imax, children park, Garden walks, day and night entertainmentWell worth staying in this area

Location. Great area to stay in, so central to everything in the inner city. All forms of transport available, we stayed over the xmas period, loved all the xmas activities around, especially the fireworks & xmas trees & decorations
Shopping with a view. Love the setting around Darling harbour and shopping choices

Take a quick tour, but save your money. Darling Harbour offers visitors one great thing that's worth the visit; the scenery. It's a lovely walk about. Other than that, save your money. There's a wild animal exhibit and an aquarium both located on the harbor. Size limitations dictate the poor animals be confined to tiny cages and ponds. It's sad, especially when Sydney has two other wild animal areas near by that offer the animals great range of freedom. In addition, the rest of the harbor is a combination of kitschy over priced attractions straight off the midway of any state fair, and wildly over priced (even for Sydney) restaurants. Even the Maritime museum is priced to the hilt. Come for a visit, but leave your wallet in your room.
Plenty to do.. Wow what a place, plenty of Restruants and Cafes to eat at, and you can go to the Aquarium, Maritime Museum,and catch a Ferry, and plenty of shops.
Lots to do.. Darling Harbour is very convenient to the hotel. Lots of great restaurants to choose from. Nice shops and various activities happening on the Harbour a really active place.

A bit overrated. some decent restaurants and bars but nothing too special, of all the restaurants there we found only one which had Kangaroo on the menu, surely a must for any restaurant which is catering for visitors to the country

Great at night, maybe not in the day. Darling Harbour is great for tourists as well as Sydney Residents. There are lovely restaurants on the water and some cool bars and clubs. Other attractions include the Harbourside shopping centre and the Aquarium. It's worth a visit however I would only reccommend you go for a meal as the restaurants here really are great, and there are fireworks every Saturday at 9pm.
Great place to play and stay. Close to all kinds of things touristy. Nice if you don't want to venture far from your hotel
Wildlife Sydney. Expensive, but this may be the only chance to see AU's indigenous animals.
Lovely place.. Lovely place to sit on a terrace but....the food and drinks are very expensive there.
Beautiful area. We stayed at Darling Habour and fell in love with the area. It was clean, safe an area that was all round lovely to be in, made us proud to be aussies.
So much to do here.. From the Sydney aquarium to the IMAX theatre to the chinese garden, it's a wonderful place to have a whole morning. Enjoyed it.

Tourist Central. OK yes everything is geared for the tourist BUT that is a good thing in many ways. There's everything you could want or need, and spending a whole day there enjoying it is easy. Lots for families, couples and singles. It's clean and the prices in the shops were quite reasonable.

Busy, crowded, very touristy. Definitely a must see, but do not spend too much time there, as there are many other places around Sydney which are more interesting. We walked fround Circular Quay to Darling harbour which is quite a walk !!

Nice Area With Plenty to See. I like visiting Darling Harbour as there is plenty to do, and a good variety of eating and drinking establishments to suit various budgets. I enjoy just sitting back and enjoying the view of the water and boats.

Lots to see and do. Great places to eat and drink around the harbour with events such as dragon boat racing at the weekend.
The fireworks display we watched from our room in the Novotel was exceptional.

Lots of restaruants and some overpriced shops. Darling Harbour is a beatuful place but find there really isnt much to do unless you want to eat and drink. Shop shopping centre is overpriced and takeway food expensive.
loving darling Harbour. fell in love with Darling Harbour, so much to see and do, full of life.

Awesome boardwalk!. One of the best outdoor areas in Sydney! Shops,cafes,bars,and the aquarium/wildlife world...so much to see and do! it's a beautiful walk during the day,and sparkling and lively at night.

Love Darling Harbour. We always visit Darling Harbour when we visit Sydney. This time we took our children to Sydney Wildlife World and Sydney Aquarium. They loved them. We have been to Cargo Bar several times and took our children for lunch this time. The tables have a great outlook - really good for people watching. The service and food are also great. Really quick. Our boys are still talking about the chicken wings. My husband is still talking about the cold beer.

Lots of places to eat and plenty to see and do!. We first walked round Darling Harbour on our 2nd evening in Sydney and it was a Saturday evening. The place was completely buzzing - there were people everywhere! We had a bit of trouble getting somewhere to eat as we hadn't booked, but we ended up in Eat,Love Pizza, which was great, if a bit pricey. At 9pm there was a firework display out in the Harbour, which took us by surprise, but apparently they have one every Saturday in the winter months. There are loads of places to eat all around the harbour - another day we went to Hurricane's which is a great place specialising in burgers and ribs - you should book in advance to make sure you get a table - that was one of the best meals we ate whilst in Australia! Our waiter was from Scotland, which was a bit weird, but nice too!
Darling darling harbour. Plenty of good resturants, small shopping mall, behind is a fantastic play area for children by the IMEX cinema all based on water theme and was free of charge

I was disappointed. For a long tr I've wanted to go to darling harbour, but I was disappointed. Guess I found it to lack the character of the many other tourist precincts... Some amazing restaurants, I can't put my finger on it, I was just glad we hadn't based ourselves there for our stay.
Great range of restaurants. Some good places to eat with good views and nice to walk around. A few historic pubs such as the Pyrmont are nearby and have more atmosphere than the drinking holes here.

Don't miss out. This one of the most clean harbour sites we have visited. The seafood at the seafood restaurants here are just superb. Especially their abalones, crayfish (make sure they are freshly cooked - some Asians running food stalls here re-cook before serving them to innocent people)

Great spot when you're looking for something to eat. Darling Harbour is not only the location of the Acquairum and Wildlife Park, but also offers the best concentration of eating establishments in Sydney. Options range from the Food Court where you can find an enconomy meal, to high-end dining. Most restaurants post menus outside, so walk around and browse before you decide on where you are going to eat. Easy ferry ride from Circular Quay or other Sydney locations.

Plenty to do..worth a visit. I must admit I hadnt heard of Darling Harbour before I visited AUS but this is worth visiting. It is renowned by Australians as a tourist attraction and true Australians wouldnt usually visit but it does have lots of restaurants together with a recently opened Hard Rock Cafe and mall.They also have the Sydney Aquarium, IMAX Theatre, National Maritime Museum, Powerhouse Museum and Sydney Wildlife World.I visited the Aquarium, Wildlife World and the Sydney Tower Eye on a multi ticket - its cheaper to buy all 3 together than separately.The aquarium was fantastic but I thought Wildlife world was a bit disappointing. The Tower Eye was terrifying, I am scared of heights and it is very high but it is a must-see panoramic view.

So much to do at Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is a must when you visit Sydney. Firstly, there are lovely walks and parks with fountains to explore along the water's edge,.a convention centre, shops, lots of hotels and restaurants and the casino. You can get there easily on the monorail.

Exciting city experience. We did lots in a short time - saw Annie the musical at Lyric Threatre, fabulous! the boys went on a Harbour Jetboat ride, thrilling! and we ate yummy food and gelati, and watched a free street performer, very funny - all in walking distance at Darling Harbour!
Great atmosphere. Beautiful afternoon to sit and watch the "world go by". Restaurants very pricey and shops very upmarket so didn't spend anything.

Special place in Sydney. So much to do. Restaurants, cafes, Seaworld, IMax, etc.Worth taking the 'little train' to the chinese gardens and coming back for a meal or coffee in the heart of Darling Harbour. Lots of shopping and fun for kids and adults alike.Famous Hard Rock Cafe Sydney is also a 'must' in Darling Harbour

Low-key place that is good for kids. Liked the Sydney Aquarium, especially the barrier reef exhibit. Saddened to hear they are dismantling the monorail, which makes it easy for a tourist to get around.
Eat Eat Eat !!!!!!!!!!!. This must have more restaurants than any where I have ever been !!!!!!!! Wall to Wall foooooooood !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Too many choices. Staying close to Darling Harbour we visited this area often. Kids loved the Aquarium and there is plenty to see and do.

Lots to do.. There are lots of things to see and do. The aquarium, wild life park, and the Australian Maritime museum to mention a few. There are plenty of restaurants and a shopping center. You can catch the ferries as well as a harbour cruise. Lots of activities for all ages. They had a fireworks show on Saturday night. There were lots of people, families, young and old. It was a very nice show. Overall, it is worth a visit. Nice place for a dinner overlooking Cockle Bay.

Beautiful at night. We stayed at the Sydney Hilton and took the monorail there. The restaurants in this area are amazing as well as the views. The city looks beautiful at night from darling harbour. Goto Pancakes on the rocks for breakfast!

good walk - good food. it is beautiful, especially at night. it has also got a beautiful history and while there make sure to ask the locals or the "i-site" for more information. very good restaurants with a variety of food choices and also prices are available there so don't miss it.
Zaaffraan Indian Amazing. Zaaffraan Indian resturant has amazing views and amazing food located in the heart of Darling Harbour. http://www.zaaffran.com/
Great. I love Darling Harbour day or night it is so nice to just stroll through and sit down for something to eat or drink.
Harbour. Brilliant so much to see and do around Darling Harbour Walking eating shopping

Love darling harbour. Darling harbour has it all, shopping, food, entertainment, wildlife, and only a short walk to Chinatown, entertainment centre and much more. A fantastic area to base yourself on your stay in Sydney
bustling. plenty of restaurants but it can be very expensive, so go to the food halls in Harbourside Mall. Firework displays every saturday night whilst we were there, over the harbour. Amazing !!

Great place. Beautiful place and quite interesting during the weekends when there is often live music/ dance shows/ firework displays etc. Lots of cheap eating options in the adjacent shopping centre.

Great for people watching. I went with my Mum in March for a short trip to Sydney. Its a great spot to chill out and relax. With the many bars and eateries there are a few places which offer happy hour in the evening. It was great to people watch and wind down by having a few beers at half price
A great place to walk, and eat if you're hungry.. Neat, clean, interesting. Lots of restaurants nice park and playground area.
Quite touristy. Darling Harbour is nice, but it has a large amount of fast food/drink restaurants and was just a bit too touristy for my liking.

Great Exercise. Loved just walking around Darling Harbour on a Sunday afternoon. Magic weather made it better. Lots of people about, interesting sights to see & plenty of little places to stop and rest & imbibe
Pretty but overrated. Darling Harbour is quite pretty and a nice place to wander around for an afternoon but it is quite expensive once you're there.
A place for all. Never a dull moment at Darling Harbour always something for the family to do.

Book a table on the waterfront to see the fireworks!. There are some amazing fireworks displays in darling harbour most saturday nights. with lots of great restaurants to choose from get a window seat and watch the show usually around 9pm.
Good shopping. We were amazed to the quality and prices in the clothing stores, my wife bought a few fantastic outfits at great prices and very origional pieces! Loved the place!

Darling Harbour a modern part of the city. Walking across the pedestrian bridge or catching the Monorail gives you a great view of Darling Harbour. Dureing the day there are many tourists and Conventions held at the Convention Centre. There are several large Hotels which hreat accommodation. The shopping and restaurants are terrific and varied. The Chinese Gardens are well worth a visit.

Sunny Sunday. Marvelous place to spend a sunny Sunday having a good meal, watching the Greek festival, hordes of children enjoying their part, taking piles of pictures of the gorgeous ibis in the Chinese garden. Very well done use of the land around a working harbor.
Great location. Many superb restaurants and bars. Spectacular fireworks every Saturday night in Cocle Bay. A must see for all visitors
Exhibition at Convention Centre. It was my first time having a stand at the convention centre and was very impressed with the facilities and the catering.

gorgeous friday night.... a sunny day ended with happy hour cocktails at the Hard Rock Cafe, overlooking Darling Harbour - yummo! Great atmosphere and great cocktails and food. Take a walk around... then top it off with a hot chocolate or a chocolate Sundae at the Lindt cafe.... heaven! Lots to see too!

Must see. This is a safe and very nice area to spend time - maybe a day. There are plenty of things to do and see. Lots of restaurants. Walk the bridge to get a view of the surrounding. There is an IMAX, wax museum and do not miss the aquarium. The Chinese garden is also nearby.

Great shopping. Darling Harbor is home to great shopping and restaurants. There are ferrys from the wharf to Manly and Sydney. The Queen Victoria Building... A high fashion mall... is right on Darling Harbor too
Beautiful little harbour. Excellent shopping and eating establishments. A must see in Sydney.

Loved this. This reminded us of The Viaduct in Auckland but on a much larger scale. There were many people and they had the fireworks on the Saturday night. If you are into nightlife there are 'rocking' bars. If you like to have dinner out there are many many wonderful places to eat out. A great experience.

Lively!. Darling Harbour is very popular. There are nice gardens where families can go, that have many attractions for younger children. Within these gardens is the Chinese Garden (a fee). There is also an IMAX cinema, that was being upgraded to one of the largest around. The Aquarium and Wildlife Centre is also at Darling Harbour. There are many restaurants all around and at the weekend the whole area is heaving and lively.

Good to walk around but touristy. Darling Harbour itself is interesting to walk around however appears to be pitched at tourists. The cafes, restaurants and shops are expensive. The park area itself however is quite nice.
Easy to get around. Take the monorail for a quick look around and then walk around the Harbour. Great for kids too as there's a terrific playground there.
Great area. Lots of restaurants and a cinema. Also the area for the aquarium and boat trips
Great Food and atmosphere. Take the time to have lunch or dinner, then and ice cream as you watch the street performers.
Keeps getting better. Now with the new Darling Quarter with more restaurants and great water features for kids of all ages to play in.

I loved the kids playground. The kids playground is exceptional - the water playground is absolutely brilliant. My two and half year old toddlers loved it.It's also good for older kids as it teaches them about the science of water. My two just loved running around splashing in it.I was really surprised that it was free and it's such a handy location. I was told it does get very busy on weekends though! We went on a day when the weather was meant to be bad but it never eventuated so it was a lot more quiet than what it normally is.
Loved it!. We loved walking around the harbour. Lots of lovely eating places and places of interest.

Full of things to do.. Home to the National Maritime Musuem, Sydney Aquarium, and Sydney Wildlife Experience, as well as a good selection of bars, restaurants, and a shopping centre, Darling Harbour is a good place to spend most of a day exploring.Something that everyone should do.
Neat harbor. Had several opportunities to see harbor. Took ferry from/to and had dinner in the area.

A very nice place to visit either by ferry or on foot. Darling Harbour is about 8 - 10 minutes walk from The Grace Hotel, where we stayed for 5 nights. The harbour is very attractive with bars, cafes, restaurants and shops. There are also attractions like the Aquarium, the Maritime Museum, etc. The ferry goes their from Circular Quay, or you can hop on the bus.
Eat outside at Dahrling Harbour. Very trendy restaurants. Eat outdoors facing the water.Totally different vibe than Circular Quay area. Try Both areas.

Darling Harbour, Darling Dangerous.. I wonder what darling they were thinking of went they thought of the name of that part of Sydney Cove. The off spring of an incubus comes to mind with the lager louts, freaks, emos and other 'diverse' members of our society that mainly patronise this historical, for all the wrong reasons, place in Sydney. I will give you a few clues of what you can expect to come across in that desperate part of the world. 1. The poor and original off spring of the original inhabitants of that area have colloquially re- named surrounding suburbs as Dyketown (Newtown), Junkiedale (Annandale) and Multi-blow (Ultimo). The area is best visited in daylight so you can see your assailant approaching and you can negotiate the dark and narrow streets in your frantic escape with some confidence. At night it is best to travel in the area in the front seat of a locked Police car driven and occupied by members of an assault SWAT Team. Helpful tips whilst visiting the area include; Do not look at people in the eye as the red glow of their eyes balls may be the last thing you see; Do not bring cash in the area unless your last will and testament is recent and legal and anyway you will need a credit card or cheque book to cover the bill for any food you may order i.e a 1 metre x 30cm pizza starting at $65 (Margerita) at one of the cheaper restaurants. Although the area is getting tired and old in a not so glamorous way the view of the harbour whilst in protective custody is still nice especially if the intoxicated occupants of the ferries and other vessels sailing past are not yelling abuse or flashing at you.
Restaurant spot. Shops open late and good selection of places to eat
great restaurants. What a great choice of eateries decisions decisions,and what we chose was spot on,and great just walking around soaking up the atmosphere
just a nice view. GO! you need to see it! the restaurants are OK but the views are special.

Darling Harbour. Once again a fabulous place to visit. The views from the Manyley ferry of both Sydney Harbour and Darling Harbour were great. Darling Harbour was really good for an afternoon's sightseeing.

oh sooooo exciting. I loved darling harbour, we looked at the boats/the views/the shops although a pricey place to eat, we did, and loved the fantastic views and watched the sunset, breathtaking,just breathtaking, and then just for us at 10pm they had a firework display... AMAZING!!! just really finished off a perfect evening,
Restaurants galore. Lots of choices, price range and variety. We had lunch at Nick's and the caesar salad was excellent

It's nice -- modern Sydney, but a bit touristic. Darling Harbour is a place to go with kids for the aquarium, maritime museum, etc, and to watch fireworks displays. There's a nice Chinese garden, and it borders on Chinatown. There's a big shopping centre for tourists (do any locals go there???) , and it's pleasant to stroll around. It's interesting when the bridge opens. For years it was seen as a bit of a white elephant, but tourists seem to like it and the atmosphere is quite nice. As more people move into the CBD to live, perhaps Darling Harbour is coming into its own as a place for locals to enjoy too?
Entertainment central. Great place to eat and hang our with so many different restaurants, bars and cafes to choose from.
nice place to watch boats. Felt a bit pushy on the buy somthing now if it be ferry tickets or some music very clean and tidy.
darling harbour. we went to pancakes on the rocks it was good food was lovely then went to hard rock cafe for lunch the food was good a little too big for us but was good

we liked the bungalow 8. We took the ferry here three or four times. We really liked the maritime museum. It is no longer free but for $7, it has a lot of history. It also has an entire area from the USA and it makes you feel good to be allies with Australia. We share a lot of original roots.
plenty for everyone. great for families,would need a week to do everything available

loads of good restaurants. close to everything,lots of good restaurants,to suit all tasts and price,lots to do as well although we were working,china town also is close with barbacue king restaurant very good.

A jewel (of many) in Sydney's crown. Whenever is Sydney, don't miss the opportunity to visit Darling Harbour. Whilst it has a number of attractions, it is simply a great place to wander about and watch the world go by. The place is always full of people and on a fine sunny Sydney day, it sparkles.Both sides of the Harbour are jammed packed with places to eat, and the new Darling Quarter, has increased the number of venues. You couldn't be more spoilt for choice.If you like Circular Quay, you will love Darling Harbour
Fantastic and cosmopolitant. You'd find people from all walks of life, and cheerful ambience.

A Commercial Area of McDonaldland Activites. Shopping, eateries, and the Aquarium and the Maritime Museum. The maritime museum is worth a visit. The shops and the eateries are overpriced tourist traps. Most of the locals don't go here. This is a place to visit quickly while you are at the Aquarium or Maritime Museum. Sydney Harbour has much more a feel of Sydney. This harbor reminded me of McDonald's and Disneyland.
cafe culture. fab, friendly, great bars/eating places, wonderful at night.
Nice area to visit. The aquarium is here & is well worth a visit, rainy day option, remember & take you discount vouchers (you can pick these up @ the airport after you land or on hotel maps etc)

A lovely walk to Darling Harbour. If you have the opportunity, enter the walk from Liverpool street towards the harbour, or from the Chinese friendship gardens. There are many fountains and small parkways along the way that are lovely. The harbour has much to entertain. Fireworks lit the sky each Saturday evening in February. A lovely experience.

Go see it. This is the convention area- lots of shops, big hotels, aquarium. Worth a visit, but not an easy walk to opera, garden, main ferry terminal etc. If you are a tourist, stay near the Rocks- Circular Quay area if you like to walk to main attractions like opera and bridge
tourist trap. catch a ferry somewhere nice like Balmain or Manly instead

Leisure precinct. Sydney is lucky to have this outdoors, harbourside precinct which includes shopping, restaurants and the Convention Centre. Although it is within easy walking access from the city, there is also the light rail and monorail for quick access. The Casino is close by, as well as the Maritime Museum and Sydney Aquarium and the Chinese Gardens, Chinatown. It is a great place to take a walk and also a picnic lunch.
not really very nice.... well what is there except shops at exorbitant prices...i just don't rate it at all there are better conference centers elsewhere but just not in the Sydney CBA...that is all.
touity but ok. well i dont like the vibe or the hsops or the food here - sydney ahs way better offerings to be honest
Amazing. Close to Chinese Gardens. Lots of shops and cafes.
As beautiful as Sydney Harbour. What a great place with so many to do, Aquarium, Imax, shopping, dining or just relaxing at the seaside.A very modern part of Sydney nonetheless amazing.
Over rated. Was there for two hours, mainly because it was so boring that my niece decided to play a game of bowling so as to make it worth while. Shops are very old and not interesting.
Good views. Excellent views, lots of restaurants and bars. Loved it!

Enjoyable, peaceful, lots to do. I've really started enjoying the Darling Harbour area. So many options of places to eat. The Darling Quarter is so hip and modern. Love all the places to sit and relax. Really great place to spend some time.
So commercial. Just nothing but a commercial excersise in getting you to part with cash, lots of it!! Crowed, very crowded.
Attractions. A newly developed site with plenty of interesting places to visit and play.
Good restaurants, interesting museums. You don't have to spend money, just to appreciate the lively atmosphere
Don't bother. A soul-less desolate place with truly terrible shops. Avoid - there's too much to do in Sydney to waste your time here.

The essence of Sydney!. I loved Darling Harbour - lots of fantastic restaurants and bars, especially in the new Darling Quarter area. Felt like the perfect holiday area but you knew you were in the heart of the city also.
restaurants & shopping. some of the best resturant s if you visit darling harbour a must to see if in sydney

A Must for an evening cocktail. If you are in Sydney you must visit Darling Harbour, what a lovely setting for an evening cocktail or two!
Sit, relax and watch the world go by.....
over rated. having said over rated it does have some good eateries and it is a long way for us to travel
Great entertainment. The day we chose to get the monorail to Darling Harbour the Australian Navy band were out performing. Such lovely walks around the area and enjoyed the wall of immigrants.

Make sure to walk the harbor. This is a beautiful harbor (especially at night). Its a great place to walk and enjoy the site and people watch. There are restaurants and good night life. Good salsa dancing on Sunday nights.
Darling Harbour. Stayed in Darling Harbour, great night life, very safe, walk across the bridge!

a fun hub!. This is one of several fun hubs in Sydney. A huge range of dining and drinking experiences. For the kids there are lots of attractions and for the parents nice places to eat. Be careful Friday and Saturday nights, it gets very busy and hectic.
Great for families. The amazing Playground is a thumbs up for the kids although always very busy.

I loved darling harbour!. when i was in Sydney, darling harbour was my favorite place to get food and have a few drinks, at night it lights up and looks pretty cool, on a saturday they have a free fireworks show which i wish i would have seen but was busy on the day.
Great Food & Views. Lots of choice for bars and restaurants, with lovely harbour views.

Romantic dining. Darling Habour is beautiful. The variety of dining is also great but one thing that makes Darling Harbour my favourite place to visit is the stunning views of the water and the lights. I associated Darling Habour with romance. I believe that it is great place to take your date to a more fancy dinner and to spend some time away from the main city roads and cars. I personally love Darling Harbour and still think dining there is romantic.

Absolutely loved staying near the Harbour.. We stayed at the Park Royal Hotel near Darling Harbour and we loved the area. The Harbour is such a nice place to stroll around.They have shops and eating places. It is near the Aquarium, Maritime Museum, Paddy's Market, and much more.The ferries in the Harbour can take you to Tarango Zoo or Circular Quay. It is beautiful at night and I it looked like the night life there was great too.
Family / Tourist updated this summer. A new park and shopping area opened this summer worth a look however keep a watch on your kids, easy to get lost or even hurt on the equipment

Darling Quarter at Darling Harbour - great FREE fun for kids. The new playground, 'Darling Quarter' at Darling Harbour is a great place to spend some time with the kids. There are plenty of climbing ropes, slides, swings, a 21 metre flying fox and a large water play area that has locks, pumps, sluices and buckets. Don't forget to bring towels, the water play is irresistable.It is a large area with plenty of room for everyone, we visited just after New Year and it was very busy but there was still room for everyone. Good shaded areas and close to the tourist information centre and some cafes and shops if you need an ice cream the ones at minus 18 were delicious!
Great location for Dining and Fun. We loved the numerous dining and entertainment options. We enjoyed our visit to the Acquarium too!
Touristy. Not too keen on it.If you haven't anything else to do then go and see it.Wouldn't rave about the restaurants there.
Take a Day. Well it's going to take more than a few hours, so much to do, see, eat & drink..... It's a must for any Sydney visit.

A bit touristic, but still worth going. I've been here many, many times. It's a nice place to just hang out, visit the Imax or Chinese Garden of Friendship, or one of the restaurants. Food is usually very good, but a bit overpriced compared to other Sydney spots, definitely Newtown's King Street

Busy, busy.. Darling Harbour was busy when we visited on a Friday afternoon. We were looking for somewhere for lunch, and everywhere was bursting with people and chatter. We did find a pizza restaurant offering $12 pizzas, which were, unfortunatly, only during happy hour! We did enjoy our lunch there anyway, and sat under the large sails in the cool as we made plans for the weekend.The next day we caught the ferry to Pyrmont and wandered along looking at the boats & submarine before heading into the Hard Rock Cafe for lunch.
Ok. A lot of interesting things to see, but can get pricey and feel crowded.
awesome. darling harbour has it all, shopping, food, entertainment, excitement, live events all year round. not to mention the stunning view

Many places to eat, shop and fun for the kids.. You have so many selections for all tastes and budgets to dine out along the waters edge. Then there is the shopping where you combine your regular stores with those for the tourists too with longer trading hours than your regular suburban shopping centre. On the water you can enjoy a jet boat ride or on land there is the IMAX or the huge play area with swings, slides and climbing equipment.
Fantastic. What a wonderful place to just wonder around everything is here. Very pleasant. Melbourne needs something like this

don't miss nightly fireworks. some food place are overrated but generally all fairly reasonable. Excellent vibe, especially in the evenings. King street wharf should also be enjoyed while here (past the Aquarium).
Take your kids. Fantastic water and sand play area at the head of Darling Harbour. Completely free and will delight little ones in swimming togs.
Over Commercialised. Not for families in the evenings. Long walk to everywhere. Over priced food. Over priced shops
Too hyped. This area is looking tired. The restaurants feature ordinary service but at reasonable prices. Still fun to ride the monorail from the CBD.
Many restaurants and bars. Excellent location for friday and saturday nights with street arts, live music and fireworks

New addition to Darling Harbour. If you have children do visit the new "Darling Quarter" which has a wonderful water feature play area along with swings, slides and sandpits. Do remember to take swimming costumes and towels as they will get soaked here.
Great fun for children and fun for parents to watcW too.

Spot the tourist. Not a locals hang out. Cockle Bay / King St Wharf opposite is better for dinner, and the new Darling Quarter is not bad either. Free films in the park in summer. Good kids playground - very very popular by the look of it - it is often packed!!

Darling it is. We visited Darling Harbour on each of the ten days we spent in Sydney. It's an attractive place, especially for families. There's a wonderful recreation area for children, who can also splash around in the water features. Lots of restaurants to suit all tastes and a very good food hall. Maritime Museum, light house, ferries, cinema, close to China Town and City Market. A must visit place.

great playground. Darling harbour has a great children's playground, and easy way to spend an hour or two. We visited the aquarium which was interesting for a few hours. The powerhouse museum is also a short walk away.

One of my favourite haunts. I hate the traffic but I love this harbour city and especially its many harbour front precincts like Darling Harbour, which allows locals and visitors alike to spend their day with family and friends either on a shoe string budget with a picnic or packed lunch OR at one of the many eateries surrounding the Darling harbour waterfront.On our last visit on Saturday, and the same on most of our other visits, we saw young children enjoying a swim in the man-made fountains and waterway features which criss-cross the walkways. Family and friendship groups either sitting on the grass or the many park benches and cafes dotting the area. We stopped in at the iconic Hard Rock Cafe for sustenance and to drink in the view after attending a Travel expo at one of the halls at the Convention Centre. Adjacent to Chinatown and with the Sydney Aquarium, The Cockle Bay Wharf area, IMax theatre, pubs, hotels, nightclubs, apartment blocks and eateries all sitting within the Darling Harbour locality, the area is abuzz day or night with residents and patronage especially on weekends of the many harbour cruises.Another inexpensive sightseeing item to add to any local or visitors list. If travelling by car we found easy access as we parked at the Darling Quarter carpark which was just $6 for all day Saturday parking and the lift deposited us right near the Chinese Friendship Gardens.
Fantastic place!. Loved Darling Harbour! Vibrant place full of nice bars and restaurants. Well worth a visit
what a lovely place. Right close to our apartment, neat shops, good eating places, nice family atmosphere, felt safe!!

Great restaurants and fabulous view. I was staying very near to here, so visited daily. My favourite restaurants are the Festival Cafe on level 1 and the Waterfront Grill. I loved sitting having a drink and dinner with the panorama of Cockle Bay and the CBD spreading out in front of me - stunning!

Love the Harbour!. Darling Harbor was another of my favorite spots in Sydney. The maritime museum and aquarium are in this area. There are many restaurants and bars lining the water around, as well as hotels. Darling Harbour is a short walk from the CBD. You can also take a bus or train.

Very touristy!. Of all the places we went in Sydney I liked Darling Harbour the least. Lots and lots of restaurants with touristy menus and poor service. All the typical tourist attractions. Walked the entire length and did nothing. Worthless.

A Great place for kids. We were there during the summer holidays in january and it was packed with families enjoying the free water features, fountains and pools which the kids love. It epitomises the Australian outlook that if you are going to introduce these things make them user freindly, build them so kids can enjoy them. If this was in London everything would be done to stop kids splashing about in them, here it designed to do exactly the oposite. On the down side it can be avery expensive place to eat and drink but then this is the very heart of one of the great cities of the world.
A fun place to visit.. Lots to do for all ages. Great restaurants and attractions. Imax cinema is fantastic.Not to be missed on your 1st Sydney visit.

Eating paradise. Lots of places to eat and all different nationalities to choose from. Lots of wine bars too. Only down side was there was a brawl one night when we were there and somebody fell into the marina and drowned!!
always something to do. Went to the aquarium for the first time and found it great value
Wonderful View. Great place to meet up with friends and family, enjoy the views and the food all in one place

Bring the kids. Darling Harbor has some fantastic places for your kids (or grandkids!). The Wildlife Experience, the Sydney Aquarium, and one of the best playgrounds I've ever seen. Take 'em on a spin on the Monorail (unlimited pass all day) and you get a discount at many of the sites. There's easy walking between everything, but splurge on the little tram-train for the kids. After dark, the restaurants and pubs (including the Hard Rock - Sydney) are tops.
Wonderful!. So much to do. Awesome restaurants, shops, Imax, Aquarium, clubs, pubs and more! Check out Pancakes on the rocks and the biggest Imax screen in the world!
Great. The greatest harbour in the world...Great scenery, endless sightseeing, dining, adventure, entertainment and nightlife. Easily the best part of Sydney in my opnion

A great spot in Australia. Just the position of Darling Harbour is great, always lots of people especially on w/ends and holidays so there is buzz, there are places there that offer excellent tourist experiences.

Mixed Box of Dice. One side of Darling Harbour is King Street Wharf and Darling Park, on the other side is Harbourside and the Australian National Maritime Museum. King Street Wharf and Darling Park consist of more or less upmarket restaurants and bars. Regrettably, Harbourside is now a collection of cheap shops and medium quality restaurants and noisy bars. But it's a nice walk around the foreshore, there are nice fountains for children to jump around in, and a few small parks to relax. As with anything close to the water, prices everywhere are a bit over the top.

Great atmosphere. Plenty for everyone no matter what age.. There are so many restaurants to choose from that everyone will be satisfied. THere is a cinema, shoppping complex, boat trips of different sorts, kids swimming / wading area / parks etc to keep everyone happy.
Very Active Area. There are many things to do here, food, tourism sites, activities, etc.. but be sure to stop in and eat at the Chinta Ria -- great Malaysian food.
A_great_walk. Full_with_restaurants_and_pubs_with_good_food_you_cant_go_wrong!!
oodles of options and some spectacular scenery. restaurants as far as the eye can see, great bars, great views. its all good here.
Fantastic Nightlife. We loved this place, good restaurants and fabulous firework displays

Best part of the City. We were in a hotel that was about 15 mins walk from Darling Harbour and Harbourside so we visited every day we were there.It was the Chinese New Year celebrations and on the Saturday and Sunday they held the Dragon Boat races.Also for the month of February they are having a firework display on the Sat night at 9 pm. And Sydney does know how to do fireworks, as every New Year we see it on our teles.There are ferries leaving Central Quay for Darling harbour all the time and that gives you a chance to see the city from the water, Harbour side has a huge shopping mall and loads of eateries. from al la carte resturaunts to macdonalds,There is also the Imax theatre, an Aquarium and a small wildlife arena.There is also the Maritime Museum.In the evening you may have street acts, that entertain you.There are water features that are in the walkways that children can interact with, together with a huge childrens playground, that isnt frequented by druggies, or vandals and I can honestly say I didnt see any graffiti at all, not in the areas I went to.
Great Place. Lots of great inexpensive shopping done here, wonderful views. Took ferry from Circular Quay several times and it was great just to see the Bridge and Opera House.

Dinner & drinks or just chill out. you can do either at Darling Harbour. During the day its pretty laid back, with the water cooling the wind during hot days. You'll always find people just sitting around the harbour chilling or catching some sun. There's a lot of restaurants to choose from though be warned, it is a tourist area, so its a tad bit more expensive. If you go towards the Chinese Garden of Friendship to Tumbalong Park, there's a new huge playground a bunch of new restaurants too. Sometime in the afternoon, the street performers start setting up and perform for the crowds. The performances include riding a unicycle, juggling fire, balancing acts, hoola-hoops, etc. At night the harbour is at its best. The colorful lights reflecting on the water makes for an awesome photo-op. The bars & restaurants starts getting loud with music and talk from well-dressed folks having a few drinks. On Saturday nights at 9AM (I believe) they have fireworks which is always a crowd favorite.
plenty to see. the aquarium was very good, really well presented and exciting but the zoo is aimed at children and is pretty poor
greaaaat!. during day or night,everything happens around here! the best bars and clubs,the shoppings and reataurants! it's a nice and lively place. Try to stay around here! it really worthy!
So lively. So much to see and do. The Chinese Gardens are a must, the Marine museum, just walking round and sitting eating watching the world go by. Don't miss it.

Almost too commercial. Probably more appealing to a tourist, there is little to like for a local with its mass commercialism.
For many, you go there for meetings or trade events at the Exhibition/Conference centre.
Without those, I'm not sure what else would take you there.
Nicks Restaurant. Great food and really child friendly. All of the restaurants in this area have good views over the habour area and they are easy to get to from the main shopping district.

At least half a day. To much to do: chinese garden, Marine Museum, Aquarium.
50 restaurants, 300 shops, movie theaters.
The best place to buy Ozzie souvenirs, and than cross to the other side and have drink and relax.
Walking distance from the city, or the ferry from Circular Quai.
Dont take the monorail, its silly.
Excellent day out. Free fireworks show every saturday. Was really good and street performers also. Easy to find.
beautiful site, good place to walk, seat in the restaurant. beautiful site, good place to walk, seat in the restaurant

Great place to grab dinner!. We ate at Olivo in Darling Harbour and had the best lasagna and gnocchi. They have an evening dinner special that includes an entree, main and beverage and seating near the water. People are out and about and its great people watching. It's a MUST see in Sydney. The aquarium, Imax, maritime musuem and small shopping center are located there. It's walkable or accessible by the light rail or monorail.
Magic at night. Picturesque, packed with restaurants, naval museum ships to visit. Beautiful at night with lights around harbout. Where Australia Day special concert takes place.

Excellent atmosphere and sightseeing. Darling Harbour has to be one of the most interesting places to visit, from shopping to eating in various restaurants while overlooking the water. Imax theatre is great and great place to stroll around just soaking up the atmosphere.
Pretty but a bit touristy. Go for the ribs at Hurricanes!!! Everything else is overpriced. Views are great
Good to see. Great to see Fire works here when they are celebrating something. The Chinese Garden is defiantly worth a visit.
Spend a day or two. Easily spend a day or two in Darling harbour to much to see and the best eateries are here. Safe for all the family with many tourist attractions

Tourists Love It and you should too. So many things to do in one place. The Aquarium, restaurants, the new amazing playground complete with kid addicting water play, IMAX, Wildlife World, bars, shopping, a beautiful old fashioned carousel, a free maritime museum, Japanese gardens, ferris wheel, close to Chinatown and so much more . In addition, this seems to be the home for special events like fireworks and cultural celebrations. This place is great if you can get over being "too cool for school."
Darling Harbour only at Kings wharf. Thursday night at Kings Wharf, just waiting to have a meal..happy hour between 5 and 6 and people watching.
Elegance. The view from my hotel. You can be busy or just sit and watch the world go by.
Don't bother. Nothing here....move along. Nothing here move along.
The Darling of Sydney. The best way to approach Darling Harbour is on a ferry from Circular Quay. The little Darling is foody central so be prepared for a gastronomical feast.

Public money well spent to redevelop Darling Harbour. Very well thought out redevelopment and wide range of vibrant ongoing activities for families, couples, tourists, and business types after work make the Darling Harbor area a welcome addition to the Sydney city experience. Many cities around the world have tried and failed to create a second or even third quality public programming area for the well heeled and the rest of us. Sydney as succeeded in spades. Well done!

Delightful Location. What a great place to base yourself when in Sydney. Darling Harbour has literally everything you could possibly want. Starting with fantastic views and dozens of restaurants, Sydney Aquarium, another great place to spend half a day, boat rides around the harbour, great hotels, cinema complex with a giant screen, nearby gardens, shopping centres etc, etc. A visit to magnificent Sydney without spending a whole day or two at Darling Harbour would be a sin, it's a must do.

Fun place with kids. Former railways goods yard redeveloped in the 1980's into a tourist precinct. Lots of places to eat and often has free street entertainment especially weekends and school holidays. Very popular with families

Ugly tourist trap. It baffles me that Darling Harbour is considered a drawcard. There are so many other attractions that Sydney has to offer. Darling Harbour is incredibly ugly, with the vibe of a large Westfield Shopping Centre. It is very much pitched at tourists - tacky shops and "attractions", overpriced eating houses. Prepare for an expensive day out with not much to show for it.

great day out. Darling Harbour has it all for a family day out. From restaurants for any budget to attraction such as Aquarium and Wildlife World.You can go to Imax for a movie or just walk around and sit at outdoor spaces and gaze at the world. Anyone of any age would have a great day or night out.
Beautiful Place. We loved this location and were particularly taken in how clean it was and the facilities were brilliant. We walked down here everyday and spent some time in the restaurants.

The place to go in summer. l travel to Sydney 4-6 times a year, Darling Harbour is one of best attractions in Sydney, there are heaps of places along the Harbour to eat, there are place with out door sitting area's. Sitting along the Harbour would be the most relaxing space anyone could ever want. There is heaps of public transport that gets ou to Darling Harbour, you can opt an early start or a late public transport is very flexiable, even the walk from China town not far. There is a lot of accomodation around Darling Harbour as well. Must see place.

Much to do for the family. Lovely chinese garden - specially in Spring (Sept. Oct, Nov.) Many attractions for children - IMax Theatre, Aquarium. Maritime Museum, play area, restaurants and shops. It also has Conference Centres and near Casino and Hotels. Busy city area.
A Little Gem. Smaller and less busy than Sydney Harbour, this place has a great selection of shops and restaurants on the waterfront. Worth a visit for a night out.

atmosphere!. lined with restaurants there's no other place to be on Australia Day eve- book yourself a terrace table to get the best view of the fireworks! Lots else to see- a very good Maritime Museum and submarine in harbour. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay or the Monorail from the city.

touristy but worth a visit. Darling harbour does feel a bit like a tourist trap but there are some really neat places worth visiting whilst there. The chinese gardens are stunning and a great antedote to the hustle and bustle of Sydney. There are quite a few cafes located on or around Darling harbour and most are pretty reasonable

Transformed from a working harbour into a tourist paradise.. Darling Harbour was once considered the working side of Sydney which has been transformed into a wonderful place for locals and tourist to enjoy the fine food and wine that is to on offer plus you get the magnificent view of the city and the Exibition Halls to the Convention Centre and the night life.
Pretty but very commercial feel. Pretty area and buildings along the harbor, but just another touristy area, in my opinion. Much more interesting places to visit in Sydney.

Nice setting but just a big shopping mall. Darling Harbor did not have the good feel that the rest of Sydney has. On one side are the harborside shops and restaurants and the other is King's Wharf which were both just average. For those thinking of seeing Wildlife World, go to the zoo instead. This was next door to Madame Tussaud's Wax World if that's any indication as to what to expect. A quick pass will satisfy your curiosity but that's about it.

Wont beat Sydney harbour but lovely all the same.. Its a great spot for attractions, the wildlife park, maritime museum, aquarium and imax. You can catch the monorail from there too and if looking for a romantic meal there are many lovely restaurants. Its also closer to the city than Sydney harbour.
lovely. love this area of sydney. would happily spend the day wandering around the harbour

Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is close to the city centre - you can walk to it, and offers a whole range of shopping and eating experiences for the visitor. Pricing is reasonable, and if you don't like it, the city is a mere 10 minutes wallk away. Theer's plenty of accommodation options as well as high quality conference, exhibition, and entertainment venues.
Interesting. Loads of slightly expensive restaraunts. Some are great others not so good

Over rated views. Nothing special, just a little harbour in the midst of the commercial area of Sydney.Over rated restaurants dot along the bay, pesky beggars, litter & foul smell every -where, un-even walk ways, old out-dated infrastructure,

Food and entertainment. Darling Harbour is part of the 'newer' part of sydney. There are a range of things here that people come for fun and entertainment. There are numerous good restaurants and bars at both harbour side and cockle bay, theres a bowling alley, laser tag, wildlife park, playground, Chinese Gardensand IMAX cinema. Often there is free entertainment on weakends and festivals held in tumbling park.

Must see! Has so much to do you'll need almost a full day!. Darling Harbour is full of shops, restaurants, excursions, etc. A visit to Sydney is not complete without a visit to Darling Harbour. Its near the casino, the wildlife park, aquarium, the entertainment complex and tons of great restaurants. If you're there at dusk or night, the view of the city and the Harbour Bridge will astound you!
Great day out. I enjoy a day here as I feel like I am on holidays even although I live in the outskirts of Sydney

Great place to walk around. Some very nice bars, shops and restaurants here. My favorite place in Sydney. Take a ferry to here from Sydney harbour and you get a very nice view as you arrive into Darling harbour. Some beautiful yachts parked in the marina and a great place to explore or just sit and people watch. They also have the worlds largest cinema screen here, the LG IMAX which is the same size as an eight story building.
Popular spot. Lots of people seem to flock here. There are many restaurants but none that are above average. The music never seems to stop although I wished it would. Often crowded.Good fireworks

Great for a stroll, visiting an attraction or for food.. Varied space near and on the water. Easily accessed by ferry but you can drive or take a taxi or walk from Downtown Sydney. The Convention Centre often hosts displays such as the Holiday Day Show, Fitness Show but even then the area is not too crowded. The Restaurants are often expensive. Better to venture behind this area to find cheaper eateries but then you miss out on the view. Walk across the Piermont Bridge so you can view it all.

Lots to do, and great place to see fireworks.. Darling Harbour has a lot to offer - a lovely view adjacent to the CBD; IMAX in Sydney has the biggest screen; Sydney Aquarium has two dugongs in captivity (they are sooooo cute!), making up for the lack of killer whales or dolphins; some of the restaurants are very tourist-focused and not that great, check the reviews online first; take a stroll to the Star casino, if you'd like.
Well worth the visit. Be sure to catch the aquarium and Wild Life Sydney.
Lovely spot for dinner and drinks. Great variety of restaurants and entertainment, have been here several times when visiting Sydney. Great place to stay in Sydney for tourists.
Great spot on the inner harbour. lots of shops,restaruants and plenty of things to do and see.
This is the place to be!. Loads of restuarants and bars, shops and a lot of biz.
Modern Sydney. Developed during the preparations for the Sydney Olympics (2000) and now the modern centre for walking, eating and boating.
Nice place to visit. It is a great place for toruist and good to spend one afternoon with fun and good food there.

Not to be missed!. I've been in Sydney for a little over a week and i've fallen in love with the harbour!The harbour boasts an array of fantastic bars and restaurants that cater for all budgets with some fantastic views.I'd strongly recommend the Meat and Wine Co. situated next to the water and enjoyed cocktails at the Hard Rock Cafe whilst overlooking the water. The harbour is a hive of activity throughout the day and evening and offers an amazing, free firework display every Saturday evening. There is a park for children and families and lovely grassy areas for people to relax on or spend time socialising with friends. Well worth a visit if you're in the Sydney area!
place to be. Darling Harbour has it all Restaurants, night life, bars, gardens , hotels, aquarium, boats , convention center it doesn't stop.

Sydneys great White Elephant. Don't go to this tourist trap. Apart from Kings Street Wharf, there is nothing but overpriced terrible restaurants here. Best one, is the steakhouse under the flyover freeway.

The latest in children's entertainment. I went with my daughter and grandson after several previous visits (which proved most of the comments listed here by others). I was pleasantly surprised by the newly created children's play area at the back of the harbour (South), which contains inventive and also instructive devices to keep kids entertained (and cool!). Occasional shows and participative activities by musicians / performers. Plenty of facilities to quench a thirst or appetite afterwards.
Wonderful. A great example of how the city transformed a once dead area into a place for leisure and entertainment.
Touristy, but.... Although a popular tourist attraction, an early mornong breakfast in the sun or a late afternoon cocktail is always more enjoyable by the water.
The Best. Darling Harbour is like no other in the world. Just to sit and have a drink and people watch is just great. There is so much to see and do and the veiws are superb. Shopping is fantastic.
Modern, exciting part of the city. Very modern, many attractions great for the foriegn tourist

Loads of restaurants and shops. This area of Sydney was great- lots of shops and restaurants surrounding the Darling Harbour. Was there for Australia day so fireworks and a great buzz around the place.
Very touristy. If you are a true tourist, you must visit Darling Harbour! Very overpriced but worth every cent. Lovely restaraunts and pubs. And the bvie, awesome!

Do not miss. Darling harbor for me was the best, lots of places to eat. Loved the bridge when it opened to let large ships through was great to see it open. Also easy access to the mono rail on either side of the harbor.

People-watch or party. There is so much to do and see here. The Aquarium is a must, and when we go back in March, we'll visit the Wildlife Centre next door. The ferries were crowded, so we didn't use them this time, but eating and drinking are well-catered for, and reasonably priced.

Great attractions. Liked all the park and walk areas around the Darling Harbour and loved the signs directing you to all the different attractions. Would recommend visiting the Chinese garden of friendship

Perfect spot for dining or having a drink with a view of the harbour. What a gorgeous spot! There are loads of restaurants to choose from in Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf. You can sit and enjoy a drink or meal while people watching and looking out to the harbour. The restaurants turn into bars at night which are popular amongst the younger crowd so be prepared for the music to be cranked up!

Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay are good for a wander when you're hungry. Darling Harbour is a shopping and eating precinct and Cockle Bay is the other side of it. You can walk around the foreshore. There are myriad restaurants and coffee shops and the atmosphere's cool and casual. The Imax theatre with its gigantic screen, the Aquarium and the little zoo with all the Ozzie rare animals like crococdiles, cassowaries, kangaroos and emus (not that they are rare !) and koalas provide a broad spectrum of entertainment for family members of all ages. The Convention and Exhibition Centre is also at Darling Harbour.
Great place for restaurants. Massive place and so much to do. Take the ferry there and choose one of many restaurants and bars. Great way to spend a day and the ferry journey is great.

Great atmosphere. This place is fantastic! Great for couples, singles and families alike. Young and old. There is a great variety of restaurants and bars to spend the evening, most with outdoor seats! A playground for kids, and right near a zoo and aquarium. My favourite area in Sydney.

pubs, parties by the river !. nice place by the water side , full of pubs , we went on a friday and stayed the weekend ...not a family destination at night except if you take the night cruises , which we did , although it was very average both in terms of food and the entertainment ( show boat cruises ) ...but day time there is the sydney aquarium for the kids , which again is ok ....but all in all its about the atmosphere and soaking in the sun by day and the pubs by night
Always something to do. Lots of shops, close the things for the kids, restaurants.
love it. always something exciting going on, the imax is great and all of the surrounding restraunts and attractions
Darling Harbor. A nice walk from Hyde Park area. walking over the bridge provides some nice photo ops.
Good place for families to stay. Lots of walks and activities for young and old alike. Easy access to ferries. We loved the monorail.

Good places to eat. Had a number of nice meals out in Darling Harbour. It's pretty touristy obviously, so therefore not the best value for money, but nice to sit out with a meal and beer in the evening in the summer.
Family fun. Very close to were we stayed. The restaurants were very expensive but understandable being in the area they are in. Loved the maritime museum and the park area for the kids.

Excellent Sight Seeing with fun and enjoy with family. One can enjoy and see all by travelling in a cart train. Also children can enjoy in water park and also there are lot of eating place in the area. This area is in the heart of the city. One can have lot of shopping from this place.
If you love eating.... Lots of eateries for those wanting to wine and dine with great views

If you can't find something to do...you're hard to please. My husband and I were at Darling Harbour on Saturday for jet boating (don't worry the boats move slowly around the public spaces so not noisy). Highly recommend the ride for the adventurous (or perhaps a more sedate water taxi, ferry ride, etc). My husband hadn't been to Darling Harbour before; I hadn't been for several years. I thought it was even better than my previous experiences (usually passing through to visit the attractions surrounding the harbour - aquarium, entertainment centre, powerhouse museum, Imax cinema).There are dozens of eateries and restaurants: (we ate at Pancakes on the Rocks - first visit, very good food - didn't even know there was one at Darling Harbour, too). Hard Rock Cafe; several seafood restaurants; floating restaurants; foods from many styles and nationalities; favourites like Subway. Some restaurants might be best booked if you want to make an early decision, have a group to accomodate, or if events are on that will bring in crowds.Most prices I saw were in keeping with the standard of the restaurants/shop (not expensive just because of location). Most restaurants have menu and prices displayed outside, so no surprises.Lots of boutique shops (to an Australian, everything seemed to be Australiana, but I've discovered shops here before that I would buy from, so take this comment with a grain of salt). Galleries, clothing shops, lolly shops, etc - good for a browse.There are usually museums and other exhibitions, but these will depend on schedules and when they are open. We were there on Sunday and weren't looking so you'd be best to look up some Sydney Tourism sites or specific interest sites to find out. There is a Chinese Garden which is very popular. The queue to get in was huge on Sunday but the recent Chinese New Year is probably responsible for that. We couldn't see a sign for price, etc, sorry.Now, for families...apart from the attractions mentioned before (which have entry fees) there is no end of things for the children to do...free. Extensive water play streams and fountains and a huge park with slides, climbing equipment, its own water play fountain, rides (don't know if there is a cost). Expect a crowd but everyone seemed to be having fun. Expect to be able to take a seat, but you'll need to monitor the kids, especially younger ones.There's a monorail station and the monorail runs above the harbour. I believe there are plans to remove this; we were surprised it was still there.And if a walk in the perfect Sydney sunshine is a bit much, many courtesy trains are running around, just hail the driver.We didn't see half of the area in the few hours we were there. It would be worthwhile to do some research or find a tourist map at the harbour to help see the things you want to see.Note: We parked in the 'Convention and Exhibition Centre' carpark as it was very close to where we were going. However as the centre was closed we had to exit the carpark along one of several corridors (marked as stairwells) which DID have a short flight of stairs to go up. This could be a struggle for disabled, families, elderly. On the way out of the carpark we saw signage for a disabled exit towards the other end of the carpark. Be aware if you have trouble with stairs as there is no signage at the Convention Centre end.Get there! You'll love it!
So much to do and see!. Darling Harbour has so much to do, see, eat and buy! Recommend a day there in your walking shoes. Must see the wildlife world & aquarium!

So much activity!. Darling Harbour is a great spot to dine, explore, and relax. With plenty of dining options, from a food court to classy restaurants, you are sure to find something within your budget. And with the recent water feature/park development, the whole family can enjoy some fun day or night.

Full of interesting things to see and do.. Loads to see, do and places to shop. Lots of choices of places to eat but take a full wallet....its expensive! THe tourist information centre here is staffed by very knowledgeable sydneysiders and help to book trips, advise on trips and even where to see the fireworks on Hogmany.

Nice place for everyone!. Perfect place to chill out, lots of cafes, kids play areas, water play, shops, we spent a few hours there catching up with family and friends then it was a short walk to Chinatown.

New Sydney attractions. I have not visited this area for years and was deligthed to see the restaurants and fun atmosphere along the Kings Wharf area. Very vibrant with lots of happy sounding people in the eating and bar areas. Great for walking as quite flat
harbour delights. wonderful place to visit ,lots of restaurants and fun to be had by all

Outstanding park for kids, awesome atmosphere. 10 years ago it was ghost town, now it is a vibrant place. Amazing park with water races, slides, flying foxes that had my kids 8 and 9 spend 2 hours easily at each day - free! They also had a kids movie outside on the lawn at 7pm every night for free and provided chairs and mats. Cafes numerous and all looked fantastic, harbour setting gorgeous. Best of all it felt extremely safe, was clean and family friendly. Huge asset to Sydney.
Catching up with Harbour bridge. This harbour is really good and up and coming it will be a competitor in a few years for the harbour bridge
Animal interest. Visited Sydney Wild Life, the best aspect of which was handling an emu egg, a large stick insect and photographing the large crocodile.
Darling harbour. That's it..... a money pit for average everything.People hate rip offs.

Made a special trip here- not worth it- like a U.S. mall. This is not worth it- like a cheesier version of South St Seaport in NY or Quincy Mkt/ Faneuil Hall in Boston--- crossed with Mall of America. Not a great place- not great restaurants- just big, but not distinctive. And, some seedy characters hanging around. i would skip it on any future trips to Sydney
