Something for everyone. 20 years ago it was just derelict space, now it has shops, restaurants and entertainment for all.We visited a number of the restaurants as well as some retail therapy for the girls. Didn't do the Aquarium but heard it is quite good. Did do it at night - great fun, and did take the monorail.If you plan to visit Sydney put it near the top of your list.
Such a pretty harbour. Great place to sit and watch the world go by (with a glass of beer of course!). Great choice of bars and restaurants.
Best part of Sydney. Lovely play area with water fountains for children. Nice to stroll around day or night

Made better by the attractions there.. Darling Harbour is to Sydney what Docklands is to London. The same effort has been made to revitalise the area after the end of stevedoring. The maritime museum and some of the restaurants make the place. There is a good children's playground if you are travelling with kids.

Great place for family fun.. Darling Harbour has everything for the whole family. The Sydney Maritime Museum, the Sydney Aquarium, a water park, playground, picnic areas with outdoor ping pong tables, movie theater, tons of restaurants and shops... It is fun place to go for the whole family.

Great Dining & Attractions Area. Darling Harbour, walking distance from the city, is a very trendy harbour area with tons of dining and nightlife options. There are also some top tourist attractions here.
Worth a visit if in Sydney....although you can walk, its a nice cruise if you take the water taxi from Opera House to Darling Harbour.....great views of the city!

A huge entertainment area next to the CBD. Big and modern is the best how this huge entertainment area can be described. Plenty of places to eat and have fun. Everyone will find something to do there.

Darling harbour kids play ground area. Fantastic play ground area for the kiddies, on a hot day make sure you take swimmers and towel for kids as the rock floating foundation and spurt fountains are a favourite for the kids.
Beautiful cove. Darling Harbour is an inner city cove with yachts and boats. The area has great restaurants and many shops. A definite place to visit
One of Sydney's better entertainment areas.. There's restaurants, jet boat rides, iMax, an Aquarium, a Maritime Museum and the list goes on. You could easily spend the day here.

So lively!. Gorgeous at night, the home of the aquarium, Powerhouse Museum and Imax Cinema (and more) always pulses with energy. The Harbourside shopping centre stays open late at night and has a great food court, which is very convenient. Try Pakwan, an Indian food outlet where you get good-sized plates of curries cooked to order for about $15 dollars. Oh yes, the Copenhagen ice cream kiosk opens late too!
Love it. Love coming here. Walking around, taking in buskers, great food options, IMAX. never come to Sydney without coming here. A must!!
Sydney. The fact that it displays some of the finest attractions that Sydney has to offer right on the water edge.
Lovely little place to eat. Very pretty place! Lovely places to eat in the evening or a snack during the day!! I loved this place!! Quaint!!

BEAUTIFUL. This area is lovely and has had much development prior to the Sydney Olympics. The Maritime Museum is here, the monorail, and some of the most beautiful cityscapes that Sydney has to offer. Well worth the trip over---take the monorail here and the Ferry back.

Lots to see and do. This is the most touristy of the areas in Sydney, as has the IMAX (largest in the world), aquarium, maritime museum, a massive shopping mall and much more, all centred round the harbour. Or like us, you can sit on the wharf eating ice-cream and people watch! We had caught the ferry to Darling Harbour, and wouldn't have seen that side of Sydney otherwise, so definitely would recommend this method of transport. Otherwise, you can walk from George Street easily, or catch bus or mono rail.

Plenty to do and see here. There is the Imax theatre where movies are shown on a huge screen Also there is the Maritime museum and if the tall ship is in there are often tours over it and the museum itself is full of information for those that love anything to do with the seaThe Sydney Aquarium and wild life is also here Darling harbour can also be reached by walking around the waterfront from the rocks areaThere are plenty of boats to watch going in and out restaurants are varied and plentyThe Sydney Casino is a short walk away

Liked it lots. With a great celection of restaurants and quick eateries, a beautiful view, ambience, nice gardens and so close to the Chinese gardens, this made it a great place to spend a day. We took the monorail as well and then strolled around the city. Wonderful city.
Great Place to Spend a Day. Nice place to stroll around. Many restaurants and the wonderful Sydney Aquarium. Also, Imax Theatre right there.

great new splash playground for kids !. new since a couple of months ago - the new kids playground called Darling Quarter http://www.darlingquarter.com/ is a delight for small kids (an 11yo said she was too old for it - but some adults seem to like climbing the rope ladders, etc.) - particularly the wet area - channels with gates to open/close to divert the flow, sluice wheels to turn and pour water, great interactive fun for kids and there's usually some half of completely naked just enjoying the on/off splash of water from the concrete.There's a rope pulley ride, slippery dips (very popular), sandboxes, cafes, hours of fun for little kids amongst many others.Beware too hot day - as it will be completely crowded and unpleasant - better a warm day earlier or later - rainy or cold may be empty, but hey try your luck - you may love it as much as I do (I live nearby) !
take the ferry from the rocks to darling. lots to see and lots to do , plus you can shop till you drop
A Great place wit so much too see and do.. Every thing is there, the resturants, the aquarium, the wild life museum, the monorail, centre tower is a short walk, so much to do and see at your lesiure.

Great place for a day spend if you have kids. Although aquarium is a bit old - still great value and delight and beautiful collection.
Get a combined ticket aquarium and wildlife park
Wildlife park also very educational.
Attractove. Darling Harbour is an attractive location, worth a visit.

There's allot to do here. This is a great place to see by day and by night, you can jump on the monorail here and it will take you to the CBD but you can also easily get back. There's allot of fine restaurants and dinning places around and the Maratime Museum, Chinese gardens, power house museum and Sydney Star Casino ate all in very easy walking distance? Tried a few different restaurants,they are reviewed separately. Good place the IMAX theatre Is great too.

Lots of dining options. My husband and I walked to Darling Harbour one evening and were surprised at the number of restaurants. One high-end restaurant after another. We looked at the posted menus, and it didn't look like there were many vegetarian options, so we didn't end up eating there.Darling Harbour has any interesting fountains, and the area looked like it would be a neat place to visit during the day. There is also a shopping mall which has a variety of stores, including souvenir, clothing, and accessory shops.Darling Harbour is also home to the Australian National Maritime Museum (it wasn't open when we were at the harbour).We didn't have much time, but it looked like Darling Harbour would be a fun place to spend a day.
Lovely. Lovely bars and places to eat, really nice at night too.
Busy on weekends. Great place for people watching, exhibitions, walking, close to Chinatown, IMAX cinema, and lots more for tourists or a great day out in Sydney

Touristy, but worth it. Yes it is full of tourists, but I realised I was one of them!! You should be able to find whatever food takes your fancy here. We ate at the ship that's docked on the other side. Lots of shops and if you're lucky, waterborn displays/stunts.
Great area. Great to wonder around here, taking in the sights and watching people and boats come and go. Lots of restaurants, and a very pretty city location

Sydneys Jewel. Darling Harbour is a mecca of entertainment and I don't mean the street entertainers, just people watching is very entertaining. The Dining choices are amazing and no shortage of establishments

Nice. A nice place to stroll around or just to relax and do some people watching, their are plenty of attractions and the uni rail is close by, to take you to many of Sydney's recommended visit spots, it is an ideal meeting point and the harbour has some magnificent yachts docked to make us jealous :)
The Highlight. I love Darling Harbour, I walk through it everyday to go to work. Again, I have never got bored of Darling Harbour, great views, great restaurants and perfect for an evening stroll.

worth one visit. Touristy, but worth a visit once for looking at the ensemble. Visit the Aquarium and the Maritime Museum. Harbourside is a giant tourist trap but has one or two acceptable restaurants.
Beautiful part of Sydney.. This is a great day out with heaps of adventure & eating, playing & site seeing.
Beautiful harbor. While not as nice as Sydney Harbor, it is still a magnificent place to visit in Sydney
Lots to do. Lots of restaurants, attractions and sights to see. Lots of people watching guaranteed. Very close to Casino, Convention Centre. Chinese Gardens and Markets

Fireworks!. Went to Darling Harbour a few times but one particular night they had fireworks display. It was brilliant. Think they were just testing some wee ones for the New Year celebrations!! Lots of lovely shops and eating places.

New playground. Darling Harbour has just installed a new kids playground with a water play feature. It was very hot on the day we visited and there was a big crowd! The area managed to contain the crowd and all the kids seemed to be having a great time. Plenty of stimulating activities for different ages, a couples of climbing ropes courses and larger slides for the bigger kids and the varied water play for the littlies. The only criticism I have of it is that it should have a permanent attendant to pick up the rubbish that thoughtless tourists seemed to enjoy leaving.

What a great area!. This was really a nice area to visit. We took the ferry there and had dinner at "I'm Angus". There were lots of people out and about, and we had never seen such a well-behaved crowd. Lots of restaurants and bars were the attraction. The weather was perfect and everyone was in a good mood. Just a great spot.

Lovely harbour, close to city, lacking in heart. Darling Harbour is conveniently located close to the city with lots of eateries, the IMAX theatre and buskers but it lacks authenticity. The beautiful Pyrmont bridge that swings open to let the tall ships through is part of Sydney's history but there is no synchronicity with the plastic shopping centre and the barn like convention centre. Worth a look but don't plan to stay long.

Worth a visit when I Sydney. Liked breakfast and dinner at the Pyrmont Bridge Hotel located at the end of the Pyrmont Bridge. The IMAX is worth a visit but is a little pricey, find a tour info book discount voucher at the information booth. The hotels in the area are ok to stay at. A good place to sit and have an ice cream or drink in the late afternoon. Good people watching area. The shopping centre is a bit of a tourist trap but ok. The Maritime Museum is located there. If you have small children, there is a great playground behind the IMAX cinema. The Chinese garden is also close by.
Real experience with the aquarium and rain forest. I liked the walk across trhe bridge to Darling harbor, the maritime museam. And the great looking women on a windy day
Great place for a few drinks. Its full of bars and restaurants with a great view. A must visit in Sydney.

Great place to chill out and watch life go by!. Sitting down by the waterfront and taking in the views of the marina and watching people from all walks of life and nationalities drifting past enjoying themselves. Plenty of eateries that cater for the top end of town through to the more budget concious (ie backpacker).
excellant place to walk around. lots to see and do the fish underwater aquarium lots of cafes and restaurants by the harbour awesome place to be

darling habour. What a fantastic place. So many restaurants to chose from to eat dependant upon your budet. $10.00 special for fish & chips and a meatlovers pizza - great value. Also during the month of January make sure you are down there by 8:45pm as there are fireworks to celebrate 2012 every Saturday night.!

Fantastic place to spend the day with the family. The children's playground was AMAZING. Kids are able to play in the fountains which they loved. So make sure you take a change of clothes for them. There are also fantastic restaurants around for the family as well. If going without kids, you would be heading closer the the Hard Rock Cafe area where all the beautiful restaurants are located. Nice to chill with a glass of wine in the evening as the city lights turn on.
Great parks. The new darling quarter park is amazing for kids , really interesting things for kids to play with , will keep them entertained for hours
LOTS TO CHOSE FROM. An open area with a great variety for all to see and experience while there for the day .. from ships to museum type to even a casino in the background .. spend the day there!

Children's Playground. They have recently spent a fortune creating a wonderful 'Children's Playground in Darling Harbour and it is well worth a visit. We went with our grandchildren and they realy enjoyed the many interesting and varied things on offer for children There was also the added advantage that iit was free for all children nd you can easily spend a really enjoyable morning there with young children.But, I couldn't believe the naivety displayed by the designers when all the slides were closed because it was a hot day and, therefore, they would be too hot to use.It does not take too much working out that this will happen every time there is a hot day and so the new slides will spend most of the hot Aussie Summers unusable..Almost all other similar playgrounds in Australia have covered slides and so for such a well known tourist destination to openly exhibit such naivety is particularly crazy and somewhat unforgivable.

Right there between the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Take the public ferries, have some gelato (so much better than ice cream) and just enjoy the sights. Reminds me of Seattle for its compact local walkability.
Family fun area around the harbor. This area is filled with restaurants, aquarium, and other fun family activities. It is one of the stops of the monorail system.
Great vibes. Fantastic restaurants over looking the water. Lot's to see and do, busy but interesting.

A gem of a place. Darling Harbour was near and we went there every day and had breakfast at one of its many cafes (usually the Plate) which was excellent. There was so much to see and do there-walks, childrens play areas for families, shopping malls and many restaurants. You can walk across the Pyrmont Bridge and take the monorail.

Modern Harbour Development. Plenty to do here Maritme museum, Sydney Aquarium , Wildlife Sydney (check out the saltwater croc he must be way over 5 metres long) IMAX cinema Chinese garden many restaurants and bars. Tours ferries leave regularly from the jetties.

Urban Water Park on the Streets - KIDS: Play Time!. We walked through the Darling Harbour shopping mall and literally walked into, what I can on describe as a water park in the middle of a CITY!!!!! Loads of fountains, water sculptures and streams (with clean water) that you could swim and play in......... Our kids did not have their swimming gear but they stripped down to the bear minimum and in they went!! It was a brilliant day and as only our second day in Oz a real eye opener to the way the Ozies do out door so well!!! Beautiful part of the town, I will definitely revisit next time I am down under!
Great for meals and cafes. We enjoyed just sitting with friends and eating at the cafes. There is the museums to look at too. The food seemed cheaper here than Sydney Harbour.
Good IMAX cinema at Cockle Bay. Lots of restaurants and well supported by locals and tourists. We saw Mission Impossible at the IMAX and that was superb

Walk here to get to Casino or just enjoy the area around the museums. You have the Aquarium and Naval museum but also head to the other end to see some lovely open areas, big childrens playground and then the Chinese Gardens, which are well worth seeing close to China Town - where you get excellent chinese food.

FABULOUS!. We go to Sydney often & can't believe how much the Harbour has changed in just a few months. A lot more restaurants - so beautifully clean & lots of street entertainment, great eating & shopping.
Beautiful area. Darling Harbour was beautiful, don't miss any of the harbours.

A Plethora of Restaurants. Both sides of the harbor are filled with restaurants of every type and ethnicity so you can eat at a different one every night and not repeat for more than 2 weeks. Besides eating, there is a shopping mall and an Imax theater, not to mention the weekly fireworks display. There's nothing to dislike unless you don't like being around people.
nice stroll. the Harbour has great night life with lots of restaurants. We enjoyed Blackbird Cafe which had delicious salads and friendly staff.
A great place to take a day. There is a lot to view in Darling harbour so spend the day shopping, take in the sites and have lunch at one of the brilliant restaurants.

Great spot for tourists to hang out in. So much here - heaps of hotels, range of food options from cheap eats to fine dining, wading pool, aquarium, wildlife place, maritime museum, ferry connections, etc etc. Great to just walk around or spend time sitting in a waterside cafe or rooftop bar.
Don't ignore Darling Harbor. Aquarium is interesting, a the zoo is also interesting, great to walk around and see the shops and scenery. Easy to get to by ferry, you should check it out.

Great for kids. Not many cities have room for two tourist harbours, but Sydney does. Darling Harbour has a great playground if you are traveling with kids, as well as many eateries, a shopping mall and a huge IMAX theater.

an oasis in the city. I love visiting Darling Harbour. I love the Chinese Garden at any time of the year. I love the water features in the grounds of Darling Harbour. I really like the food variety in the shopping centre. I love the Maritime Museum. I like the loads of variety for families such as the aquarium, the annual shows with differing subjects. There is always something interesting to see at Darling Harbour no matter when you go.

Just a giant tourist trap. Walked around for 10 minutes and said "get me out of here.". A modern-day tourist trap. Felt like a poor version of Disneyland. Caters more to an Asian market in my opinion....just no feel of Australia to it for me at all.

Darling of a harbour. Great place with lots of dining options some very well priced. Has a real family feel with lots of kids playing in the many water fountains. There is also the Sydney Heritage fleet Museum for those who like to spend time looking at boats

Busy Darling. Impressive sky train to get here. Impressive city skyline, bridge, buildings and general view. Very crowded at Christmas with floating Santas in the harbour, trees on the shore, kids in bouncy castles. Ate in Hard Rock Cafe - waiting 1-1/2 for a table! Loud music and kids screaming. Go when it's quiet. Otherwise nice. Home of Sydney's Aquarium and some good shopping!
Lively and very family oriented. Enjoy the many restaurants and entertainment attactions of the Darling Harbour. It has a beauty all it's own too.
Tourist central. Full of tourists, but pretty and convenient. Go to the aquarium.

Amazing area!. This area is very unique with restaurants surrounding the body of water. It's filled with people on the weekends and beware of the business. Just walking around the area gives you a feel of liveliness and you begin to feel a little Australian. If you're here during Australia Day, make sure you watch the fireworks as it's spectacular and took my breath away. If you want, try to book a restaurant that gives you a view of the fireworks. Be aware of the higher prices in food as the "view" is an extra cost. Otherwise, stand along the edge with the crowd to view the beauty!
Restaurants and ambience. Great restaurants around Darling Harbour and I enjoyed the ambience of Cockle bay and also the new tumbalong park and its surroundings

So much to offer but so little quality.. I expected to see a well preserved harbour area harping back to the days when it was a commercial dock but its now just a poor tourist trap with tacky shops and concrete driveways. The Zoo and Aquarium were the only saving grace, educational and fun for kids / families.

A real touristic area. With all the good restaurants, cafes, nite clubbing and boats cruise which are available easily and not to the highest price. Whales watching and Sydney aquarium is at hand, something not to miss. If you enjoy the area around, you have access for disabled and prams very easily and go up to the swimming people in Ultimo area. Beneath Darling Harbour, Chinatown is 5 min walk and you can enjoy beautiful Asian food.
its ok.... Bit of a tourist trap - over priced bars and restaurants, but alwaays lots to do... festival weekends are great for enjoying the different music, foods, culture etc from around the world
Beautiful area, very busy. We've stayed here 3 times in the past 5 years, also with overseas visitors. A walk at night is a must.
Great tourist spot. It's a bit a tourist trap with lots of souvenir shops, but some good eateries. A little on the expensive side.

Worth a Trip over there. The harbour offered a lot of restaurant choices and also a really cool wildlife park. We didn't expect much from a wildlife park in the harbour, but were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the park and the opportunity to see Koalas and Kangaroos.

Good place to go. Whilst over in Sydney my family and I visited Darling Harbour a few times. There as so many restaurants to choose from and a nice shopping centre. The water features are a nice touch and makes for nice scenery. Due to the time we travelled to Australia Darling Harbour was quite busy with tourists and also local school children on school trips so if you don't like crowds in the Wildlife centre and Aquarium maybe not the best place to go
It's a harbour. Nothing too special but a nice spot to get food or just walk around.
Beautiful. Lit up at night, or at the daytime, the place was beautiful and bustling with people. Nice mall plenty of restaurants.
Darling Harbour, Sydney. Such a great spot which has everything. Great shopping, fantastic restaurants and bars and a wide variety of accommodation options. There's always something happening!
Its had a recent touch up... Abit touristy, but its lovely by the water, with MANY restaurants and things to do. Such as bowling, the IMAX theatre, jet boating etc!
Awsome at Night. We spent our 2 nights down at Darling it has a fantastic atmosphere and so many places to eat. Would recommend to everyone.
Darling Harbour. lovely place , lots going on, great restauants we also booked the jet boat which is a good way to see the harbour bridge
Darling harbour. Lots of action, plenty of restaurants, often an outdoor show.

Nice but overrated. Darling Harbour is okay but some parts are like a ghost town as some areas are quite empty. There are some good bars and cafes, there is also the Lindt cafe (yum). But it tends to be the company you're with that makes or breaks these places. The Aquarium is good - my favourite attraction there. Hard Rock Cafe has opened so that may attract more people to that side. The food court is average, just like any other food court. Access is easy from the CBD. The Convention Centre is just like any other convention centre in the world - when you're inside you could be in Las Vegas or anywhere.
always a pleasure. been there done that every time loving it imax food ice cream walk looking at people passing dont miss it
Badly in need of a redesign.. Located alongside of the water on the western side of the CBD, however poorly designed and in need of a rehaul.

Good place to visit. Lots of shops, cafes and restaurants on offer, along with access to ferries, hire-boats, buses, and monorail. There are attractions to visit such as the Aquarium, Wildlife centre and Maritime museum. Also provides for families with water-fountain/swimming features and playground.
Mediocrity en masse. Busy, crowded. In my mind, a lot to offer with little satisfaction, unless of course you are a family with younger children, then nothing is far away.

Great Place to Visit. We spent two days in Sydney with our two boys, and a majority of our time was around Darling Harbour, there is so much to see and do, The shopping centre was great, so many resturants to choose from, the monorail was very handy and the kids playground was fantastic my boys had so much fun,.Highly recommend if you visit Sydney make sure you go to Darling Harbour

Don't skip Darling Harbour. We went to Darling Harbour in the afternoon during our stay in Sydney. We got a bite to eat at Grill'd who serves excellent burgers and then walked around a bit. We walked around the Maritime Museum and took some pictures, but did not go inside. We opted for the Wildlife Park and the Aquarium which were worth the money. We decided to get the 3 in 1 deal to see these two including the Sydney Tower. There were several other places to eat that we saw and is a short walk to the Star City Casino.

Always fun. The weather was wonderful, warm and low humidity. Its a great place to just buy an ice cream and people watch. It has had a major upgrade and there are lots of new places to eat and a wonderful kids playground. Most of the restaurants have a deal on and you get a great meal and cocktail and dessert for under $40 each with an amazing water view. Love it :)
Nice place. Great place for photoshoot! And especially in the evening during sunset!

Christmas in Sydney. So many great things to explore (aquarium and Wildlife Center among the best), restaurants, shops, etc., and most of them were open on Christmas Eve (great fireworks), Christmas Day, and Boxing Day. Great views too!

Highlight of Sydney. Darling harbour is a must see if you visit Sydney. It's gardens are gorgeous and there are loads of places to eat and drink. The area is very clean is a great place to sit and people watch on a good day.
Restaurants and shopping. One for the teenagers and those wanting to shop at expensive boutiques and souvenir places. Some great restaurants around here for fine and casual dining.
ok. Very commercial but worth seeing - Maritime museum, chinese gardens. Catch a ferry from circular quay!!
Perfect Day or Night. Lots of food, entertainment, and a romantic spot for couples and families alike. Lots to see and do, and great views of the City!
Full of attractions and restraunts.. Pretty harbor with buch of shops and eateries. The prices are pretty stiff - plain spaghetti dish was $28.50! You will spend close to $100 easily.

Not much to do Here. It seemed not much more than a glorified food hall and had some pretty ordinary shops selling pretty junky stuff. The location is lovley, but what is there to do here except pay to see other stuff? Not our favourite experience in Sydney.
a relaxing afternoon. great atmosphere with lots of cafés, restaurants and people. Perfect for photos.

Loving it. There is so many things to do and attractions to visit.
I went to Wildlife world, where you could discovered rainforest in the city.
Good. Good area in the wet, plenty of shops and we had an excellent breakfast here
Worth the visit. The Acquarium is here but even without it you can spend some time here, take pictures, stroll. Just avoid the overpriced Lindt caffe.
Great new water park. Darling Harbour is very impressive and well worth a visit. There is a water park area, which I was told only recently opened, which is great - especially for kids and it's free!
Nice dining options. If you wanted inexpensive food (like in a food court) or a nice restaurant, you had your choices here. It was also nice scenery for dining or just strolling around.

Darling harbour is amazing, Nice and wonderful place!. There is lot of things to do hère. The Chinese garden, restaurants, cinémas Some malls for the shopping.
There is wharf and a lot of
Great place to visit. Easy to get to from the monorail, there are several attractions (wildlife zoo, aquarium, Hard Rock Cafe) located in the Harbour. Great place to visit.

great experience. We were in Sydney in Oct/Nov. 2011 and stayed in Pyrmont (10 min. walk to Darling Harbour) everything you want is there, excellent choice of restaurants, just relaxing on the water front watching people and Buskers. Can't wait to go back
Love the restaurants. Love this area for the restaurants, sitting outside looking at the buildings all lit up in the evening while eating many exquisite meals at several of the eateries there

Darling Harbour rocks!. I've always loved the ambience of Darling Harbour especially on a Friday night when you have all the office workers out and about celebrating just before the weekend. The area around Darling Harbour with its myriad of bars, restaurants, cafes and shops is a real "buzz" - its one of the very many lively areas of this city that make Sydney such a great place in which to live!
There is nothing there. I've never understood Darling Harbour. There is nothing there, there is nothing for the traveller to take pictures of and the shopping stinks. Don't waste your time.
A beautiful place. A beautiful place with lots of restaurants and a shopping mall.

Great shopping precinct.. Many shops - great views. Wonderful place to eat, especially with a window seat or outside. The Darling Harbour playground was a favourite of the kids with normal playground features but also the water activities there. Easy walk to other main areas of the city including Paddy's Market, Powerhouse Museum and transport stops.

Don't miss the Kids playground. Our 11 year old daughter could have played here all day, every day. It was a great place to find other kids for her to play with. She was intrigued and challenged by the water playground part in particular. All this even though it rained every day during our five day trip to Sydney in summer. She loved this so much she didn't care about the rain. Even our 18 year old son enjoyed dabbling with it! My husband and I enjoyed watching them play while we took time out from walking, walking, walking as we saw the sights. Warmed up with a hot chocolate nearby. We returned at night...worth the effort to see the Harbour sparkle.

Lovely harbor, lots of restaurants & an aquarium. Darling harbor has a collection of eateries and a truly fabulous aquarium. When we were there (November) there were free fireworks on certain nights. It's also a good place to start a hop-on-hop-off harbor cruise.

A great place to relax. Although considered "touristy" by locals, Darling Harbour has a lot to offer Sydney-siders as well as tourists.Tourists can enjoy several venues here including "The Aquarium", "Wildlife Sydney" and the "Maritime Museum". There's also quite a few restaurants here too as well as various activities throughout the precinct for tourists and their children. Darling Harbour is a short ferry ride from Circular Quay, or a 5-10 min walk from Town Hall, or perhaps catch the Monorail. From Central you can catch the Light Rail - so there's a lot of options for getting to / from this area.The other venue that's perfect for locals and tourists is the Chinese Garden of Friendship at the southern end of the precinct. This is a peaceful haven in the midst of Sydney and well worth a visit.In addition, there are several hotels at Darling Harbour which are popular with tourists as they are often slightly cheaper than those at say The Rocks.For locals - all the above applies too. There are many events held at the Convention Centre which is at the south end of the precinct, not to mention the Entertainment Centre too.

Should be on your itinerary. In and of itself it's not necessarily excellent, but it's a part of Sydney that must be seen to get a feel of the place. The harbour is undoubtedly pretty and there are plenty of restaurants at which to eat next to the water and there is usually a hustle and bustle which adds to the atmosphere especially at night. The restaurants around there tend to be very touristy and overpriced (Sydney has so many other good restaurants), but it's Darling Harbour and you're in Sydney, take a look, have a drink and walk around. There are also some museums around, which you may want to go to. Definitely walk over the bridge to Peirmont. Keep walking straight and through the lights. It's a quaint Sydney neighborhood that is a great place to grab a coffee.

Lots of Attractions....kind of like Disneyland. We are glad we took the time to visit and walk around but it's a little too commercial for our tastes though in fairness you could say there is something for everyone at Darling Harbour. There's lots to see and do; IMAX, an Aquarium, a Maritime Museum, tons of pricey restaurants and bars, shopping galore, you name it.

A much more vibrant area tha the main harbour, excluding the Opera house. We took the Sydney harbour hop on hop off boat trip and finished our trip at Darling Harbour, I would recommend that rather than go back on the boat get off and walk back through the city for a real treat, journey time to walk is only around 20 minutes, unless of course you are with my wife who cannot pass a shop and it took us 2 hours even with atrip on the monorail !!
Spectacular Views. There are few places as lovely as watching the world go by as you lunch in Darling Harbour.

A fabulous location. There are so many shops, cafes and restaurants with so much to offer. The location is just so good as you can walk around all day with so much to see and stop off at a cafe etc when it suits. Love the area so much, try and get there as often as possible.
Good place for families. Noticed it was a good place for families but wouldn't go back as a couple.
Tourist focused. The harbour's worth a visit, but it is full of tourist boat trips and attractions.
Amazing location and must see place for everyone. This is a perfect place for hangouts and weekend parties and must see location in Sydney.

Heaps to do & see, so close to the Harbour and Opera House. Brilliant atmosphere, eating houses and shopping abound, people enjoying themselves amongst the lawns, gardens, water features and harbourside.

Must go, Must see. Lovely place to visit, with modern clean facilities all round.A bustling place surrounded by shops / restaurants with lovely views and plenty of things of interest to see / do.There is a real happy buzz to the place but it can be pleasantly calm too, if you need it to be.A place and a pace to suit all ages / types. We visited several times by either walking round the waterfront route from the rocks or cutting up and through the main city streets, or by jumping a ferry from circular Quay. Do try a lunchtime bucket of prawns and a beer (gorgeous) but be warned, you won’t want your dinner / evening meal.Overall a great place to visit and revisit.
love it!. Aquarium: AWESOME!!Animal World: loved it!Harbour prominade and waterside eateries: everything you could want!
Wander around always something happening. Head to the lindt cafe and get a strawberry dipping plate.. Is amazing!

Lively Place. We caught the mono rail to Darling harbour, sat on seats overlooking water and tried to eat lunch but the seagulls were quick to share our lunch, lots of fun. Shops are good, a really nie place to go.
Very nice. Darling Harbour was very pretty and you should make a point to see it. They have some very nice shops and the area is just beautiful.
its is a great darling harbour to go to. itis a great shopping mall and a cafes and you can catch the ferry therer and injoy the view

Worth Visiting. Darling Harbour is a real tourist trap that is expensive but worth visiting for the experience. This is were you will find the Aquarium, the Maritime Museum, the Wildlife Adventure, Harbourside Mall, IMAX Theatre and lots of restaurants like the Hard Rock Café and Pancakes on the Rock.
The hub bub of darling harbour. Absolutely love Darling Harbour, the restaurants and cafes the people watching it is a great place to visit.

Still has the fireworks and the buzz. We timed dinner out to make it to darling harbour in time to see the fireworks, lots of people, great vibe, and ten minutes of fireworks just because...we were at Brisbane fireworks on new years eve and they only seemed to last that long! Lovely to watch and wander around in the evening with all the lights!
PERFECT HARBOUR. the harbour is amazing with a large variety of thing to to and see ther. recomended to anybody who is thinking of going there

Entertainment Central!. The teenage daughter thought she had died and gone to heaven to discover the Harbourside Shopping Centre!!! Wonderful food court too. Outside, there is always something going on and if not, lovely walks through the grounds and fountains. Short walk from Darling Harbour up through to Chinatown and Paddys Markets.
Good atmosphere. Nice place to visit, lots of good restaurants around.

Darling Harbour. Take the quick ferry over from Sydney Harbour to Darling - explore the board walk and grab lunch while you are there. Lots to do for families - water features to play in and usually live music. Really good selection in resturants.
Also make sure to visit the new Hard Rock and the mall there.

the place to be!. fantastic harbour just round from harbour bridge get the ferry ot monorail round from the city. lovely harbour lots of shops and resaurants maritime museum and so much more!!!! we went here 3 times during our month long visit as ther is so much to do for all ages
Beautiful!. Our hotel was close enough that we could walk to Darling Harbour, long blocks but doable, it was clean, has a lot of shopping restaurants and beatufil homes around it.

A very young part of Sydney. Here you get all the modern AND the classic stuff. Darlingharbour offers the worlds biggest IMAX-screen, a chinese garden, maritim museum, food court, nice view on Sydney downtown, cool kids playground
Great vibe!. Great places to eat, water park for the kids and fanatastic vibe at night. Enjoyed eating an ice cream as we walked through in the evening

Great people watching and more.... The Harbour is surrounded by restaurants, bars and shopping. Boats, water taxi's, ferries and tours are all located in this harbour. You can walk around the Harbour or ride in a small train (on wheels) for about $4.50 for an adult. Sit in an outside facing bar and watch the many variations of people coming by. Great people watching area from locals to tourists to the abstract. Happy hour drinks are about half price at most bars and it runs from about 5:00pm-8:00pm daily (Monday-Friday).
Loads to do and see. Clean place, everything near by, cafes, restaurants. many things for kids.
Very HIP and Trendy. Lots of good restaurants. Very hip and trendy area. Must see if you are nearby.
Darling Harbour. Lots to do and see, various choices of restaurants and shopping at Harbourside.
Too narrow. I know this is touted but I arrived by ferry on a very HOT afternoon and felt confined in the space. I much prefer the Opera House side.
My Faverate Location. Liked the view and the calming effect... Beware of the seagulls robbing you of your food though....
Relaxing. A lovely spot to enjoy the atmosphere, lovely views, good food and wine. Although it would be nice to see some more NSW wines on restaurant lists.
very pretty and quaint.. Lots of choices in food, but places were packed with tourists and it was not cheap. The food is sky high pricewise
Loved Darling Park area!. Since we were last in Sydney there has been a lot of work done on Darling Park. This is an area of beautiful landscaping and architecturally very interesting.
Very touristy, but nice.. This is more a place to go with children. There is a huge play area. It is quite touristy. The views are nice, but I didn't spend too much of my time there.
Pretty as picture at night. Touristy by day, but a pretty place at night. Great places to dine over looking the harbour and fireworks at 9PM every night.

A beautiful open space with plenty to see. Darling Harbour is very modern and clean. There are many restaurants to fit most budgets. The park also has many interesting water fountains that you can run your hands through. A variety of street performers are on hand to provide some laughs! It is a very large and open area which also contains one of the coolest kid's playgrounds I've ever seen! It is free to walk around and there are plenty of attractions to suit most interests.

Many things to do.. Monorails, museums, trains, aquariums, and wildlife preserves. But there's even more. Darling Harbour has many restaurants and shops, including the Hard Rock Cafe and the worlds largest IMAX theatre. In December, the whole Harbour is covered in lights and Santas in their Santa Fest.

Great place for a stroll. Lots to see and do, aquarium, maritime museum, nice bars and restaurants, great place for people watching. Near to Chinese Gardens, which are excellent if you have young children- a great play area with creative equipment and water features. Wonderful for a hot day especially.

Darling Harbor delites. Italian Restaurant excellent value
Ambiance great
Entertainment good
Relaxing

We love Darling Harbour. We stayed in Darling Harbour next to the Wildlife Centre and we were very happy. There was so much to do and see and the eateries were numerous. We went for a ride around the city on the monorail, stopping at Paddys Market on the way (which was a real letdown).We had a ride from one end to the other on a little train on wheels that regularly runs around DH but it costs $4.50 pp each way which is why there arent many people using it.The ferries stop at the bridge end of the harbour. The hop on hop off bus has two stops here, one behind the Aquarium and the other further along. We went to the Maritime Museum which was very good. We walked over Pyrmont bridge to get from one side of the water to the other. There is also an information centre, IMax, and lots of toilets.
Fantastic. Loads of attractions - one of the best facilities I have seen.
Expensive darling. Nice to walk around, but expensive for a backpacker no much going on there in the day if you dont want to spend much money

the best place to hang out in sydney. the most happening place in sydney is darling harbour. youll love it if you have kids with you since there are a lot of founbtains and play areas all around it....lovely eat outs...all other sydney cool attractions very close by....hop on hop off bus tour pick up...imax and what not. I cant forget just the walk me, my husband and our 2 year old used to take at night on darling harbour.love it and miss it
Nice cafes. A lively place with lots of cafes and nice places to eat.
Ratty tourist trap. Darling Harbour is a bit of a ratty tourist trap that badly needs a refurb. Head over to Cockle Bay Wharf on the other side of the bay for some better bars and restaurants.
Like a Big Outdoor Mall. Lots of walking, lots of restaurants, and lots of fun. Don't miss the Maritime Museum if you like the history of the sea Australian style.
Don't miss out. Please do not miss this wonderful location, a great place to relax and enjoy the views, had to be my favourite location.

great to see, but don't stay there!. We stayed in Darling Harbour but only because we had a great employee rate at a very nice hotel there. Darling Harbour is cool but its VERY touristy and over-priced! great to visit for an afternoon perhaps but if you want a non-chain restaurant, try Surry Hills nearby instead!
A happening place. Saturday night, 8.30pm, and the place was packed with families, including toddlers, all taking advantage of the fine weather and family facilities.
A real buzz!. Greta area to hang around and watch the harbour scene, people watch, eat, shop or drink. Lots of street entertainment.

A nice way to spend a few hours. beautiful place and great if you enjoy people watching as there are such a variety of characters that visit the harbour. Worth a visit so that you can stroll around it soaking up the atmosphere, visit the museams, enjoy the water fountains, laze in a cafe or restaurant or shop in the centre. You could spend a few hours there easily

Come at saturday night for the once-a-week fireworks. Darling Harbor is a center of tourist spots in one area with a beautiful view. Many attractions are available in this area from cafe, imax, restaurants, nightlife, playground for kids, parks, office building, museum, etc.For families, the most interesting places to visit will be the maritime museum exhibition of the warship and submarine. Then the IMAX, then for kids under 10 years old, theres a new playground park with water play, sand, and many more.Every saturday night at 9 PM local time, a firework show is available for everyone to enjoy for free. Its awesome! The crowd went crazy when the firework starts and applause is always present afterwards.Hotels around the area are more expensive but made the journey here shorter. Considering taxi is a bit pricey in Sydney, the saving for taxi would compensate the additional cost for hotels nearby.Hope this helps.

So many places to eat.. The harbor is great, literally hundreds of restaurants. There is the Chinese Gardens near, Lindt Cafe, Hard Rock, The Aquarium, the Wildlife Center, The world largest IMAX. It's great and so much to do, even a mall.

Great Views, Horrible Everything ELSE. It is a beautiful spot... but the restaurants all seemed more like bars or really low-grade restaurants. We sat down somewhere and actually walked out after the appetizer. The Manager didn't even ask us why. I get the sense that, that is the theme for that spot. Maybe if you're just going out for drinks it would be an ok area, but to eat - STAY FAR AWAY. I told a local we went there and that it was horrible and he kind of laughed/snarled and said, "Darling Harbor IS horrible!"
bravo. also could see the 3-D imax. very impressive. Darling Harbour is famous for the bars and night club
Please see the sydney harbour review if you are really interested in my opinion. I mixed up the sydney harbour with the darling harbour.

Top 10 must do list. Darling Harbor is within walking distance of downtown Sydney. It is surrounded by public parks (including the beautiful Chinese Garden), hotels, restaurants/bars for every wallet size, shops, and open space for sitting/lying down. Yes, there is calm water and an elevated bridge across the mid-section of the small harbor. We went one night to watch the free 10-min fireworks which are scheduled at 9 pm on some saturdays during the holiday seasons. The place is unique due to the combined magic of green parks, blue waters, open spaces, boats and yachts, and carnival ambiance among the various businesses. There are people but we didn't feel crowded like in other similar inner city attractions elsewhere. If the Opera House is the jewel of high culture, then Darling Harbor is the gem of the common people. Both have their own way of seeing and be seen!
LOVE IT!. Great place - clean, modern and LOTS to do and see!
Brilliant.. Went on the HMAS Vampire destroyer and HMAS Onslow submarine...quite an eye opener about life in the navy. The bars and shops are fantastic and the scenery is amazing
Take the walk. The darling harbour bridge hosts a ton of great restaurants and events..You need to walk all the way down and see the fountains to the Imax

Compares to anywhere else in the world!. A quick getaway (for us) - and nowhere better but Darling Harbour in Sydney. There is so much to do, places to eat, entertainment everywhere and reasonable accommodation to be had. You can wonder for hours - watching, eating enjoying all the multicultural delights of such a great place.We stayed at the Mercure on George Street, and were given the best treatment - upgrade, chocolates on arrival, late checkout and such friendly staff at reception.Definately the place to go for a quick break.

the place to have a great evening. We stayed there and walked it around....it has a large mall with food court, restaurants and great shops overlooking the harbor. At night you can have a great view of the skyline and the Sydney Tower.
Busy. A wide choice of restaurants for every pocket, but beware pickpockets and try to avoid weekends and some evenings when there is just so much going on.

cute area!. my husband and i strolled around here. the aquarium is here along with the mall on the other side of the bridge. we bought a lot of our souvineers at the mall - lots of choices! slightly less busy than circular quay and the walk between here and the chinese garden is beautiful. lots of falls and fountains.

An awesome place to hang out with friends.. They recently opened up a new section within Darling Harbour called “The Darling Quarter” where it now features an expansive playground where the kids/young adults can have fun.It also features some great restaurants which is also amazing should you want to find a place to dine out.This place has always been very good to walk around and venture around the urban jungle of Sydney with essentially all of the latest festivals being housed there.Catch a ferry during the day time, walk around in the night time.An absolutely perfect sector of Sydney which makes me even more prouder to be an Australian.
Stay here -at least visit it. Everything you could want is here.. Good restaurants, water taxis,rail transport..and a great variety of places to visit. museums, aquarium... Fantastic

Such a nice place to wander and people watch. This area is great to wander around on a sunny day. Lots of shops to peek into, restaurants galore. We also did the 3.2KM seawall to Circular Quay. Long walk but nice to see the harbour activity. Definitely worth doing if you want to see the harbour close up.
busy. ALway sgreat to see the crowds that enjoy the area So much happening and a great variety of restaurants and eaterys.
casual walk. great place to walk around, street performers, markets, great atmosphere
Worth Seeing. With the Monorail, markets, maritimes museum, cafes and gardens there is plenty to see and all worth a visit.

Great restaurants. Great restaurants on Darling Harbour. Very well cared for area and very well set out. Something for everyone. Cafes if you just want coffee and great restaurants if you want something special.

Amazing new playground. At the southern end of Darling Harbour there is an attractive new precinct called Darling Quarter and it contains the most amazing children's playground. The water, sliding and climbing options for kids of all ages are fantastic and as a woman in her mid 40's I just wanted to play...a must see for all families and those that love to be a kid sometimes too..... and yes....its free!!!
Must see. I love it here. It has a beautiful boardwalk, with lots of shopping, restaurants, IMAX, boating opportunities, Maritime Museum etc.
great park. Fantastic park for kids. Excellent restaurants. Always a pleasure to browse around this happening area in Sydney.
Developed and crowded. We went to the Sydney Aquarium at Darling Harbour. It is nice, but Darling Harbour is crowded on a Saturday.
Great. Great restaurants, great views. Very vibrant area. The small little parks and sculpted features was fun. LOTS that you can do, from quick sushi to fine dining.
lively. nice lively part of town with a lot of restaurants/ bars to choice from

Great Fun. Well worth a visit and you can use the harbour ferries to get there (we went back to the Circular Quay that way). The Maritime museum is exceptionally good - currently with an exhibition about Scott. You pay to tour the boats but it is otherwise free. We happened on a tour given by Paul (Bennett?) who was shipped over with the orphans ( Read "Empty Cradles" or watch "Sunshine and Oranges". Lots of eateries and bars given a sunny day just stroll round or use the monorail to get some good views. Pick up your souvenirs in Paddy's Markets.
must see. I used to live in sydney and still enjoy darling harbour. A must see for visitors
Busy, busy. Thoroughly enjoyed our Darling Harbour experience including the Harbourside shopping, restaurants, big screen to watch the Rugby World Cup and the activity.

Expensive. Arrived with the Rugby world cup in full swing but locals more interested in Aussie rules games. Large screens in the Harbour but no atmosphere. On a rainy day not much to do except get fleeced as a tourist. Wildlife experience place next to the Aquarium entertaining for an hour but so expensive to see a few Koala's!

Great harbourside. Lots to do at Darling Harbour - food, water taxi stop, shopping, museums.My favourite thing about Darling Harbour was the Australian Maritime Museum. Most of the displays in the main building is free-admission, but you will have to pay a fee to check out the retired battleship and submarine moored just next to Pyrmont Bridge. There are a lot of restaurants there too. Dinner alfresco is exceptionally pretty, as you watch the lights of the city dance on the waters of Cockle Bay.
Lots to do. Darling Harbour is a wonderful place to spend a half day and have a great meal. Kind of touristy, but still has the Aussie charm.

Excellent spot for being a tourist. The way the harbor is designed and developed draws the typical tourist to it's modern docks. The yachts, the bars, restaurants, how easy it is to get to, the bridges to walk across, the mall, the maritime museum, etc. Darling Harbour lives up to it's name in regards to having a darling experience.
Cool area. Cool area too see during the day or night. Lots of restaurants to have dinner and over looking the harbour. Great atmosphere.

Lovely place.... Nice place to visit. Lots of nice restaurants to eat at. You can walk all the way around the habour and they have a lot of attractions to go to. Weekends can be very busy, so be prepared for lots of people. Plenty of boats to take trips on as well. The views all around the habour are beautiful.

Lots to see and do. During the day the view is beautiful with lots of talented entertainment set up around the harbour, from jugglers to singers and mimes. The grounds are clean and safe, surrounded by restaurants and cafes for all tastes and budgets. Of a night the entertainment continues with live shows and a beautiful fire work display most weekends. Perfect for families or a romantic night out, especially watching the fireworks from the walking bridge!

Vibey place, must see!. We made our pilgrimage to the hard Rock Cafe at night to enjoy great music. Went back the next day to enjoy the busy waterway and cafe culture. The nearby Chinese Garden, park and fountans were a pleasure to visit.
Nice area to wonder around. Very pleasant & nice water front area to wonder around.food outlets are quite expensive!
Great. A few restaurants, some great shopping, and IMax, Harbour Jet Tours accessible from here. Great way to spend half a day.

Very Nice, important to see, but not a must, or a highlight.. I'm not really sure how to explain this place. It's mostly just a collection of shops and restaurants along the water. The restaurants are pricey, so we never ate at any of them, and the shops are nothing spectacular. It's pretty similar to Circular Quay, but less pretentious feeling. I could see myself going there for some drinks to watch the game, or do some Christmas shopping, but it's not a place that blew my mind. There wasn't really anywhere to sit down and just enjoy the nice weather unless you sat on some steps, or a fountain ledge, or go to one of the bar patios. Nothing would prevent me from going back, but I would be fine not seeing it again.

Nice area but not the highlight of our trip. Darling Harbour is a nice area and we enjoyed walking through it. We didn't spend much time there though because we were warned by several people ahead of time that the restaurants were overpriced and we also weren't really interested in the other things it has to offer. The imax was very expensive, we went to the zoo so didn't feel the need to see the wildlife place, we have an awesome aquarium in Atlanta so no real desire to see that...nothing wrong with the area, just wasn't where we wanted to spend our time. We enjoyed other areas of Sydney much more.

A must to visit. Darling Harbour is a must see on any visit to Sydney. It offers excellent views of Sydney Harbour, the Harbour Bridge, the Maritime Museum and a great IMAX Theatre. A large number of restaurants and cafes will satisfy any visitor, while shopping , although expensive due to location, is extensive. The monorail offers good transport although this area is accessible by foot from the centre of Sydney. Good accommodation is available at many nearby hotels including Novotel and Ibis.

GOOD FOOD, GOOD SHOPPING. Darling Harbour is a must for anyone visiting Sydney, a short walk from Central Station, lots of great eating spots and plenty of shopping. You can fill in a day here, wear walking shoes and bring the camera.

Not Impressed!. We were not impressed with Darling Harbour or the Pyrmont Bridge. This area has been taken over by a big shopping mall and not that interesting. We walked over to the Maritime Museum to look at the ships outside but ended up not spending that much time there.
Fabulous location. I love Darling Harbour there is so much to see its always different and the variety of food is great. Good day or night out no matter what your age.

Great spot!. Darling Harbour is one of the must visit areas for anyone visiting Sydney on holidays. There is a vast array of things to do. Starting at the City side you have the Sydney Aquarium, restaurants, shops, IMAX, an outdoor Piazza area with the Sydney 2000 Olympic statues and street performances.Further around there's the Convention Centre, Shopping malls, more restaurants and the Sydney Maitime Museum which is superb!It's easily accessible on foot, by car, taxi, train and monorail as well as a ferrie service from Circular Quay.
maybe the best harbour in the world.... great place to visit in sydney....you will love it !!!......and many things to do and see.....just discover....
Better than Sydney Harbour. This area of Sydney is better that Sydney Harbour. More choice of Bars and Food outlets. The area is more tourist friendly.Visit the Hard Rock Here!

Wholesome entertaining place. A pleasantly wholesome entertaining place. Shopping, cinemas, kiddy train rides, pretty n soothing water features, street performances n restaurants n cafes lining up along the harbour. There's even a chinese garden! Simply a cool place to chill out just about anywhere. Further up there's an aquarium too. Awesome. Full of buzz indeed.

VISIT THE SUBMARINE AND WW2 DESTROYER. We arrived very tired from a long flight and could not get into our room so ventured out to explore Darling Harbour. As we had some time to kill, we carried on past all the restaurants and found a WW2 destroyer and submarine to visit. It was really interesting. Loved it!
Very pleasant walk. We enjoyed our walk around Darling Harbour. Lots of lovely appartments, cafe's, and in general just a lovely place to spend sometime wandering around.

especially this weekend 6-7 Aug. 2011. visit the organic expo, darling harbour , Hall 3.i defy you not to like the organic expochallenge you to try 'Red Dragon ginger beer' (it has a kick to it)try and get a hand full sample of 'brown rice crisps' and head for the cheese stall that hands out samples of 'Bellingham Blue'. "Brilliant!", as Billy Connolly would say.and the novelty item: bamboo tooth brush for $3i could go on like a politician in front of a TV camera...@Darling Harbour, Hall 3. $18 bucks. Less for concession
Great place and views. Great place to visit, lots of view, shops and restaurants, recommended

Beautiful Harbour. Do not go before 12 noon. It is fairly dead. Things pick up afternoon. There is the maritime museum which has free admission for the gallery only. Expensive foods. There is a food court on the left side. Ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour is a nice ride in the evening. Saw the last Harry Potter movie at the largest IMax in the world there. Close to chinatown. Very easy to walk to do from anywhere in Sydney city center. There is also a monorail stop there.

Darling Harbour - Just go!. Try and get to Darling Harbour, in the evening, just before the sun goes down. The queues for the restaurants are less and you can get a seat on the outside. Then choose your meal and sit back and watch the free show as the lights go on and the reflections, in the water, light up. It is just great and you can't get a bad meal. The only sad bit is when the meal is over and you have to leave!

Darling Harbor. I have just returned from Sydney, Aus. What a fabulous city. I really enjoyed the trip. Darling Harbor is great. You can really enjoy peace and stroll along the board. The side street food are very tasty. Fish market is a Must. Very fresh mud crabs, oysters, and abalone, great taste. Then, of course, the Opera House. If not seeing the show, then should really join the opera house tour to get an inside look. Paddy's Market is full of a variety of tourist sourveniers, a Must go as well. However, the U.S. dollar is not as strong as Aus. dollar now. Will need to watch your budget...

Go at night. The Darling Harbour is definantley a must when you are in Sydney, but try to go at night; AWESOME photos you can't get during the day. Overall though, the harbour is very touristy, not a suprise though, right?

Great Harbour. Visited Darling Harbour while on hols in Sydney, there is a great array of shops, cafes and restuarants. While we were there they were prepearing for Australia day so there was a really good buzz about the place. It has a nice new look and feel about with a monorail running over it, there was a small train running round it if you didnt want to walk it. There is loads to see and do a really nice part of Sydney a must visit;.

A lovely place to visit.. I stayed right near Darling Harbour and attended a conference there so I was there quite a bit. The harbour is so lovely. I really enjoyed it. The restaurants are over priced for what they serve so best go elsewhere.

Excellent Wine and Dine. If you want to spend a nice evening have a drink with friends/partner, this is the place. You have a lot of fine restaurants with varied options of cuisine, and good Australian beer. The aquatic museum and the national maritime museum are right here. A must visit place for travelers to Sydney.
Lovely Darling Harbour. A must go place when you are in Sydney. We loved the Christmas fireworks display, the music from the bars, the atmosphere and the restaurants.

Party. It is worthwhile to take a twilight ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour and take in the sunset skyline at the Sydney Harbour and then the Darling Harbour. This could be one of the best experiences in Sydney. Upon reaching Darling Harbour, stroll along the Harbour before dropping into one of the many hip eateries and pubs along the way. If it is a weekend night, this is one of the most happening party spot in the city. Party here when you are in Sydney. I did all this when I was here and made it a point to dine and have a drink or two on a Saturday night.

I loved it in Darling Harbour. There's so much to do in Darling Harbour I personally went to Sydney Aquarium which is well worth going to and the Dugongs there are lovely, and there is so much to see and learn.There is also a place called wildlife world where you can see the koalas and other animals however I would highly recommend Toronga Zoo as it is much better and there is much more to see just get a ferry from Circular Quay and you're there :)There is plenty of places to eat in Darling Harbour lots and lots of restaurants and cafe's it's beautiful.

Darling Harbour, a great place to eat and stroll. Went here when visiting my Aunt in Uncle. Wanted to do a little shopping, grab a bite, with a drink. It's very clean, well maintained. Plenty of parking, which is always a perk to this Californian. We ended up going to the food court, which isn't something I would normally do. However they had a stand selling Pites, which are Arabic pizzas. Since I never had it, I had to buy it. The cost was really good, fries, Pite, & soda, came to about $6.00 in American Dollars. Overall, one of the best meals I had in Australia!

Absolutely beautiful!. This is a beautiful location with everything located closely - from the Imax theatre to the Sydney Aquarium. Easy to catch a ferry to Circular Quay or organise a cruise. Fantastic shopping centre and the Monorail also stops there. As tourists, we loved the Monorail which does a loop of the city and a day pass for an adult was about $9. Cockle Bay is amazing with beautiful food to suit every budget and taste - all in a very picturesque setting. The icing on the cake was perfect Sydney weather. Easy to spend the entire day wandering around Darling Harbour.
Beautiful at night. We enjoyed walking around the harbor but we were drawn to the attractions.

Great little harbour!. Darling harbour is amazing and a must-see! The atmosphere is amazing and it's great just to walk around and take in the atmosphere and the sights. Lots of restaurants and things to do around the harbour also!

Has it all!!. Water taxi to Circular Quay
Aquarium
Markets
Shopping
Casino nearby
Great restaurants
Chinese Gardens
Museums and a whole lot more. We will be back.

Great little harbour, go at night when its all lit up!. Really liked this place, its a great atmosphere, you can eat cheap at Macdonalds or the cafes or eat at lovely restaurants with fancy cocktails and seafood in the bucket loads! There is a lovely shopping centre with shops for all price ranges which is open til 9pm. For kids or entertainment theres the IMAX well worth a visit, the worlds biggest cinema screen! Or theres a bowling alley for family fun, bound to be something here to suit everyone and if you dont have money to spare its great for a photo and a little stroll!

The Hub of Sydney's Tourist Precinct. Yes - all the hype surrounds the Opera House, The Bridge and The Rocks but if you want to chill out and soak up the atmosphere, Darling Harbour is the place to do it. Surrounded by a huge variety of restaurants, bars and other eateries you can sit and watch the boats go by, visit the National Maritime Museum, Aquarium or Wildlife World; be entertained by street theatre performers; wander down to Paddy's Markets or Chinatown or hop on a ferry to explore the harbour. We really love spending time in this precinct whenever we visit Sydney. We especially love to grab an icecream cone after dinner and sit on the wharf to watch the city lights.

A Sydney MUST! A great place for a stroll. Darling Harbor is a great place to go for a leisurely stroll.It is close to Sydney's CBD, and readily accessible by public transport.There is a wide range of restaurants which offerca good view over the Harbor- most display their menus at the front, so you can find somewhere to suit your taste.Also, it's the area where several of Sydney's most popular attractions are located, including the Sydney Aquarium, Maritime Museum, Powerhouse Museum, Star City Casino, Wildlife World, the Chinese Garden of Friendship and an IMAX cinema.It's a good place to visit either on a sunny day or in the evening. With a diverse range of things to do and see, it offers a good variety of attractions.

Darling Harbour, The Next Best Thing. Walk across the bridge for a great view of the Harbour and get your picture taken with the Darling Harbour sign. Connects to great museums, shopping centers, and some good walks. A great alternative to Sydney Harbour.

fav place in sydney!!. GORGEOUSSS! spent 3 days in sydney, i was at darling harbour everyday! harbourside has lots of great restaurants, ate at this place called blue fish. very good fish and chips! the sydney aquarium and wildlife park are also located at darling harbour. youll pass by lots of bars and restaurants on the way there too. during happy hours, house wine and champagne goes for really cheap prices! ooh you can do whale watching there as well! at night, the entire harbour transforms into this really beautiful place.. lots of lights and really quite happening! plenty of bars and clubs.. and loads of cabs after haha

Lively Scene - Don't miss it. We didn't spend much time here but it is great location and well worth spending quite a bit of time exploring. From other reviews I can see that it is great location to stay as it is central to most everything and lots to do within walking distance. We skipped aquarium and wildlife park (teenagers not to into that stuff nowadays). We tried to catch an IMAX film but they were all sold out (on a Saturday). There were so many nice looking waterfront restaurants; I imagine it is a great place for a meal. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Darling Harbour so you are well situated to see many waterfront areas in Sydney. We did stroll through Chinatown and went to Paddy's Market on Friday, both interesting experiences and nearby.

My favourite place in Sydney Australia.. My kids adored the place, even my husband. A great place for family vacation. We were in Sydney for a week and couldn't get enough. We stayed in an accommodation in Circular Quay, located in between the Opera House and Darling Habour. The train station is just a walk from our apartment.

This should be on your list of places to visit. This is one of the places in Sydney that you need to visit. Chances are you will at some point or other anyway as the hop-on hop-off cruises start from here, the aquarium is here, the explorer buses pass through and there is a wealth of museums and cafes to explore or eat at. There are some shops too I think but I didn't really look at them.Firstly lets just say the area is nothing overly special, however I've rated it above average as I think it's a place you need to visit when in Sydney. It is a nice area but it is just a quay with some good views. Having said that I really enjoyed just browsing around the area, looking at what there was to see, enjoying the view from the bridge over the harbour. I also visited some of the places around the harbour such as Sydney Aquarium.To get the best views go up to the top of the bridge that has the monorail going across it. You can get some really good photos from there and it's a good place to wait if you're early for a boat cruise or something.It's also not too far from the chinese area of the city so you can get some great chinese food, or visit the chinese gardens without having to walk far.

Darling Harbour. We stayed at the Novotel on Darling Harbour for 10 nights and i loved it there.Plenty of nice places to eat with a big food court inside with every kind of food you could think of.Nice shops too, and everyone was very friendly there.Also plenty to do as there is the aquarium,wildlife centre,I-max cinema, paddys markets and the water taxis are a great way to ger around.Luna park is a short ride away in a taxi.We did the harbour Jet boating as well which was great fun!Would definately go there again,lovley place, really clean.

Fantastic. We stayed near Darling Harbour and happened to venture that way most days. It was buzzing with life and friendliness and there was so much to see. There are some nice places to eat and the street performers were brilliant. Definately worth going to.

Always something to see or do!. There always seems to be something to see or do whilst in Darling Harbour. There are a number of hotels overlooking the harbour (including the Ibis, Novotel, Mecure) which must offer great value views. There are wooden tiered steps down to the water which double up as great places to sit, sunbathe or just watch the world go by! Whilst not really an attraction in its own right - you will find plenty to do at Darling Harbour - including:Sydney Aquarium, Wildlife World, Maritime Museum, Powerhouse Museum, Chinese Garden and the Imax cinema. If you fancy a trip on the water you will be equally spoilt for choice: Sail with Olympic sailors on Sydney by Sail; Matilda Cruises offer a wide choice of trips including Taronga zoo, opera house, lunar park to name but a few; Harbour jet will whizz & spin you around the harbour at a scary 75kph; If you want a more sedate experience visit the naval ships and submarine within the national maritime museum - including Captain Cook's Endeavour and Destroyer HMAS Vampire - all really interesting even if you're not an avid maritime fan! There are also really groovy looking water taxis available or catch a ride on the Monorail which circles the harbour. There are restaurants surrounding the harbour, so plenty of choice and a shopping mall. If you want Paddy's Market walk past the water features and Chinese Garden and you will eventually find it! The whole area is a joy to walk around with lovely & unusual water features. Often there are exhibitions or street entertainers present. Its also very clean! It's touristy, yes - but it is an interesting part of Sydney that mustnt be missed.

Always something going on. Okay, so you're not going to find the best restaurants in the city, and you can expect to pay above average for a schooner of ale, but there is always something worthy of attention going on in Darling Harbour. Permanent attractions such as the Chinese Garden of Friendship, iMax theatre and Wildlife World are well worth a visit, and if you've already been there and done that you can guarantee that a wander through Darling Harbour on a sunny weekend will always nett a festival, exhibition, or something else equally interesting to grab your attention. Darling Harbour is a clean, bright, aesthetically pleasing, family friendly area, which provides a great backdrop and attmosphere for a lovely day out. Top off the experience by arriving or departing on the ferry which adds a romantic twist to any day out.

Darling Harbour restuarants are great but dont bother with CMC. We had a wonderful few days touring around Sydney and Darling Harbour. Visited the Aquarium, Paddy's Market etc etc and tried out a number of the restuarants. Can't fault most of them but give CMC ( Citi Marina Cafe) a miss. Shocking service, bad food, cold and almost raw food. A waitress who couldn't understand english. Totally disgraceful. Give Nick's a go for breakfast. Under the bridge on the Cockle Bay side is a cafe that has all lunch meals under $10-. This is the best low cost meal cafe on the harbour. Plenty of other great meals to be had in the area..just not CMC.

What a darling!. A real cosmopolitan feel to Darling Harbour - we had a great day here. Sydney Aquarium and the Chinese Gardens of Friendship are situated here as well as some great shops and a market. The harbour itself is really relaxed and there are street entertainers and boat rides galore! Well worth a visit.

Amazing sights to see in Darling Harbour!. I was in Australia on student exchange, and on the last 2 weeks of my exchange, I spent some time in Sydney. While I was there, I did a boat tour/sky tour of Darling Harbour, as well as trips through the Chinese Gardens, Aquarium, Torongo Zoo, and several museums. Needless to say, Darling Harbour and Sydney as a whole is a gorgeous city that needs to be seen by everyone!
